Name: Finance Wrangler
Description: At Automattic, we are the people behind WordPress.com, WooCommerce, and Jetpack. We believe in making the web a better place. We’re a distributed company with 800+ Automatticians in 65+ countries speaking 75+ languages. Our shared goal is to democratize publishing so that anyone with a story can tell it, regardless of income, gender, politics, language, or where they live in the world.  On Automattic’s finance team, we spend every single day helping our company and our investors make better decisions. We build business analytics that make complex things simple. We create and share insight into Automattic’s worldwide operations, including by forecasting our businesses and their markets. We collaborate with leads across our company to improve performance. We do deals, including global M&A and financings.  We’d love to hear from you if: You have developed a strong financial skill set in investment banking, consulting, or a similar analytical environment.You are meticulous and able to master vast amount of details then build on that foundation to provide strategic insights and advice.You are fluent in the financial and operating metrics of software as a service (SaaS) or other subscription businesses.You are excited about working directly with large datasets and SQL.You are passionate about and experienced with lean, fast-growing, dynamic organizations.You are highly motivated to learn new things and improve your skills.You have excellent verbal and written skills in English. If you have experience with WordPress, software development, coding, open source, or other relevant areas, don’t forget to mention it. Like all positions at Automattic, you’ll work remotely, and can be based wherever you live.  We’re serious about growing diversity in the tech industry. We want to build Automattic as an environment where people love their work and show respect and empathy to those with whom we interact. Diversity typically includes, but is not limited to, differences in race, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, political and religious affiliation, socioeconomic background, cultural background, geographic location, disabilities and abilities, relationship status, veteran status, and age. To work on diversity means that we welcome these differences, and strive to increase the visibility of traditionally underrepresented groups. Read more about our dedication to diversity and inclusion.How to ApplyDoes this sound interesting? If yes, please send a short email to jobs @ this domain telling us about yourself and attach a résumé. Let us know what you can contribute to the team. Include the title of the position you’re applying for and your name in the subject.  Proofread! Make sure you spell and capitalize WordPress and Automattic correctly. We are lucky to receive hundreds of applications for every position, so try to make your application stand out. If you apply for multiple positions or send multiple emails there will be one reply.  If you’re reading this on a site other than automattic.com please ensure you visit automattic.com/work-with-us for the latest details on applying.  To increase your chances of standing out, please answer the following: In one sentence, how would you describe Automattic’s business model to someone who isn’t familiar with the company?What is your favorite SaaS metric for a business like WordPress.com?Tell us about an analysis problem you enjoyed working on recently. Why did you like it? ← Work With Us

Name: Senior Account Executive, Large Enterprise Solutions
Description: BigCommerce, named a "Best Place to Work" in 2018 is looking for a Senior Enterprise Account Executive to join our growing sales team. In this role, you will drive sales revenue by acquiring new high value, enterprise clients by showing them the power of the BigCommerce Platform to help them Sell More. What You Will Do:Drive sales revenue through new client acquisition for Fortune 1000 / IR1000 accountsActively manage the sales process, including positioning, presenting and /demoing the product, and closing sales within the designated territoryAct as territory owner and subject matter expert for one or more categories/verticalsBuild and manage a book of business through outbound prospecting as well as inbound leadsIdentify each client's unique needs and cultivate effective sales strategies and proposalsCoordinate resources for implementationBe the expert - Provide eCommerce industry information to clients regarding web design, online marketing (SEO, PPC, Email Marketing, Google Analytics), e-commerce strategies, etcAchieve your sales targets and performance metricsBe organized - maintain a CRM with leads and effectively manage an account set, keep detailed and accurate notes of all sales related activitiesThink like a CEO - communicate with management team and team members to increase client satisfaction and conversion and drive overall sales improvementsEngage closely with the BigCommerce Partner Ecosystem and Sales Engineering team to design solutions and close sales both over the phone and on-site, depending on client size and needWho You Are:7-10+ years technology sales experience, including 5+ years Enterprise Sales experience in a fast-paced environment with a focus on consultative solutions selling for a SaaS and eCommerce companyBachelor's Degree required, MBA a plusEnterprise Sales Hunter - You have a demonstrated ability to drive complex sales with all stakeholders (from both the business and IT, mid level to senior executive), and have successfully, consistently achieved quotas and objectives within a fast paced, high growth sales environmentMaster Influencer - Excellent written/verbal communication and customer relationship skills are criticalTechie - Strong Internet, email, and electronic document management skills are a must. A basic understanding of HTML, CSS and internet technologies (shopping carts, web hosting, email and online marketing tools) a big pluseCommerce geek - Technical understanding of software and the e-commerce space combined with strong business and sales acumenEthical - You are customer focused and do the right things the right way every timeAttentive - You are able to manage sensitive client information and numerous details with easeDriven - You are a results-oriented closer with a positive outlook and a clear focus on quality and business performanceAnalytical - You are able to provide consistent, accurate sales forecastsSolution Oriented - You have the ability to identify and creatively solve complex problems to keep a sale on track

Name: Contingent Sr. Project Manager/Business Analyst
Description: OverviewThe Sr. Project Manager / Business Analyst will support Corporate Security Technology Upgrade project by providing both Project Management and Business Analysis expertise to the team. This role is within BSA/AML, Corporate Security and Fraud Department and will be accountable to deliver an Enterprise software solution which consolidates all physical security events onto one platform and managed by one organization. As the platform solution has been determined, the initial focus will be working with stakeholders, vendor management, and vendors to complete vendor due diligence and contracting. In parallel, one will need to put on their Business Analyst hat and perform requirements definition deliver traditional business analysis artifacts (BRD, Event Trigger Business Rules, System and Business Process flow diagrams, traceability matrix and others as necessary). As the vendor becomes engaged and the project moves to design and execution phases, this professional will be responsible for all Project Management activities which includes working closely with vendor resources and impacted stakeholders across the organization. This is very much both a roll up your sleeves, dive into the details, author project artifacts, and think strategically and partner across the organization providing clear communication and execution plans.ResponsibilitiesServes as the Sr. Project Manager / Business Analyst for this project. Direct the activities of the project team (i.e. Business Staff, Technical Architect, Network Engineers, Field Services, Systems Administrators, QA, DBA, and Vendor / Integrator)Defines, leads, and manages all aspects of the project, scope, budget, financial forecasting, scheduling, resources, and quality control of work products following company’s PMO standards and governance guidelines and project management best practices.Owns and manages the Work Queue for each of the business units which includes leading the activities for prioritization, impact analysis, sequencing of activities, and overall communications for status, action items, decisions made/needed and issues and risksCreates MS Project schedules, meeting minutes, self-managing and updates file shares and SharePoint with deliverables for internal audit purposesDevelops and implements templates and standards for project deliverables and work products.Facilitates impact analyses of current/existing technologies on the program.May contribute and/or lead vendor relationship management for project-related vendors; supports enterprise vendor management standards and coordinates initial contracts, contract renewals, and addenda to contracts with key project vendors.Supports management in data gathering for regulatory and third party reviews.Monitors project execution and escalates project issues as necessary.Maintains project website and database, and issue and risk tracking logs using MS Project, MS Office, Visio, SharePoint, SnagIt.Maintains a flexible work schedule.Perform other duties when assigned. QualificationsMust HavesMust have a bachelor’s degree or higherTen or more years of project management / business analysis experience and demonstrated successAppreciation of the intricacies of a highly government-regulated environment.Formal training in project or program management;Must be able to work independently and with minimum directionDemonstrated ability to execute complex projects within budget and on timeMust possess strong interpersonal, organizational, team building, mentoring, and communication (written and verbal) skillsMust be able to serve as a beacon for groups that are striving for better coordination; this implies advanced skills in persuasionAbility to build relationships at all levels of the enterprise and with external vendorsPrevious experience in the below would be preferred.Physical Security technologies (Video Surveillance, Access Control)Facilities related projects – Coordination of contractors accessing and installing security devices at regional offices.Information technology and information systemsBankingBusiness and data analysisConducting gap assessmentsCreating product, service, and/or systems inventoryExpert in MS Office, MS Visio, and MS ProjectAbility to multi-task and respond to with multiple priorities.

Name: Contingent: Tableau Reporting Specialist
Description: OverviewTableau Reporting Specialist As part of the Information Services team, the Wealth Management (WM) Technology Team drives the vision to create an industry leading, client-centric wealth technology experience. The team is looking for forward thinking, action oriented individuals to help drive the implementation of innovative, cutting-edge solutions. Summary: This position reports to the WM Reporting Team Lead and supports the development and implementation of Tableau dashboards and datasets for the WM department.  The Tableau Report Developer works with subject matter experts from the project and business teams to determine: Data requirements for the PWM Reporting platform; develop functional specifications; provide detailed data flow documents. They will also participate in the full development process life-cycle from concept, through testing and implementation. This includes identifying necessary data, reconciling with the new application and the legacy data sources and ensuring a successful implementation of PWM Reporting capability. Specific tasks include: communicating business term definitions; establishing data quality rules; writing and executing data quality checks; researching and analyzing data in support of business functions; process and workflow knowledge; and user acceptance testing.ResponsibilitiesDesign and develop Tableau reports and dashboards that will yield actionable insights that present the answers to business questionsDevelop, implement, and optimize analytical processes and associated KPI’s to improve how we measure and report on the performance of the organizationRun ad-hoc analysis for Product and Business Managers using standard query languages and operationalize for repeatable use via Tableau reporting suiteCode and modify SQL/ETL based on dashboard requirementsMaintain validation of reporting business rules, documentation and distributions to proper stakeholdersTrain and educate co-workers on data visualization tools and best practicesParticipate in design and delivery of curriculum related to rollout of new reports and dashboards to drive adoption and to enhance business decision-making capability QualificationsExperience & Education: BA or BS in Management Information Systems, Mathematics, Computer Science, or Engineering required5+ years of experience using business intelligence reporting tools. Mastery of Tableau for the creation and automation of Enterprise Scale dashboards5+ years of experience writing advanced SQL, performance tuning of BI queries, data modeling, and data mining from multiple sources (SQL, ETL, data warehousing).Knowledge of Private Wealth Management/Investment Management – with ability to interpret definitions and calculations from business language to developer logicExperience with portfolio management and related reportingExpertise with Data Visualization best practicesPossess a strong foundation in data analytics, an understanding and foundation in data scienceHave exposure to statistical modeling experience (R, SAS, SPSS). (Preferred) Technical Skills: Strong visualization design and development experience with Tableau (and other Business Intelligence tools)Expert in writing SQLExcellent attention to detail and experience debugging code Professional Skills/Competency: Proven track record of delivery for business critical BI/Analytics projectsAbility to operate with cross-functional teamsStrong quantitative and analytical skills - ability to quickly analyze data to identify key insights and apply them to the businessClear, high-level understanding of complex data models and software integration/deliveryExcellent communication skills, including ability to present effectively to both business and technical audiences at all levels of the organizationStrong orientation to clients, including demonstrated ability to understand needs and apply this knowledge to drive data enhancements Personal Skills/Competency Consistently demonstrates and follows high standards of integrity in business decision-makingDemonstrates excellent communication and interpersonal skills; able to communicate clearly and concisely in a variety of settings and styles; is effective in a variety of formal presentation and meeting settingsGains support for change by providing context and responding with sensitivity to concerns; takes initiative to recommend/ develop innovative approaches to getting things doneCan quickly find common ground and solve problems for the good of all; is a team player and encourages collaborationBI Tools – Required (Tableau required)SQL – RequiredExcel - RequiredWealth Management/Investment Management data experience - RequiredTFS/JIRA or other issue tracking application preferred Mental/Physical Requirement The ability to learn and comprehend basic instructions; understand the meanings of words and respond effectively; and perform basic arithmetic accurately and quickly.Vision must be sufficient to read data reports, manuals and computer screens.Hearing must be sufficient to understand a conversation at a normal volume, including telephone calls and in person.Speech must be coherent to clearly convey or exchange information, including the giving and receiving of assignments and/or directions.Position involves sitting most of the time, but may involve walking or standing for brief periods of time.Must be able to travel in a limited capacity.

Name: Analytic Consultant 4 / Senior Data Analyst Wholesale Customer Relationship Management (CRM)
Description: Job DescriptionAt Wells Fargo, we want to satisfy our customers financial needs and help them succeed financially. Were looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. Join our diverse and inclusive team where youll feel valued and inspired to contribute your unique skills and experience.  Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.  Data Management and Insights (DMI) is transforming the way that Wells Fargo uses and manages data. Our work enables Wells Fargo to empower and inform our team members, deliver exceptional experiences for our customers, and meet the elevated expectations of our regulators. The team is responsible for designing the future data environment, defining data governance and oversight, and partnering with technology to operate the data infrastructure for the company. This team also provides next generation analytic insights to drive business strategies and help meet our commitment to satisfy our customers financial needs.  This Analytic Consultantfor Wholesale Customer Relationship Management (CRM) Data is being created as part of the strengthening of the Wholesale Data Office and its ability to strategically support the business objectives and initiative based investments for the continuous improvement and enhancement of the Customer Data Domain (CRM) for Wholesale Banking and in particular the common Wholesale CRM strategy and objective as part of Whole Relationship Management Foundations (WRMF) initiative.  The Analytic Consultant will be working under the direction and guidance of the WRMF/Wholesale CRM Data Leader and will perform the detailed capture, analysis and documentation of business data elements & taxonomy, business rules and other supporting data for the CRM data management. With input from Wholesale LOB representatives and WRMF process team, perform the necessary alignment and standardization of definitions for key terms and align with WRMF target state system definitions.  Support the data governance and data profiling work in concert with EIT and other resources. Perform data quality gaps analysis and capture data quality rules in support of target state.  KEY RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE:Work closely with cross functional teams inclusive of WRMF Process & Tools teams, Wholesale LOB representatives, PPMG, EIT and other disciplines to align business and data strategies for CRM data.Establish and document data taxonomies and other data management artifacts like business glossary, lineage, data quality metrics for effectiveness of data related activities.Work with business to establish data standards in customer data / CRM domain and instrument the ecosystem with data quality measurements and drive continual improvement in data quality.Analyze CRM, Non-CRM and External vendor data.Identify and bring visibility to cross-LOB opportunities regarding CRM data. Enable common definitions and standardization.Data Profiling and Data Analysis.Perform Data quality analysis and profiling and enable the capture of data quality rules.Support the documentation of required data governance artifacts.  LOCATION(S): The preferred location(s) for this job opening is Summit, NJ; Charlotte, NC; San Francisco, CA; Minneapolis, MN; Phoenix, AZRequired Qualifications6+ years of experience in one or a combination of the following: reporting, analytics, or modeling; or a Masters degree or higher in a quantitative field such as applied math, statistics, engineering, physics, accounting, finance, economics, econometrics, computer sciences, or business/social and behavioral sciences with a quantitative emphasis and 4+ years of experience in one or a combination of the following: reporting, analytics, or modeling5 + years of experience gathering business requirements from various sources including end-users and stakeholders5+ years of experience with data analysis and documentation5+ years of SQL experience3+ years of data management experience including data modeling, data integrity and data quality3+ years of financial services experienceDesired QualificationsExtensive knowledge and understanding of research and analysisStrong analytical skills with high attention to detail and accuracyExcellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skillsOther Desired Qualifications Experience in business data information architecture (metadata), data governance, data analytics, data modeling, or a combination thereof accuracy SQL experience with data profiling and data analysis Experience with Data Quality tools like Informatica DQ 3+ years experience with capture / documentation of data requirements and other data artifacts and usage of Data Governance tools like Collibra Experience with Customer Relationship Management tools like Salesforce, MS Dynamics a plus Solid problem solving skills Experience working hands on with multiple teams in a matrix organization, including ability to work effectively with individuals at all levels of the company Good working knowledge of technology practices, including lifecycle management and technology risk mitigation techniquesDisclaimerAll offers for employment with Wells Fargo are contingent upon the candidate having successfully completed a criminal background check. Wells Fargo will consider qualified candidates with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable local, state and Federal law, including Section 19 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act.  Relevant military experience is considered for veterans and transitioning service men and women.  Wells Fargo is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer, Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation.

Name: Senior Business Analyst, Data Governance
Description: OverviewAs a key member of the Enterprise Data and Client Insights (EDCI) team, this position will play an important role the bank’s data governance program and related policies, processes and reporting. Working with other members of the EDCI team, technology and lines of business, this individual will support the execution of the data governance program.• Execution of the Bank’s data governance and data quality programs (policy, standards and controls)• Promoting the adoption of on-going Data Governance and Data Quality routines with key business partners• Sufficiently controlled, tested and documented data provisioning practices, mapping, lineage and reconciliation to support rigorous examination  The ideal candidate is a motivated, detail-oriented analyst who loves data and possesses excellent technical proficiency and strong business acumen.ResponsibilitiesResponsibilities:  • Design and deliver management reporting focusing on operational KPIs and early warning indicators• Build data sourcing for key data sets and develop BI reports/dashboards• Engage with business and technology partners to document business and functional requirements • Develop high value-added reporting and presentations for management • Engage with stakeholders to analyze and isolate root cause of data issues and drive data cleansing efforts• Develop and maintain detailed documentation of process design, data flows, data taxonomy, business glossary, data lineage and related controls/ procedures• Preparation of materials for key data governance meetings (e.g., Data Champions, Oversight Committee)• Responsible for understanding data from the enterprise perspective and managing it in such a way that it can be understood and leveraged across the organization• Other responsibilities may involve reference data and master data management governance processes • Responsibilities include: 1) adhering to and complying with the applicable, federal and state laws, regulations and guidance, including those related to Anti-money laundering (i.e. Bank Secrecy Act, US PATRIOT Act, etc.) 2) adhering to Bank policies and procedures, 3) completing required training, 4) identifying and reporting suspicious activity to the AML Officer, and 5) knowing and verifying the identity of any customer(s) that enters into a relationship with the Bank.QualificationsExperience:• Experience 5 - 7 years of financial services industry experience, preferably in deposit services• Proficient processing complex business concepts, researching data issues and managing through remediation• Experience with (or exposure to) account opening processes, KYC and operational controls• Skilled analyzing data and complex data relationships• Experience with BI reporting, including data visualization tools• Proficient SQL skills • Analytical skills to collect and profile data and compute key metrics (e.g., KPIs, KRIs)• Process design experience with process optimization mindset• Broad exposure to data governance/ data management concepts and technologies • Extensive experience presenting content to various audiences including senior management• Consulting background or experience in consultative role working closely with business stakeholders• Excellent presentation and documentation skills • Requires proficiency with varied computer and network operating systems • Experience with data management technologies and tools (e.g., MDM, ETL, Collibra) (desired)  Personal skills desirable for this role:• Passion about data management and data governance • Excellent interpersonal and collaboration skills• Objective, creative, and diplomatic team player• Extremely meticulous in approach to work• Outstanding attention to detail and strong organizational skills• Ability to work effectively with business and technology partners as well as with outside vendors and contractors• Ability to lead projects and work with little or no supervision, yet thrive in a collaborative environment• Proven ability to meet established deadlines• Voracious learner (technology, business processes, new tasks)• Strong analytical and problem solving skills• Must possess the ability to multi-task handling multiple projects or support efforts simultaneously• Strong drive for results• Good influencing skills• Strong leadership and mentoring skills• High levels of concentration• Ability to work calmly under pressure• Exhibits strong character• Must possess excellent written and oral communications skills• Demonstrated focus for customer satisfaction• Excellent relationship management skills• Must possess sound judgment for negotiating deliverables and timelines with tact and diplomacy

Name: Senior Business Analyst, Marketing Strategy & Analytics
Description: Affirm is working tirelessly to create a simpler and more innovative lending product, one that puts consumer’s financial future first while enabling them to live their lives without worry!We’re looking for intelligent, independent, and driven professionals to join our new Marketing Strategy & Analytics team here at Affirm. The MS&A team plays a pivotal role in defining Affirm’s interactions with our consumers through dual analytical and business oriented insights. This role will work cross-functionally in driving initiatives across all of Affirm’s consumer-facing business units, helping engage our customers with Affirm’s fundamental mission of putting their interests first.What You'll DoBuild strong interpersonal and cross-functional relationships across Affirm with an eye on driving forward marketing strategy and execution excellenceDevelop and drive marketing plans and strategies based on exploratory analytics and consumer insights that allow Affirm to differentiate from its competitorsServe as a critical component of consumer-facing projects that will help drive Affirm into the futureDesign and implement tests (A/B and multivariate) to build and optimize drivers of the Affirm businessPlay a role as an internal marketing consultant for the marketing, product, and client success teamsHelp and take ownership in the definition and reporting of critical tracking metrics and weekly/monthly/quarterly reporting as well as forecasting for all things marketingMaintain a strong understanding and even help shape our evolving marketing data warehouseBecome an expert in the retail POS financing and e-commerce spaceWhat We Look ForPassion and drive to disrupt both the retail and lending industry for the better3+ year of experience in a client-facing analytically-driven role (consulting, finance, analytics, etc.)1+ year of experience with e-commerce marketing in a consumer-facing role a plusStrong working knowledge of analytical tools, such as SQL, Python, R, and ExcelStrong interpersonal skills and ability to work in a team environment and cross-functionallyAbility and passion for finding analytical insights and communicating them as actionable business/marketing insightsAbility to think creatively and critically and thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic, and often ambiguous work environmentEnough laziness to find a faster way to do your least favorite tasksHumility and team player - you go out of your way to help teammatesAbout AffirmAffirm is reinventing credit to make it more honest and friendly. Started by PayPal co-founder Max Levchin, Affirm gives consumers the flexibility to buy now and make simple monthly payments. Unlike other credit options, Affirm offers transparent payment terms (no fees or compounding interest), and employs advanced technology to reach a broader consumer population.#LI-JA1

Name: Business Development Manager - Analytics
Description: Analytics - BUSINESS DEVELOPMENTLocation: Silicon Valley, CAAbout Trianz Trianz is a global professional services firm committed to enabling leaders to develop and execute operational strategies, leverage new business and technology paradigms, and achieve results expected by senior management in their organizations- predictably. What We Stand For Our clients are transforming their businesses, competitive strategies, product and service portfolios, customer-partner-employee interactions and their ecosystem as a whole. The cost of misses is not financial alone but a lost window of opportunity. So getting things right the first time is absolutely critical.  As a result, Trianz is focusing on three important themes in our engagement model with clients. Crystallize business impact from a top management point of viewHelp Clients achieve results from strategy-by making execution predictable through innovative execution techniquesCreate a positive, enriching partnership experience in everything we doIndustries, Clients & Practices Trianz works with clients across High Technology, Banking, Insurance, Manufacturing, Retail, Telecom, e-businesses and Public Services. Most clients are Fortune 1000 organizations and our relationships are sponsored by senior leaders in Enterprise Analytics Sales, Finance, Marketing, Human Resources, Operations and Information Technology. We partner with our clients to address the following key service areas: CloudAnalyticsDigitizationSecurityInfrastructure solutions About the Role;Analytics Solutions- Business Development Trianz is looking for a Business Development representative to cover the Western United States as part of its exploding Analytics practice. The candidate should have 10+ years of experience in the Analytics space with a strong aptitude of software, services and managed services. The business development representative will be responsible for positioning key Trianz offerings with new client prospects in the western US. The representative will be supported by a global organization that includes a strong digital marketing team, inside sales representatives and a pre-sales technical support team as starters.  The chosen representative will also have the strength of several global partnerships such as Snowflake, MemSQL, Looker, Qubole, Cloudera, Teradata, Talend, Tableau, Qlik, SAS and others.  The business development representative will be responsible for the development, advancement and closure of opportunities in their given territory. Responsibilities of the business development representative shall include but not be limited to: SkillsPursue and maintain certifications related to any of our partners that require sales certifications in addition to any certifications Trianz deems important as a pre-requisite to the roleFollow up on leads from Marketing campaigns, conferences, advertising, Inside sales, LinkedIn outreach and other inbound and outbound lead generating tacticsCreate your own leads from existing relationships as prudent and/or through request for referrals from clients to your developDevelop relationships with sellers on the ground for your various partners, highlight to them the work we do, maintain a communication strategy with them either directly or with the help of marketing This should be viewed as communication and a very tertiary means for opportunity development.Work closely with counterparts from the inside sales team to review scripts on a regular basis for effectivenessreview effectiveness of emails, LinkedIn and other outreachdefine targeted clients to try and penetrate and jointly create a strategycommunicate effectively to develop and advance opportunitiesLeverage the Trianz off shore marketing support team as necessary for proposal development, RFP responses and other needsLeverage pre-sales technical support team to deliver presentations, demonstrations, pilots, proofs of concept and other required deliverables to progress the saleTravel as needed to client sites, technical conferences, training, team and company functionsPosition Trianzs growing managed services business and remote management capabilities with every opportunity (as prudent or relevant)CompetenciesWork with extended members of the team included proposal assurance team to develop and deliver proposals, SOWs, RFPsLeverage your knowledge of the Analytics field to demonstrate expertise in the domain as it pertains to the solutions we deliver and the evolution of the field Stay current on industry trends, news, analyst insights and related topicsLeverage existing or create appropriate materials to present to prospects throughout the opportunity development phasesDemonstrate command of meetings and presentations based on your experienceWork with the local marketing team for any initiatives you want to run in territory or to understand any campaigns they are running on behalf of the organization The Trianz Client Acquisition Team (CAT) sets out to be the pace setters in the organization as a high performance culture that drives hard to win, rewards and celebrates success and helps his/her fellow employee to better serve our clients. We are Growing Rapidly: 2017 Highlights Trianz is growing above the average of the professional services industry. Here are some highlights. Voted significantly above other services firms by 90% + of clients for business impact, execution predictability and organizational commitment in the recent Trianz wide client satisfaction survey.Won the Customer Obsession Award from Amazon Web Services for our innovation and execution record in Cloud Infrastructure and Business Applications strategy and services.Won UNICOM awards for the #1 Digitization and #1 Analytics project over a wide array of competition.Featured by IDC in their Spotlight series under the theme of Operationalizing Strategies through Execution Excellence: A New Paradigms in Technology Delivery.Achieved 50%+ revenue and employee growth compared to prior years exit showing an increasing acceptance of our models and success from our differentiated methodologies in strategic execution.Talk to us, Join us & Develop into Leaders Come join a dynamic global firm. We are an open, non-bureaucratic and no-nonsense culture. We believe in a culture of innovation, encouraging our people to create. We believe training and development of all our associates as the most important thing we can provide to our talent. We are investing heavily- in classroom, online and on the job training. Seeing our talent develop into leaders- is whats fundamental for everyone at Trianz.  We are hiring at all levels of Trianz. And we are hiring globally. So- if you have a passion for execution and would like to develop into a leader capable of taking on anything, or are already a leader, talk to us!  Equal Opportunity Employer Trianz does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, creed, national or ethnic origin, gender, religion, disability, age, political affiliation or belief, disabled veteran, veteran of the Vietnam Era, or citizenship status (except in those special circumstances permitted or mandated by law).

Name: Business Analyst
Description: About Us: Braintree lets you move money from one place to another safely and securely. Every time you pay for an Uber ride, book a stay through Airbnb, or pay with PayPal when you check out online, you're probably using our product. It sounds complex (and it is), but we make it so simple you can't tell we're there.  We solve world-scale problems and provide opportunities to match. We build diverse teams that recognize our strengths and allow us to work on our weaknesses. You bring skills and a relentless focus on the customer, and we'll provide the support you need to do the best work of your life.  Check us out: GitHub | Blog | Twitter | LinkedIn | Facebook | The Muse | Glassdoor The Analytics Team: The Braintree Analytics Team is committed to delivering actionable and insightful reporting and analysis to drive all parts of the business forward. We relentlessly advocate the use of empirical evidence to inform decisions so Braintree may achieve their greatest potential. As Braintree products and features rapidly evolve, the Analytics Team coalesces information from multiple, disparate resources to provide a cohesive data story to our core stakeholders. Communication is key to our process, and we don't want to hinder it with walls. Many analysts work in pairs, which means you always have another set of eyes to help you.We keep the team in sync with daily stand-ups and have regular retrospectives to discuss things that are going well and opportunities for improvements.We value unique perspectives brought by diverse backgrounds and experiences. A broad range of ideas and perspectives help us to create the best possible output.We learn and grow as a team with bi-weekly knowledge sharesTypes of projects we work on: Internal Reporting and Analysis We build reports and self-service tools to monitor transaction authorization rates, to track the adoption of new products and features, and to measure the impact of global marketing initiatives.We work closely with Accounts, Sales, and Marketing teams to understand, measure, and track our merchants' experience. Merchant-facing Reporting and Analysis We strive to develop reporting tools that address the immediate need while anticipating how it can serve a broader audience and set of needs in the future.We team up with Account Managers to understand merchants' questions, to advise what analysis our team can provide, and to facilitate communication of findings back to the merchant.What we look for in you:Professional experience in a quantitative/analytical roleStrong communication skills, particularly in explaining complex topics to varied audiencesHigh degree of proficiency with SQL, familiarity with common scripting languages such as Python or RResourcefulness, ability to parse internal documentation, developer documentation and code repositoriesExperience leveraging common visualization tools such as Looker or Tableau to tell a story with dataStrong sense of ownership in work, attention to detail and quality of outputExcellent time management skills, ability to juggle many things at oncePerks:Open dev days: every two weeks we spend a day working on projects that interest us and help us expand our skills and knowledge.Participation in the technology community: we help cover travel and attendance costs for conferences, and we offer opportunities and tools for speaking.Check out our Careers page for more company perks. We know the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates. Please don't hesitate to apply. You can also check out our FAQ!

Name: Advanced Analytics Specialist 2
Description: Position DescriptionROLE CAN BE LOCATED IN SAN BRUNO, CA OR HOBOKEN, NJ  Flawless Inventory Management is key to building a profitable and scalable ecommerce business. The Supply Chain Product Management & Analytics (SCPMA) team manages several core aspects of inventory management across Walmart.com and Jet.com, such as forecasting customer demand, purchasing to that demand, bringing end-to-end visibility to our supply chain performance and working on special projects to optimize the physical supply chain.  The Advanced Analytics Specialist is responsible for helping build best-in-class analytics tools and products to enable 200+ internal users to make critical business decisions, daily, using one of the richest data sets in the world. Your ultimate goal is to use data to rapidly release tools to enable the Supply Chain & Inventory operators, and then partner with our Engineering team to productionize these tools into sustainable products. You will learn the art and science of Analytics at an unsurpassed scale with the largest retailer on the planet. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams such as product, engineering, inventory managers, fulfillment operators, and retail team. What youll be working on:Analytics: Work with large, messy, disparate datasets and conduct ad hoc back of the envelope analyses to quickly inform critical business decisionsProduct: Build innovative analytics products, and data infrastructure to bring clarity to our operators and enable them to make insightful decisionsProject Management: Gain understanding of sometimes unarticulated business needs, translate strategic initiatives into detailed product specifications, and work with Product Managers on the team to catalyze product developmentModeling: Develop and improve upon our methodology for demand forecasting and inventory replenishment logic with some of the best data scientists in the industryStrategy: Design scalable workflows and tools to automate processes that would otherwise be manual and time-consuming About You  You are a risk taker and a dreamer that delivers, doesn't take "it's not possible" for an answer, and has big ideas they can't wait to bring to life. You pride yourself on being the first of your friends and colleagues to have the pulse of whats happening in the world and staying in the know. You have a passion for working with data to deliver actionable guidance and drive business performance. You want to be a part of one of the fastest growing ecommerce companies around where the only constant is change, and you thrive on taking anbiguity in stride.  Our team is small but mighty, which is why we are looking for a rock star Advance Analytics Specialist who will leave no stone unturned to identify the best possible solution and will Do whats right for the customer whether internal or external. Expert at SQL, Excel and Python (preferred) - ability to manipulate large quantities of data to drive business decisions is a mustStrong business acumen and scrappiness - you approach problems in a scientific manner but can also execute pragmaticallyExcellent analytical, organizational, and written/verbal communication skillsDemonstrated superb ability to independently frame problems, drive analysis, engage stakeholders #LI-KA2Minimum Qualifications•0-4 years of professional experience in a highly analytical and data intensive role at a startup and/or finance/consulting firm (not including internships) BA/BS degree in Economics/Mathematics/Statistics/Computer Science or equivalent practical experience; MBAAdditional Preferred Qualifications•Hands-on experience with VBA, R, Looker, Tableau or other data analysis/visualization tools is a plusCompany SummaryThe Walmart eCommerce team is rapidly innovating to evolve and define the future state of shopping. As the worlds largest retailer, we are on a mission to help people save money and live better. With the help of some of the brightest minds in technology, merchandising, marketing, supply chain, talent and more, we are reimagining the intersection of digital and physical shopping to help achieve that mission.Position SummaryROLE CAN BE LOCATED IN SAN BRUNO, CA OR HOBOKEN, NJ Flawless Inventory Management is key to building a profitable and scalable ecommerce business. The Supply Chain Product Management & Analytics (SCPMA) team manages several core aspects of inventory management across Walmart.com and Jet.com, such as forecasting customer demand, purchasing to that demand, bringing end-to-end visibility to our supply chain performance and working on special projects to optimize the physical supply chain. Your ultimate goal is to use data to rapidly release tools to enable the Supply Chain & Inventory operators, and then partner with our Engineering team to productionize these tools into sustainable products. You will learn the art and science of Analytics at an unsurpassed scale with the largest retailer on the planet. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams such as product, engineering, inventory managers, fulfillment operators, and retail team. You pride yourself on being the first of your friends and colleagues to have the pulse of whats happening in the world and staying in the know. You have a passion for working with data to deliver actionable guidance and drive business performance. You want to be a part of one of the fastest growing ecommerce companies around where the only constant is change, and you thrive on taking anbiguity in stride.  Our team is small but mighty, which is why we are looking for a rock star Advance Analytics Specialist who will leave no stone unturned to identify the best possible solution and will Do whats right for the customer whether internal or external.
