Name: Associate, Strategic Finance
Description: DoorDash is building a high performing Strategic Finance team that will drive the financial and operating strategy of the company. We're looking for strategic thinkers who can model the future, solve complex problems and collaborate effectively with teams to implement solutions.This is a unique role with an opportunity to make an immediate impact by helping identify, size, propose, and execute on major new company initiatives. The right candidate will have the skill set to enable data-driven business decisions, and to develop sophisticated financial models that help us optimize our investments in all sides of our business (Dasher, Merchant, and Consumer). You'll combine knowledge of the business with advanced scenario modeling and data analysis, enabling you to become a trusted business partner throughout the organization and help lead projects from idea generation through execution. What you'll doEnd-to-end analysis - extract raw data and build models that solve complex problems and uncover insights throughout the companyDrive strategic decision making - use data to constantly improve visibility into company performance, prioritize opportunities and make recommendations for new projects to pursuePartner with key stakeholders throughout the company on initiatives that help improve the experience of consumers, dashers and merchantsOwn special projects - new initiatives and opportunities always come upAbout you2 - 4 years experience in business strategy / analytics, business operations, monetization, growth strategy, consulting, investment banking, or other analytically-intensive roles at either high-growth technology startups or well-established companiesAdvanced SQL proficiency. Able to manipulate large data sets, uncover hidden insights in our data, and meaningfully improve our understanding of our business through this processAdvanced Excel & financial modeling skills. Able to build robust financial models used by teams throughout the company, and to size opportunities and build business cases for pursuing new initiativesStrong communication and interpersonal skills. Cross-functional relationships and effective communication are critical to implementing impactful projectsSelf-starter with attention to detail. Ability to move quickly and desire to own projects from Day 1Nice to havesExperience leading projects/teams and turning ideas into measurable outcomesFamiliarity with data visualization tools such as Tableau, and data-oriented programming languages like R or PythonExperience with a logistics or consumer products companyAbout us Founded in 2013, DoorDash is a San Francisco-based technology company passionate about transforming local businesses and dedicated to enabling new ways of working, earning, and living. Today, DoorDash connects customers with their favorite local and national businesses in more than 1,000 cities across the United States and Canada. By building intelligent, last-mile delivery technology for local cities, DoorDash aims to connect people with the things they care about one dash at a time.

Name: Business Analytics Manager
Description: Have you ever tried to hire a plumber? How about a house cleaner? If you have, chances are it took you way longer than it should. In the era of instant-everything, it’s crazy that you still have to waste an entire afternoon researching, calling and vetting local service professionals whenever you need one. The market for hiring them is huge — $700B in the US alone — but the process is inefficient and largely offline.  Thumbtack is transforming this experience end-to-end, building a marketplace that matches millions of people with local pros for almost any project. In making these connections, not only do our customers get more done every day, our pros are able to grow their businesses and make a living doing what they’re great at.About the Business Analytics TeamThe Business Analytics team’s mission is to unlock strategic opportunities and enable Thumbtack to achieve its full business potential. To accomplish this mission, we focus on: Strategic insights: Analytics to uncover insights that will be game-changers for our business, and that inform company strategy and team execution.Business performance: Metrics, dashboards, and forums that help us measure progress towards our goals and foster deep understanding of our business.Telling Thumbtack’s story: Using metrics and data visualization to tell Thumbtack’s story to investors, board members, our team, and the world.Building a world-class team: hiring the best, and investing in coaching, learning, and team building. We are a tight-knit group that is passionate about driving business impact through analytics.About the RoleAs a leader on the Business Analytics team, you’ll drive insights and action across the breadth of the marketplace. You’ll be a steward of key company metrics and dashboards, and dive deep on analytical questions that are critical to Thumbtack’s success. You’ll partner with our leadership team to develop company strategy and goals, share performance updates with the Board, and work with teams across the business to drive actionable insights and business impact. This particular role will lead the team’s business performance work and manage and grow a team of Business Analysts.About youYou’ll be a great fit for the team if:You’re extremely data-driven -- you love learning from data to make decisions, and always seem to have data at your fingertipsYou geek out on metrics and dashboards -- you enjoy tracking trends, and have a driving curiosity to understand what’s driving themYou enjoy answering big questions with analysis, and diving deep to reveal insightful and actionable insightsYou’re passionate about measuring business impact, and drawing the connection between what teams are building and how it impacts company metricsYou enjoy roles that enable you to understand the breadth of the business (vs. focusing on one specific area) Name: 2019 MBA Summer Intern - Product Manager, Search Product
Description: Position DescriptionIn this role you drive product strategy and execution from inception through delivery for Online Grocery. You interact regularly with senior leaders and are responsible for delivering new initiatives and features that deliver value to the customer.  Intern project  During the summer you will find a customer pain point on the Search experience, you will research it and back it up with data, qualitatively and quantitatively working in Data Science and UX research. You Will lead brain storming sessions with different stakeholders (Engineering, Design, Business, Product) to find different solutions. You will prototype your solutions and share the results with to Product and Engineering leadership. At the end of the summer we expect you to deliver tangible impact to the business either by learning new insights about our customers and ideally by solving a customer problem.  Key stakeholders: Product, Analytics, Business and Engineering teams for Online Grocery and Search. Business teams for Online Grocery. Executive team for Product, Engineering and Business.Minimum Qualificationso Currently enrolled in the first year of an MBA program with Data Science orientation and 3 years of product management, consulting or Business. o E2E Product Review Presentation including: o Customer Journey and Pain points  o Company Strategy  o Supporting Analysis  o Feature Design  o Prototyping and testing plan.  o Feature Results.  o Next Steps and Recommendations.Additional Preferred Qualifications• Uncompromising commitment to the customer In depth knowledge of big data and understanding of basic cycle of Machine learning development process.Leadership experience: Experience driving cross functional projects with a track record of leading teams to deploy innovative solutions that deliver measurable results at scale.Strong analytical skills including the ability to structure problems for analysis, query data, and understand root causes. Experience working with data scientists and optimization modelsExceptional communication skills #MBAinternshipsCompany SummaryThe Walmart eCommerce team is rapidly innovating to evolve and define the future state of shopping. As the worlds largest retailer, we are on a mission to help people save money and live better. With the help of some of the brightest minds in technology, merchandising, marketing, supply chain, talent and more, we are reimagining the intersection of digital and physical shopping to help achieve that mission.Position SummaryAre you passionate about understanding what customers want and connecting them with the right products by building a world class Search engine? If so, the Search Product team is looking to hire a Product Manager that is passionate about delivering a great customer experience for Walmart Grocery. The Online Grocery Search is helping busy families nationwide to get their groceries online so that they can save time and money for things that matter most.

Name: People Analytics Business Partner
Description: At Uber, we ignite opportunity by setting the world in motion. We take on big problems to help drivers, riders, delivery partners, and eaters get moving in more than 600 cities around the world.  We welcome people from all backgrounds who seek the opportunity to help build a future where everyone and everything can move independently. If you have the curiosity, passion, and collaborative spirit, work with us, and let’s move the world forward, together. About the Role Our People Analytics team is looking for an analyst to join our Analytics Business Partner (ABP) team. This individual will be focused on playing an analytically consultative role in enabling our recruiting organization in creating and executing against data-driven strategies. They also will be responsible for owning the development, measurement, and improvement of key recruiting initiatives and will be seen as a trusted analytical thought partner. What You’ll DoBecome a deep subject matter expert of our global recruiting business and be able to leverage your analytical toolkit in the formation of creative solutions for key business opportunitiesEnsure the consistent application and interpretation of key HR data and analyses across the organization through partnership, reporting, and business intelligenceForm strong relationships with Recruiting Leadership to develop deep context about the organizationBe the eyes and ears for our broader People Analytics team and partner with Core Analytics to identify areas to streamline central analytical processes and programsWhat You’ll NeedBachelor and/or Master’s degree in Business, Economics, or other business operations focus2+ years of management consulting, operations, finance or other analytical related experience. Recruiting or People Analytics in a high-growth or tech environment a plusQuantitative analysis expertise in one or more analytical tools. Fluency with spreadsheets is a minimum; SQL, Python, R a plusData-driven and highly analytical - you’re able to translate data and insights into a meaningful story to drive strategy, action, and decision-making at an executive levelSelf-starter attitude - you boldly pursue your work and love the responsibility of being personally empoweredCuriosity - you're innovative, creative, and constantly looking for opportunities to tweak and optimizeAbout the Team We are People Analytics, the team that brings Uber’s people data to life. Through trusted partnerships with client organizations across the company, we advocate for sound data-driven decisions regarding Uber’s most valuable asset--its people. We utilize our diverse skill sets and methodologies to create and implement initiatives that tackle Uber’s toughest people challenges.  As a team, we believe that people decisions are business decisions, and we strive to create a workplace where every employee at Uber can succeed while driving our business forward. We believe that proactive, innovative analysis and research will enable us to build a sustainable workforce for Uber’s future, and we believe we are a catalyst for positive organizational change. We aspire to become the most impactful people analytics team by using people data to build a world-class culture and experience for Uber employees globally.

Name: Senior Director of Ecommerce
Description: Senior Director of eCommerce is a critical, innovative and strategic role for Biossance, leading the growth and development of a large eCommerce business in the Skincare arena. The leader is expected to deliver business results by optimizing a Best in Class website experience and an easily converted client experience.  ResponsibilitiesEcommerce to include the following: Develop and execute vision and strategy for eCommerce channel that encompasses product, marketing and site design.Develop and execute a business strategy that optimizes traffic, conversion and AOSLead Innovation and Industry leading digital thinking for Biossance.com Ability to build new website experience, from conception to launch on new product/brand ideaCreate and Lead Roadmap for infrastructure and features. Continuously enhance functionality across all sitesManage all digital vendor relationships and projects for mutual success, from contract negotiation through to launch and ongoing enhancements Ensure the day-to-day effectiveness of content display merchandising, navigation, search functionality and product presentation to optimize our customer experienceOversight for all site development phases from concept to launch, including business requirements, user flows/wire frames, functional requirements, QA/testing, and post-launch monitoring and optimization to ensure efficiency, accuracy and timeliness of all web content publishing.Maintain updates and resolve issues regarding site experience improvements. Manage all aspects of web analytics as related to eCommerce and communicate relevant information to team members, executive leadership and cross-functional partners Coordinate with CRM team to implement personalized experiences and campaigns as well as drive personalization. Advise on key changes and strategic direction in the eCommerce and ensure eCommerce principles are incorporated in all cross-functional projects. Develop and enhance customer segmentation and cluster group analysis and their use in driving business performance. Financial + Analytics to include the following:Manage the P&L for Biossance.com, as well as monthly forecasting and budgets for eCommerce. Optimize cost efficiency for site maintenance and enhancementsCollaborate with inventory team to develop a sales & inventory plan that optimizes channel growth and profitabilityProvide on-going tracking and analysis of customer on-site behavior through market and competitive analysis and review and measurement of site analyticsIntegrate feedback from Customer Service and customer research into site functionality and product presentation requirements Personal Competencies Global Business AcumenMerchandising & Assortment Strategy to include the following:Partner with content and Social Media managers, editors, designers, developers, and others to ensure alignment with the brand strategy platform.Defines, aligns, and manages online product content including product descriptions, pictures, product metadata, categorization, and pricing. Collaborate with merchandising and inventory to develop and execute the brand promotional strategyTeam Development to include the following: Lead team of 3 6 peopleCoach team members to success and holds individuals accountable for achieving results.Reinforce a culture of test and learn; advise or identify new test ideas with the goal of driving increased revenue per visit and an improved customer experience across all device types. QualificationsBachelors degree; 12+ years of related business experience, Beauty or Retail industry preferred.Passion for skincare / beauty industry.Ability to identify the big ideas from the small ones and drive for results on the big ideas.Must demonstrate strong strategic, creative, interpersonal, and organizational skillsThrive in an environment that is fast-paced, rapidly changing, and customer service-oriented.Able to handle multiple priorities while meeting objectives.Team player who builds strong, effective partnershipsTeam builder who develops and coaches team members to reach their own professional goalsExcellent written and verbal skillsEmbrace Amyris Core ValuesAdherence to Amyris Safety Policies and Procedures No Compromise BeautyBiossance is a clean beauty brand that uses biotechnology to create skincare products that are effective, sustainable and safe. We formulate with a No Compromise approachproudly blacklisting over 2,000 potentially harmful ingredients. Only the most trustworthy and powerful make our final cut. Our StoryIt all began inside our Berkeley labs in 2003, where through biology and modern technology a plant-derived cure for malaria was created. Since then, over 120 million royalty-free treatments have been given, saving lives and communities. Inspired to keep positively changing the world through biotech, we turned to the ingredients people use on their bodies every day. And we asked how we could do better. Drawing on our rich history of science and sustainability, we create skincare products that are incredibly effective and safe without harming the environment. Because our standards for clean beauty are highand our standards for ourselves are even higher.Biossance products are available at Biossance.com and Sephora.Amyris, a leader in industrial synthetic biology, uses its innovative bioscience solutions to achieve renewable products by converting plant sugars into hydrocarbon molecules. Amyris molecules are used in wide range of specialty & performance chemicals, flavors & fragrances and in applications ranging from cosmetics to biofuels. Learn more at www.amyris.com.As a VEVRAA Federal Contractor, Amyris is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Amyris complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment.If you are a recruiter or placement agency, please do not submit resumes to any person or email address at Amyris, Inc. prior to having a signed agreement. Furthermore, any resumes sent to us without an agreement in place will be considered your companys gift to Amyris and may be forwarded to our recruiters for their attention.For a full list of our current openings, please visit our website .

Name: Senior Analyst, Business Analytics
Description: Job Description Senior Analyst, Business Analytics Description At TripAdvisor Experiences, the only thing we love more than travel is data. We slice it, we dice it, and we use it to empower our decision making. In fact, most would be surprised at just how many people in our office can write their own SQL queries.  The Experiences Analytics Team is seeking a Senior Analyst, Business Analytics who has the analytical skills and business knowledge to support numerous end users from an analytics and measurement perspective and is looking to join a fast-growing all-star team dedicated to providing the highest quality data driven insights. What Youll DoLead analysis/reporting of current business operating metrics, focused on developing the capability to provide insight into TripAdvisor's Experiences products and improving TripAdvisor's understanding of its market-by-market customer propositions and competitor positioningProvide timely insights and analytical support to different internal stakeholders to support effective business decision-making, including Product, Marketing, Supply and Business Development.Create concepts, justify business cases and manage the implementation of changes to the website experience to improve customer engagement and value metricsEmploy/automate reporting tools to measure customer interaction (such as acquisition of members, engagement metrics, and member and user value) and competitor positioning (such as reach and page impression growth, content feature set, and marketing activities)Lead analysis of consumer and member behavior across the websites, using web analytics tools and internal warehouse data to identify source of traffic and which areas of the site, content and functionality users are engaging inIdentify key success indicators and determine best practices for measurement and reportingLead product experimental design like A/B or Multi-variate test to identify opportunity for product optimization and improve business KPIsAssist with ad hoc queries and provide analytical support to our fast-growing business as it evolvesWhat We Seek3-5 years of experience in an analytical role (ideal backgrounds include: a similar business analyst role at a web company, a data-based consulting role, or other data strategy type positions)Education: Bachelor's Degree in an analytical field (math, economics, engineering, statistics, etc), Masters Degree a plusExcellent problem-solving and analytical skills, involving data analysis, experimental design and predictive modelingAbility to work with large dataset and summarize findings in a clear formatCombine creative and pragmatic use of insight and data with attention to detailYou live in Excel, a SQL client, R/Python, Tableau and a few other useful tools of the data tradeProactive not reactive, with ability to work independently in a fast-paced environmentAbility to take in loose requirements, work independently, ask smart questions, and produce high quality actionable insightsConfident with learning new tools, technologies, and methodologiesAbility to work at all levels including senior management; and across multiple functions/departmentsSmall company experience with hands on / can-do mindsetSome programming/scripting ability a huge plusExperience with statistical packages such as SAS, R, SPSS, etc. a plus LI-JC1#

Name: Account Executive - SF
Description: WHO WE ARE Looker is on a mission to bring better insights and data-driven decisions to every business. Everything we do is aimed at making sure our customers love every aspect of Looker, from our products and technologies to our ease of doing business and our support. We are looking for curiously brilliant individuals to join our team as we reinvent data analytics. Get data-driven and see yourself at Looker. WHAT WE'VE GOT GOING ONWe are seeking experienced SaaS Account Executives that take a consultative, conversational, and diagnostic approach to the sales process. The ideal candidate would be described as a Data, Analytics and Business Intelligence enthusiast with a strong understanding of and/or curiosity about the importance of leveraging data to make critical business decisions. If you are naturally curious, have a technical aptitude or possess a desire to get deeper into the technical side of the sales process, we should talk.WHAT WE NEED YOU TO DOManage the entire sales process, including web-based product demonstrations, account management, generating quotes, negotiating contracts, and closing businessThis is a quota-carrying sales position that is critical to the overall success of Looker WHAT YOU BRING TO LOOKER2-4+ years minimum experience in a SaaS, quota-carrying sales role, ideally in business intelligence or analyticsDriven to excel in a fast-paced, autonomous, fun, start-up environmentPassionate about data and how customers can get value out of itAble to demo the product and articulate how customers can achieve valueAble to convey technical principles in a very consultative and conversational wayAccustomed to running the complete sales cycle from qualifiation to close (this is not an inside support role)Able to understand the power of listening and observation Possess a natural curiosity about data and the value it brings to business decision-making#LI-AL1A LITTLE MORE ABOUT LOOKERLooker is a complete data platform that offers data analytics and business insights to every department, and easily integrates into applications to deliver data directly into the decision-making process. Over 1,600 industry-leading and innovative companies such as Sony, Amazon, The Economist, IBM, Spotify, Etsy, Lyft and Kickstarter have trusted Looker to power their data-driven cultures. The company is headquartered in Santa Cruz, California, with offices in San Francisco, New York, Chicago, Boulder, London and Dublin, Ireland. Investors include CapitalG, Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers, Meritech Capital Partners, Redpoint Ventures, First Round Capital, Sapphire Ventures and Goldman Sachs. For more information, connect with us on LinkedIn, Twitter, Facebook and YouTube or visit looker.com.Looker aspires to be a workplace that is not only free of discrimination, but one that fosters inclusion and belonging. We strongly believe that diversity of experience, perspective, and background lead to a better environment for our employees and a better product for our users. We encourage you to join us in changing the way businesses use data.

Name: FP&A Manager, Emerging Markets
Description: About the Company eBay Classifieds Group is an innovative leader in online classifieds, with eleven brands that span the Globe. Our sites help people find whatever they are looking for in their local communities whether its a job, an apartment, a sofa, a car, a concert ticket, financial services or new friends. Every connection made or item found makes a difference by creating a world where people share more and waste less. People who want to connect and trade visit our sites because they are fun, easy to use and built on trust.  Our Emerging Markets businesses form a core part of our Global Growth Business Unit, which is a portfolio of businesses in the US, Mexico, South Africa, Argentina and Poland. About the Role The FP&A Manager, Emerging Markets will be responsible for financial planning, forecasting and reporting, provide financial and strategic insights and partner closely with the management team to help grow and develop the business. The position is based in San Francisco and reports to the Head of Emerging Markets FP&A. Key Responsibilities: · Lead financial planning, forecasting and reporting for the full P&L  · Collaborate with business and analytics teams to understand performance drivers and business outlook  · Provide the business with weekly revenue forecasts and business insights using a detailed bottoms up revenue forecast model with supporting business drivers  · Lead month and quarter-end close  · Ensure all monthly and quarterly FP&A related reporting requirements and submissions are met in a timely and accurate manner  · Partner with controllership team in execution of accounting and financial controllership processes  · Support annual budget, strategic planning and quarterly ops reviews Qualifications: · Approximately 4-6 years of related finance experience  · Previous FP&A experience in a large company  · Industry experience in e-commerce or consumer internet a plus  · Proven record of exceptional performance at all professional and educational career stages  · Excellent Excel and financial modeling skills  · Experience with enterprise financial planning systems (preferably SAP, BPC)  · Strong presentation and communication skills, proficiency with PowerPoint  · High energy and a desire to work in a result-oriented, dynamic fast growth environment  · Willingness and ability to work during periods with high workloads  · Experience working for a multi-national company  · Bachelors degree  This website uses cookies to enhance your experience. By continuing to browse the site, you agree to our use of cookies  View our privacy policy  View our accessibility info eBay Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, and disability, or other legally protected status. If you are unable to submit an application because of incompatible assistive technology or a disability, please contact us at talent@ebay.com. We will make every effort to respond to your request for disability assistance as soon as possible.  For more information see:  EEO is the Law Poster  EEO is the Law Poster Supplement

Name: New Product Opportunities Director – Global Pharma Strategy
Description: The New Product Opportunities Director - Pharma Strategy, will be responsible for evaluating new business opportunities and developing a pharma strategy. In this challenging and highly visible role, this individual will help management formulate long-term strategic priorities and plans, analyze and make recommendations related to emerging industry trends, expansion opportunities, competitive dynamics, and collaboration opportunities. This role will provide leadership in the design, development and implementation of strategic initiatives that advance Genomic Health’s objective to partner with pharma organizations in achieving better care for cancer patients. The New Product Opportunities Director – Pharma Strategy, will develop and maintain a view of the broader Oncology and Urology pharmaceuticals market dynamics. He/she will keep abreast of new developments in key therapeutic areas, synthesize, and share findings and recommendations with management and the corporate development team. He/she will proactively identify, develop, and drive longer-term strategies and initiatives that will result in profitable growth for the Oncology and Urology businesses in US and Ex-US markets. This role will partner closely with cross functional teams to identify unique opportunities that could include but not limited to: licensing, distribution, clinical trial collaboration, or biomarker discovery. This individual will educate and advise leadership on the pharma market as well as potential investment and growth opportunities. This position will report to the VP/Sr. Director of Strategy and Product Management within the Business & Product Development organization. RESPONSIBILITIES / DUTIES:Define a pharma strategy that will maximize the success of GHI’s key franchises – Urology and Oncology. Effectively prioritize and support strategy development and manages through ambiguity.Identify market opportunities and unmet customer needs through various sources of qualitative and quantitative data collection and analysis including start-up incubators, customer advisory boards, customer market research, internal subject matter experts (editorial, production, marketing, sales, support, and technology), competitive product analysis, and other direct and indirect forms of customer/market feedbackMaintains thorough knowledge of company's products, competition, and broader market dynamics that frame the business context both present and over the next few years. Blends experience in pharmaceuticals along with knowledge of company’s products to identify opportunities to leverage organization’s strengths to build partnerships with pharma companies.Be highly commercial in mindset and possess sound judgement—able to spot opportunities and quickly capitalize on them—with a strong financial and analytical acumen; inclination to think in terms of new business opportunities / models, cost/benefit analysis, and using a data-driven approach. Facilitates business problem solving through structured hypotheses, detailed analyses, and synthesized insights leading to recommendations to senior management.Develops business models to evaluate acquisitions, new business models, or in support of understanding the size, growth, and evolution of markets in which we do business, doing so with imperfect dataProvide vision and leadership in long-range company planning.Identifies, scopes and manages strategic projects end-to-end; maintains responsibility for deliverables and timelines, shifting priorities as needed; manages stakeholder relationships and expectationsBuilds trust and productive relationships with team members and stakeholders across the organizationInfluences and gains acceptance of others to one’s ideas through effective communication, relevant and insightful analyses, and creative thinkingActs as thought partner in strategic discussions even outside of own projectsStrong ability to collaborate and effectively communicate at all levels. Lead and make strategic recommendations in a respectful manner without dictating; built solid long-term relationships based on earned mutual respectInteracts with external leaders (KOLs, executives, academic researchers, consultants) to discuss pharma strategy and clinical data and/or collaboration/partnership opportunities.Other responsibilities as assignedQUALIFICATIONS:BS in Life Sciences or similar discipline with a general understanding of biology, diagnostics, pharmaceuticals, or medical devices. MBA strongly preferred.A minimum of 15 years of relevant industry experience in product management, commercialization, and/or M&A experience in the pharmaceuticals or biopharma industry. Prior Management Consulting experience or diagnostics (IVD) experience would be a plus.Self-starter with the demonstrated ability to generate and articulate a vision and strategy and carry it all the way to tactical planning and successful execution in a dynamic market place.Demonstrated strong understanding of the pharmaceuticals and/or biopharma industry to manage through ambiguity and help management sift through various strategic opportunitiesDemonstrated history of identifying market opportunities and leading the development of commercially successful new products in existing and/or new marketsDemonstrated ability to effectively distill a large amount of complex customer, clinical, market, and technical data from multiple sources into a clear value proposition and to articulate and communicate this value proposition to a range of customer and internal audiences.Demonstrated history of building alignment between product, technology and subject matters experts within an organization, as well as a demonstrated capacity of effectively interact with external stakeholdersDemonstrated history of sound business judgment, analytical rigor, and disciplined product strategy decisions based on data-driven insightsMust have demonstrated success in managing multiple stakeholders and resolving conflict within teams.Must have excellent communication skills including oral, written and presentation techniques.Able to integrate and apply feedback in a professional manner.Able to prioritize and drive to results with a high emphasis on quality.DESIREDMS or PhD Life Sciences or similar disciplineStrong knowledge and experience in the area of oncology or urology including external trends and issues in the global oncology and/or urology landscapeStrong analytical skills with experience with financial modeling or data analysis skills. Ability to build and analyze financial models to forecast and track resultsExperience in a regulated market space including CLIA, FDA, CEExperience with business development including in-licensing and external partnershipsExperience with working in both the clinical environment (i.e HCPs) and the diagnostic lab environment (i.e testing laboratories) Physical Requirements Travel Requirements: 10%- 20%Use of computer, and or telephone for long periods of time may be necessary.Considerable periods of time may be spent concentrating and or analyzing dataConsiderable periods of time may be spent communicating verbally and in various written forms including presentation material and email with other peopleAt times, stress may be experienced.Standing or sitting for long periods of time may be necessarySome lifting (greater than 25 pounds) may be necessary; Facilities, Materials and Engineering employees occasionally must lift at least 50-75 pounds.May be exposed to hazardous materials, tissue specimens and instruments with moving parts, lasers, heating and freezing elements, and high speed centrifugation (GENERALLY LABORATORY & CUSTOMER SERVICE EMPLOYEES ONLY) Company Profile:Genomic Health is a global provider of genomic-based diagnostic tests that address the overtreatment of cancer, one of the greatest issues in healthcare today. Our goal is to improve the lives of people with cancer by providing personalized, biological information that helps them get the right treatment at the right time, and to avoid unnecessary treatments and their side effects. In this way, our work is truly life, changing.Our Oncotype IQ Genomic Intelligence Platform is a portfolio of diagnostic tests that help physicians and patients answer specific and critical treatment questions throughout the cancer journeyWe currently offer Oncotype tests addressing breast, colon, prostate and lung cancers and hundreds of thousands of patients from over 90 countries have benefited from our tests.The Oncotype DX breast cancer test is considered standard of care in the US and is included in all major international clinical guidelines for breast cancer treatment.We are expanding our portfolio of tests to include additional liquid- and tissue-based tests through clinical research and internal product development as well as strategic partnerships.Join the Genomic Health Team, and have the unique opportunity to make a difference in the lives of patients with cancer, while developing your career potential. We embrace our unique culture characterized by our Core Values of Community, Truth Seeking, Being Ahead of the Curve and Winning to be the best in the world at what we do. We maintain competitive total rewards programs designed to satisfy our employees’ work life and personal life needs. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, gender identity, color, religion, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability.

Name: Staff Data Scientist - Business Analytics
Description: OverviewThe Staff Data Scientist – Business Analytics will be responsible for identifying opportunities to use customer driven analytics to drive growth and improved decision making in Intuit’s Small Business Division. This role requires an individual with advanced analytical skills, excellent communications skills, and a passion for creating actionable customer insights to influence business operations and strategy.ResponsibilitiesKey thought-partner with business stakeholders.Suggest appropriate analysis, ideas and data points to help drive business decisions – collaborate with business partners to prioritize areas of opportunity to drive growth and improved customer retention - Lead and execute analytics problems end-to-end.Skilled at probing for, evaluating and synthesizing data from disparate data sources to draw interpretive insights.Conduct detailed and advanced analyses of new and existing businesses covering a variety of areas including financial modeling, pricing, ROI analysis, revenue optimization, and product performance.Translate complex business requirements into a roadmap with key milestones and deliverables QualificationsBachelor’s degree in a quantitative field - Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering or related fields; Master’s preferred.7+ years of work experience involving quantitative data analysis.Superior analytical skills and creative problem solving skills are a necessity.Database experience with advanced SQL skills; experience researching and manipulating complex and large data sets; Hadoop experience a plus.Experience in analytical and modelling tools, such as Python, R or SASExperience with data visualization tools, such as TableauExperience with A/B test and experimental designMindsets:Willingness to dig-in and understand the data and to leverage creative thinking and problem-solving skills are absolute musts.Self-starter who takes the initiative to get things done.Outstanding team player with a customer-back mindset.

Name: Senior Analyst, Business Analytics
Description: NerdWallet is seeking a data-driven and analytical professional for our Business Analytics team, focused on providing data solutions and innovations to help grow our business. Successful candidates will partner with various business units to uncover data based insights at NerdWallet and will be challenged to understand and contribute to all aspects of NerdWallet's data. Ideal candidates will be passionate about finance and technology (FinTech) and NerdWallet.Where you can make an impact:Drive highly visible projects for NerdWallet. Future projects include optimizing our feed rankings, running tests to improve early user retention, and targeting users with personalized financial products.Collaborate cross-functionally with sister analytics teams at NerdWallet to leverage shared platforms, best practices, insights and innovations.Work alongside Product and Engineering counterparts to ensure proper tracking of instrumentation of new products or features.Own the data, analytics, and reporting to empower product teams and guide business decisions.You are:Highly productive: Work with limited oversight on a day to day basis. This role is intended for somebody who will take meaningful responsibility and initiative for our business metrics.Structured thinker: Understand the key drivers to our business and identify how to modify them to improve business metrics.Consumer-first and positive thinker: You're motivated to work hard in a fast-paced environment business decisions here can connect and impact millions of users.Expert multi-tasker and prioritizer: Experience (and preferably an enjoyment of) balancing numerous different priorities and demands.Your experience:BA/BS degree, preferably in a quantitative major like Math, Statistics or Economics2+ years of experience in a quantitative role, preferably at a consumer technology companyStrong communication skills and the ability to explain complex analyses to both technical and non-technical audiencesProficiency in SQL and handling big data (experience with Python or other scripting languages a plus)Experience with analytics and BI tools (Tableau, Qlikview, etc.) a plusWhat we offer:Competitive compensation package401(k) with company match100% paid premiums for medical, dental and vision for employee and their dependentsPaid maternity and paternity leaveCommuter, gym and cell phone stipend$500 enrichment stipend towards learning and development for your roleCatered lunches daily, free dinner, and kitchens stocked full of snacksOnsite coffee bar with baristasCompany happy hours, social events and outingsGenerous, flexible vacation NerdWallet is committed to pursuing and hiring a diverse workforce and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on the basis of any characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local law.

Name: Account Executive, West
Description: Account Executive Clarabridge has a storied history of consistent growth and expansion. As a Clarabridge Account Executive, you will need to serve as a farmer and a hunter who is enthusiastic about identifying target prospects, creating opportunities, and effectively communicating just how crucial our Customer Experience Management platform can be for an organization's brand and bottom line. Our most successful Account Executives have a forward-thinking approach to solving business issues, an obsession with customer satisfaction, and a background in selling SaaS within the VOC, CEM, or business analytics landscapes. Clarabridge works primarily with Fortune 1000 and Fortune 500 companies, so experience driving and closing large, complex deals with prominent brands is a huge plus. What you'll do:Cultivate and maintain a solid pipeline of well qualified opportunitiesTake charge of your sales cycles. We want your fingerprints on everything from initial prospecting and opportunity identification, all the way to sale closure and managing the post-sale relationshipBe a high-touch sales rep who builds strong client connections and gains insight into how the Clarabridge solution can create maximum value for our customersDevelop expertise and become a go-to resource for information on Clarabridge and on the Customer Experience Management industryLand and expand is a key strategy to our growth--you will be expected to develop and maintain key accounts and identify opportunities for the company to continue to deliver value and demonstrate the impact our product has to the client's customer success strategyKeep track of everythingnew leads, deal progress, marketing commitments, and success rates-- so you can report back to your manager on how awesome you are on a regular basisHave your suitcase handyyou'll be traveling within your assigned territory about 60% of the timeHelp Clarabridge continue its exponential growth by meeting and exceeding your sales goals. Reach new heights of personal and professional success in the processAbout you:You have a Bachelor's degreeYou've been navigating complex, enterprise-level SaaS sales cycles for 5 10 years and have been successful meeting seven-figure direct sales quotasYou've successfully and consistently met or beat your annual sales quotaExperience managing renewals and upselling to assigned key accountsYou're comfortable calling on and closing transactions with prominent business executives of all levelsYou embrace the chaos and love the challenge and excitement of selling an innovative product in a high-growth, fast paced environmentYou easily grasp clients' needs and are able to clearly articulate the business value and ROI of SaaS solutionsExceptional presentation, verbal and written communication skills

Name: Program Manager, Talent Acquisition
Description: The Program Manager, Talent Acquisition will play a vital role in leading execution excellence, continuous improvement and measurement of global and company-wide talent processes and programs. The program manager will work closely with all members of HR and the business and will be responsible for designing, implementing and management of key talent programs. Programs include, but are not limited to: Global Mobility, AAP/EEO, Diversity & Inclusion, Internship, Analytics and Immigration. The Program Manager will be the liaison to external process vendors, both existing and future. The Program Manager will work closely with the Head of Talent Acquisition, HR Leadership Team and HR Business Partners in the implementation and management of key Talent Acquisition programs. The Program Manager will effectively plan and project-manage the delivery of these processes and programs, while continuously improving execution and measuring success. This is a great opportunity for someone who has well developed analytical, project management and HR functional skills to join a team that values teamwork to achieve exceptional results. This hands-on partnership role requires a highly collaborative individual to serve as a trusted advisor and coach to the business in a high-paced environment.Responsibilities Build strategic and operational partnerships with the global Human Resources teamDesign and develop key talent processes, such as Global Mobility, Diversity & Inclusion & InternshipManage and continuously improve existing programs, such as AAP/EEO, Contingent Workforce Management, Internship, etc. Responsible for project managing, planning and executing programs from start to finish while leveraging appropriate change management processes and analytics to ensure programs are rolled out to the business in a timely, well-coordinated mannerCoordinate and project-manage the annual calendar of Talent Acquisition in partnership with the HR Leadership TeamIn partnership with the HR Business Partners and HR Operations, lead execution excellence of global Talent processes and programs deep into the organization. Manage all KPI reporting for Talent AcquisitionDevelop, interpret and present a point of view with respect to analytics/KPIsEnsure accurate and confidential recordkeepingEvaluate and mitigate talent risks by leveraging business analytics and processesEnsure the highest standards of ethics and integrity by providing coaching, support and escalating critical issues as appropriateTrain and coach the HR community and others on the deployment and effective execution, measurement and tracking of Talent programs across the organizationWork closely with the Head of Talent Acquisition to identify innovative ways to continue to grow and support the HR FunctionOther duties and projects as assignedQualificationsBachelor Degree in Business, Human Resources or related area. Masters preferred.5+ years professional Human Resources experience. PHR or SPHR certification preferred.3+ years Program/Project Management experience with implementing company-wide processes and programs.2+ years experience with Global Mobility preferred.Demonstrated experience creating and driving clear, effective processes to support outcome delivery.Demonstrated proficiency leveraging analytics in the context of coaching and partnering. Ability to interpret data and connect the dots to form meaningful recommendations.Proven experience working with confidential or sensitive information.Project and program management ability to plan, identify, coordinate and track critical activities, milestones and deliverables with strong organizational skills and attention to detail.Process improvement and systems thinking a track record of utilizing continuous improvement methodology as a business practice.HR technology High competency required in MS Office Products and knowledge. Past experience with Lever preferred.Strong analytical skills and expert excel experience.Influence and negotiation ability to present ideas effectively, represent the best interests of all stakeholders, guide discussions, shift thinking, enable stakeholders to express concerns and goals, propose best path forward and drive alignment at all levels of the organization, including at the senior levels.Innovative and proactive problem-solving skills with the ability to exercise integrity and sound judgment in complex and ambiguous situations. Multinational experience experience working across cultures and geographies in a fast-moving global organization.Superior customer service orientation Initiative to work independently and within a dynamic team environment.Candidate must have excellent verbal, written, listening and influence skills and be able to present facts clearly and concisely to all levels of the organization.Possess strong analytical, time-management and organizational skills.Candidate must have solid team skills and be able to work efficiently and effective with associates at all levels of the organization. Excellent written and verbal skillsEmbrace Amyris Core ValuesAdherence to Amyris Safety Policies and Procedures Amyris, a leader in industrial synthetic biology, uses its innovative bioscience solutions to achieve renewable products by converting plant sugars into hydrocarbon molecules. Amyris molecules are used in wide range of specialty & performance chemicals, flavors & fragrances and in applications ranging from cosmetics to biofuels. Learn more at www.amyris.com.As a VEVRAA Federal Contractor, Amyris is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Amyris complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment.If you are a recruiter or placement agency, please do not submit resumes to any person or email address at Amyris, Inc. prior to having a signed agreement. Amyris is not liable for and will not pay placement fees for candidates submitted by any agency other than its approved recruitment partners. Furthermore, any resumes sent to us without an agreement in place will be considered your companys gift to Amyris and may be forwarded to our recruiters for their attention.For a full list of our current openings, please visit our website at www.amyris.com.

Name: Director of Business Operations and Analytics
Description: ABOUT THE ROLEZenput was founded in 2012 with offices in San Francisco, CA (our HQ) and Atlanta, GA. Were changing the way restaurants and other retail chain operators like Dominos, Chipotle, KFC, Jersey Mikes, and 7-Eleven translate operations strategy into great customer experiences. Today we have customers who are collectively overseeing 40,000 locations across 35+ countries using our mobile platform to drive operations excellence across all their stores. Do you enjoy answering tough business questions fundamental to growing a tech company? Are you curious how efficient our sales and marketing funnel is? Do you wonder why certain customers take off with engagement and others do not? Do you want to have an important, strategic seat at the table instead of a supporting role? Yup, we are definitely looking for you!Our growing team is focused on delivering market-changing products while staying true to business fundamentals, not just the dream of revenue one day. This makes our director of business operations a critical hire - someone who can help improve our business every single day.Were looking for a special individual who has a demonstrated ability to quickly understand the core drivers of any business, plan, lead and implement changes that improve overall efficiency. This is more than a consultant - were looking for someone who takes personal and psychological ownership over projects to deliver outstanding results - never settling for good enough. You are part analyst, part strategist, part project manager, and part builder,.If youre a highly analytical self-starter with an entrepreneurial spirit, youll fit right in. Weve got an incredible opportunity in front of us, a leadership team cranking to execute, and we need a cross-departmental leader to help us get there. If youre down to put in the hours and want to make a difference, this is the place for you. A Successful Director of Business Operations and Analytics will:Act as the product manager for the business - your product is the companyPartner with department leads and executives to identify the highest value improvements to systems and processes -- and make sure they get doneQuickly generate hypotheses, execute tests, and provide data-driven recommendationsCommunicate clearly across teams on performances of initiatives and ongoing operationsDevelop relationships with stakeholders across departments so that they rely on you as a trusted resource for guidanceDeliver financial modeling that helps us understand where to invest our resources and where to slow downConsistently prioritize potential projects for effort vs. potential returns to optimize your time for the highest potential impactDesign and deliver simple and elegant solutions that will scale as our company growsNeed to have:4-8 years overall work experienceA balance of engineering and business experience; able to produce data-driven recommendations and resultsSpectacular critical thinking and problem solving skillsLight programming experience, SQL experience is a big PLUS2+ years of go-to-market experience working closely with sales and marketing teams or product teamsSuccessful transformations youve led within past companies and thoughtful analysis of what worked and whyA GSD attitude and the willingness to quickly turn around an MVP and several iterationsNice to have:Fearlessness with a willingness to try new ideas, concepts, and be wrong (but definitely learn from the experience)Experience in a top-tier consulting firm (an MBA doesnt hurt either)An unabashed desire to work with A players and an unwillingness to compromiseStartup experience ideally in a B2B SaaS environmentSound right up your alley? Want to learn more? So do we! But dont stop there, give us a few reasons to really get excited about you - share your thoughts on:- Whats the most impactful business recommendation youve delivered? How do you measure that?- Whats the most interesting job thats not on your resume? Why?- Whats the last book you read? Thoughts? Would you recommend it?Note: not answering these questions will exclude you from the review processABOUT USZenput is how top operators make great customer experiences happen. Restaurants and other retail chains such as Dominos, Chipotle, KFC, Jersey Mikes, 7Eleven, and Mapco use Zenputs operations execution platform to see inside and improve the operations of every location. By making it easy to roll-out, track and enforce compliance with operating procedures and key initiatives, Zenput helps operations leaders who are collectively overseeing 40,000 locations across 35+ countries collaborate more effectively with employees in the field and in their stores to improve performance and exceed customer expectations.Zenput provides equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law.

Name: Director, Product Marketing
Description: Our team is growing and adding an agile product marketing leader to join us in our mission to change legacy security paradigms. You will drive a team of skilled and creative product marketers to develop & improve our sales enablement tools & processes. You are an expert wordsmith in articulating solution value in a high volume direct & channel sales environment. You have a keen eye that enables a diverse audience of sales teams, analysts, customers, partners and other key internal and external consumers of product information. You are a powerful combination of player/coach who thrives in a dynamic, merit-based, and scale growth environment.What we are looking to add to our team:You will influence product direction and make an impact across the company as we embark on our next stage of growth. You will report to the VP of Product Marketing, based at AlienVault's HQ in San Mateo. Work with product management, sales and marketing teams to define and execute go to market strategies to scale pipeline growth, conversions, market leadership and awarenessLead a talented team of product and technical marketing managers and work with them to drive key initiatives (pricing and packaging, competitive analysis, sales & partner enablement, product launches, campaigns, analyst engagements, thought leadership)Excellent storyteller who translates sophisticated and complex technical features into clear, compelling, and memorable stories of end customer value by audience typeDrive content creation including solution data-sheets, demos, blogs, webcasts and impactful sales/partner enablement toolsAnticipate and address needs of various sales and partner channels and geographies (enablement activities, key assets/tools)Develop and deliver persuasive presentations including executive briefings, analyst briefings, industry events, webcasts, and trade shows.We want to know you better if:Experienced product leader who has successfully scaled growth in a product marketing function8+ years of product marketing/product management experience with a deep understanding of the security space and velocity sales channels. Security technologies: SIEM, threat detection, incident response, endpoint & data center security, public cloud, enterprise/SMB IT and demonstrate industry awarenessKeen interest in cybersecurity, the ability to identify and explain technology, product, and market differentiators in simple termsYou are a strong people, project and program management leaderExperienced business and analytical skills in conducting market analysis, to develop and execute GTM plansTrack record of enabling sales teams & channels to scaleExcellent written communications and strong presentation skillsComfortable working with C-level stakeholdersBS/BA in a technical or marketing discipline required, MBA preferredWillingness & ability to travel up to 30%, within the U.S. and internationally.About Us:We founded AlienVault to help organizations of all sizes achieve elite security without the headaches and huge expense of other solutions. And we are passionate about our mission!  We are a developer of commercial and open source solutions to handle cyber-attacks, including the Open Threat Exchange, the world's largest crowd-sourced computer-security platform. We grow through innovating and offer a host of award-winning solutions. In addition, you'll have a chance to collaborate with some of the brightest minds in the security industry.  As a member of The Alien Nation, you will be entering an exciting growth stage company with offices in Austin, San Mateo, Spain, Ireland, and Australia.The Perks:Be part of a dynamic growing company that offers a meaningful and fun work environmentCompetitive compensation that includes base salary & commissions, Spiffs, President’s Club for top performersHealthy Benefits & Vacation packageCentral commute located off of the 101 & a short bike ride from Caltrain + commuter benefitsAT&T discounts:50% off internet50% off wirelessFree Direct TVNumerous industry awards and is recognized as a visionary in the industryStrong year-over-year growth and a rapidly-growing customer base At AlienVault we celebrate and support the differences that make you, you. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and employer. We truly believe that diversity makes us better!

Name: Principal Data Scientist
Description: Formation provides personalization for the largest enterprise businesses in the world. We work with high volume data streams to deliver tailored experiences and orchestrate physical and digital exchanges into a seamless journey. Our Data Science team works closely with Product and Engineering to transform the way people engage across multiple industries. Our team is focused on applying reinforcement learning and statistical analysis to complex, real-world problems for Fortune 500 customers with massive data sets.As the Principal Data Scientist, you will work with our Leadership team and on cross-functional teams to help drive Machine Learning and Optimization strategy and execution across Formation's core product. Key Responsibilities:Provide technical leadership to Data Science teams and serve as subject matter expert in Machine Learning, Optimization, Reinforcement Learning, Recommender Systems, and Contextual BanditsOversee the design, testing, and productionization of Reinforced Learning-based experimentation Collaborate with colleagues in Product and Customer Success roles, sharing responsibilities that impact the entire product life-cycleLead, train and mentor Data ScientistsPresent methodology and results to Executives at Fortune 500 customersSkills and Experience: Master's or Ph.D. in a quantitative/analytical field such as Data Science, Machine Learning, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, Engineering or Physics Minimum of 8 to 10 years experience in industry, policy, or related disciplines of workExpertise in Machine Learning with a focus on Contextual Bandits, Reinforcement Learning, and Recommender SystemsExpertise in building and deploying Machine Learning and Optimization Models at scaleDemonstrated experience in using the above methods to solve complex business problems working with structured and unstructured data, and providing best-in-class data driven products and/or solutions for customers.Demonstrated experience in managing and leading large complex projects, including (but not limited to) formulating the business and analytical problem, extracting, cleansing, and manipulating large, and diverse data sets, building descriptive, predictive and prescriptive solutions and deploying these solutions in the cloud and/or on premise systemsDemonstrated experience in communicating complex analytical solutions, data relationships and results, and their business impacts to multiple business partners and stakeholders, through compelling data visualization and storytelling skillsProficiency in Python, TensorFlow, Spark, and cloud environments (e.g. AWS)Knowledge of Data Science concepts related to e-commerce (e.g. lifetime value, net incremental revenue, churn) is a plusABOUT FORMATIONFormation distills complex customer data into uniquely tailored experiences; we orchestrate physical and digital exchanges into one seamless journey. Our business is building lasting, trusted relationships between people and brandsand making it look easy.We're already reaching millions of people a day, and we're just getting started. Our founding leadership is equal parts business, design, and engineeringbecause we believe differing perspectives + passionate discourse achieve the greatest outcomes. We are collectively talented, but also humble. We give our whole selves. We love learning new things.Formation is committed to inclusion and diversity and is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, or veteran status.Also, we are thrilled to be named one of the Top 50 startups by LinkedIn! Every member of our team makes Formation a special place to work and grow. Come join us and see for yourself!

Name: Deal Desk Specialist
Description: Fastly helps the world's most popular digital businesses keep pace with their customer expectations by delivering fast, secure, and scalable online experiences. Businesses trust Fastly to accelerate the pace of technical innovation, mitigate evolving threats, and scale on demand. Founded in 2011, Fastly powers online destinations including Airbnb, GitHub, Alaska Airlines, Pinterest, Vimeo, The Guardian, The New York Times and Ticketmaster.  The worldwide cloud services market is projected to grow rapidly to $236 billion in 2020, according to Forrester, Inc. As more and more businesses move operations to the cloud, Fastly is well positioned to continue increasing CDN, cloud networking and cloud security market share with edge cloud services that reach beyond content delivery.  We're building a better Internet. Come join us. Deal Desk Specialist Fastly's Deal Desk Specialist is responsible for supporting the sales team, and ensuring that the business is executing on deals that make sense for both the customer and the company. What You'll DoAct as trusted advisor to quota bearing sales reps in deal shaping opportunitiesGuide sales teams in the deal flow process and ensure smooth handoffs to Contracts and BillingAnalyze deal structure, business terms, and pricing and impacts to optimize profitability, meet strategic corporate goals, and accelerate deal closureCollaborate with internal stakeholders (Sales, Finance, Product, and Legal) to ensure that all deals align with corporate strategies and guidelinesReview and update customer account information to ensure high degree of data accuracyWork closely with customers to address billing inquiries and transactions as neededProvide additional ad-hoc deal support to Deal Desk Managers as neededProvide business analytics as requiredWhat We're Looking For2+ years working as a sales coordinator or in an administrative support roleCustomer service experience in a high transaction environmentComfortable communicating with Executive level decision makersA self-starter, with excellent attention to detail and that takes initiative to resolve pressing business issuesAbility to manage multiple deals and tasks simultaneously and experience in collaborating with cross-functional teamsStrong analytical skills and experience with profitability analysis and pricing strategyExperience with Salesforce and financial modeling in ExcelBonus PointsSalesforce CPQ/Steelbrick experience a plusCDN background a plusWhy Fastly?Wehaveahugeimpact. Fastly is a small company with a big reach. Not only do our customers have a tremendous user base, but we also support a growing number of open source projects and initiatives. Outside of code, employees are encouraged to share causes close to their heart with others so we can help lend a supportive hand.We're a Global Company. Fastly's home base is in San Francisco, but we have multiple offices and employees sprinkled around the globe. In fact, 50% of our employees work outside of our SF headquarters! An international culture is part of our DNA.Wecareaboutyou. Fastly works hard to create a positive environment for our employees, and we think your life outside of work is important too. We support our teams with great benefits like up to 20 weeks of paid parental leave, options for free medical/dental/vision plans, and an open vacation program that enables our folks to take the time they need to recharge (some benefits may vary by location).Wevaluediversity. Growing and maintaining our inclusive and diverse team matters to us. We are committed to being a company where our employees feel comfortable bringing their authentic selves to work and have the ability to be successful -- every day.Wearepassionate. Fastly is chock full of passionate people and we're not 'one size fits all'. Fastly employs authors, pilots, skiers, parents (of humans and animals), makeup geeks, coffee connoisseurs, and more. We love employees for who they are and what they are passionate about. We're always looking for humble, sharp, and creative folks to join the Fastly team. If you think you might be a fit please apply! Fastly provides equal employment opportunity without regard to an applicant's race, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, national origin, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, religion, marital status or veteran status.Applicants with disabilities may be entitled to reasonable accommodation under the terms of the Americans with Disabilities Act and certain state or local laws. A reasonable accommodation is a change in the way things are normally done which will ensure an equal employment opportunity without imposing undue hardship on Fastly. Please inform us if you need assistance completing any forms or to otherwise participate in the application process.

Name: Senior Business Analytics Manager
Description: Primary Responsibilities  As a senior manager on the Analytics team, you will be an important thought partner for the Product organization and for the business at large.  You will drive significant business impact by delivering high quality insights and recommendations that are grounded in your ability to combine strategic thinking and problem solving with well-thought-through analysis. In this role, you will:  * Work directly with Product and Analytics leadership to conceive and structure analysis, and deliver highly actionable insights from “deep dives” into specific areas of our business  * Package and communicate findings and recommendations to a broad audience (including senior leadership)  * Manage the relationship with 3-5 business stakeholders (internal clients):  o Acting as their thought partner  o Helping them to identify major areas of opportunity  o Interpreting data and analyses  o Setting and managing expectations (priorities, timelines) around the delivery of analysis  * Directly manage 4-5 analysts  o Developing analysts into strategic thinkers; guiding them to think in terms of key business questions, decision frameworks and impact  o Providing day to day guidance to ensure timely delivery of accurate analysis  o Owning performance management and career development  o Recruiting new analysts as necessary  Education  Required  * Bachelor's degree, preferably in but not limited to Business, Economics, Finance, Engineering, Operations Research or Computer Science  Not required but nice to have  * MBA  Experience  Required  * 5+ years at a top-tier strategy consulting firm (e.g. McKinsey, Bain, BCG), investment bank or private equity firm, with at least 2+ years at the Associate, Consultant or Sr. Associate level  * 3+ year(s) of managing parts of the client engagement, including: leading conversations to understand business context, building relationships with the client, identifying key business issues, structuring analysis, and managing the development and delivery of recommendations  * 3+ year(s) of people management experience  * Experience participating in the firm's recruiting activities  Skill Set  Required  * Ability to structure analysis to solve complex business problems  * Ability to package findings/recommendations from analysis in a coherent, impactful way  * Strong presentation and communications skills  * Proficiency in analysis and business modeling using Excel  * Basic understanding of statistics and A/B testing  Not required but nice to have  * Experience working on engagements focused on online businesses  * Experience working on engagements focused on subscription businesses  * Basic to mid-level proficiency in data extraction using SQL  * Web analytics tools like Google Analytics, Omniture  * Predictive modeling, regression analysis using R or Python

Name: Director, Process Analytical Chemistry
Description: We seek an enthusiastic, team oriented, and adaptable manager to lead the Process Analytical Chemistry group. This group is responsible for supporting recovery and purification process development by providing fit-for-purpose analytical methods to support process selection, optimization, and troubleshooting. The ideal candidate will have expertise and experience managing high performing teams that provide analytical support to process development functions; a broad technical background in analytical methods, including a variety of instrumentation and complex sample types; and a strong command of statistics for analytical method evaluation.ResponsibilitiesManage team of analytical chemists to ensure fit for purpose analytical assays are deployed to support product recovery and purification.Assign team members and allocate instrument resources to execute agreed upon deliverables for projects, balancing multiple program priorities and reprioritizing as necessary.Identify and utilize external laboratories for analytical services as appropriate to optimize business costs and time.Identify areas where additional capital infrastructure is required and build business case for input to department budget.Hire and train additional personnel where necessary to meet business objectives.Manage analytical laboratory space and instruments used by team members and other stakeholders. Oversee implementation of additional instruments and processes to improve the efficiency of operations. Proactively identify and communicate resourcing shortfalls to department and project leads. Evaluate tradeoffs and propose possible solutions.Formulate strategic roadmap for Process Analytical Chemistry function. Proactively identify new ways of working and new technologies to increase efficiency, throughput, data quality, and to generate new relevant data types.Mentor and train employees to enable engagement, retention, and high performance.Represent the team capabilities and impact within R&D, to stakeholders in Quality, Process Development/Manufacturing, and Commercial organizations at Amyris, and, where required, to Amyris business partners. Build and maintain relationships with these stakeholders to ensure business goals are met.Review and approve Standard Operating Procedures, Method Development Reports, and other written documentation of analytical studies.Maintain safe work environment.QualificationsPh.D. degree or 15+ years experience in analytical chemistry or related discipline. Previous experience in providing analytical support to process development teams in an industrial setting. Team management abilities including delegation; performance evaluation, feedback, coaching, rewarding; conflict resolution.Ability to translate business and project milestones into analytical resourcing requirements (people, instruments and assays).Ability to establish and maintain key stakeholder relationships.Technical background in quantitative assay development and evaluation. Familiarity with a broad range of analytical platforms (e.g. chromatography, mass spectrometry, titration, spectroscopy). Familiarity with treatment of complex, inhomogeneous sample types.Ability to recommend and evaluate statistical approaches used to draw conclusions from large data sets in the context of analytical method validation and comparability. Ability to use Minitab, JMP or similar statistical tools.Adaptable, highly self-motivated and able to work creatively, efficiently and productively to support rapid research efforts in the fine chemical industries.Excellent written and verbal skillsEmbrace Amyris Core ValuesAdherence to Amyris Safety Policies and Procedures Amyris, a leader in industrial synthetic biology, uses its innovative bioscience solutions to achieve renewable products by converting plant sugars into hydrocarbon molecules. Amyris molecules are used in wide range of specialty & performance chemicals, flavors & fragrances and in applications ranging from cosmetics to biofuels. Learn more at www.amyris.com.As a VEVRAA Federal Contractor, Amyris is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Amyris complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment.If you are a recruiter or placement agency, please do not submit resumes to any person or email address at Amyris, Inc. prior to having a signed agreement. Amyris is not liable for and will not pay placement fees for candidates submitted by any agency other than its approved recruitment partners. Furthermore, any resumes sent to us without an agreement in place will be considered your companys gift to Amyris and may be forwarded to our recruiters for their attention.For a full list of our current openings, please visit our website at www.amyris.com.

Name: Senior Data Scientist, Business Analytics
Description: OverviewThe Senior Data Analyst for Quickbooks Self-Employed will join a team leading development of products to serve the needs of self-employed workers (the largest and fastest-growing segment of the US workforce).  Data is central to Intuit’s decision-making process, and analysts are a critical component to evangelize data-driven decision making in our Quickbooks organization.  This role will be primarily responsible for shaping the way we measure and improve product design and scaling analytics methods and tools to support our customer experiences. You will lead the way for high quality, high velocity decisions and play a critical role in both self-help experiences and live support assistance, so that customers are always well prepared to manage their business.ResponsibilitiesDemonstrate knowledge of business goals and constraints.
