Name: Business Process Owner - Labor Reporting, Analytics & Real E
Description: Forget what you know about old-school industry rules. When you work at Old Navy, youre choosing a different path. From day one, weve been on a mission to democratize fashion and make shopping fun again. Our teams make style accessible to everyone, creating high-quality, must-have fashion essentials for the whole family, with love, season after season. We opened our first store in 1994 in San Francisco and have been on a roll ever since. Today, customers can find fabulous fashion at affordable prices online and in one of our 1,000+ stores globally. Old Navy celebrates a workplace thats just as diverse as our customers. Fun, fashion, family and value are at the heart of everything we do. We cultivate a community of playful personalities that thrive in a fast-paced environment where our employees can be their most authentic selves. Here, were family. Old Navy a brand for everyone a place for you!OVERVIEW The Business Process Owner Labor Reporting, Analytics & Real Estate is responsible for managing all reporting and analytical aspects of Old Navys Labor Allocation Model. This position is responsible for updating the labor model for all Real Estate Activity and management of pre-opening payroll budgets. This position is expected to accurately report labor hours and payroll while meticulously validating and troubleshooting all systems related issues. Above process management, it is expected that this position identifies opportunities for continuous improvement to systems and business partner relationships. This position is required to work closely with the Field Finance Team to ensure that the labor allocation meets the organizations fiduciary requirements. ORGANIZATIONAL LEADERSHIPAs the Business Process Owner Labor Reporting and Analytics, you are part of the Store Operations team.You collaborate with business partners in stores and Upper Field, Visual and Field Merchandising, Inventory Management, Marketing, Pricing, Finance, Customer Data & Analytics, and Human Resources to Identify both short-term and long-term improvements within labor management.You support multiple simultaneous aspects of a project and work streams with quantitative and / or qualitative analysis.You identify and use multiple ways to achieve goals in case of obstacles; identify opportunities in process to contribute to commercial success of our stores.You lead and inspire the Store Operations team to be: product obsessed, customer-focused, innovative, fast-moving and team-oriented.KEY RESPONSIBILITIESReport forecasted and actualized labor usage to HQ and Field TeamAnalyze labor usage across subsets of stores to identify underlying trends and propose improvements to labor allocation and usageEnsure weekly labor hours are generated and communicated accurately for all Real Estate ActivityCoordinate, communicate, and track necessary hour adjustmentsRespond to field questions regarding payroll reportingSupport the maintenance of and updates to the centralized scheduling systemCreate and maintain reporting to support the Store Operations teamOvercomes obstacles with creative problem solving and collaboration at all levels of leadershipKEY EXPERIENCESStrong business acumen skills, including financial and statistical analysisStrong Microsoft Excel and Access SkillsKnowledge and experience with Essbase databases preferredExcellent verbal and written communication and presentation skillsProven ability to build peer relationships and influence othersExcellent problem solving and organizational skillsBA/BS or equivalent experienceAbility to travel, including overnight as requiredAbility to work a flexible schedule to meet the needs of the business, including night and weekendsKEY BENEFITS:Merchandise discount for our brands: 50% off regular-priced merchandise at Employer, Banana Republic and Old Navy, 30% off at Outlet and 25% off at Athleta.One of the most competitive Paid Time Off plans in the industry.*Employees can take up to five on the clock hours each month to volunteer at a charity of their choice.*Extensive 401(k) plan with company matching for contributions up to four percent of an employees base pay.*Employee stock purchase plan.*Employees receive medical, dental, vision and life insurance.*Employees can apply for tuition reimbursement.*Family care programs.Commuter benefits.Pet Discount Program. *For eligible employeesEmployer Inc. is an equal-opportunity employer and is committed to providing a workplace free from harassment and discrimination. We are committed to recruiting, hiring, training and promoting qualified people of all backgrounds, and make all employment decisions without regard to any protected status. In 2016, Employer Inc. was named one of the Best Places to Work by the Human Rights Campaign for the thirteenth consecutive year and was the sole winner of the Catalyst award for equality in the workplace in 2016.

Name: Software Engineer, Data
Description: We're looking for a talented engineer to help us build the communication fabric that enables data to flow effortlessly between Gusto systems and 3rd party services.Data PlatformThe goal of Gusto's data platform is to make all Gusto data accessible and queryable for applications spanning business intelligence, product analytics, predictive modeling, and data-driven product features. Build pipelines to ingest and transform data from all application data stores, logs, product analytics, and 3rd party services into our S3/Athena (Presto) data lake.Work closely with the Business Intelligence team to build our Enterprise Data Warehouse and support data-driven decision making.Support the Data Science team in training, productionizing, and deploying machine learning models.Service PlatformThe service platform is a new initiative at Gusto laying the groundwork for the modularization of our systems. This is a unique opportunity to help design the next generation of Gusto's software architecture and integration standards, enabling the entire engineering team to develop software faster, more reliably and in a more maintainable way for the long term. Identify tools and patterns to solve common engineering challenges like schema/interface definition, messaging, and remote procedure call.Create well-defined service interfaces for existing product functionality and extract core services into loosely coupled modules.Embed with other engineering teams to understand their pain points, advise on API design, and assist with large service extraction projects (bring your war wounds from past work on monolith refactoring).What we're looking for:At least 6 years of software engineering experience.Experience working on projects with engineers as users (ex: libraries, services, or platforms).Strong written and verbal communication skills. Enjoys writing documentation and mentoring other engineers.Passionate about emerging technologies, but diligent about not always jumping on the latest, shiny new thing.Bonus points:Experience with stream or message based integration (ex: Kafka, ActiveMQ, RabbitMQ) and data pipelines (ETL).Familiarity with schema/interface definition tools (ex: Protobuf, Thrift, JSON Schema).Experience with SOA (service oriented architecture) or EAI (enterprise application integration) patterns.Experience with batch and streaming data transformation tools (ex: Hadoop/Spark).Solid understanding of cloud architecture patterns, Docker, and AWS (or comparable cloud platform).Learn more about Gusto Engineering with a few highlights from our blog:How We Built a Service-Driven TeamOur Diversity Goals and EffortsOur Principles and ValuesAbout GustoOur customers come from all walks of life and so do we. We hire people from a wide variety of backgrounds, not just because it's the right thing to do, but because it makes our company stronger. If you share our values and our enthusiasm for small businesses, you will find a home at Gusto.  Gusto's mission is to create a world where work empowers a better life. By making complicated, impersonal business tasks simple and personal, Gusto is reimagining HR, payroll, and benefits for over 60,000 companies nationwide. Gusto has offices in San Francisco and Denver and the company's investors include Google Capital, General Catalyst, Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers, as well as the founders of Instagram, Stripe, Nest, PayPal, Yelp, Dropbox, and Eventbrite, among others.

Name: General Manager (Wealth)
Description: NerdWallet's mission is to provide clarity for all of life's financial decisions. The General Manager for Wealth (Banking and Investing) is responsible for leading two of NerdWallet's core and high-growth businesses. You will have a unique ability to lead a large segment of business for a fast growing and innovative startup. The successful candidate is competitive, resourceful, creative, and analytical. The role will work across all major functions at NerdWallet, including Content, Marketing, PR, Sales, Engineering, Design, Business Operations, and Analytics, in order to grow our new business lines. The position is based in San Francisco and will report to the Vice President, Product & General Management, Credit & Wealth.Where you can make an impact:Be accountable for growing and delivering the P&Ls for our Banking (deposits) and Investing (brokerage) businessesLead strategy, planning and execution with cross-functional teams aligned to and supporting the businessManage business development to deliver on revenue growth through pricing or budget growthPartner with product teams to deliver on the consumer experienceIncrease customer acquisition through marketing and content generationYou are:Creative: continuing to drive growth requires new strategies and approaches; we need someone who can leverage past success for future growthDriven and Goal-Oriented: simply put, you like to win or accomplish your goals.Solid Business/Strategic Intuition: You are able to identify the right opportunities, build a business case, make tough prioritization calls and devise a clear execution plan.Strategic and Analytical: ability to analyze, learn, and understand situations quickly and holistically and focus on the activities that matter the most.Fast to learn and improve: as we're competing in a dynamic market, we work in a hypothesis driven manner with rapid iteration to figure out what works in a particular market.A strong communicator and influencer: you enjoy working across a diverse team of colleagues and have the ability to get others excited about your initiatives.Your experience:Undergraduate degree from top tier university; MBA preferred6+ years of experience in strategic and operating roles with proven results from taking strategy through successful executionSuccess in driving business outcomes, demonstrated by customer-driven and financial metricsExperience driving business outcomes and results from strategic management of partners or clientsDeep data and analytic orientationIndustry background in the banking (deposits) or investing (brokerages)Proven track record of leading cross-functional teams and influencing across the company in a matrixed environmentStrong people management and people development skillsExcellent verbal and written communication skills requiredFamiliarity with working in an internet product company a plusWhat we offer:Competitive compensation package401(k) with company match100% paid premiums for medical, dental and vision for employee and their dependentsPaid maternity and paternity leaveCommuter, gym and cell phone stipend$500 enrichment stipend towards learning and development for your roleCatered lunches daily, free dinner, and kitchens stocked full of snacksOnsite coffee bar with baristasCompany happy hours, social events and outingsGenerous, flexible vacation NerdWallet is committed to pursuing and hiring a diverse workforce and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on the basis of any characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local law.

Name: Business Intelligence Lead
Description: ApplyDescriptionAbout PLAYSTUDIOS PLAYSTUDIOS is a developer of engaging casual games for the world’s largest social and mobile platforms. Founded by a team of experienced gaming and technology entrepreneurs, our free-to-play applications combine the best elements of popular social games with established gambling mechanics. Players enjoy an ever-growing collection of slot and table games and the opportunity to earn an unprecedented selection of valuable real-world Rewards. We have content studios in the San Francisco Bay Area, Austin, Tel Aviv and Hong Kong and have partnered with some of the world’s largest entertainment companies, including King, Konami, and MGM.  We’re looking for an experienced Business Intelligence Lead to join our team. At PLAYSTUDIOS we encourage a culture in which we’re always learning about our products, our customers & our industry. The BI Lead will work closely with the Product, UA, Marketing & Management teams to develop data-centric insights into our business challenges. This position reports to the Director of Business Intelligence and is a highly visible opportunity. This is an exciting opportunity to join a world-class team and bring our exciting games to even more fans worldwide. RequirementsResponsibilities:Lead ad-hoc analysis and insights for PLAYSTUDIOS’s franchise product.Partner with business functional heads to design both operational and ad hoc reporting.Work with SQL, Excel, Python, Tableau, etc. on a daily basis to access and manipulate: Get it, munge it, analyze it, report on it.Create ongoing insights related to business analytics, product performance, new feature releases, monetization optimization, and player behavior.Regularly present data insights to the management team.Mentor BI analysts on the team.Requirements:5+ years of business intelligence / analytics experience.Advanced SQL competency.Familiarity with at least one scripting language (Python, PHP, Ruby, Perl, etc…) required.Solid background in medium-level probability and statistics.Exceptional analytical ability.Good practical grasp of business rules and needs.Excellent communication/presentation skills – comfortable in presenting to senior level executives.Exceptional competency in retrieving data, conceptualizing it, and articulating a story with insights and recommendations.Preferred:Familiarity with any statistical package (R, Stata, SAS, SPSS, Python libs etc…) a strong plus.Strong familiarity with Python/Jupyter/Anaconda stack strongly recommended.Benefits and Perks:100% health benefit coverage for you and your dependents!401K plan and stock options.Flexible vacation policy.Great downtown Burlingame location with extensive nearby dining options.Employee-driven entertainment, happy hours, and team-building events.Catered lunches multiple times per week.Snacks and drinks available in the kitchen.Casual startup-like environment.An open, collaborative work space.Commuter benefits program.

Name: Business Development Manager, Analytics and Machine Learning
Description: Welcome to Planet. We believe in using space to help life on Earth. Planet designs, builds, and operates the largest constellation of imaging satellites in history. This constellation delivers an unprecedented dataset of empirical information via a revolutionary cloud-based platform to decision-makers in commercial, environmental, and humanitarian sectors. We are both a space company and data company all rolled into one.  Customers and users across the globe use Planet's data and machine learning-powered analytics to develop new technologies, drive revenue, power research, and solve our world's toughest challenges.  As we control every component of hardware design, manufacturing, data processing, and software engineering, our office is a truly inspiring mix of experts from a variety of domains.  We have a people-centric approach toward culture and community and we are iterating in a way that puts our team members first and prepares our company for growth.  Join Planet and be a part of our mission to change the way people see the world. The Role: The Business Development Manager is responsible for identifying commercial revenue opportunities and managing the strategic partnerships to support the sales roadmap with geospatial analytics customers. This job has elements of strategy, sales, project management and execution. Responsibilities include:Identifying and evaluating potential business opportunities and strategic partnerships within the Geospatial ecosystem to build Planet market share in thisverticalRefining a strategic approach to expanding Planet's solutions into key market segmentsDeveloping and presenting executive updates benchmarking progress against target metrics to the Sales Leadership to assist in decision making (i.e. analysis of market size, revenue and funding, strategic planning) and strategic planningSupporting contract negotiation with external partners and customersWorking with Planet cross-functional teams to gather information on technical feasibility of new projects, establish consensus on stakeholders, and successfully negotiate and close new accountsProject Management of pilots, opportunities, and partnershipsThe Must Haves:At least 3-5 years of relevant Business Development experience in Analytics and Machine Learning industriesBachelor's Degree is required. MBA is highly preferred.Experience in the Geospatial Imagery Ecosystem, Analytics and Machine Learning industries including working relationships with key stakeholdersExcellent project, time, and budget management skills, and being able to handle multiple tasks simultaneously without sacrificing attention to detailA mixture of high energy, flexibility and team orientation with a direct, honest, and respectful approach to problem solving, and an ability to work both collaboratively and independently in a high-growth, start-up cultureOutstanding executive communication (speaking and writing), interpersonal, and organizational skillsSome press about us: Our CEO, Will Marshall's TED Talk  "Tiny Satellites ushering in the New Space Revolution" Bloomberg Businessweek  "The All-Seeing Eye in the Sky video" Bloomberg Businessweek video  "Planet And Rocket Lab Create Mission Patch To Honor Women In Aerospace" Planet Blog Join Us: Planet is headquartered in San Francisco, California, Earth. If you are feeling inspired, check out our website www.planet.com/careers and apply. Be sure to include a cover letter to let us know why you think you'd be a good fit and feel free to mention anyone you have previously worked with at Planet. We are committed to building a diverse team and encourage applications from people of all backgrounds.

Name: Senior Accountant
Description: With thousands of beautiful spaces built for travel and life, Sonder is transforming the future of hospitality. Each Sonder is purposefully selected, designed and maintained - customized to reflect the vibe of its neighborhood. Whether your stay is two days, two months or two years, in a studio or a six-bedroom, Sonder ensures a unique, yet consistent experience. And with 24/7 on-demand service, crisp linens, and over 200 other quality standards, were taking stay further for guests all around the world.Sonder started a little over four years ago, and now has thousands of spaces in cities across the globe. AT SONDER YOU WILL:Perform financial statement analysis and document meaningful explanations for fluctuations to help management with business decisions. Perform monthly accounting close activities, including preparing journal entries, account reconciliations, and reporting.Develop and implement process improvements, document desktop procedures and processes to achieve efficiencies. Proactively pursue business issues that impact the general ledger and identifying opportunities for efficiency and implementing time/resource saving solutions.Support external audit requirements related to specific areas of responsibilitySupport management in completing special projects, ad-hoc reporting and analysis requests, and other tasks as assigned.Assist in preparation of monthly and quarterly financial statementsWHAT WE LOOK FOR:Bachelors degree in Accounting4+ years professional experience, with at least 2 years of relevant month-end close experiencePublic accounting experience combined with industry experience preferred.Strong interpersonal and communication skillsPrevious experience working in a large ERP (SAP, Oracle, NetSuite) environmentExcellent time management skills, ability to prioritize and multitaskStrong business acumen, analytical skills, detailed-orientedCPA preferredWe also have great benefits to make your life easier so you can focus on what you're best at:• Competitive salary• Generous stock option plan• Medical, dental and vision insurance• Unlimited vacation• Annual free credits and discounts to stay in Sonders• A company with a huge vision, a dynamic work environment, and a team of smart, ambitious and fun to work-with colleagues!Depending on your location:• Daily catered lunches• All the coffee you can imagine• Snack-filled kitchenWe are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Name: Wealth Management Analytic Consultant 2
Description: Job DescriptionAt Wells Fargo, we want to satisfy our customers financial needs and help them succeed financially. Were looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. Join our diverse and inclusive team where youll feel valued and inspired to contribute your unique skills and experience.  Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you. Wealth and Investment Management (WIM) businesses build enduring client relationships through sound, thoughtful and objective advice. We help our clients by developing individualized plans for everything from retirement goals to business succession planning, to family legacy intentions. Services include comprehensive planning and advice, investment management, brokerage, private banking, estate planning strategies, trust, insurance and both individual and institutional retirement. Wealth Management (WM): Wealth Management business is a leading provider of financial services to high-net worth clients through Wells Fargo Private Bank, and to the affluent segment through partnerships between Wealth Brokerage Services and the Consumer Bank. In Wealth Management, clients are provided with a complete range of solutions to help them manage, preserve and transfer their wealth.  This position will provide data and analytical support on management reports and research projects, working with different departments and partner groups in Investments. These projects may be small/simple or a part of larger/complex WIM-wide initiatives. This position will play a critical role in managing the business and solving problems, such as understanding what factors drive growth and impact customer behavior.  Working with senior consultants or directly with partners, responsible for identifying and defining business requirements and translating business needs into moderately complex analyses and recommendations. Performs analysis of findings and trends using statistical and/or financial analysis, modeling, process documentation, profitability analysis, customer/demographic analysis, etc; recommends solutions to increase revenue, reduce expense, maximize operational efficiency, quality, compliance, etc. Identifies business requirements and analytical needs; identifies and recommends potential data sources; compiles and mines data from multiple, cross business sources. Develops specific, customized reports, ad hoc analyses and/or data visualizations to make recommendations for alternatives. Ensures adherence to data management/data governance regulations and policies. May provide guidance to less experienced specialists. May partner with technology and/or with other business groups.Required Qualifications4+ years of reporting experience, analytics experience, or a combination of both; or a BS/BA degree or higher in a quantitative field such as applied math, statistics, engineering, physics, accounting, finance, economics, econometrics, computer sciences, or business/social and behavioral sciences with a quantitative emphasis and 2+ years of reporting experience, analytics experience, or a combination of bothDesired QualificationsA Masters of Business Administration (MBA), Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA), or comparable professional designationMicrosoft Visio experienceAbility to make timely and independent judgment decisions while working in a fast-paced and results-driven environmentAbility to translate and present complex technical data across technical and non-technical groupsAbility to translate and summarize complex data into understandable, actionable information and recommendationsAdvanced Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook and PowerPoint) skillsKnowledge and understanding of AsterKnowledge and understanding of financial concepts and methodologiesKnowledge and understanding of OBIEE (Oracle Business Intelligence Enterprise Edition)Knowledge and understanding of TableauStrong organizational, multi-tasking, and prioritizing skillsExcellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skillsStrong analytical skills with high attention to detail and accuracyOther Desired QualificationsKnowledge of CrontabKnowledge of R Shiny 2+ years of SQL experience2+ years of quantitative development experience2+ years SAS experience2+ years R Studio experienceDisclaimerAll offers for employment with Wells Fargo are contingent upon the candidate having successfully completed a criminal background check. Wells Fargo will consider qualified candidates with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable local, state and Federal law, including Section 19 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act.  Relevant military experience is considered for veterans and transitioning service men and women.  Wells Fargo is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer, Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation.

Name: Distribution Data and Technology Strategist
Description: Job DescriptionAt Wells Fargo, we have one goal: to satisfy our customers financial needs and help them achieve their dreams. Were looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. Join our diverse and inclusive team where youll feel valued and inspired to contribute your unique skills and experience.  Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.  Wealth and Investment Management (WIM) businesses build enduring client relationships through sound, thoughtful and objective advice. We help our clients by developing individualized plans for everything from retirement goals to business succession planning, to family legacy intentions. Services include comprehensive planning and advice, investment management, brokerage, private banking, estate planning strategies, trust, insurance and both individual and institutional retirement.  Wells Fargo Asset Management, a division of Wells Fargo Wealth and Investment Management, strives to help clients achieve their financial goals through top-tier investment options managed by specialized investment teams that are supported by independent risk management and backed by superior, collaborative service. With more than $504 billion in assets under management as of January 12, 2018, Wells Fargo Asset Management has 29 autonomous investment teams with specialized expertise and proven processes, more than 500 investment professionals, and a global reach with offices and clients around the world.  We provide clients with a broad array of investment options across all major asset classes, including actively managed equity, fixed-income, liquidity, stable value, and alternative investments. Investment strategies are accessible through a variety of product structures, including institutional separate accounts, retail separately managed accounts, mutual funds (open-end, closed-end, variable trust), private funds (hedge funds, commingled investment vehicles, medium term note programs), and Luxembourg-domiciled funds (UCITS).  In addition to these various investment options, WFAM also is focused on delivering holistic investment solutions, thought leadership, and innovation for clients with the goal of building long-term, dynamic relationships. Key to being able to execute on those objectives is the Distribution Enablement team. This team is comprised of individuals with a variety of skills who can collaboratively support a multitude of needs across all of the distribution teams within WFAM. From building out sustainable processes, solving an immediate problem, creating efficiency gains or addressing a core client need, coordination and harnessing the WFAM team is at the center of all of their engagements.  The Distribution Data and Technology Strategist is a critical and significant role within the team. This role will be responsible for building a data-driven distribution intelligence operating model to prioritize resources across client relationships. This role will work with, and across the distribution teams at WFAM, to allow us to identify, and implement, innovative technology solutions to create a more efficient distribution strategy. This role partners closely with, and engages senior leaders across WFAM, to analyze and support initiatives that can lead to greater efficiency in our distribution model.  Key responsibilities of this position include: Participate and drive strategic direction of distribution data and technology enablementBuild a data-driven distribution intelligence operating modelLead implementation of innovative technology solutions across distribution teamsCollaborate with key business and technology partners to deliver analytics that grow ROI, increase sales team productivity, and improve efficiencyOversee distribution related market data relationships, including sourcing, fiscal management, and contract administrationMaintain architecture and continuous improvement of sales data ecosystem, CRM tools and governance modelSupporting a diverse set of enterprise-wide strategic initiativesRequired Qualifications10+ years of experience in one or a combination of the following: project management, implementation, or strategic planning5+ years of management experienceDesired QualificationsExperience successfully collaborating with others in a change driven environmentProject management experienceAbility to execute in a fast paced, high demand, environment while balancing multiple prioritiesAbility to take initiative and work independently with minimal supervision in a structured environmentAbility to work in a fast paced deadline driven environmentExcellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skillsSolid creative and strategic thinking skillsStrong organizational, multi-tasking, and prioritizing skillsStrong presentation skillsExperience consulting, influencing and partnering with business executives, leadership, human resources partners and peersExperience with Agile Scrum (Daily Standup, Sprint Planning and Sprint Retrospective meetings) and KanbanOther Desired Qualifications5+ years of investment management and Fintech experienceExperience in sourcing and implementing technology solutionsAsset management data analytics experienceA background and passion for innovationExperience driving for results, applying a sense of urgency, and bringing issues to closure in a decisive manner despite obstacles and oppositionKeen analytical skills including: synthesizing, organizing and evaluating data in support of core business analytics/special requestsAbility to lead, and work effectively in a team environmentAbility to partner and build relationships across all organizational levels, where flexibility, collaboration, and adaptability are vitally importantExperience with database software and applications such as Salesforce, BrightScope, SatuitDisclaimerAll offers for employment with Wells Fargo are contingent upon the candidate having successfully completed a criminal background check. Wells Fargo will consider qualified candidates with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable local, state and Federal law, including Section 19 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act.  Relevant military experience is considered for veterans and transitioning service men and women.  Wells Fargo is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer, Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation.

Name: Senior Business Analyst, Strategy & Analytics
Description: Affirm is working tirelessly to create a simpler and more innovative lending product, one that puts consumers financial future first while enabling them to live their lives without worry!Were looking for intelligent, independent, and driven professionals to join our new Marketing Strategy & Analytics team here at Affirm. The MS&A team plays a pivotal role in defining Affirms interactions with our consumers through dual analytical and business oriented insights. This role will work cross-functionally in driving initiatives across all of Affirms consumer-facing business units, helping engage our customers with Affirms fundamental mission of putting their interests first.What You'll DoBuild strong interpersonal and cross-functional relationships across Affirm with an eye on driving forward marketing strategy and execution excellenceDevelop and drive marketing plans and strategies based on exploratory analytics and consumer insights that allow Affirm to differentiate from its competitorsServe as a critical component of consumer-facing projects that will help drive Affirm into the futureDesign and implement tests (A/B and multivariate) to build and optimize drivers of the Affirm businessPlay a role as an internal marketing consultant for the marketing, product, and client success teamsHelp and take ownership in the definition and reporting of critical tracking metrics and weekly/monthly/quarterly reporting as well as forecasting for all things marketingMaintain a strong understanding and even help shape our evolving marketing data warehouseBecome an expert in the retail POS financing and e-commerce spaceWhat We Look ForPassion and drive to disrupt both the retail and lending industry for the better3+ year of experience in a client-facing analytically-driven role (consulting, finance, analytics, etc.)1+ year of experience with e-commerce marketing in a consumer-facing role a plusStrong working knowledge of analytical tools, such as SQL, Python, R, and ExcelStrong interpersonal skills and ability to work in a team environment and cross-functionallyAbility and passion for finding analytical insights and communicating them as actionable business/marketing insightsAbility to think creatively and critically and thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic, and often ambiguous work environmentEnough laziness to find a faster way to do your least favorite tasksHumility and team player - you go out of your way to help teammatesAbout AffirmAffirm is reinventing credit to make it more honest and friendly. Started by PayPal co-founder Max Levchin, Affirm gives consumers the flexibility to buy now and make simple monthly payments. Unlike other credit options, Affirm offers transparent payment terms (no fees or compounding interest), and employs advanced technology to reach a broader consumer population.#LI-JA1

Name: Head of Decision Science and Analytics
Description: Hi there!  We're looking for an exceptional leader with deep expertise in decision science, business analytics and marketing analytics. You will build and lead our decision science and analytics teams, provide thought leadership to the company around how we handle data, build analysis of that data and strategically apply learnings toward improving our product, marketing, and overall business. We are looking for someone with a proven history of building and leading successful teams, process and culture that drive a strong understanding of our data, how we use data and how we empower others to use data across the company. Additionally, you will work closely with department leads, product managers and the executive team to understand their roadmaps and proactively align analytics' roadmap to support them. While you will report to the Chief Marketing Officer, you will work together to set a vision for Decision Science, develop a world class team, and create cross-functional partnerships across the executive team at Zapier.  We know applying for and taking on a new job at any company requires a leap of faith. We want you to feel comfortable and excited to apply at Zapier. To help share a bit more about life at Zapier, here are a few resources in addition to the job description that can give you an inside look at what life is like at Zapier. We hope you'll take the leap of faith and apply. Our Commitment to ApplicantsCulture and Values at ZapierZapier Guide to Remote WorkZapier Code of ConductDiversity and Inclusivity at Zapier Zapier is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace dedicated to pursuing and hiring a diverse workforce. Even though our job description may seem like we're looking for a specific candidate, the role inevitably ends up tailored to the person who applies and joins. Regardless of how well you feel you fit our description, we encourage you to apply if you meet these criteria: About You10+ years relevant experience, proven track record in leading and growing decision science and analytics teamsPassion for managing people, developing talent and building a resilient team culture.Experience driving strategic work and operationalizing the output across an organizationOutstanding oral and written communication skills, ability to present work at an executive levelExceptional analytical skills, ability to partner with functional teams to develop and apply key insightsExpert level experience in both using and mentoring others on the use of business intelligence platforms (Looker preferred), Redshift, SQL, Google 360 Suite and similar tools.Experience with ETL and dimensional modeling preferably with star schemaPositive, company first attitude, strong collaborator with proven ability to partner/lead cross functional effortsThings You'll Do: Zapier is a fast-growing and remote-first company, so you'll likely get experience on many different projects across the organization. That said, here are some things you'll probably do: Build and lead a world class team of highly talented analysts focused on building our business, marketing, and product analytics functions. Develop a strong team culture focused on partnership with all key functional teams.Leverage corpus of analysis to provide recommendations on company strategy, business decisions, and prioritization to functional leaders. Collaborate with department leaDecision Science and product to document their current and future analytics needs.Work with across Zapier to identify business opportunities, measure KPIs, craft data driven narratives, make quant backed recommendations and drive informed actions.Manage and optimize processes: You will evaluate and improve processes for prioritizing and assigning tasks, data modeling, visualization and communicating timelines and deliverables.Analyze and present usage behavior metrics, such as funnel conversion, user churn, activation, engagement and purchasing drivers. Work with marketers and product managers to design tests to improve these metrics.Use a variety of statistical methods to uncover user/customer insights in order to develop and guide product design and marketing program decisions.Ensure all teams have insight to data and can answer their own questions. Develop data literacy program and provide easy to use tools with clear documentation, examples and tutorials.Collaborate w/ teammates, data services, product, finance and operations to help create roadmaps for data modeling and analysis that serve the team in the short and long term.As part of our All Hands Support initiative, every week help customers have the best possible experience with ZapierAbout Data at Zapier Zapier relies on dozens of systems that emit data about Zapier and our potential and current users and partners. This data is useful for us to make a better product, better decisions and understand our weaknesses and opportunities. The data team at Zapier pulls this data from DBs, APIs and through event streams, collocates it and then processes through all the disparate systems to bring them together in a reliable, timely, performant and easy to understand way to employees and systems that need access to it.  Our stack best summed up by AWS Redshift (and related AWS products like AWS Glue, Redshift Spectrum, AWS S3), Looker, Matillion ETL, Kafka, Python, and R. But we're pragmatic -- for example, we have a some Java for ingesting data from Kafka, and we use Clojure for inferring schema and other information about data sets. About Zapier For the past six years, Zapier has been helping people across the world automate the boring and tedious parts of their job. We do that by helping everyone connect the web applications they already use and love.  We believe that there are jobs a computer is best at doing and that there are jobs a human is best at doing. We want to empower businesses to create processes and systems that let computers do what they are best at doing and let humans do what they are best at doing.  We believe that with the right tools, you can have big impact with less hassle.  We believe in small teams. Small teams are fast and nimble. Small teams mean less bureaucracy and less management and more getting things done.  We believe in a safe, welcoming, and inclusive environment. All teammates at Zapier agree to a code of conduct. The Whole Package Location: Planet Earth.  If you want to work remote, that's great. If you want to work near others, that's cool too. Our team of 150+ is distributed because it lets us work with the best people. You don't have to be located in the USA either. Some team members live in the United Kingdom, Thailand, India, Nigeria, Taiwan, Guatemala, New Zealand, Australia, and more! You just need the skills and drive to succeed in this role and the ability to work from anywhere.  Compensation: Competitive salary (we don't use remote as an excuse to pay less)Great healthcare + dental + vision coverage*Retirement plan with 4% company match*Profit sharing2 annual company retreats to awesome places14 weeks paid leave for new parents of biological or adopted childrenPick your own equipment. We'll set you up with whatever Apple laptop + monitor combo you want plus any software you need.Unlimited vacation policy. Plus we require you to take at least 2 weeks off each year. We see most employees take 4-5 weeks off per year. This isn't a vague policy where unlimited vacation means no vacation.Work with awesome companies around the world. We partner with great software companies all over the world and you'll constantly get to interact with people from these great companies *While we take care of our international folks as best we can, currently, healthcare and retirement plans are only available to US-based employees. How To Apply We have a non-standard application process. To jump-start the process we ask a few questions we normally would ask at the start of an interview. This helps speed up the process and lets us get to know you a bit better right out of the gate.  After you apply, you are going to hear back from us, even if we don't seem like a good fit. In fact, throughout the process, we strive to make sure you never go more than seven days without hearing from us.  Optional: Share anonymously some demographic information about yourself to help us better track trends related to the backgrounds of candidates interested in working at Zapier in order for us to build a team that represents the users at Zapier and the broader world population.  Zapier is an equal opportunity employer. We're excited to work with talented and empathetic people no matter their race, color, gender, sexual orientation, religion, national origin, physical or mental disability, or age. Our code of conduct provides a beacon for the kind of company we strive to be, and we celebrate our differences because those differences are what allow us to make a product that serves a global user base.

Name: Enterprise Sales Executive
Description: WHO WE ARE Looker is on a mission to bring better insights and data-driven decisions to every business. Everything we do is aimed at making sure our customers love every aspect of Looker, from our products and technologies to our ease of doing business and our support. We are looking for curiously brilliant individuals to join our team as we reinvent data analytics. Get data-driven and see yourself at Looker. WHAT WE'VE GOT GOING ONAs our Enterprise Sales Executive at Looker, you will be helping customers fundamentally change the way they explore & analyze their complex data and build value for their companies in the areas of Data and Analytics/Business Intelligence, reporting, visualization, data exploration/discovery, embedded analytics, and data science. WHAT WE NEED YOU TO DOIdentify and qualify opportunities for Lookers in-database Business Intelligence software to solve customer Big Data problemsDefine, confirm and communicate the differentiated value of Looker to the customer at both the technical and business levelEstablish Lookers ability to deliver business value through reference and use case selling, and proof of concept engagementsUnderstand the formal and informal buying process in the customer's environmentIdentify the customer approvers, decision makers, and influencers, and develop strategies for each to mitigate risk and increase deal confidenceManage the closing process including negotiations, terms and conditions, and procurement activitiesDevelop a 3x-5x 12 month pipeline of qualified opportunities to meet and exceed your quota targetsUse Salesforce.com to maintain a current and accurate pipeline of your early stage, upside, and forecast dealsConsistently communicate and brainstorm with your Looker management and extended team around all aspects of account and opportunity status & developmentDirect accountability to meet or exceed your quarterly and annual sales quota on a consistent basisWHAT YOU BRING TO LOOKERDirect or indirect background in Business Intelligence with a strong understanding of market dynamics and process areas related to dataHigh level of Business Intelligence Software sales experience as an inside or outside representative with a demonstrated history to consistently meet or exceed performance targetsDemonstrated ability to build and manage customer executive relationshipsDemonstrated ability to manage complex sales cycles including the ability to provide coordination and direction to your extended teamDirect or indirect experience in Business Intelligence or demonstrated ability and background to qualify opportunities, and communicate/position software technologyOutstanding communication and interpersonal skillsStrong orientation to team communication and collaborationPreferred: Inside or outside sales experience with data processing workflows, data analytics, Business Intelligence, and/or data visualization software#LI-AL1A LITTLE MORE ABOUT Name: Analytic Consultant 5 - WFCRC Strategic Controls & Analytics Consultant
Description: Job DescriptionAt Wells Fargo, we want to satisfy our customers financial needs and help them succeed financially. Were looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. Join our diverse and inclusive team where youll feel valued and inspired to contribute your unique skills and experience.  Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.  Corporate Risk helps all Wells Fargo businesses identify and manage risk. We focus on three key risk areas: credit risk, operational risk and market risk. We help our management and Board of Directors identify and monitor risks that may affect multiple lines of business, and take appropriate action when business activities exceed the risk tolerance of the company.  The Wholesale Financial Crimes Risk Controls (WFCRC) team is responsible for the coordination, oversight and ultimate execution of Wholesale Bankings commitments to key internal and external stakeholders as it relates to the management of financial crimes risk with the Wholesale Bank. In addition to having responsibility for Wholesale Bankings execution of the Bank Secrecy Act/Anti-Money Laundering (BSA/AML) program, WFCRC is also responsible for the remediation of the OCC BSA/AML Consent Order. This team will partner with line of business (LOB), operations, risk and compliance team members, Wholesale Group Risk Office (in particular Financial Crimes Risk & Compliance), Enterprise Financial Crimes Risk Management, Wells Fargo Audit Services, all applications within the Wholesale Data EcoSystem (WCIS, Cornerstone, iHub, WDM, etc), and Testing & Validation to advocate and ensure alignment in scope, purpose, expectations and execution of the Wholesale Financial Crimes Program. The team will achieve this through a focus on strong communication, strategic planning, thoughtful and meaningful tracking/reporting, and timely escalation and change management.  WFCRC has an exciting opportunity for an experienced, forward-thinking Analytics Consultant 5 (AC5). The AC5 will report to the Strategic Controls and Analytics (SCA) Operations Risk lead and will help provide expertise and oversight to the Wholesale LOBs and other key stakeholders.  In general, an AC5 is responsible for consulting with partners to identify and provide business needs, complex analysis, and recommendations. Identifies and recommends internal and external data sources, compiles/mines data from multiple, cross business sources; recommends and participates in the development of complex analysis designs using statistical and/or financial analysis, predictive modeling, process documentation, comparative analysis, customer/demographic analysis, etc.; interprets results and recommends solutions to increase revenue, reduce expense, maximize operational efficiency/quality, etc. Ensures adherence to data management/data governance regulations and policies. Data involved may be very large, structured or unstructured, and from multiple sources. To a certain degree, may assist indirectly in the technical build-out and/or support of databases, query tools, reporting tools, BI tools, dashboards, etc. that enable analysis, modeling, and/or data visualization. May manage project teams and provide guidance to less experienced team members.  This AC5 posting is within the WFCRC Strategic Controls & Analytics team (SCA). This group is responsible for oversight of data and analysis related to all the operational risk functions within the Wholesale division.  The AC5 will be responsible for process/data oversight and accurate / timely delivery of business capabilities for the WFCRC, Data team. This position will support the team and be responsible for: Providing updates via SharePoint for weekly project management status and reportingAssisting with creating/managing a process to prioritize data gaps, issues, etc.Partnering with business groups, project management teams, technical teams, and other key individuals associated with filling data gaps and/or data issuesProviding guidance on project scope while keeping in mind Customer Due Diligence (CDD), Know Your Customer (KYC), and Financial Crimes purview guidelinesReviewing stakeholder documentation for accuracy and validity in overall design or delivery componentsPerforming data analysis required to support various projects/identifying data sources and data gaps or information requests by writing/coding complex/recursive SQL (Oracle, Microsoft SQL, Teradata) importing temporary datasets, and using advanced MS Excel capabilities to identify populations in a highly complex environmentIdentifying business needs and working with teams in building reports to support ongoing needs relative to WFCRC Processes and ControlsProviding User Acceptance Testing, internal review, and/or guidance for the business deliverablesPerforming moderately complex to complex test data conditioning, with an emphasis on negative testing to verify project processes are functioning as expected.Analyzing process, data, and/or controls and creating summaries in MS Excel, MS Word, MS Visio, or PowerPoint for management review and communicationsRequired Qualifications8+ years of experience in one or a combination of the following: reporting, analytics, or modeling; or a Masters degree or higher in a quantitative field such as applied math, statistics, engineering, physics, accounting, finance, economics, econometrics, computer sciences, or business/social and behavioral sciences with a quantitative emphasis and 5+ years of experience in one or a combination of the following: reporting, analytics, or modelingDesired QualificationsExtensive knowledge and understanding of research and analysisStrong analytical skills with high attention to detail and accuracyExcellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skillsAdvanced Microsoft Visio skillsAdvanced Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook and PowerPoint) skillsExperience implementing and monitoring regulatory compliance trainingAbility to facilitate trainingStrong organizational, multi-tasking, and prioritizing skillsAbility to prioritize work, meet deadlines, achieve goals, and work under pressure in a dynamic and complex environmentAbility to work effectively in a team environment and across all organizational levels, where flexibility, collaboration, and adaptability are importantAbility to track large volumes of activities across multiple projects and groupsSuperior project management skills including the ability to handle multiple projects concurrentlyAbility to translate and summarize complex data into understandable, actionable information and recommendationsRelational database experienceKnowledge and understanding of database design/modeling logical and physicalKnowledge and understanding of database administration, design, or modelingKnowledge and understanding of database querying and creating ad hoc reporting results using SQL or similar querying methodsInternational or wholesale banking exposure; preferably within Wells FargoKnowledge and understanding of wholesale banking products and servicesOther Desired Qualifications5+ years of advanced skills in SQL (SQL Server, Oracle, Teradata, Nexus) with the ability to talk in terms of data attributes / tables and the ability to write complex SQL queriesWorking knowledge of information architecture; e.g., master data management, data warehousing, etc.Working knowledge of statistical packages; e.g., Jupyter / scikit-learn, SAS, etc.Experience working with large integrated technology environmentsWorking knowledge of enterprise system integration patternsExperience building and retaining documentation to track analysis results and logicSkills in writing use cases and diagraming key concepts to support data workExperience with Compliance data and controls in Wholesale or Wholesale (or similar) line of businessExperience in Wholesale CDD Customer systems such as WCIS, Cornerstone, iHUB, WDMDisclaimerAll offers for employment with Wells Fargo are contingent upon the candidate having successfully completed a criminal background check. Wells Fargo will consider qualified candidates with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable local, state and Federal law, including Section 19 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act.  Relevant military experience is considered for veterans and transitioning service men and women.  Wells Fargo is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer, Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation.

Name: Business Analytics Strategy Manager
Description: Job ID: 162781 Location Name: CA-FSC SF Off (0174)Address: 525 Market St, 32nd Floor, San Francisco, CA 94105, United States (US)Job Type: Full TimePosition Type (Regular/Temporary): RegularJob Function: MarketingBusiness Analytics & Strategy Team: The Sephora Business Analytics & Strategy team works in close partnership with key stakeholders across the organization identifying strategic opportunities and making data-driven decisions. Our team assesses the performance of key strategic initiatives across the company and provides our leadership team with an understanding of the greater prestige beauty market and how Sephora can continue to win across both retail and digital. We play a critical role in helping cross-functional teams understand the drivers of business performance through the lens of our clients and provide actionable insights across Merchandising, Marketing and Retail. Your role at Sephora:The Manager of Business Analytics & Strategy will partner within Analytics and across the organization to develop a well-rounded perspective on business performance and bring insights together to tell a cohesive story and drive strategic decisions. This person will also significantly contribute to the organization’s understanding of the Prestige Beauty Market through market share and competitive analysis. The Manager will work closely with our Director of Business Analytics and VP of Strategy to directly influence Sephora’s senior leadership team. The ideal candidate is data-savvy and has an intellectual curiosity to drill deep to uncover business drivers and present insightful, actionable recommendations to the business. S/he is comfortable with ambiguity and exploring new growth opportunities for the business. This candidate can successfully build collaborative partnerships across the organization, independently manage projects, and also work together with other analytics team members and leadership. You will also: Analyze client behavior and external market data to explain the drivers of business performance, identify changes in trend and uncover potential opportunities to fuel business growth.Provide perspective of Sephora’s business relative to total Prestige Beauty through market share analysis and reporting. Monitor market trends to uncover patterns or variances between channels and categories. Assist in managing the relationship with market data/measurement vendors. Deliver informative assessments of the competitive landscape of beauty (including promotional activity, earnings calls, industry research)Perform data driven modeling to deliver fact-based recommendations and explanations, often for senior leaders of Sephora Americas and Sephora GlobalCollaborate within Analytics department and cross-functional partners to deliver a holistic view of business performanceWe’re excited about you if you have: Comfort performing complex analyses (leveraging multiple data sources) to generate data-driven insight and recommendationsExceptional problem-solving and critical thinking skills with outstanding attention to detailInquisitive nature and proactive approach to data exploration and opportunity identificationAbility to manage ambiguity and use business savvy and strategic thinking to determine the best approach forwardCourage and fearless approach to influence, persuade and drive change across the organizationHighly organized with the ability to balance multiple projects simultaneously, prioritize workload and appropriately escalate when necessaryStrong communication skills, with ability to communicate complex topics in a simple way and bubble up just the most important and actionable insights. Strong interpersonal skills and comfort engaging with senior executives in person and via emailEntrepreneurial orientation, with ability to thrive in an environment with rapid changeHigh degree of initiative, autonomy and optimismBachelor's degree with 3-5 years of experience in an analytical role with increasing responsibilityAdvanced Excel skills (including building models and advanced calculations) requiredIntermediate/Advanced Powerpoint skills requiredIntermediate experience with data mining and writing queries a plus (SQL preferred)Intermediate data visualization skills a plus (Tableau preferred)Previous experience in consulting or investment banking a plus Previous experience with market measurement, such as Nielsen, IRI, NPD, a plus.You’ll love working here because: The people. You will be surrounded by some of the most talented, supportive, smart, and kind leaders and teams – people you can be proud to work with.The product. Employees enjoy a product discount and receive free product (“gratis”) various times throughout the year. (Think your friends and family love you now? Just wait until you work at Sephora!)The business. It feels good to win – and Sephora is a leader in the retail industry, defining experiential retail with a digital focus and creating the most loved beauty community in the world…with the awards and accolades to back it up.The perks. Sephora offers comprehensive medical benefits, generous vacation/holiday time off, commuter benefits, and “Summer Fridays” (half-days every Friday between Memorial and Labor Day)…and so much more.The LVMH family. Sephora’s parent company, LVMH, is one of the largest luxury groups in the world, providing support to over 70 brands such as Louis Vuitton, Celine, Marc Jacobs, and Dior.Working at Sephora’s Field Support Center (FSC)Our North American operations are based in the heart of San Francisco’s Financial District, but you won’t hear us call it a headquarters – it’s the Field Support Center (FSC). At the FSC, we support our stores in providing the best possible experience for every client. Dedicated teams cater to our client’s every need by creating covetable assortments, curated content, compelling storytelling, smart strategy, skillful analysis, expert training, and more. It takes a lot of curious and confident individuals, disrupting the status quo and taking chances. The pace is fast, the fun is furious, and the passion is real. We never rest on our laurels. Our motto? If it’s not broken, fix it.Sephora is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military/veteran status, or disability status. Sephora is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to applicants with physical and mental disabilities.Sephora will consider for employment all qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with applicable law.COMPANY OVERVIEW:SEPHORA has been changing the face of prestige cosmetics since its debut in 1970s Paris. Sephora was acquired by luxury group Moët Hennessy Louis Vuitton (LVMH) in 1997 then launched stateside in 1998, and is currently home to 200 world-class brands - including its own private label, SEPHORA COLLECTION. Sephora's curated assortment features more than 14,000 products including makeup, skin care, perfume, hair care, body, professional tools and more. Sephora is the beauty education hub, offering consultations at the Beauty Studio, a variety of complimentary classes, one-on-one service from Personal Beauty Advisors, and exclusive retail technology SKINCARE IQ, COLOR IQ, and FRAGRANCE IQ. Sephora is an international force in beauty, and its award-winning website and ever-growing presence on social-media make it the world's premier digital beauty destination.

Name: Manager Sales Analytics and Business Intelligence
Description: Title of Job: Manager Sales Analytics and Business Intelligence Company Description: eCommerce Tech Platform- Retail Location: San Francisco  Our SF based tech ecommerce client is looking for a Manager Sales Analytics and Business Intelligence to navigate between the ‘ why, ’ the ‘ what’, and the ‘ so-what’ of data science & analytics. You will help the sales team understand the current state of the business and uncover opportunities for growth. What you will be doing:Work closely with the sales team to identify areas for optimization and measure the impact of initiatives like: pipeline visibility and forecasting, performance metrics, lead scoring)Perform detailed analysis of sales pipeline performance such as: sales channel performance, volume, momentum and framework.Develop and manage crucial KPIs and dashboards for stakeholdersSpearhead CRM analytics and build out a complex supply analytics structureCreatively mine for insights that the team can leverage to create a better and unique customer experiencePioneer new tech and methodologies that will make a dramatic impactGather requirements from leadership and translate them into effective decision-making tools.What we want to see:5+ years of experience in an analytics, engineering, finance, management consulting or equivalentMust be passionate about redefining what best-in-class service and customer experience looks likeExcitement for creative problem solving, and a curiosity to uncover truth through dataExperience with Python or other scripting languages are a plusExpert level proficiency in SQL (SQL Server, MySQL, Postgres, BigQuery)Experience with Salesforce.com or other equivalent CRM (Certified salesforce administrator a plus)Solve interesting problems and make a dramatic impact on the company dailyLeverage data in a highly strategic way to drive change and growthExcitement to join a fast-growing company that is reinventing the fashion industry

Name: Senior Data Engineer - Data Modeling/ETL
Description: Slack is looking for expert data engineers to join our Data Engineering team. In this role, you will be working cross-functionally with business domain experts, analytics, and engineering teams to design and implement our Data Warehouse model. You will design, implement and scale data pipelines that transform billions of records into actionable data models that enable data insights.  You will lead initiatives to formalize data governance and management practices, rationalize our information lifecycle and key company metrics. You will provide mentorship and hands-on technical support to build trusted and reliable domain-specific datasets and metrics.  The candidate will have deep technical skills, be comfortable contributing to a nascent data ecosystem, and building a strong data foundation for the company. They will be a self-starter, detail and quality oriented, and passionate about having a huge impact at Slack. Responsibilities:Translate business requirements into data models that are easy to understand and used by different disciplines across the company. Design, implement and build pipelines that deliver data with measurable quality under the SLAPartner with business domain experts, data analysts and engineering teams to build foundational data sets that are trusted, well understood, aligned with business strategy and enable self-serviceBe a champion of the overall strategy for data governance, security, privacy, quality and retention that will satisfy business policies and requirementsOwn and document foundational company metrics with a clear definition and data lineageIdentify, document and promote best practicesRequirements:Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related field, or equivalent training, fellowship, or work experience5+ years of experience working in data architecture, data modeling, master data management, metadata managementA consistent track record of close collaboration with business partners and crafting data solutions to meet their needsVery strong experience in scaling and optimizing schemas, performance tuning SQL and ETL pipelines in the OLTP, OLAP and Data Warehouse environmentsDeep understanding of relational as well as NoSQL data stores, methods and approaches (logging, columnar, star and snowflake, dimensional modeling)Proficiency with object-oriented and/or functional programming languages is a big plus (e.g. Java, Scala, Python, Go)Hands-on experience with Big Data technologies (e.g Hadoop, Hive, Spark)Excellent written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills, able to effectively collaborate with technical and business partnersExcellent understanding of trade-offsDemonstrated ability to navigate between big-picture and implementation details

Name: Sales Enablement & Business Analytics (Analyst)
Description: Common Purpose, Uncommon Opportunity. Everyone at Visa works with one goal in mind – making sure that Visa is the best way to pay and be paid, for everyone everywhere. This is our global vision and the common purpose that unites the entire Visa team. As a global payments technology company, tech is at the heart of what we do: Our VisaNet network processes over 13,000 transactions per second for people and businesses around the world, enabling them to use digital currency instead of cash and checks. We are also global advocates for financial inclusion, working with partners around the world to help those who lack access to financial services join the global economy. Visa’s sponsorships, including the Olympics and FIFA™ World Cup, celebrate teamwork, diversity, and excellence throughout the world. If you have a passion to make a difference in the lives of people around the world, Visa offers an uncommon opportunity to build a strong, thriving career. Visa is fueled by our team of talented employees who continuously raise the bar on delivering the convenience and security of digital currency to people all over the world. Join our team and find out how Visa is everywhere you want to be. Sales Enablement & Business Analytics (Analyst) The Sales Enablement & Business Analytics Analyst is a highly visible role within the Visa Global ARP Operations team. This role will help make the Visa Global Risk team more effective and productive by using a data-driven approach to develop commercialization frameworks that scale our most innovative Risk capabilities and partnering with the Risk Managers deliver these solutions to our clients globally. This is an exciting opportunity to act as a partner to our external facing teams and advise executives in the global risk organization on how to deliver client value and drive further differentiation in the payments market.  ResponsibilitiesSupport the development and implementation of commercialization strategies for new capabilities and markets, including developing overall framework, delivery channels, expected outcomes, etc. Conduct data-driven business analytics that support recommendations on strategy and investment for Risk leadershipDesign quantitative frameworks and tools that demonstrate the value of Visa Risk solutions to key external stakeholders, including merchants and issuers Collect & analyze data, information, and research through quantitative and qualitative channels that enable the development of decision frameworks for Risk leadershipEstablish communication plan that ensures the larger organization is aware of key priorities, activities and results while providing the proper support to ensure goals are metCreate a feedback loop on the team needs and develop plan to address them  Capabilities & Experience Minimum of 3 years of experience, preferably 5 Bachelor’s degree from a top university in a business-related field (e.g. Business, finance, economics, marketing, or related areas).Recent graduates with demonstrated strong strategic/analytical abilities, or 1-2 years of experience in a top-tier strategic consulting firmExperience with data analysis and modeling to drive business recommendations Excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to develop strong working relationships across different functions and organizationsSolid influencing skills and presentation skills and ability to communicate at all levels with clarity and precision both written and verbally is necessary    Visa will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of Article 49 of the San Francisco Police Code. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Name: Finance Business Analyst
Description: Sr. Finance Business Analyst Overview: The Senior Finance Business Analyst will be responsible for designing and optimizing analytical tools, business processes, and systems in Genomic Health’s Finance organization. The Senior Business Analyst acts as the interface between business and technology teams. He/she will support process/system design and improvement projects and product launches through all phases of the project life cycle with a focus on Procurement to Pay, Revenue Processing and Recognition (Results to Cash), Pricing, Accounts Payable, Accounts Receivable, Foreign Currency management, Financial Reporting, and General Ledger related processes.  This position will specialize in assignments involving the design of processes, systems and reports to improve the efficiency of the Finance department, though support of other areas may be required and will be assigned as needed. The primary customers for this position includes Finance, Managed Care, Supply Chain, and IT. Responsibilities: Business Process, Systems, and Analytics - Analysis & Support Work with Finance Department Leads and Platform Manager to analyze existing business processes, systems, and analytical tools to identify pain points and opportunities for improvement.Develop detailed documentation (gap analyses, process flow charts, decision tables, etc.) to aid in the understanding of business requirements and potential solution options.Consult a broad group of stakeholders to understand competing requirements; negotiate a process/system solution that will meet the needs of the broader group.Document business requirements in the form of user stories and in other written documentation as required.Lead meetings to ensure business requirements are communicated to and understood by software developers.Collaborate with IT and business to propose and provide input on system design solutions and process changes.Serve as Product Owner on the Agile implementation team. Change Management Summarize and communicate implementation solutions to business.Provide input and support to business during implementation phase, including carrying out software user testing, composing SOPs, and/or conducting employee training.Serve as frontline support in troubleshooting process and systems issues, and provide ongoing operational support as required. Project and Portfolio Management Provide project status updates in both verbal and written format.Assist the Scrum Master in developing detailed project timelines to ensure analysis and change management activities are accounted for.Collaborate with the ERP Portfolio Management Team to maintain a backlog of projects and features. Propose phasing strategies to efficiently implement projects.Essential Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:Works with minimal guidance from manager to deliver on medium to high complexity projects: o Quickly develops a detailed understanding of the processes, systems, and analytics utilized by the business area  o Consolidates input from business and technical stakeholders. Negotiates solutions to ensure a broad range of stakeholders’ needs are met  o Overcomes challenges to move projects forward  o Efficiently manages multiple projects with competing deadlines Demonstrates effective analysis and communication skills: o Mines data to inform business process flow decisions  o Documents complex business processes  o Demonstrates outstanding written and verbal communication skills  o Delivers well-organized, informative presentations and requirements documents Excellent team player, demonstrating strong interpersonal and collaborative skillsPrior work in a Finance department of a publicly traded company desiredCourageous, curious, and articulate.Qualifications:BS/MS degree5-8 years of business process improvement experience, either in a Business Analyst role or as a member of the Finance team.Prior experience working with ERP and CRM systems. NetSuite experience a plus.Experience with regulatory controls such as SOXPrior experience working in the healthcare industry desirable. Physical Requirements  CORPORATE OFFICE JOBS: TRAVEL, PHYSICAL/MENTAL DEMANDS AND WORK ENVIRONMENT:Travel Requirements: 10%Use of computer, and or telephone for long periods of time may be necessary.Considerable periods of time may be spent concentrating and or analyzing dataConsiderable periods of time may be spent communicating verbally and in various written forms including presentation material and email with other peopleAt times, stress may be experienced.Standing or sitting for long periods of time may be necessarySome lifting (greater than 25 pounds) may be necessary; Facilities, Materials and Engineering employees occasionally must lift at least 50-75 pounds.May be exposed to hazardous materials, tissue specimens and instruments with moving parts, lasers, heating and freezing elements, and high speed centrifugation (GENERALLY LABORATORY & CUSTOMER SERVICE EMPLOYEES ONLY) Company Profile:Genomic Health is a global provider of genomic-based diagnostic tests that address the overtreatment of cancer, one of the greatest issues in healthcare today. Our goal is to improve the lives of people with cancer by providing personalized, biological information that helps them get the right treatment at the right time, and to avoid unnecessary treatments and their side effects. In this way, our work is truly life, changing.Our Oncotype IQ Genomic Intelligence Platform is a portfolio of diagnostic tests that help physicians and patients answer specific and critical treatment questions throughout the cancer journeyWe currently offer Oncotype tests addressing breast, colon, prostate and lung cancers and hundreds of thousands of patients from over 90 countries have benefited from our tests.The Oncotype DX breast cancer test is considered standard of care in the US and is included in all major international clinical guidelines for breast cancer treatment.We are expanding our portfolio of tests to include additional liquid- and tissue-based tests through clinical research and internal product development as well as strategic partnerships.Join the Genomic Health Team, and have the unique opportunity to make a difference in the lives of patients with cancer, while developing your career potential. We embrace our unique culture characterized by our Core Values of Community, Truth Seeking, Being Ahead of the Curve and Winning to be the best in the world at what we do. We maintain competitive total rewards programs designed to satisfy our employees’ work life and personal life needs. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, gender identity, color, religion, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability.
