Name: Project Manager, Compliance Analytics & Operations
Description: New Balance was founded on one simple maxim: we were born to move. For over a century, that idea has inspired us to support athletes of all kinds in their pursuit of excellence, whether that means winning a medal or just leading a more active lifestyle.  But as proud as we are of our history, we’re even more excited about our future. We innovate fearlessly, guided by our core values and driven by the belief that conventions were meant to be challenged. We seek leaders and pioneers – those kindred spirits who follow only their passions — because tomorrow belongs to the courageous of today.  Join us in upholding a culture of integrity, teamwork, and community. Join New Balance and declare your independence.JOB MISSIONThis position is responsible for Global Compliance data analytics and internal reporting, including the development of data dashboards for various internal audiences/stakeholders. You will manage the integration of NB Global Compliance policies and procedures as well as help coordinate with our Domestic team to ensure consistency in practice between global supply chain and NB owned factories.MAJOR ACCOUNTABILITIES Analyze and regularly report on supplier performance and areas of opportunity/concernSupport team leadership in strengthening NB compliance program policies, procedures, and systems – including reporting tools – for regional and global useBuild strong relationships with internal and external businesses to ensure that NB social and environmental standards, policies, and procedures are fully compatible and integratedWork with internal and external partners to deliver remediation, training, and other mechanisms to build supplier capacityResearch, learn, and understand: labor, wage, and safety laws; labor contracts; factory management systems; and international human rights standardsWork closely with Global Compliance team members to understand and stay current on relevant labor and HSE legislation within our supply chain countriesREQUIREMENTS FOR SUCCESSBachelor’s degree in relevant course of study5+ years of relevant experience; preferably with at least 3 years in a direct company-based CSR roleDatabase/data systems expertise; experience with Fair Factories Clearinghouse (FFC) and Spotfire a plusExperience conducting factory compliance audits and overseeing corrective actionsExperience creating globally relevant operational policy and supporting SOPsStrong understanding of apparel and footwear supply chain operationsWillingness to actively question the way things are done and use data to inform strategy and prioritize actionDomestic and international travel (20-25%) Our Benefits:Our products are only as good as the people we hire, so we make sure to hire the best and treat them accordingly. In addition to a comprehensive traditional benefits package (medical, dental, vision, 401k, etc.) we proudly offer a slate of more nontraditional perks – opportunities like on/offsite seminars, customized team building sessions, tuition reimbursement, and various mentorship programs – that encourage our associates to grow personally as they develop professionally. You’ll also enjoy a flexible work schedule, gym discounts, fitness reimbursements, and volunteer opportunities, because work-life balance is more than just a buzzword – it’s part of our culture.Equal Opportunity Employer:New Balance provides equal opportunities for all current and prospective associates and takes affirmative action to ensure that employment, training, compensation, transfer, promotion and other terms, conditions and privileges of employment are provided without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, handicap, genetic information and/or status as an Armed Forces service medal veteran, recently separated veteran, qualified disabled veteran or other protected veteran.To Apply:Please visit the New Balance Athletics’ careers website.

Name: Director, Business Analytics Cloud Enablement
Description: Manages the development, establishment and direction of regional, role based, or line of business sales training strategies and policies to enable optimal productivity of the sales organization. Responsible for managing the design, development and deployment of product, process and skills enablement programs that drive elite sales performance within Oracle's global sales organization.  Determines and evaluates sales training needs for the organization. Develops and directs the build of sales training curriculum and programs. Organizes and manages sales training sessions. Facilitates formal and informal presentations to senior management, sales organization, and other internal functions as appropriate. May work with other Oracle team to incorporate corporate or regional strategy into training curriculum. Provides guidance within the sales organization and shares best practices. Analyzes performance of sales personnel to determine need for additional training. May oversee a staff of sales trainers and/or Sales Performance Designers and others. Keeps informed of new training methods and techniques.  Assists in the development of short, medium, and long term plans to achieve strategic objectives. Regularly interacts across functional areas with senior management or executives to ensure unit objectives are met. Ability to influence thinking or gain acceptance of others in sensitive situations is important. Demonstrated leadership and people management skills preferred. Strong written, verbal, and interpersonal skills. Bachelors or equivalent years of professional experience preferred. Provide input to the program development team to ensure the development of accurate and timely courseware to support global and regional goals. Manage training resources and other Oracle personnel and third-parties performing the roles of subject matter experts for global curriculum development or delivery in region. Oversee and direct input of programming needs for programs for designated pillars/lobs within Oracle  Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans status or any other characteristic protected by law.  This position is responsible for increasing sales of the Oracle Business Analytics Cloud portfolio by enabling Oracle field sales and the Oracle PartnerNetwork members to drive sales and revenue growth.  The ideal candidate for this position should have:  10 years total business software professional experience  BA/BS degree in a relevant field, advanced degree a plus  Experience selling, demoing and/or implementing Business Analytics Cloud solutions  Training development and delivery experience  Management experience  Experience working with software partners  Excellent written and verbal communication skills  Project management skills  Familiarity with Oracle Business Analytics Cloud features and benefits as well as general field service business principles  Self-starter with ability to manage time and objectives independently *Responsibilities include:* Manage team ofBusiness Analytics Cloud Enablement training developers and instructors  Develop and deliver regional, role based, or line of business sales training strategies and policies  Manage the design, development and deployment of product, process and skills enablement programs that drive elite performance within Oracle s global sales organization and Oracle PartnerNetwork  Drive enablement through initiatives including guided learning paths and hands on in person or virtual training.  Manage stakeholder committees  Coordinate with regional sales and alliances teams Expected Travel:*Up to 20% domestic and international travel anticipated Salary and job level commensurate with experience *Job:** **Training**Organization:** **Oracle**Title:** *Director, Business Analytics Cloud Enablement**Location:** *United States**Requisition ID:** *18000VW3*

Name: Institutional Long Term Sales Representative 2 - Insurance
Description: Job DescriptionAt Wells Fargo, we have one goal: to satisfy our customers financial needs and help them achieve their dreams. Were looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. Join our diverse and inclusive team where youll feel valued and inspired to contribute your unique skills and experience.  Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.  Wealth and Investment Management (WIM) businesses build enduring client relationships through sound, thoughtful and objective advice. We help our clients by developing individualized plans for everything from retirement goals to business succession planning, to family legacy intentions. Services include comprehensive planning and advice, investment management, brokerage, private banking, estate planning strategies, trust, insurance and both individual and institutional retirement.  Wells Fargo Asset Management, a division of Wells Fargo Wealth and Investment Management, strives to help clients achieve their financial goals through top-tier investment options managed by specialized investment teams that are supported by independent risk management and backed by superior, collaborative service. With more than $504 billion in assets under management as of January 12, 2018, Wells Fargo Asset Management has 29 autonomous investment teams with specialized expertise and proven processes, more than 500 investment professionals, and a global reach with offices and clients around the world.  We provide clients with a broad array of investment options across all major asset classes, including actively managed equity, fixed-income, liquidity, stable value, and alternative investments. Investment strategies are accessible through a variety of product structures, including institutional separate accounts, retail separately managed accounts, mutual funds (open-end, closed-end, variable trust), private funds (hedge funds, commingled investment vehicles, medium term note programs), and Luxembourg-domiciled funds (UCITS).  The Insurance team employs a holistic approach to covering the total client. The teams consultative approach is rooted in a deep understanding of a clients needs while simultaneously up-tiering the relationship at every level, especially at the C-Suite. At the core of the Insurance Teams approach is the engagement at the CIO/CFO/CEO level which firmly positions WFAM as a trusted advisor and strategic partner with our insurance clients.  Key to delivering this model is: Know the clients strategies, key senior leaders and the extent of their relationship with Wells FargoMaintain thorough, direct dialogue with clients, understand risk appetite of CIOsExperience and understanding of general account investments for different types of insurance entitiesLeadership of C-Suite level relationships to allow for cross-platform strategic dialogue with key decision makers to effect greatest level of desired changeApproach clients in a top-down manner: honor the positive aspects and work to improve pain-points in relationshipsMove the client out on the relationship value scale from single product sales to a trusted advisor / strategic partner by leveraging all of Wells Fargos capabilities, expertise and senior managementAnticipate client needs and deliver appropriate solutions and innovative ideasUnderstand and stay current on Wells Fargo's business strategy in order to drive firm-wide initiativesNavigate and collaborate with key wholesale banking partners including Financial Institutions, Healthcare and Investment BankingDeep top-to-bottom relationships throughout all of the key areas of Wealth and Investment Management and Wells Fargo, allow for the greatest level of advocacy and visibility of our key clients This is a proactive sales role in which the individual must effectively articulate and position WFAM products, strategies and solutions while cultivating deep client relationships with all types of insurers including health, property & casualty, life and reinsurers.  This will entail a thorough understanding of an insurers general account assets including regulatory compliance, risk based capital charges and accounting rules. This individual will be able to lead the sales process from qualification, to opportunity, RFP (when required) to close, effectively leveraging WFAMs extensive and complex internal resources. This role requires an ability to effectively identify, evaluate and communicate a wide array of bespoke strategies and solutions. To that end, this role demands a proven ability to coordinate and partner with consultant relations as needed, our 29 investment teams and the multi-asset solutions team.  The individual will have demonstrated an ability to lead new business meetings and close sales to mid-size to large, clients and prospects. The sales director must proactively position and differentiate WFAM from competitor firms and products. The ability to articulate sophisticated, concepts, ideas and processes to clients/prospects who may have varying levels of investment acumen is paramount.  This individual will have demonstrated an ability to navigate complex insurance organizations and build strong relationships throughout the entirety of the entity. The ability to challenge and influence key decision makers at the executive, C-suite level is paramount.  The sales director role demands a high degree of collaboration with our wholesale banking partners: Corporate Banking and Commercial Banking. The individual will also be expected to elevate WFAMs profile in the insurance sector through broad, and frequent interaction with consultants, industry groups, leaders, clients and prospects.  One position is available, preferably residing in the Midwest.Required Qualifications5+ years of investment sales experienceDesired QualificationsSolid knowledge and understanding of investment products and servicesStrong sales skillsA BS/BA degree or higherExcellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skillsAn active Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA) designationOther Desired Qualifications Extensive knowledge and understanding of the institutional investment industry and products Experience driving for results, applying a sense of urgency, and bringing issues to closure in a decisive manner despite obstacles and opposition Keen analytical skills including: synthesizing, organizing and evaluating data in support of core business analytics/special requests Excellent presentation skills Ability to work in a fast-paced deadline driven environment Effective organizational, multi-tasking and prioritizing skills Solid knowledge and understanding of investment products and services Ability to work effectively in a team environment and across all organizational levels, where flexibility, collaboration, and adaptability are vitally important Experience as a money manager, research analyst, consultant relations director or product specialist Experience with database software and applications such as SNL, Salesforce or SatuitJob ExpectationsRegistration for FINRA Series 7 or 63 must be completed within 90 days of hire date if it is not available for transfer upon hire. FINRA recognized equivalents will be accepted.Obtaining and/or maintaining appropriate Financial Industry Regulatory Authority (FINRA) license(s) is required for ongoing employment in this position. In addition state registration, specific product licenses or SAFE licensing may apply. Additional requirements include meeting enhanced financial fitness and criminal background standards. Wells Fargo will initiate the FINRA review process at the time of offer acceptance.For specific FINRA qualification exams obtained after 9/30/2018, the Securities Industry Essentials (SIE) exam co-requisite may also be requiredDisclaimerAll offers for employment with Wells Fargo are contingent upon the candidate having successfully completed a criminal background check. Wells Fargo will consider qualified candidates with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable local, state and Federal law, including Section 19 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act.  Relevant military experience is considered for veterans and transitioning service men and women.  Wells Fargo is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer, Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation.

Name: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: Postman builds the worlds leading API Development Environment. We help everyone from individual developers to teams at organizations like Adobe, Salesforce, Cisco, Okta and Autodesk, collaboratively design, build, test, document, publish, consume and share both internal and external APIs. Over 5,000,000 developers and 100,000 organizations worldwide use Postman. Our customers LOVE our product and we continue to grow rapidly.  As an expert in delivering business intelligence for Postman, you will work with our team to answer critical business questions in a data-driven manner. This role will require an informed and critical eye, someone who questions and reviews the validity of data from several perspectives, not just someone who fires a query and blindly forwards the results. ResponsibilitiesDesign, build and maintain analytical infrastructure across the organizationWork closely with business stakeholders and engineering to make sure data definitions and technical logic specifications align with business requirementsHandle data extractions and translations from multiple data sources in order to build and support sustainable, high-performance data model solutionsAutomate ETLs to acquire, process, and curate data, with an eye for reproducible analysisRecommend data standards and best practices to improve quality of data and speed to insightDesign and build business metrics for our corporate reporting; build dashboards in analytical/BI tools for business stakeholdersTranslate analytical insights into actionable recommendations for business and process improvementRequirements3 + years of relevant experience in Business Intelligence, Analytics, or other quantitative disciplinesExperience solving ambiguous and complex data problemsExperience mapping business objectives into actionable analyses, and explaining technical concepts, and implications to a broad audienceAnalytics industry Knowledge with a comfortable sense of the tooling landscapeProficient in SQL and working with large datasets, and knowledge of system architectureKnowledgeable in one or more leading BI Analytics platformsUS Citizenship or work authorization.Local candidates only. (San Francisco Bay Area)Plus: Experience with LookerBenefits We are located right on Market St., in downtown San Francisco, near the Montgomery Bart stop. We offer a competitive salary, equity participation, excellent benefits, an informal & fun working environment, and catered lunches.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Working for a major bank in Downtown San Francisco, this role is working as a technical analyst within the AML/BSA division. You will be responsible for data mining Teradata using SAS to automate reports to produce alerts that could progress to Suspicious activity reports. Ideal education background statistics or engineering to apply please send your up to date resume to Athena.davis@rhmr.com

Name: Business Operations Analyst
Description: Role/Responsibilities: The Risk & Finance Analytics (RAFA) division of Moody’s Analytics delivers solutions to financial institutions to manage their risk exposures, profitability, and balance sheet. Our products and services are focused on the application of quantitative models to business problems associated with credit assessment and monitoring, portfolio management and construction, stress testing, and impairment processes. Our team consists of experts at interpreting financial information, developing data-driven analytics, and applying information and analytics to our customer’s business needs.  The Business Operations Analyst reports to the Program Management Director. Will work with the management team and other internal partners to manage various operational, programmatic, and strategic aspects of the business. To be successful the individual will need to possess a wide range of skills to support and manage projects across a wide group of stakeholders Key responsibilities:Operations and Business AnalysisSupport the process of identifying, prioritizing, planning, and managing strategic projects for Line of Business (LoB)Participate and/or lead team wide projects including management of specific business projects and change management programs.Development and ownership of analytics against performance measures at project, segment, and LoB levels.Manage the contractor hiring process for the business and associated expense analysis.Prepare executive management dashboard and reports to track progress of key performance metrics.Support financial forecasting activities, including development of detailed budget and forecast models to drive high quality decision-making and closely monitor business performance.Support other strategic projects and business wide initiatives.Communication & Success FactorsProduce and deliver regular communication to various stakeholders within RAFA team and other lines of businesses across Moody’s Analytics regarding objectives, strategies, and departmental commitmentsDevelop materials and messages to be distributed in various channels related to specific activities, relating them to broader objectivesAbility to manage multiple projectsDemonstrate aptitude to work with senior team members and gain their confidenceDemonstrate consistent deliveryTeam player with motivation for career growth

Name: Content Marketing Intern
Description: Kabbage is blazing a trail in big data and fintech, and we are looking for a Content Marketing Intern in the summer of 2019 (June 3 August 2) to join the Kabbage team as we continue our amazing growth trajectory.  Kabbage is more than a lender for small businesses; our data and technology platform is now being used as a fully branded product by other lenders, and our products are expanding. We've received numerous awards & recognition, including Glassdoor's 2017 Best Places to Work, "36th fastest growing company in the US" on the INC 500 List, Fast Company's "Top 10 most innovative companies in finance" and Forbes' "America's Top 100 Most Promising Companies" among others.Your mission:Our San Francisco Office is looking for a customer-focused, creative, and process-loving intern to help provide value and insights to small businesses through compelling content and storytelling.What you'll be doing:Manage content creation in collaboration with in-house teams and agenciesHelp distribute and integrate content across brand, demand generation and customer acquisition channelsWork with team to ensure that all content is strategically matched to a persona and buying stageUse personas, campaign themes, competitive intel and analytics to build and maintain content calendar and repositoryBuild out content roundtables cross-functionally to allow for feedback loops and sharing of insightsSuggest new asset creation and edit and repurpose content as neededMeasure and report on performance of contentWhat we're looking for in you:Collaboration: Working well with a range of people from across the businessAnalytical Skills: Able to structure and process qualitative or quantitative data and draw insightful conclusions form itInitiative: Actively finds ways to make improvements at workCreativity/Innovation: Generates new and innovative approaches to problems; open to new ways of doing thingsEnthusiasm: Exhibits passion and excitement over work; has a can-do attitudeWhat you should have:Eligibility: seniors in undergraduate programs and graduate students are welcome to apply.Pursuing a degree in Marketing, Journalism, Communication, or other relevant field of study.Ability to understand and present content and social performanceExperience with Wordpress, Excel, and the top social channels The Kabbage AdvantageAt Kabbage, our people are awesome, so we built the Kabbage Advantageour way of being awesome right back. Our team members enjoy a dynamic work environment with daily catered lunches, fully stocked kitchens, cold-brewed coffee and beer on tap. We offer onsite fitness and meditation classes, adjustable sit/stand desks, and top-of-the-line hardwareto name a few more.  While our perks and benefits are generous, the people are actually what make Kabbage great. Kabbagers are curious, creative, and resilient. We are enthusiastic, productive, and problem solvers. And we don't do it alone. At Kabbage, you will find low-key individuals who work hard to communicate effectively and work collaboratively. Kabbage is an equal opportunity employer. At Kabbage we make all employment decisions, which include hiring, promoting, transferring, demoting, evaluating, compensating and separating, without regard to sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, race, color, religion, age, national origin, pregnancy, citizenship, disability, service in the uniform services, or any other classification protected by federal, state or local law.

Name: Manager, Business Analytics
Description: COMPANY LendingTree was founded in 1996 by CEO Doug Lebda to help people comparison shop and get a great deal on the single biggest transaction of their lives: their mortgage. In doing so we fundamentally disrupted the mortgage industry making it much more competitive and consumer focused, while helping over 30 million people in the home buying and refinancing processes. LendingTree is now a well-known household brand which has expanded to include comparison shopping for credit cards, student loans, personal loans, auto loans, and business loans as well as related categories like home services and online college degrees. We are quite literally the place consumers come to shop for a better deal on their money.  LendingTree is publicly traded (TREE) and our stock has delivered impressive performance month after month. If you're looking for an opportunity with a dynamic company that is fanatically pro-consumer and that champions your entrepreneurial spirit, you've come to the right place! CULTURE Our clothes are casual and relaxed, and our work ethic is highly professional. It is our culture for each team member to challenge the status quo, express their opinions, and to stand up, ask for the ball and run with it to meet our aggressive goals. We also have a lot of fun together! We're always looking for the best, brightest, high energy, results-driven Rock Stars to join our team. We reward innovation, creativity and the ability to just GET STUFF DONE. THE POSITION You absolutely love data (unstructured and structured), testing hypotheses, and arriving at data-driven recommendations that have an immediate impact on the business. You have a strong business acumen and exceptional critical thinking that you employ to turn data insights into strategic action. You are passionate about communicating insights as much as you are about discovering them in the first place. You constantly ask questions about how to use analytics to improve the business and constantly make impactful strategic decisions. You have a passion for marketing and a desire to use data to optimize performance. You enjoy collaborating with teams across digital and traditional channels to understand and support their goals. Responsibilities:Own the strategy, launch, administration, optimization, budget and P&L of your business vertical.Provide focused analysis of data attributes to understand patterns and offer insights to maximize business revenue and product improvements/development.Perform exploratory and targeted data analyses using descriptive statistics and other methods.Build predictive models to optimize CRM retargeting strategy, matching algorithms.Build, test, optimize and productionalize machine learning models (e.g. offer sorting, product affinity, LTV etc.)Work with Product team to conduct A/B tests and define KPIs, to improve customer retention.Collaborate with marketing managers to work on innovative ideas to increase market share.Recommend new strategies after conducting internal analysis, researching competitor campaigns and digesting industry reports, tracking the resulting initiatives and reporting on the financial impact of your work.Become well-versed in digital analytics tools to track and understand full-funnel performance.Define KPIs and create standard reports and dashboards to analyze performance; work with cross-functional teams to set targets and measure performance.Requirements:4+ years of experience in quantitative analysis and data science.Bachelor's/Master's degree in Computer Science, Math, Statistics, or other quantitative field.Strong experience using SQL and working with large datasets.Knowledge of Machine Learning models and advanced statistical techniques.Data modeling experience in Python or R.Ability to synthesize data from multiple sources to drive actionable insights; a proven influencer with excellent communication skills.Expert data harmonization skills questions every data point before relying on it.Individual Contributor can work with least guidance, and a Team Player can mentor and guide individuals with passion for data.Off the charts analytical thinker. You have a giant brain.Superior problem-solving & critical thinking skills. You know how to rip apart difficult problems and construct elegant solutions.Strategic toolkit: you can focus an organization on the key business levers and not get caught in the million daily tasks. You see the forest and the trees.Pragmatic: you know the 80/20 rule, and know when to boil the ocean and when not to. The solutions you develop are understandable and implementable.Self-directed. You check in regularly with your boss, but you can run with a ton of autonomy.Team player. You play nice with others. People like working with you.Competitive Spirit and Inquisitive mind.Desire to roll up your sleeves and dig into the work.Motivated to work hard in a fast-paced environment.SDL2017

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Job Description Business Analyst Role Job SummaryAssist in defining business requirements, software specifications, applications and designing workflow processes. Major Duties and Responsibilities: Assist in designing business and technical requirements to support new business functions, improve internal processes, and satisfy external customer requests, and change or enhance the functions of current programs for the same reasons. Evaluate current and future business needs with regard to streamlining and standardizing business processes, opportunities for automation, and improving patient interactions. Define and drive time and motion studies for different projects for clinics and supporting departments. Working closely with clinical and operational leads, diagnose process improvement opportunities and develop solutions using principles of process excellence and related tools. Create quality reporting, analysis and audits for developing plans and programs to support continuous quality improvement using applicable tools. Assist in the creation, implementation and evaluation of user acceptance testing and production quality review. Create all required documentation to meet department standards, such as, end user documentation, business SOPs and training materials. Education and Experience: Preferred Bachelor's degree in related field or equivalent combination of experience and education Three (3+) years experience in a healthcare environment Two (2+) years experience in developing requirements and designing workflow processes. Experience interacting with a wide range of customers, such as staff, clinicians, clinical managers, and directors. Experience with office business tools, such as Microsoft Office (especially PowerPoint, Word, and Excel), BOX, Google Docs, and SmartSheet and other similar products. Competencies: Excellent organizational, communication and presentation skills, especially around listening to customers needs and the ability to articulate those needs into accurate written requirements and presentations. Ability to access, compile and analyze large volume data sets into concise and precise information Ability to define & design business processes into manageable components Ability to understand and analyze metrics Ability to multitask and work independently a well as part of a team Ability to analyze and interpret data Strong ability to multi-task across multiple projects and timelines Strong customer focus Strong attention to detail Ability to prioritize tasks with minimal input to accomplish daily and long-term goals Ability to work onsite and participate in interactive onsite meetings on a regular and predictable basis. Ability to work in collaboration with team members. Ability to be responsive in a thoughtful, methodical and effective way. EEO Employer

Name: Analyst, Business Analytics
Description: At Pandora, we're a unique collection of engineers, musicians, designers, marketers, and world-class sellers with a common goal: to enrich lives by delivering effortless personalized music enjoyment and discovery. Peoplethe listeners, the artists, and our employeesare at the center of our mission and everything we do. Actually, employees at Pandora are a lot like the service itself: bright, eclectic, and innovative. Collaboration is the foundation of our workforce, and we're looking for smart individuals who are self-motivated and passionate to join us. Be a part of the engine that creates the soundtrack to life. Discover your future at Pandora!  Pandora is looking for a detail oriented Analyst, Business Analytics to develop and manage insights/dashboards/forecasts around ad product performance and sales/revenue trends. This individual will work closely with stakeholders across the company (Product, Finance, PYM, and Sales) to interpret findings and identify patterns in the data. We are interested in a self-starter who will own the responsibility of telling a story based on what they find and track down issues/anomalies as they arise. They must have a strong sense of time management and ability to communicate with both technical and non-technical audiences. Key Responsibilities:Point of contact for creating and maintaining dashboards for key stakeholders and Senior LeadershipAbility to interface with various teams to develop contextual analysis around trends & movementsProactively identify opportunities where data collection and analysis can improve business processes and influence decisionsWork closely with various teams to understand data pipelines and track-down issues impacting revenue/inventoryWork closely with stakeholder teams to ensure data classification and definitions of critical KPIs are understood and accurately capturedPreferred Requirements:Bachelor's degree, with a successful track record in analytical coursework (Economics, Statistics, Mathematic, etc.)2+ years of work experience in an analytical roleExtensive experience with SQL and database concepts requiredExperience with reporting tools such as PowerPoint & Tableau requiredExperience with Hive and ELT processes preferredExperience with Salesforce.com preferredMastery of Excel requiredExcellent problem solving abilityExceptional attention to detail and ability to plan/pace projectsStrong analytical, communication and documentation skillsExperience with online advertising preferred Pandora is committed to diversity in its workforce. Pandora is an equal employment opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants without regard to gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, race, veteran or disability status. Women and people of color are encouraged to apply.  Pandora is also a VEVRAA federal contractor. Pandora requests priority referrals of protected veterans from each ESDS, as required by regulation.  If you believe you need a reasonable accommodation in order to search for a job opening or to apply for a position, please contact us by sending an email to disability@pandora.com This email box is designed to assist job seekers who require a reasonable accommodation to the application process. A response to your request may take up to two business days.  In your email, please include the following: The specific accommodation requested to complete the employment application.The location or office to which you would like to applyThe subject of the email should read "Request for Reasonable Accommodation".SDL2017

Name: Security Technical Program Manager
Description: Twitch Security is the team charged with measuring, understanding, and improving Twitch’s security posture and culture, anchored by a core tenet to defend the customer and their data. We’re looking for a Technical Program Manager (TPM) to join the Twitch Security team and help lead its company-wide initiatives.TPMs at Twitch apply their technical and organizational skills to correctly capture requirements, plan for dependencies, and make their teams more efficient. They know how to apply technology to solve problems. The Security TPM role is both diplomat and advocate, and is trusted to represent the Twitch Security team to both customers and stakeholders, internal and external. You will help define goals, measure progress, manage dependencies, and clear blockers.Twitch Security is early in its roadmap and the successful candidate will have a unique opportunity to apply the lessons of their past successes and failures to a growing program. You will solve new problems unique to Twitch as well as old favorites, and help build a company-wide security culture focused on protecting the customer.You’ll find a Requirements section below. If you meet all these then we strongly encourage you to apply. If you meet some of them but think this role sounds like something you’d be great at, we strongly encourage you to apply. If you meet just one of them but think you bring something unique to the team, we strongly encourage you to apply.Responsibilities Own successful delivery of large, high impact and highly cross-functional program initiatives while simultaneously and accurately tracking a set of smaller projects.Work closely with Twitch’s product teams, throughout the product’s life-cycle. Recognize, adopt and instill good practices from security engineering fields throughout the organization. Exercise risk-based judgment, and to help teams to make the right security calls.Drive strategic cross-functional planning, leading discovery and prioritization by closely partnering with engineering leads to develop program plans, including roadmap, dependency identifications and resourcing plan.Establish and drive adoption of program frameworks, tools and best practices. Share your program management knowledge with engineering leadership teams. Lead post-program analysis to guide future programs.Communicate clearly and effectively to executive management on the plans, status and critical issues. Escalate urgent issues appropriately and driving them to closure in a timely manner.Requirements Minimum of 5 years of experience as a technical program manager in software/web development organizations.BS or MS degree in computer science or equivalent experience.Strong technical acumen and ability to actively participate and contribute to technical designs discussions, proactively identify challenges and risks, working closely with engineers on addressing challenges and form mitigation plans.Considers the larger picture (e.g., efficiency, availability, operability, scalability, business goals, customer experience, etc.) Balances against the needs of engineering teams who have to build, maintain and extend features for the life of the technology. Incorporates these requirements into project plans.Demonstrated ability and experience to influence, develop productive working relationships, and lead engineering teams and key stakeholders from different business functions.Strong analytical and communication skills, a risk mitigation mindset, and ability to escalate at appropriate levels of urgency.Strong sense of ownership and willingness to go above and beyond to chase down loose ends that lead to a successful program.Solid understanding of agile product development methodologies, and their application to manage programs effectivelyGood judgement and pattern recognitionCreative problem solving ability.Proactive demeanor with a bias towards action.Bonus points Years of demonstrated experience working in security.Solid understanding of cloud-based applicationsAvid user of Twitch with a passion for the Twitch communityPerks Full benefits, including medical, dental, vision and life401(k) savings plan with a company matchCatered daily lunch and dinners (and hearty breakfasts three times a week)Unlimited snacks and drinksMonthly in-office massagesCorporate gym membershipCommuter benefitsFlexible time off policyWeekly happy hours and opportunity to attend one gaming event or tournamentTop of the line technology to help you build your own workspaceAbout TwitchTwitch is the world’s leading video platform and community for gamers, with more than 100 million visitors per month. We connect gamers from around the world by allowing them to broadcast, watch, and chat with each other. Twitch’s live and on-demand video platform forms the backbone of a distribution network for video game broadcasters including pro players, tournaments, leagues, developers and gaming media organizations. Twitch is leading a revolution in gaming culture, turning gameplay into an immersive video experience. Learn more at http://twitch.tv.We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at Twitch. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Name: Product Manager - Driver Loyalty
Description: At Uber, we ignite opportunity by setting the world in motion. We take on big problems to help drivers, riders, delivery partners, and eaters get moving in more than 600 cities around the world.  We welcome people from all backgrounds who seek the opportunity to help build a future where everyone and everything can move independently. If you have the curiosity, passion, and collaborative spirit, work with us, and let’s move the world forward, together. About the Role As a Product Manager on Driver Loyalty, you will work on critical, complex features that recognize our drivers’ high-quality service and commitment to our platform. The features you define, develop and launch will leverage the massive scale of our global marketplace. They will motivate our drivers to provide excellent service, and help instill a sense of pride, progression & opportunity during their time with us. What You’ll DoDefine a strategy & product roadmap that increases driver retention & engagement by rewarding high-quality service and sustained commitment to our platform.Collaborate with several internal teams - including but not limited to Driver Pricing and Incentives, Driver Preferences, Driver Earnings, Shared Rides, Matching, Airports, Courier, Vehicle Solutions, and Support - to execute & iterate upon your roadmap.Collaborate with designers & engineers to bring your vision to life.Collaborate with data science to develop comprehensive experimentation plans and to understand business impact of your features.Scale your features to international markets, making modifications based on local business needs, market dynamics, & regulations.What You’ll NeedMinimum 4 years of experience as a Product Manager.Strong written and oral communication skills. Demonstrated experience delivering executive-level presentations as well as detailed product requirement documentation.Prior experience collaborating with designers to bring your vision to life.Prior experience collaborating with engineers to build and launch products. Demonstrated ability to understand and tradeoff engineering cost against business goals.Demonstrated analytical ability. SQL competency a plus.About the Team The Driver Loyalty team’s mission is to instill long-term, emotional connection between our driver partners and Uber. We aim to recognize high-quality service and commitment with rewards that are meaningful and motivating. We believe that drivers should have opportunities to progress during their time on our platform. We also believe that drivers are more than people who transport riders from point A to point B - they have unique personal and professional goals, and it is our duty to help them with their endeavors.

Name: Clinical Business Analytics, Senior Manager (CBASM)
Description: SUMMARY: The CBASM is accountable for ensuring high quality clinical financial management (forecasting)and spend analysis activities for a portfolio of studies by partnering with study teams, service providers, and Finance/Accounting. In addition, the CBASM is responsible for the accuracy, transparency and efficiency of clinical program financial modeling, budgeting, variance and forecasting analyses. This position will report into the Senior Director of Outsourcing and Procurement. The core duties and responsibilities of the CBASM include, but are not limited to: ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:Manage and provide clinical financial models to ensure study forecasts align with changes to clinical contract business terms, assumptions, and timelines.Provide monthly clinical trial accruals and payout (invoicing approval and reconciliations).Support the SOX compliance process by capturing the costs and assumptions for each clinical vendor by month and compares against the approved budget.Provide cost analysis of service provider contract budget.Responsible for tracking, collecting, collating, analyzing and interpreting the group’s operational efficiency through metrics and performance to key goals and measures by using relevant systems and information from multiple data sources for internal, competitive, and market dynamics analyses., such as vendor costs, site budgets and grants benchmarking analysis management, etc.Develop and provide various reporting and analytics as required for quarterly management update or as needed including vendor and site budget cost savings reports and tracking metricsAbility to gather data from multiple sources and incorporate to develop Power Point or presentation materialObtain and validate information from appropriate data sources for internal, competitive, and market dynamics analyses.Participate in cross departmental process improvement initiatives such as improving financial reporting of service provider spend, improving communication with key stakeholders and senior management and/or ad hoc initiatives as required.Partnership with Finance and Account Payable.EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE/SKILLS:Education:BS/BA or MS/MA degreed (scientific or healthcare discipline preferred). Persons without a formal degree who have comparable depth and breadth of training and experience and who meet job-specific criteria are eligible for consideration7+ years’ (senior manager)of clinical finance and analytics experience at a sponsor or CROExperience:Expert experience (requirements) using computer applications including Spotfire®, Excel, spreadsheets, PowerPoint,Working knowledge of ICH Good Clinical Practice guidelinesKnowledgeable of clinical development organizations, relevant analytics concepts and methods andExcellent analytical and quantitative, problem solving skills and organizational skillsMust be self-motivated and able to work on problems of moderate scope and complexity where analysis of situations or data requires a review of a variety of factorsFlexible and Name: Group Strategy Manager, Product Strategy
Description: At Uber, we ignite opportunity by setting the world in motion. We take on big problems to help drivers, riders, delivery partners, and eaters get moving in more than 600 cities around the world.  We welcome people from all backgrounds who seek the opportunity to help build a future where everyone and everything can move independently. If you have the curiosity, passion, and collaborative spirit, work with us, and let’s move the world forward, together.  We are a nimble and highly impactful team responsible for shaping product vision and strategy. The team is responsible for pushing our thinking beyond the here and now: Digging into data, uncovering insights, then developing and socializing a viewpoint on where to play and how to win across multiple time horizons  The team reports directly to the Head of Product and works closely with the CTO and tech leadership to prioritize and drive strategic initiatives, and consists of representatives from product management, analytics, and operations. What You’ll NeedBA/BS degree (EE/CS, MBA degree a plus)10+ years of work experience at a management consulting firm, tech investment banking and/or product management or bizops at a fast-growing technology company.Strong expertise in business analytics and strategy, ability to distill immense datasets to drive strategic decisionsA deep understanding of consumer products and the unique challenges of a double-sided marketplaceA consumer product mindset with a near-unreasonable high bar for user experience tradeoffs for business benefitsHigh degree of comfort with C-level communications and problem solvingTechnical depth that enables you to break down technical complexity and drive problems to conclusion with the engineering team.Tenacity and ability to build from scratchGrittiness and comfort with ambiguity

Name: Sr. Analyst, Business Analytics
Description: At Pandora, we're a unique collection of engineers, musicians, designers, marketers, and world-class sellers with a common goal: to enrich lives by delivering effortless personalized music enjoyment and discovery. Peoplethe listeners, the artists, and our employeesare at the center of our mission and everything we do. Actually, employees at Pandora are a lot like the service itself: bright, eclectic, and innovative. Collaboration is the foundation of our workforce, and we're looking for smart individuals who are self-motivated and passionate to join us. Be a part of the engine that creates the soundtrack to life. Discover your future at Pandora!  Pandora is looking for a detail oriented Sr. Analyst, Business Analytics to develop and manage insights/dashboards/forecasts around ad product performance and sales/revenue trends. This individual will work closely with stakeholders across the company (Product, Finance, PYM, and Sales) to interpret findings and identify patterns in the data. We are interested in a self-starter who will own the responsibility of telling a story based on what they find and track down issues/anomalies as they arise. They must have a strong sense of time management and ability to communicate with both technical and non-technical audiences. Key Responsibilities:Point of contact for creating and maintaining dashboards for key stakeholders and Senior LeadershipAbility to interface with various teams to develop contextual analysis around trends & movementsProactively identify opportunities where data collection and analysis can improve business processes and influence decisionsWork closely with various teams to understand data pipelines and track-down issues impacting revenue/inventoryWork closely with stakeholder teams to ensure data classification and definitions of critical KPIs are understood and accurately capturedRequirements:Bachelor's degree, with a successful track record in analytical coursework (Economics, Statistics, Mathematic, etc.)5+ years of work experience in an analytical roleExtensive experience with SQL and database concepts requiredExperience with reporting tools such as PowerPoint & Tableau requiredExperience with Hive and ELT processes preferredExperience with Salesforce.com preferredMastery of Excel requiredExcellent problem solving abilityExceptional attention to detail and ability to plan/pace projectsStrong analytical, communication and documentation skillsExperience with online advertising preferred Pandora is committed to diversity in its workforce. Pandora is an equal employment opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants without regard to gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, race, veteran or disability status. Women and people of color are encouraged to apply.  Pandora is also a VEVRAA federal contractor. Pandora requests priority referrals of protected veterans from each ESDS, as required by regulation.  If you believe you need a reasonable accommodation in order to search for a job opening or to apply for a position, please contact us by sending an email to disability@pandora.com This email box is designed to assist job seekers who require a reasonable accommodation to the application process. A response to your request may take up to two business days.  In your email, please include the following: The specific accommodation requested to complete the employment application.The location or office to which you would like to applyThe subject of the email should read "Request for Reasonable Accommodation".SDL2017

Name: Sales Operations Analyst - Sr.
Description: Reporting to the Sr Manager - Sales Operations, this person is responsible for driving and measuring productivity across our global Restaurant Services organization. Are you passionate about ownership of goals and productivity metrics for customer facing teams? Here you'll have the opportunity to represent about 250 employees. You will also design new and enhance existing critical metrics to motivate the teams and drive core business initiatives across roles. You will also be responsible for measuring the impact of these roles and making recommendations to optimize or expand on our resources. You will work cross-functionally with multiple departments including sales, marketing, operations, finance, product, and IT to align on initiatives and needs. You'll find yourself in an influential contributor role by tapping into our rich data sets and influencing how we build our operations and sales efforts and strategies around the globe. This is a highly visible role, so confidence and clarity in communicating to all audiences is critical. This position is empowered to make recommendations and decisions on ideal practices for internal sales and services teams and the related productivity expectations, processes, training, and metrics associated with them.ResponsibilitiesEnhance and/or develop objective goals for Restaurant Services roles within the organizationInterpret results to make recommendations for changes to the team’s structure, territory, size, and/or priorities.Build a deep understanding of the reality of the Global Restaurant Sales and Services roles and responsibilities that can be used to realistically interpret dataEnable visibility into progress against goals and important metrics throughout against timelinesDeliver results against goals with the close of each month and quarterStay in tune with changing business needs to adjust goals as neededDefine and enhance strategic programs and initiatives that improve productivity and performance globallyFacilitate monthly cadence of deep dives on high-level strategic initiatives across the organization to ensure visibility, focus, and resultsIdentify problems and opportunities and perform root cause analysis/diagnosis leading to significant business impactPresent recommendations to senior teams for strategic decision-making, operational change, and investmentUse quantitative and qualitative analysis to turn raw data into actionable insights, recommendations, dashboards, and reports for the larger sales and operations teams.Work cross functionally with business optimization, marketing, finance, and data analytics teams to collectively work through complex business problems and aid in high-level planningPrepare presentations and clearly communicate findings from initiatives to senior management and to the broader organization.Define metrics and work with our Data Analytics team to automate dashboards that monitor performanceRespond to reporting and analytic needs from management and the fieldLead in-depth productivity analysis across roles in the Sales and Services organizationCommunicate success metrics on a variety of projectsRequirementsVery good at setting goals and maintaining productivity metricsSuccess using complex data to make recommendationSuccess leading interdepartmental relationships and ability to effectively collaborateAdvanced Salesforce.com userStrong verbal and written communication skills; including documenting business processes, and use cases and business requirementsExperience leading cross-functional teamsExcellent business liaison skills. Ability to digest system complexity and articulate to business users in concise and simple language.Experience with project management and prioritization.Minimum of 3-4 years working with a sales organization.Advanced Excel skills required, including proficiency with pivot tables and VLOOKUPSProfessional experience in data analysis and the ability to see beyond the numbers to drive sound decision-makingAbility to be highly productive with minimal oversight from senior managementExperience working in fast-growing, performance-focused environmentsOperational experience in measuring and improving productivity, utilization, scale initiatives etc.Ideally, you'll possess business insight, strong analytical, troubleshooting, problem solving, and project management skills.Ability to synthesize information to see big pictureYou've got amazing people skills; ability to successfully work and partner across multiple functions in an organization.High energy and contagious enthusiasm. Willing to work through tough projects and be a peer leader in order to support growth of the business.College degree requiredWhat’sNext? OpenTable is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer M/F/D/V.  If you're passionate about joining the OpenTable team and believe this is the role for you, please apply via our website at www.OpenTable.com/careers.  #LI-SH1

Name: Senior Analytics Consulting Manager II (Survey Research)
Description: Managerial consulting supports senior leadership by addressing strategic issues, including determining the problem definition and structuring the problem solving approach, generally where no precedent currently exists. Issues span several topics and are not restricted to one functional area. Examples include strategy development, market assessments, policy issues, profitability assessments and major implementations. Issues support senior leadership in the definition and attainment of organizational goals. Consulting Manager II is responsible for a large managerial consulting group or department, including managing its staff and related budgets. Essential Functions: - Leads multiple large-scale strategic management efforts designed to facilitate attainment of key organizational objectives. - Provides leadership and expert consultation on management issues. - Sets the overall direction of the practice to address key organizational issues. - Staffs projects to ensure that teams are composed of individuals with appropriate skills and expertise. - Ensures that client and organizational needs are met consistently. - Collaborates with Consulting Managers to provide support to regional and SA leadership in the pursuit and attainment of organizational goals. - Provides leadership in the development and dissemination of best practices across regional departments. - Establishes effective working relationships with peers both internal and external to KP. - Fosters a customer oriented work environment with emphasis on dedication to helping customers, respect for individuals, highest standards of quality, innovation, empowerment, and teamwork by developing and implementing policies and practices that reflect the vision of Kaiser Permanente. - Manages and develops staff. - Coaches and develops employees according to their strengths; creates a structure that will promote self-directed work. - Manages group, project and/or department budget.

Name: Director, Business Innovation
Description: As a Director, Business Innovation within the Administration Group, you will help lead projects of high strategic significance to the company. Specifically, you will help direct the investigation of new business opportunities for Moody’s Analytics in the US market. These opportunities may involve both organic and acquisition-driven growth. Your role will be to define, conduct, and manage research into potential customers, partners, and competitors for each new business opportunity. You will plan and oversee quantitative and qualitative analyses, ultimately aimed at helping the executive team decide and prioritize which business opportunities should be pursued.  As a senior member of a project team that is assessing a business opportunity, help to define and guide the exploratory work of the team. This will involve planning day-to-day activities, undertaking your own analyses, and verifying the quality of the team’s output. You and your colleagues will be analyzing market dynamics, conducting research, collecting and crunching data, building financial models, and writing up your findings, all as part of making fact-based recommendations to the senior management of Moody’s Analytics about whether or not to pursue the business opportunity. Responsibilities include: Lead group discussions about business opportunities, clarifying assumptions, essential facts, etc., and evaluating the pros and cons of the opportunity.Coordinate hypothesis testing, deciding what data is needed to test ideas, and then guiding the team to source and analyze the relevant data.Meet with clients, partners, acquisition targets, and other experts to gather information, validate hypotheses, and discuss findings. Plan and organize these discussions on behalf of the team.Define and conduct surveys, experiments, and other forms of research that will help clarify whether or not each business opportunity is worthwhile. Assist other Business Analysts in setting up and managing their own experiments.Mentor other Business Analysts and check the quality of their work, giving feedback as required. Help hire and select other Business Analysts to fortify the overall capabilities of the team.Formulate conclusions, and take the lead in preparing interim reports and final presentations. Help articulate recommendations to the executive leadership of Moody’s Analytics.Maintain a broad awareness of the fast moving worlds of data and analytics. Keep up with relevant trends, technologies, and players, and identify topics of interest for the executive leadership of the company.Maintain a broad understanding of Moody’s Analytics’ offerings and capabilities, and then help identify how those offerings and capabilities might apply to new business opportunities.

Name: Paid Marketing Specialist
Description: Job DescriptionPaid Marketing Specialist Overview:• The ideal candidate will have solid experience in performance marketing with cross-channel/integrated digital marketing and revenue generating responsibilities. The candidate will be comfortable with managing and juggling multiple campaigns, audiences, and creatives with the objective of exceeding ROI targets across multiple platforms. You should be analytical and motivated by data and audience insights to support digital marketing plans that help drive both members sign up and engagement with our jobs platform. What we need your help with:In partnership with the marketing manager, orchestrate integration of all paid and owned media channels to ensure optimal results.Direct/oversee integrated marketing campaign execution (working closely with our digital media agency).Consolidate and share weekly and monthly reports. Develop insights and course of action to help improve or scale performance.Help set up a complex test that employs multiple creative and channels.Performs QA of creative, landing page, and web experience. Ensure tracking accuracy.Partner with business analytics team to interpret testing results, and provide recommendations for future testing.Basic Qualifications:BA/BS degree in marketing or related field.4 years or more of digital marketing experience.Demonstrated mastery of multi-channel digital media strategy, A/B and multivariate test design, optimization and ROI.Experience in running performance/digital marketing channels (SEM/Display/Paid Social/Mobile).Preferred Qualifications:Digital agency experience is a plus.Loves to capitalize on new growth opportunities through a structured, curious, and data-driven approachProficiency of digital marketing tools such as Google Analytics, Google Adwords, Apple Search Ads, Facebook Ads manager etc.Understanding of Adwords APIs or at least that they exist and can be leveraged to find scale.Ability to clearly communicate complex workflows, dependencies and tradeoffs in both speech and writing.A sense of humor and/or the ability to have fun.

Name: Senior Data Scientist, Research
Description: Slack's mission is to make people's work lives simpler, more pleasant, and more productive. We do this by incorporating customer insights from Slack Research into all stages of product development, growth strategy, sales and customer success programs.  Slack Research is looking for an experienced data scientist, quantitative researcher, or social scientist with a quantitative background, to join the small but growing Quantitative Research team. This person will be based full-time in San Francisco. Some companies call this role a quantitative researcher, and some call it a data scientist. At Slack, this role lives within the Research team, and all that matters is that you're passionate about leading projects to generate foundational insights that are rigorous, reliable, and have long shelf-life. Your work will be shared throughout the companyincluding product, design, sales, marketing, and leadership.  Slack has a positive, diverse, and supportive cultureif this sounds like a good fit for you, send us a nice hello. What you will be doing The Quantitative Research team strives to answer foundational questions that include: What motivates customer behavior? What drives customer love? How do these impact our business? We measure customer sentiment, model relationships between user behavior and sentiment, and estimate the impact these have on Slack's business.We use whatever analytic strategy, study design, or methods of data collection necessary to generate reliable, comprehensive, and deep insights.Typical studies include, but are not limited to, a combination of experimental design, statistics/modeling (e.g., surveys, behaviors, time series), and NLP.What you should have You have expertise in all aspects of quantitative researchmore specifically, a hybrid of data science as well as quantitative social science. You have 4+* years of relevant industry experience.You have an extensive background in a quantitative or technical field, especially data science or social science.You have experience with statistical analysis software like Python, R, Stata, or SPSS as well as some proficiency in SQL.You have completed graduate-level coursework in statistics-related fields (e.g., survey statistics, econometrics, NLP), experimental design, or quantitative social sciences (e.g., economics, behavioral economics, sociology, social psychology, organizational behavior or management science).You've demonstrated experience collecting and analyzing diverse datasets (e.g., large and small, structured and unstructured, behavioral and self-reported).Your interpersonal skills are exceptionalyou have experience leading projects involving cross-functional teams. This role requires fostering relationships across areas of the business that include Analytics, Business Strategy, Data Engineering, Product, Sales, Growth, and Marketing.You're passionate about setting new standards for quantitative research methods as well as crafting and executing on impact-driven research.You have excellent written and verbal communication skills. You excel at telling stories with data, rather than just reporting on trends and stats. * Through trial and error we've learned that people don't apply unless we provide a guideline. But what's more important to us than a number are the experiences you've had, and the skills you've developed, regardless of the length of time it took you to get where you are. Have 20+ years? Awesome, please apply. Have only 2 years, but feel you meet the requirements above? Great, please apply.

Name: Senior Java Developer
Description: Job DescriptionSenior Java Developer  Staffigo Technical Services is an IT Consulting firm performing industry solutions for clients all over the US. We are currently actively seeking a Senior Java Developer.  As a Senior Java Developer with Spring expertise, you will have the opportunity to design and build software products and features for both internal and external clients. We are a team of innovators, continuously exploring new technologies that ensure remains on the cutting edge of application development. In this position, you will be utilizing Java, Spring Boot, MongoDB, JSON, and SQL daily. Responsibilities Take ownership of stories and drive them to completion through all phases of the entire SDLC.  Work on external facing and internal applications  Lead design of Java and Spring Boot based solutions  Perform development of Java and Spring Boot based solutions  Perform unit and integration testing  Be a quality advocate  Provide mentoring to junior resources  Participate in retrospective reviews  Participate in the estimation process for new work and releases  Maintain and enhance existing applications  Bring new perspectives to problems  Be driven to improve yourself and the way things are done Requirements Bachelors degree (Masters degree desired) typically in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Mathematics, Business Analytics or another technically strong program. Name: Senior Data Engineer
Description: Upwork is the world's largest freelancing website. Each year $1.5 billion of work happens through Upwork, allowing businesses to get more done and helping professionals break free of traditional time and place boundaries and work anytime, anywhere on projects they love. At Upwork, you'll help build on this momentum. Together, we'll create economic and social value on a global scale, providing a trusted online workplace for businesses to connect with extraordinary talent and work without limits.Our Data Management team is tasked with building and supporting the business analytics infrastructure at Upwork that analysts and partners use on a daily basis to make critical business decisions. We are looking for a passionate engineer who has a love of data and analytics to empower our Sales, Marketing, and Enterprise teams in leveraging data to drive and measure impact. In this role, you will own the end-to-end analytics solution partnering with data infrastructure product and engineering to develop and operate the complete solution. You will have an instrumental role in ensuring that our analysts, business partners, and executive team have consistent and reliable data and insights at their fingertips.Your Responsibilities:Own the entire end-to-end execution from requirements gathering from key stakeholders to building scalable, efficient, and reliable data marts which provide our business partners with clarity into the complexities of our platformCreate maintainable, scalable data processing pipelines in PostgresSQL, Python, and other data processing language in the data platform running in AWSDefine, develop, and operate functional data marts/cubes with common open source and SaaS based data processing and management tools like embulk, airflow, rundeck, Spark, Informatica, etc.Partner with cross-functional engineering peers as you take ownership of the entire analytics lifecycle including instrumentation, logging, data modeling, data warehousing, data delivery and dashboardingProvide guidance on development and implementation of data quality rules and validation processes, leading initiatives to improve data quality and issue resolutionPartner with Sales and Enterprise teams in defining and executing their analytics and reporting roadmapFunction as the subject area expert in Sales and Enterprise data domain maintaining business specific metadata and data integration contracts with 3rd party vendors as well as internal data ownersWhat it takes to catch our eye:8+ years combined experience in database application development, data management and governance in medium and large size companiesExperience with marketplace businesses, especially as it pertains to working with large datasets inherent to two-sided marketplacesA proven record of taking large data projects from ideation to implementationExpert in writing advanced SQL and performance tuning others SQLExpert in designing, implementing, and operating efficient, scalable, and reliable data transformation pipelinesStrong analytical skills; ability to collect, organize, and analyze informationSolid experience in database modeling, architecture, design, and implementationFamiliar with sales process, sales commission attribution methodologies, and Salesforce.com application and data architectureFluent in data visualization techniques with tools such as Looker, Domo, or similarAble to influence, lead, and communicate effectively across engineering teams, business units and other partners to negotiate priority, scope, and design solutionExcellent oral, written, and presentation skills, including the ability to work in person, virtually, and in a globally-staffed environmentFluent and effective in working with a global distributed teamDemonstrate strong understanding of development processes and agile methodologiesCome change how the world works.At Upwork youll help shape the future of work. From our offices in San Francisco, Mountain View and Chicago, together were creating exciting new opportunities for a world of professionals. Youll be part of a vibrant culture built on shared values: Inspire a boundless future of work, Put our community first, Have a bias towards action, and Build amazing teams. Along the way youll have fun and enjoy the perks of a people-first company: Work from Home Wednesday's, daily breakfast and lunch, regular in-office happy hours, top-notch benefits and more. Check out Upworks spotlight on The Muse for a glimpse of our daily work/life balance.Upwork is proudly committed to recruiting and retaining a diverse and inclusive workforce. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we never discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical condition), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.
