Name: Market Planner - Canada Outlet
Description: Forget what you know about old-school industry rules. When you work at Old Navy, youre choosing a different path. From day one, weve been on a mission to democratize fashion and make shopping fun again. Our teams make style accessible to everyone, creating high-quality, must-have fashion essentials for the whole family, with love, season after season. We opened our first store in 1994 in San Francisco and have been on a roll ever since. Today, customers can find fabulous fashion at affordable prices online and in one of our 1,000+ stores globally. Old Navy celebrates a workplace thats just as diverse as our customers. Fun, fashion, family and value are at the heart of everything we do. We cultivate a community of playful personalities that thrive in a fast-paced environment where our employees can be their most authentic selves. Here, were family. Old Navy a brand for everyone a place for you!The Market Planner creates and manages sales and inventory plans from investment through allocation at the product/category/item level for the Outlet (ONO) channel within the Old Navy Canada market. The Market Planner is responsible for ensuring that the development and management of assortment, demand and inventory plans achieve divisional financial goals.Responsibilities span across business analytics, pricing strategy, assortment + investment planning, and store communications. The role stretches from daily business management and reporting of financials, to identifying, driving and recapping key deviations specific to the Canada ONO business. Key Roles and Responsibilities: Financial Planning - Forecasting Develop and build department & class level plans that support division strategyDevelop and build pre-season style plans and recommend investment quantities and accurate flow forecastsManage the reconciliation of class-to-department bottoms-up plansDevelop and build department/class level allocation strategiesCreate and execute sizing and packing strategies that support department and divisional objectivesResponsible for open-to-buy activities at department/class level Plan Management - Allocation Manage inventory plans from investment through allocation execution, including ongoing assessments and updatesEnsure receipt accuracy to support in-season allocation strategiesOwn and approve initial inventory releasesForecast in-season sales and inventory and develop strategies to maximize opportunities and mitigate riskManage the reconciliation of class-to-department bottoms-up plansStrategize, recommend and execute in-season pricing strategiesAccountable for campaign margin roll up specific to ONO, and its impact on total marketOwn in-season management of ONO exclusive product promotion cadence, sales forecasting, and markdown strategy Product/Assortment: Identify exclusive ONO assortment needs - collaborate with key stakeholders to drive divisional strategies unique to ONO stores, gain alignment and ensure budget expectations are met.Drive assortment + investment planning for ONO exclusive product.Influence allocation strategies to fuel ONO business strategies partner with store planning and Canada allocation analyst for proper execution. Business Process Management - Supply Chain Operations Develop monthly forecasts of sales and inventory for Basics managed through demand forecasting and vendor management tools, as required People Management (if applicable) Manage an Inventory Analyst by creating a collaborative, innovative and results-orientated environmentSupport the career development and skill development of Inventory Analyst to ensure job satisfaction, retention and future talent development Support HQ and Field Partnership Clear communication with key business partners of upcoming events, strategies and nuances from Canada Specialty stores.Facilitate weekly calls with field leaders recapping divisional wins, opportunities and identifying action items.Develops, executes and distributes weekly promotional signage and expectations to field.Skills Required:Analytic Skills: Ability  to think objectively and interpret meaningful themes from quantitative and  qualitative dataProblem Solving & Decision  Quality: Able to use rigorous logic and methods to solve problems  with effective solutionsCollaboration: Able to  build constructive and effective relationships with a broad and diverse  group of business partnersInfluencing &  Negotiation: Can present ideas and directions that lead others to  actionPresentation Skills:  Effective in a variety of presentation settings including one-on-one,  small and large groups, and with peers and leadership.Financial and Business  Acumen: Ability to evaluate financial and business indicators and  translate data into actionable information to drive results; proficiency  in retail mathSystems and Tools Acumen:  Expertise in Excel Advanced skill level (ability to create pivot tables,  build macros, write complex formulas), and have aptitude to learn  technical applications quicklyProcess Management: Able  to create and organize work and processes to get things done in the most  efficient mannerPossess strong organizational  and time management skillsDemonstrate strong listening,  written and oral communication skillsQualifications:Bachelor's degree or equivalent  experience3-5 years of retail experienceSelf-motivated and works well independentlyThrives in ambiguous and ever-changing environmentsEntrepreneurial SpiritAbility to  travel internationallyKEY BENEFITS:Merchandise discount for our brands: 50% off regular-priced merchandise at Employer, Banana Republic and Old Navy, 30% off at Outlet and 25% off at Athleta.One of the most competitive Paid Time Off plans in the industry.*Employees can take up to five on the clock hours each month to volunteer at a charity of their choice.*Extensive 401(k) plan with company matching for contributions up to four percent of an employees base pay.*Employee stock purchase plan.*Employees receive medical, dental, vision and life insurance.*Employees can apply for tuition reimbursement.*Family care programs.Commuter benefits.Pet Discount Program. *For eligible employeesEmployer Inc. is an equal-opportunity employer and is committed to providing a workplace free from harassment and discrimination. We are committed to recruiting, hiring, training and promoting qualified people of all backgrounds, and make all employment decisions without regard to any protected status. In 2016, Employer Inc. was named one of the Best Places to Work by the Human Rights Campaign for the thirteenth consecutive year and was the sole winner of the Catalyst award for equality in the workplace in 2016.

Name: Senior Manager, FP&A
Description: What sets Bank of the West apart from other banks is our team membersthey embody the optimistic spirit of the West. There is a spirit here that drives us to do more. Our team of more than 10,000 employees is vital to the success of our Bank. They reflect our modern western valuesstraightforward, entrepreneurial and optimistic. We seek to create a corporate culture that fosters and rewards excellence, encourages creative thinking and respects diversity an environment where team members are engaged, supportive of one another and enthusiastic about serving our customers. Bank of the West offers the stability of a company that has a 135 year history and is part of BNP Paribas, a European leader in global banking and financial services and one of the 6 strongest banks in the world. We offer opportunities across our diverse business lines Retail Banking, Commercial Banking, National Finance, and Wealth Management.  Job Description Summary Responsible for a body of work with the objective to analyze, report and improve the Equipment Finance Division (CBG) financial planning and reporting function. Directs budget/forecast processes and regular and ad hoc analytical activities within the group with the objective of providing insightful and actionable analysis to identify opportunities to improve Bank process, efficiency, profitability, and productivity. Responsible for management reporting to internal consumers as well as b BNP Paribas Leasing Solutions (parent company), Claas Financial Services LLC 's Board and BNP Paribas Leasing Solutions Canada's Management. Shapes the bank's profitabilty reporting views, with oversight on RONE, Segment Reporting, and Revenue/Expense/Capital allocations methodology reviews. Ensures meaningful and relevant information while guaranteeing data integrity and accuracy. Drives the Financial feedback loop taking into consideration actuals, planning, reporting, analysis and improved assumptions for executive management decision making.  Essential Job Functions Drives the budget and forecast Process, including timing, deliverables, presentation content and target setting with senior management. Coordinates with systems and technology teams to drive planning system enhancements. Provides strategic insight in the review of the Banks performance, including the performance of individual business lines and divisions that are incorporated into the review of monthly results. Works with business lines to understand their Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and to incorporate those drivers into the profitability analysis of the Bank. Creates strategic analysis of business line/unit profitability that allows for senior management to make strategic decisions regarding the allocation of resources to the business activity. Develops analytics regarding the Banks transfer pricing gap which includes monitoring the changes in the transfer pricing gap over time to assess the reasonableness of its change over time. Improves the existing BNP reporting process to ensure that results reported are accurately produced within requisite deadlines, utilize new information systems capabilities (Hyperion), are managed in a controlled process, etc. Liaise with parent company BNP Paribas, Bank of the West business lines and Corporate Finance to manage changes to reports and requests. Ensures that changes to reports/requests that become standardized are integrated into the controlled pro Other Job Duties Collaborates with business partners and senior management to improve their understanding and integration of allocations and profitability data into executive review and analytical process. Effectively communicates any potential risks of meeting budget/forecast reporting deliverable and deadlines to senior management. Liaise with the business, development team and technology on an ongoing basis to enhance the efficiency, accuracy and control over the report production process. Coordinates administrative and HR responsibilities for the team. Provides coaching, guidance and support, by setting professional development plans to assist employees to reach their full potential. Performs other duties as assigned. Required Experience Requires broad management knowledge to lead project teams in one department. Typically has mastery level knowledge and skills within a specific technical or professional discipline with broad understanding of other areas within the job function. Requires 12 years minimum prior relevant experience. Education Bachelor's Degree Finance, Accounting or Equivalent - Required MBA Degree Finance, Accounting or Equivalent - Preferred Skills Significant knowledge of Budgeting/ Forecasting Processes. Experience managing a financial reporting function and should have excellent skills in creating controlled production processes, which create efficient, accurate and reliable reporting on a consistent basis. Deep understanding of the implications of allocations, including revenues, expenses and capital Product profitability and/or segment reporting experience Strong experience in report writing, business requirement proposals, client interaction, and methodology documentation. Solid organizational skills, with the ability to handle complex projects in a multi-tasking environment and meet deadlines with quality results. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills coupled with thoroughness and attention to detail. Track record of improving processes for accuracy, repeatability and control. Excellent Customer Service Skills to build strong relationships with business lines. Strong written and verbal communication skills. Ability to lead a team of managers and financial analysts. Experience with Hyperion (v9) including Smartview, Essbase, and Financial Reports. Equal Employment Opportunity Policy

Name: Pricing Strategist
Description: About Us At Cloudflare, we have our eyes set on an ambitious goal: to help build a better Internet. Today, Cloudflare runs one of the world's largest distributed networks that powers more than 10 trillion requests per month, which is nearly 10 percent of all Internet requests worldwide. Cloudflare protects and accelerates any Internet application online without adding hardware, installing software, or changing a line of code.  Our customers range from Fortune 500 companies and nonprofits to small businesses and budding entrepreneurs. We are working to create a faster, more secure, and more reliable experience for anyone online and given the scale at which we operate, our mission is big. Our team is hard at work shaping the future of the Internet by solving some of its toughest challenges.  We realize people do not fit into neat boxes. We are looking for curious and empathetic individuals who are committed to developing themselves and learning new skills, and we are ready to help you do that. We cannot complete our mission without building a diverse and inclusive team. We hire the best people based on an evaluation of their potential and support them throughout their time at Cloudflare. Come join us! What you'll doDevelop, implement, and scale global pricing strategies to capitalize on market opportunities and achieve business objectives.Assist to ensure effective implementation of pricing strategies by identifying appropriate resources, testing all new pricing models, and leading cross-functional teams.Identify metrics to determine performance of pricing changes.Assist by conducting pricing research using techniques including conjoint analysis and Van Westendorp analysis to inform pricing strategy recommendations.Model financial implications of pricing changes to current and forecasted revenue.Use strong communication skills (verbal and written) to discuss models with financial planning and analysis team and sales team to ensure alignment with their models/plans.Assist in developing metrics to track and monitor pricing and discounting performance.Build dashboard to assess pricing trends and monitor sales performance using tools (including Tableau, Microsoft Excel, and Google Sheets).Assist in identifying new business and growth opportunities to create incremental growth, including new pricing models, pricing promotions, and go to market approaches.Improve sales process by streamlining discount approval process while balancing need to maintain financial performance by analyzing historical pricing and discounting data.Develop an understanding of customers' lifetime value by analyzing revenue and churn for various customer segments.Analyze customer data to identify attributes to categorize customers into segments.Examples of desirable skills, knowledge and experienceMaster's degree or U.S. equivalent in Business Administration, Mathematics, Statistics, Marketing, Business Analytics, or related field,plus 2 years of professional experience in developing financial models involving sales and pricing data.Must also have the following: 2 years of professional experience in marketing and pricing for SaaS products including performing and interpreting quantitative research of pricing strategies and research of pricing strategies1 year of professional experience in performing marketing research with financial modeling in the technology industry;1 year of professional experience in developing and testing pricing strategies for products or services in the technology industry;1 year of professional experience in developing, monitoring, and analyzing the performance of pricing models in the technology industry;1 year of professional experience in using business intelligence and analytics software (including Tableau)What Makes Cloudflare Special? We're not just a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company. We're a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company with a soul. Fundamental to our mission to help build a better Internet is protecting the free and open Internet. Project Galileo: We equip politically and artistically important organizations and journalists with powerful tools to defend themselves against attacks that would otherwise censor their work, technology already used by Cloudflare's enterprise customers--at no cost. Project Athenian: We created Athenian Project to ensure that state and local governments have the highest level of protection and reliability for free, so that their constituents have access to election information and voter registration. Path Forward Partnership: Since 2016, we have partnered with Path Forward, a nonprofit organization, to create 16-week positions for mid-career professionals who want to get back to the workplace after taking time off to care for a child, parent, or loved one. 1.1.1.1: We released 1.1.1.1 to help fix the foundation of the Internet by building a faster, more secure and privacy-centric public DNS resolver. This is available publicly for everyone to use - it is the first consumer-focused service Cloudflare has ever released. Here's the deal - we don't store client IP addresses never, ever. We will continue to abide by our privacy policy and ensure that no user data is sold to advertisers or used to target consumers.  Sound like something you'd like to be a part of? We'd love to hear from you!  Cloudflare is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity for all people and place great value in both diversity and inclusiveness. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to their, or any other person's, perceived or actual race, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, family care status, or any other basis protected by law. We are an AA/Veterans/Disabled Employer.  Cloudflare provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities. Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job. Examples of reasonable accommodations include, but are not limited to, changing the application process, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment. If you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job, please contact us via e-mail at hr@cloudflare.com or via mail at 101 Townsend St. San Francisco, CA 94115.

Manages accounts including the entire sales process from business development prospecting and specifications through contract negotiations, signing, and post-sales support. Name: Data Scientist
Description: Rally Health is seeking a Data Scientist to work closely with our product teams to improve our products and grow our business through analytics and development of data strategies.  Rally products inform users about their healthcare options and help to engage them in their own healthcare. In this role, the Data Scientist will work with product teams to investigate user behavior and develop data strategies (e.g., personalized recommendations) to improve product performance and ultimately health outcomes. This involves leveraging data to measure and improve our offerings through metric development and instrumentation, data investigations, designing and interpreting experiments, exploratory research, and impact evaluation.  We are able to bring together a rich set of relevant data to do this work including lifestyle and health status information from our health assessment survey; engagement and activity data from our Wellness product; intent data from our provider search product; and direct health information including biometrics and medical and pharmaceutical claims. The Data Scientist will work in close coordination with the product team, applying this data to generate insights and develop data strategies that help our products evolve to better serve our customers and users. Skills:Ability to proactively identify opportunities and solve challenging business problems with a variety of data tools in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.Ability to use predictive analytics and classical modeling techniques for statistical inference and creation of data insights.Ability to work in a variety of data environments, e.g., Hadoop HDFS, SQL, Mongo, etc.Experience in SQL and some scripting language (Python, R, etc.)Focus on quality and process to ensure the integrity of our analytic outputExperience:Graduate of Data Science program or technical analytical experience using data science toolsExperience driving analytic projects and investigations to produce measurable results.Familiarity with data-driven product development (A/B testing, time series analysis, propensity modeling, etc.); you tailor your approach to the problem rather than trying to apply the same techniques everywhere.Familiarity solving business challenges with data using scripting languages (such as Python or R) and SQLNice to Have:Healthcare or wellness specific business knowledge and/or experience with behavioral and claims dataExperience using ML to solve business problemsExperience in a big data environments, like Hadoop or SparkAdvanced (post-baccalaureate) degree in a quantitative field

Name: Sr Manager - Digital & Media
Description: Since the beginning, weve been inspired by everything women and girls are capable of, whether theyre serious athletes or just getting into fitness. We create versatile premium performance apparel designed for a life in motion. Challenge fuels us and we are always reaching for the amazing.  Were looking for people who find inspiration in the same things we do: the limitless potential of women and girls everywhere. If you share our passion for a healthy, active lifestyle, personal growth, innovative product and creating rewarding experiences join our community. Athleta is a certified B Corp put simply we put people and planet right up there with profit and were committed to using business as a force for good.  Alone we are strong, united we thrive. Together, we create the Power of She.Athleta is creating a new breed of premium, authentically active and fashion-fueled apparel for a life in motion. Our mission is to ignite a community of active, healthy confident girls who empower each other to realize their limitless potential.We're looking for people who find inspiration in the same things we do. Like community. Participation. Empowering others. Working as a team. Never forgetting that work isn't work without a little play - and, of course, being a part of something bigger. At Athleta were always reaching for amazing - and that challenge is what fuels us!Power of SheSUMMARYA critical team member of the Athleta Digital Marketing team, the Senior Manager of Digital Marketing and Media is responsible for driving Athletas digital and media strategy and execution. Name: Director of Business Strategy & Development
Description: Job DescriptionOur client, a healthcare company, is looking for entrepreneurial Director of Business Strategy & Development with a background in early-stage healthcare, pharma, or medical device companies. The Business Strategy & Development Lead is responsible for the development of our client's business strategy, revenue and reimbursement model and the cultivation of key strategic partnerships that position the company for growth.Responsibilities: Help develop and execute our client's business development and growth strategyWork with our client's leaders to craft and execute launchEstablish key partnerships with academic researchers, CROs, pharmaceutical companies, and insurersBuild the pharma + CRO sales pipelineWork with regulatory and insurance groups to gain industry adoptionDevelop pricing models and reimbursement strategies for our client's servicesEstimate our client's revenue projections for key disease and service areasGuide the development of BD and marketing materials to achieve business goalsWork with product team to integrate key customer needs and revenue-generating servicesHelp our client to establish a competitive positioningRequirements5+ years proven success in role with direct, relevant experience in consultative sales (pharma, healthcare, medical devices, CROs, etc.) and in the development of academic research collaborationsStrong analytical, business development, product and finance backgroundDemonstrated ability to maintain and grow senior-level customer relationshipsSuccessful launch of a commercial productExperience in pharmaceutical and healthcare salesDemonstrated overachievement against aggressive goals set in previous positionsMBA is a plus

Name: Senior Cybersecurity Analyst
Description: Visa Inc. is a global payments technology company that connects consumers, businesses, financial institutions and governments in more than 200 countries and territories, enabling them to use digital currency instead of cash and checks.  Visa does not issue cards, extend credit or set rates and fees for consumers. Visa's innovations enable its bank customers to offer consumers choices: Pay now with debit, ahead of time with prepaid or later with credit products. From the world's major cities to remote areas without banks, people are increasingly relying on digital currency along with mobile technology to use their money anytime, make purchases online, transfer funds and access basic financial services. All of which makes their lives easier and helps grow economies.  Behind the Visa brand are more than 14,000 talented employees who continuously raise the bar with innovative solutions and products that deliver the convenience and security of digital currency to more people all over the world. The position will specialize in providing end to end IAM lifecycle from HR driven processes (Joiner, Mover, Leaver, Conversion, User Access Revalidation); andProviding role based access governance and IAM processes for high and critical applications at Visa, including enrolling applications to IAM servicesApplication enrolment to IAM services and role based access governance, i.e. manage role lifecycle management processes, incl. role modelling and engineeringAct as the Subject Matter Expertise (SME) in all aspects of Identity and Access management life-cycle especially on processes for Joiner, Mover, Leaver, Conversion, User Access Revalidation to IAM compliance issues and role engineeringIdentify process automation opportunities on existing access management practicesParticipate activities in Access Management to provide access management business requirements and insure compliance with industry and company security standardsComplete access request processing as per pre-defined sets of procedure and within agreed Service Level Agreements (SLA), resolve problem tickets and assist other security analysts as neededDocument access management procedures for assigned applications and/or platforms; keep the access management procedures up-to-dateProactively identify audit and compliance access related issues to reduce the risk of security exposures on the support systems and applications operational efficiency and works with various teams to implement the improvementsProvide guidance and direction on access controls and IAM practices to customerAnalyze and improve existing solutions, streamline processes and recommend upgrades to Application Access Management services to improve end user experience and productivityDay-to-day access management activities for high/critical applications and systems, including on-call support for a 24X7 operation for any Access Management Security issuePartner with clients and stakeholders to grow or deliver new capabilities/solutions       Visa’s Access Management team is looking for a talented and motivated individual with strong technical skills and the ability to rapidly learn new technologies. We are looking for an exceptional candidate that shares our passion for delivering solutions to complex security problems, while maximizing productivity and minimizing employee friction. Up to 5 years CyberSecurity experience and relevant Access Management experienceCISSP and other comparative CyberSecurity certifications are preferredBachelor's degree in engineering, computer science or a related field is requiredProven application access management and role based access governance expertise with demonstrated ability in the following areas: Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyse, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracyStrong knowledge of and experience with business intelligence and analytics packages (Tableau, etc.), databases (SQL, etc.), scripting (PowerShell, VBScript, JavaScript) and programming (C#, Java, ETL frameworks)Identity and Access Management end-to-end lifecycle, from HR driven processes (Joiner, Mover, Leaver, Conversion, User Access Recertification) to IAM complianceApplication and entitlement schema analysis, data and business process analysis, requirement gathering and documentationMicrosoft Active Directory and associated components (LDAP/Kerberos)At least one IDM Platform (Oracle Identity Manager, Sailpoint, etc.)At least one Privileged Access Management Platform (Xceedium, Lieberman, Thycotic, CyberArk, etc.) All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. Visa will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of Article 49 of the San Francisco Police Code.

Name: Product Analyst
Description: OverviewAt Segment, we believe companies should be able to send their data wherever they want, whenever they want, with no fuss. Unfortunately, most product managers, analysts, and marketers spend too much time searching for the data they need, while engineers are stuck integrating the tools they want to use. Segment standardizes and streamlines data infrastructure with a single platform that collects, unifies, and sends data to hundreds of business tools with the flip of a switch. That way, our customers can focus on building amazing products and personalized messages for their customers, letting us take care of the complexities of processing their customer data reliably at scale. We're in the running to power the entire customer data ecosystem, and we need the best people to take the market.Segment is a data company, so it's critically important that we make important decisions in data-driven ways. We're opening a new Product Analyst role that will act as a thought partner to our Product and Engineering teams. This is a high-impact role in which your business expertise, analytical rigor and interpretation of results will materially influence Segment's product road map.We're looking for a talented and creative analytics practitioner to help supercharge Segment's Product Management efforts. Your mandate will be to drive better and faster Product and Engineering decisions. You will be a part of the larger analytics team, and will be embedded in the Product and Engineering team. This is not the kind of data analysis role that focuses solely on inbound "build a dashboard" requests - your success in this role will be based on the quality of decisions made with your help, and the resulting product outcomes. What you'll do:Affect Segment's Product road-map by driving objective, data-based decision making in goal setting and initiatives prioritization, design and success evaluationPropose what to build next. Use insights about customer behaviors and long-term trends to identify new levers to help move key metricsDesign and evaluate experiments, understand root causes of changes in metricsDefine key product metrics and leading indicators, develop tools and dashboards to make these metrics reliable, useful and used by the broader PM organizationBe the expert on relevant data sources to answer particular sets of questions, ensuring data integrity. Independently and creatively define and procure relevant information sources that may not be immediately available. Build key data sets to empower operational and exploratory analysis You're a great fit if youYou have 5+ years of experience in analytics or comparable role at a growth stage startup AND/OR PhD in a quantitative fieldYou are a master of analytical and structured thinkingYou are an expert at telling stories with data, and you convey quantitative results clearlyYou have proven success in effective two-way communication with stakeholders and influencing decisionsYou are an expert at SQL and data visualization tools (Tableau)This role requires beingfull-time in our San Francisco officeSegment is an equal opportunity employer. We believe that everyone should receive equal consideration and treatment. Recruitment, hiring, placements, transfers, and promotions will happen based on qualifications for the positions being filled regardless of sex, gender identity, race, religious creed, color, national origin ancestry, age, physical disability, pregnancy, mental disability, or medical condition.

Name: Paid Marketing Specialist
Description: Job DescriptionPaid Marketing Specialist Overview:• The ideal candidate will have solid experience in performance marketing with cross-channel/integrated digital marketing and revenue generating responsibilities. The candidate will be comfortable with managing and juggling multiple campaigns, audiences, and creatives with the objective of exceeding ROI targets across multiple platforms. You should be analytical and motivated by data and audience insights to support digital marketing plans that help drive both members sign up and engagement with our jobs platform. What we need your help with:In partnership with the marketing manager, orchestrate integration of all paid and owned media channels to ensure optimal results.Direct/oversee integrated marketing campaign execution (working closely with our digital media agency).Consolidate and share weekly and monthly reports. Develop insights and course of action to help improve or scale performance.Help set up a complex test that employs multiple creative and channels.Performs QA of creative, landing page, and web experience. Ensure tracking accuracy.Partner with business analytics team to interpret testing results, and provide recommendations for future testing.Basic Qualifications:BA/BS degree in marketing or related field.4 years or more of digital marketing experience.Demonstrated mastery of multi-channel digital media strategy, A/B and multivariate test design, optimization and ROI.Experience in running performance/digital marketing channels (SEM/Display/Paid Social/Mobile).Preferred Qualifications:Digital agency experience is a plus.Loves to capitalize on new growth opportunities through a structured, curious, and data-driven approachProficiency of digital marketing tools such as Google Analytics, Google Adwords, Apple Search Ads, Facebook Ads manager etc.Understanding of Adwords APIs or at least that they exist and can be leveraged to find scale.Ability to clearly communicate complex workflows, dependencies and tradeoffs in both speech and writing.A sense of humor and/or the ability to have fun.

Name: Senior Analyst - Data Insights & Analytics
Description: Forget what you know about old-school industry rules. When you work at Old Navy, youre choosing a different path. From day one, weve been on a mission to democratize fashion and make shopping fun again. Our teams make style accessible to everyone, creating high-quality, must-have fashion essentials for the whole family, with love, season after season. We opened our first store in 1994 in San Francisco and have been on a roll ever since. Today, customers can find fabulous fashion at affordable prices online and in one of our 1,000+ stores globally. Old Navy celebrates a workplace thats just as diverse as our customers. Fun, fashion, family and value are at the heart of everything we do. We cultivate a community of playful personalities that thrive in a fast-paced environment where our employees can be their most authentic selves. Here, were family. Old Navy a brand for everyone a place for you!Job Summary: The Product Strategy & Operations team is responsible for enabling our product teams to achieve high performance and bring product strategies to life by providing product insights at the right time, creating clear growth strategies tied to long range plans and building best in class processes. This role will drive analytics to provide insights on our products and growth strategies. They will own training and ad-hoc analysis projects for our product teams and rollout the introduction of any new external data sources or vendors.Competencies:Learning AgilityDrives ResultsResourcefulnessCollaboration & InfluencingKey Responsibilities:Primary point of contact for Product Teams with regards to data analysis - - for questions, training, ad-hoc analysis for external data sources that the PS&O team managesPartner with Merchandising teams on ad-hoc Market share requests as neededManage rollout of any new external data sources or vendors that Old Navy engages withDrive dashboard development and rollout of new analytics serviceManage data delivery and analysis coming from analytics vendor and work with Company Planning on ongoing integration in Commercial Planning processManage data delivery for Divisional Strategy Managers and ensure standardization of informationAssemble pre-season fact packs from multiple data sources and publish to the businessQualifications:Analytical/Problem Solving SkillsMinimum 3 years experience demonstrating analytical, research and problem solving skillsDetail oriented; able to execute with efficiency and accuracyTechnology savvy able to learn new software quicklyExposure to:Research sources, techniques, and presentationIndustry and competitive analysis, modeling, and financial analysisBusiness strategy developmentCommunication & Interpersonal SkillsGood communication skills: written and oralStrong interpersonal skills and professional presence: work well as part of a cross-functional teamProject managementStrong organizational and time management skillsStrong attention to detailProficient in Microsoft Excel, PowerBI (preferable) and PowerPointCreativityAbility to generate innovative insights from analysis to drive actionable resultsAble to work in and bring structure to ambiguous environmentsLeadershipInitiative and ability to work independentlyComfort in fast paced, dynamic, matrixed work environmentExperienceBA/BS degree required1-2 years of work experience, preferably within retail industry, management consulting, consumer products, and/or investment bankingInterest/knowledge of retail industryKEY BENEFITS:Merchandise discount for our brands: 50% off regular-priced merchandise at Employer, Banana Republic and Old Navy, 30% off at Outlet and 25% off at Athleta.One of the most competitive Paid Time Off plans in the industry.*Employees can take up to five on the clock hours each month to volunteer at a charity of their choice.*Extensive 401(k) plan with company matching for contributions up to four percent of an employees base pay.*Employee stock purchase plan.*Employees receive medical, dental, vision and life insurance.*Employees can apply for tuition reimbursement.*Family care programs.Commuter benefits.Pet Discount Program. *For eligible employeesEmployer Inc. is an equal-opportunity employer and is committed to providing a workplace free from harassment and discrimination. Name: Vice President of Engineering
Description: Are you a software engineer and established global team leader who is passionate about using AI to measurably end poverty? Samasource fuels AI for humanity. We use machine learning to solve the R&D challenges of our clients, and in doing so, create meaningful social impact via job creation in East Africa. Samasource serves Fortune 500 customers including Microsoft and Google, as well as several leading AI start-ups, and is a large-scale provider of training data strategy and annotation services in the computer vision space. Several of the world's most-used technology products, from facial recognition software to autonomous vehicles, rely on massive volumes of Samasource's ground truth training data.  Some of the projects we tackle: Conserve wildlife and stop the illicit ivory trade using algorithms to automatically detect poaching behavior via satellite and drone imageryBring self-driving cars to reality, saving millions of livesDramatically reduce the cost of detecting disease via image recognition We're looking for a dynamic AI/ML software engineering team leader who can grow our 12-person team to 20-30 engineers, partnering with our global executive team to develop our long-term technology vision. Location - Remote or from a Samasource office. We have offices in San Francisco, New York, and the Hague, with delivery operations in Kenya and Uganda and fantastic remote talent across the globe. We're looking for a brilliant VP Engineering hire with mission, business and role alignment and we're open to that person working remote with travel as needed to collaborate with team members and clients. The Samasource Engineering Leadership Opportunity Samasource is looking for an experienced senior engineering leader with a background in distributed web application development and machine learning to lead our technology team and develop our AI vision.  With over 40% YoY growth, were looking for a hands-on leader to grow our Engineering Team by 150% in 2019. The right candidate will be: Goal-oriented and motivated to continue our current growth rate, increasing our annual revenues by 5X over the next 5 years.Entrepreneurially-minded: Youll need to lead and grow our 12-person, globally distributed engineering team to 20-30 engineers across several pods including: Our core training data annotation platformA new team working on AI/ML algorithm developmentData warehousing & reportingEnterprise applications for workforce managementMission-driven: The guiding light driving our talented team of social entrepreneurs, technologists, and BPO industry experts is the conviction that giving work in the digital economy is the most powerful solution to ending global poverty.Established as a leader: We seek an Engineering leader with proven experience managing and scaling teams of over 20 engineers to deliver enterprise software. Our annotation platform is built in Ruby on Rails, Javascript and Angular. We have an expanding data warehouse for business analytics, and our client data management process accommodates a rich menu of transformations, conversions, and preprocessing pipelines. As a rule, we prioritize getting stuff done over perfectionism and tenacity over technical brilliance. Were looking for somebody who has successfully built engineering teams and taken products to market. Roles and ResponsibilitiesResponsible for Samasources engineering growth roadmap and vision across our web properties and backend work distribution platformWorks with management to set engineering priorities and resource needsCollaborates closely with Product Management to set short-term development goals and pursue long-term engineering innovationAggressively builds and grows a team of talented engineers to achieve our companys visionStrongly communicates engineering goals, priorities and execution plans to the Samasource board, management, and staffWrites elegant, high-quality, unit-tested code (Be prepared to send in samples of your work!)Requirements Professional Attributes 10+ years of engineering experience with at least 3 years of experience in a leadership roleRecent experience successfully translating company vision into concrete, measurable engineering deliverables and leading a team of at least 10 direct-report software engineersExtensive background in delivering high-availability web applications on cloud-hosted infrastructureAcademic or professional experience building and improving machine learning algorithms and familiarity with ML frameworks such as PyTorch, Tensorflow, or KerasSuccessfully builds and manages remote teams of engineers across time zonesPython and Ruby app development and data processing experienceStrong relational database experience including performance tuningStrong understanding of Javascript/Typescript and a client-side framework such as AngularComfortable in a Linux environment and with devops on Heroku and AWSExperience with data processing pipelines such as Spark, EMR, and BI toolsStrong working knowledge of unit testing frameworksLightweight approach to project management/planning (paint the picture, capture the granular details in JIRA)Preference for agile development methodology Personal Attributes Aggressive growth orientationStrong bias toward finding and implementing solutionsGenuine interest in learning about new machine learning techniques and brainstorming how to apply themDeep commitment to building an ethical, world-class company with technology at its coreComfortable managing a globally distributed teamAt home in a very fast-paced environment with a high level of ambiguityWillingness to make this startup a major part of your lifeBenefits Samasource offers a full benefits package, including: medical, dental, and vision insurance, short- and long-term disability insurance, AD&D insurance, employer-matching 401K, generous holiday and vacation policies, sabbaticals, paid disability and baby bonding leave, a monthly gym stipend, and professional development opportunities. Name: Business Analyst
Description: DoorDash is looking for a Business Analyst to drive business decisions and strategic initiatives across the Merchant and Sales teams. This role will uncover strategic insights, automate reporting and build internal tools and dashboards to empower the organization. You'll work cross-functionally between our sales, merchant, operations, product, and analytics team to build the merchant foundation.What you'll doUse SQL to build dashboards that drive business decisions across different lines of business and teams within Merchant Operations and Sales, including rep performance, vendor operations, agent performance, program management, and productIdentify, prioritize, and implement opportunities to build and evolve automated reporting and dashboards for internal teams and Merchant vendorsDevelop operational metrics and set strategic goals to track the weekly/monthly/quarterly performance of internal teams and Merchant vendorsConduct analysis and share data-driven insights by synthesizing the impact of initiatives led by project teamsEnsure data integrity by understanding and identifying opportunities to improve the back end data structureHelp build data governance with single source of truth data documentationAbout youYou are a strong business thinker, able to use 'first principles' to solve challenging business problems at their root levelYou are data-driven, able to analyze data with strong attention to detail and accuracy, and passionate about telling the story behind the numbersYou are a self-motivated, rapid learner, excited about developing your analytical and problem-solving skillsYou are results-oriented, always evaluating whether our team's activities are achieving the desired, measurable impactYou are an owner, always looking for opportunities to learn and better your work productYou are comfortable in a fast-paced, constantly changing team-oriented environment and able to manage multiple deadlines simultaneouslyQualificationsBA/BS degree in quantitative or business fields, or equivalent work experience2-3 years of work experience in data analytics, management consulting, or other quantitative roleAnalytical mindset with demonstrated ability to work through complex, ambiguous problems using dataProven ability to achieve expert level in scripting languages or data analysis tools such as SQL, R, and Microsoft Excel. Proficiency in SQL and data visualization tools a plus.Strong written/verbal communications and presentation skillsAbout us Today, we're one of the fastest, most reliable food delivery platform in North America. But that's just the tip of the iceberg. We want to share our revolutionary logistics technology with every business around the world, to streamline how our cities and local economies work. Make no mistake, it isn't going to be easy, and our mission isn't for the faint of heart. But if you're daring, and you want to make a dent, let's chat.

Name: Director - Lean Six Sigma Black Belt
Description: Forget what you know about old-school industry rules. When you work at Old Navy, youre choosing a different path. From day one, weve been on a mission to democratize fashion and make shopping fun again. Our teams make style accessible to everyone, creating high-quality, must-have fashion essentials for the whole family, with love, season after season. We opened our first store in 1994 in San Francisco and have been on a roll ever since. Today, customers can find fabulous fashion at affordable prices online and in one of our 1,000+ stores globally. Old Navy celebrates a workplace thats just as diverse as our customers. Fun, fashion, family and value are at the heart of everything we do. We cultivate a community of playful personalities that thrive in a fast-paced environment where our employees can be their most authentic selves. Here, were family. Old Navy a brand for everyone a place for you!OVERVIEW Rethinking the way we work is no small task -- and its not an extracurricular activity. You will be focused on productivity and efficiencies across Old Navy. You will act as a technical expert and functional champion to reimagine processes and help instill a continuous improvement mindset across the organization. You will leverage the Lean Six Sigma framework to build a foundation of consistency while enabling brand right experiences to delight our customers. The ideal candidate will possess a strong business acumen, superior analytical skills, and extensive Lean Six Sigma experience. Name: Social Media Analyst (Sysomos, Crimson Hexagon)
Description: Title: Social Media Analyst  You will be part of our client's global social media team who works closely with Product Marketing Managers covering a wide range of products (such as our client Search and Android) across markets, aspiring to make our client the most loved and engaged social brand in the world while driving core business metrics. As a Business Analyst, you will work with Marketing and other cross-functional teams (Product, Content, Engineering etc) to fully utilize social data in order to uncover insights that inform business and marketing decisions and track/assess the effectiveness of our campaigns/programs.  Candidate will have a strong analytics background, proficient at querying data, but also experienced at turning raw data into valuable insights. Should be comfortable running simple linear regression analysis, and will demonstrate strategic thinking in combining our data for insights. Good oral and written communication skills essential.  Top 3 Daily Responsibilities: Own the overall social analytics, set KPIs, develop the metrics infrastructure and optimize organic/paid social campaigns.Track and quantify social impact on our client business metrics including our ability to grow social footprints for our partners.Accelerate speed to insights for timely decision making; spot trends before they become trends.Additional Responsibilities:Gain predictability in where and how we invest our resources. Skill/Experience/Education  Mandatory BA/BS degree in Journalism, Business Analytics, Economics, Math, Statistics and/or related disciplineMinimum 2-3+ years experience with social listening tools such as Sysomos, Crimson HexagonProficiencies in Excel/our client spreadsheet with the ability to move and shift dataWell-versed in story-based reporting (on paper and in person): candidate doesn't just cough out facts and figures, but rather thoughtfully and holistically creates reports that address strategic marketing and business questions with a data-based narrative.Track record of effectively delivering multiple projects at one time in very fast-moving environment, strong project management experience.Demonstrated ability to work calmly and maintain good judgment in fast-paced, high-stress environments, as well as ability to escalate appropriately. Desired 1+ years of experience in SQL analyzing sophisticated data sets; well-versed in analytical and presentation tools (pivot tables, graphs, functions, etc)Ability to influence at all levels and work effectively across functions and geographies.Lead non-hierarchical, cross-functional working teams who don't report into this role.

Name: Business IQ Solution Architect
Description: About UsAt AppDynamics, our Application Intelligence Platform empowers today’s software-defined businesses with the ability to proactively monitor, manage, and optimize the most complex software environments. Because we start with user interactions, our platform is able to dynamically collect millions of performance data points across your applications and infrastructure. We then apply intelligence to instantly identify performance anomalies, enable automatic fixes and continuously measure business impact. And all this happens in real time, in production, with cloud or on-premise deployment flexibility. So even in the most dynamic production environments, you can know more and know it faster. It’s more than monitoring—it’s true Application Intelligence. For more information, visit www.appdynamics.com.About the role:Business iQ (BiQ) Solution Architecture will plan, implement and maintain group wide strategies and best practices for engaging with customers and prospects around BiQ. The solution architect will build a practice and enable current and future BiQ specialists within the company. The team will focus on consultative selling. Your team will work closely with clients and internal teams alike to ensure growth and ROI within the BiQ product.You Will:Educate internal AppDynamics Teams e.g. Sales, Professional Services, Customer Success on BiQ best practicesCreate and maintain BiQ content to be used to educate our CustomersWork with cross functional teams to drive BiQ go-to-market strategyWork closely with our key customers to drive BiQ AdoptionContinue to educate yourself and implement BiQ use cases to maintain subject matter expertiseDevelop new BiQ use cases and applicationsWork closely with our Product teams to drive new features that will provide value to our customersTrack and share customer experiences with our Product teams to provide valuable feedbackExecute BiQ workshops with Customers to gather requirements around BiQ use casesImplement BiQ use cases in ProductionPlayer-Coach and Mentor CS team members as they develop strategies to help our customers achieve their goals About you:You should be excited about working across many functional groups to evangelize and enable products. You have a great passion for real time business analytics and developing internal and external solutions to propel products. You should be comfortable in customer facing roles, you easily empathize with the customer’s specific business circumstances & needs. Deep experience in consulting, marketing and selling enterprise BI or Analytics softwareKnowledge in both analytics and enterprise applicationsWorking knowledge of building Web and Mobile Applications40% travel should be expectedExecutive level problem solving skills, interpersonal skills and expert communicator Perks:We know that the award-winning culture at AppDynamics is something to brag about, but here are more reasons that make you excited to get out of bed to come in the morning, like: Medical, dental, vision coverage401k match (4.5%)Wellness perks (gym, hobbies, education, store discounts, personal finance).4 weeks paid time off (PTO), 5 days volunteer time off (VTO), 14 holidays (including 1 birthday PTO and 1 floating holiday).Mandatory company shut down between Christmas and New Years.Pre-tax commuter benefits.Just a note Note to Recruiters and Placement Agencies: AppDynamics does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Please do not forward unsolicited agency resumes to our website or to any AppDynamics employee. AppDynamics will not pay fees to any third party agency or firm and will not be responsible for any agency fees associated with unsolicited resumes. Unsolicited resumes received will be considered property of AppDynamics.  AppDynamics is an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, age, protected veteran status, or any other unlawful factor. AppDynamics complies with all applicable laws, including those regarding consideration of qualified applicants with criminal histories (such as the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance). If your disability makes it difficult for you to use this site, please contact talent@appdynamics.com. AppDynamics participates in E-Verify.

Name: Senior Analyst - Strategy
Description: Our past is full of iconic moments but our future is going to spark many more. We're looking for the people who'll help make our next decade just as revolutionary as our first five. If you're one of the super-talented who thrive on change, aren't afraid to take risks and love to make a difference, you're the right fit. Come grow with us.OVERVIEWAre you passionate about Retail Strategy, and do you want to shape the future of one of the biggest apparel companies in the world?Do you want to join a team that engages with the C-Suite of a F200 company on a weekly basis?Do you want to prepare for a diverse and exciting set of career opportunities across our portfolio of brands?If so, Employer Inc. is looking for you! The Corporate Strategy team works front and center in defining the best path forward for our company. Through rigorous analyses, focus on our customers, creative thinking, and deep partnership with the business, we develop the strategic direction for our portfolio of brands.We are responsible for the definition and evolution of our overall corporate strategy, for identifying organic and inorganic growth opportunities where we can create structural advantage, and for preparing and supporting our C-Level executives for key meetings.Our team reports to the Chief Customer Officer / EVP of Strategy, and provides strategic support to our CEO and Leadership Team. We partner with C-level functional leads and Brand Presidents, as well as other Senior leaders across the company.WHO ARE WE LOOKING FORAs a Senior Analyst, you will be in charge of driving critical projects to advance our priorities, growth, and long-range plans.Working together with a Manager on the team, you will be asked to drive workstreams for Corporate and Brand strategic efforts, including special projects for the CEO and Leadership Team. Your goal is to drive long-term, value-creating opportunities through deep partnership with leaders and stakeholders across the company.KEY RESPONSIBILITIESSupporting initiative identification, planning, and successIdentifying key issues, structuring problems, and developing and delivering key outputs that drive value creation across Employer Inc. brandsPerforming quantitative and qualitative analysis, including mining and analyzing data, setting-up financial models, and performing market and competitive researchSynthesizing findings and developing supporting material for senior team meetingsServing as a strategic partner as Brands develop annual Long Range PlansSupporting cross-functional business partners at all levels with analytic insights and problem solvingQUALIFICATIONS1-3+ years of professional work experience, ideally with a top-tier management consulting firm or in Corporate/Business StrategyStrong analytical skills, with ability to collect, organize and analyze large sets of data efficiently and effectivelyAbility to develop hypotheses and translate complex ideas into structured outputStrong written and oral communicatorDemonstrated track record as an outstanding problem-solver and strategic thinkerStrong ability and willingness to collaborate effectivelya true team playerSelf-starting and independent - able to define workplans, drive work, and report on statusPREFERRED QUALIFICATIONSInterest in and experience with retail and/or apparel industryKEY BENEFITS:Merchandise discount for our brands: 50% off regular-priced merchandise at Employer, Banana Republic and Old Navy, 30% off at Outlet and 25% off at Athleta.One of the most competitive Paid Time Off plans in the industry.*Employees can take up to five on the clock hours each month to volunteer at a charity of their choice.*Extensive 401(k) plan with company matching for contributions up to four percent of an employees base pay.*Employee stock purchase plan.*Employees receive medical, dental, vision and life insurance.*Employees can apply for tuition reimbursement.*Family care programs.Commuter benefits.Pet Discount Program. *For eligible employeesEmployer Inc. is an equal-opportunity employer and is committed to providing a workplace free from harassment and discrimination. Name: Analytic Consultant 5
Description: Job DescriptionAt Wells Fargo, we want to satisfy our customers financial needs and help them succeed financially. Were looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. Join our diverse and inclusive team where youll feel valued and inspired to contribute your unique skills and experience.  Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you. Corporate Risk helps all Wells Fargo businesses identify and manage risk. We focus on three key risk areas: credit risk, operational risk and market risk. We help our management and Board of Directors identify and monitor risks that may affect multiple lines of business, and take appropriate action when business activities exceed the risk tolerance of the company.  Independent risk management in Corporate Risk is responsible for independent oversight of risk-taking activities. The function is led by the Chief Risk Officer, who reports to the chair of the Risk Committee of the Board of Directors. Strategic enterprise function-aligned leaders in the Corporate Risk organization provide an independent view of horizontal, cross-business risks. Strategic Enterprise Risk Management Strategic Enterprise Risk Management (SERM) is a group directly under the Chief Risk Officer that is responsible for a variety of strategic functions within Corporate Risk that includes risk reporting, risk governance, risk programs that oversee risk measurement and risk identification, strategic and reputational risk oversight, and risk optimization and strategy. Enterprise Risk Reporting and Intelligence Enterprise Risk Reporting and Intelligence (ERRI) is a newly formed group within SERM that is responsible for developing and managing board and executive management reporting on risks across the organization, and for developing strong risk analytics and intelligence capabilities to proactively identify and report on risk trends. The group will also coordinate cross-functional efforts across front line and independent risk management organizations to continuously enhance risk reporting and analytics.  The group consists of three business teams Reporting Design and Execution, Risk Analytics and Intelligence, and Strategic Enterprise Risk Reporting Services, and a horizontal Process Support team. The Reporting Design and Execution team will manage the periodic reporting process for the board and management. The Risk Intelligence and Analytics team will utilize subject matter experts and sophisticated risk data and analytics platform to analyze risk trends across the company. The Strategic Enterprise Risk Reporting Services team is a central team that supports all of SERMs data and reporting needs which includes the ERRI team and the Enterprise Risk programs. The process support team is responsible for horizontal team initiatives, financial forecasting, organizational design and project coordination.  This position would be part of the Reporting Design and Execution team supporting Board reporting for financial and non-financial risk areas. We are currently seeking an Analytic Consultant 5 who brings their strong data analytics experience and leadership skills to drive the design of a new Board reporting structure. This Analytic Consultant will be a self-starter who is able to understand the unique challenges of the multiple sets of data to deliver a comprehensive report. This job requires the ability to see the big picture and be comfortable executing independently. This job requires the ability to see the big picture and be comfortable executing independently.  Please note: Based on the volume of applications received, this job posting may be removed prior to the indicated close date. If you do not apply prior to the closing of this posting, we encourage you to apply for other opportunities with Wells Fargo.Required Qualifications8+ years of experience in one or a combination of the following: reporting, analytics, or modeling; or a Masters degree or higher in a quantitative field such as applied math, statistics, engineering, physics, accounting, finance, economics, econometrics, computer sciences, or business/social and behavioral sciences with a quantitative emphasis and 5+ years of experience in one or a combination of the following: reporting, analytics, or modelingDesired QualificationsExtensive knowledge and understanding of research and analysisStrong analytical skills with high attention to detail and accuracyExcellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skillsStrong analytical skills with high attention to detail and accuracyOther Desired Qualifications5+ years of experience in one or a combination of the following: reporting, analytics, or modelingStrong experience with Excel for data analysis and presentation including macros, pivot tables, and graphsExperience with TableauExperience with analytic coding tools (i.e. SAS, SQL)Extensive knowledge and understanding of data analysis, data aggregation and database construction and manipulationExperience transitioning a manual process to an automated stateUnderstanding of key data management activities needed to support critical reportingExcellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills; ability to interact with both technical and non-technical team membersDemonstrated ability to play a leadership role in large, complex analytical projectsFamiliarity with relevant regulations such as BCBS 239Be a self-starter with the ability to acquire new concepts and skills quicklyStreet AddressNC-Charlotte: 301 S Tryon St - Charlotte, NC CA-SF-Financial District: 550 California St - San Francisco, CADisclaimerAll offers for employment with Wells Fargo are contingent upon the candidate having successfully completed a criminal background check. Wells Fargo will consider qualified candidates with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable local, state and Federal law, including Section 19 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act.  Relevant military experience is considered for veterans and transitioning service men and women.  Wells Fargo is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer, Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Business Analyst We are: The Wix Business Analysis (BA) group, 100+ business analysts and data scientists who strongly believe in using analytics to understand how our users interact with our products. With over 130 million users, we collect over a billion events a day – that’s 1TB of data added daily! We do it all using cutting edge technology to process, store, & query our data, including tools we develop ourselves as well as tools like Hadoop and Presto. You are: An SQL expert who’s also highly skilled in data analysis and visualization (Excel/Tableau/similar). You have 2+ years’ experience in quantitative analysis, preferably for an internet company. You’re an excellent communicator with the ability to deliver results of analyses clearly and effectively. You also have a strong sense of curiosity and a desire to learn & be part of a high-tech, internet-based industry. You know how to harness complex organizational interfaces, and initiate and drive projects from beginning to end with minimal guidance. Bonus points if you have a BSc/BA in a highly quantitative field such as mathematics, statistics or engineering. As a Business Analyst, you will: Analyze and optimize products and activities, take part in design and implementation, and be a key part of strategic product decisions.Build and maintain reports, dashboards and metrics, in addition to monitoring the integrity and validity of the data reported.See beyond numbers and help to inform, influence, support and execute our business decisions.Conduct customer analysis–churn, behavior, segmentation, trends, customer value and more.Work with large amounts of data and build tools to streamline the process.Work as part of a company-wide department that supports Product Managers, Marketing, Finance & Management. Responsibilities  Requirements

Name: Senior Analyst, Global Real Estate Finance & Strategy
Description: Our past is full of iconic moments but our future is going to spark many more. We're looking for the people who'll help make our next decade just as revolutionary as our first five. If you're one of the super-talented who thrive on change, aren't afraid to take risks and love to make a difference, you're the right fit. Come grow with us. Getting recognized by any industry for your work is an honor, but being included in Business of Fashions first-ever Best Companies To Work For In Fashion report is especially exciting. At Employer Inc., one of our driving values is to provide meaningful career experiences that allow our employees to grow, while also building an unrivaled and engaging culture that inspires people to do their best work. We are thrilled to be acknowledged for the work we are passionate about and strive to offer to our amazing employees every day! Employer Inc.s Global Real Estate Finance & Strategy team is a centralized corporate function that provides strategic and analytical support to the Employer, Inc. portfolio of brands including Employer, Banana Republic, Athleta, and Old Navy. We are dedicated to all brands and are responsible for making strategic investment decisions for the companys fleet of retail stores.We are currently seeking a Staff Analyst to join the team of dynamic industry professionals. The ideal candidate has strong analytical and organizational skills are essential in this energizing environment. Your insights will be pertinent to your team's recommendations on strategic real estate decisions. Your key responsibilities include building business cases for store investments and lease renewals which include the development and analysis of pro forma sales call, cannibalization potential, forecasted store P&L, and return on investment metrics such as IRR and NPV. You will make an impact on store creation for our brands globally. Your creativity, attention to detail, and dynamic cross-functional partnership will be essential to every project. You deliver in deadline driven environments with calculated and strategic orientation. You will resolve immediate issues while anticipating needs for the future. You will partner with Store Development, Store Operations, Real Estate Field, Real Estate Law, and other functional groups externally and internally across the company. You will have high exposure and opportunity to expand knowledge and experience with each project. If you are eager to join an industry leading organization, innovate in your area, and learn new skills, tell us about yourself and we hope to meet you soon.As one of the world's largest specialty retailers, our past is full of iconic moments. But we're most passionate about the future, and the people who will help make our next decade just as groundbreaking as the last fifty years. Essential Duties & ResponsibilitiesPrepare and deliver insights and recommendations based on analysis.
