Name: ITC-ITSD IMA Business Analytics Analyst
Description: Chevron is one of the world's leading energy companies, with approximately 60,000 employees working in countries around the world. We explore, produce and transport crude oil and natural gas; refine, market and distribute fuels and other energy products; manufacture and sell petrochemical products; generate power; and develop future energy resources, including biofuels and geothermal energy.  Chevron is accepting online applications for the position of Business Analytics Analyst located in San Ramon, CA California / United States through December 5, 2018 at 11:59 p.m. (Eastern Standard Time).  Requisition ID#396158  The candidate who fills this position will have primary responsibility for supporting and administering Power BI at Chevron, while also coordinating with offshore resources performing incident management activities. This position also includes regular collaboration with installed business partners and project development teams for support issue resolution, onboarding of new users and groups, packaging of software updates, consulting on usage of existing and new features, and projections of demand growth.  Responsibilities for this position may include but are not limited to: Manages the Remedy incident queue, performing direct resolution for US daytime hour requests and prioritizing/assigning incidents to the offshore team as appropriate.Holds offshore team accountable for incident resolution timeframes specified in SLA, and ensures adequate incident resolution documentation.Works with Microsoft to ensure the platform is available, compliant, and functioning per Service Level Agreements. Administers User Access, and promotes content to the premium serviceCoordinates/performs IRM compliance activities as required.Periodically assesses license compliance, and projects license and premium node demand growthEstablishes and maintains a seamless working relationship with all business partners that utilize Business Analytics platform services across Chevron, including Upstream, Downstream, Enterprise Functions, and Gas & Midstream.Participates in local user groups, CoPs and external Industry wide User Groups.Assists with training coordination and deliveryProvides input to platform strategy, coordinating POC's for new functionality, and established best practices and guidelines for usage of the Power BI platform.Stays abreast of new technology developments as required.Maintains platform documentation and user guides and process documentation.Submits and Responds to Change Requests as needed (following change management processes).Responds to and resolves customer-reported incidents.Provides consultation to customers on usage of existing and new featuresDocuments all work done in resolving incidents on the main work information tab for each incident.Serve as an escalation point to Microsoft for production and/or platform issuesMonitor the overall availability and performance of Power BI and take corrective actions as necessary to ensure peak operational performanceRequired Qualifications:BS Computer Science or Information Management Systems.At least 1 year experience administering a large-scale Power BI environment.Minimum 2 year previous tech support experience w-BI Platform administration (Cognos, Spotfire, SAP BO, Microstrategy).At least 1 year experience developing Power BI reports.Tech Support experience with Operational Processes- ITSM, IRM, 24X7 support, BCP-DR, etc.Preferred Qualifications:Strong written and verbal skills w-ability to effectively engage bus and tech resources on all levels.Ability to develop strategic relationships with business, vendors, CVX partners.Strong meeting facilitation-presentation skillRelocation Options: Relocation may be considered. International Considerations: Expatriate assignments will not be considered.  Chevron regrets that it is unable to sponsor employment Visas or consider individuals on time-limited Visa status for this position. Regulatory Disclosure for US Positions: Chevron is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status, or other status protected by law or regulation.  Chevron participates in E-Verify in certain locations as required by law.  Nearest Major Market: San Francisco  Nearest Secondary Market: OaklandSDL2017

Name: Paid Social Marketing Coordinator
Description: We are looking for a Paid Social Marketing Coordinator who will support the Paid Social marketing team here at ThirdLove. This position will be critical to the operational success of the team, participating in and owning the end-to-end process and management of various marketing campaigns. This role is a great fit for someone extremely detail-oriented, masterful at juggling multiple projects, and who wants to learn and grow in the digital marketing space. THE JOBPerform day to day operational support tasks including campaign setup, audience creation, uploading deliverable assets, and reporting on campaign KPIs.Coordinate and collaborate extensively with various stakeholders throughout the campaign process. You'll work closely with the Facebook team handling a diverse set of tasks.Deliver reporting and analysis of marketing campaignsAssist with list management & hygiene: importing, segmenting, and pulling specific lists based on project specsCoordinate, set up and run A/B marketing campaign tests.Track and analyze marketing campaigns to help identify opportunities for improvements and ROI optimizationSupport the marketing team in various exciting marketing initiatives, as neededTHE QUALIFICATIONSBachelor's degree in Marketing, Business, Business Analytics, or related fieldHighly curious, motivated, proactive, and adaptable to a fluid environmentExperience in marketing, business, retail, and/or eCommerce preferred, but not requiredExcellent Excel skillsSharp attention to detailStrong written and verbal communication skills and the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teamsStrong project management skills and the ability to multi-task and work under tight deadlines THE PERKSComprehensive health benefits (medical, dental, vision, life and disability)Equity401k planStocked kitchenSubsidized delivered lunches 3 times a weekWellness benefits including monthly in-office massage visitsAwesome product discounts and quarterly product allotment (free product)ThirdLove® is empowering women to feel comfortable and confident in their everyday lives. We're the innovative brand behind half-sizes and we're looking for talented people who share our commitment to providing a better, more intuitive shopping experience.  Our rapidly growing team (over 350 today) is based in San Francisco with offices in Chico, CA and Argentina. We're funded by Tier 1 investors and are disrupting a $100 billion global market we've been named one of the Next Billion-Dollar Startups 2018, Best Breakthrough Start-Up, and one of 2018's Top Retail Disruptors.  Our culture is collaborative, fast-paced, and data-driven. Instead of using standard industry molds, we developed an algorithm to help our customers find their perfect fit to date, over 11 million women have taken our easy-to-use Fit Finder® Quiz. Since our inception, we've backed all of our decisions with the latest lift tests and media mix models, and because our teams work closely together across departments, we are able to achieve effective, dynamic results. Our people and our machines are always learning.  Five core values drive all of the work we do: Every Day Is a New Day.Learn from the past but keep moving forward. Stay positive and optimistic.Make It Happen.Be proactive. Be thoughtful about how.Defy Conventions.Question the status quo. Ask why. Be nimble and embrace change.We're Stronger Together.Give your full attention, share information, and help others learn and develop.Put Customers First.Make every interaction count. Name: Credit Portfolio Manager 2 - Account Management Optimizing Strategies
Description: Job DescriptionAt Wells Fargo, we want to satisfy our customers financial needs and help them succeed financially. Were looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. Join our diverse and inclusive team where youll feel valued and inspired to contribute your unique skills and experience.  Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.  Consumer Lending is an industry leader in supporting homeowners and consumers. Our group includes Home Lending, Personal Lending, and Wells Fargo Auto, and the professional services teams that partner with these businesses. Our foundation for success can be summarized in three beliefs: Our product is service. Our value added is financial advice and guidance. Our competitive advantage is our people. Weve built our team of top professionals by rewarding their accomplishments and ensuring they have what's needed to succeed.  The CLG team includes Home Lending, Consumer Credit Card, Personal Loans and Lines, Direct Auto, Dealer Services, Commercial Auto, Retail Services and Education Financial Services including the professional services teams that partner with these businesses - Human Resources, Finance, Credit Risk, and Compliance & Operational Risk.  Wells Fargo Consumer Credit Solutions is seeking a senior leader to help drive and optimize Account Management programs, including but not limited to new channel and prospect strategies, and account and customer treatment optimizations. Responsibilities will include, but are not limited to the following: Manage Balance Build initiatives (for example, Balance Transfer, Rate Sales, Activation and Retention), and program performance and portfolio monitoring for Credit Card, ULOC, Dillard's and Retail Services: Manage a team to perform quantitative analytics and experimental designs using programming tools (eg. SQL, SAS, Tableau and/or Python, R), analyze sample and data from a variety of sources (FDR, ADH, Hemisphere, BMG, Data Lake, etc.) to optimize segmentation, portfolio and account management program strategiesDeliver strategy performance monitoring and reporting insights that satisfy risk, business, regulatory, corporate credit and compliance requirementsDevelop partnerships with Product, Marketing and Finance, and create/present CAPsSupport Audit, Exam, SHRP, Operations, Executive Office and customer inquiriesProvide ad-hoc business analytics to support senior management and business partnersMaintain on-going processes and data updates to ensure data integrity, accuracy and timelinessDetermine new channel, product, and prospect impacts to account management strategies including development of loss forecasts As a Team Member Manager, you are expected to achieve success by leading yourself, your team, and the business. Specifically you will: Lead your team with integrity and create an environment where your team members feel included, valued, and supported to do work that energizes them.Accomplish management responsibilities which include sourcing and hiring talented team members, providing ongoing coaching and feedback, recognizing and developing team members, identifying and managing risks, and completing daily management tasks.Required Qualifications7+ years of risk experience2+ years of management experience10+ years of SQL or SAS experience5+ years of full-cycle credit experience including testing and control.Other Desired QualificationsStrong strategy, data/analytics and reporting experiences, SAS/SQL and/or Python/R background, and extensive experience in combining/analyzing data from multiple large data sources to develop and implement credit control strategiesExperience designing and delivering new products and portfolio management strategies including: conducting competitive analyses, financial analyses and building justification to support business recommendationsKnowledge and understanding of competitive environment and regulatory issues, familiarity with credit card industry is a plus.A Master's degree or higher in a quantitative discipline,Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skillsHigh attention to detail and accuracyAbility to articulate complex concepts in a clear mannerAbility to prioritize work, meet deadlines, achieve goals, and work under pressure in a dynamic and complex environmentKnowledge and understanding of databases and data mining techniquesProactive with results driven attitude, and strong problem solving skillsWell organized, attention to detailProven track record with hands on experience in business analytics and strategy recommendationsDisclaimerAll offers for employment with Wells Fargo are contingent upon the candidate having successfully completed a criminal background check. Wells Fargo will consider qualified candidates with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable local, state and Federal law, including Section 19 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act.  Relevant military experience is considered for veterans and transitioning service men and women.  Wells Fargo is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer, Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation.

Name: Growth Analytics Analyst
Description: Quantium For over 15 years Quantium have combined the best of human and artificial intelligence to power possibilities for individuals, organisations, and society. Our solutions make sense of what has happened and what will, could or should be done to re-shape industries and societies around the needs of the people they serve. We combine a diverse team of experts that spans actuaries, statisticians, data scientists, product leaders, strategy consultants, software engineers, delivery managers, industry experts, designers, and futurists – all dedicated to harnessing the power of data to drive transformational outcomes for our clients. We implement renowned data handling techniques, without which clients cannot fully realise the strategic and commercial value of their data. We always go beyond mere data-led insight, into actionable commercial solutions that reshape businesses, categories and, at their very best, society at large. Quantium delivers ground-breaking solutions in data and technology. We develop, analyse and monetise datasets, generate insights, create decision support tools and embed automated decision engines. We bring all this to bear in Q, which powers everything we do.Role summaryThe Growth Analytics Analyst, is a technical role to support the application of analytical solutions for new and innovative projects, product development, new markets expansion or securing and growing strategic clients, to accelerate the growth of Quantium. It will involve working closely with other members of the Growth Analytics team, client staff when working onsite, and members of the Product team in some cases.Some travel is likely to be required, with extended periods of working onsite at client offices sometimes being required.The role offers the opportunity to develop a range of technical skills on cutting edge projects, with progression to more commercial responsibilities also being an option. Key responsibilities: · Ownership of the data component of a project  · This means you will be responsible for writing the code that prepares data for further analysis · It involves extracting, checking, cleaning and manipulating the raw data · Feature engineering is part of this process · Contribute to the analytics components of the solution i.e. building and testing models / algorithms · Support the rest of the team's delivery of the project. This could involve:  · Building reporting dashboards · Creating slides · Documenting our approach · Training internal or client teams · Key activities · Working in a team of analysts and data scientists to develop new analytical solutions  · It can include all components from data checks and manipulation through to modelling and other advanced analytics · It is typically done in Spark / Scala or Teradata for data preparation and Spark / Scala or R for advanced analytics  · Creating slides or other materials to help communicate project outputs · Handover, including documentation, of work to longer term owners (in some cases) · Projects typically consist of a small team of people (3-5) working on one task, with a mix of different skills and experience levels. Almost always, our projects present us with problems that require statistical models or bespoke algorithms to solve.Experience and education required: · Up to 3 years experience in a highly technical analytics environment, carrying out data analytics or data science work · Tertiary qualifications in engineering, mathematics, actuarial studies, statistics, physics, or a related discipline · Experience in Spark / Scala, R, modelling and unsupervised learning is desirable · Experience in communicating analytical approaches to others · Problem solving skills · Ability to pick up new tools and approaches quicklyWhat does success look like?A successful analyst will be able to: · Extract data from a variety of sources · Summarise data issues and communicate them to the team · Prepare summaries of the data that help the rest of the team with their analysis · Write efficient code that is easy for others to interpret · Begin forming the right conclusions about the validity of data · Build features that are designed by someone else · Execute the build of an end-to-end modelling / algorithm pipeline with some support · Create first version of slides · Understand how their tasks affect the rest of the projectKey business capabilities required:Analytics and Modelling - Data Manipulation - Manipulate data effectively to improve its functional application, useability, interconnectivity, or qualityAnalytics and Modelling - Method Application - Accurately and appropriately apply the specific method to meet the needs of the problem Analytics and Modelling - Data Discovery - Ability to explore the availability, suitability and compatibility of available data and assess the viability of the project/product/partnershipAnalytics and Modelling - Insight Generation - Convert information into meaningful, actionable recommendations for Quantium's clients and partnersAnalytics and Modelling - Insight Visualisation - Represent information in a format designed to make explicit the value in the data, in an easily understandable and meaningful way for the audienceKey People and leadership capabilities required:Achieve & perform - you have high standards of excellence and consistently deliver great results for our clientsAgile & innovative - you act decisively, think nimbly, and you look for creative ways to deliver better resultsAchievement oriented - you contribute to a culture of high performance and seek opportunities to make a differenceSelf-aware - you have a clear perception of yourself, you take responsibility for your actions and you accept others without biasesAlignment - you mobilise yourself and others towards our future direction and strategyBrand advocate - you believe in what we do and speak positively about QuantiumGrow others - you naturally look to unlock the potential of yourself and others

Name: Strategy & Insights Analyst
Description: About ThumbtackHave you ever tried to hire a plumber? How about a house cleaner? If you have, chances are it took you way longer than it should. In the era of instant-everything, it's crazy that you still have to waste an entire afternoon researching, calling and vetting local service professionals whenever you need one. The market for hiring them is huge $700B in the US alone but the process is inefficient and largely offline.  Thumbtack is transforming this experience end-to-end, building a marketplace that matches millions of people with local pros for almost any project. In making these connections, not only do our customers get more done every day, our pros are able to grow their businesses and make a living doing what they're great at.About the Business Analytics TeamThe Business Analytics team's mission is to unlock strategic opportunities and enable Thumbtack to achieve its full business potential. To accomplish this mission, we focus on: Strategic insights: Analytics to uncover insights that will be game-changers for our business, and that inform company strategy and team execution.Business intelligence: Metrics, dashboards, and forums that help us measure progress towards our goals and foster deep understanding of our business.Telling Thumbtack's story: Using metrics and data visualization to tell Thumbtack's story to investors, board members, our team, and the world.Building a world-class team: hiring the best, and investing in coaching, learning, and team building. We are a tight-knit group that is passionate about driving business impact through analytics.About the RoleAs a Business Analytics team member, you'll drive insights and action across the breadth of the marketplace. You'll be a steward of key company metrics and dashboards, and dive deep on analytical questions that are critical to Thumbtack's success (such as 'what makes a market healthy?' or 'what drives customers to return to Thumbtack?'). You'll partner with our leadership team to develop company strategy and goals, share updates with the Board, and work with teams across the business to drive actionable insights and business impact.About youYou'll be a great fit for the team if:You're extremely data-driven -- you love learning from data to make decisions, and always seem to have data at your fingertipsYou geek out on metrics and dashboards -- you enjoy tracking trends, and have a driving curiosity to understand what's driving themYou enjoy answering big questions with analysis, and diving deep to reveal insightful and actionable insightsYou're passionate about measuring business impact, and drawing the connection between what teams are building and how it impacts company metricsYou enjoy roles that enable you to understand the breadth of the business (vs. focusing on one specific area) and partner with people across the companyYou appreciate the power that analytics has to enable the company to reach its full potentialResponsibilitiesDefine, measure, and track the key metrics that measure Thumbtack's successDesign and build key company data tables, dashboards, and insights tools that power decisions across the companyParticipate in weekly and monthly business metrics reviews that illuminate areas of focus for the companyConduct in-depth analysis to answer key questions that are critical to Thumbtack's strategyPartner effectively with teams across the company, including Product, Engineering, Marketing, Operations, Finance, and the leadership teamContribute to our team and company data culture through peer collaboration, training, coaching, and moreMust-Have QualificationsBA/BS degree, preferably in Economics, Business, Math, Statistics, or Computer Science2+ years of experience in a highly analytical role, e.g. technology, finance, or consultingProficiency using SQL to analyze large data sets, or excellent excel skills and enthusiasm to learn and use SQLExemplary analytical problem solving skills, including strong business judgment and the ability to identify and synthesize insights from analysisAbility to work with company executives to understand the company's business needs and strategyStrong communicator, attentive listener, and compelling explainerNice-to-Have QualificationsPrior work experience at a marketplaceStatistics knowledge / experienceExperience with R or PythonMore About UsThumbtack is a local services marketplace one of the largest in the U.S. that helps millions of people hire local professionals. With hundreds of unique service categories, customers can find a Thumbtack pro for almost anything: landscapers, DJs, personal trainers, even piano teachers. And in making these connections, we empower local pros too. Helping them get new customers and make a living doing what they're great at.  Founded in 2008 and headquartered in San Francisco, Thumbtack is backed by over $250 million in investment from Sequoia Capital, CapitalG, Tiger Global Management, Javelin Investment Partners and Baillie Gifford. See what it's like to work hereMeet the pros who inspire usFollow us on LinkedIn Thumbtack embraces diversity. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and do not discriminate on the basis of sex, race, color, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, national origin, citizenship, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Name: Business Analyst - Strategic Sourcing
Description: Our past is full of iconic moments but our future is going to spark many more. We're looking for the people who'll help make our next decade just as revolutionary as our first five. If you're one of the super-talented who thrive on change, aren't afraid to take risks and love to make a difference, you're the right fit. Come grow with us. OVERVIEW:As a Business Analyst, you will be responsible for the creation, maintenance and implementation of tools and dashboards that will support the Employer Inc Strategic Sourcing teams analytical inputs to competitive sourcing bid exercises. In addition, you will be responsible for conducting market research, analyzing spend, volume and savings data, and making recommendations to assist with and identify opportunities to drive value across the Employer Inc enterprise. You will collaborate effectively with internal and external stakeholders across varying levels, from peers to executives. Your new position will include projects at any point during their lifecycle from developing strategy, crafting a plan to implement, and execution.ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:Manage and execute sourcing activities across categories through technical/functional knowledge, in support of the business short-term and long-term plans. Strong critical thinking and business curiosity, including exceptional analytical and creative problem solving skills, strong ability to work with complex and detailed data to drive insights and decisions.Sourcing Capability: Manage, plan, and execute sourcing activities to drive short and long-term results. Has ability to leverage market knowledge and collaborate/ influence stakeholders.Drive for Results: Demonstrated ability to work effectively in an ambiguous environment to achieve high levels of performance and deliver sustainable results to the teamExperience: Minimum 2 years of professional experience in management consulting, strategic sourcing, or supply chain. Demonstrated experience with analytical, system and problem solving skills. Technologically savvy: advanced Excel, coding (VBA), macro development, etc experience is necessary.Education: Bachelor's degree in business administration, supply chain management or related disciplineKEY BENEFITS:Merchandise discount for our brands: 50% off regular-priced merchandise at Employer, Banana Republic and Old Navy, 30% off at Outlet and 25% off at Athleta. Name: Summer 2019 Intern - Data Analytics Analyst
Description: Summer 2019 Intern - Data Analytics AnalystTeam DescriptionThe Analytics team within Security arms our leadership team with the knowledge and insights to drive business outcomes to create the most secure and compliant enterprise cloud. We provide holistic visibility into our Security Investments as well as business operations across our Security Organization. The person in this role will need to be able to collaborate with stakeholders to understand the business outcomes we want to change, identify the data needed to drive those changes, analyze the data to test your hypothesis and unlock key insights to drive action to help our security team. You'll be able to do this on the Salesforce Einstein Analytics data platform while leveraging the latest technology stack on our platform. Your ResponsibilitiesPartner with Security teams to help develop hypothesis to drive data analysis to generate insights on the dataDeliver Ad-hoc data analysis and/or Statistical analysisDevelop dashboards in Einstein Analytics to support analysisPartner with Data Engineers and Data Visualization EngineersBuild new mechanisms for data automation Minimum QualificationsPursuing a degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems, Business Analytics, Information Technology & Business or equivalent/related degreeExperience with Development in BI software (ex. Tableau, Microstrategy, Einstein Analytics)Working knowledge in at least one business intelligence tool such as MicroStrategy, Tableau or Business ObjectsProgramming experience in SQL, Python or RExperience with one or more database management tools Oracle, Postgres SQL, Amazon Redshift/RDS, etc.Understanding of data manipulation and database skills such as SQL with familiarity with ETL development processPreferred QualificationsStrong communication and visualization skills; can easily create powerful visualizations that transform complex data into easily-consumable, actionable insightsMust be analytical, results driven, creative, innovative, self-motivated, proactive, organized, and be able to handle multiple projects simultaneouslyStrong technical skills with the ability to analyze issues, technical risks, and recommend permanent solutions to issues while still being able to communicate to non-technical usersMust be detail oriented, organized, proactive mindset, can anticipate questions, automate answers to routine questionsAbout Futureforce University RecruitingOur Futureforce University Recruiting program is dedicated to attracting, retaining and cultivating talent. Name: Paid Search (SEM) Associate
Description: If you love the world of eCommerce and search marketing and are passionate about building a brand that uses technology to create a better shopping experience, the SEM associate role could be perfect for you! This role will be essential in bringing all of our paid search channels in-house, and continuing to build, manage, optimize, and rapidly grow them. You'll become an expert direct response advertiser through participating in end-to-end creation of ads, will have a direct impact on revenue and growth, and help manage multi-million dollar budgets at one of the fastest growing brands in America. Youre a great fit for the role if you love a good challenge, can juggle multiple projects while maintaining attention to detail, are highly analytical with a passion for testing and learning, but also enjoy using the creative half of your brain! THE JOBHelp execute customer acquisition campaigns across paid search channels (Google, Bing, Yahoo), and Google Display Network.As our first true SEM hire, you will be the key player in overhauling our paid search channels, bringing all efforts in-house, and scaling rapidly.Create and implement on-going testing plans for ad copy, creative, landing pages, targeting strategies, etc.Perform in-depth data analysis to spot trends/shifts in the landscape and build actionable plans to improve performance and ROICoordinate workflows between Marketing and many cross-functional teams, such as Brand for ad creation, Product for landing page testing, Inventory Planning for alignment in marketing efforts, and Analytics for a greater understanding of campaign performance and identifying areas of opportunity.Relentlessly analyze and optimize campaigns through A/B testing new audience segments, targeting strategies, creative testing, and keyword management/expansion.Provide ad hoc analysis as well as regular channel performance reports.Support the marketing team in various marketing initiatives, as needed.THE QUALIFICATIONSBachelors degree in Marketing, Business, Business Analytics, or related field1-2+ years of experience in search engine marketing campaigns on Google AdWords, Bing AdCenter and Yahoo Gemini.A keen interest in the digital advertising worldfast-paced and constantly-evolving, fueled by data-driven decisions and a desire to try whatever is new.You think that working in a startup environment with ambiguity and frequent change sounds like an exciting chance for ownership and innovation!Strong project/time-management skills, and the ability to multi-task between a mix of short-term and long-term projects, involving multiple teams and marketing partners.Very strong analytical skills with an ability to organize and scrutinize data, interpret metrics and identify trends.Excellent Excel skillsTHE PERKSComprehensive health benefits401k planEquitySubsidized lunchesQuarterly product allotmentWellness benefits including in-office massage visits

Name: Manager Analytics
Description: Job DescriptionUNCOVER AND EXECUTE ON GROWTH OPPORTUNITIES THROUGH OBJECTIVE ANALYSIS, OPERATIONAL INSIGHTS AND STRATEGIC INITIATIVES We’re looking for inventive, full-stack data experts that are unconventionally curious, rigorous in their attention to detail, and maintain a healthy degree of skepticism. You should be technically adept and possess a keen eye for business, with a real passion for making an impact through creative storytelling and timely actions.  WHY YOU SHOULD JOIN OUR DATA TEAM: Our customers love us: Many of our teammates on the product, data, and sales teams are former customers that joined to help turn data teams into superheroes.We help build a better product (for ourselves): In marketing, they say “remember, you’re not the target audience”. But what if you were? You will help design a product targeted at you.We are the cutting edge: Given our unique position in the company, as well as the data industry, we are privy to closed betas of data tool offerings. We frequently provide feedback to partner vendors and contribute to open source packages. You’ll have the opportunity to participate in thought leadership, open source development, and community moderation.Everyone on the team is full-stack: From developing data models in Airflow/DBT to delivering recommendations to senior leadership, everything is in each individuals purview.Full exposure to all parts of the business: The data team has built cash forecasting and GAAP reporting for the finance team, pipeline tracking and health analysis for the sales team, cohort investigations for the marketing team, customer health scores for the customer success team, and feature affinity curves for the product team, just to name a few. You will partner with and be exposed to every team: an unparalleled opportunity to learn about all the nuts and bolts of a business. HOW YOU’LL RAMP:  Within your first week... You’ll learn the business from most of the key business owners, including Sales, Marketing, Finance, Support / Solutions, Product, and Engineering. By Day 30... You will deftly answer questions by querying our data models and systems of record (including SFDC, Zuora, Intercom, Outreach, Bizible etc.) while increasing the adoption of data across the company. By Day 60... You will start to identify and pursue projects that directly drive revenue.You will be writing ETL scripts in SQL and Python to retrieve unstructured data from the depths of S3 and code business logic into structured data transformations. You will implement a single source of truth by updating existing models and generating new data resources from sales activity data, marketing attribution data, and customer interaction logs. By Day 90... You will make recommendations that directly influence business outcomes. You will identify areas of opportunity, spin up collaborative teams, and report on successes. WHAT YOU’VE ACCOMPLISHED SO FAR:  Warehousing and Data Enablement You have run analytics for company-wide initiatives that involved utilizing Python knowledge to parse logs, in-depth SQL experience to wrangle messy data, and warehousing expertise to construct efficient ETLs and clean data marts that are ready for business-user exploration. All of this was done in efficient, legible, and commented code (bonus if you can submit samples)Your data adventures have taken you through charge / invoice, subscription, CRM, usage, clickstream, pricing, marketing schema and more. Your endless curiosity has identified patterns in these models and allows you to construct data transformations that make them insights-ready.You have implemented and propagated the use of several BI solutions (MicroStrategy, QlikView, Tableau, Periscope Data, Looker etc.) to increase accurate data availability within a company. Cross Functional Leadership and Operations Mastery of verbal, written, and visual communication skills has gotten your work in front of the executives at your company, influencing them with your analytical insights.Your structured analytical approach to problem solving and project management knack help you scope, communicate, execute on, and deliver projects that others shy away from. You have integrated a billing system, migrated from invoice-linked refunds to charge-based ones, or even evaluated marketing performance based on manually entered UTM parameters. Analytical Rigor and Technical Aptitude You have designed, documented, and evaluated A/B tests to deliver product, sales, and marketing insights.Your understanding of modern object oriented languages (Ruby, Python, Go, etc.) has enabled you to unravel product code and track down data anomalies. Opportunity Identification Your ability to prioritize and set direction in a dynamic environment has allowed you to identify the diamonds in the rough and polish them to groundbreaking initiatives.Startups change direction quickly, and so do you. You’ve spun up a “startup within a startup”, tested an MVP product direction, or dropped a seemingly successful initiative to make room for one with an even larger opportunity. Our tech stack: Periscope DataAirflowDBTGitHubFivetran+StitchDockerGlueRedshiftSpectrumAthenaS3EC2 ABOUT PERISCOPE DATA: We're a passionate, venture-funded team with more than 1000 customers, including Adobe, Flexport, EY, Uber, ZipRecruiter, Fender, Meredith, & Tinder.We are onboarding rapidly! We’ve grown our team 3x over the last two years.We believe strongly in a data-driven approach to all that we do. We're constantly measuring and optimizing everything about the business.We’ve been recognized by Comparably, Glassdoor, Bay Area News Group and SF Business Times for our amazing company culture.Our product is very sticky. Users spend ~20 hours per week doing technical analysis on our platform.We have super high customer retention — better than best in class SaaS companies.We provide free lunch every day and cover healthcare for all of our employees.We’ve recently moved into our new global headquarters, a newly renovated building in SOMA customized to our unique needs.

Name: Systems Business Analyst Learning Management System (Tempo
Description: Our past is full of iconic moments but our future is going to spark many more. We're looking for the people who'll help make our next decade just as revolutionary as our first five. If you're one of the super-talented who thrive on change, aren't afraid to take risks and love to make a difference, you're the right fit. Come grow with us.OVERVIEWThe Systems Business Analyst role supports the technical & functional team that manages our global Learning Management System (SuccessFactors Learning). The role is responsible for supporting system administrators & users with training program operations, such as creating courses, testing web-based training and preparing the learning system for employee use. This role will support project initiatives and other change management needs. Role is accountable for understanding how the Learning Management System supports our training programs and initiatives.RESPONSIBILITIESApply functional and learning system experience and assist learning technology team with system updates and user supportComplete Functionality or User Acceptance Testing on approved quarterly upgrades, releases or enhancementsAudit and implement maintenance updates and initiatives to improve the functionality within LMSCreate courses in learning management system for specialized enterprise learning programsGenerate reporting for enterprise learning programs and auditing.Load and Test web-based training modules for tracking and completion issuesMonitor Administrator Group Mailbox, categorize and re-direct issues to System Administrators for follow-up & resolution (tier 1 support)Contribute to continuous improvement efforts to evolve support model while meeting business needsReview and suggest updates to user guides and training. Update guides when neededQUALIFICATIONSMinimum educational level: Bachelors Degree or equivalent combination of education and experience2-3 years experience working with a learning management system in a large organization preferredDemonstrated proficiency with the Microsoft Office suiteDemonstrated ability to work in a virtual office environment with remote team membersAbility to assess and recommend process options to improve efficienciesKnowledge of instructional design theories, approaches and conceptsKnowledge of learning program planning methodsKnowledge of software implementation process and development lifecycleExcellent organizational skills with time management skillsStrong interpersonal skills with a professional communication styleTeam player with solid planning, judgment, flexibility, collaboration, and decision-making abilitiesAble to work independently and under pressure to meet deadlines in a fast paced, challenging, and dynamic environmentKEY BENEFITS:Merchandise discount for our brands: 50% off regular-priced merchandise at Employer, Banana Republic and Old Navy, 30% off at Outlet and 25% off at Athleta.One of the most competitive Paid Time Off plans in the industry.*Employees can take up to five on the clock hours each month to volunteer at a charity of their choice.*Extensive 401(k) plan with company matching for contributions up to four percent of an employees base pay.*Employee stock purchase plan.*Employees receive medical, dental, vision and life insurance.*Employees can apply for tuition reimbursement.*Family care programs.Commuter benefits.Pet Discount Program. *For eligible employeesEmployer Inc. is an equal-opportunity employer and is committed to providing a workplace free from harassment and discrimination. Name: Senior Manager, Express Drive Analytics
Description: At Lyft, community is what we are and it's what we do. It's what makes us different. To create the best ride for all, we start in our own community by creating an open, inclusive, and diverse organization where all team members are recognized for what they bring.  To grow our analytics capabilities, we need a strong Senior Manager, Business Analytics who can understand all aspect of the Express Drive (XD) program and can tie pulling levers on one side of the program with moving metrics on the other side - and succinctly communicate these effects to all levels of the organization. This person will oversee the Business Analytics team, guiding Express Drive's strategy and execution across functions through deep expertise on Express Drive's operations, product, and finances - focusing the broader team's attention on areas of highest leverage and uncovering new opportunities to unlock the next step change in Lyft supply.  This role will oversee all Business Analytics for the Express Drive program, including volume planning, vehicle economics, as well as strategic opportunities - and ensure the program is delivering an optimal balance of volume, efficiency, and quality. It requires a background in complex querying and modeling combined with strategic thinking and excellent communications.  You will have significant exposure to senior leadership and will play a critical role in advising the program Director.Responsibilities:Within Express Drive, the Business Analytics team guides strategy and decision-making across all functions by understanding how each moving piece drives business results. Projects will include: OKR setting, tracking, and forecastingProgram economics managementPartnership and contract assessmentIncentives design and assessmentEvaluating XD compared to other supply leversProduct feature prioritization and assessment based on business impactVolume and expansion planningDriver behavior analysisQuality of experience measurement and benchmarkingDeveloping and maintaining central self-serve repository for XD Analytics knowledge Describe the day-to-day Coordinate and prioritize XD Business Analytics projects and ad-hoc requests for team of analystsReview work of analysts, synthesize results to build cohesive picture of program performanceMonitor program performance and progress towards goals, identify and triage issuesLead deep dives into data through complex querying and modeling to uncover new areas of opportunityDevelop analytical frameworks, roadmaps, and metrics for the teamProvide guidance on operational, product, and business decisions based on results of analysisPresent hypotheses and results of analytics work to executive team and broader organizationEnsure analytical rigor and business consideration in all program decision-makingExperience & Skills:Degree in a quantitative field (master's a plus)Experience in investment banking or consultingExperience in a high growth company in a management roleAbility to synthesize large, complex sets of data and present actionable recommendations on their basisStrong communication and presentation skillsImpeccable judgementLow ego, high driveTechnical: Excel, Mode, facility with sql, R, Tableau a plusLyft is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer that proudly pursues and hires a diverse workforce. Lyft does not make hiring or employment decisions on the basis of race, color, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, sex, gender, gender-identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, military or veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable local, state, or federal laws or prohibited by Company policy. Lyft also strives for a healthy and safe workplace and strictly prohibits harassment of any kind. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance and other similar state laws and local ordinances, and its internal policy, Lyft will also consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Name: Architect - Global Manufacturing Industry Services
Description: *Architect - Global Manufacturing Industry Services** Are you ready to seize an opportunity to work with Microsoft's most established and innovative customers, advising and supporting their Business and IT Executives with the planning and realization of key digital transformation initiatives within the Manufacturing Industry? Do you have a track record of employing strong business and technology architectural skills, orchestrating the creation and delivery of creative solutions that generate and accelerate actual business value? Do you have a passion for the manufacturing industry, Microsoft's technology & solutions, and are committed to accelerate our customers to a world of digital innovation and business transformation? Do you want to lead Microsoft into a new generation of consulting services? This could be your next great career adventure!  We are looking for a deep industry expert who can identify, lead and run a set of complex industry solution opportunities through delivery. This will require forming anchoring relationships through customer engagement with both internal and external partners. This role will support the Microsoft sales team pursuits, scoping proposals and ensuring delivery on groundbreaking engagements. The mission is to work with Microsoft's largest Enterprise clients to help them accelerate towards their business goals, take advantage of Digital Business Transformation, improve the business value from their Microsoft technology investments, and unleash innovation for their organization, their employees and customers. This role is critical in sales and delivery driving the discovery, ideation, and solution architecture, with a laser focus on customer business outcomes facilitated by Microsoft products and technologies. Furthermore, the role requires maintaining the business decision maker relationship and ensuring the expected business outcomes are achieved.  This role requires years of direct industry experience, deep industry insight and discernment to bear on worldwide delivery opportunities and contribute to thought leadership across both Microsoft Services and the entire company. *Responsibilities***Desired Capabilities** + Experience with operational manufacturing systems: ERP, SCM, PLM and ISA-95 systems: MES, SCADA, PLC, Historian, etc  + Working knowledge of field and factory equipment physical application, operating performance and maintenance processes  + Experience with asset management, equipment performance monitoring, telematics or advanced machine telemetry systems, and associated business value of digital solutions  + Working knowledge of how industry standards influence solution direction, capabilities and compliance, e.g. industry STEP AP-242, SAE J1939, ANSI Z535.1, including information models such as ISO 10303-239  + Knowledge of industry solutions from Microsoft partners and their role in the overall solution architecture and fulfilment of success criteria *Role functions** + Identifying, designing and successfully executing on solution architecture that is measured by quantified business outcomes  + Ability to understand the needs of nontechnical customers, to conceptualize, launch and deliver technology enabled business change projects  + Defining / leading repeatable ideation steps with customers to explore art of the possible through industry specific, cross industry business solutions/patterns and technology components, and demonstrating techniques such as Design Thinking and Inclusive Design.  + Leading with IP development and reuse initiatives, harvesting standard methodologies in presales, architecture, business planning, and customer engagement.  + Generating trust, forming partnerships across the organization, and orchestrating interdisciplinary teams to the benefit of customers.  + Being situationally aware to adapt and solve challenges from a business and technology perspective.  + Balancing critical thinking with pragmatic operational delivery.  + Partnering with the customer facing teams and other Services teams to identify, develop, lead on key digital business transformation services opportunities.  + Ability to grow share of wallet for the Microsoft Platform and Microsoft Services in targeted accounts. Grow the field capability through mentoring, readiness, and community evangelism.?? *Qualifications** + 10+ years experience in conjunction 5+ years working for a brand name manufacturer (Ex: Ford, Toyota, Boeing etc...)  + Deep industry expertise and business insight with name brand experience from a world-renowned manufacturer or supply chain partner  + A strategic eye for the manufacturing business, industry practices and ability to architect solution approaches using Microsoft technology and offering portfolio  + Ability to quickly architect digital solutions using the portfolio of Microsoft products and technologies, that directly address business measures and strategic goals of the Enterprise  + Engaging with key decision makers to build unique and differentiated agile proposals focused on business impact  + Ensuring project delivery meets or exceeds customer expectations for strategic fit, capabilities and performance.  + Engagement with Fortune 500 customers at executive and senior levels.  + Executive presence and discernment to win the hearts and minds of business leaders  + Experience within Enterprise in-house strategic operating units/centers of excellence, or related advisory services including, management/technology consulting  + Insight, curiosity, desire to constantly improve, acquire new skills and commit to results.  + Bachelor Degree or higher in Computer Science, Business, or Engineering, and/or equivalent work experience  + Executive level social, verbal, written and presentation skills, good listener, ability to provide a trusted voice at the decision-making table and be an advocate of Microsoft's vision and value proposition  + Solid understanding of Microsoft's offerings (or Compete) and experience with the implementation/adoption of key solutions and services such as Azure, Cloud, Platform & Productivity, Business Analytics, Devices & Mobility  + Knowledge of Enterprise Architecture, IT Portfolio Lifecycle Optimization, Organizational Design and Change Management, IT Governance, etc.  + This position may require up to 75% travel domestically and globally.  Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form at https://careers.microsoft.com/us/en/accommodationrequest .  Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

Name: Digital Analytics Specialist
Description: The OpportunityWe are looking for a Digital Analytics Specialist to offer domain expertise and client support for our international offices. As Digital Analytics Specialist you will own a P&L closely with stakeholders and various client-side departments to oversee design, development, and validation of Analytics data for the Google Analytics platform.  This role focuses on the design and implementation of customized analytics and attribution strategies as well as creating training and deployment processes that scale globally. This includes the assessment of user-level data and integration with real-time technologies; formulating testing mechanisms to measure and optimize media performance; and overseeing the execution of recommendations for optimal performance across the wide base of paid and unpaid, online and offline media channels our clients leverage.  Responsibilities include:  Client Facing Hands on implementation of clients' analytics accounts including properties, user management, dashboards, and reportingPlan, design and implement data analytics across a portfolio of digital channels and platforms in the Google Analytics 360 suiteArchitect client-side "source of truth" such as a Site Analytics and Marketing Intelligence platform or dashboardSource key customer insights through data and testing to define KPIs and inform our digital campaignsEstablish standard process for client's digital properties to set up, maintain and track data for reach, engagement, performance and other behavior metricsTranslate the result of the attribution model/testing towards action partner with our internal team, to drive value across the Marketing channels being tracked; support diverse stakeholders by generating custom reports according to business needsWork with developers and product owners to determine appropriate metrics and behavior to track new and existing propertiesNurture client understanding of the importance of building & testing an attribution strategy across media buys; act as a consultative resource to help clients understand what their own testing models should look likeUnderstand and deploy integrations between analytics platforms and external data from POS systems, advertising networks, CRMs, location-based tracking, and offline paid media - predominantly deterministic, potentially probabilistic models Business Facing Project manage account analytics efforts setting company-wide best practices and processesDrive towards higher effective rate between client value and costs; build efficiencies into repeatable processes and scale globallyWork with the Product team to translate business requirements into new products; Work with Sales team to translate products into outbound opportunities; work with Account Management team to R&D and Commercialize productsEducate Accounts, Sales, and Engineering teams on various analytics software to support fulfillment; train employees and offer platform expertise; define roadmap for long-term Customer Analytics needs What you bring to it: 2+ years hands-on experience with Google Analytics 360 and Google Tag ManagerInstallation & Architecture experience with Google Analytics (360), Adobe Omniture, VisualIQ, Convertro, Marketo, Segment, Drupal, Data Studio, C3, Salesforce, Target, Monetate, Optimizely, Google Optimize, Tableau, Looker, and any other analytics & visualization platformsAble to read/write basic HTML/HTML5 /CSS/JavaScript, other front end languages (Python, NodeJS, PHP, etc.), and ability to query large databases (SQL)Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Management of Information Systems, Math, or Statistics/EconomicsExcellent analytic, quantitative and problem solving skills with proven ability to deliver actionable insightsProficient in computer applications used to manipulate large datasets to analyze, test, validate and report public web usage dataAble to relay technical requirements to engineers for execution of custom codeExperience reading API documentation and understanding the technical requirements for implementation with other platformsExperience in tag architecture analysis and using tagging platform(s) to execute proper data flowAbility to explain architecture proposals to non-technical audiences and communicate business value of suggested ideas & plansPassionate about working in an extremely fast-paced, demanding, and fluid start-up environment as well as a desire to build a company up from an early stage What we offer: Competitive salary + year-end bonus tied to Company performanceFunded Pension planUnlimited vacation daysGym membership of your choiceMightyHive mobile phone planMonthly food and entertainment allowanceCompany Uber account to get you around in styleNew MacBook Pro laptop computer #mh

Name: Pricing Strategy Manager
Description: Pricing Strategy Manager Marketing | San Francisco, California  Create world-class strategies to reach more customers & partners and help them understand DocuSign's potential impact on their business. Position Summary As the Manager of Pricing Strategy, you will be responsible for enabling our executive team to make key strategic decisions by creating a clear, insightful fact base and highlighting the strategic implications of that analysis. You will work with executives across the organization to drive business impact. You will collaborate extensively with product marketing, product management, partner marketing, sales, and finance to accelerate growth across our company as we create a new software category. This position is an individual contributor and reports to the Vice President of Strategy. Responsibilities Build a fact base and communicate insights to support some of DocuSign's most important strategic decisions. Responsibilities will include: Analyze DocuSign sales data and product usage data to develop key business insights (e.g., Who's buying what? Who's using what? Where are do we have opportunities to create more customer value?)Identity, incorporate, and analyze external secondary research to supplement our internal data (e.g., government research, analyst reports, public company financials)Create and analyze data from primary research (e.g., customer surveys, conjoint surveys) conducted by DocuSign and our research partnersCommunicate business insights identified in the analysis by creating clear, concise, and persuasive PowerPoint presentationsBasic QualificationsBS degree, ideally in a quantitative field (e.g., Finance, Economics, Statistics, Math, or CS)2-5 years of experience in an analytical rolePreferred QualificationsExcellent Excel skills ability to clean, blend, and prep large quantities of dataAbility to distill big data sets into actionable insights that drive business valuePrevious analytical experience at a top tier consulting firm or Sales organization (e.g., Sales Strategy/Ops role)Ability to create and present data in a visual format and explain the insights clearly and concisely. Understanding of data visualization techniques will be valuable (e.g., www.edwardtufte.com)Strong collaboration, verbal and written communication skillsFamiliarity with Salesforce reporting, Qlik, and AlteryxPassionate about analytics and their ability to drive impact across our business, across the industry, and around the worldBonus: Cloud software or high tech experienceBonus: Experience building customer research, including conjoint surveysMarketing @ DocuSign We create world-class content and marketing solutions to reach more customers and help them understand the potential impact DocuSign can have on their business. Designing creative for a new business campaign. Refining messaging around a new product launch. Organizing a captivating customer event. Developing innovative social media campaigns. Collaborating on playbooks and training with the Sales team. Marketing is the face and voice of DocuSign and plays a key, high-impact role in how we tell our story. About DocuSign DocuSign® is changing how business gets done by empowering hundreds of thousands companies and tens of millions of users in most countries around the globe to sign, send and manage documents anytime, anywhere, on any device with confidence. DocuSign replaces printing, faxing, scanning and overnighting documents with the easiest, fastest, most trusted way to make every approval and decision digital. Organizations of all sizes and industries are accelerating contracts, approvals and workflows with DocuSign's Digital Transaction Management (DTM) platform and eSignature solution. DocuSign keeps life and business moving forward.  DocuSign is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Individuals seeking employment at DocuSign are considered without regards to race, ethnicity, color, age, sex, religion, national origin, ancestry, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, physical or mental disability, registered domestic partner status, caregiver status, marital status, veteran or military status, citizenship status, or any other legally protected category.  #LI-DS1

Name: Director - Business Development - Pharma Partnerships
Description: About Freenome Freenome is on a mission to empower everyone with the tools they need to detect, treat, and ultimately prevent diseases. By applying machine learning techniques to high quality multi-omics datasets covering various disease types, Freenome is developing blood tests to detect early-stage cancer and make treatments more effective. The company has raised $78 million from investors such as Andreessen Horowitz, Google Ventures, Polaris Partners, and Founders Fund.Our Science Freenome is building technology to gain an understanding of the body through several analytes derived from blood. These signals include cell-free DNA, methylation of cell-free DNA, cell-free RNA, circulating proteins, and immune profiling derived from thousands of prospective samples. By developing novel statistical learning methods and applying them to integrate various -omics datasets, Freenome is a leader in modeling specific biological mechanisms to capture disease dependent signatures such as gene expression, immune response, tumor burden, tissue of origin, and 3D chromatin structure. By building comprehensive discovery datasets and modeling critical biological systems, Freenome is learning what biological changes are present within the blood between a variety of different disease states including cancer, autoimmune disorders, infections, drug response, and aging. With the combination of Freenomes datasets, cross-functional technical expertise, and mission to uncover the biological truth, we seek to positively change the lives of millions through the early detection and early treatment of disease.Our Culture Freenomers are technical but creative, visionary yet grounded, empathetic and passionate. We build teams around divergent expertise, which allows us to solve problems and uncover opportunities in unique ways. Freenomers are some of the most talented experts in their fields. Together we advance healthcare one breakthrough at a time. We value empathy, integrity and trust in one another. That means embracing others perspectives, those of our coworkers, and those of the patients and communities we serve. It means knowing when to push and when to be quiet and listen. At Freenome we give each other the benefit of the doubt in the belief that were all working as a team toward the same goals. We conduct ourselves with integrity, empowering others to grow in a collaborative environment. Freenome explicitly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran status.About the Role We are looking for lifelong learners who are passionate about biology and immuno-oncology, from the newest sequencing techniques through the impact of machine learning methods. In this role, youll help grow Freenome's biopharma business. You will leverage your existing network and build new connections to collaborate with biopharma groups supporting their drug discovery and clinical development. You will identify how Freenome's multianalyte approach powered by machine learning could accelerate clinical trials, improve the chance of success and understand underlying biology driving response to therapy. You will identify/win and build companion diagnostic deals with pharmaceutical partners. Youll make new connections through networking, introductions, conference attendance and other creative approaches. Youll partner closely with scientific, clinical and business leadership within drug development companies to build partnerships using our platform. Youll shepherd potential partners from the ground up to fully fledged partnerships based on Freenomes platform for discovery, clinical trials and Companion Diagnostics (CDx)Responsibilities Identify and develop new relationships, and grow business from existing partnerships (nurturing and expanding them) Maximize mutual benefit with our partners and meet revenue targets Manage and oversee contract development process with pharma & biotech; liaising with internal and external counsel and displaying an understanding of IP considerations Investigate and develop strategic long term business relationships driving to Companion Diagnostic deal agreement in relation to Immuno-Oncology agents and combination therapies Maintain high level of business acumen, analytical and product knowledge including IO therapies, oncology and AI discovery trends, new and emerging therapeutics, competitive landscape Educating and evangelize our platform to potential and current partners Understand our latest scientific results and how they link to the most recent discoveries in publications within the oncology, immuno-oncology and AI driven drug discovery space to build effective and engaging relationships with biopharma groups.What We're Looking For 10 years of business development experience working in biotechnology, biopharma or Big Pharma environments Experience building relevant relationships with various scientific and business teams within pharmaceutical companies MS or above in Molecular Biology, Computational Biology, Genomics or related fields with proven knowledge of oncology - immuno-oncology preferred. Proven track record of presenting, negotiating and closing deals driving to revenue and value creation knowledge of oncology drug discovery and clinical development Excellent communication skills ability to clearly and effectively communicate to a broad range of audiences Understand team dynamics including expertise in navigating and influencing within pharma Minimum travel expectation 50%Nice to Haves Experience working in molecular diagnostic, immuno-oncology, genomics, and/or artificial intelligence Experience directly driving In and out licensing deals Experience working in several different companies in the space at varying scale Phd and/or MBA degreeWhat does a successful person look like at Freenome? Those who thrive at Freenome prioritize, manage, and execute their own goals in alignment with those of the company. They embrace our values of empathy, integrity, and trust, and hold themselves and their team accountable. They crave collaboration with brilliant minds from unfamiliar fields of study and believe that hiring and mentorship are fundamental to our success. Above all, they welcome and provide constructive feedback and criticism, trusting in the good intentions of others, and feel secure in the knowledge that embracing mistakes is the best way to learn and move on. For those who crave challenges, understudied problems, and the chance to see their work impact the lives of millions of people affected by cancer every day, Freenome is the place to be.

Name: Sr. Business Analyst, Reporting and Data Analytics
Description: Responsible for identifying and documenting business processes through interviewing clients and reviewing and analyzing existing systems and processes. Plans and manages initiatives, proposals, or projects, including identifying project resource needs and roles. As a change agent, works to drive culture change, client communications, and related work regarding system changes, implementations, and related business process impacts.Business and Process Improvement: Identifies opportunities for business or process improvement; makes associated recommendations and implements as appropriate. Skills required:Analysis/documentation of processes, methods, solutions, etc.Interpretive - translates business processes and requirements into system specificationsMust be able to work in a Labor/Management Partnership environment. Preferred Qualifications:Experience using Salesforce or similar CRM Products to develop client or business solutionsExtensive experience working with users and stakeholders to gather and analyze requirementsStrong presentation, communication (written and verbal) skills, and interpersonal skillsAbility to juggle and prioritize multiple tasks within a collaborative team environmentExperience leveraging and configuring AppExchange products to develop a solutionFamiliar with data visualization tools such as Tableau and CognosAble to write code in SQLExperience with forecasting and modeling regression analysisExperience leveraging and configuring Salesforce AppExchange products to develop a solution Salesforce Certified AdministratorSalesforce Certified Service Cloud AdministratorSalesforce Certified Platform Developer 1Certified Scrum MasterAbility to work closely with users and stakeholders to understand their reporting needs and analyze processesExperience developing design requirements of the project by incorporating the client's requirementsAbility to manage relationships with key stakeholdersCan work as the SME for Salesforce Service Cloud Reporting functions and featuresExperience in participating in key meetings with clients including requirement sessions, system demos, user acceptance testing, and end user training

Name: Credit Risk Analytics Consultant 3 - Governance & Oversight
Description: Job DescriptionAt Wells Fargo, we want to satisfy our customers financial needs and help them succeed financially. Were looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. Join our diverse and inclusive team where youll feel valued and inspired to contribute your unique skills and experience.  Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.  Corporate Risk helps all Wells Fargo businesses identify and manage risk. We focus on three key risk areas: credit risk, operational risk and market risk. We help our management and Board of Directors identify and monitor risks that may affect multiple lines of business, and take appropriate action when business activities exceed the risk tolerance of the company.  The Credit Capital, Allowance and Stress Testing (CCAST) organization within Corporate Credit & Market Risk is seeking a highly motivated individual to join our team.  CCAST is responsible for: Oversight and analysis of credit risk-weighted assets (RWA) in compliance with Basel regulationsConsolidation, coordination, documentation and oversight of the allowance for credit losses (ACL) and related external disclosuresCoordination, oversight, documentation, and submission for the credit section of the company-wide stress testing exercises in compliance with Dodd-Frank/Comprehensive Capital Analysis and Review (CCAR) requirements. The CCAST team works with people throughout the company, including Senior Credit Officers, Controllers, Treasury, and other groups to support the $960B loan portfolio and other credit risks. The team is also responsible for maintaining strong relationships with regulators, external auditors and other examiners.  Within CCAST, Regulatory Credit Capital Oversight (RCCO) is seeking an individual with strong governance and COSO reporting background to work with both the Wholesale and Retail Workstreams to ensure the banks compliance with the Basel regulatory capital rules. This position will report to the Governance and Oversight Team manager and work extensively with other parts of RCCO (workstream teams, operations & reporting and analysis) as well as a variety of business partners on quarterly and monthly deliverables. Key business partners include Wholesale and Retail data providers (lines of business), corporate controllers, corporate treasury and other corporate oversight areas.  The duties of this position include, but are not limited to: Manage the monitoring and testing of Wholesale and Retail Basel Workstream compliance with the Governance & Oversight Framework and COSO Policy.Enhance and maintain Compliance Rationale Documents and related processes to ensure documentation supports compliance with the Basel Rules as it pertains to the Wholesale and Retail lines of business.Monitor compliance with corporate policies to identify gaps and opportunities for improvementMonitor the remediation of governance-related issues in the Shared Risk Platform (SHRP) to ensure remediation plans are on target.Coordinate remediation efforts across teams including Corporate Risk, Line of Business Credit and Finance and Treasury and Enterprise Basel.Assist with all internal reviews with WFAS, EC&O, and other RCCO governing bodies. This position is part of a high functioning, high profile team and requires the presence and professional demeanor necessary to interact effectively with team members across corporate risk and finance and their technology organizations. Strong organizational and communication skills are needed.Required Qualifications7+ years of risk reporting experience, risk analytics experience, or a combination of bothDesired QualificationsA BS/BA degree or higher in business administration, finance, or accountingExcellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skillsKnowledge and understanding of regulatory compliance requirements surrounding BASEL, Risk Appetite and stress testingOther Desired Qualifications3+ years in a compliance function in the financial services industry with an emphasis on risk management, audit, and/or internal controls2+ years experience with the Basel regulatory framework for credit exposures with a focus on governance or regulatory reportingAbility to communicate across various levels of management and to operate independently, analyze issues and make key decisionsSuccessful at turning preliminary or ambiguous information, ideas or problems into well-defined plans and implementable solutionsAbility to prioritize multiple tasks, take on new challenges and collaborate effectively with other team members to accomplish business goalsDemonstrated ability to work independently under pressure with tight deadlinesProficient in Microsoft office products Word, Excel and Power PointUnderstanding of governance frameworks, process documentation, what could go wrong analyses and management review controls.Experience with commercial and/or consumer lending.DisclaimerAll offers for employment with Wells Fargo are contingent upon the candidate having successfully completed a criminal background check. Wells Fargo will consider qualified candidates with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable local, state and Federal law, including Section 19 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act.  Relevant military experience is considered for veterans and transitioning service men and women.  Wells Fargo is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer, Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation.

Name: Technical Implementation Consultant - Analyst
Description: Position: Technical Implementation Consultant 2019 Overview: Recognized on the Inc. 5000 fastest growing companies in the US, Peloton is one of the largest and fastest growing professional services firms specializing in Integrated Cloud Solutions for Enterprise Resource Planning, Enterprise Performance Management, and Big Data and Analytics. At the core of who we are – we believe that business analytics is changing the competitive landscape. Companies that are equipped with the right information, have the know-how, and the enabling technology to consistently leverage analytics will gain a competitive advantage.  Our company provides an opportunity to work with consulting professionals in a collaborative, stimulating, entrepreneurial environment. Where individuals look forward to arriving at work each day, are recognized and appreciated, and are allowed to move boundaries and take calculated risks for greater success. Our teams partner with business leaders to develop unique and innovative solutions that generate real business results. Beyond results, we also strive to make every engagement educational and fun. Yes – fun! We really like what we do and we let it show.  If you are interested in being part of our high performing and growing organization – and have strong passion for business and/or technical consulting; especially as related to analytics, enterprise performance management, cloud solutions, or information management – you may be a good fit for our team. Join the revolution and lead organizations on a journey to compete in the 21st century! Qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, genetics, or veteran status.
