Name: MBA University Grad
Description: Company DescriptionDropbox is a leading global collaboration platform that's transforming the way people work together, from the smallest business to the largest enterprise. With more than 500 million registered users across more than 180 countries, our mission is to unleash the worlds creative energy by designing a more enlightened way of working.  Headquartered in San Francisco, CA, Dropbox has more than 12 offices around the world.Team DescriptionAs a new MBA graduate, youll be challenged and inspired to impact our growing business while being fully immersed in a cross-functional environment. Whether youre joining our marketing, revenue, or business strategy teams, youll have a chance to work directly with senior business leaders, industry experts, former startup founders and PhDs. Come be an integral part of shaping our dynamic business as we move to make the world a more collaborative place for everyone.Role DescriptionThere are five critical areas to find impact within our growing business units. Business Strategy and Operations (BSO), Business Development, Growth and Monetization, Product Marketing, Revenue Strategy, and Information Technology. You will drive business initiatives across the company improving our product's potential, in order to delight our users and help Dropbox grow.BusinessStrategy&Operations(BSO) - The BSO team partners with Dropbox leadership to continually evolve the companys strategic agenda, address critical business challenges, and improve operational rigor within the company. Our team works closely with senior executives in a variety of functions - such as product, growth, sales, marketing, business development, and finance - to set our strategy and drive key business initiatives through a number of high-visibility projects.Our team is tight-knit, and youll have the opportunity to engage with peers/mentors from premier professional services firms and MBA programs. Prior full-time work experience in strategy consulting, investment banking, private equity/venture capital, or strategy/business operations for a technology company is a plus.Business Development - The Business Development team builds and leads a global partner ecosystem that include partnerships across the spectrum of 300k+ developers to large technology companies such as Adobe, Microsoft, Amazon, Dell, HP and Apple. We partner closely with Dropbox leaders across functions - such as product, engineering, sales, marketing, legal and finance - to drive growth of individual and business users for both Dropbox and our partners.Requires experience in consulting, private equity/venture capital, operations or Chief of Staff experience.Growth Management - Our Growth & Monetization team drives business growth through rapid experimentation and data insights. Were responsible for understanding the end-to-end customer funnel to optimize monetization opportunities and help users realize the full potential of our products. We work closely with many teams, including Product, Engineering, Analytics and Sales. In this role we are specifically passionate about retaining existing users by demonstrating marketing and growth tactics to improve renewal and engagement metrics.Requires experience in project management while demonstrating strong analytical abilities and experience with A/B testing.Marketing - The Marketing team sets product positioning and strategy, leads product launches, and gathers customer insights. We partner with teams including Product, Sales, and Engineering. You will focus on driving the messaging, content, and go-to-market strategy to reach prospective customers and influence their decision to try or buy Dropbox.Requires prior full-time or MBA internship experience in a marketing role, or a function that directly works with marketing teams within the technology industry (such as sales, PR, or partnerships)Business Intelligence and Analytics - The Information Technology and Services team builds scalable technology solutions that have broad impact for our growing teams globally. As a Business Analyst on the Business Intelligence and Data team you will partner with key partners and establish standard methodologies and guidelines for creation, storage and publishing of data. By ensuring the health of our data, insights and metrics you will help design and implement purposeful architectures and roadmaps.We value past experience in business intelligence, data integrations, data management and governance within SaaS and other cloud technologies. Bachelor's degree in Information Systems or Computer Science or equivalent experience is preferred. RequirementsCurrently enrolled as a second year student pursuing a Masters in Business Administration with a graduation date of Spring 2019.Please note, to be considered for MBA roles, US work authorization will be required to move forward in the interview process. H-1B visa sponsorship will not be available for consideration at this time. Benefits and Perks100% company paid individual medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage401k + company matchMarket competitive total compensation packageFree Dropbox space for your friends and familyWellness ReimbursementGenerous vacation policy10 company paid holidaysVolunteer time offCompany sponsored tech talks (technology and other relevant professional topics) Dropbox is an equal opportunity employer. We are a welcoming place for everyone, and we do our best to make sure all people feel supported and connected at work. A big part of that effort is our support for members and allies of internal groups like Asians at Dropbox, BlackDropboxers, Latinx, Pridebox (LGBTQ), Vets at Dropbox, Women at Dropbox, ATX Diversity (based in Austin, Texas) and the Dropbox Empowerment Network (based in Dublin, Ireland).

Name: Business Analyst, Demand Generation/Marketing Ops
Description: Position: Business Analyst, Demand Generation/Marketing OpsLocation: Onsite in San Francisco, CAYour Impact: As an analyst of global operations team, you will mainly support the demand generation and marketing operations teams in the Americas (US, Canada, LaCa) plan and the execution of their campaigns and initiatives around Lead Buy, Webinars, and Direct Mail campaigns. As a key member of the marketing operations team, you will work closely with other members in marketing, sales, IT, enterprise ops and other areas of Salesforce.About you:Love of learning and passion for innovative technology.Interest in demand generation (webinars, lead buy, and direct mail campaigns).Highly functional in a dynamic, challenging environment.Thrive in a culture of ownership, delivery and innovation.High attention to detail and process.Responsibilities: Manage the operational support of demand generation technologies including Webinar, Lead Buy and Direct Mail platforms.Own the relationship with various internal stakeholders to ensure proper execution of marketing campaigns.Responsible for campaign setup governance and training for internal and external stakeholders.Manage projects to roll out new technologies and install demand generation systems for international teams.Troubleshoot system issues as they arise; develop proposals for fixes, and execute.Document new process, system changes, standards and educate internal teams.Assist with special projects and other tasks as assigned.Required Skills/Experience:3-5 years experience in a Marketing role. Experience in an operations role is a plus.Understand marketing systems infrastructure. Marketing automation experience with Salesforce Marketing Cloud (SMC) is a plus.Strong understanding and experience with Salesforce CRM.Proficient project management skills and experiences.Experience working with demand generation platforms and vendors.Experience making data-driven decisions using data analysis, analytics, campaign reports and dashboards.Must have natural curiosity. Quick learner with the demonstrated ability to prioritize and meet deadlines.Strong analytical, conceptual and problem-solving abilities.Strong communication skills, Excellent in verbal, writing, and editing skills.Team player, able to work with global cross-functional teams.Relevant BA/BS degree.Posting StatementSalesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this Web site or directly to managers. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesforce.com or Salesforce.org.Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance and the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring, Salesforce will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Name: Senior Manager, Analytics
Description: Ubisoft is composed of over 14,000 talented people located in 5 continents across the globe. With more than 80% of our teams dedicated to creation, Ubisoft is the biggest in-house creative force in the industry.  The company's 40+ different creative studios work hand-in-hand each day to deliver rich and innovative gaming experiences that reflect the creativity and diversity of their teams. This cross-studio collaboration model means every team member has the opportunity to participate in challenging projects based on iconic brands including Assassin's Creed®, Tom Clancy's Rainbow Six Siege®, Tom Clancy's The Division®, For Honor®, Rabbids®, Rayman®, Watch Dogs®, Far Cry®, The Crew®, Just Dance® and more.  With an expansive global distribution network, Ubisoft is also a company that stays in close contact with its local fans.  Ubisoft, a global leader in the video games and entertainment industry, is seeking a Senior Manager, Marketing Analytics to build and lead a team focused on Brand, Media, Digital and Web analytics.  This person will be a high-performing individual with an analytical mind and strong interpersonal and communication skills. The ideal candidate is a self-starter who can manage their time effectively and educate themselves while contributing to marketing investments performance. Responsibilities:Partner with marketing leaders across Brand, Media, and owned Digital channels to create a comprehensive measurement framework for key franchisesCollaborate with business intelligence team to maintain a marketing data warehouse by providing clear requirements and timely data validations.Develop robust analytic processes to frame campaign expectations, inform decision-making, and recommend marketing strategiesImplement solutions to measure and optimize the impact of marketing activities on sales and user engagementManage a team of media and brand analysts supporting specific brands (games) and media channels (e.g. web) lead ongoing projects, ad hoc analysis, and insight generation\Synthesize data from various sources to deliver actionable insights and codify learnings as best practicesWork closely with marketing teams and agencies to define key performance metrics, create and maintain reports and identify trends and opportunities across media, social and web activitiesBachelor degree in a technical or quantitative discipline (Mathematics, Economics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering), Master's preferred; MBA a plusMinimum 7 years of professional related experience, including management responsibilitiesStrong quantitative skills, and experience utilizing scientific analytic methods, qualitative methods, and quantitative analysis techniques, as well as predictive modelingDemonstrated success presenting complex qualitative and quantitative research data in a clear and compelling manner that inspires actionExcellent organizational, communication and interpersonal skillsIn depth knowledge of SQL, Tableau and Excel. Experience in programming and with R or comparable statistical modeling tool is a plusExperience creating and maintaining a data warehouse is a plusExperience with ad serving platforms (e.g. Double Click) and CRM solutions is a plus Ubisoft is committed to creating an inclusive work environment that reflects the diversity of our player community. We are an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age or disability status.SDL2017

Name: BPM Manager
Description: Microsoft US is looking for a Director of Business Programs (Digital Transformation Lead / Managing Architect) who has a mix of strategy, industry, architecture, technology, people leadership and business acumen. This role will need technology knowledge, experience with applying business-outcome based approaches to customer problems and the ability to lead teams of architects and business program managers (digital advisors) who help Microsoft enterprise customers achieve their most challenging business and organizational goals by leveraging their current and future investment in the Microsoft Platform. *Responsibilities** Demonstrated ability to engage in senior level business and technology decision maker discussions related to agility, business value, and end to end information technology is also a must.  DT Leads have a passion for the customer, the business and our people, which is demonstrated through professionalism and striving for excellence in all aspects of the customer experience.  The DT Lead provides strategic technical direction and reports to the CTO of MSUS.  The DT Lead role is a key leader of the MSUS CTO Council and an enabler for architects and consultants across the organization.  The DT Lead provides leadership to the team and organization on how to envision transforming our customers moving forward, partner and excite our clients on how we get there, and then help make a proposal to make it real.  The DT Lead will support the strategies of the Office of the US CTO which include defining and driving customer Digital Transformation strategies and solutions, growing the business by delivering digital transformation and technical presales services, ensuring high customer satisfaction by driving architecture governance and quality assurance for all phases of the solution lifecycle, and fostering the architect and technical communities to provide support and growth for our people.  The DT Lead will also be influencing and coordinating the Digital Transformation plans, program, and execution with other regional, US and WW teams.  The individual will also review and provide feedback and guidance on technical approaches to opportunities and deals and will lead the Enterprise Presales initiative for MSUS. *Qualifications** + At least 10 years experience with broad understanding of the technology industry, including current and emerging Digital Solutions, and experience managing technology-enabled business change  + 5+ years of people management experience  + Proven talent driving teams for performance, growth and delivery of customer satisfaction  + Significant experience working with the BDMs and/or for top technical and business consulting firms, including people management, business development, sales management, operations management, and driving delivery excellence  + The successful candidate will have strong business acumen, excellent analytical, problem solving, project and people management skills, and a demonstrated track record delivering complex projects to enterprise customers.  + Thought leader with executive presence, including ability to hold CXO and BDMs level discussions, and executive-level, exceptional interpersonal, verbal, written and presentation skills  + Consistent record of delivering business value at an executive level, by bringing the benefits of technology to transform their business  + Ability to generate trust, build alliances, and orchestrate interdisciplinary teams to the benefit of customers  + Empathy, curiosity, and desire to constantly improve, acquire new skills and drive for results  + Passion for technology, business, market trends and, specifically, the Customer  + Ability to become an advocate for Microsoft?s vision and value proposition, and diverse offerings, by conceptualizing, planning and leading implementation/adoption of Microsoft technologies  + Recognized innovator with strong storytelling abilities to inspire growth mindset for the teams and the customers  + Excellent written & verbal communications, experience with persuading C-level audiences, and a desire to work in fast paced environment are also required.

Name: Senior Marketing Manager Analytics
Description: Senior Marketing Manager, AnalyticsMarketing | San Francisco, CaliforniaPosition Summary The Web and Marketing Analytics team is passionate about using data to help make better decisions about our marketing activities and investments that build and accelerate pipeline for our Global Sales teams. We're looking for a Senior Manager of Marketing Analytics to lead Marketing influence modeling and reporting as well as support lead scoring analysis. This person is an experienced, creative thinker and problem-solver who can take a hands-on approach and deep dive into our disparate systems and data sets to deliver clear, impactful insights.  This position is an individual contributor position and reports to the Director, Marketing Analytics. ResponsibilitiesDrive enterprise-grade Marketing influence and attribution modeling while delivering ongoing reporting and analyticsAnalyze online and offline customer behavior and journeys, demonstrating robust attribution techniquesSupport lead scoring analysis via advanced statistical analysis or machine learning modelsProvide business requirements and collaborate with internal teams on data capture strategy to support advanced analysis of Marketing's influence on the creation and acceleration of pipelineCollaborate on performance goals, own and run regular reports and scorecards around account-based marketing initiativesDesign, build, and maintain automated dashboards that connect data from internal and external data sources, with visualizations and tools that allow business users to self-serveDeliver quick insights on ad hoc projects and analyses as necessaryBasic QualificationsBS or MS degree in quantitative fields (Statistics, Math, CS, Economics or Finance preferred)4+ years of hands on experience within a modeling/attribution analytics role, ideally in B2B SaaSPreferred QualificationsYou have 4+ years of experience with CRM & Marketing Automation capabilities and data sets (Salesforce and Eloqua proficiency preferred)You have technical expertise regarding data mining, media analysis and segmentation techniquesYou have experience with predictive modelingYou have experience building and operating models using advanced SQL, Python,You have familiarity with updated SiriusDecisions Demand Unit Waterfall and Account-based Marketing conceptsYou are naturally inquisitive, and go beyond the ask to resolve questions that need to be addressed with data, analytics and attribution modelingYou have experience establishing critical metrics, dashboards, and analytics at a fast-growing companyYou have demonstrated ability to effectively communicate complex analyses to non-technical audiences and translate insights into clear recommendationsYou have working knowledge of data visualization and dashboarding (e.g. Qlik, Tableau, etc)You have strong quantitative and analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracyYou are a productive individual contributor who works well as part of a tightly-knit teamMarketing @ DocuSign We create world-class content and data-driven marketing solutions to reach more customers and help them understand the potential impact DocuSign can have on their business. Designing creative for a new business campaign. Refining messaging around a new product launch. Organizing a captivating customer event. Developing innovative social media campaigns. Collaborating on playbooks and training with the Sales team. Marketing is the face and voice of DocuSign and plays a key, high-impact role in how we tell our story. About DocuSign DocuSign® is changing how business gets done by empowering hundreds of thousands companies and tens of millions of users in most countries around the globe to sign, send and manage documents anytime, anywhere, on any device with confidence. DocuSign replaces printing, faxing, scanning and overnighting documents with the easiest, fastest, most trusted way to make every approval and decision digital. Organizations of all sizes and industries are accelerating contracts, approvals and workflows with DocuSign's Digital Transaction Management (DTM) platform and eSignature solution. DocuSign keeps life and business moving forward.  DocuSign is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Individuals seeking employment at DocuSign are considered without regards to race, ethnicity, color, age, sex, religion, national origin, ancestry, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, physical or mental disability, registered domestic partner status, caregiver status, marital status, veteran or military status, citizenship status, or any other legally protected category.  #LI-DS1

Name: VP Finance
Description: About Rocksbox  Rocksbox is a venture-backed, fast-growing jewelry eCommerce business. Our vision is to build the destination retail brand for jewelry and accessories. We leverage technology and data to deliver a personalized shopping experience and products that our customers love. We believe in building a healthy business for the long term, so we are metrics driven, with strong unit economics. At Rocksbox our mission is to build a brand that inspires others to live life to the fullest. We are passionate about the evolution of retail and about building experiences that our customers love.  Rocksbox is looking for a hands-on financial leader, strategist and manager to join our executive team. As VP of Finance you will report directly to the CEO and be responsible for all aspects of finance and accounting, including financial strategy, accounting, financial planning and budgeting, capital strategy, financial infrastructure, investor management, and board communications. Business Analytics and HR teams will also report into you. In this role you will:Build and lead high performing finance team. Develop strengths and ownership on your team, empowering your team to grow and to drive impact for themselves and the company.Oversee accurate financial accounting, reporting, taxes and compliance.Manage accounting team (currently outsourced) to complete monthly financials.Manage all tax reporting. Responsible for completion of the annual income tax return working with external firm in order to ensure timely filing.Develop strategy and build system to support recent changes in ecommerce tax law.Support financial planning and budgeting.Develop and support internal planning and budgeting process, working across all functional areas of the business, including merchandising, marketing, operations and engineering.Develop tools, processes and communication touch-points to support transparency and empower smart and quick decisions across and within the teamShape company strategy.Work closely with the CEO and leadership team on ongoing basis to evolve our overall strategy and evaluate risks and strategic scenarios, providing knowledge of financials drivers, risks, sensitivities, trade-offs and opportunities.Develop long term capital strategy for the business, leveraging existing and new financial partners to make smart and strategic capital decisions as we scale.Scale finance infrastructure.Scale financial infrastructure, including systems, tools, and processes. Will need to oversee moving to new finance system as the company grows.Own relationship with Stripe, Recurly, and other payment partners.Investor relations and corporate governance.Support investor and stakeholder communications, including investor reporting, Board communications and cap table management.Oversee Business Analytics team, responsible for providing analytics support across all functional areas of the business.Oversee HR function, including all aspects of payroll, benefits, 401K, culture and team.Requirements:You demonstrate VP qualities, including:Thought leader. Name: Product Manager, Data
Description: Recurly is seeking a Product Manager to help build a high-volume, highly reliable, and powerful data solutions that would power machine learning efforts, merchant-facing product features, and business analytics. This person will own the strategy, develop the roadmap for our data platform, and work closely with leaders across the organization to realize the product vision. In addition to owning the data product strategy, this position allows for design, launch, and project management, and is a unique combination of product owner and business analyst which is a great blend of technical, product, and data responsibilities. Responsibilities:Work with our customers to understand their targets, challenges, and goals.Craft data products that will help address customer needs - whether that is adding new data into the data warehouse, enhancing dashboards and visualizations, or improving tooling for data science.Ensure compliance and accuracy across all data and reports.Create the roadmap for defining and building out core data reporting.Work with our Data and Platform Services teams to identify complex business questions and formulate a plan to break down these problems into solvable pieces.See around corners of unknown data needs and get them coordinated into the roadmap.Help define user experience and build reports and dashboards.Proactively communicate status, risks, and changes to scope to the rest of the organization.Requirements:2+ years of experience building out the infrastructure, analytics, and/or data science products as a software engineer.3+ years as a Product Manager, from prioritizing opportunities to gathering and writing requirements.Experience collaborating with data scientists and engineers, and forming the connective tissue between the data team and the rest of the company.Experience working with data platforms (data warehouse, analytics, reporting, visualizations).Validated experience in the understanding of balancing internal stakeholder and end- customer goals and turning them into successful products.Ability to articulate the value of a data platform in a commercial way.Loves to get into the detail and solving problems but can also step back and communicate the bigger picture.Independent and collaborative. Able to work across cross-functional teams and manage projects to completion.Ability to set and manage customer expectations and to negotiate appropriate resolutions to issues.About Recurly: Recurly is an enterprise-class subscription management platform that cuts through the complexity of subscription management to optimize and automate revenue growth. Founded in 2009, Recurly uses an open platform approach to easily connect with a broad variety of back-office systems. In addition to enabling lightweight and flexible custom integrations, Recurly also has powerful out-of-the-box integrations with enterprise solutions like Salesforce, NetSuite, and Avalara to provide efficiencies through end-to-end automation of billing events throughout the customer lifecycle.  Recurly's flexible architecture, coupled with deep expertise in the payments industry is validated by the billions of dollars in transactions the company processes each year. Thousands of companies worldwide depend on Recurly to manage and optimize their rapidly-growing subscription businesses.  Offices located in San Francisco, California and Boulder, Colorado.

Name: Vice President, Advance Analytics
Description: Vice President, Advanced Analytics Komodo Health is transforming healthcare predictive analytics with its own proprietary data cloud and streaming data analytics platform. Our real-time healthcare intelligence engine provides healthcare business leaders the ability to modernize and improve the way they engage and serve the medical community, and the result is a more transparent, efficient and productive healthcare ecosystem, ultimately leading to reduced patient disease burden.  Our Advanced Analytics practice seeks experienced and entrepreneurial leaders who are ready to lead and grow an Advanced Analytics team. This is an excellent opportunity for accomplished Life Sciences leaders to have massive impact at a fast-growing technology company. The Vice President, Advanced Analytics, will lead and grow the Komodo Health Advanced Analytics function to deliver customer value through Komodo's analytics services capabilities. The role requires comfort interfacing with a diverse set of internal stakeholders (Product, Engineering, People, Finance) and Life Sciences customers ranging from Commercial (Marketing, Sales, and Analytics), Medical Affairs, Clinical Operations, Market Access, and Real-World Evidence, and an ability to engage, communicate, consult, and partner effectively.  At Komodo Health, we value our culture of encouraging growth, collaboration, and constructive debate as well as delivering innovative solutions and services that "wow" our customers. Komodo Health is backed by leading technology investors on the East and West Coasts, and is partnered with leading academic institutions, technology leaders and life sciences thought leaders. Responsibilities:Team Leadership and ManagementSet Advanced Analytics team vision and goals, and execute to deliver on the goals and the visionSet and improve inter-team and cross-functional processes for operational effectivenessRecruit, deploy, manage, and engage Advanced Analytics team membersLead team capacity planning and resource managementCoach, train, and guide Advanced Analytics team targetsDevelop and grow relationships with key customers to support engagement with Komodo products and services; develop customer championsMaintain a thorough understanding of customers' needs, gaps, account strategy and customer engagement to optimize customer interactions for impactInternal Collaboration and General LeadershipDevelop Komodo Health's external thought leadership through presence at key industry conferences, summits, and networking events; Present Komodo Health capabilities or key insights where appropriateAct as an adviser and SME to Sales and Account Management teams during opportunitiesCollaborate closely with Product and Engineering teams to identify and develop new analytics service offerings; act as an internal adviser to provide deep industry and customer contextShare customer feedback with Product, Engineering, and other cross-functional colleagues to enhance ongoing product development effortsRequirements:10+ years' experience in client-facing roles of increasing responsibility delivering analytics or consulting services to Life Sciences customers within innovative technology or commercial solutions providers to the Life Sciences industry, top analytics consulting or boutique life sciences analytics consulting firms5+ years prior experience managing 5 or more direct reports and managing other people managersProven track record of delivering services revenue at or above target, individually and as a team leadHands-on experience in business analytics in biopharma, including experience working with sales, marketing, market access, and other HCP, provider, payer, and patient-level dataAdvanced storytelling, communication, and interpersonal skills, and experience owning high-profile customer relationshipsSuccessful track record of developing long-term business relationships with Life Science customers in Marketing, Commercial Analytics, Medical Affairs, or Market AccessAbility to successfully manage multiple customer relationship and projects with high quality and grace under pressureAgility to work across internal teams to deliver to customer contractual requirements and business needsFlexible mindset to embrace use of new software applications and cloud-based platformsDemonstrated track record of growing and retaining high performing teams and culture in a fast-paced, dynamic and rapidly changing startup don't just accept difference we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products, and our community. Komodo Health is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.

Name: Solution Architect
Description: At Anaplan, we believe in hard work, having fun, and bringing excellence to everything we do. Our product is arguably the most sophisticated in its class, but our product alone does not make heroes of our customers. Our Customer Success team does. A position on our team gives you the opportunity to take the "service" in "software-as-a-service" to a whole new level, and enjoy rapid career growth while you're at it.  Anaplan is changing the way companies plan and this isn't Customer Success as usual. We're looking for a SOLUTION ARCHITECT who delight in the most detail-oriented and challenging puzzles. Based in San Francisco, this is a fantastic opportunity for a high-achiever able interpret complex business challenges into solution designs for clients.  We're not looking for average. Do you enjoy diving into issues and designing complex solutions? Do you have a passion for data, multi-dimensional modeling and data integration? If so, this job is for you. What you'll be doing: As an architect, you are primarily responsible for the successful delivery of Anaplan planning solutions in strategic accounts. You will: Translate existing solutions, spreadsheets, and business problems into sophisticated Anaplan multi-dimensional modelsModify existing models as part of a connected solution, optimization, or to incorporate new functionalityServe as the architectural SME for large-scale connected planning solutionsExemplify The Anaplan WayProvide candid, meaningful feedback and progress updates in a timely manner to the Business Partner and teamDevelop model documentationParticipate in data integration and migration solutionsParticipate and/or lead UAT testing and deploymentMore about you:A 4 year degree in Finance, Accounting or MIS4+ years' experience implementing Enterprise Performance Management solutionsAdvanced Microsoft Excel / financial modeling skillsDemonstrated knowledge of a formal system implementation methodology requirements gathering, design, build/test and deploy (Agile methodology preferable)Superb written and oral communication skillsProven ability to lead execute responsibilities simultaneouslyPenchant for service excellence and a collaborative styleSubject matter expertise in planning and modeling in Supply Chain, Finance or Sales strongly preferredStrong understanding of data integration (inbound and outbound)Passion for business analytics, modeling and planningExcellent problem solving and analytical skillsResults-oriented, motivated, self-starterCoaching mentalityCollegial, open and grounded in integrityDesire to work with a truly dynamic and exciting team, with a "roll-up your sleeves" approachStrong desire to excel and be committed to gaining exposure to multiple industries while further developing your career Bonus Points:Excellent problem solving and analytical skillsResults-oriented, motivated, self-starterCoaching mentalityCollegial, open and grounded in integrityDesire to work with a truly dynamic and exciting team, with a "roll-up your sleeves" approachStrong desire to excel and be committed to gaining exposure to multiple industries while further developing your careerWhat we offer:A rewarding, progressive career with a company that values diversity, flexibility and understands the need for a good work/life balance.Market-leading salaries combined with generous bonuses, equity and a range of comprehensive benefits.Regular agile meetups, events and hackathons (both attending and hosting!)Flexible working, catered lunches, a fully stocked kitchen and plenty of parties & eventsA range of sports, health and wellbeing initiatives3 days of paid leave every year to help support the charity or cause of your choice.The chance to contribute and evolve a company with a valuation over $1.4 billion Do you align with Anaplan's Values? Open: We share fearlessly for the greater good Explore all of our Values on Anaplan.com/careers #AnaplanLOVE About Anaplan We're building a truly unique technology. From our calculation engine and in-memory data store, to apps and predictive analytics; amazing technology is being developed every day.  We're addressing a $100B/year problem that all global businesses face. Our mission is to break the traditional business planning mold, currently performed through spreadsheets or legacy systems. Anaplan's Connected Planning platform is enabling customers to improve decision-making by turning response time into real time.  With 900+ customers and 175+ partners globally, Anaplan's platform is solving some of the most complex challenges in business. CEOs, analysts, and the press agreeAnaplan is changing the way the world does business. Learn about our history, see our recognitions and achievements, and take a look at what it's like to work at Anaplan.  Get to know more about working at Anaplan by checking out our social channels. FacebookTwitterInstagramYouTubeCAN'T FIND THE PERFECT ROLE FOR YOU? NEW OPPORTUNITIES ARE OPENING UP DAILY:ANAPLAN.COM/CAREERS #LI-TT1

Name: Senior Financial Analyst
Description: a little bit about usWe're on a mission to simplify the everyday lives of consumers. We believe post-purchase is a critical phase of the customer journey. That's why we created Narvar - a platform focused on driving customer loyalty through seamless post-purchase experiences that allow retailers to retain, engage, and delight customers. If you've ever bought something online, there's a good chance you've used our platform!  From the hottest new direct-to-consumer companies to retail's most renowned brands, Narvar works with Glossier, Home Depot, Neiman Marcus, Sonos, and 500+ other brands. With offices in San Francisco, London, and Bangalore, together we've served over 306 million consumers worldwide across 5 billion interactions, 38 countries, and 50 languages.  Pioneering the post-purchase movement means navigating into the unknown. Our team thrives on this sense of adventure while nurturing a mindset of innovation. We're a home for big hearts and we leave our egos at the door. We work hard but we always make time to celebrate professional wins, baby showers, birthday parties, and everything in between.the roleAs a Senior Financial Analyst on our finance team, you will play a key role in developing Narvar's strategic and financial planning function to support our rapid growth. In addition to driving and supporting our financial planning, forecasting, reporting, and analysis efforts, you will have the opportunity to turn these insights into initiatives and help drive strategic decisions. This is a unique opportunity to work directly with senior management to drive the direction of the business by analyzing and implementing strategic initiatives.what you'll doLead the long-term strategic and financial planning process, partnering with functional leaders to shape business priorities and develop financial plans to execute against those prioritiesCreate and monitor our annual budget and monthly forecastsDevelop forecast models and drive towards their achievement in partnership with various other functional teamsPrepare reporting packages including comprehensive Key Performance Indicator (KPI) reporting, analysis of key business trends, and comprehensive executive-level analysesAssist in preparing analysis, commentary, and presentation material for Board of Directors meetings, operations reviews, management meetings, and financial reviewsPrepare detailed variance analysis of financial statements and managerial reports and understand, analyze, and report on key variances between actuals and planDevelop and enhance reporting on competitive intelligence, customer intelligence, geographic economic data, and technology trendsCollaborate with cross-functional teams to model and execute business analytical projects and support company initiatives and financial decisionsPartner with the accounting team on month-end close reporting with respect to the close package and the accuracy and completeness of the financial resultsPerform ad hoc financial analysis to support business decisionswhat we're looking forYou have a bachelor's degree in a business-related field (finance, accounting, economics) or engineering from a top schoolYou have at least 3-4 years combined experience in financial analysis, budgeting, or investment bankingYou have SaaS industry experienceYou have exceptional attention to detail and organizational skills, demonstrating the ability to dive into details and reconcile differencesYou have strong analytical skills with the ability to make recommendations around processYou have strong communication and interpersonal skills and can work across all levels within the organizationYou can work independently and as a member of a teamYou have strong financial systems and business application skills including Excel, PowerPoint, and other web-based management reporting toolsYou're excited to be a part of a fast-paced, high-growth companyWe are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Name: Partner Marketing Manager
Description: THE COMPANY Pantheon powers the world's professional websites. Our multi-tenant, container-based cloud platform enables businesses to run mission-critical Drupal & WordPress websites. Developers, Marketers and IT can instantly scale in response to unplanned traffic spikes, without upgrading VMs or clusters. Large enterprises use Pantheon, including eBay, AdRoll, Cisco, United Nations, and Yale University.  We value teamwork, humor, and hard work, balanced with solid social time together. We're enthusiastic participants in several open-source communities and have real relationships with many of our most active customers and that's where you come in. THE ROLE Pantheon is currently looking for a motivated, proactive and energetic Partner Marketing Manager to join our Marketing Team. This candidate will work full-time out of our San Francisco or Minneapolis office as a full-time team member.  The Partner Marketing Manager will fully own our channel marketing program to web development agencies. The ideal candidate has a proven track record of success in managing and growing a channel or partner program and can bring new ideas to the table to enrich the Pantheon Partner Program. Experience in channel marketing and proven skills in sales collaboration are a must. COOL THINGS YOU'LL DO The primary responsibility of the Partner Marketing Manager is to build, manage, and grow Pantheon's channel marketing program to retain existing agency partners and acquire new agencies to join the Partner Program. This role is the front lines for channel sales and revenue growth.  You will serve as the product owner of Pantheon's Partner Program. This role will be expected to do the following: Ownership of all channel marketing programs and agency messagingOwnership of channel marketing KPIs and strong opinions on how to drive measurable impactLeading initiatives cross-functionally with multiple teamscollaboration is a non-negotiableIdeating on ways to expand program offeringsWorking with Pantheon's Sales and Product teams to refine our story and product for agenciesBuilding strong relationships with agency partners for content collaboration and sales channel growthWhat You Bring To The TableBA/BS or equivalent3+ years successfully managing a partner or loyalty programDemonstrated track record of growing channel marketing programs to drive company revenueStrong verbal and written communication skillsExperience writing long and short-form marketing copy, and executing on marketing strategyHighly collaborative working style with the ability to work cross-functionally across internal teams; ability to manage external client and vendor relationshipsCompetency in web and business analytics tools and reportingHighly resourceful, self-motivated with a strong sense of ownership in areas of responsibilityVery organized, exceptional attention-to-detail with the ability to prioritize competing time demandsStrong desire to make an impact at a high-growth/high potential startup Bonus Points For:Experience in marketing technology, open source, and/or website developmentExperience with agency marketing or account managementWorking knowledge of marketing automation tools like Marketo, Salesforce and Google AnalyticsA compelling cover letter stating why you are the right person for the role and PantheonCool Stuff You'll Get In Return We have all the usual benefits and perks you'd expect from a high tech company, but what we can really offer you is a fantastic work environment powered by an amazing team. And oh yeah, some other things to note: Fun at WordPress and Drupal community eventsDiscounts on custom bicycles - the founders of Pantheon also founded Mission BicycleDog-friendly office (SF)Fully loaded kitchen and daily catered lunchesMonthly gym and book allowanceKombucha on tap and omg...did you say Its-Its are in the freezer? (SF)Pantheon complies with applicable state and local laws governing non-discrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Name: Forward Deployed Solution Engineer / Sales Engineer Early Professional
Description: C3 is the leading AI software platform for digital transformation. At the C3 Platform's core is the revolutionary C3 Type Systeman extensible, model-driven AI architecture. The comprehensive and proven C3 Platform enables enterprises to develop, deploy, and operate enterprise-scale AI applications 10 to 100x faster than alternative approaches. Overview of the Role Forward Deployed Solution Engineers (FDSE) work at the leading edge of our business to rapidly and accurately configure the C3 Platform and Application solutions to solve complex business problems involving significant scale and technical complexity in new domains and for new customers.  FDSEs work closely with the customer's IT, business analytics, and data science teams to demonstrate the capabilities of the C3 Platform. Our FDSEs are comfortable architecting systems that require analyzing high-volume, high-frequency, broad, unstructured or real time data sets. Data science and big data techniques are core to the C3 Platform and the FDSEs maintain conversational and technical competency in these areas. We're looking for engineers who are technical and also enjoy selling and interacting with customers to solve high impact, previously unsolved problems.  Recent examples of successful engagements include predictive maintenance on oil and gas equipment and aircraft subsystems, supply chain optimization, manufacturing yield optimization, chronic disease prevention, customer spend prediction, and equipment lifetime optimization. These are high value projects with high levels of internal and external visibility. Your Responsibilities:Collaborate with Forward Deployed Solution Leaders and other C3 domain experts, including application engineers, product managers, and data scientists to deliver pre-production applications on the C3 IoT Platform using C3 DSL, JavaScript, Python, and HTML/CSS.Design, develop and maintain demos using C3 DSL and JavaScript, Python, HTML, CSS.Conduct C3 Platform and application demonstrations and training to both internal and external audiences.Participate in all appropriate product, sales, procedural training, and certification to acquire and maintain knowledge necessary to be effective in the position.Requirements:Bachelor of Science in Computer Science, Engineering, MIS, or comparable area of study.Experience in both front and back end development, exposure to CSS & HTML, and significant skill in one or more of the following languages: JavaScript, Java, and/or Python.Experience demonstrating software products, presenting technical deep-dives, and technical objection handling.General knowledge of big data, database, batch/stream processing, and cloud technologies.Understanding of machine learning concepts, examples and benefits.Highly communicative and team oriented.Strong work ethic, goal-oriented, attention to detail and proven record of delivery.Preferred:Familiarity of CLI tools, specifically: awk, sed, grep, find, tail, head, curl.Familiarity with version control tools, specifically: Git.Technical competency in Data Science, i.e. experience in describing or programming machine learning algorithms.Experience in working in an AGILE engineering organization.Understanding of the competitive landscape in enterprise big data and machine learning platforms.Competency in public speaking & customer interaction. C3 provides a competitive compensation package and excellent benefits including: Competitive salary, generous stock options, 401K, medical, dental, and vision benefits. At the office, we offer a fully stocked kitchen with catered breakfast and lunch, table tennis and pool table, free membership at our on-site gym, Friday evening social hours with food, drink and music and a fun team of great people. C3 is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of any legally protected characteristics, including disabled and veteran status.

Name: Director, Supply Chain Fulfillment Operations
Description: With thousands of beautiful spaces built for travel and life, Sonder is transforming the future of hospitality. Each Sonder is purposefully selected, designed and maintained - customized to reflect the vibe of its neighborhood. Whether your stay is two days, two months or two years, in a studio or a six-bedroom, Sonder ensures a unique, yet consistent experience. And with 24/7 on-demand service, crisp linens, and over 200 other quality standards, were taking stay further for guests all around the world.Sonder started a little over four years ago, and now has thousands of spaces in cities across the globe. We are looking for a hands-on operations leader to be responsible for all aspects of fulfillment operations and warehouse management related to bringing a Sonder unit to life. In this role you will work to continuously improve Sonders supply chain, with the ultimate goal of providing an amazing guest experience.AT SONDER YOU WILL:Build a world-class team with high likelihood of team expansion as we scale furtherDevelop and execute on strategy on supply chain process across the value chain, including warehouse operations, network strategy, and logisticsEnsure infrastructure can scale with company growthBring a sense of urgency and ownership to delivering on business goalsWork cross-functionally with sourcing, product, business analytics, finance, and interior design teams to ensure that fulfillment is in sync with other functional teams' decisions and activities on ongoing basisDetermine network strategy to match business goalsCollaborate with general managers in each city to drive supply chain strategy and processes WHAT WE LOOK FOR:10+ years of experience in hands-on operations, supply chain, and/or logistics, including leadership role in fast growing start-upExperience working with or implementing a Warehouse Management System (WMS) programExperience selecting and/or working with 3PL partnersQuantitative. Comfortable owning the numbers and using data to inform decision makingStrong sense of ownership and problem-solving skills; willing to roll up the sleevesSignificant project/team management experienceCollaborative, positive attitude, hard workingEffective communicator, leader and managerStrong desire and ability to deal with ambiguity in the absence of defined systems and processes - this is what you will be building! A perfectionist, obsessing over all the detailsWe also have great benefits to make your life easier so you can focus on what you're best at:• Competitive salary• Generous stock option plan• Medical, dental and vision insurance• Unlimited vacation• Annual free credits and discounts to stay in Sonders• A company with a huge vision, a dynamic work environment, and a team of smart, ambitious and fun to work-with colleagues!Depending on your location:• Daily catered lunches• All the coffee you can imagine• Snack-filled kitchenWe are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Name: (Lead/Senior) Database and Implementation Engineer
Description: (Lead/Senior) Database and Implementation Engineer  Location: San Francisco  Reports To: Director of Engineering  Aktana is looking for a talented Senior Database Engineer to help develop and administer large-scale data integration, data processing and data analytics database and platform.  Responsibilities:   Architect, design, and implement large scale data management and business analytics  solutions at a detailed level by applying industry knowledge, best practices, and  architectural guidance to ensure system functionality, performance, and cost efficiencies   Create packages, procedures, functions, triggers, and views to implement business logics   Analyze and understand data sources and end-user requirements to deliver data  integration solutions for managing Aktana data.   Design, build, test, implement, and support ETL/Data Integration solutions that meet  defined requirements   Formulate and implement monitoring, security, and availability policies, procedures and  standards relating to server and storage management.   Manage database updates to production using SQL scripts or other automation  technology   Script and/or develop in-depth application and database monitoring tools and recovery  mechanisms.   Background in tuning and optimizing of MySQL, SQL Server, Oracle, or Postgres  environments as well as diagnosing and solving performance issues.  Requirements:  Education  o BS/MS degree in Computer Science or related fields and/or equivalent work experience.  People and Project Management Skills  o Excellent verbal and written English communication skills  o Ability to lead and mentor heterogeneous engineering teams in complex projects  o Incredible work ethic that thrives in fast paced, collaborative, dynamic team work  environment  o Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously, meeting different schedules and  deadlines  o Proven ability and desire to deliver projects on time, on quality  o Able to cope with and thrive in uncertain and changing project requirements  o Ability to lead technical projects and code at the same time  o Experience with/understanding of Agile development processes  Technology Skills and Experience  o 5+ years database development and architecture experience in a production  environment supporting large data platforms.  o Strong experience of data modeling, schema design, and stored procedures  o Strong experience on SQL, Procedural SQL including programming and ways to  optimize SQL code in one of RDBMS environments  o 4+ years of ETL Development experience with strong ETL and SQL  programming skills (required); MySQL experience (required)  o Experience with ETL (required), Pentaho (preferred), Informatica or similar tools  o Working experience with both high volume OLTP and high volume batch processing  o Tuning experience with high volume OLTP and high volume batch processing  o Strong scripting and automation skills with bash, perl, python, java, or ruby on Linux  and Windows environments.  o Demonstrated understanding of RDBMS clusters and replication with one of RDBMS  systems: MySQL , SQL Server, or Oracle,  o Extensive experience on system and database monitoring  o MySQL , SQL Server, or Oracle certification required  o Demonstrated self-motivation and a personal track record of life-long learning  Pluses:  o Understanding differences in setup/tuning strategy for different OS platforms:  especially Linux vs. Windows  o DNS Services  o Experience with NoSQL data management and analysis technologies such as  Cassandra, MongoDB, Hadoop, HDFS, HBase, Pig, Hive, Redis, MemcacheD
