Name: Regional Sales Manager- SF
Description: WHO WE ARE Looker is on a mission to bring better insights and data-driven decisions to every business. Everything we do is aimed at making sure our customers love every aspect of Looker, from our products and technologies to our ease of doing business and our support. We are looking for curiously brilliant individuals to join our team as we reinvent data analytics. Get data-driven and see yourself at Looker. WHAT WE'VE GOT GOING ONWe are seeking an experienced Software/SaaS sales manager and leader for our western region (quota carrying) sales team. You will work with a team of direct reports to build and scale a high performing sales team for Lookers small and medium size business tiers. WHAT WE NEED YOU TO DOA Strong Manager & Communicator. You are a people person who is a great recruiter, motivator, mentor and coach with a proven track record in building high performing sales teamsAn Amazing Salesperson. You are passionate about sales, sales best practices, and strategies for optimizing sales outcomesA Team Player. Proven collaborator and liaison with all levels and departments within an organizationAn Experienced, Proven Leader. You have done this before. You know what it takes to build and develop high-performing inside sales teams in todays modern SasS and subscription-based software marketsThis is a manager level, quota-carrying position that is critical to the overall success of LookerThis position is based out of our San Francisco officeWHAT YOU BRING TO LOOKER5+ years minimum experience and proven performance in a SaaS and/or subscription-based software sales management role, ideally in business intelligence, analytics, or related data technologyA deep understanding of what it takes to hire, ramp, and manage entry level and early-stage sales teams and line level sales managers to a high level of performanceGreat communication, coaching, and leadership skillsA natural orientation for collaboration and working with cross-functional teams to optimize for company outcomes#LI-AL1A LITTLE MORE ABOUT LOOKERLooker is a complete data platform that offers data analytics and business insights to every department, and easily integrates into applications to deliver data directly into the decision-making process. Over 1,600 industry-leading and innovative companies such as Sony, Amazon, The Economist, IBM, Spotify, Etsy, Lyft and Kickstarter have trusted Looker to power their data-driven cultures. The company is headquartered in Santa Cruz, California, with offices in San Francisco, New York, Chicago, Boulder, London and Dublin, Ireland. Investors include CapitalG, Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers, Meritech Capital Partners, Redpoint Ventures, First Round Capital, Sapphire Ventures and Goldman Sachs. For more information, connect with us on LinkedIn, Twitter, Facebook and YouTube or visit looker.com.Looker aspires to be a workplace that is not only free of discrimination, but one that fosters inclusion and belonging. We strongly believe that diversity of experience, perspective, and background lead to a better environment for our employees and a better product for our users. We encourage you to join us in changing the way businesses use data.

Name: Director, Sales Strategy & Operations Global Industries GoToMarket
Description: Join us as we pursue our disruptive new vision to make machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers. At Splunk, we’re committed to our work, customers, having fun and most importantly to each other’s success. Learn more about Splunk careers and how you can become a part of our journey.Role:Splunk is seeking an analytical and strategic operations leader to join the Global Sales Strategy & Operations Team. This individual will be a key business partner and trusted advisor to our Global Industries GoToMarket team. Splunk is in its infancy stages of building out the industries practice and this individual will be a key contributor in shaping the company’s industries strategy, resource investments and operating cadence.  Key responsibilities will include determining the early success metrics of the Industries GTM team and developing highly repeatable and scalable industry-specific campaigns by closely interlocking with our Products, Market Group, Marketing and Sales team. Ultimately, each industries team will be successful if it is growing faster than the rest of the business and boosting our sales team’s productivity.  The ideal candidate will be data driven, system savvy, intellectually curious, a fast learner, detail oriented and able to move quickly while keeping focused on high impact projects with limited direction and supervision. Equally important, this individual will also be able to communicate effectively with sales leadership and senior executives across multiple departmentsResponsibilities:Planning – Work with global leadership teams as well as cross functional leaders (HR, Finance, Product, Marketing, etc.) to design and execute the industries GTM sales motion, determine the resources required to execute the plan, align on strategies and execution plan with our direct sales teams, and socialize the plan with the broader GTM team. This person will be the strategic voice of the Global Industries team.  Execution – Manage day-to-day operational tasks, including but not limited to headcount and resourcing allocation, salesforce.com hierarchy and industries data management. Improve processes and increase efficiencies for the sales organization as well as for the sales operations group.  Reporting & Analytics – Ensure key dashboards and reports are accurate and relevant. Leverage existing and/or new applications to improve delivery technology. Collaborate with senior management to refine KPIs and interpret results into actionable recommendations. Identify trends to improve business results including lead conversion, lead management and pipeline reporting.  Project Management – Ensure surgical execution of the industries strategies across the various GTM functions. Ensure all parties are well-aligned and socialized of various initiatives launched by the Global Industries GTM team.Requirements:8+ years of experience in Management Consulting, Investment Banking, Business Strategy or Sales/GoToMarket Operations role desiredExperience working for fast-growing enterprise software companies is a plusWorks effectively in complex and matrixed organizations. Able to see the big-picture while also being hands-on and in the details.Always focused on doing what’s right for the business. High energy and contagious enthusiasm. Willing to take on the tough projects and challenges to support growth of the business.Ability to be highly productive with minimal oversight from senior management.Sets goals and drives to fulfillment. Takes responsibility for actions and for outcomes.Possesses business acumen, strong analytical, troubleshooting, problem-solving, and project management skills.Strong interpersonal skills and able to speak in front of senior audiences as well as write clearly, concisely, and compellinglyDemonstrated ability to solve problems and provide practical business insights from complex data setsGathers and uses data strategically to create improvements and persuade othersAbility to manage multiple concurrent projects and drive initiatives in a cross-functional environment.Willing to travel as needed (~25%)Location: San Francisco or San JoseBachelor’s Degree in an analytical field (e.g. Computer Science, Business, Engineering, Mathematics, or Statistics).MBA/ graduate degree preferred but not required We value diversity at our company. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which the candidate is applying. For job positions in San Francisco, CA, and other locations where required, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Name: Director, Consultant Relations
Description: DayTwo is seeking a Director of Consultant Relations to drive our early stage consulting and sales growth in the areas of health managements and employee benefits at Fortune 500 companies, and with major benefits consultancies. Drawing on a strong understanding of the healthcare marketplace, business, and international healthcare systems, this highly motivated individual, is responsible for formulating strategies to directly develop, define, negotiate and close key partnership deals across the U.S. This role will rely heavily on your ability to bring your network and healthcare experience to craft effective working relationships, with the ultimate goal of establishing DayTwos product pipeline of microbiome-based diagnostics and therapeutic solutions as the preferred choice in leading healthcare organizations.Relationships-driven and mission-oriented, this leader will build strong relationships with a consultative sales mindset. Possessing a strong understanding of the healthcare marketplace, this sales leader will identify and secure new business opportunities and partnerships with various players in the space, specifically targeting employee benefits consultants and leverage key consultant relationships. Initially, this will be an individual contributor role; however, this individual will have the opportunity to build and lead a team of strategic account executives as DayTwo continues to scale and grow its business across the U.S. DayTwo is in an exciting, growth phase, and the Director should be excited about evolving with the organization and continuing to grow professionally and personally.ResponsibilitiesWork in conjunction with the COO to establish short and long term Go-To-Market strategy to develop and execute comprehensive sales initiatives for the healthcare marketplaceIdentify healthcare providers and influencers, assess and develop new market initiatives, and analyze business opportunities to strengthen, expand and drive market penetration, along with strong channel partnership effortsRapidly build a sales pipeline that can support a sustainable sales targetDevelop and cultivate high level executive relationships with assigned prospects Act as advisor on marketing and branding initiatives Coordinate across consultant channels in building relationships and awareness of solutionsDirect implementation of comprehensive programs and oversee vendors for continuous process improvementConsult with clients to formulate solutions for employer-based wellness and health management programs Negotiate best practice contract termsUnderstand target customers business needs, leveraging consultative skillset to develop customized proposalsScope proposals to ensure appropriate levels of and accounting for consultant engagement, services, and deliverablesWhat You Bring To The Team10+ years of commercial experience in business development or sales in healthcare, corporate wellness and/or industry and successful experience in developing long-term, relationship based, complex, consultative solutionsBachelors Degree requiredProficiency in healthcare and market knowledge to develop and implement sales/marketing business plans to establish new partnerships in order to execute strategies for growthHave experience calling into and setting meetings with leaders at payers, including health plans and large self-insured employersExisting relations with field consultant professionals at healthcare and employee benefits consultants Proficiency in business analytics in order to forecast growth opportunities including excel and CRMs (Salesforce preferred)Strong executive presence; ability to build relationships at different levels of customer organizations from C-level to mid-level managersProven business development experience in cultivating and nurturing key relationships and ability to communicate and execute strategy consistent with client needsStrong communication and negotiation skillsTravel as required - In addition to face-to-face meetings at consultant offices, travel may include industry conferences and DayTwo-hosted eventsAmbitious, high energy individual with experience in start-ups or fast-paced, highly entrepreneurial environmentsBenefits & PerksCompetitive compensationStock OptionsHealth, dental, and visionPaid Time OffOnsite gymWalkable to BART

Name: Business Operations Associate (BizOps)
Description: We're building a best in class business operations team to help Bolt scale. We lead mission critical efforts across functions, empower our business with analytics and insights, incubate new roles, and build out strategic initiatives. You may explore how to win in new segments, map and automate processes to enable scale, or unlock new revenue opportunities. Whatever it is, Business Operations works on whatever it takes to move Bolt past our growth bottlenecks. We care about outcomes, not activity.We see this role as something that youll do for 18-24 months before finding a more permanent position inside of our growing company. You should expect a high degree of autonomy, but also ample mentorship and opportunity for growth. You'llWork with various teams (people ops, sales, marketing) to ensure that Bolt can scale through rapid growthIdentify and implement new opportunities that grow Bolt's businessDive on analyses and research that guide Bolt's growth decisionsIncubate and help run new teamsEnsure that Bolt is an amazing place to work. You can be described as follows...Strong pattern of academic and/or professional achievementExperienced in a highly strategic, analytical and operational role in a fast-paced environmentExcel in analytics and problem solvingGreat attitude High ability to get stuff done A mentality for identifying and fixing problems and issues Nice to haves:Desire to be a founder or first employee At least 1+ years of work experience in finance, consulting, tech or other rigorous environmentUnderstanding of technology and experience with various tools (e.g. SQL, Excel, Python, Asana)PolymathBolt is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

Name: Product Manager- Order Management Systems
Description: Our past is full of iconic moments but our future is going to spark many more. We're looking for the people who'll help make our next decade just as revolutionary as our first five. If you're one of the super-talented who thrive on change, aren't afraid to take risks and love to make a difference, you're the right fit. Come grow with us.  Gap Inc.'s Distributed Order Management (DOM) Product Management team helps identify, evaluate and optimize the Gap Inc. DOM capabilities by identifying opportunities, determining solutions, delivering products, conducting business analytics and improving our processes to operate efficiently and in support of our strategic goals. The DOM product team focuses on improving every aspect of the customer experience for the technology ecosystem that sits between e-commerce and our global supply chain.  As a Product Manager for the DOM, you will help shape the future of the way we support our omni-channel customers. You are responsible for all aspects of delivering digital order management that supports our global ecommerce businesses. You will own the OMS technology roadmap and implementation. You will act as the conduit between the business and the development teams, balancing strategic priorities with system stability.  The person in this position will be instrumental in delivering omni-channel capabilities that become a foundation for our strategic platform across all channels and geographies supporting a fast, efficient, and cost effective global network strategy.  What you get to do in this job: As a product management manager, own and drive opportunity assessments, definition development, monitoring and implementation of product capability roadmaps aligned to business strategies and LRP.Own defining and partnering with IT and Business Partners across Gap Inc to manage and deliver business capabilities and system solutions.Engage and communicate clearly with leaders at different levels on business and technology.Identify key issues, guide and execute analysis, develop conclusions, and present findings to members of the leadership team. Anticipate roadblocks, both intellectual and political, and proactively address issues before they impact business results.Lead cross functional projects to support supply chain process optimization end to end. This includes thought leadership, solution innovation and change management identifying process improvement opportunities, key issues, development of conclusions and implementation plans supported with qualitative and quantitative analysis.Work in a mixed model of both waterfall and agile development and deployment.Anticipate upstream and downstream impacts of the project and works with internal business groups to adjust business tools and practices in order to support new features and functionality.Communicate product solutions and benefits to customers and stakeholders; including knowledge transfer and training for on-going management of features.Recognition as an expert across Gap Inc someone who has excellent judgment and whose projects have contributed significantly to the success of Gap Inc. and can successfully champion new initiatives to leadership.What you need to be successful:Strong understanding of Distributed Order Management technologies including OMS, Order Fulfillment Optimization, Payments, Customer Communications, and Delivery. Ecommerce PdM experience with an understanding of downstream technologies could substitute for direct DOM experience.Experience with developing DOM capabilities within a DevOps model.Experience with implementing the latest OMS vendor solutions like Sterling, Manhattan, Oracle, Salesforce, etc a plusDemonstrated ability to think globally/strategically and frame new and complex issues - a serious product manager and thought leader that can make strategic choices and help focus the organization on the most critical and value-added activities.Demonstrated ability to manage multiple tasks and projects, to prioritize, and adapt to a changing and ambiguous environment.Exceptional analytical and creative problem-solving skills, strong ability to work with complex and detailed data.Proficient at project management and senior management communication.Ability to influence and manage project outcomes to deliver results.Solid interpersonal skills with proven ability to develop and maintain effective business partner relationshipsBachelor's degree in Business, Supply Chain Management, Finance, Operations or related field.Detail oriented with strong organizational skills, excellent written and oral communication skills.Demonstrated ability to manage multiple tasks and projects, to prioritize, and adapt to a changing environment.Solid interpersonal skills with proven ability to develop and maintain effective business partner relationships4+ years of experience managing multiple projects in various phases of ideation, execution, or deliveryKEY BENEFITS:Merchandise discount for our brands: 50% off regular-priced merchandise at Gap, Banana Republic and Old Navy, 30% off at Outlet and 25% off at Athleta.One of the most competitive Paid Time Off plans in the industry.*Employees can take up to five "on the clock" hours each month to volunteer at a charity of their choice.*Extensive 401(k) plan with company matching for contributions up to four percent of an employee's base pay.*Employee stock purchase plan.*Employees receive medical, dental, vision and life insurance.*Employees can apply for tuition reimbursement.*Family care programs.Commuter benefits.Pet Discount Program.For eligible employees Gap Inc. is an equal-opportunity employer and is committed to providing a workplace free from harassment and discrimination. We are committed to recruiting, hiring, training and promoting qualified people of all backgrounds, and make all employment decisions without regard to any protected status. In 2016, Gap Inc. was named one of the Best Places to Work by the Human Rights Campaign for the thirteenth consecutive year and was the sole winner of the Catalyst award for equality in the workplace in 2016.  ApplySDL2017

Name: Paid SearchAssociate -
Description: If you love the world of eCommerce and search marketing and are passionate about building a brand that uses technology to create a better shopping experience, the SEM associate role could be perfect for you! This role will be essential in bringing all of our paid search channels in-house, and continuing to build, manage, optimize, and rapidly grow them. You'll become an expert direct response advertiser through participating in end-to-end creation of ads, will have a direct impact on revenue and growth, and help manage multi-million dollar budgets at one of the fastest growing brands in America. Youre a great fit for the role if you love a good challenge, can juggle multiple projects while maintaining attention to detail, are highly analytical with a passion for testing and learning, but also enjoy using the creative half of your brain! THE JOB Help execute customer acquisition campaigns across paid search channels (Google, Bing, Yahoo), and Google Display Network. As our first true SEM hire, you will be the key player in overhauling our paid search channels, bringing all efforts in-house, and scaling rapidly. Create and implement on-going testing plans for ad copy, creative, landing pages, targeting strategies, etc. Perform in-depth data analysis to spot trends/shifts in the landscape and build actionable plans to improve performance and ROI Coordinate work flows between Marketing and many cross-functional teams, such as Brand for ad creation, Product for landing page testing, Inventory Planning for alignment in marketing efforts, and Analytics for a greater understanding of campaign performance and identifying areas of opportunity. Relentlessly analyze and optimize campaigns through A/B testing new audience segments, targeting strategies, creative testing, and keyword management / expansion. Provide ad hoc analysis as well as regular channel performance reports. Support the marketing team in various marketing initiatives, as needed. THE QUALIFICATIONS Bachelors degree in Marketing, Business, Business Analytics, or related field 1-2+ years of experience in search engine marketing campaigns on Google AdWords, Bing AdCenter and Yahoo Gemini. A keen interest in the digital advertising worldfast-paced and constantly-evolving, fueled by data-driven decisions and a desire to try whatever is new. You think that working in a startup environment with ambiguity and frequent change sounds like an exciting chance for ownership and innovation! Strong project/time-management skills, and the ability to multi-task between a mix of short-term and long-term projects, involving multiple teams and marketing partners. Very strong analytical skills with an ability to organize and scrutinize data, interpret metrics and identify trends. Excellent Excel skills THE PERKS Comprehensive health benefits 401k plan Equity Subsidized lunches Quarterly product allotment Wellness benefits including in-office massage visits

Name: Business Analyst (Contract)
Description: This position is located in our San Francisco office. OverviewYou will be responsible for managing the requirements throughout the full lifecycle of digital projects. You will play a critical role in each phase of the project. In early phases, the you will help create the business requirements definition and assist the team and client with feature prioritization. In design phases, you will write detailed functional specifications, annotations and acceptance criteria. In development and deployment phases, you will hand off artifacts to development, ensure code is written to specification, and prepare training materials for end users. You have experience as a Business Analyst, Product Owner, Product Manager or Functional Analyst within an agency or consulting setting. You also have familiarity with the full spectrum of digital projects including design, technology, strategy and analytics projects. This is a 6 month contract which can lead to longer term.What You'll Do:Act as the Subject Matter Expert throughout the entire project lifecycleGather and prioritize business requirements from diverse stakeholder groupsBuild Product Backlogs from requirements gathering activitiesWork with other disciplines to size and scope features in the Product BacklogConduct Product Backlog grooming sessions throughout the project lifecycleWork closely with Project Management to manage project scopeWork closely with team leads to plan, size and manage sprintsDocument business requirements via user stories and process flowsDocument functional requirements including writing wireframe/comp annotations, user stories, acceptance criteria, and assisting with technical and non-functional requirements.Hand off specifications to Engineering teamsReview completed development to ensure features are built to specificationPrepare training documentation for users on systems such as CMS, DAM and campaign management toolsWho You Are:3-5 years experience as a Business Analyst, Functional Analyst or Product Owner for digital product, mobile application, and/or website developmentAt least 1-2 years' experience in an agency or consulting/professional services settingExperience with agile and scrum project methodologiesFamiliarity with CMS platforms such as AEM, Sitecore, Episerver, Drupal, etc.Background in software development helpfulExperience with Jira and Confluence project management toolsA four year college degreeWho we areHero Digital is a digital consulting firm focused on creating digital brand, product, and service experiences. We are headquartered in San Francisco with offices in Philadelphia, Seattle, Dallas, and LA. In addition to competitive salaries and a full range of benefits, we offer an entrepreneurial environment that requires a passion for working hard, thinking fast, and delivering ferociously on behalf of clients. We enjoy working with one another as much as we enjoy hanging out at the end of the day.  Hero Digital is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees

Name: Business Analyst
Description: About UsWe're a small team of smart people who like working hard and having fun too, we released the most disruptive enterprise management software in the world: Odoo.  Odoo, Inc. provides a range of specialized and easy-to-use business applications that form a complete suite of tools to address any business need. Odoo gives millions of companies easy access to the software they need to run and expand their business. Odoo is the most installed business software in the world, used by over 3,000,000 users worldwide ranging from startup companies to large enterprises. Odoo's online offer is 3 times more affordable than traditional competitors like SAP and Microsoft.Odoo has a strong international presence, with offices in San Francisco, New York, Brussels, Luxembourg, Hong Kong, and Gujarat. The San Francisco office was established in 2010. Since then, we've been growing tremendously.You think it's too good to be true? See for yourself. Preview our1-click demoand read what people say about Odoo onTwitter.ResponsibilitiesTake part in the functional consulting services we provide to our partners and customers in the North and South American markets. This role focuses on getting the platform of apps set up for a client that might not have the time or resources to implement a new system on their own.Analyze customers operations, needs, and business processes in order to map them properly with Odoo software services.Quantify resources required for a task/project. You can create systems which are then used by clients that want a product they love.Accompany customers in the full delivery cycle from software configuration to "go-live" and after as they grow (you hold onto your clients even if they are not active with hours or without).Coach customers on how to use Odoo efficiently through individual sessions in a way that best helps clients manage their own open-source system.Optionally, deliver Odoo functional training sessions on-site or online one week every 2 months to train end-users or employees coming from our customers and partners (8-15 people per session).Support the sales team during pre-sale with challenging implementations, analysis when working with clients, and in connecting with clients that wonder about the possibilities of OdooYour ProfileMust-HavesA degree in either Business Administration, IS/IT, or Computer Science. We look for what really prepares people for working with businesses and their softwareBetween 1 and 5 years of experience that in business-owning, client facing, analysis, software implementation (not coding/design), and/or a passion for a career in functional consultationExcellent planning and communication skills that will lead to long-term success with clients.Ability to learn fast and execute accordingly. You will take lead with important choices, such as how you create clients' systems. You can connect with your manager during weekly one-on-one meetings as well.An affinity with the IT world, that leads you to understand what an ERP is and what open source is.Nice to HaveExperience tracking hours: Clients purchase hours for their projects and Business Analysts at Odoo work through these hours with clients. We operate in an open way, so clients have access to a portal with how you spend hours and can give feedback with every interaction as well.Available to travel 3% of your time: For the duration of their consulting work with Odoo, the consultant will work mainly from the company office in San Francisco, but they will travel to client locations to provide on-site consulting services as needed by clients and by the decision of their manager (once they are ramped up and knowledgeable hopefully, as they would not have the support of a fellow colleague on site).ValuesYou are able to work in a fast-paced start-up environment with a hands-on attitude. Help us build Odoo into a great company!You are open-minded, agile, and can react to change quicklyYou are business savvy and are not afraid to take appropriate initiativesYou are an autonomous learner as well as project manager that can hold your own with projects they are delegatedYou have a passion for software and businesses all over the world using our great platform that grows companies to new heightsYou understand things change, processes can be different in a month, and can work with leaders to train othersYou are approachable, honest, organized, and a fun team playerEmployees with BenefitsCompensation and PerksWe offer you the opportunity to join a popular open source project and receive a complete functional Odoo training. Also, a great experience in state-of-the-art web technologies and agile development in a nice working atmosphere with a young and passionate team.And last but not least, we offer you a full-time job with an attractive salary and benefits package.BenefitsHealthcare, dental, vision, life insurance, Flexible Spending Account (FSA), and  Health Savings Account (HSA).PTOsVacation time, sick leave, and standard holiday paid time off.Save on CommutePre-tax commuter benefits  (parking and transit).Discount ProgramsBrand-name product and services in categories like travel, electronics, health, fitness, cellular, and more.Prime locationRight off Highway 101, free employee parking, walking distance from MUNI as well as dozens of local restaurants.Sponsored EventsTuesday Employee Dinners, Monthly Lunch Mixers, Monthly Happy Hours,  Annual Team-Building Event, etc.Sport ActivitiesPlay any sport with at least six colleagues and the bill is covered by Odoo. Large game room in the office for everyone to enjoy!Eat & DrinkPeet's and Philz coffee as well as pantry snacks provided free for all employees.

Name: Digital Marketing Specialist
Description: What we need your help with:In partnership with the marketing manager, orchestrate integration of all paid and owned media channels to ensure optimal results.Direct/oversee integrated marketing campaign execution (working closely with our digital media agency).Consolidate and share weekly and monthly reports. Develop insights and course of action to help improve or scale performance.Help set up a complex test that employs multiple creative and channels.Performs QA of creative, landing page, and web experience. Ensure tracking accuracy.Partner with business analytics team to interpret testing results, and provide recommendations for future testing.Basic Qualifications:BA/BS degree in marketing or related field.4 years or more of digital marketing experience.Demonstrated mastery of multi-channel digital media strategy, A/B and multivariate test design, optimization and ROI.Experience in running performance/digital marketing channels (SEM/Display/Paid Social/Mobile).Preferred Qualifications:Digital agency experience is a plus.Loves to capitalize on new growth opportunities through a structured, curious, and data-driven approachProficiency of digital marketing tools such as Google Analytics, Google Adwords, Apple Search Ads, Facebook Ads manager etc.Understanding of Adwords APIs or at least that they exist and can be leveraged to find scale.Ability to clearly communicate complex workflows, dependencies and tradeoffs in both speech and writing.A sense of humor and/or the ability to have fun.

Name: Consultant II, Strategy
Description: company that is pioneering the future [*************************************** Our teams around tdown to not only delivering a better world [************************************************************* but working to mae that champions inclusion, diversity [*************************************************** and overall employee well-being [****************************** through programs suleadership. Our core values [*********************************************** define who we are,  AECOM Consultant II, Strategy in San Francisco, California  United States of America - California, San Francisco  Job Summary  Strategy Plus, AECOM's design consulting studio operates at the intersection of Business Transformation, Communications Strategy and Place Making and is looking for highly motivated applicants who possess outstanding analytical, communication and design skills. The successful candidate will join our multidisciplinary team of talented designers and be responsible for supporting our state of the art consulting projects which encompass world class corporations, healthcare and cultural institutions, universities, and local and federal government.  Working as a collaborative team player, this individual will be responsible for excellence in delivering specific activities within a project, including client interaction, communication, planning, research, data analytics, visualization, presentation preparation and report writing with oversight from a Project Manager and Principal in Charge. Our clients are located through the Americas and this individual may be required to travel up to 50% of the time.  Candidates will be expected to possess experience in one or more of the following:  Business strategy, analytics and operations planning  Communication strategy branding and marketing  Workplace strategy, planning and design  Assisting in creating and delivering change management strategies and organizational development plans  Experience in user research, design strategy, and space programming  Highly collaborative, highly communicative creative team player  Excellent presentation and communication skills - Design Story Telling  Comfortable in a fast-paced, open, creative environment  Ability to contribute to workshops, focus groups and presentations  Critical thinking and persuasive writing skills  Familiarity with research methodologies and processes  Flexibility and the ability to work on more than one project in more than one team  Minimum Requirements  Bachelor's degree in business, architecture, planning, design, social science or another relevant field  5+ years relevant post education experience  Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, Adobe Creative Suite (specifically InDesign)  Revit or other space planning / design CAD systems  Web based data analytics, visualization, GIS and presentation software  Project management, project work planning, scheduling  Space programming, user research, design strategy and conceptual design  Preferred Qualifications N/A What We Offer  When you join AECOM, you become part of a company that is pioneering the future . As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each person's potential, and we'll help you reach yours. Name: Decision Analytics Associate Consultant
Description: ZS is the world’s largest consulting firm focused exclusively on helping companies improve overall performance and grow revenue and market share, through end-to-end sales and marketing solutions – from customer insights and strategy to analytics, operations and technology. From our worldwide offices, ZS experts draw on deep industry and domain expertise to help companies make smarter decisions quickly and cost effectively. We are particularly known for our strong presence in the pharmaceutical and health care sectors, yet work across a range of industries.ZS's Business Consulting group delivers solutions to a broad spectrum of marketing and sales challenges. We also help our clients transform their marketing and sales organizations to implement these solutions. Our solutions and recommendations are based in rigorous research and analysis underpinned by deep expertise and thought leadership.DECISION ANALYTICS ASSOCIATE CONSULTANTDecision Analytics Associate Consultants (DAACs) design and execute analyses to address business problems for our clients and project teams. DAACs leverage their analytic skills to find data-driven insights that help our clients solve their most important business problems, and engage with clients to help them understand the implications and make plans to act on them.Responsibilities:• Develop and apply advanced statistical models that help clients understand dynamic business issues;• Leverage analytic techniques to use data to guide client and ZS team decision-making;• Design custom analyses in R, Tableau, SAS, Visual Basic and Excel to investigate and inform client needs;• Synthesize and communicate results to clients and ZS teams through oral and written presentations;• Develop client relationships and serve as key point of contact on aspects of projects;• Provide client and ZS teams project status updates;• Create project deliverables and implement solutions;• Advance problem solving skills and improve ZS’s capabilities;• Guide and mentor Associates on teams.Qualifications:• Bachelor's or master's degree required in any discipline with strong record of academic success in quantitative and analytic coursework such as operations research, applied mathematics, management science, data science, statistics, econometrics or engineering;• 2-4 years of relevant post-collegiate job experience. A PhD may substitute in lieu of work experience;• High motivation, good work ethic, maturity and personal initiative;• Strong oral and written communication skills;• Empathy, adaptability and emotional intelligence;• Close attention to detail, with a quality-focused mindset;• Self-discipline for planning and organizing tasks;• Aptitude for, and enjoyment of, working in teams.ZS is a global consulting firm; fluency in English is required, additional fluency in at least one European or Asian language is desirable. Candidates must possess work authorization for their intended country of employment. An on-line application, including a full set of transcripts (official or unofficial), is required to be considered.ZS Associates offers a competitive compensation package with salary and bonus incentives, complete medical/dental/life insurance programs and retirement benefits. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer.NO AGENCY CALLS, PLEASE.Connect with ZS on social media:Like ZS Careers on FacebookFollow ZS Careers on Twitter and InstagramFollow ZS on LinkedIn for more job opportunitiesSubscribe to the ZS YouTube ChannelZS has been recognized globally for its expertise in consulting and its flexible work environment. View ZS’s accolades.

Name: Manager, Brand Insights
Description: Instacart is building the best way for people anywhere in the world to shop for groceries. Since Instacart started in 2012, we've launched same-day delivery in 200 US markets. We are laser focused on delivering groceries from your favorite stores right to your door. We now cover over 60% of US households and aim to have 80% coverage by the end 2018that's 90 million households! From a technology point of view, the platform is complex, rapidly scaling and processing millions of transactions in real-time all of the time. Our technology coupled with operational expertise enables Instacart to deliver fresh groceries in as little as an hour. This is a difficult problem to master and we are making it happen. Every day, we solve incredibly hard problems to create an experience for our customers that is absolutely magical.  As we continue our fast growth, we are looking to add to our Business Development team. The Manager, Brand Insights works closely with the Director, Brand Insights to identify opportunities and trends for CPG customers to improve the experience end to end from content to advertising. The Manager utilizes all available data as well as primary and secondary research, analysis, reporting and presentation. The Manager has working knowledge of primary/custom research design as well as syndicated research. The Manager can apply and integrate multiple sources of information to communicate a holistic story to the CPG Partners to develop recommendations.  The Manager is an information expert; skilled at interpreting information and creating stories with the information; skilled in the use of a broad set of analytical tools; can merge data from a variety of sources to develop recommendations that drive Brand's volume and influence the CPG Partner's strategic direction. The Manager continually educates the Brand Partnership teams on market performance and opportunities. Primary Responsibilities/Accountabilities:Identify the key business drivers for our CPG Partners, quantify their impact on the business, deliver business  insights, make actionable recommendations to grow the business, develops and integrates consumer, customer  insight to better inform targeted strategies, plans and decisionsAbility to work independently as the key resource day to day Partner analytic needsAbility to identify the right survey and custom research opportunities for our CPG PartnersIntegrates data from a variety of sources to identify key trends and emerging solutions for the Partner & customerAid in development of white papers, heightening the Instacart Analytics equity in the ecommerce Analytics spaceApplies the full suite of tools available against business issuesJob Skill Qualifications/Abilities:3-5 years consumer package goods industry experience; category management experience and/or ecommerce  experience a plusStrong analytic / problem solving capabilityStrong syndicated and panel data knowledgeGood project management and training skillsAbility to comprehend and sell concepts within the context of Brand PartnershipsAbility to learn and apply different software applicationsSolid written / oral communication and interpersonal skillsMinimum Bachelors degreeJob Skills DevelopedAbility to analyze the business from a CPG perspective, identify the key business drivers and quantify their impact on  the business, deliver business insights, make actionable recommendations to grow the businessUnderstanding of application of primary and secondary research to drive recommendations and enhance strategic nature of partnershipsLeadership skills in identification of and addressing business opportunitiesInnovation and creativity in the development of selling stories for key business initiativesBroaden analytical tool set skills through application against business issuesBenefitsTalented and collaborative coworkers who will both push and support youMarket competitive salary, equityMedical, dental, vision benefits and 401(k) retirement planTake what you need vacation (and we really mean it)16 weeks maternity leave / 8 weeks paternity leave so you can truly bond with your childComplimentary Instacart Express membership (free Instacart delivery!)ResourcesTech BlogLife at InstacartTeam Stories

Name: Product Manager, Analytics
Description: NGINX helps the world's most innovative companies deliver their sites and applications with performance, reliability, security, and scale. More than 300 million sites including half of the Internet's busiest websites rely on NGINX. Companies like Airbnb, Box, Instagram, Netflix, Pinterest, SoundCloud, and Zappos use NGINX for advanced load balancing, web and mobile acceleration, security controls, application monitoring, and management. NGINX Software, Inc. is searching for a Product Manager (PM) to join our growing team in San Francisco. The Product Manager will be responsible for creating and executing a strategy that surfaces insight from the data we see from within modern applications.  Our culture is built upon our core values: progress, excellence, openness, and curiosity. We're a small, growing company with a startup culture and products that are chosen for high performance and efficiency by innovators around the world. If you want to make a difference, take your career to the next level, and work in a highly energetic environment, please send us your resume we'd love to talk. This is a key role with the following responsibilities:Collaborate with NGINX leadership to define NGINX's analytics product strategyTake ownership of the analytics roadmap and prioritiesKeep stakeholders informed of product plans and key dependenciesWork with development to deliver capabilities and releases on an aggressive scheduleWork with other PMs to ensure product plans are aligned and dependencies are knownEngage with customers and sales regularly to share knowledge and collect feedbackPresent as a thought leader and subject matter expert at internal, customer, and industry eventsThe ideal candidate has the following qualifications:3-5 years of enterprise software product management experience, ideally with at least 2 years of experience working on analytics, BI, and/or APM solutions.Strong knowledge of DevOps and AppDev buyers, and the ecosystem of products they useA bachelor's degree in engineering or computer scienceAn MBA is preferred but not required with sufficient experience in a PM roleNGINX Software, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. Our culture is built on values of progress, excellence, openness, and curiosity. These values are very important to our company and its continued success. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, gender, age, religion, disability, veteran status, or any other category protected by law. By fostering a diverse business environment, we welcome the opportunity to grow and learn from each other, our customers, investors, suppliers, and business partners. NGINX is not open to third-party solicitation or resumes for our posted positions. Any resume submitted to an NGINX employee by a recruiting firm that does not have a valid, written search agreement with us will be considered a referral, regardless of whether it is submitted for a posted position or for general consideration, and no matter how it is submitted (via email, the Internet, or other means). No fee will be paid in the event a candidate is hired by NGINX as a result of the referral or through other means.

Name: Technical Client Experience Professional
Description: Job Description IBM Cloud Private for Data can accelerate your journey to AI by simplifying hybrid data management, data governance, and business analytics with a single interface. Be an integral part of this team that makes data simple and available across the enterprise to help drive a data driven culture. The main responsibility as a client experience professional will be to enable different personas like Data Scientist, Data Curator, and Data Engineer to collaborate with each other on their Data Journey and help gain value from the IBM Cloud Private for Data platform.  In this role you will also get an opportunity to work with the different capabilities available in the platform around data store, data governance and data analytics. Drive user requirements around serviceability and usability in the interface using the state of the art technologies, work closely with the backend developers to bring in new features, and collaborate with the architect and the design team to meet the aggressive deadlines. Key Attributes:Collaborate across teamsDemonstrated problem solving skillsSolid client facing skillsSuccessful meeting deadlinesPreferred work locations: Leawood, KS and San Jose, CA  Required Technical and Professional Expertise Experience with the following tools and technologies: Demonstrated experience with KubernetesDemonstrated experience with DockerHadoop and SparkObject-oriented/object function scripting languages such as Python, Java, C++, etcExperience supporting, troubleshooting, and debugging web based applicationsExperience working directly with clients and be capable of diffusing issues easily and effectivelyExposure to data science, big data analyticsUnderstanding of Linux/Unix and Windows systemsDemonstrated interpersonal communicator, both in written and spoken word Preferred Tech and Prof Experience  Knowledge of one or more IBM technologies such as: IBM Data Science Experience (DSX), IBM®InfoSphere®Information Governance Catalog (IGC), IBM InfoSphere®Information Analyzer (IA), IBM Cognos Analytics and IBM Db2  EO Statement  IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Name: Director of Engineering, BA
Description: The BA Group at Splunk is looking for a seasoned engineering leader to help manage and grow a team of passionate engineers to help scale our product offering in the Business Analytics space. You are someone who thrives in a dynamic environment and has a track record of technical expertise and management responsibility. You will be responsible for driving your team to deliver creative products and releases in the Business Analytics area, with high quality and in a timely manner. You and your team will focus on enabling business users to leverage power of core Splunk technology during their daily business life. You will act as a liaison between your team and Senior Management, Product Management, Project Management etc.Requirements:Experience developing and delivering scalable, full-stack solutions.Experience developing analytics solutions for a non-technical end user.Experience building and cultivating good engineering practices and processes, like version control, test-driven development, continuous integration, and build/test/release automation.BS CS/EE or equivalent with 15+ years of industry experience, of which 5+ years is in Engineering ManagementRoles and Responsibilities:You will diagnose and resolve systemic obstacles that prevent your team from delivering high-quality software.You will champion an atmosphere of continuous improvement by serving as a coach, mentor, and technical advisor.You will meet 1-1 with team members on a regular basis.You will plan and support career development.You will recruit and retain top talent.What We Offer You:A constant stream of new things for you to learn. We're always expanding into new areas, bringing in open source projects and contributing back, and exploring new technologies.A set of exceptionally talented and dedicated peers, all the way from engineering and QA to product management and customer support.A stable, collaborative and supportive work environment.We don't expect people to work 12 hour days. We want you to have a successful time outside of work too. Want to work from home sometimes? No problem. We trust our colleagues to be responsible with their time and dedication, and believe that balance helps cultivate an extraordinary environment.We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status

Name: Business Analyst, Senior
Description: Financial Analysis Associate responsibilities include auditing high-volume expense reports, assisting with Travel and Corporate Cards administration and Vendor Maintenance. A successful Financial Analysis Associate combines excellent communication and analytical skills with a thorough knowledge of accounting principles to analyze financial information and maintain internal policy quality control.Experience in creating reports using Business Intelligence tools and processing invoices/expenses on platforms such as Concur and Oracle Fusion highly desired.Responsibilities include:Auditing expense reports to ensure compliance with T&E policy and to identify potential fraud or waste and abuse of company’s resources.Communicating expense audit progresses and findings, assisting in improving T&E policy compliance and audit plan.Answering high-volume expense/invoice inquires, researching, locating and providing clear and accurate AP information.Assisting with Shield Travel program administration by creating new profiles and answering related inquiries.Assisting with Corporate Cards administration by tracking applications, receipt acknowledgements and physical card deliveries.Adding/Editing suppliers, researching suppliers’ inquiries and other potential aspects of Vendor Maintenance.Potential responsibilities include system implementation, month-end journal entries preparation, AP reporting and internal auditing.Requires 3 to 5 years of professional experience directly related to all aspects of Accounts Payable operational, analytic and reporting functionsConcur expense / invoice processing experience highly desired, including experience creating reports using Concur’s Cognos toolAbility to communicate effectively to all levels of AP stakeholders.Self-starter and proactive learner with a strong customer service mindset, someone can work well both with a team and independently.

Name: Senior Technical Program Manager, Builder Platform
Description: About TwitchTwitch is the world’s leading video platform and community for gamers, with more than 100 million visitors per month. We connect gamers from around the world by allowing them to broadcast, watch, and chat with each other. Twitch’s live and on-demand video platform forms the backbone of a distribution network for video game broadcasters including pro players, tournaments, leagues, developers and gaming media organizations. Twitch is leading a revolution in gaming culture, turning gameplay into an immersive video experience. Learn more at http://twitch.tv.About the positionLike building platforms and tools, hard technical challenges, and enabling video content creators to earn a living doing what they love? We’re looking for a Senior Technical Program Manager to work company-wide to define and drive our builder platform. You will provide technical direction for a global staff of engineers focused on providing Twitch creators and their community with highly available experiences. You will be responsible for driving large-scale initiatives that automate and continuously improve the software development, release, monitoring and incident and problem management process for all of Twitch.You will:Define and drive a new program for internal developers building services at Twitch. Drive availability and engineering best practices across all of Twitch engineering.Work with senior engineering and leadership across the company. Develop roadmaps for large and complicated architectural changes and drive them to delivery.A perfect fit in this environment requires you to be:Adaptable to meet challenging goals in an agile team.Ready to deal with a dynamic, ever-changing environment.Self-motivated and proactive to maintain momentum and progress.A proven collaborator across all disciplines.Consider business and technical concerns. Motivated and able to quickly learn new technologies and weird things built on old ones.ResponsibilitiesStructure, kick-off, and run continuous and/or time-bound programs within and beyond the Engineering organization by clarifying priorities, enabling the execution of deliverables, defining program process flow, and providing continuous transparency.Own successful delivery of large, high impact and highly cross-functional product initiatives while simultaneously and accurately tracking a set of smaller projects.Drive strategic cross-functional planning, leading discovery and prioritization by closely partnering with product managers and engineering leads to develop program plans, including roadmap, dependency identifications and resourcing plan.Continuously improve product delivery and organization. Establish and drive adoption of program frameworks, tools and best practices. Share your program management knowledge with engineering leadership teams. Lead post program analysis to guide future programs.Communicate clearly and effectively to executive management on the plans, status and critical issues. Escalate urgent issues appropriately and driving them to closure in a timely manner.Build and maintain alignment across multiple teams within builder platform for keeping a focus on execution, continuous improvement, and operational excellence.RequirementsMinimum of 7 years of experience as a technical program manager in software/web development organizations 5+ years experience driving cross-organizational technical initiatives. Strong technical acumen. Actively participate and contribute to technical designs discussions for large scale distributed services, proactively identify challenges and risks, work closely with engineers and product manager on addressing challenges and form mitigation plans. Demonstrated ability and experience to influence, develop productive working relationships and lead to successful product delivery with product managers, engineering teams and key stakeholders from different business functions. Strong analytical and communication skills, a risk mitigation mindset and exhibit appropriate levels of urgency.Strong sense of ownership. Proactively remove program obstacles, and willingness to go above and beyond to chase down loose ends that lead to successful product delivery.Focus on results and outcome, not just process. You have experience establishing processes that are or appropriate. Zealots for specific processes and tools need not apply.PerksFull benefits, including medical, dental, vision and life401(k) savings plan with a company matchClipper Card to pay for your commute from anywhere in the Bay AreaCatered daily lunch and dinners (and hearty breakfasts three times a week)Unlimited snacks and drinksCorporate gym membershipMonthly in-office massagesFlexible time off policyWeekly happy hours and opportunity to attend one gaming event or tournament a yearTop of the line technology to help you build our own workspace

Name: Marketing Business Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionJob #: 886887  Position: Sr. Analyst, CRM Testing Status: Full time, Contract to Hire Reports to: Sr. Manager, CRM Strategy Location: San Francisco [Sephora Department] Approved department description (to be provided by recruiting team) Your role at Sephora:  As Sr. Analyst CRM Testing, you will work as part of a cross functional agile CRM scrum team focused on rapidly testing, learning and iterating new client led marketing opportunities. You will be at the center of revolutionizing our approach to Personalization testing. Your role on the scrum team will be to size, design, coordinate, measure and provide insights of A/B tests across multiple media channels and platforms: email, mobile, site, direct mail and digital paid media. Reporting to the Sr. Manager of CRM Strategy, you will lead: CRM Pilot Opportunity Sizing: Actively explore our marketing, sales and client data to identify business opportunities  Use a data centric approach to estimating the business impact of potential CRM pilots  Prioritize and manage the backlog of CRM test ideas  Campaign Test Design & Coordination: Design the test plan to ensure ability to get a statistically significant read for KPIs to support the test hypothesis  Work closely with the marketing channel specialists to ensure the test is designed and executed as needed  Be open to creatively solving for and supporting cases where a pilot requires data or functionality that isnt readily available or out of the box  Results Measurement & Insights: Measure the results of A/B tests and provide clear learnings, insights and opportunities  Track the testing throughput and incremental revenue generated by CRM pilots  Communicate results daily with the core scrum team and more broadly with the larger cross functional stakeholders.  Qualifications: 2-4 years experience in an Analytics role  Strong A/B testing background ideally across multiple channels with experience and comfort with testing processes that requires being in the details of the data  Strong SQL skills  Excellent communication skills able to articulate findings that are not always straightforward or intuitive  Experience with APT Test & Learn is a plus  Experience with Adobe Test & Target, Adobe Campaign and Tableau is a plus  A passion for client and change management  Strategic mindset  Intellectual curiosity and willingness to accept feedback  THE TEAM & MISSION Sephora is revolutionizing our approach to client-driven marketing. We are taking our passion for our clients and injecting it with new thinking and agile processes to accelerate how we do CRM. For this transformation, we need a diverse team of strategists, digital marketing experts, data scientists, developers and creatives dedicated to testing new ideas. This team will be really good at interpreting data and insights, then asking 'what if we tried...?'. Beyond ideation and concepting, we need scrappy individuals who can dig into the how. This team must thrive working in a dynamic environment to get things done. They'll use their expertise and ingenuity to fill in gaps where needed. And last, this team will be unwavering in their focus, upholding a mandate to rapidly test, iterate and inspire the entire organization with client learnings and opportunities. THE PROFILE Contagious energy  Curious, borderline obsessed with testing  Not afraid to fail, gain insights and apply to future  Advocate for personalization and relevancy  Knows how to both lead and listen in team settings  Have as much fun in ideating at a whiteboard as combing through engagement data & trends  Working at Sephoras Field Support Center (FSC) Our North American operations are based in the heart of San Franciscos Financial District, but you wont hear us call it a headquarters its the Field Support Center (FSC). At the FSC, we support our stores in providing the best possible experience for every client. Dedicated teams cater to our clients every need by creating covetable assortments, curated content, compelling storytelling, smart strategy, skillful analysis, expert training, and more. It takes a lot of curious and confident individuals, disrupting the status quo and taking chances. The pace is fast, the fun is furious, and the passion is real. We never rest on our laurels. Our motto? If its not broken, fix it. Sephora is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military/veteran status, or disability status. Sephora is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to applicants with physical and mental disabilities. Sephora will consider for employment all qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with applicable law. 2-4 years' experience in an Analytics role * Strong A/B testing background - ideally across multiple channels with experience and comfort with testing processes that requires being in the details of the data * Strong SQL skills * Excellent communication skills - able to articulate findings that are not always straightforward or intuitive * Experience with APT Test & Learn is a plus * Experience with Adobe Test & Target, Adobe Campaign and Tableau is a plus * A passion for client and change management * Strategic mindset * Intellectual curiosity and willingness to accept feedback, * Contagious energy * Curious, borderline obsessed with testing * Not afraid to fail, gain insights and apply to future * Advocate for personalization and relevancy * Knows how to both lead and listen in team settings * Have as much fun in ideating at a whiteboard as combing through engagement data & trends

Name: Regional Sales Manager- SF
Description: WHO WE ARE Looker is on a mission to bring better insights and data-driven decisions to every business. Everything we do is aimed at making sure our customers love every aspect of Looker, from our products and technologies to our ease of doing business and our support. We are looking for curiously brilliant individuals to join our team as we reinvent data analytics. Get data-driven and see yourself at Looker. WHAT WE'VE GOT GOING ONWe are seeking an experienced Software/SaaS sales manager and leader for our western region (quota carrying) sales team. You will work with a team of direct reports to build and scale a high performing sales team for Lookers small and medium size business tiers. WHAT WE NEED YOU TO DOA Strong Manager & Communicator. You are a people person who is a great recruiter, motivator, mentor and coach with a proven track record in building high performing sales teamsAn Amazing Salesperson. You are passionate about sales, sales best practices, and strategies for optimizing sales outcomesA Team Player. Proven collaborator and liaison with all levels and departments within an organizationAn Experienced, Proven Leader. You have done this before. You know what it takes to build and develop high-performing inside sales teams in todays modern SasS and subscription-based software marketsThis is a manager level, quota-carrying position that is critical to the overall success of LookerThis position is based out of our San Francisco officeWHAT YOU BRING TO LOOKER5+ years minimum experience and proven performance in a SaaS and/or subscription-based software sales management role, ideally in business intelligence, analytics, or related data technologyA deep understanding of what it takes to hire, ramp, and manage entry level and early-stage sales teams and line level sales managers to a high level of performanceGreat communication, coaching, and leadership skillsA natural orientation for collaboration and working with cross-functional teams to optimize for company outcomes#LI-AL1A LITTLE MORE ABOUT LOOKERLooker is a complete data platform that offers data analytics and business insights to every department, and easily integrates into applications to deliver data directly into the decision-making process. Over 1,600 industry-leading and innovative companies such as Sony, Amazon, The Economist, IBM, Spotify, Etsy, Lyft and Kickstarter have trusted Looker to power their data-driven cultures. The company is headquartered in Santa Cruz, California, with offices in San Francisco, New York, Chicago, Boulder, London and Dublin, Ireland. Investors include CapitalG, Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers, Meritech Capital Partners, Redpoint Ventures, First Round Capital, Sapphire Ventures and Goldman Sachs. For more information, connect with us on LinkedIn, Twitter, Facebook and YouTube or visit looker.com.Looker aspires to be a workplace that is not only free of discrimination, but one that fosters inclusion and belonging. We strongly believe that diversity of experience, perspective, and background lead to a better environment for our employees and a better product for our users. We encourage you to join us in changing the way businesses use data.

Name: Solution Architect, Energy and Utilities - IBM Consulting
Description: Job Description The Cognitive Business Decision Support (CBDS) Solution Architect for Energy & Utilities (E&U) Digital Operations is directly responsible for the successful delivery of BA&S projects to IBMs E&U clients. This individual provides hands-on leadership and direction to the Delivery team, as well as produces deliverables as appropriate. Typical client engagements for the CBDS Solution Architect include Advanced Metering and Smart Grid, business and process modeling, operational transformation, sales and operations planning, rapid process change, strategic profit improvement, cost management, quality management and customer and operational analytics to further key operational transformations. Other opportunities may include Outage Management, Distribution Management or GIS replacements, ERP implementations (SAP/Oracle) or other transformational programs. The candidate will have worked with Advanced Metering Infrastructure (AMI), Smart Grid, Outage Management, Demand Manage or GIS programs, ERP systems or other transformational initiatives. Responsibilities include:Articulate industry trends and issues and client business values with consultative selling approaches.Broad conversational expertise in the areas of Business Analytics, Customer Operations, Enterprise Asset Management and Smart Grid.Bridge technology and business solutions to harness advances in data technology, data management and analytical techniques to improve business performance.Create and implement industry solutions within the Energy & Utility environment.Assist Energy & Utility companies through significant transformations.Lead and team with IBM colleagues and vendors to develop creative solutions.Prior experience in developing Solution Architecture and Design deliverables, especially in Energy & Utility and AMI projects IBM Global Business Services (GBS) is a team of business, strategy and technology consultants enabling enterprises to make smarter decisions and providing unparalleled client and consumer experiences via Cognitive data analytics, cloud technology and mobile app development. With global reach, outcome-focused methodologies and deep industry expertise, IBM GBS empowers clients to digitally reinvent their business and get the competitive edge in the cognitive era in over 170 countries. IBM is a leader in this global transformation, and there is no better place to launch or further your career. World-class learning opportunities, mentoring and a flexible work environment  you will find a wealth of opportunities within IBM to create the career youve always imagined.  Bottom line? We outthink ordinary. Discover what you can do at IBM. Learn more about our industry work in Telecommunications and Media & Entertainment: ibm.com/industries/mediaentertainment/ BENEFITS Health Insurance. Paid time off. Corporate Holidays. Sick leave. Family planning. Financial Guidance. Competitive 401K. Training and Learning. We continue to expand our benefits and programs, offering some of the best support, guidance and coverage for a diverse employee population. ibm.com/employment/us/benefits/ibm.com/press/us/en/pressrelease/50744.wssCAREER GROWTH Our goal is to be essential to the world, which starts with our people. At our core, we are committed to believing and investing in our workforce through: Skill development: helping our employees grow their foundational skills and promoting internallyFinding the dream job at IBM: navigating our company with the potential for many careers by channeling an employees strengths and career aspirationsDiversity of people: Diversity of thought driving collective innovationThe IBMer: ibm.com/ibm/responsibility/2015/ibmer/CORPORATE CITIZENSHIP IBMers are from over 170 countries, amazingly we connect, collaborate, and care. IBMers drive a corporate culture of shared responsibility. We love grand challenges and everyday improvements for our company and for the world. We care about each other, our clients, and the communities we live, work, and play in! ibm.com/responsibility/initiativesibm.com/responsibility/corporateservicecorps/ Required Technical and Professional Expertise  At least 5 years of experience in the Energy & Utilities industryAt least 5 years of experience in leading solution architecture and design efforts related to transformational E&U programs (e.g. AMI, Smart Grid and/or OMS Integration projects including System Integration and Business Transformation)At least 3 years of experience in one or more of the following focus areas: AMI, Smart Grid, OMS/DMS/GIS, ERP (Oracle/SAP), Work and Asset ManagementAt least 3 years of experience with AMI Applications: Itron, Siemens Energy IP, L+G, etc.At least 3 years of experience with ESB Products: Tibco, Mule, Web Methods, etc. Preferred Tech and Prof Experience At least 8 years of experience in the Energy & Utilities industryAt least 8 years of experience in leading solution architecture and design efforts related to transformational E&U programs (e.g. AMI, Smart Grid and/or OMS Integration projects including System Integration and Business Transformation)At least 5 years of experience in one or more of the following focus areas: AMI, Smart Grid, OMS/DMS/GIS, ERP (Oracle/SAP), Work and Asset ManagementAt least 5 years of experience with AMI Applications: Itron, Siemens Energy IP, L+G, etc.At least 5 years of experience with ESB Products: Tibco, Mule, Web Methods, etc. EO Statement  IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Name: Sr. Account Executive Media and Communications
Description: Overview  As a Senior Account Executive at SAS, you will be responsible for the sale of SAS software products, solutions and services to current and prospective clients in the assigned territory. This is a highly strategic position where your responsibilities will include working with and leading other sales, services, and support personnel to position SAS solutions with clients in the communications and media sector. Primary Responsibilities:Sells software solutions and services to current and prospective customers to achieve required revenue targets.Develops a 12/24/36 month account plan for each key client in the territory. Keys to success include understanding the client's key business objectives, the constraints keeping the client from fully realizing those objectives, how SAS could help the customer to overcome those constraints, and the primary contacts within the client who are charged with overcoming those constraints to drive business success.Implements strategies for generating sales opportunities within the territory based on the multi-year account plan and the identified business needs of the client where SAS can address those needs.Qualifies each opportunity to determine SAS' goodness of fit, the client's readiness to purchase, and the probability of successfully closing each opportunity by developing a formalized opportunity plan for each key sales engagement.Leads other sales personnel including technical sales consultants, post sales consultants, SAS management, and SAS legal to prosecute sales engagements and close those opportunities when forecasted.Develops an in depth understanding of company pricing and licensing procedures.Prepares standard quotations and proposals; works collaboratively with his/her extended sales team to create and finalize contracts and set time schedules for the provision of professional services and training.Follows up with customers to track satisfaction levels and to discover additional revenue opportunities.Accurately forecasts revenues to ensure sales engagements will close when anticipated and at the forecasted value.Essential Qualifications:Bachelor's degree; preferably in Business, Marketing, MIS, or other relevant discipline.Requires a minimum of five years of experience in direct sales, marketing, or technical sales support of computer software solutions (including related training products and services), computer hardware, or telecommunications software/hardwareAbility to travel as much as 70% or as business needs require.Work location of San Diego or San Francisco are strongly preferred to minimize required travel. Portland, Seattle and Denver also considered.Additional Requirements:Experience in and knowledge of complex technology solution sales; knowledge of software and/or hardware acquisition cycles and buying influences.Ability to analyze and evaluate territory dynamics and develop a sales plan at both the territory and individual client level.General understanding of business, analytical, and technical concepts with the ability to communicate and relate SAS' capabilities to client needs.Ability to work independently and as part of a team.Preferences:Significant experience selling software solutions into the communications and media industry is preferred.Equivalency:Equivalent combination of education, training and experience may be considered in place of the above qualifications. SAS looks not only for the right skills, but also a fit to our core values. We seek colleagues who will contribute to the unique values that makes SAS such a great place to work. We look for the total candidate: technical skills, values fit, relationship skills, problem solvers, good communicators and, of course, innovators. Candidates must be ready to make an impact. Additional Information: To qualify, applicants must be legally authorized to work in the United States, and should not require, now or in the future, sponsorship for employment visa status. SAS is an equal opportunity employer.
