All qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. Read more: Equal Employment Opportunity is the Law. Also view the supplement EEO is the Law, and the notice Pay Transparency  Equivalent combination of education, training and experience may be considered in place of the above qualifications. The level of this position will be determined based on the applicant's education, skills and experience. Resumes may be considered in the order they are received. SAS employees performing certain job functions may require access to technology or software subject to export or import regulations. To comply with these regulations, SAS may obtain nationality or citizenship information from applicants for employment. SAS collects this information solely for trade law compliance purposes and does not use it to discriminate unfairly in the hiring process.  Want to stay up to date with life at SAS, products and jobs? Follow us on LinkedInSDL2017

Name: Solutions Partner Manager
Description: Amplitude’s mission is to help product organizations build better products. We’re already the analytics platform of choice for top product teams around the world including Microsoft, Twitter, Adidas, CapitalOne, Disney, and Hubspot. Amplitude partners with best in class agencies and consultancies to help us generate new business, deliver services, and ensure customer success and retention.Amplitude’s Solutions Partners are the leaders in product analytics services for digital products.We are looking for a Partner Manager to help acquire new agency/consulting partners and grow our existing partner relationships on the West Coast of North America to drive increased revenue and velocity from this channel. You will be responsible for generating revenue through acquisition of target partners, qualifying inbound interest, and developing and holding partners accountable to quarterly business plans.With your knowledge of agency and consultancy service businesses you will help your target partners build a product analytics service model on top of Amplitude. Your experience of the digital services space enables you to validate your target partner accounts, identify the right stakeholders, and make contact directly or leverage your network to facilitate introductions.You enjoy wearing multiple hats - context shifting from business development, strategy, consulting, marketing, and sales is something which keeps you engaged and excited. You are naturally curious and want to understand how businesses operate and how they can be improved.Responsibilities Generate new enterprise business opportunities and sales pipeline for the account executive team through your network of partners. Acquire new partners into the partner program and establish productive ongoing relationships through business planning and goal setting. Increase the productivity of the existing solutions partners through strategic planning and training sessions.Be a coach and partner to your network, help them grow their product analytics business and thrive vs their competitors.RequirementsBusiness development experience - direct sales, account management with an expansion/upsell function, or partner management roles are a must.Strong knowledge of the agency and consultancy services landscape. You will have either worked in the industry or sold to companies within it.Customer or partner account management experience and working at scale.Success building and managing channel partner relationships is highly preferred.5+ years of technology industry experience - preferably in the Big Data, Analytics, Mobile or MarTech space.About AmplitudeAt Amplitude, we’re on a mission to help product teams understand their users’ behavior so that they can build better products. We’ve built a product analytics platform that enables anyone, regardless of analytics experience, to listen to what their users are telling them through user behavior.Founded in 2012, Amplitude is located in San Francisco’s SOMA neighborhood, and we are backed by IVP, Battery Ventures, Benchmark Capital, and Y Combinator. You can learn more about our team, culture, and environment at https://amplitude.com/careers.Amplitude provides equal employment opportunities (EEO). All applicants are considered without regards to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, or sexual orientation.#LI-EA1

Name: Director of Product Marketing: B2B Solutions
Description: Rakuten Interactive is seeking a Director of Product Marketing (B2B Solutions) to create and lead its digital transformation platform, with a concentration on technology portfolio allocation and startup partnerships. This is a challenging hybrid role that requires significant product management, product marketing, and partnership/integration experience. We are building a hybrid stack with O&O (owned and operated) Rakuten assets across data analytics, content solutions, to digital marketing--as well as breakout startups for channel sales, investments, and technology share. The analogy is the Adobe Marketing/Experience Cloud. The big idea is to not give digitally obsessed organizations PowerPoints, but the actual solutions, data, and strategy to realize: (1) Cost Savings (2) Customer Engagement and (3) Revenue Uplift. This is a role that requires end-to-end product thinking and deadline-driven execution:1. Starting the need for technology supply, we need a personality and futurist to enlist growth-stage startup CEOs to bolster our assets with new technology: broker agreements, create channels, consolidate marketing, and quickly go to market as a leading solutions platform. 2. Our candidate must align technology needs to the $400B digital transformation market. What would be digestible as a cost? Which product has the largest uplift? Which 3-4 solutions work best as a platform pillar, such as IQ, Customer Experience, or Automation? This requires sharp-witted messaging as demand generation and a complete plan for customer fulfillment. 3. Lastly, the product marketing: What is the simple, repeatable, and memorable way to demonstrate and showcase our platform? Which consultancies, infrastructure partners, and research firms (IDC, Forrester, Gartner) should we plug in and work with? Work with our design lead and sales team to produce measurable exposure and media payback. Our ideal candidate is a creative doer who has significant years of framing opportunities and driving complex initiatives in digital and cloud, fulfilling promises as the evangelist for partner orgs and the revenue/delivery requirements for the business.You will be in charge of these core pie ingredients: • Build and brand our transformation platform: choose and consolidate startups, develop platform pricing, develop market validation, and integrate competitive advantage of data. Direct design and marketing efforts for initial logo wins and first-to-revenue. • Manage partnerships team (supply): discover startups for the digital transformation value chain, negotiate partnership terms, know how to say no to entrepreneurs, and take many coffees to intimately understand each product in the portfolio.• Got-to-market marketing and sales support: The platform must be sales-ready, simple enough to sell via phone/WebEx, yet flexible enough to customize deep organizational needs.Responsibilities:• Drive best-in-class product integrations into Rakuten Interactive via JV, white-label, investment, or M&A to create revenue platforms across front-line ad sales, consultancy, outsourcing, and managed services• Work with CEOs, investors, corporate development teams to onboard cutting-edge Series A, B startups as solution partners and prioritize the entire pipeline• Connect and process complex or orphan solutions as marketable platforms: IQ, Customer Experience, Industry Automation, etc. with licensing agreements, revenue share, and credible GTM strategies• Embed self and team into startup ecosystem, developer events, hackathons to lay partnership pipeline • Evangelize Land and Expand strategy for partner organizations and Rakuten Interactive stakeholders. Regularly educate team, sales force, and internal divisions of RakutenExperience:• Cross-discipline solution building is a must, from productizing to marketing and channel partners.• 10-15+ years in product marketing and partnerships at mid-late stage tech or SaaS startup, blue-chip technology firms, and full-service VC firms.• Material partnerships that have added to top-line, accretive revenue. E.g., beyond LOI/MOU into contract and implementation.• Domain expertise in business intelligence, analytics, AI/automation, customer experience, CRM, etc.• On partnerships: VC, accelerator experience is a huge plusTeam Fit:• Smart, humble, hungry, and start-up clairvoyant • Hunter mentality, existing book of business / relationships• Agitator, friend, and driver mentality to make partners successful• Self-direction in fluid and ambiguous environments • Right kind of ambition: growing people and products, no bureaucracy or politics• Not a 11am-3pm Mountainview job: legwork and persistence requiredEducation:• Bachelors degree, computer science a plus • MBA a plus, but not overly necessary• Self-starters with Udacity, Coursera, Udemy nanodegrees and coursework welcomeThis is an accelerated and thoroughly vetted process for qualified candidates. No external agencies please. Compensation commensurate with experience. Proud EOE/M/F/D/V/SO.Only apply from this original link if referred from elsewhere: https://jobs.lever.co/rakuteninteractive/5dc8fda2-550d-4675-99af-b474d1583f4fRakuten Interactive is a cloud solutions and services group within the world's leading innovation company, Rakuten, Inc. We provide lasting end-to-end solutions using state-of-the-art infrastructure, technology, and know-how. Our suite of 20+ commerce tools helps mid-market and F1000 businesses keep up with rapid tech developments and stay competitive.Rakuten, Inc. (TSE: 4755) is a global leader in internet services that empower individuals, communities, businesses and society. Founded in Tokyo in 1997 as an online marketplace, Rakuten has expanded to offer services in e-commerce, fintech, digital content and communications to more than 1 billion members around the world. Since 2012, Rakuten has ranked in the top 30 of Forbes Magazine's annual "World's Most Innovative Companies" list. The Rakuten Group has over 14,000 employees, and operations in 29 countries and regions. For more information visit http://global.rakuten.com/corp/. Rakuten is the Main Global Partner of FC Barcelona, one of the world's most valuable sports teams, and the official sponsor of 2017, 2018 NBA Champions, the Golden State Warriors.

Name: Business Systems Analyst IV
Description: Business Systems Analyst IV  26-Nov-2018 Job Code and Payroll Title 0657 Business Systems Analyst IV Job SummaryJOB OVERVIEW The Senior Analyst plans, implements and deploys academic information systems and enhancements to existing academic information systems. Projects will address administrative and academic needs for systems that support management of academic appointment and advancement, academic research compliance processes, online processes for managing faculty payroll modifications, etc.  The Senior Analyst will present materials and facilitate group discussion with departmental staff, managers (SMEs, labs, focus groups), and higher level management, the Vice Provost of Academic Affairs, the Assistant Vice Provost of Academic Affairs and the Vice and Associate Deans of Academic Affairs for all the UCSF Professional schools. The position schedules and directs the activities of technical programmers and analysts in support of the Advance Faculty Information system (Advance) and the Magical PAF Machine system (MPM), and provides input to the performance evaluation process.  This position is expected to apply advanced business process, analytical concepts in support of organizational objectives to resolve highly complex issues where analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation of variable factors. The individual selects methods, techniques and evaluation criteria to obtain results.  This position will involve collaboration and work in partnership with other UCSF organizations, and the individual will be expected to work well and closely with many different groups of constituents at UCSF and in the vendor professional services group. The Senior Analyst will use the ability to work well with technical as well as non-technical personnel.  The Senior Analyst reports to the technical manager of Enterprise Applications, and may be assigned other tasks by the Deputy Director of Enterprise Applications as appropriate. INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY The UCSF Information Technology (IT) supports UCSF's complex business and mission needs that require a broad set of skills and services. ABOUT UCSF The University of California, San Francisco (UCSF) is a leading university dedicated to promoting health worldwide through advanced biomedical research, graduate-level education in the life sciences and health professions, and excellence in patient care. It is the only campus in the 10-campus UC system dedicated exclusively to the health sciences. Organization Campus Req Number50981BRLocation Mission Center Building Job Title Senior Analyst Appointment Type Career Percentage100%Shift Length 8 Hours Shift Days Work Days Monday - Friday, 8:00 am - 5:00 pm Required QualificationsBachelor's degree in related area and / or equivalent experience / trainingAt least five years of related experienceAdvanced knowledge of business and process analysis functionsAdvanced knowledge of related areas of ITDemonstrated experience / advanced skills with process analysis, process development, systems analysis, system implementation plans, process architectures and systems analysis methodologies and practices including traditional waterfall, Agile, Agile Scrum, UML, UML EnterpriseAdvanced knowledge and experience in methodologies associated with process and software design, modification and implementation; must know how to develop SQL code and methodsDemonstrated ability to work with others from diverse backgrounds; lead cross-functional teams and present to high-level executivesDemonstrated effective, professional communication and interpersonal skills. Demonstrated ability to communicate technical information to technical and non-technical personnel at various levels in the organization. Interpersonal and communications skills to work with both technical and non-technical personnel at various levels in the organizationSelf-motivated, works independently and as part of a team. Able to learn effectively and meet deadlinesDemonstrated problem solving skills, testing and test planning skillsPreferred QualificationsGraduate degree in Business, Computer Science or equivalentAdvanced knowledge of Academic information systems, Academic Personnel Policy, Academic administration practices at UCSF or similar organizationsDemonstrated experience in project management and executionExperience with evaluation, procurement, installation, support and maintenance of software applicationsLicense/Certification n/a Position Type Full Time Department Name Information Technology / Financial Systems Equal Employment Opportunity The University of California San Francisco is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran or disabled status, or genetic information.

Name: Sr. Publishing Analyst
Description: We are seeking a Senior Publishing Analyst to join our Mobile Publishing team in San Francisco. What part will you play? The Senior Publishing Analyst will work with business intelligence, analytics and publishing professionals to determine the best approaches and systems for supporting state-of-the-art analytics; they must have an affinity for data and analytics that support key business decisions. The Senior Publishing Analyst will work closely with the Mobile games team, User Acquisitions, Central Product Managers, and other groups to evaluate how our customers are coming to and playing our games and inform improvements we can make to drive sustained engagement and monetization. Specifically, they will be extremely detail oriented, with a strong product orientation and an affinity for data and analytics in support of driving both product-level and business decisions.  The successful candidate thrives at delivering solutions to complex data problems preferably in gaming, and has proven themselves effective at navigating and overcoming both internal and external challenges. Reporting to the Sr Manager, Publishing Analytics, this role is crucial to attaining Warner Bros. aggressive goals in mobile games. ResponsibilitiesOwn instrumentation of analytics, tracking hooks, and taxonomy during development phase; establish best practices for repeated application.Manage 3rd party tool integration, manage analytics/integration projects across multiple team.Own collection and analysis of game data.Generate actionable reports and recommendations on features that will improve retention, monetization and acquisition of gamers.Identify pain points and work with product management, design and product development to implement strategies to address key problem areas.Suggest and analyze the effectiveness of A/B tests.Establish game data/data science foundation for our studios, work closely with platform team, game team, and third party vendors to establish best practices.Share insights with executive leadership and game teams regularly.Create cogent reports that are simultaneously data-rich and easily digested.Documentation of analysis/code/scripts.What do we require from you?MA/MS Degree in Quantitative Analysis, Statistics, Computer Science, Operations Research, Economics, Mathematics or related field preferred.Minimum 4-5 years experience in data and analytics-intensive role. Mobile, social or online games experience a plus.Deep familiarity with iOS, Android, or Facebook games marketplaces, design trends and analytics best practices.Experience writing queries and using software tools to put together reports and analysis to drive key business decision-making.Experience with using R or Python for statistical analysis.Ability to promote analytics across the organization and lead teams to using analytics insights to drive decisions.>1 year of experience performing user acquisition analysis in the mobile/game space.Proven ability to conceive and test hypotheses based on inconclusive or incomplete data from unstructured data and creating structures that lend themselves to analysis.Strong analytical background with a focus on consumer behavior in digital entertainment/games.Proven SQL skills – Must be experienced writing queries across complex database structures. Distributed querying experience (Hive/Pig/Presto) a huge plus!Experience with using Tableau or Looker.2 years of experience with using R or Python for statistical analysis.Must have excellent interpersonal, communication, and presentation skills.Ability to collaborate with colleagues across different disciplines and locations to achieve results.Ability to work in a fast-pace environment and prioritize work to meet specific deadlines required.Must be self-motivated and results oriented.Familiarity with mobile game development process a plus.Flexibility to travel to Warner Bros. studios as required.Attendance at industry conferences as required.Passion for gaming!Requisition #166427BRPosition Type Full Time Area of Interest Big Data/Analytics, Game Development/Publishing, Mobile WB Business Unit WB Games Industry Games – Development & Publishing Company Overview Warner Bros. has been entertaining audiences for more than 90 years through the world’s most-loved characters and franchises. Warner Bros. employs people all over the world in a wide variety of disciplines. We're always on the lookout for energetic, creative people to join our team. * WB is an equal opportunity employer and will consider for employment qualified applicants consistent with the requirements of Article 49, Sections 4904-4905 and 4908-4910 of the San Francisco Police Code and all candidates for employment regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, citizenship, age, disability, marital status, military or veteran’s status (including protected veterans, as may be required by federal law), sexual orientation or any other category protected by law. Business Unit Overview Warner Bros. is a top video games publisher across multiple platforms. In mobile games, we have a growing portfolio of hits that includes DC Legends, Mortal Kombat X, and LEGO Star Wars: The Complete Saga, and we continue to expand by adding great people and leveraging the best portfolio of brands and intellectual property in the industry, such as DC Comics, Harry Potter, and LEGO. We are looking to add enthusiastic, talented and experienced professionals to our Mobile Publishing team.

Name: Cloud Architect
Description: Splice Machine, an AI data platform startup company, is looking for a Cloud Architect with experience working with Mesos/Marathon, Docker Swarm, Kubernetes or Hashicorp Nomad. Work from anywhere in the US.  Splice Machine's CEO, Monte Zweben, is a serial entrepreneur and former Founder/ CEO of Blue Martini, one of the most successful IPOs in early 2000. He started Splice Machine to disrupt the $30 billion traditional database market with the first open-source dual engine database and predictive platform to power Big Data, AI and Machine Learning applications.  Splice Machine has recruited a team of legendary Big Data advisors including Andrew Moore, Dean of Carnegie Mellon School of Computer Science and former VP Engineering Google, Roger Bamford, "Father of Oracle RAC", Michael Franklin, former Director of AMPLab at UC Berkeley, Ken Rudin, Head of Growth and Analytics for Google Search, and Bruce Cleveland, Founding Partner at Wildcat Ventures and former Siebel & Oracle senior executive, to collaborate with the Splice Machine team as we blaze new trails in Big Data.  Unlike other Big Data platforms that provide offline, batch analysis, Splice Machine powers intelligent applications that are woven into the operational workflows of companies. It is a scale-out SQL RDBMS, data warehouse and machine learning platform in one. Splice Machine is open source and is built upon the popular Apache Hadoop, HBase, and Spark distributed platforms. Customers like Visa, Anthem Healthcare, Wells Fargo and Kroger use Splice Machine to make it easy to harness data, capture actionable insights, inject AI and take real-time action. Cloud Architect Do you have vision and bold opinions on the right way to design and build an enterprise cloud? Have you been looking for an opportunity to implement your ideas, building from early stage inception to a 99.99% operation on multiple platforms? Splice Machine is looking for a Cloud Architect with serverless computing to help About YouYou know what it takes to build, deploy and run a highly available, global-scale, enterprise-wide, cloud platform because you've done it.You've run a platform that can claim comparable up-time to AWS, MS Azure, Google App Engine and Force.com.You believe in serverless computing, automating and codifying operational procedures as much as possible.You love building secure, reliable environments, learning new things to continuously improve and optimize your systems.You have an eye for design elegance in infrastructure.You have worked with Mesos/Marathon, Docker Swarm, Kubernetes, HashiCorp Nomad or another comparable container scheduler.About What You'll Work OnAs Cloud Architect, you'll co-own the design, development, implementation, and administration of our platform to ensure the reliability, recoverability and optimum performance with the Cloud Manager.You will design, build, utilize and improve tools to automate the deployment, administration, and monitoring of Splice Machine's cloud-native platform using Mesos, Marathon, DCOS, Docker, Kubernetes, AWS and Azure among other big data automation and self healing tools.Deliver service availability at or greater than 99.99% uptime in the cloud at specified concurrency and performance levels.Design and package a cloud service to be sold to current and new customers.Develop and manage multiple, large-scale enterprise relationships, working with technical and business leaders.Deploy and utilize automation tools to minimize human operational requirements, provide flexibility and elasticity across cloud infrastructure providers, and facilitate easy movement to and from the cloud for clients.Create, manage-to and regularly report against KPIs for the platform's operation, overseeing all platform change management and deployment activities.Consistently improve performance and reliability as the platform scales, driving continuous improvement through operational metrics.The opportunity to go outside your normal duties and work on our blog, attend hackathons and conferences, speak at events, contribute to StackOverflow and open source development or anything else you're interested in that can add to our community.RequirementsTechnical aptitude and a passion for staying current with new and upcoming technologies to ensure the best possible solutions.Experience designing a serverless computing environment using Mesos/ Marthon, Kubernetes, Nomad, or Docker Swarm.Experience building large-scale public cloud application deployments powering mission critical applications.Broad knowledge in development tools, database management, business analytics, operating systems, servers & storage, networking firewalls & security and data centers.Knowledge and experience managing Hadoop and Spark environments.Strong DevOps background for Linux based systems Our team enjoys access to the best tools available, an open and collaborative distributed work environment and a supportive culture inspiring them to do their very best. We offer great salaries, generous equity, employee health coverage, flexible time off, and an environment that gives you the flexibility to seize moments of inspiration among other perks.

Name: Director of Platforms & Partnerships: Digital Transformation Suite
Description: Rakuten Interactive is seeking a Director of Platforms & Partnerships to create, market, and lead its digital transformation platform, with a concentration on technology portfolio allocation and startup partnerships. This is a challenging hybrid role that requires significant product management, product marketing, and partnership/integration experience. We are building a solutions platform with data analytics, customer experience, content, and AI-driven/automation products that are partly owned & operated by Rakuten and partly, 3rd party sourced. The necessity is to bring to market a finished product used by the entire Rakuten group whether it be channel sales, strategic partnership, vendor selection, or technology share. The analogy is the Adobe Marketing/Experience Cloud. The big idea is to not give digitally obsessed organizations PowerPoints, but the actual solutions, data, and strategy to realize: (1) Cost Savings (2) Customer Engagement and (3) Revenue Uplift. This is a role that requires end-to-end product thinking and deadline-driven execution:1. Starting the need for technology supply, we need a personality and futurist to enlist growth-stage startup CEOs to bolster our assets with new technology: broker agreements, create channels, consolidate marketing, and quickly go to market as a leading solutions platform. 2. Our candidate must align technology needs to the $400B digital transformation market. What would be digestible as a cost? Which product has the largest uplift? Which 3-4 solutions work best as a platform pillar, such as IQ, Customer Experience, or Automation? This requires sharp-witted messaging as demand generation and a complete plan for customer fulfillment. 3. Lastly, the product marketing: What is the simple, repeatable, and memorable way to demonstrate and showcase our platform? Which consultancies, infrastructure partners, and research firms (IDC, Forrester, Gartner) should we plug in and work with? Work with our design lead and sales team to produce measurable exposure and media payback. Our ideal candidate is a creative doer who has significant years of framing opportunities and driving complex initiatives in digital and cloud, fulfilling promises as the evangelist for partner orgs and the revenue/delivery requirements for the business.You will be in charge of these core pie ingredients: • Build and brand our transformation platform: choose and consolidate startups, develop platform pricing, develop market validation, and integrate competitive advantage of data. Direct design and marketing efforts for initial logo wins and first-to-revenue. • Manage partnerships team (supply): discover startups for the digital transformation value chain, negotiate partnership terms, know how to say no to entrepreneurs, and take many coffees to intimately understand each product in the portfolio.• Got-to-market marketing and sales support: The platform must be sales-ready, simple enough to sell via phone/WebEx, yet flexible enough to customize deep organizational needs.Responsibilities:• Drive best-in-class product integrations into Rakuten Interactive via JV, white-label, investment, or M&A to create revenue platforms across front-line ad sales, consultancy, outsourcing, and managed services• Work with CEOs, investors, corporate development teams to onboard cutting-edge Series A, B startups as solution partners and prioritize the entire pipeline• Connect and process complex or orphan solutions as marketable platforms: IQ, Customer Experience, Industry Automation, etc. with licensing agreements, revenue share, and credible GTM strategies• Embed self and team into startup ecosystem, developer events, hackathons to lay partnership pipeline • Evangelize Land and Expand strategy for partner organizations and Rakuten Interactive stakeholders. Regularly educate team, sales force, and internal divisions of RakutenExperience:• Cross-discipline solution building is a must, from productizing to marketing and channel partners.• 7-10+ years in product marketing and partnerships at mid-late stage tech or SaaS startup, blue-chip technology firms, and full-service VC firms.• Material partnerships that have added to top-line, accretive revenue. E.g., beyond LOI/MOU into contract and implementation.• Domain expertise in business intelligence, analytics, AI/automation, customer experience, CRM, etc.• On partnerships: VC, accelerator experience is a huge plusTeam Fit:• Smart, humble, hungry, and start-up clairvoyant • Hunter mentality, existing book of business / relationships• Agitator, friend, and driver mentality to make partners successful• Self-direction in fluid and ambiguous environments • Right kind of ambition: growing people and products, no bureaucracy or politics• Not a 11am-3pm Mountainview job: legwork and persistence requiredEducation:• Bachelors degree, computer science a plus • MBA a plus, but not overly necessary• Self-starters with Udacity, Coursera, Udemy nanodegrees and coursework welcomeThis is an accelerated and thoroughly vetted process for qualified candidates. No external agencies please. Compensation commensurate with experience. Proud EOE/M/F/D/V/SO.Only apply from this original link if referred from elsewhere: https://jobs.lever.co/rakuteninteractive/5dc8fda2-550d-4675-99af-b474d1583f4fRakuten Interactive is a cloud solutions and services group within the world's leading innovation company, Rakuten, Inc. We provide lasting end-to-end solutions using state-of-the-art infrastructure, technology, and know-how. Our suite of 20+ commerce tools helps mid-market and F1000 businesses keep up with rapid tech developments and stay competitive.Rakuten, Inc. (TSE: 4755) is a global leader in internet services that empower individuals, communities, businesses and society. Founded in Tokyo in 1997 as an online marketplace, Rakuten has expanded to offer services in e-commerce, fintech, digital content and communications to more than 1 billion members around the world. Since 2012, Rakuten has ranked in the top 30 of Forbes Magazine's annual "World's Most Innovative Companies" list. The Rakuten Group has over 14,000 employees, and operations in 29 countries and regions. For more information visit http://global.rakuten.com/corp/. Rakuten is the Main Global Partner of FC Barcelona, one of the world's most valuable sports teams, and the official sponsor of 2017, 2018 NBA Champions, the Golden State Warriors.

Name: Sales Engineer - SF
Description: WHO WE ARE Looker is on a mission to bring better insights and data-driven decisions to every business. Everything we do is aimed at making sure our customers love every aspect of Looker, from our products and technologies to our ease of doing business and our support. We are looking for curiously brilliant individuals to join our team as we reinvent data analytics. Get data-driven and see yourself at Looker. WHAT WE'VE GOT GOING ON As a key contributor to our Enterprise Sales Engineering team, youll serve as a technical champion to uncover true customer needs and demonstrate Looker's powerful value proposition. Working with sales counterparts, youll help acquire new customers, expand relationships and drive revenue growth. Your breadth and depth of knowledge in data discovery and analysis will expand significantly, and youll help shape the product roadmap. Youll passionately position Looker as the next generation BI platform. You'll foster Customer Love. WHAT WE NEED YOU TO DOStand as the technical liaison, collaborate with internal sales, marketing and services teams to develop customized presentations, demos, prototypes and trialsContribute to sales scripts, lead customer discovery, implement prototypes, share knowledge expertise, and guide solution development/deploymentRespond to functional and technical elements of RFPsCommunicate customer requirements and potential competitor solutions. Provide a strong technical response in aid to customer needsManage customer trials, ensuring that they are engaged with the product, the trial, and moving toward a resulting solutionEducate technical and architectural concepts to a variety of audiences, including developers, architects, and IT professionalsKeep current on product releases and new features, assist in training new hires and colleaguesDocument and deliver both product feedback and new requirements from the fieldA deep understanding of the Looker product, working closely with sales to resolve critical technical issuesWHAT YOU BRING TO LOOKER3 - 5 years pre-sales experience within enterprise SaaS buying environmentsExperience successfully demonstrating and articulating value of Business Intelligence and Analytics toolsProficiency in SQL programmingAbility to influence both technical and executive audiencesSavvy presentation and demonstration skills, fluidly translating complex technology conceptsAdvocate for team selling, partnering with sales to qualify opportunity and align key customer stakeholdersPassion for data and analytics, a philosophy of using technology to help solve business problemsKeen analytical and problem solving skillsCuriosity to learn and assimilate technical information quickly, enthusiasm to share and teach othersAvailable for 25% regional travel Team selling is our philosophy - Lets win together! #LI-JR1A LITTLE MORE ABOUT LOOKERLooker is a complete data platform that offers data analytics and business insights to every department, and easily integrates into applications to deliver data directly into the decision-making process. Over 1,600 industry-leading and innovative companies such as Sony, Amazon, The Economist, IBM, Spotify, Etsy, Lyft and Kickstarter have trusted Looker to power their data-driven cultures. The company is headquartered in Santa Cruz, California, with offices in San Francisco, New York, Chicago, Boulder, London and Dublin, Ireland. Investors include CapitalG, Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers, Meritech Capital Partners, Redpoint Ventures, First Round Capital, Sapphire Ventures and Goldman Sachs. For more information, connect with us on LinkedIn, Twitter, Facebook and YouTube or visit looker.com.Looker aspires to be a workplace that is not only free of discrimination, but one that fosters inclusion and belonging. We strongly believe that diversity of experience, perspective, and background lead to a better environment for our employees and a better product for our users. We encourage you to join us in changing the way businesses use data.

Name: Internal Consultant
Description: Job DescriptionOn Lok Lifeways  We are a non-profit committed to our participants. On Lok Lifeways PACE long term senior care is provided by On Lok Senior Health Services, a 501(c)(3) non-profit Dedicated to The Care of Elders: On Lok, Inc. is a not-for-profit organization founded in the early 1970s by a group of citizens concerned about the plight of elders and the lack of long term options in the community. On Lok, Inc. serves as the administrative arm of a group of five affiliated non-profit organizations. Its functions include research and development, human resources, fundraising and management information systems.  We understand the importance of a system that works together. Your expertise, drive and passion can help us carry out our mission to improve lives and advance healthcare.  Join our team of leaders to begin a rewarding career!  POSITION SUMMARY: This position will support the organization-wide strategic plan by leading the design and execution of high-priority strategic planning projects, and operating as an internal consultant on key initiatives defined by the strategic plan. This position will involve high exposure to the Senior Leadership Team and will report to the Senior Director of Strategic Planning. DUTIES / RESPONSIBILITIES:Project Definition:a. Define and identify the problem to solve, while keeping a strategic mindsetb. Understand needs quickly and analyze how best to achieve desired outcomesc. Be able to propose a variety of analytical methods to best define and scope the workResearch:a. Work with stakeholders to gather informationb. Be able to draw upon knowledge to quickly hone in on data sourcesc. Digest and synthesize large amounts of information quicklyAnalysis:a. Be able to employ a variety of analytical methods depending on the issueb. Be well versed in financial modelling, cost-benefit analysis, operational efficiency analysis, buy-versussell decisions, scenario planning, statistical analysis, marketing analytics, feasibility studies, etc.c. Be rigorous in drawing insights from informationRecommendations:a. Deepen insights and frame decision points for the organizationb. Use data and objectivity to guide discussionc. Effectively contextualize recommendationsPersuasion and presentation:a. Create effective storyboards for varying levels of the organization and diverse audiencesProject management:a. Develop project workplans and execute with efficiency and autonomyb. May be assigned to other departments and functional areas to manage key projectsc. May be called upon to oversee in-flight projects in other departmentsd. May provide coaching and technical assistance to project teams that need more hands-on support in building business cases, creating change management plans, defining scope of work, planning work, etc.Other duties and projects, as assigned.QUALIFICATIONS (knowledge, skills, abilities):Bachelor's degree with outstanding academic performance required. Master's degree in business, or related analytical specialty preferred.Minimum 3-5 years of firm-based management consulting, or structured internal consulting.Exceptional analytical and quantitative problem-solving skillsStrong record of leadership, collaborative teamwork, and good judgmentAbility to navigate nonprofit organizations with sensitivity and effectivenessAbility to communicate complex ideas with organization, narrative and persuasionAttention to detail, and the ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneouslyDemonstrated level of resourcefulness and can-do attitudeKnowledge of the healthcare industry a plus. Knowledge of affordable housing also a plus. The above statements are intended to describe the general nature of work performed. They are not considered as an exhaustive list of all job tasks performed. On Lok reserves the right to change job descriptions, work hours or work sites as required by the program/  On Lok's Employee Benefits include (eligible for any position for 20 hr/wk or more): Medical, Dental, and Vision coverageRetirement Savings Plan 403(b) and Term Life/AD&D InsuranceFlexible Spending Account, Commuter Checks, MLA scholarships, Employee Assistance Program (EAP)Pet Insurance and additional discountsHolidays (10 per year), vacation time, sick leave, and long-term disability insurance Job Posted by ApplicantPro

Name: Consumer Sales Director
Description: About this role: The Consumer Sales Director will be responsible for leading the Small Business segment in the West Region. This involves creating and implementing the strategy, leading the team to achieve challenging sales targets, launching new products, scaling across 14 markets in the West, building and investing in the team culture, hiring and developing top talent, and collaborating with various stakeholders.  The Consumer segment represents an incredible opportunity for WeWork. This segment is designed to target companies who have 1-49 employees globally. ResponsibilitiesManage revenue, sales targets, and other KPIs for the regionSuccessfully hire, train and manage the growing sales team in the regionBuild a scalable and repeatable sales process for the Consumer segmentDefine key sales and marketing strategies for the region, budgets required to deliver, and drive successful execution to achieve resultsLead and manage the Sales Managers and effectively leverage centralized inbound and outbound teamProvide innovative, scalable solutions and sales processes to achieve team goalsWork cross-functionally with other departments to achieve goalsMaintain regular communication cadence with the global/regional sales organization to communicate best practices and share learningWork closely with sales and growth operations to constantly analyze results and identify opportunities to improve systems, processes and programsQualificationsCollege degree; MBA preferred5-7 years of experience in sales leadershipExperience working in high-growth and/or early stage company environmentsExpert presentation, analytical, meeting management, process definition, and communication skillsExperience managing managers and producing exceptional resultsA willingness to travel and spend sufficient time on the road to understand the businessHighly analytical, detail oriented and process drivenHighly adaptable and excited to operate in a fast-paced environmentHighly collaborative, ability to create relationships quickly with colleagues and partners in the businessA sense of humor even when things get tough; at WeWork we are all in it together; a willingness to go above and beyond to support the team and get things done, even if it sometimes means helping others with their work

Name: Senior Growth Analyst
Description: About Us:KeepTruckin is on a mission to connect the worlds trucks. With the leading ELD and fleet management platform, we are bringing the trucking industry online and fundamentally changing the way freight is moved on our roads.The numbers tell the story:- The KeepTruckin network is composed of more than 200,000 trucks and is expected to grow to 400,000 by end of 2018.- We grew from $1 million to more than $50 million in annual recurring revenue in 12 months, among the fastest growing SaaS companies ever.- Our Glassdoor rating is 4.8 stars. We have built an incredible culture with high trust and transparency, where people feel empowered to do their best work.About the Job:We are seeking a talented and energetic Growth Analyst who thrives at the intersection of data, sales, engineering, and marketing. The ideal candidate is intellectually curious with a strong technical and analytical background. This is a great opportunity to learn and grow your analytics, business and strategy skillsets while having a substantial impact at a fast growing company.Responsibilities:Conduct regular and ad-hoc analyses for tactical daily operations, as well as for key initiatives and strategiesDevelop and conduct experiments for improving performance on both internal (e.g. business processes) and external metrics (e.g. revenue)Communicate insights and recommendations to the broader teamDrive implementation and adoption of successful experiments across the organizationRequirements:7+ years experience in an analytics or business operations roleBachelors Degree or equivalent in Math, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science or BusinessGreat business acumen to extract valuable signals and present actionable insightsStrong mathematical background; you understand different analytics methods and toolsExperience with Python, or other statistical scripting languagesExceptional proficiency with SQL, reporting tools (Looker) Ability to define a business problem, collating the required information, analyzing the results and synthesizing a compelling argumentAs an equal opportunity employer, we are committed to diversity in the workforce. In accordance with applicable law, we prohibit discrimination against any applicant or employee based on any legally recognized basis, including, but not limited to; race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, lactation, childbirth or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, age (40 and over), national origin or ancestry, physical or mental disability, genetic information (including testing and characteristics), veteran status, uniformed service member status or any other status protected by federal, state or local law.

Name: Senior Manager, Forecasting & Analytics - Biopharma
Description: I am currently working on a Senior Manager, Forecasting & Analytics role.  You:  7 years pharmaceutical/biotech/medical device forecasting & analytics experience  NOTE: Will waive prior forecasting experience requirement for PhD candidates  Experience with IQVIA/IMS and/or Symphony Secondary data  Experience with patient-flow, trend-based and epidemiology-based forecast models  Ideally experience in pre-launch and launch products  Must have outstanding presence and presentation skills as you be presenting to senior level people  Self-starter who can hit the ground running  Must be based out of the San Fran area office  Will consider H1B transfer candidates  TITLE: Senior Manager Forecasting & Analytics  REPORTS TO: AD Forecasting & Analytics  LOCATION: South San Francisco, CA  RELO: Yes  In this role, the Senior Manager, Forecasting & Analytics will be responsible for the revenue forecast and brand analytics for all products inline and launching in the 0-4 year window. Partner with the Finance team to lead key business processes in support of the Operating Reviews and Budgeting processes. Regularly communicate with Senior Executives and strategic partners to report analytical findings or projections on forecasting, inventory management, and key performance metrics/diagnostics.  Design and implement processes to both support decision-making process as it relates to key strategies and increase the overall effectiveness across the Commercial, Marketing, Finance and Manufacturing functions.  RESPONSIBILITES:  Revenue forecasts in support of Strategic Planning, Finance, Incentive Compensation, Manufacturing and Investor Relations  National-level performance reporting and diagnostics, including reconciliation with forecasts  Patient-level dynamics  Market and competitor assessments  Marketing mix assessment and optimization  Pricing, contracting, patient assistance & co-pay support strategy  Promotional program ROI assessment  E-marketing analytics  Collaborate with key business partners to develop short- and medium-term forecasts integrating key market dynamics and cross-functional expertise  Responsible for developing robust forecasting models and identifying the causes of variance in monthly forecasts  Support the development of sales and marketing initiatives and evaluation of program potential  Manage ongoing business relationships with data vendors, consultants and selected partners  Strong communicator that is able to provide guidance to Brand Leads on defining assumptions, monitoring key performance indicators and recommending changes to achieve brand and/or sales goals  Define the appropriate methods, techniques, evaluation criteria, and quality assurance protocols for National Analytics & Forecasting  Develops and implements customized tools to innovate and/or streamline forecasting processes to match needs and market specific dynamics  Ability to assume full responsibility for accuracy and reliability of complex analyses, including forecasts and ROI analyses  In-depth knowledge of pharmaceutical data sources (e.g., Symphony Health, IMS, etc.) is required  Understanding of the pharmaceutical / biotechnology industry and experience forecasting similar products or therapeutic areas is highly desired  REQUIREMENTS:  10+ years of experience and a Bachelor’s degree in business administration, economics, finance, engineering, or related fields  Advanced degree (MBA / MA, Ph.D.) is preferred but not required  7+ years of relevant experience in sales/marketing analysis, statistical analysis, or financial forecasting in the pharmaceutical or biotech industry  Balances exceptional technical expertise with strong strategic thinking and practical business orientation  Able to distill complex information to essential knowledge, and persuasively present to all levels of management  Able to assume full responsibility for accuracy, reliability, and timeliness of deliverables completed through own efforts or those of subordinate employees, i.e., both leader and hands-on contributor  A firm grasp of complex forecasting & modeling techniques that support various types of strategic analytics (e.g., forecasting, business analytics, sales incentive modeling, etc.) is preferred. Candidates with strong analytical capabilities without forecasting experience are also encouraged to apply  Must be able to recognize and interpret business issues/opportunities and recommend solutions persuasively supported with rigorous analysis  Experience in a pharmaceutical environment is desirable, as is a solid understanding of principles relating to the area of functional specialization  Highly developed interpersonal skills with ability to lead, interact with, focus, resolve conflict and drive consensus among individuals from a variety of cultures, and disciplines is required  Demonstrated ability to lead, collaborate, and influence cross-functional stakeholders and executive management  Strong knowledge of the roles of other functions (Finance, Market Research, Marketing, Managed Care, etc.)  Must have a proven ability to sustain a high energy level over time  Advanced knowledge of global Sales and Marketing organizations and pharmaceutical data sources (e.g., IMS, Symphony Health) is required  Consulting experience preferred  Must be authorized to work for any employer in the US without sponsorship

Name: Cloud Lead

Work from anywhere in the US.  Splice Machine's CEO, Monte Zweben, is a serial entrepreneur and former Founder/ CEO of Blue Martini, one of the most successful IPOs in early 2000. He started Splice Machine to disrupt the $30 billion traditional database market with the first open-source dual engine database and predictive platform to power Big Data, AI and Machine Learning applications. It is a scale-out SQL RDBMS, data warehouse and machine learning platform in one. Splice Machine is open source and is built upon the popular Apache Hadoop, HBase, and Spark distributed platforms. Customers like Visa, Anthem Healthcare, Wells Fargo and Kroger use Splice Machine to make it easy to harness data, capture actionable insights, inject AI and take real-time action. change management and deployment activities.Consistently improve performance and reliability as the platform scales, driving continuous improvement through operational metrics.The opportunity to go knowledge in development tools, database management, business analytics, operating systems, servers & storage, networking firewalls & security and data centers.Knowledge and experience managing Hadoop and Spark environments.Strong DevOps background for Linux based systems Our team enjoys access to the best tools available, an open and collaborative distributed work environment and a supportive culture inspiring them to do their very best. Name: Professional Services Solutions Engineer
Description: C3 is the leading AI software platform for digital transformation. At the C3 Platform's core is the revolutionary C3 Type Systeman extensible, model-driven AI architecture. The comprehensive and proven C3 Platform enables enterprises to develop, deploy, and operate enterprise-scale AI applications 10 to 100x faster than alternative approaches.  C3 has openings for Professional Services Solutions Engineers to work with our customers to solve their specific business problems using the C3 platform. You will be required to design and implement advanced application solutions, deploy existing C3 product suite applications, and build new cutting-edge tools on C3 platform. The C3 product suite is entirely data-driven, so a great candidate will have a passion for acquiring, analyzing, and transforming data to generate insight. This role is very hands-on and requires a perfect combination of "big picture", solution-oriented mindset and solid implementation skills. Your Responsibilities:Engage directly with customers to design and develop applications & solutions based on the C3 platform.Become an expert in the C3 platform and associated Tools to enable and assist C3 customers to build their own applicationsPerform debugging, troubleshooting, modifications and unit testing of applications and solutions.Assess technical risks and come up with mitigation strategiesDevelop new specs, documentation, participate in the development of technical procedures and user support guidesRequirements:Minimum of 2 years work experience building enterprise applicationsPersonable, professional and collaborativeDemonstrated proficiency with JavaScriptWorking knowledge of Agile Software development methodologyExperience in working with customers to develop or deploy new business solutionsExperience with relational databases (any vendor)Experience with development or implementation of enterprise and/or cloud softwareSolid understanding of concepts of cloud computingStrong organizational and troubleshooting skills with attention to detailStrong analytical ability, judgment and problem analysis techniquesInterpersonal skills with the ability to work effectively in a cross-functional teamPreferredMinimum of Bachelor degree in Computer Science or Electrical Engineering; advanced degree preferredPaaS, SaaS and business intelligence/analytics implementation experienceDomain expertise in certain key industries (Oil & Gas, Financial Services, Telecommunications, Discrete Manufacturing, Healthcare, Public Sector etc)Proficiency in data integration/ETL technologies, such as Tibco C3 provides a competitive compensation package and excellent benefits including: Competitive salary, generous stock options, 401K, medical, dental, and vision benefits. At the office, we offer a fully stocked kitchen with catered breakfast and lunch, table tennis and pool table, free membership at our on-site gym, Friday evening social hours with food, drink and music and a fun team of great people. C3 is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of any legally protected characteristics, including disabled and veteran status.

Name: Director of Renewal and Payment Analytics
Description: About GoDaddy GoDaddy powers the world's largest cloud platform dedicated to small, independent ventures. With nearly 17 million customers worldwide and over 75 million domain names under management, GoDaddy is the place people come to name their idea, build a professional website, attract customers and manage their work. Our mission is to give our customers the tools, insights and the people to transform their ideas and personal initiative into success. To learn more about the company visit www.GoDaddy.com.  Lead insights and analytics for renewals and payments team. Drive framework and vision with which we think about and integrate this subject across all of analytics. Own all renewal & payment analytics efforts across all of analytics. Director of Renewal and Payment Analytics GoDaddy powers the world's largest cloud platform dedicated to small, independent ventures. With nearly 18 million customers worldwide and over 75 million domain names under management, GoDaddy is the place people come to name their idea, build a professional website, attract customers and manage their work. Our mission is to give our customers the tools, insights and the people to transform their ideas and personal initiative into success. To learn more about the company visit www.GoDaddy.com.  As a data-driven company, GoDaddy, is seeking a talented and highly-motivated analytics leader to join our Business Analytics team. We are looking for a leader that is passionate, extraordinary, analytical, strategic, and inquisitive. The right person will raise the profile and excellence of our entire team. If this is you, please apply! You will be integral to our company growth through the insights you uncover, the thoughtful recommendations you make, and the people you mentor and lead. Responsibilities:Manage activities of the renewal and payments analytics organization. You will be identifying opportunities, setting priorities and establishing goals to optimize GoDaddy’s existing product subscription business and our payment funnels.Build and enhance the framework with which we view and measure the payment and renewal pieces of our business.Identify actionable insights, suggest recommendations and influence the direction of the business by effectively communicating findings to cross functional groupsPartner with Platform teams to develop industry leading data capabilities, including prototyping & design, governance, data quality, and providing long term visionDevelop and implement “best practices” for the visualization of data and the building of end-to-end reporting and analysis solutionsGuide team in the use of data science techniques to drive increased subscription renewal rates, customer LTV, and payment success ratesExplore and recommend emerging technologies and techniques to support & enhance the analytics team as a wholeA minimum of 10 years of experience in an analytical organization delivering platform solutions and capabilities. Experience in payment, fraud, or subscription analytics a plus.Experience with SQL and data visualization tools (Tableau, MicroStrategy, PowerBI)A minimum of 3 years experience managing people and developing talent in analysts, data scientists and data engineers.Advanced understanding of analytical techniques including predictive modeling, experiment design and measurement, and machine learning.Proven ability to build cross-functional relationships and partner with leaders to deliver solutions that are aligned to strategy and support business objectivesExceptional verbal and written presentation skills, including ability to prepare materials for audiences at all levels of the organization GoDaddy is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We will not discriminate against any applicant or employee on the basis of age, race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, medical condition, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, marital status or civil partnership/union status, physical or mental disability, pregnancy, childbirth, genetic information, military and veteran status, or any other basis prohibited by applicable federal, state or local law. GoDaddy will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with local and federal requirements.  If you need assistance completing an application for a position with us, please reach out to our Recruiting Team at Recruiting@godaddy.com  To submit your application to this position, please click Apply . Name: Senior CRM Manager
Description: Who are we TripAdvisor is the worlds largest online travel site, visited by 390 million travellers each month, and our business TripAdvisor Experiences (including Viator) is one of the fastest growing key areas not just for TripAdvisor, but across the travel industry. We provide the experiences that help travellers create unforgettable memories and make the most of their trips, from champagne brunch on top the Eiffel Tower to cage diving with sharks in Hawaii. TripAdvisor provides a unique, global work environment that captures the speed, innovation and excitement of a start-up, at a thriving, growing and well-established industry brand. You will be part of a dynamic, fun, and energetic team where you can immediately make meaningful contributions.  This is a unique opportunity to work for one of the most progressive companies in the digital space. Were looking for a talented Senior CRM Manager to own critical elements of our Experiences & Travel Agents email programmes, as well as assisting in technical projects that increase our efficiency and improve the experience for both our travellers and travel agents. Why this job is excellent As a Senior CRM Manager for a pioneering digital organisation, you will play an integral part in shaping its future success. This is a fantastic opportunity for a technically-minded CRM manager to further develop their skills whilst creating groundbreaking customer & travel agents experiences that drive exponential business growth. What youll get Youll be surrounded by a leading team of digital experts who will support your development within a fast-paced business environment. Working alongside seasoned CRM professionals, you will report to the CRM Director and have frequent exposure to the senior leadership in the organisation.  Youll get experience of working across the entire company by building partnerships with key stakeholders (Customer Service, Marketing, Sales, Business Development, Product and Engineering functions). What You'll Do This is a pivotal role, which requires end-to-end delivery from capturing business requirements through to planning, product delivery, and evaluation of performance against KPIs.  Youll be highly motivated and excel at managing multiple projects simultaneously to test and execute immediate change. Responsibilities will include, but not be restricted to:Responsible for planning, developing and executing strategies to drive user engagement and improve conversion and repeat rates of Viator Travel AgentsTranslate business goals into accurate delivery requirements, including but not limited to: specifying required data, segmentation & targeting logic, and dynamic content requirementsWork cross functionality with product, engineering, coding, copy, business development, design, analytics, and other teams outside of CRM, to deliver programs and initiativesConduct in-depth user research & quantitative analytics that will directly impact strategy and the roadmapWriting technical specs, testing and executing email programmes as per business needsOwn comprehensive daily, weekly, monthly reporting of all relevant CRM KPIs & build the right dashboards to track and socialize performanceArticulate and present strategy, progress, results and data analyses / learnings effectively to stakeholders and the wider businessServe as the CRM expert for Viator Travel Agents program to drive smooth execution and optimizationManaging one-off email requestsWhat We Seek5+ years experience working in a CRM role in a high energy online environmentProven history of developing high quality digital user experiencesAbility to manage large, cross-functional projects and deal with multiple monthly launchesProactive & independent, always looking for ways to take initiative and improve existing programs/processesSuperb verbal and written communication skills with a high degree of comfort interpreting results and communicating insights effectively to stakeholders and senior leadershipExperience working with Coding and Engineering teams to drive technical projectsMeticulous attention to detail with a clear, methodological approach to problem solvingResults-driven marketer with proven quantitative and analytical skills; should be extremely comfortable with Excel (functions, pivots, etc.).Creative problem-solving skills with focus on efficient execution while balancing big-picture thinkingUndergraduate degree required LI-JC1#

Five or more years’ experience as a Project Manager and or Sr. Business Analyst. Previous utility experience. Name: Services Applications Engineer
