IBM Senior Technical Solution Specialist Interns are guided by IBMs purpose To Be Essential.  You will assist in the delivery of industry centric technology solutions to clients of all sizes and markets. During your internship, you will work directly with sales professionals and contribute to the day-to-day sales operations of the team. Interns will gain an understanding of IBM sales practices as well as knowledge about IBM's products to help develop business solutions. You will have the opportunity to shadow sales representatives on client engagements and network throughout all levels of the robust IBM organization, which will enable you to form contacts and gain insights on future opportunities within IBM. You may work with any of the following business units: Analytics, Business Partners, Cloud, Internet of Things, Security, Services, Systems Hardware, Talent & Collaboration Solutions, Watson Customer Engagement.  As a Senior Technical Solution Specialist Intern, you will be part of the client account team and drive revenue through in-depth, complex technical demonstrations, designing solutions, technical evaluations, and/or proof-of-concepts.  Please note: this is not a coding, development or extensive hands-on role. This role will involve technical consulting with clients, helping them design technical solutions. Be a Challenger, Step Up, Get Ready and Jump into the Ring!Senior Technical Sales Intern applicants should:Demonstrate a real passion for salesHave customer sales/service experienceHave a capacity to grasp technical detailsBe a self-starter and have proven leadership experiencePossess people and teaming skillsPossess research and analytical skillsDemonstrate strong written, oral, and interpersonal skillsBe able to independently travel to local IBM clients and meetingsProgramming coursework or experience is a plus If you would like additional information about the Summit Program, please visit: http://www-03.ibm.com/employment/summit  IBM will not be providing visa sponsorship for these positions now or in the future. Therefore, in order to be considered for the IBM Summit program, you must have the ability to work without a need for current or future visa sponsorship.  Required Technical and Professional Expertise Registered full-time university studentEnglish: Fluent Preferred Tech and Prof Experience Computer Science, Data Science, Computer Engineering, Analytics, Electrical Engineering, Information Technology or similar disciplines EO Statement  IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Name: Services Engineer - Intern
Description: C3 is the leading AI software platform for digital transformation. At the C3 Platform's core is the revolutionary C3 Type Systeman extensible, model-driven AI architecture. The comprehensive and proven C3 Platform enables enterprises to develop, deploy, and operate enterprise-scale AI applications 10 to 100x faster than alternative approaches.  We are looking for Services Engineer interns to join us during our Summer 2019 internship program. As a Services Engineer Intern, you will work with our customers to solve specific business challenges. Using the C3 Platform, you will configure advanced applications, train customer users, and support customers through application deployment. You will collaborate with the C3 Team to do meaningful work while also growing your expertise in engineering. Your Responsibilities:Engage directly with customers to design and develop applications & solutions based on the C3 platform.Become an expert in the C3 platform and associated Tools to enable and assist C3 customers to build their own applications.Perform debugging, troubleshooting, modifications and unit testing of applications and solutions.Assess technical risks and come up with mitigation strategiesDevelop new specs, documentation, participate in the development of technical procedures and user support guides.Requirements:Pursuing a Bachelor of Science or Master of Science in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or similar field.Experience building enterprise applications.Experience with test automation tools.Experience with relational databases (any vendor).Experience with Unix-based operating system.Demonstrated proficiency with JavaScript.Working knowledge of Agile Software development methodology.Solid understanding of concepts of cloud computing.Strong organizational and troubleshooting skills with attention to detail.Strong analytical ability, judgment and problem analysis techniques.Interpersonal skills with the ability to work effectively in a cross-functional team.PreferredPaaS, SaaS and business intelligence/analytics implementation experience.Domain expertise in certain key industries (Oil & Gas, Financial Services, Telecommunications, Discrete Manufacturing, Healthcare, Public Sector, Etc.).Proficiency in data integration/ETL technologies, such as Tibco. C3 provides interns a competitive compensation package. At the office, we offer a fully stocked kitchen with catered breakfast and lunch, table tennis and pool table, free membership at our on-site gym, Friday evening social hours with food, drink and music and a fun team of great people.  C3 is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of any legally protected characteristics, including disabled and veteran status.

Name: Enterprise Sales Engineer - SF
Description: WHO WE ARE Looker is on a mission to bring better insights and data-driven decisions to every business. Everything we do is aimed at making sure our customers love every aspect of Looker, from our products and technologies to our ease of doing business and our support. We are looking for curiously brilliant individuals to join our team as we reinvent data analytics. Get data-driven and see yourself at Looker. WHAT WE'VE GOT GOING ON As a key contributor to our Enterprise Sales Engineering team, youll serve as a technical champion to uncover true customer needs and demonstrate Looker's powerful value proposition. Working with sales counterparts, youll help acquire new customers, expand relationships and drive revenue growth. Your breadth and depth of knowledge in data discovery and analysis will expand significantly, and youll help shape the product roadmap. Youll passionately position Looker as the next generation BI platform. You'll foster Customer Love. Team selling is our philosophy - Lets win together! WHAT WE NEED YOU TO DOStand as the technical liaison, collaborate with internal sales, marketing and services teams to develop customized presentations, demos, prototypes and trialsContribute to sales scripts, lead customer discovery, implement prototypes, share knowledge expertise, and guide solution development/deploymentRespond to functional and technical elements of RFPsCommunicate customer requirements and potential competitor solutions. Provide a strong technical response in aid to customer needsManage customer trials, ensuring that they are engaged with the product, the trial, and moving toward a resulting solutionEducate technical and architectural concepts to a variety of audiences, including developers, architects, and IT professionalsKeep current on product releases and new features, assist in training new hires and colleaguesDocument and deliver both product feedback and new requirements from the fieldA deep understanding of the Looker product, working closely with sales to resolve critical technical issuesWHAT YOU BRING TO LOOKERMinimum 3 - 5 years in customer-facing role within enterprise SaaS buying environmentsExperience successfully demonstrating and articulating value of Business Intelligence and Analytics toolsProficiency in SQL programmingAbility to influence both technical and executive audiencesSavvy presentation and demonstration skills, fluidly translating complex technology conceptsAdvocate for team selling, partnering with sales to qualify opportunity and align key customer stakeholdersPassion for data and analytics, a philosophy of using technology to help solve business problemsKeen analytical and problem solving skillsCuriosity to learn and assimilate technical information quickly, enthusiasm to share and teach othersAvailable for 25% regional travel #LI-JR1A LITTLE MORE ABOUT LOOKERLooker is a complete data platform that offers data analytics and business insights to every department, and easily integrates into applications to deliver data directly into the decision-making process. Over 1,600 industry-leading and innovative companies such as Sony, Amazon, The Economist, IBM, Spotify, Etsy, Lyft and Kickstarter have trusted Looker to power their data-driven cultures. The company is headquartered in Santa Cruz, California, with offices in San Francisco, New York, Chicago, Boulder, London and Dublin, Ireland. Investors include CapitalG, Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers, Meritech Capital Partners, Redpoint Ventures, First Round Capital, Sapphire Ventures and Goldman Sachs. For more information, connect with us on LinkedIn, Twitter, Facebook and YouTube or visit looker.com.Looker aspires to be a workplace that is not only free of discrimination, but one that fosters inclusion and belonging. We strongly believe that diversity of experience, perspective, and background lead to a better environment for our employees and a better product for our users. We encourage you to join us in changing the way businesses use data.

Name: Social Media Analyst
Description: Social Media Analyst  Location: San Francisco, CA  Duration: 1 year Description:Candidate will be part of client's global social media team who works closely with Product Marketing Managers covering a wide range of products (such as Android) across markets, aspiring to make client the most loved and engaged social brand in the world while driving core business metrics. As a Business Analyst, you will work with Marketing and other cross-functional teams (Product, Content, Engineering etc) to fully utilize social data in order to uncover insights that inform business and marketing decisions and track/assess the effectiveness of our campaigns/programs. Candidate will have a strong analytics background, proficient at querying data, but also experienced at turning raw data into valuable insights. Should be comfortable running simple linear regression analysis and will demonstrate strategic thinking in combining our data for insights. Good oral and written communication skills essential.Top 3 Daily Responsibilities:Own the overall social analytics, set KPIs, develop the metrics infrastructure and optimize organic/paid social campaigns. Track and quantify social impact on client business metrics including our ability to grow social footprints for our partners. Accelerate speed to insights for timely decision making; spot trends before they become trends.Additional Responsibilities:Gain predictability in where and how we invest our resources. Skill/Experience/Education Mandatory:BA/BS degree in Journalism, Business Analytics, Economics, Math, Statistics and/or related disciplineMinimum 2-3+ years' experience with social listening tools such as Sysomos, Crimson HexagonProficiencies in Excel/Google spreadsheet with the ability to move and shift dataWell-versed in story-based reporting (on paper and in person): candidate doesn't just cough out facts and figures, but rather thoughtfully and holistically creates reports that address strategic marketing and business questions with a data-based narrative.Track record of effectively delivering multiple projects at one time in very fast-moving environment, strong project management experience.Demonstrated ability to work calmly and maintain good judgment in fast-paced, high-stress environments, as well as ability to escalate appropriately. Desired 1+ years of experience in SQL analyzing sophisticated data sets; well-versed in analytical and presentation tools (pivot tables, graphs, functions, etc)Ability to influence at all levels and work effectively across functions and geographies. Lead non-hierarchical, cross-functional working teams who don't report into this role.SDL2017

Name: Industry X- 3DEXPERIENCE Senior Business Analyst
Description: Job descriptionIndustry X.0 -Level  9 – 3DEXPERIENCE Senior Analyst: The digital revolution is changing everything. It’s  everywhere – transforming how we work and play. Are you reacting to the  disruption each day or are you leading the way as a digital disrupter?  Accenture Digital is driving these exciting changes and bringing them to life  across 40 industries in more than 120 countries. At the forefront of  digital, you’ll create it, own it and make it a reality for clients looking to  better serve their connected customers and operate always-on enterprises.  Join us and become an integral part of our experienced digital team with  the credibility, expertise and insight clients depend on. Industry X.0 A new area within Accenture Digital is Industry X.0, an  advanced, digitally enabled, innovative, planning and  investment approach for manufacturing and asset-intensive industries  In your role within our Industry X.0 team, you’ll help  clients take advantage of significant market opportunities as digital technology  moves into the core of industry in product development and manufacturing  environments. You’ll help them transform their product, manufacturing and  product related services value chains in Products, Communications, Media, High  Tech, Aerospace & Defense, Chemicals, Mining, Oil & Gas and Utilities.  As part of Accenture Digital, you’ll benefit from tailored career  management and specialist skills that will fuel your ambitions in the Industry  X.0 space.  Responsibilities of the 3DEXPERIENCE  Senior Analyst may include: Provide  Technical- and Domain-Expertise on complex projects.Participate  in requirements gathering and specifications creation.Participate  in the technical design, supporting the technical architect.Development:  configure the applications based on the functional and technical design.Deployment  / Implementation: Diagnose and resolve defects. Contribute to, and  prepare, implementation plan details. Execute the implementation  plan.Documentation:  Document the configuration and architecture.Validation  Tests: Conduct unit testing and functional and integration testing,  including preparation of test cases/scenarios and test data.Maintenance:  Analyze, design and produce solution enhancements.Coaching  of workstream team(s).Successfully  supporting the management team in different project workstreams.Programming:  Write new, or modify existing, process extension based on physical design  and/or programming specifications. This includes documenting the code.Reporting:  Progress status and issues.Meet  travel requirements, up to 80%. + Basic qualificationsBasic Qualifications:1  + years of professional experience programming with 3DEXPERIENCE or other  Dassault Systèmes products, including 1 + years of professional experience  programming with JAVABachelor’s  Degree in Software Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science  or related degree.Preferred Qualifications: API development.Systems Implementation  methodology knowledge (Agile Methodology, Waterfall).Data migration experience.Team management experience.Excellent communication  (written and oral) and interpersonal skills.Collaboration skills.Ability to work in a team  environment.Flexibility.Time management skills. All of our consulting  professionals receive comprehensive training covering business acumen,  technical and professional skills development. You’ll also have  opportunities to hone your functional skills and expertise in an area of  specialization. We offer a variety of formal and informal training  programs at every level to help you acquire and build specialized skills  faster. Learning takes place both on the job and through formal training  conducted online, in the classroom, or in collaboration with teammates. The  sheer variety of work we do, and the experience it offers, provide an  unbeatable platform from which to build a career.  Applicants for employment in the US  must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require  sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States and  with Accenture (i.e., H1-B visa, F-1 visa (OPT), TN visa or any other  non-immigrant status).  Candidates who are currently employed by a client of Accenture or an affiliated  Accenture business may not be eligible for consideration. Name: Senior Solutions Sales (MBA) - IBM Summit
Description: Job Description The IBM North America Global Markets team is seeking highly talented individuals to fill consultative, client-focused, business to business relationship roles.  At IBM, were motivated by more than just selling solutions. We want our clients to succeed. Our clients have the future in mind, and your job is to help them get there. As part of IBMs sales team, you will work with clients as they transform organizations and entire industries. As an IBMer, you will have access to the entire organization to develop creative ideas that help clients build the world they envision. Our clients are game changers; join a company where you can do your best work! Our Senior Solution Sellers are guided by IBM's purpose To Be Essential. You will actively:Engage clients to develop trust and credibilityHelp clients, of all sizes and markets, grow their businesses by solving strategic and tactical business problems with IBMs proven cognitive and cloud technology solutionsDemonstrate industry expertise, technology solution knowledge, and consultative sales techniques to influence client decisions, add new value, and meet immediate and long-term business requirementsEngage client decision makers to drive alignment and consensus on IBM solutions via social, phone or in-person interactionsIdentify potential new buyers and solution opportunities within the client organizations using IBM tools and other social business resourcesNegotiate and close deals by understanding, building, and delivering client value propositions; share insights that promote the IBM brand using social mediaDevelop and execute long-term consultative sales strategies to grow current clients and generate new business opportunitiesCollaborate with IBM sales, technical, executive, product development, financial, and other support resources to deliver extraordinary client engagementsContinuously maintain and grow skills and knowledge in consultative sales, industry applications, and technical solutions, applying expertise to demonstrate IBMs thought leadership during client engagements This position requires a challenger mentality; a real passion for client success, sales achievement, and daily collaboration with clients and other IBM teammates. You may work with any of the following business units: Global Markets, Analytics, Business Partners, Cloud, Global Finance, Internet of Things, Security, Services, Systems Hardware, Talent & Collaboration Solutions, Watson Customer Engagement. You may work in one of the following markets: Communication, Distribution, Federal, Financial Services, Industrial or Public. Summit Training During the six-month development program, we provide extraordinary sales, technology, and industry solution training through a combination of classroom and online resources, hands-on field experiences, phone sales, and structured mentorship. We will equip you with the knowledge and skills needed to make an immediate impact and achieve individual growth as a leader.  We offer Summit opportunities in one of 7 metro regions: Atlanta GA, Boston MA, Chicago IL, Dallas TX, New York NY, San Francisco CA, and Washington DC.  Training requires 25% travel. Be a challenger. Step up, get ready and jump into the ring!This role may be for you if you show a proven track record of accomplishment in:Aptitude to learn and use innovative selling technologies (e.g., analytics, social media) to network, engage clients, identify new business opportunities, and translate business requirements into technology solutionsConversant and knowledgeable about technology, trends and how technology is being applied to address business challengesTeam collaboration and leadershipExperience demonstrating business insight for long-lasting client relationships and resultsMotivation to accomplish sales and business objectivesProfessional verbal, written, and interpersonal skillsEmpathy and skills to achieve high levels of customer satisfaction If you would like additional information about the Summit Program, please visit: http://www-03.ibm.com/employment/summit/  IBM will not be providing visa sponsorship for these positions now or in the future. Therefore, in order to be considered for the IBM Summit program, you must have the ability to work without a need for current or future visa sponsorship.  Required Technical and Professional Expertise Bachelors degree in Business, Communications, International Relations, Management Information Systems (MIS) or similar disciplinesPrior work experience in a client sales role (1-2 years) Preferred Tech and Prof Experience Masters degree in Business, International Relations, or similar disciplinesWork experience in one of the following markets: Communication, Distribution, Federal, Financial Services, Industrial or Public (1-2 years) EO Statement  IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Name: Sr Strategy Manager, Product Strategy
Description: At Uber, we ignite opportunity by setting the world in motion. We take on big problems to help drivers, riders, delivery partners, and eaters get moving in more than 600 cities around the world.  We welcome people from all backgrounds who seek the opportunity to help build a future where everyone and everything can move independently. If you have the curiosity, passion, and collaborative spirit, work with us, and let’s move the world forward, together.  About the Role  We are a nimble and highly impactful team responsible for shaping product vision and strategy. The team is responsible for pushing our thinking beyond the here and now: Digging into data, uncovering insights, then developing and socializing a viewpoint on where to play and how to win across multiple time horizons  The team reports directly to the Head of Product and works closely with the CTO and tech leadership to prioritize and drive strategic initiatives, and consists of representatives from product management, analytics, and operations. What You’ll NeedBA/BS degree (EE/CS, MBA degree a plus)6+ years of work experience at a management consulting firm, tech investment banking and/or product management or bizops at a fast-growing technology company.Strong expertise in business analytics and strategy, ability to distill immense datasets to drive strategic decisionsA deep understanding of consumer products and the unique challenges of a double-sided marketplaceA consumer product mindset with a near-unreasonable high bar for user experience tradeoffs for business benefitsHigh degree of comfort with C-level communications and problem solvingTechnical depth that enables you to break down technical complexity and drive problems to conclusion with the engineering team.Tenacity and ability to build from scratchGrittiness and comfort with ambiguity

Name: Business Analyst, Senior
Description: Financial Analysis Associate responsibilities include auditing high-volume expense reports, assisting with Travel and Corporate Cards administration and Vendor Maintenance. A successful Financial Analysis Associate combines excellent communication and analytical skills with a thorough knowledge of accounting principles to analyze financial information and maintain internal policy quality control.Experience in creating reports using Business Intelligence tools and processing invoices/expenses on platforms such as Concur and Oracle Fusion highly desired.Responsibilities include:Auditing expense reports to ensure compliance with T&E policy and to identify potential fraud or waste and abuse of company’s resources.Communicating expense audit progresses and findings, assisting in improving T&E policy compliance and audit plan.Answering high-volume expense/invoice inquires, researching, locating and providing clear and accurate AP information.Assisting with Shield Travel program administration by creating new profiles and answering related inquiries.Assisting with Corporate Cards administration by tracking applications, receipt acknowledgements and physical card deliveries.Adding/Editing suppliers, researching suppliers’ inquiries and other potential aspects of Vendor Maintenance.Potential responsibilities include system implementation, month-end journal entries preparation, AP reporting and internal auditing.Requires 3 to 5 years of professional experience directly related to all aspects of Accounts Payable operational, analytic and reporting functionsConcur expense / invoice processing experience highly desired, including experience creating reports using Concur’s Cognos toolAbility to communicate effectively to all levels of AP stakeholders.Self-starter and proactive learner with a strong customer service mindset, someone can work well both with a team and independently.

We move quickly to serve our clients’ needs so that their financial transactions are handled with ease and efficiency. Client trust and security are paramount in our line of business. Ultimately, our goal is unsurpassed client satisfaction which will lead to personal referrals – our number one source of new business. We recognize that our competitive advantage starts with our people and our culture. At First Republic, we work hard and move quickly as a very coordinated team. If you are looking for an opportunity to grow and contribute in a fun, fast-paced environment, First Republic is the place for you. We have exceptional people focused on providing extraordinary service.  The Client Care Analyst will focus on the contact center’s various business initiatives, including, but not limited to process improvement, special projects, audit support, and technology-related enhancements. business changeDocuments project decisions and project meetingsMonitors project and/or program execution and escalates project issues as necessary.Synthesize findings from data analysis and make and proficient in ExcelStrong communication (presentation and verbal) and project management experienceAbility to adapt to a fluctuating work pace environment.Displays accuracy and thoroughness, while Name: Senior IT Business Analyst
Description: TEAM OVERVIEW Our IT team members are helping to build capabilities to support our rapidly growing company. All of our members are subject matter experts and are hands-on professionals who enjoy building and managing our portfolio of technologies, applications and processes. We are fully integrated into the workflows of our business and are integral to the overall success of our company. The RoleManaging our Applications Portfolio, with a critical emphasis on Salesforce administration.Collaboratively working with business and technology leaders throughout the company to assist in selecting and managing applications.Managing a portfolio that includes Salesforce, Zendesk, Microsoft Office, HR systems and other cloud providers.Managing partner/vendor relationships. Name: Business Program Manager
Description: The Microsoft Customer Service and Support (CSS) team is on the front line with our customers - Consumer and Commercial - helping them get the most from their technology investments.  The Customer, Market and Industry Insights [CMII] team sits within CSS. CMII?s charter is to understand the CSS experience from the customer perspective [Outside - In] as captured through their actions, behaviors, and language; measured through their sentiment and acted upon through Voice of the Customer [VoC] insights. Complimented by the Voice of the Market, we bring an important perspective leading with customer sentiment with the goal of growing loyalty.  The CMII Business Program Manager within Voice of the Customer will lead the development and execution of the team's technical roadmap. As this is a small but mighty team, the ideal candidate will have a holistic understanding between the following areas: data science fundamentals, data analytics and visualization techniques, data management core principles, strategic thinking, and stakeholder management experience with a strong desire to learn. Additionally, business analytics and the related skills [data and statistical], technologies and practices that allow for analysis that leads to meaningful business insights is paramount.  The ideal candidate will also be able to thrive in a sometimes-ambiguous, fast-paced work environment, while delivering outcomes that are aligned with the over-all VoC strategy and program objectives.  This position will report into Customer, Market and Industry Insights leader in Customer Service & Support. *Responsibilities***Core Responsibilities:** + Own the VoC technical roadmap, including the mix of technologies that span internally-developed solutions to enterprise agreements with third party analytics offerings  + Manage the in-house VoC data platform in Azure, data science models built on MS Machine Learning Server, and all VoC dashboards in Power BI through a team of third-party vendors  + Understand business and technical requirements from internal VoC consumers, prioritizing feature, function requests to evolve capabilities while considering data science and engineering resources  + Serve as the main point of contact for translating business needs into complex technical requirements, whether with internal stakeholders or through the evaluation of third-party vendors  + Envision and develop new VoC self-serve tools along with more automated ways to action customer feedback leveraging technology  + Maintain existing SQL data infrastructure and lead the onboarding of new customer feedback data sources as necessary; ensure the platform scales and adapts to change accordingly  + Maintains high level understanding of how natural language processing (NLP) machine learning models work, along with the latest industry methods for extracting meaning from unstructured text sources  + Partner effectively with other VoC team members to execute on shared priorities, especially those deliverables with a high dependence on business and data analytics  + Identify, develop and continuously evolve how we listen to and action customer feedback, in collaboration with VoC offering PMs, to ensure the voice of our customers is infused across CSS  + Analyze competitive and customer data in a timely fashion  + Perform business analysis, including qualitative and quantitative, and deliver in ways that are relevant and easy for diverse stakeholders to consume, understand and use  + Work with various stakeholders and leaders to drive BI automation and drive efficiency gain *Success Criteria includes:** + Capture 100% of the voice of the customer across CSS assisted support interactions  + Execution of a cohesive VoC strategy that delivers the customer voice to the business, allowing Microsoft to deeply understand and effectively act on customer feedback across all products.  + Create efficiency and drive continuous improvements in processing of CSS feedback, leverage the customer voice, realized through automation and machine learning  + Removal of manual processes and obstacles that hinder our ability to understand customer voice at scale, while ensuring high quality output [accuracy]  + Common language and understanding of VoC technology is used across CMII and with key stakeholders that allows for collaborative planning and progression of shared agendas  + Maximum uptime for internal VoC Data Platform and VoC Dashboards *Qualifications***Basic Qualifications:** 5+ years of experience in data science, data management, computer science, or similar fields, preferably with experience in how enterprise customer support organizations function *Preferred Qualifications:** + Bachelor?s Degree in Analytics, Statistics, Math, Computer Science, or similar technical fields  + Strong data and business analytical skills and excellent problem solving ability with strong business and marketing acumen  + Able to translate complex data into action by clearly and cogently communicating the implications of analyses from peers up to senior management.  + Able to frame complicated questions and work with large data sets to distill clear and actionable insights for the business  + Highly organized with meticulous attention to detail and results oriented  + Strong presentation and content development skills to support cohesive story-telling  + Excellent communication and relationship management skills  Hiring Manager: Tina Gentile, Director Customer, Market and Industry Insights  Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form at https://careers.microsoft.com/us/en/accommodationrequest . Name: Business Development Manager
Description: Chime is the largest and fastest-growing company in US Challenger Banking market, with nearly 2M accounts and no physical branches. Were a technology company focused relentlessly on helping our members achieve financial health and our DNA is opposite that of big banks. We dont charge fees, help you save money automatically, give you your paycheck two days early and keep you updated on spending with the best mobile app in banking. And were just getting started. We are proud of our mission, devoted to our members, and passionate about applying technology to the challenge of making financial health a reality for everyone. We have one of the most experienced management teams in FinTech and just raised a $70M Series C led by Menlo Ventures to fuel rapid growth and continue building our SF-based team.The Role As Business Development Manager, you will report to our VP of Business Development and help contribute to Chimes revenue and growth. You will initially help build partnerships with companies that offer products and services that would provide both significant member benefit as well as a revenue opportunity for Chime. By analyzing existing member data and preferences, the competitive landscape, and overall partner opportunities, you will prioritize both verticals and companies within those verticals to approach and negotiate deals with. Youll own the end-to-end opportunity from sourcing to partner performance evaluation. Youll also set the direction of where this offering can go and how deeply we may want to integrate with our best performing partners to further optimize performance. Lastly, youll work with product and marketing to experiment and test marketing channels to drive optimal member benefit and value to Chime. In addition, you will help grow our member base through strategic partnerships with a variety of companies who would represent a compelling distribution opportunity for Chime. Alongside our VP, you will identify high impact categories, prioritize opportunities, and leverage your network in order to structure unique partnerships that add value to both Chime as well as the partner. Lastly, you will provide business development and partnership support for various new product initiatives where we may prioritize a partner strategy over a build or acquire approach. If you have a track record of building high impact partnerships and a deep belief that financial services should exist to drive financial wellness, we want to meet you.Responsibilities Develop and execute partnerships strategy for established and yet-to-be-launched aspects of Chimes business Work closely with product, design, legal/compliance, risk, engineering, analytics, and member services teams to identify and engage partners to grow both distribution, revenue, and product capabilities Navigate your way to partners through your existing network and continue to grow your network to facilitate relationship-building Own partner relationship end-to-end, including initial scoping, negotiations, launch, and ongoing partner management Use analytical resources to prioritize, measure, and optimize partnerships Minimal travel requiredExperience & Skills 5+ years of experience in partnerships and business development Analytical grounding and thought process in order to both prioritize opportunities and evaluate performance Proven ability to negotiate and close deals ranging from tactical, mid-size opportunities, to strategic, large and complex partners Proven track record of relationship development, contract negotiation, and problem solving Ability to shift seamlessly from big picture strategic thinking to detailed operations and tactical execution Interpersonal skills with the ability to think and communicate creatively, thoughtfully, and quickly with both non-technical and technical internal & external teams Highly entrepreneurial and comfortable working in a fast-paced environment with the ability to focus and thrive under minimal guidance Strong network of existing, leverageable relationships preferred but not required BA/BS required or equivalent work experience; MBA optional We provide Competitive salary and equity based on experience, with medical and dental benefits. Free snacks and drinks, plus catered Wednesday lunches. Flexible vacation policy. Monthly happy hours and company events. Dog-friendly office. A challenging and fulfilling opportunity to join one of the most experienced teams in fintech and help create a completely new kind of bank. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. Chime is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

Name: Sr Strategy Manager, Product Strategy
Description: At Uber, we ignite opportunity by setting the world in motion. We take on big problems to help drivers, riders, delivery partners, and eaters get moving in more than 600 cities around the world.  We welcome people from all backgrounds who seek the opportunity to help build a future where everyone and everything can move independently. If you have the curiosity, passion, and collaborative spirit, work with us, and let’s move the world forward, together.  About the Role  We are a nimble and highly impactful team responsible for shaping product vision and strategy. The team is responsible for pushing our thinking beyond the here and now: Digging into data, uncovering insights, then developing and socializing a viewpoint on where to play and how to win across multiple time horizons  The team reports directly to the Head of Product and works closely with the CTO and tech leadership to prioritize and drive strategic initiatives, and consists of representatives from product management, analytics, and operations. What You’ll NeedBA/BS degree (EE/CS, MBA degree a plus)6+ years of work experience at a management consulting firm, tech investment banking and/or product management or bizops at a fast-growing technology company.Strong expertise in business analytics and strategy, ability to distill immense datasets to drive strategic decisionsA deep understanding of consumer products and the unique challenges of a double-sided marketplaceA consumer product mindset with a near-unreasonable high bar for user experience tradeoffs for business benefitsHigh degree of comfort with C-level communications and problem solvingTechnical depth that enables you to break down technical complexity and drive problems to conclusion with the engineering team.Tenacity and ability to build from scratchGrittiness and comfort with ambiguity

Name: Vice President, GTM Strategy & Revenue Operations
Description: Vice President, GTM Strategy & Revenue Operations As VP of Go To Market Strategy and Revenue Operations, you'll report to the CEO and work cross functionally with Marketing, Sales, Self Serve, Product, Data, and Customer Success teams to develop and lead the execution of go-to-market strategies that meet rapidly scaling revenue targets and grow RealtimeBoard's market share. You will be responsible for making sure that our GTM strategy is enabled with all necessary resources (finance, people, partners, etc), operationalized and executed with regular cadence & internal QBRs. Also among responsibilities is calculating and improving unit economics (CAC, LTV, payback, etc) across whole business (SS and HT), maintaining cross department infrastructure of internal tools for users operations, designing integrated revenue forecast for Self Serve and High Touch businesses, enabling Marketing, Sales, Success, Self Serve leaders with necessary resources and helping them to achieve outstanding results. This role will help us build sustainable, predictable and scalable business with a foundation for long term. What You'll Do:Partner with CEO and executive leadership to set ambitious goals for marketing, self-serve and high-touch teamsIdentify, prioritize, and support the execution of strategic growth initiatives, by working cross functionally with marketing, sales, self serve, product, data, and customer success teamsAnalyze CAC, LTV, payback period and other critical business metrics across the whole funnelPartner with marketing, self serve and high touch leaders to design unit economics applicable for the state of businessLeverage product usage data and business analytics to deliver insights and proactively drive business decisions to focus product, marketing and sales on right prioritiesManaging and measure leading indicators of the business to predict outcomesDesign integrated revenue forecast for self serve and high touch businessesBuild and maintain end-to-end revenue (go-to-market) operations functionEvaluate, develop and maintain cross department infrastructure of internal tools for users operations (CRMs, chats, emails tools, data, etc)Design, coordinate, launch and manage cross-functional GTM projects (e.g partners programs, etc)Drive the operating rhythm of the business through regular revenue focused meetings, ops reviews, internal QBRsIdentifying and removing friction in the sales processEnable sales team with relevant compensation plans aligned with strategic goalsSupport sales leadership with alignment of the sales recruiting processes with sales strategyOwn planning, budgeting, compensation, metrics and headcount for GTM functionBuild a highly effective team; coach and mentor team members to support their growth and professional developmentWhat You'll NeedBA/BS degree in math, statistics, economics, business or related discipline, preferredSaaS business operations leadership requiredExperience with self-serve to enterprise model (land & expand), preferredExperience with Product Led Growth GTM models10+ years experience, including 3+ in people management, and proven success leading strategic projects in a business operations, revenue or strategy roleProven track record of improving achieving company KPIs and revenue objectivesTrack record scaling business operations to support the scale of $10M-$200MStrong finance and analytics backgroundExcellent project management skillsHands-on with building models and processesAbility to keep business leaders aligned around business metrics, gain consensus for new processes or tools, make recommendations and, influence at the executive levelCapable of independently seeking information, solving problems, gathering resources and delivering results in ambiguous situationsQuick learner and un-learner, ability to guide leaders and the company through rapid change, effectively lead cross-functional change-management initiatives (to move with the company from stage to stage)Excellent communication and analytical skills with the ability to distill complex ideas and strategies into simple, concise recommendationsEngaging manager and people-developerWhat's in it for youExcellent health benefits that includes medical, dental and visionFlexible time offSnack and drinks providedBrand new office coming soonTeam outings and collaborationAbout RealtimeBoard RealtimeBoard is a leading visual collaboration platform for cross-functional teams in organizations of all sizes. Over 2 million managers, designers, agile coaches, marketers and other professionals collaborate, visualize and collect ideas and share their work using our product. We have 8000+ paying customers from world's most successful and innovative companies, including teams inside Netflix, Twitter, Skyscanner, Qlik, Upwork, Expedia, Spotify, eBay, Cisco, Sapient, Geometry, Unbounce, Autodesk, PwC, Deloitte and others.

Name: Business Operations Manager
Description: WHO WE ARE:LifeDojo is on a mission to reverse the global epidemic of chronic disease by fundamentally reinventing how digital health improvement programs are delivered through companies, healthcare systems, schools and communities. We are turning the traditional medical model upside down and giving the end-user complete control to design their health habit journey. Founded in 2013, LifeDojo has earned the trust of the world’s largest companies and, together, we are having a huge impact on healthcare costs, productivity, and inspiring a genuine culture of health.WHO YOU ARE:2018 has been an exciting year of growth. With that growth, the need for improved processes, project management methods and attention to operational detail has become crystal clear. LifeDojo is seeking a uniquely capable Business Operations Manager to work alongside our executive team to both develop and execute on operational processes within the customer success, finance, sales and marketing departments in order to bring our effectiveness and efficiency to the next level.To be successful, we are seeking exceptional candidates who are:Self-starter - you have a bias towards action and are able to thrive in a fast-paced, constantly changing work environmentProblem solver – you have a talent for synthesizing complex projects, can independently translate high-level goals into actionable plans, and enjoy implementing processFlexible Learner – you can ramp from being familiar to being an expert in a matter of daysNaturally curious – you always look for ways to innovate and improveEntrepreneurial – you crave responsibility and want to shape the vision and direction of the companyOwner – you’re always looking for opportunities to better your work product and own the outcome – both the good and the badRelationship-builder – you can influence and motivate people at all levels across a variety of job functionsIf you are excited by the idea of joining a fast-growing, well-being focused company that is both challenging and exciting, then we’d love to hear from you.REQUIREMENTS:4-6 years of total work experience, including at least 2 years experience at a top-tier management consulting firm, or equivalent experience in venture-backed startup, VC, or strategy / operations position at a fast-growing technology companyBA/BS University Degree with demonstrated honors for excellenceExceptional problem-solving, business judgment, and analytical capabilitiesStrong attention to detail, relentlessly resourceful and able to drive autonomouslyHigh EQ and capable of building strong relationships inside and outside the organizationHighly proficient in excel, powerpoint and other cloud-based productivity suitesPassionate about LifeDojo's missionBONUS SKILLS:Project management training and/or certification(s)Social Science research experience or educational backgroundRecruiting experienceWHY WORK HERE?:If solving behavior change in order to alleviate human suffering gets you jazzed to go to work every day then LifeDojo is the place for you. We are uniquely focused on creating an inspiring, supportive, transparent culture where ideas, discussion, debate and genuine trust thrive.As a wellbeing company we also believe that the healthier and happier you are the better able you will be to excel in your role. We work hard yet maintain a belief that we must also tend to all aspects of our complex lives. Expect to be encouraged to put your physical, mental and emotional health first!COMPENSATION & BENEFITS:Industry competitive salary and stock optionsComprehensive healthcare coverage (medical, dental, vision)401(k) retirement savings planUnlimited PTOFlexible schedulesGym membershipOffice environment designed to support your overall wellbeingLifeDojo is an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal opportunity regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or veteran status.

This position is based in South San Francisco, CA for a long-term contract. Name: Business Analyst, Client Care
Description: OverviewFirst Republic is an ultra-high-touch bank that provides extraordinary client service. We believe that one-on-one interactions build lasting relationships. We move quickly to serve our clients’ needs so that their financial transactions are handled with ease and efficiency. Client trust and security are paramount in our line of business. Ultimately, our goal is unsurpassed client satisfaction which will lead to personal referrals – our number one source of new business. We recognize that our competitive advantage starts with our people and our culture. At First Republic, we work hard and move quickly as a very coordinated team. If you are looking for an opportunity to grow and contribute in a fun, fast-paced environment, First Republic is the place for you. We have exceptional people focused on providing extraordinary service.  The Client Care Analyst will focus on the contact center’s various business initiatives, including, but not limited to process improvement, special projects, audit support, and technology-related enhancements. This individual must have the ability to build positive working relationships with Client Care team members and other departments.ResponsibilitiesSKILLS, KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES:Excellent skills to understand business requirements and business process management, and then translate them to particular reporting, system, or workflow requirementsWorks with Contact Center leadership to define and meet departmental goals. Serves the as a support liaison with partner groups to accomplish cross-functional initiatives. Ability to communicate and present results in a concise, brief, and summarized fashionIdentify, distinguish and analyze multiple data sources to understand challenges and then make recommendations for business changeDocuments project decisions and project meetingsMonitors project and/or program execution and escalates project issues as necessary.Synthesize findings from data analysis and make verbal/written recommendations to upper managementSelf-starter and quick learner with ability to work independently, with minimum direction, and with multiple prioritiesStrong Microsoft Office skills and proficient in ExcelStrong communication (presentation and verbal) and project management experienceAbility to adapt to a fluctuating work pace environment.Displays accuracy and thoroughness, while completing work assignments in a timely manner.Adhering to and complying with the applicable, federal and state laws, regulations and guidance.Ability to function in a PC windows or MAC etc.), 2) adhering to Bank policies and procedures, 3) completing required training, 4) identifying and reporting potential suspicious activity to the BSA/AML Officer, and 5) knowing and verifying the banking/financial services regulatory compliance.Must be able to work independently, efficiently, and possess excellent organizational and prioritization skills.Must be detail-oriented and able to handle multiple tasks concurrently.A strong sense of urgency and superior client service skills.Must be flexible and able to change direction quickly.Comfortable in a fast-paced environmentAbility to handle confidential information and has the judgement to escalate issues when appropriate.Superior verbal and written communication skills.

Name: Analytics Associate
Description: Job Description159 Solutions, an IQVIA company, provides data driven analytical solutions for life sciences commercial teams, with a deep understanding of oncology and specialty markets. 159 Solutions’ strong track record in specialty commercial solutions combined with IQVIA’s capabilities in commercial analytics and deep oncology knowledge set the stage for growth and allow for expanded capacity to support pharma customers in an increasingly competitive environment.Do you …Describe yourself as a data person with strong analytical and technical skills?Consider yourself a strong problem solver with ability to translate data into key business insights?Have an interest in various healthcare data sources and how to leverage them in advising clients on critical sales and marketing decisions?Enjoy working in teams to solve complex analytical problems in a fast-paced and dynamic setting? If you answered “YES” to the above questions, we strongly recommend you to read on. Who we are:We are a rapidly growing healthcare analytics consulting firm, comprised of driven, collegial, and intellectually curious individuals. We own the success of our teams and operate under a culture of mutual respect, casual intensity, and smart risk-taking. Our vision is to become the go-to analytics company in select therapeutic areas. We will achieve this vision by staffing our teams with the right people and offering our clients innovative and insightful solutions to their business needs. Our team of experts come with many years of experience from the healthcare industry or the consulting space. We invest in the growth of our company and achieve our goals by nurturing our people and helping them achieve their professional goals. Analytics Associate Job description: Analytics Associates play a critical role in the success of our projects. They leverage their analytical skills and use tools such as SAS, Alteryx, Excel, and SQL in order to analyze healthcare data sets and present insights and key findings to team members and clients. They work with their fellow team members to understand the client’s business context and provide meaningful insights into solving problems in sales and marketing. In a nutshell, Analytics Associates use excellent technical and communication skills in order to deliver impactful and relevant solutions to clients. They frequently engage with the company leadership and are well-positioned to grow and develop within the organization. . Some of the key activities for the Analytics Associate include:Working closely with experienced Managers and Principals in creating custom solutions for unique business problemsContributing to planning, executing, and delivering projects from start to finish – right from the primary analysis of the data to the final delivery to the clientCollaborating with the onshore and offshore teams in delivering against set project plan and timelineContributing to the broader success of the organization and participating in idea generation, knowledge transfer, and innovation in expanding company services and product offeringsResponsibilities: Analyzing large healthcare data sets using SAS, Alteryx, Excel, SQL, and other database management tools – 60% Working with Principals to build and deliver high impact business solutions to clients with needs in the sales and marketing fields – 20%Understanding business needs and contribute to client management – 10% Contributing to Internal initiatives and helping drive development of new services and product offerings – 10% Qualifications: A Bachelor’s or Advanced Degree in a relevant field such as Engineering, Computer Science, Math, Statistics, Biostatistics, Economics, or BusinessStrong analytical skills with the ability to translate complex analysis into strategic insights and recommendations for sales and marketing teamsKeen interest in the biotechnology, healthcare, and pharmaceutical industry coupled with willingness to learn about product marketing, sales analytics, and business intelligenceExcellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact effectively with teammates and clients in order to comprehend and communicate business and technical needs and requirementsThe ability to adapt to a rapidly-changing environment and balance multiple priorities without compromising quality of work#LI-LG1Job ID: R1030695

Name: Social Media Analyst
Description: Social Media Analyst  Location: San Francisco, CA  Duration: 1 year Description:Candidate will be part of client's global social media team who works closely with Product Marketing Managers covering a wide range of products (such as Android) across markets, aspiring to make client the most loved and engaged social brand in the world while driving core business metrics. As a Business Analyst, you will work with Marketing and other cross-functional teams (Product, Content, Engineering etc) to fully utilize social data in order to uncover insights that inform business and marketing decisions and track/assess the effectiveness of our campaigns/programs. Candidate will have a strong analytics background, proficient at querying data, but also experienced at turning raw data into valuable insights. Should be comfortable running simple linear regression analysis and will demonstrate strategic thinking in combining our data for insights. Good oral and written communication skills essential.Top 3 Daily Responsibilities:Own the overall social analytics, set KPIs, develop the metrics infrastructure and optimize organic/paid social campaigns. Track and quantify social impact on client business metrics including our ability to grow social footprints for our partners. Accelerate speed to insights for timely decision making; spot trends before they become trends.Additional Responsibilities:Gain predictability in where and how we invest our resources. Skill/Experience/Education Mandatory:BA/BS degree in Journalism, Business Analytics, Economics, Math, Statistics and/or related disciplineMinimum 2-3+ years' experience with social listening tools such as Sysomos, Crimson HexagonProficiencies in Excel/Google spreadsheet with the ability to move and shift dataWell-versed in story-based reporting (on paper and in person): candidate doesn't just cough out facts and figures, but rather thoughtfully and holistically creates reports that address strategic marketing and business questions with a data-based narrative.Track record of effectively delivering multiple projects at one time in very fast-moving environment, strong project management experience.Demonstrated ability to work calmly and maintain good judgment in fast-paced, high-stress environments, as well as ability to escalate appropriately. Desired 1+ years of experience in SQL analyzing sophisticated data sets; well-versed in analytical and presentation tools (pivot tables, graphs, functions, etc)Ability to influence at all levels and work effectively across functions and geographies. Lead non-hierarchical, cross-functional working teams who don't report into this role.SDL2017

Name: Localization Business Analyst C
Description: Localization Business Analyst C428 – San Francisco, CALocalization Team is seeking an experienced Localization Business Analyst to help our Localization Operations team. In this role, you’ll guide localization business decision making process through gathering metrics and data from various sources, analyzing them, and providing insights.  In addition, you’ll handle all the budget, cost model update, invoicing, and financial side of our business unit. Lastly, you’ll create high quality decks, reports, and dashboards for the team. Flexibility to work from our Palo Alto office on Tuesdays & Thursdays, and the entire team works from home 1 day per week! What You’ll Do Create function-relevant online dashboards, with little or no help from engineering, for our Localization Program Managers, Language Managers, and Management TeamRecommend strategic decisions to leadership based on analyzing data and providing business insightsUpdate our financial cost model to reflect the reality of our evolving businessOwn and scale vendor financial reporting processEnhance the process for both invoicing and data trackingPerform analytics on raw data and provide regular insight & reportsCreate highly polished decks for management with data pulled in from various sources What You’ll Need BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experienceMinimum of 2 years of localization business analyst experience in high-tech industry on the client sideProficient in SQLExceptional Excel / data management skills and creating reportsExperience presenting data visually and selling ideas to leadershipExperience handling budget and reportingPassionate about subjects such as experimental design, data visualization, and statistical analysis techniques.Ability to navigate ambiguity, work independently and be able to chart direction of projectsStrong analytical and problem solving experience, coupled with excellent business judgmentVery detail-oriented, quality-focused and proactive • Excellent written and verbal communication skills and the ability to manage multiple and diverse stakeholders across businesses and leadership levelsAbility to learn new tools/systems quickly • Self-directed – you need to take initiative in tackling large problems head onExcellent team playerPassionate about the company and our mission Bonus Points For MBA degreeExperience in technology, management consulting, business intelligence, or investment banking sectorExperience with Looker, Tableau, or other data visualization software For more information contact Gary glafave@anzuglobal.com  If this is not what you’re looking for maybe you could refer a colleague. We offer a referral bonus if your colleague is hired.

Name: Director, M&A Operational Due Diligence/Performance Improvement
Description: Business Title: Director, M&A Operational Due Diligence/Performance ImprovementRequisition Number: 36850 - 10Function: Advisory Area of Interest:State: CACity: San FranciscoDescription:Known for being a great place to work and build a career, KPMG provides audit, tax and advisory services for organizations in today's most important industries. Our growth is driven by delivering real results for our clients. It's also enabled by our culture, which encourages individual development, embraces an inclusive environment, rewards innovative excellence and supports our communities. With qualities like those, it's no wonder we're consistently ranked among the best companies to work for by Fortune Magazine, Consulting Magazine, Working Mother Magazine, Diversity Inc. and others. If you're as passionate about your future as we are, join our team.  KPMG is currently seeking a Director in M&A Services for our KPMG Strategy practice.  Responsibilities: As a key advisor to corporate clients, direct and deliver operational due diligence and performance improvement services, while overseeing teams of consultants on each engagementWork closely with the engagement Partner/Managing Director to lead and develop client relationshipsHelp lead business development efforts including writing proposals, participating in pitch meetings, and negotiating scope and termsLead the team to create value-add insights that tie to the client's strategic and financial ambitions, including identifying the underlying value proposition and challenging the client's near and long term investment thesis through structured data analyses to identify operational risks, efficiencies, or other opportunitiesWork across B2B and B2C industries, including industrials, services, healthcare, consumer goods, retail, energy, technology and telecom, and financial servicesParticipate in the professional development of KPMG Strategy team members and assist with the recruiting and training of new staff Qualifications: A minimum of eight years external consulting experience in a client-facing strategy discipline at a Big 4 firm, major strategy firm, or a boutique strategy firm, with a focus on private equity due diligence, operational due diligence, and/or operational performance improvement; additional relevant work experience in M&A Operations for a private equity firm, or in a strategy and/or corporate development department of a Fortune 100 firmBachelor's degree from an accredited college/university, preferably in Business Administration, Engineering, or other related field; Master's degree in Business Administration from an accredited college/university is preferredExperience helping global corporations and/or private equity firms conduct thorough analysis of potential acquisition targets, including assessing and executing operational due diligence, carve-outs, and performance improvements; plus project/program management, strategic cost management, operational improvement, customer profitability, pricing, discount optimization, organizational restructuring, change management, and/or corporate turn-aroundsStrong business acumen, with analytical and problem solving skills and ability to understand how business model decisions impact operating model design/execution across operations, technology, risk governance and organizational designComfort with ambiguity and fluid consulting situationsAbility to travel at a significant level, as needed KPMG LLP (the U.S. member firm of KPMG International) offers a comprehensive compensation and benefits package.
