Name: Industry X- 3DEXPERIENCE Senior Business Analyst
Description: Job descriptionIndustry X.0 -Level  9 – 3DEXPERIENCE Senior Analyst: The digital revolution is changing everything. It’s  everywhere – transforming how we work and play. Are you reacting to the  disruption each day or are you leading the way as a digital disrupter?  Accenture Digital is driving these exciting changes and bringing them to life  across 40 industries in more than 120 countries. At the forefront of  digital, you’ll create it, own it and make it a reality for clients looking to  better serve their connected customers and operate always-on enterprises.  Join us and become an integral part of our experienced digital team with  the credibility, expertise and insight clients depend on. Industry X.0 A new area within Accenture Digital is Industry X.0, an  advanced, digitally enabled, innovative, planning and  investment approach for manufacturing and asset-intensive industries  In your role within our Industry X.0 team, you’ll help  clients take advantage of significant market opportunities as digital technology  moves into the core of industry in product development and manufacturing  environments. You’ll help them transform their product, manufacturing and  product related services value chains in Products, Communications, Media, High  Tech, Aerospace & Defense, Chemicals, Mining, Oil & Gas and Utilities.  As part of Accenture Digital, you’ll benefit from tailored career  management and specialist skills that will fuel your ambitions in the Industry  X.0 space.  Responsibilities of the 3DEXPERIENCE  Senior Analyst may include: Provide  Technical- and Domain-Expertise on complex projects.Participate  in requirements gathering and specifications creation.Participate  in the technical design, supporting the technical architect.Development:  configure the applications based on the functional and technical design.Deployment  / Implementation: Diagnose and resolve defects. Contribute to, and  prepare, implementation plan details. Execute the implementation  plan.Documentation:  Document the configuration and architecture.Validation  Tests: Conduct unit testing and functional and integration testing,  including preparation of test cases/scenarios and test data.Maintenance:  Analyze, design and produce solution enhancements.Coaching  of workstream team(s).Successfully  supporting the management team in different project workstreams.Programming:  Write new, or modify existing, process extension based on physical design  and/or programming specifications. This includes documenting the code.Reporting:  Progress status and issues.Meet  travel requirements, up to 80%. + Basic qualificationsBasic Qualifications:1  + years of professional experience programming with 3DEXPERIENCE or other  Dassault Systèmes products, including 1 + years of professional experience  programming with JAVABachelor’s  Degree in Software Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science  or related degree.Preferred Qualifications: API development.Systems Implementation  methodology knowledge (Agile Methodology, Waterfall).Data migration experience.Team management experience.Excellent communication  (written and oral) and interpersonal skills.Collaboration skills.Ability to work in a team  environment.Flexibility.Time management skills. All of our consulting  professionals receive comprehensive training covering business acumen,  technical and professional skills development. You’ll also have  opportunities to hone your functional skills and expertise in an area of  specialization. We offer a variety of formal and informal training  programs at every level to help you acquire and build specialized skills  faster. Learning takes place both on the job and through formal training  conducted online, in the classroom, or in collaboration with teammates. The  sheer variety of work we do, and the experience it offers, provide an  unbeatable platform from which to build a career.  Applicants for employment in the US  must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require  sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States and  with Accenture (i.e., H1-B visa, F-1 visa (OPT), TN visa or any other  non-immigrant status).  Candidates who are currently employed by a client of Accenture or an affiliated  Accenture business may not be eligible for consideration.  Accenture is an EEO and Affirmative Action Employer of  Females/Minorities/Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities.  Equal Employment Opportunity  All employment decisions shall be  made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin,  ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender  identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status  or any other basis as protected by federal, state, or local law.  Accenture is committed to providing veteran employment opportunities to our  service men and women.  APPLY SAVE THIS JOBShare

Name: Market Planner - Canada Outlet
Description: Forget what you know about old-school industry rules. When you work at Old Navy, youre choosing a different path. From day one, weve been on a mission to democratize fashion and make shopping fun again. Our teams make style accessible to everyone, creating high-quality, must-have fashion essentials for the whole family, with love, season after season. We opened our first store in 1994 in San Francisco and have been on a roll ever since. Today, customers can find fabulous fashion at affordable prices online and in one of our 1,000+ stores globally. Old Navy celebrates a workplace thats just as diverse as our customers. Fun, fashion, family and value are at the heart of everything we do. We cultivate a community of playful personalities that thrive in a fast-paced environment where our employees can be their most authentic selves. Here, were family. Old Navy a brand for everyone a place for you!The Market Planner creates and manages sales and inventory plans from investment through allocation at the product/category/item level for the Outlet (ONO) channel within the Old Navy Canada market. The Market Planner is responsible for ensuring that the development and management of assortment, demand and inventory plans achieve divisional financial goals.Responsibilities span across business analytics, pricing strategy, assortment + investment planning, and store communications. The role stretches from daily business management and reporting of financials, to identifying, driving and recapping key deviations specific to the Canada ONO business. Key Roles and Responsibilities: Financial Planning - Forecasting Develop and build department & class level plans that support division strategyDevelop and build pre-season style plans and recommend investment quantities and accurate flow forecastsManage the reconciliation of class-to-department bottoms-up plansDevelop and build department/class level allocation strategiesCreate and execute sizing and packing strategies that support department and divisional objectivesResponsible for open-to-buy activities at department/class level Plan Management - Allocation Manage inventory plans from investment through allocation execution, including ongoing assessments and updatesEnsure receipt accuracy to support in-season allocation strategiesOwn and approve initial inventory releasesForecast in-season sales and inventory and develop strategies to maximize opportunities and mitigate riskManage the reconciliation of class-to-department bottoms-up plansStrategize, recommend and execute in-season pricing strategiesAccountable for campaign margin roll up specific to ONO, and its impact on total marketOwn in-season management of ONO exclusive product promotion cadence, sales forecasting, and markdown strategy Product/Assortment: Identify exclusive ONO assortment needs - collaborate with key stakeholders to drive divisional strategies unique to ONO stores, gain alignment and ensure budget expectations are met.Drive assortment + investment planning for ONO exclusive product.Influence allocation strategies to fuel ONO business strategies partner with store planning and Canada allocation analyst for proper execution. Name: UM - Manager, Analytics
Description: Position Summary At UM, Analytics, Decision Sciences, and Research works as a team, which is uniquely capable of delivering a smartly blended solution by tapping a broad set of analytical skills. The Manager, Analytics is tasked with partnering with key internal and client teams to oversee measurement, insights and performance optimization deliverables. The ideal candidate is able to push beyond the obvious answers and quickly use the data, tools, analysis techniques and resource partners to get to the root of story. The manager of Analytics is a subject matter expert, but also eager in the desire to learn and further develop the discipline.  Essential Functions Ownership of ongoing analytics and measurement programs for media planning and investment solutions Work with internal and client stakeholders to development measurement plans including establishing campaign performance benchmarks, media goals, and statistical framework Manage dashboard and insights programs across campaigns, competitive intelligence, audience analytics leveraging UM Audience Measurement Platform Manage marketing mix modeling data requirements and implementation of optimization analysis End to end ownership of brand health survey research programs (survey design, insights development, presentations) including coordination with external measurement partners such as comScore, Research Now, and Millward Brown Responsible for client communication including reporting, requests and questions Manage timelines for dashboards and other client insights deliverables Qualifications Education:  Bachelors degree Concentration in statistics, mathematics, economics, finance, business, science or engineering is highly preferred Work Experience:  5+ years analytical experience, preferably in the advertising or media industry Skills:  Strong understanding of advertising measurement and analytics, with the ability to provide meaningful insight to the client as well as internal teams. Experience developing insights from third-party ad serving and digital analytics/attribution tools: DoubleClick, Adobe, Google Analytics, Visual IQ, etc. Experience with statistical analysis, including test design and sample requirements Proficiency with at least one statistical software package such as SAS and R; general programming experience (SQL, Python, Excel VBA, etc.) is a huge plus Proven ability to digest and explain complex ideas to a diverse group of stakeholders; including data visualization/ dashboards using tools such as Tableau and Datorama Experience developing custom measurement solutions; including survey design and fielding Must be a team player but also have the ability to work independently High proficiency in Microsoft Office suite (Excel, PowerPoint) Ability to work under pressure and manage multiple priorities About Us: UMs culture is an inclusive one, where people are encouraged to bring their full selves to the office, and where personal and professional growth are a priority of every member of the team. The executive leadership is dedicated to building a culture that permeates every element of the company, from work flexibility, to career planning and regular talent reviews, to an active culture club. They proudly uphold the following values:  A full-service media agency, UM strives to use Better Science and Art to create moments that drive business momentum for brands. Founded in 1999, UM is made up of entrepreneurially-minded planners, researchers, investment experts, decision scientists, account executives, and content and activation specialists over 4,800 employees across  130 offices in over  100 countries around the world. They are globally headquartered in New York, with six additional North America offices in Dallas, Detroit, Los Angeles, Miami, San Francisco, and Toronto.  Courage: having the courage to try the things that make us afraid, present something to a client that we know isnt what they are expecting, taking on roles that we may be a bit intimidated by, inventing the future, etc. Candor: pushing ourselves to have the hard conversations with colleagues, team members, clients and media partners that will make us all better. Curiosity: being curious about the world, media, our clients and each other and using this curiosity to find new and innovate ways of doing everything we do. Commitment: being committed to UM, our teams, and our clients and going above and beyond when it is required. Community: being an active and positive participant in the UM community, our team and client communities, our local community and the world and creating valued communities with the people, clients and partners that we work with. Caring: caring about those around us both their work lives as well as their personal lives and working to make everyone have as complete and fulfilling a life as possible. As a company, they are constantly pushing themselves to improve, under their Better Science, Better Art, Better Outcomes banner, striving to set the bar in the ever-evolving media landscape. Key clients include J&J, Sony, HULU, H&M, Coca-Cola, Hersheys, Spotify Exxon, and BMW.

Name: Business Analyst (Salesforce Service Cloud)
Description: Job DescriptionWe live in a moment of remarkable change and opportunity. Data and technology are transforming industries, society, and even the workplace by creating professions that did not exist before the emergence of data, cloud, social, and mobile technologies.  As the largest technology and consulting employer in the world, IBM is a leader in this global transformation and is just the place to continue your career. Network in an open, friendly and flexible work environment where diversity is embraced, while new and creative ways of thinking are encouraged and supported. As an IBMer, you can change the way the world works. Join this IBM team and be part of a diverse and global company of thinkers and doerspeople who want to make an impact, cultivate their expertise and collaborate with some of the worlds top business and technology professionals.  The Client Support IT team is looking for an experienced Business Analyst to join our high-performing application development team. Our portfolio of applications spans electronic support, call/problem management, and entitlement systems. We operate and transform the capabilities for IBM worldwide technical support which is key to IBMs growth.  IBM is focused on the client experience. A key measurement of client satisfaction is the Net Promoter Score (NPS). In this role, you will be responsible for driving NPS improvements for clients as well as IBM support professionals. Youll work with the support and transformation leadership teams to gather, analyze and drive change using client satisfaction data, direct client interaction, and executives from across the IBM support organization. Working with the development teams, you will develop actions to improve NPS scores and communicate the progress to executive leadership as well as the IBM support teams. This position will require the ability to work across management matrices and also leverages strong Agile and iteration management skills. Who you are:Self-motivated and self-managed with a demonstrated analytical ability and curiosityTakes creative approaches to problem solving, innovation, and issue resolutionWorks independently and within a team settingStrong oral and written communication skillsFluent in EnglishLive in or willing to move to Armonk NY, Austin TX, Littleton MA, or Raleigh NC to work collaboratively in the officeHow well help you grow:This role will give you executive visibility and the chance to show that you can drive impactful change.Offer an opportunity to be a part of a hardworking team in a collaborative, borderless organization in an inspiring, empowered environmentProvide a place where youre proud to work and where you are motivated to produce the best results possible No remote opportunities exist  Must have the ability to work in the US without current/future need for IBM sponsorshipRequired Technical and Professional Expertise 10+ years of experience with IBM support or development processAbility to work with both the business and technical resources to understand and define functional/technical requirements Ability to use Agile collaboration tools (e.g. Mural, Slack, RTC, Trello)Working familiarity with Agile development conceptsMust have excellent communication skills Preferred Tech and Prof Experience Subject matter expert in Salesforce Service CloudFamiliarity with IBM brand and business structure EO Statement  IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Name: Business Program Manager
Description: The Microsoft Customer Service and Support (CSS) team is on the front line with our customers - Consumer and Commercial - helping them get the most from their technology investments.  The Customer, Market and Industry Insights [CMII] team sits within CSS. CMII?s charter is to understand the CSS experience from the customer perspective [Outside - In] as captured through their actions, behaviors, and language; measured through their sentiment and acted upon through Voice of the Customer [VoC] insights. Complimented by the Voice of the Market, we bring an important perspective leading with customer sentiment with the goal of growing loyalty.  The CMII Business Program Manager within Voice of the Customer will lead the development and execution of the team's technical roadmap. As this is a small but mighty team, the ideal candidate will have a holistic understanding between the following areas: data science fundamentals, data analytics and visualization techniques, data management core principles, strategic thinking, and stakeholder management experience with a strong desire to learn. Additionally, business analytics and the related skills [data and statistical], technologies and practices that allow for analysis that leads to meaningful business insights is paramount.  The ideal candidate will also be able to thrive in a sometimes-ambiguous, fast-paced work environment, while delivering outcomes that are aligned with the over-all VoC strategy and program objectives.  This position will report into Customer, Market and Industry Insights leader in Customer Service & Support. *Responsibilities***Core Responsibilities:** + Own the VoC technical roadmap, including the mix of technologies that span internally-developed solutions to enterprise agreements with third party analytics offerings  + Manage the in-house VoC data platform in Azure, data science models built on MS Machine Learning Server, and all VoC dashboards in Power BI through a team of third-party vendors  + Understand business and technical requirements from internal VoC consumers, prioritizing feature, function requests to evolve capabilities while considering data science and engineering resources  + Serve as the main point of contact for translating business needs into complex technical requirements, whether with internal stakeholders or through the evaluation of third-party vendors  + Envision and develop new VoC self-serve tools along with more automated ways to action customer feedback leveraging technology  + Maintain existing SQL data infrastructure and lead the onboarding of new customer feedback data sources as necessary; ensure the platform scales and adapts to change accordingly  + Maintains high level understanding of how natural language processing (NLP) machine learning models work, along with the latest industry methods for extracting meaning from unstructured text sources  + Partner effectively with other VoC team members to execute on shared priorities, especially those deliverables with a high dependence on business and data analytics  + Identify, develop and continuously evolve how we listen to and action customer feedback, in collaboration with VoC offering PMs, to ensure the voice of our customers is infused across CSS  + Analyze competitive and customer data in a timely fashion  + Perform business analysis, including qualitative and quantitative, and deliver in ways that are relevant and easy for diverse stakeholders to consume, understand and use  + Work with various stakeholders and leaders to drive BI automation and drive efficiency gain *Success Criteria includes:** + Capture 100% of the voice of the customer across CSS assisted support interactions  + Execution of a cohesive VoC strategy that delivers the customer voice to the business, allowing Microsoft to deeply understand and effectively act on customer feedback across all products.  + Create efficiency and drive continuous improvements in processing of CSS feedback, leverage the customer voice, realized through automation and machine learning  + Removal of manual processes and obstacles that hinder our ability to understand customer voice at scale, while ensuring high quality output [accuracy]  + Common language and understanding of VoC technology is used across CMII and with key stakeholders that allows for collaborative planning and progression of shared agendas  + Maximum uptime for internal VoC Data Platform and VoC Dashboards *Qualifications***Basic Qualifications:** 5+ years of experience in data science, data management, computer science, or similar fields, preferably with experience in how enterprise customer support organizations function *Preferred Qualifications:** + Bachelor?s Degree in Analytics, Statistics, Math, Computer Science, or similar technical fields  + Strong data and business analytical skills and excellent problem solving ability with strong business and marketing acumen  + Able to translate complex data into action by clearly and cogently communicating the implications of analyses from peers up to senior management.  + Able to frame complicated questions and work with large data sets to distill clear and actionable insights for the business  + Highly organized with meticulous attention to detail and results oriented  + Strong presentation and content development skills to support cohesive story-telling  + Excellent communication and relationship management skills  Hiring Manager: Tina Gentile, Director Customer, Market and Industry Insights  Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form at https://careers.microsoft.com/us/en/accommodationrequest .  Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

Focuses on solving conflict, not blaming; Maintains confidentiality; Listens to others without interrupting; Keeps emotions under control; Remains open to others' ideas and tries new things. Name: Senior Strategy & Planning Associate - Global CommOps
Description: At Uber, we ignite opportunity by setting the world in motion. We take on big problems to help drivers, riders, delivery partners, and eaters get moving in more than 600 cities around the world. We welcome people from all backgrounds who seek the opportunity to help build a future where everyone and everything can move independently. If you have the curiosity, passion, and collaborative spirit, work with us, and lets move the world forward, together.  About the Role Based in San Francisco, the Senior Strategy & Planning Associate - Global CommOps will deliver high priority projects across the Community Operations organization, which is responsible for providing customer support to the rider and driver-partner community. As a member of the Community Operations Team, you will drive the analysis behind company-wide decisions related to our community's support experience. For this role you should have excellent analytical skills, excellent time-management and organizational habits, and the ability to clearly communicate and present information for stakeholders at all levels of the business.  What You'll Do Drive analysis on globe-spanning projects and important strategic decisions improving the experience for our partner drivers and ridersCoordinate with other members of the Community Operations Team to measure the impact and efficiency of new products and business processesDevelop analytical frameworks to support the company in new markets and productsIdentify operational weaknesses and help improve or innovate new processes to keep local teams as efficient as possibleBuild, maintain, and communicate detailed reporting models to assist city-level, regional, and global operations managers What You'll Need BA/BS/Masters in Economics, Business, Engineering, or other quantitative focusMinimum 4 years of investment banking / consulting / analytical or related experienceExcellent communication and organization skillsBalance attention to detail with swift execution - we need to do things quickly, and we need to do them well. Balancing those can be challenging, and this should be a strengthExceptional Excel / data management skillsBonus Points ifHigh-growth analytics or operations experienceSQL experienceAbout the Team The Strategy & Planning team works with teams around the world to provide critical business insights to help identify opportunities and implement operational improvements.

Name: Inside Sales
Description: Over the next 10 years, biotech will fundamentally rewrite the way we live. Gene editing and cell therapy will dramatically change how we treat cancer and other major illnesses. Biofuels and biomaterials will transform the cars we drive, the clothes we wear, and the makeup of everyday objects. Crop science and synthetic biology will produce sustainable and ethical food. Benchling's mission is to accelerate the research that propels us towards this future, and magnify its impact, through modern software.  Every day, scientists around the world use Benchling in their efforts to solve humanity's most pressing problems. For these scientists, Benchling is the central technology they use to conduct their research.  Benchling was founded by a team of MIT graduates and has raised funding from Benchmark, Andreessen Horowitz, Thrive Capital, and Y Combinator. Our customers include pharmaceutical giants, leading biotechs, and the world's most renowned research institutes.  Benchling is building a team of world-class account executives to drive commercialization of our product. You will be responsible for the complete sales lifecycle, including outbound prospecting and achieving quota and related revenue objectives within your assigned account territories. This includes daily prospecting, qualifying opportunities, and efficiently leveraging internal resources to bring opportunities to a successful close, then facilitating the hand-off to customer success. Responsibilities:Daily outbound calling through established campaigns to prospective customers / prospectsConsistent attainment of financial targets within assigned territoryAttainment of productivity metricsEstablish and expand relationships with customer influencers, decision makers and executivesEducate prospects on Benchling's value proposition and solutionsDevelop and execute territory and sales plan for assigned territoryOwn the entire sales cycle, with management oversight and support: proposal development, pricing, negotiation, and closingPartner with marketing on campaigns and lead generation activitiesCoordinate internal resources within sales and other departments to achieve objectivesMaintaining and updating pipeline and other relevant data in internal company systems (CRM)Weekly / monthly / quarterly Pipeline & territory forecastingYou:Minimum 3+ years of previous tech / software sales experience, preferredConsistent track record of exceeding sales targetsTenacity is a mustExcellent organizational and time management skillsExcellent verbal and written communication skillsKnowledge of computer usage in a web-based environmentStrong business planning and analytical skillsSelf-motivated, able to assume responsibility, and work in a professional team environmentDegree in a Life Sciences discipline, Business or Computer Science preferred, or equivalent relevant sales experience

Name: Manager, Web Analytics

In this role, you will partner with the Digital Experience and Interactive team, integrated marketing teams and business groups to refine and optimize the website user experience thereby increasing conversion, optimizing marketing channels and informing key UX/UI decisions. Name: Business Information Security Officer (BISO)
Description: Location: San Francisco, CA  SEND RESUMEOur client is a $30B+ global company that holds the #2 market position in their industry and is committed to a major transformation that includes centralizing and growing their cybersecurity team as well as a move to be a very nimble, open source development, and cloud enabled organization. As part of their expansion and commitment to cybersecurity, our client is currently seeking a Business Information Security Officer (BISO) for their SF area business.  The BISO functions as the security leader focusing on Information Security Risk Management, Policy Compliance, Access Management, Data Protection, and Security Awareness and Education. This person will be accountable to an area of responsibility and will report both into that area as well as the Information Security Program Office.  This individual will be responsible for establishing and driving a business specific Information Security program aligned with the business area risks and will serve as a trusted advisor, both to the business and to the CISO. This role will be accountable for keeping clear lines of communication including but not limited to; transparency to the business on upcoming security initiatives, reporting of security risks to the CISO and appropriate committees, as well as a key player in the information security incident response process, from identifying impact to the business and to consumers, to helping shape remediation, and developing external and internal message points. In addition, this role will ensure business compliance with the Information Security Policy and Standards while continuously monitoring and reporting on risks and documented exceptions.  Establish a documented Information Security Program and supporting strategy for the area of responsibility (AOR) Ensure program is aligned with the Information Security Program, Policies and StandardsEnsure inclusion of all applicable regulatory, legal and contractual obligationsLeverage the Enterprise and specific Information Security Risk Assessments to establish and monitor the programUpdate the program annuallyKey Success CriteriaSupport the Business Unit and CISO in seeking cost optimizing and driving reduction in operations costs of managing the security controls.Increased levels of security across designated Business Unit.Improved compliance with security standards and policies across Business Unit teams.Greater awareness of information security and data privacy requirements (globally); andDrive adoption of global security program standards throughout the product and core business platform teams.Required Skills and Experience:Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience plus at least 8 years of experience in audit and/or information security related role.Strong understanding of audit/risk management methodologies and regulatory requirements pertaining to information security, privacy and/or data securityBroad technical security background is desiredProject management experience highly desiredAbility to manage multiple complex priorities and competing agendas without express authority over delivery teamsAbility to interpret and apply policies and regulations across a large, complex businessAnalytical aptitude with an emphasis on investigative, methodical critical questioning and logical thinking; a data-driven decision makerHigh level of interpersonal skills to interact with leaders at multiple levels and facilitate team interactionsAdvanced skills with MS-Windows and other related PC applications SEND RESUMEFor immediate consideration, please forward an updated resume to Jason M. Lentz at jlentz@htassociates.com or call (847) 577-0300.Share this:Click to share on Twitter (Opens in new window)Click to share on LinkedIn (Opens in new window)Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window)Click to share on Google+ (Opens in new window)Click to print (Opens in new window)Like this:Like Loading...

Name: Sr. Account Executive Media and Communications
Description: As a Senior Account Executive at SAS, you will be responsible for the sale of SAS software products, solutions and services to current and prospective clients in the assigned territory. This is a highly strategic position where your responsibilities will include working with and leading other sales, services, and support personnel to position SAS solutions with clients in the communications and media sector. Primary Responsibilities:Sells software solutions and services to current and prospective customers to achieve required revenue targets.Develops a 12/24/36 month account plan for each key client in the territory. Keys to success include understanding the client’s key business objectives, the constraints keeping the client from fully realizing those objectives, how SAS could help the customer to overcome those constraints, and the primary contacts within the client who are charged with overcoming those constraints to drive business success.Implements strategies for generating sales opportunities within the territory based on the multi-year account plan and the identified business needs of the client where SAS can address those needs.Qualifies each opportunity to determine SAS’ goodness of fit, the client’s readiness to purchase, and the probability of successfully closing each opportunity by developing a formalized opportunity plan for each key sales engagement.Leads other sales personnel including technical sales consultants, post sales consultants, SAS management, and SAS legal to prosecute sales engagements and close those opportunities when forecasted.Develops an in depth understanding of company pricing and licensing procedures.Prepares standard quotations and proposals; works collaboratively with his/her extended sales team to create and finalize contracts and set time schedules for the provision of professional services and training.Follows up with customers to track satisfaction levels and to discover additional revenue opportunities.Accurately forecasts revenues to ensure sales engagements will close when anticipated and at the forecasted value.Essential Qualifications:Bachelor's degree; preferably in Business, Marketing, MIS, or other relevant discipline.Requires a minimum of five years of experience in direct sales, marketing, or technical sales support of computer software solutions (including related training products and services), computer hardware, or telecommunications software/hardwareAbility to travel as much as 70% or as business needs require.Work location of San Diego or San Francisco are strongly preferred to minimize required travel. Portland, Seattle and Denver also considered.Additional Requirements:Experience in and knowledge of complex technology solution sales; knowledge of software and/or hardware acquisition cycles and buying influences.Ability to analyze and evaluate territory dynamics and develop a sales plan at both the territory and individual client level.General understanding of business, analytical, and technical concepts with the ability to communicate and relate SAS’ capabilities to client needs.Ability to work independently and as part of a team.Preferences:Significant experience selling software solutions into the communications and media industry is preferred.Equivalency:Equivalent combination of education, training and experience may be considered in place of the above qualifications. SAS looks not only for the right skills, but also a fit to our core values. We seek colleagues who will contribute to the unique values that makes SAS such a great place to work. We look for the total candidate: technical skills, values fit, relationship skills, problem solvers, good communicators and, of course, innovators. Candidates must be ready to make an impact. Additional Information: To qualify, applicants must be legally authorized to work in the United States, and should not require, now or in the future, sponsorship for employment visa status. SAS is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. Read more: Equal Employment Opportunity is the Law. Also view the supplement EEO is the Law, and the notice Pay Transparency  Equivalent combination of education, training and experience may be considered in place of the above qualifications. The level of this position will be determined based on the applicant's education, skills and experience. Resumes may be considered in the order they are received. SAS employees performing certain job functions may require access to technology or software subject to export or import regulations. To comply with these regulations, SAS may obtain nationality or citizenship information from applicants for employment. SAS collects this information solely for trade law compliance purposes and does not use it to discriminate unfairly in the hiring process. Want to stay up to date with life at SAS, products and jobs? Follow us on LinkedIn

Name: Data Engineer
Description: Join us as we pursue our disruptive new vision to make machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and strive to provide the best experience for our customers. At Splunk, we're committed to our work, customers, having fun, and most meaningfully to each other's success.  The internal innovation team using and promoting the use of Splunk is looking for a Data Engineer to architect and build innovative use cases for Splunkers. This position is responsible to build and scale the data infrastructure that works in conjunction to Splunk to provide business analytics. The role involves ownership and technical delivery, working closely with other members of marketing, sales, sales engineering, product management, development engineering, and partners, leading the end to end experience. The position is based at Splunk's Bay Area offices in San Francisco or San Jose, California and is an excellent opportunity at a fast-growing and dynamic enterprise technology company. Strong technical experience within enterprise software is critical.  Responsibilities: I want to and can do that! Insights: Enable Splunk's internal business users to make decisions based on data in a dynamic, fast-growing environment. Implement operational and analytical reporting use cases and dashboards for internal departments such as Finance.Agility: Closely collaborate with our Product Owners and Business Systems Analysts to align priorities and for verification of developed solutions. Ability to work on the development initiatives (multiple technologies) as part of a scrum team on sprint cycles.Innovation: Build a scalable data infrastructure with the structure and rigor of solving engineering problems. Build data pipelines that collect, process, and organize data from internal and third party data sourcesAble to develop visualization (preferably using Splunk) for the aggregated information by the pipeline and educate the business owner on the optimal use of the solution to answer business critical questions.Streamline: Define and follow coding standards, unit test framework and establish standard methodologies, as applicable. Work with business analysts and data engineers to enable self-service analysis for data analysts within business teamsOperate: Provide operational & production support for the data pipeline and the Visualizations. Basic Qualifications B.S. degree in computer science, mathematics, statistics or a similar quantitative field4+ years of work experience in a relevant field (Data Engineer, DW Engineer, Software Engineer, etc.)Proficient in at least one modern programming language (e.g. Python, Java)Experience leading large-scale cloud data warehousing and analytics projects, including using AWS technologies Redshift, Snowflake, Kafka, S3, EC2, Data-pipelineExperience processing and automation of large amounts of data, in various formats such as Parquet, ORC and processing data in batch and streaming modeExperience building agile, loosely coupled and extensible data infrastructureExperience ingestion of data from internal and third party sources and familiarity with data design principles. Own data quality throughout all data life cycles, including acquisition, cleaning, processing, and validationExcellent SQL skills and experience with relational databases.Proficiency in a major programming language (e.g. Java) and/or a scripting language (Perl/Python) utilizing the REST APIs.Strong communication skills and ability to discuss the product with PMs and business ownersSelf-starter who truly enjoys a fast-paced, innovative software start-up environment. An innate desire to deliver and a strong sense of teamworkPassionate about groundbreaking technology, enjoys creativity, and has strong written and verbal communication skills.Experience with Splunk, SFDC are a plus.Experience with the Agile framework of implementation is a plus. We value diversity at our company. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which you are applying.  For job positions in San Francisco, CA, and other locations where required, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.SDL2017

Name: Analytics & Insights Team Lead
Description: At Uber, we ignite opportunity by setting the world in motion. We take on big problems to help drivers, riders, delivery partners, and eaters get moving in more than 600 cities around the world.  We welcome people from all backgrounds who seek the opportunity to help build a future where everyone and everything can move independently. If you have the curiosity, passion, and collaborative spirit, work with us, and let’s move the world forward, together. About the Role The Analytics & Insights Team Lead will manage high priority projects across the organization, supporting our program managers and lines of business. This role will work with our Core Business Support team to provide critical business insights to help identify opportunities and implement operational improvements. Leveraging operational and analytical experience from challenging environments in the past, this person will manage a team of analysts and will be instrumental in driving our business forward. We’re looking for a strategic critical thinker who can start at a higher level and then dive deep into the details to deliver results.  The ideal candidate for this role should have strong analytical skills, experience managing a team, excellent time-management, and organizational habits, and the ability to clearly communicate and present information to seek buy-in. What You'll DoLead a team of highly skilled analysts to deliver key analysis and projects across our Community Operations organizationServe as project manager and support your team on the day-to-day execution of their projects, reporting, and other functions your team takes on.Coordinate with key stakeholders to scope, manage, and execute against projects plansDrive analysis on important strategic decisions to optimize our customer support programWork closely with other members of the Uber team, measure the impact and efficiency of support delivery processes and identify ways support can drive value to the businessDevelop analytical frameworks to help operationalize new productsIdentify operational weaknesses and help improve or innovate new processes that drive operational excellenceBuild, maintain, and communicate detailed reporting and analytics modelsWhat You'll NeedBachelor’s DegreeMinimum 3 years of experience investment banking, consulting, business intelligence, strategy or related experience; high-growth operations or startup experienceAbility to be an effective leader managing teamsExceptional communication and organization skillsAbility to work with remote teams to develop strategies and foster a cohesive and creative work environmentInvestigate and get the data we require will make you much more effective in this roleExceptional Excel / data management skillsSQL expertiseExperience with R and/or Python, data visualization toolsBonus Points ifMBA degree or masters in a quantitative field (e.g., analytics, statistics)About the Team The NorthAm Community Operations team ensures that we are providing high-quality support at scale. The Analytics & Insights team is tasked with providing critical business insights to help identify opportunities and implement operational improvements across our entire organization.

Name: Atlas Operations
Description: Atlas Operations  San FranciscoEnable more people to start internet businesses  In 2016, we launched Stripe Atlas, a new way for entrepreneurs anywhere in the world to start an Internet business. Since then, we’ve been heartened by the opportunity to help entrepreneurs from more than 125 countries build global companies. We’ve been hard at work adding features to make it easier to start and run a company. Beyond incorporation and a bank account, our tools handle stock issuance, taxes, registered agent renewal, and more. Stripe’s mission is to expand the GDP of the internet, and our mission with Atlas is to enable more people—wherever they might be—to start internet businesses.  As a member of the Stripe Atlas Operations team, you will design, scale and drive programs in partnership with customer support, risk, compliance, and engineering teams to help founders build better businesses. You will own relationships with some of our partners (e.g. banks or accounting firms) and will make sure they offer great products, services and experiences to our users.  Stripe Atlas operates as a small startup within Stripe, and you’ll be a key contributor to driving our mission and expanding our impact.You will: Develop, maintain, and own partnerships that power Atlas features. Partners can be banks, legal or accounting firms and potentially companies in other spaces in the future.Work with partners to manage day-to-day operations, debug breakages, and improve processes.Work with engineering and operational teams to build tools that improve our operational processes.Develop and drive programs involving various internal Stripe teams and often external partners to make sure that our product and operations are ready for larger scale.Develop, monitor and analyze metrics measuring efficiency and effectiveness of Atlas Operations. Drive key business decisions using the insights derived from quantitative analysis.Do whatever it takes to help our users. You will hold the rest of the team and our partners accountable for high standards of customer experience.You are:Users first: you care deeply about the customer experience and go the extra mile to help users solve problems. You are passionate about helping entrepreneurs build businesses.Analytical: You are incisive about breaking down problems, and excel at using data to drive decisions (even when the data is not perfect).Exceptionally effective: You are an outstanding project manager, who can take an idea to impact without direction. You routinely deliver results people didn’t think were possible.Polished communicator: You have excellent communication skills, both written and verbal. You are comfortable working with executive and operational teams of external partners and are capable of driving negotiations on your own.Rigorous: You always question the first answer and enjoy going levels deeper to find all the edge cases. You are rigorous when designing new processes and put a high bar on the quality of your deliverables.Urgent: You move fast and you’re comfortable doing whatever it takes to get the job done. You are also comfortable working on multifaceted problems you’ve never faced before. It’s not expected that any single candidate would have expertise across all of these areas—we’re looking for candidates that are particularly strong in a few areas, and have some interest and capabilities in others.#LI-FB1We look forward to hearing from you. Apply now

Description: Cannot process Visa at this time and will accept only Green Cards and Citizens *** H1b visa and EADs DO NOT apply *** Looking for a Salesforce Business Analyst to engage directly with business units to; identify system needs for accomplishing business goals, create process maps and wireframes, evaluate solutions, assist with prioritization, manage delivery and QA Own execution of declarative configuration and maintenance in Salesforce (ie, reports, page layouts) Provide user administration support like granting access and addressing general usability questions Monitor and respond to feature and support requests Verify and conduct regression testing of functionality before release to users Participate in daily scrum meetings to report progress and address obstacles Excellent communication and client facing skills Requirements and Skills; 3+ years Salesforce administration experience Salesforce Certifications required Adept at working independently while staying in sync with team and stakeholders Experience working in an agile environment and using Atlassian tools a plus Certifications & Licenses: Salesforce Administrator Salesforce Advanced Administrator - provided by DiceSalesforce, Business Analyst, Salesforce Administration, Salesforce Business Analyst, Salesfoce Business Analysis

From engineering to application development, knowledge management and business process management, we help our clients find the right problems to solve, and to solve these effectively. Our team of 200,000 innovators, across the globe, is differentiated by the imagination, knowledge and experience, across industries and technologies, that we bring to every project we undertake.Wanted: Global Innovators To Help Us Build Tomorrow’s EnterpriseAs a Consultant, you will be a key player in the consulting team that helps discover and define the problem statement, evaluates the solution options and makes recommendations. Name: Data Analyst - Science & Technology
Description: Alexandria Real Estate Equities, Inc. (NYSE:ARE) is an urban office REIT uniquely focused on world-class collaborative science and technology campuses in AAA innovation cluster locations. Alexandria pioneered this niche in 1994 and has since established a dominant market presence in key locations, including Greater Boston, San Francisco, New York City, San Diego, Seattle, Maryland, and Research Triangle Park. Alexandria is known for its high-quality and diverse tenant base. Alexandria has a longstanding and proven track record of developing Class A assets clustered in urban science and technology campuses that provide its innovative tenants with highly dynamic and collaborative environments that enhance their ability to successfully recruit and retain world-class talent and inspire productivity, efficiency, creativity, and success. For additional information on Alexandria, please visit www.are.com.  We are seeking a Data Analyst for our San Francisco office. The position will support Alexandria's Science & Technology team by analyzing Alexandria's large amount of proprietary data on the life science industry and publically available data including, but not limited to, VC Funding, government data (i.e. NIH, FDA, CMS) and capital markets. Alexandria's Science & Technology Team supports Alexandria Real Estate Equities through four main areas capital markets/industry trends, real estate, venture capital investments and thought leadership.  The Company is an equal opportunity employer. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, sex (including sexual or gender identity), religion, national origin, ancestry, sexual orientation, age, marital or veteran status, genetic information, physical or mental disability, or medical condition. Essential Duties and Responsibilities:Improve large scale data analysis, and direct team towards best technology tools to maximize team efforts and data tracking and analysisUse statistical methods/models to analyze data and generate useful business reports for the Science & Technology TeamProvide support for strategic in-depth research studies that require data compilation, analysis, and interpretationWork collaboratively with other members of the Science & Technology Team to identify trends in Alexandria Venture Investments (AVI) and recommend opportunities to leverage proprietary AVI dataUse data to create models that depict trends in the life science industry, and amongst Alexandria tenantsWork with Science & Technology Team to outline the specific data needs for each business method analysis projectWork with IT Business Intelligence team with defining requirements, documenting, testing business dashboards and analytics and new applicationsIn collaboration with Science & Technology team members, conduct research (primarily quantitative) relevant to various disease and therapeutic areas, US healthcare and regulatory activity, and broader trends in the life science and technology industriesAnalyze short and long-term drivers affecting the life science and technology industriesQualifications and Experience:Bachelor's Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, or Predictive Analytics; Masters Degree a plus3+ years' data mining experience5+ years in a data analyst roleUser experience in one or more Business Intelligence tools3+ years' experience in SAS, R, Python or other statistical modeling language1+ year experience in Informatica Data Quality, IBM InfoSphere or other data cleansing software is a plusHighly developed critical thinking skills and ability to find valuable data where no one else thought to lookAbility to clearly present complex findings verbally, visually and in writingAbility to collaborate effectively with team members across disciplines and in multiple geographic locationsStrong attention to detailSome understanding of life science and technology concepts and the life science industry preferredAbility to work independently and to effectively manage and organize multiple projects concurrentlyCommunicate with co-workers, management, and others in a courteous and professional mannerSDL2017

Name: Senior Manager, Commercial FP&A, NA Consolidation
Description: For Current Gilead Employees and Contractors:Please log onto your Internal Career Site to apply for this job.Job DescriptionSpecific Responsibilities & Skills for this Position The Senior Manager will be responsible for North America (NA) commercial revenue and expense consolidation across Therapeutic Areas (TAs). This includes leading the forecast and long range planning across the NA FP&A team and pulling together a holistic view of revenues, investments and growth drivers across TAs. This position reports to the North American Commercial Finance Senior Director and will manage 1 Senior Analyst.  She/He will also be the business partner and oversee the expense budgets for the VP of Commercial Operations and the VP of Managed Markets. This role will partner with these teams to analyze budget requests and tradeoffs to optimize value to the organization. Success in this role will require the ability to cultivate an effective business partnership between the Commercial functional areas and Finance. Essential Duties & Job Functions Responsibilities include: Coordinate and consolidate the 3 year long rang plan and annual operational forecasts for the NA Commercial teams. Develop executive summary slides which present the forecast across TAs. Analyze resourcing across TAs and develop recommendations on how to realign investment across our portfolio to support top line growth.Lead and consolidate the monthly and quarterly close process, including managing expense accruals, management reporting, and budget vs. actual variance analysis. Report results to Commercial and Finance executives.Proactively recommend process improvements to increase the efficiency and effectiveness of our reporting and analysis. Lead best practice sharing and standardization across TAs. Develop subject matter expertise on financial systems and processes. Develop new reporting capabilities to monitor key performance metrics.Manage the Commercial Operations and Managed Markets budgets. Partner with the business to lead their 3 year and annual planning processes, monthly close processes, and management reporting. Work with the Commercial Operations and Managed Markets teams to provide analytical support for tactical and strategic decisions.Provide ad-hoc analyses and project support for the finance leadership team.Provide managerial leadership and guidance to your direct report.Knowledge, Experience, & Skills The preferred candidate will possess a minimum of 8-10 years experience, having held positions of increasing scope and responsibility, including at least 3-5 years experience as a senior finance leader and business partner. He/She must also have a minimum of 2-3 years of management experience. A BS or BA is required and an MBA or CPA is strongly preferred. Prior experience in bio-tech or pharma is strongly preferred. In-depth proficiency in aspects of accounting and finance and knowledge of US GAAP is required. In depth knowledge of US Healthcare Systems, Business Intelligence, Planning and ERP systems is required with proficiency in Microsoft tools. Experience in high-growth, multi-national organization a plus.  The key competencies for this candidate are:Excellent interpersonal skills: an inquisitive mind, and the ability to work effectively with multiple functions are required.Ability to quickly establish credibility with diverse audiences and be perceived as a leader is required.Business Savvy and Financial Acumen: The candidate will possess technical knowledge on analytics, business foresight, and problem-solving skills.Results Orientation: The ideal candidate will be results-driven and must thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. He/She must have the ability to deliver results and possess a strong drive to meet and exceed goals and is willing to take ownership of problems and make sound decisions.Team Leadership: Demonstrates ability to align and motivate a team to achieve objectives including financial results, timely and accurate reporting, transparency, and controls.Change Leadership: The candidate will be an independent self-starter and a proactive leader with a drive to strive for continuous improvement and consistently challenging the status quo. Will be viewed by business partners and Finance colleagues as a thought leader with strong, influencing capabilities, who can also maintain open and transparent communication channels. For jobs in the United States:As an equal opportunity employer, Gilead Sciences Inc. is committed to a diverse workforce. Employment decisions regarding recruitment and selection will be made without discrimination based on race, color, religion, national origin, gender, age, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, genetic information or characteristic, gender identity and expression, veteran status, or other non-job related characteristics or other prohibited grounds specified in applicable federal, state and local laws. Name: IT Director, R&D/PDM Business Solutions Architect
Description: For Current Gilead Employees and Contractors:Please log onto your Internal Career Site to apply for this job.Job DescriptionSpecific Responsibilities and SkillsThe R&D / PDM Business Solutions Architect is accountable for developing business-enabling technology solutions, including analytics, that support Research, Development and Manufacturing-specific capabilities and needs (from Research to Corporate Quality to Process Development to Biologics Manufacturing). This role applies a structured business solution architecture approach and methodology for capturing the key views of the business unit, in collaboration with our business engagement leaders, within the context of the enterprise. Maintains expertise in the direction of the business functions in partnership with business engagement, to identify challenges and associated plans to advance business capabilities. Effective partnership and teamwork with business partners, their IT teams and all other Gilead IT service teams is a key success factor. This role reports directly to the Senior Director of R&D/PDM IT.Essential Duties and Job FunctionsThis role will be accountable for, but not limited to, the following key responsibilities:Business PartnershipIn collaboration with Business Engagement Leads, develop and sustain effective relationships and partnerships with key Research, Development and Manufacturing stakeholders, providing insights and advice on opportunities to leverage technology for business outcomes, and pulling in key stakeholders into solution discussions and plans as appropriate.Business AnalysisDevelop deep and Research, Development and Manufacturing IT solution development.Ensure effective consultation with Research, Development and Manufacturing business partners in exploring and applying innovative outside-in solution ideas to address business opportunities and challenges.Perform matrix leadership and hold accountability for business gap analysis, process mapping and requirement gathering and definition.Portfolio and Delivery PlanningPartner effectively with the Enterprise Project Management Office (ePMO) in prioritizing Research, Development and Manufacturing business-specific demand as part of portfolio planning for projects.Develop and maintain a three-year roadmap strategy for Research, Development and Manufacturing with key business leaders/ stakeholders.Develop, prioritize with business leadership, and deliver IT Advisory Council (ITAC) approved “roadmap” technology investments to enable the desired Research, Development and Manufacturing capabilities.Participate in annual and off-cycle project intake and planning.Work with IT Shared Services (e.g. Oracle EBS, Information Management, Content Management, Workflow Management, Infrastructure, and Quality) to ensure interfaces and integration points are fully planned and coordinated properly.Solution Architecture and DesignEnsure the proper architecture and design of business-enabling solutions that are consistent with the Gilead IT Architecture Review Board (ARB) standards, principles and design guidelines.Partner effectively with other Solution Delivery IT leaders to identify potential shared platform solutions that can be leveraged across other business areas to minimize redundant solutions.Develop business enablement & solution roadmaps.Partner with enterprise architecture to conceptualize solution architectures adhering to Architecture Directions and Standards while addressing business strategies, business capability requirements, business processes. Contributes to enterprise architecture by modeling and mapping business processes, capabilities and enterprise information.Perform process development and mapping from Research to Release.Build and maintain an integrated view of the system landscape to support future business intelligence and analytics (e.g. regulatory filings, inspection readiness, etc.).Solution Development and SupportDrive the evaluation of “ideas” to bring tangible, actionable solutions.Solve for business capability gaps, support development of business cases and weave solution execution plans into technology roadmaps, with appropriate linkages to other/related systems and areas.Ensure that all Business IT Roadmaps are developed in compliance with Gilead’s Enterprise Project Management Office (ePMO) standards & processes and Quality, Security and Compliance (QSC) rules and policies.Provide input to the enterprise architecture to guide the enterprise toward a target state as it relates to supported line of business.Serve as a change agent to drive process and system capability improvements across Research, Development and Manufacturing, partnering with IT Cross-Functional Teams including Infrastructure Services, Quality, ePMO & Architecture, and Information Management.Drive efficiency gains and quality improvementsGeneral Leadership and ManagementSupport the IT Senior Director of R&D/PDM IT in leading and managing an effective multi-disciplinary team of business savvy IT experts, and in contributing innovative thoughts to the Research, Development and Manufacturing IT vision.Ensure effective leadership, teamwork and collaboration with other IT directors, managers and staff across IT to achieve a unified and responsive IT services approach to the Business.Ensure proper inspection readiness and compliance in all aspects of solution delivery.Lead continuous improvements to drive IT effectiveness with the Business and IT.Manage internal personnel, external partners and service providers where applicable.Knowledge, Experience and SkillsMinimum of 12+ years of experience (with a Bachelor degree, or a minimum of 10+ years of experience with an advanced degree) in an IT leadership and Account Management role in the Pharmaceutical/Biotech industry, with a focus in Research, Development and Manufacturing.Minimum of five years of experience working as a Business Solution Architect in the Pharmaceutical industry, soliciting and defining requirements and business capabilities, and conducting process mapping.Minimum of 10 years of experience at the intersection of strategy, architecture and innovation, applying advanced technologies to large and/or complex business problems.Working experience and knowledge of end-to-end IT software and systems solution delivery from idea conception, design, development and/or configuration, and transition into production support and maintenance.Experience with all disciplines of architecture (information, applications, solutions, enterprise).Knowledge and experience working with core IT technologies including the Oracle suite of products focused on Supply Chain and Manufacturing, Sparta Trackwise, Eduneering ComplianceWire, Werum MES, and virtual computing, as well as other technologies supporting clinical supplies manufacturing, asset management and quality-focused activities (e.g. deviations, CAPAs and investigations).Knowledge and understanding of six sigma required.Working experience and knowledge in IT solution delivery using delivery approaches besides in-house development via managed services providers.Working knowledge of various solution delivery methodologies – waterfall, agile, hybrid methods, etc.Working knowledge of applied IT architecture in the effective design of business-enabling solutions.Solid understanding of IT governance, inspection, compliance and regulatory requirements for validated systems.Demonstrated relationship savvy in building effective trusted advisor relationships with business partners and IT alike using effective relationship-building, negotiation, mediation and influencing skills.Ability to lead and manage under conditions of ambiguity skills, problem-solving abilities and attention to detail.Independent, self-motivated, self-managing, proactive and responsive with a bias for action and results.Demonstrates Gilead’s core values of Excellence, Accountability, Teamwork and Integrity.Good verbal and written communication, presentation and facilitation skills.High level of personal integrity consistent with Gilead’s core
