ideally in Finance, Business, or Computer Science4+ years as a Business Analyst, Marketing or FP&A ideally in eCommerceProven experience to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure and fast pace environment is crucialAbility to promote collaboration and teamwork across organizational boundaries.Great communication and interpersonal skills to effectively communicate to all levels and multiple departments.Attention to detail and deadlinesKEY BENEFITS:Merchandise discount for our brands: 50% off regular-priced merchandise at Gap, Banana Republic and Old Navy, 30% off at Outlet and 25% off at Athleta.One of the most competitive Paid Time Off plans in the industry.*Employees can take up to five on the clock hours each month to volunteer at a charity of their choice.*Extensive 401(k) plan with company matching for contributions up to four percent of an employees base pay.*Employee stock purchase plan.*Employees receive medical, dental, vision and life insurance.*Employees can apply for tuition reimbursement.*Family care programs.Commuter benefits.Pet Discount Program. *For eligible employeesGap Inc. is an equal-opportunity employer and is committed to providing a workplace free from harassment and discrimination. We are committed to recruiting, hiring, training and promoting qualified people of all backgrounds, and make all employment decisions without regard to any protected status. In 2016, Gap Inc. was named one of the Best Places to Work by the Human Rights Campaign for the thirteenth consecutive year and was the sole winner of the Catalyst award for equality in the workplace in 2016.

Name: Partner Deal Operations Analyst
Description: This is an opportunity for an ambitious and talented individual to make an impact in a high profile role within Revenue Operations, that partners directly with the Alliances sales organizations. As a part of the global Partner Operations team, the individual would work closely with the Alliances sales teams to formulate and vet the business, pricing, and contractual terms in complex partnership proposals and to ensure effective and appropriate monetization of all partner relationships. The individual will formulate and manage deal execution processes that require constant interface with multiple internal functions including sales, sales strategy, finance, revenue accounting, legal, and sales operations to ensure that internal controls and processes are in place and that all functions are prepared to support rapid deal execution. This job requires equal parts critical thinking, attention to detail, and analytical insight. It also provides a chance to achieve significant responsibility and autonomy, access to senior executives, and prospects for rapid career development within one of the most innovative and fast-growing groups within SalesforceLocation: San Francisco, CAType: Full-timeResponsibilities include but are not limited to:Review and approve reseller partnership proposals for an assigned territory, to include evaluating the business case for partnerships and ensuring that all requests align with Salesforce.com internal requirements.Communicate requests for approval for proposals and drive alignment with other groups and exec leaders across Salesforce.Identify concepts that pose business, legal, or other risk, determine possible courses of action, and make recommendations to the Partner Account Manager (PAM) and other Alliances sales leaders. Ensure PAM completes necessary steps to maintain compliance with all SFDC partner requirements.Ensure that all necessary approvals and supporting documents are recorded per Salesforce policy prior to advancing requests through process.Work cross-functionally with members of sales, technical architects, legal, finance, sales operations, and other SFDC teams to ensure that approvals are met.Provide routine reporting and analysis on team operational metrics.Undertake project-based work as needed in areas such as enablement, standardization, and approval optimization.Required Skills and Attributes:BA/BS required, preferably in finance or related field.3-5 years experience, mainly in pricing, strategy, consulting, or other highly analytical business function.Highly analytical with strong quantitative skillsAdvanced Excel skills; ability to build financial and business models is a must.Strong PowerPoint skills; able to create concise, attractive, executive-level slidesIncisive sense of commercial acumen with a “big picture” outlookExcellent communications skills; summarizes complex concepts in an accessible mannerInquisitive, questioning mindset with close attention to detail; leaves no stone unturned and double-checks everythingTeam player with high level of emotional maturity; able to be diplomatic and work effectively with wide variety of personality typesDedicated to continuous improvement in all functionsAbility to multi-task and perform in a high-paced and fluid environmentAbility to work with a sense of urgency and minimal supervisionAbility to proactively identify problems and generate plan to solve them“Plus” Skills and Attributes:MBA or advanced degree.Familiarity with common technical and business principles for SaaS and PaaS companiesExperience working in a channel/partner function.Experience reviewing, editing, or negotiating complex business contractsPosting StatementSalesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this Web site or directly to managers. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesforce.com or Salesforce.org.Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance and the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring, Salesforce will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Name: Vice President Finance, Ecosystems Technology
Description: OverviewIntuit believes in the power of the individual. The power to do more. To make more. To be more.  We believe in the people who do things – the hat jugglers, the to-do list junkies, the masters of getting it done faster, better and more efficiently than ever before. Whether that's balancing the household budget, running a business or paying taxes.  We believe in these people because we are these people. We thrive on action – and results. And by making things simpler, we all get more out of doing what we love. We're innovators, and have been at it for more than three decades. And we don't stand still.  As the world evolves, so do we – inventing new solutions to solve important problems, perfecting those solutions and delighting our customers. In short: We’re on a mission to power prosperity around the world.  We started small in 1983 with Quicken personal finance software, simplifying a common household dilemma: balancing the family check book. Today, we serve 46+ million customers in North America, Europe, Australia and Brazil, with products available from the desktop to the cloud.  Supporting our mission, our strategy is to apply a laser-like focus to help our customers prosper through One Intuit Ecosystem that: Puts more money in their pockets through data-driven servicesEliminates work through innovative technologyProvides complete confidence that they can do it right – by themselves – with complete confidence Just as we transformed before, from DOS to the web, and to the cloud and mobile, we are evolving again to deliver personalized experiences on a trusted, open platform and help create indispensable connections.  As the way we live and work evolves, we adapt our strategy to meet and lead these changes. No matter where you find us – and whether you use our products on your PC, mobile phone or tablet – we remain committed to creating new and easier ways for consumers and businesses to tackle life's financial chores, giving them more time to live their lives and run their businesses. As our business and product lines grow beyond accounting and into new areas, we will build on our heritage of innovation. That's not just our history. It's our future.  Come join the finance organization at Intuit! We're looking for a seasoned finance executive to join a world class leadership team as the Vice President, Finance for the Ecosystems team, which includes Tech and Data, Customer Success and Product and Design. This position will report directly to Intuit’s Chief Financial Officer.  Intuit is the global leader in financial management software. We have pioneered the shift to cloud computing for consumers, small businesses and those that serve them. We are rethinking how we can impact customer’s financial lives so profoundly they would never go back to the old way. This means dramatically rethinking how we simplify taxes, finding new ways to help consumers save more money, and working with others to leverage the data we have to solve new problems. Our efforts to give back to the community, attract great leadership, and invest in our employees has resulted in us consistently placing in the top Great Places to Work.  Intuit finance is known for highly analytical leaders who work in close partnership with business leaders to drive growth and accelerate profitability through strategic, financial and operational leadership. Our group is a small and nimble team, working in a highly collaborative environment. We are looking for a dynamic, experienced finance leader to drive change, provide operational rigor, evaluate and make investments, and deeply understand all aspects of our business. You will be a key member of the leadership team, working closely with other finance and business leaders inside these teams and horizontally across the company.ResponsibilitiesProvide strategic guidance and thought partnership to the executives and leaders within Tech and Data, Customer Success, and Product and DesignLead the strategic and financial planning process across these organizationsActively shape and evaluate technology strategy and business opportunitiesProvide strategic guidance to the leadership team on all decisions that have significant business and financial impact with the objective of maximizing and enhancing the company’s investmentsProvide visibility and accountability for the financial performance of the businessInterpret business analytics and external data to develop or revise strategies and operating plansEnsure that the operating infrastructure is in place to support the achievement of financial targets and long-range plans aligned with the organization's strategic plansManage team of finance leaders and professionals in a fast-paced environmentAbility to quickly gain trust, engage in constructive debate, and work directly with a broad group of senior executives, including partnering with peer leaders across finance and other functionsLead ongoing change in an evolving organization by articulating a clear case for change and then gaining shared vision with employees through effective, frequent and timely communicationRecruits and mentors a high performing team, including ensuring members have the resources, skills, and capabilities they need to provide exceptional finance support Qualifications15+ years of progressive finance experience driving success in complex, fast growing businesses, ideally in software, services and SaaSProven ability to influence and communicate in a collaborative, inclusive culture while being comfortable with conflict and open debateBroad intellectual curiosityGrace under pressure with a good sense of humor and dose of humilityDegree in Finance, Accounting or Business preferred Imagine a career where your creative inspiration can fuel BIG innovation. Year-over-year, Intuit has been recognized as a best employer and is consistently ranked on Fortune’s “100 Best Companies To Work For” and Fortune World’s “Most Admired Software Companies” lists. Immerse yourself in our award-winning culture while creating breakthrough solutions that simplify the lives of consumers and small businesses and their customers worldwide.  Intuit is expanding its social, mobile, and global footprint with a full suite of products and services that are revolutionizing the industry. Utilizing design for delight and lean startup methodologies, our entrepreneurial employees have brought more than 250 innovations to market – from QuickBooks®, and TurboTax®, to GoPayment, Mint.com, big data, cloud (SaaS, PaaS) and mobile apps. The breadth and depth of these customer-driven innovations mean limitless opportunities for you to turn your ingenious ideas into reality at Intuit.  Discover what it’s like to be part of a team that rewards taking risks and trying new things. It’s time to love what you do! Check out all of our career opportunities at: careers.intuit.com. EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability

Name: Senior Business Analyst
Description: The Senior Business Analyst is a self-starter, has strong attention to detail and is able to interpret data for internal stakeholders to help inform business decisions. The ideal candidate will measure web audience trends, the performance of digital products to illustrate clients return on investment, performance and revenue drivers for publisher partners, and provide insights into best practices and performance enhancements.  He/she utilizes various measurement tools and provides timely in-depth reporting, analysis and optimizing solutions. The Sr. Business Analyst is expected to be an active participant on the business, consistently engaged, and contributing ideas and insights that will benefit our internal teams, clients and publisher partners. Under general supervision, this position exists to assist the organization in making strategic data-related decisions by analyzing, manipulating, tracking, internally managing, and reporting data. ResponsibilitiesBuild, test and implement reports with accurate, easy to read, useful information that satisfies internal and external client needsProvide and present reports and dashboards that include trending, analysis, and recommendations for publishers, product, and performance optimizationUtilize proprietary and third party tools (business intelligence platform, web analytics platforms and ad-serving technologies) to report and analyze product, pricing and revenue dataEnsure that quality and timeliness of measurement deliverables meet company and client expectationsParticipate in interdepartmental conversations to develop, test, and enforce reporting standards, prioritize projects, and discuss data objectives across a number of business functionsAct as a data steward and ensure data integrity by monitoring exception reporting and providing requirements for any system clean-upsMust be able to manage multiple projects and work with key stakeholders across different departmentsOther duties as needed.RequirementsBachelor degree or higher in a quantitative, applied mathematics, business, marketing or consumer research discipline (Statistics, Data Mining, Economics, Marketing, Marketing Research, etc.)3 to 5 years of experience working with data and research in a professional settingStrong attention to detail and analytical skills with the ability to relate results to client business objectivesExperience with SQL, Python, macros and statistical procedures in SASExperience building dashboards in Tableau and other data visualization programs/toolsAdvanced computer skills required (MS Excel, MS PowerPoint)Experience or understanding of Google s tech stack (especially ad-serving technologies and supporting analytics tools)Strong knowledge of web analytics and reporting toolsExcellent written and verbal communication, report writing, and presentation skillsStrong ability to communicate key insights to upper-level managementKnowledge of digital display marketing and automotive industry a plus.

Name: Workday Business Analyst
Description: Workday Business Analyst  We are looking for an experienced Workday Business Analyst who is knowledgeable and enthusiastic about designing and executing the strategy for a rebuild of our Workday compensation setup. This resource will be responsible for understanding business requirements, conducting functional design, and performing system build.  The ideal candidate is someone who is knowledgeable about Workday configuration and can quickly act upon provided instructions for system configuration. This individual should have an extensive background in building scalable and innovative solutions for human resources. This role will join an IT Applications group dedicated to supporting the Employee Success (HR) organization. Our ideal candidate enjoys working in dynamic and high-growth environments and is experienced in managing complex projects in support of an overall HR philosophy and strategy. We are looking for candidates with deep expertise with business analysis and Workday HCM and Compensation. Responsibilities: Work effectively with Employee Success (HR) and IT to identify, document and prioritize requirements for Workday systems  Write functional specifications for new functionality, configure system changes within Workday  Partner with ES and IT tams to evaluate how best to use Workday technology to meet evolving business requirements and information needs  Ensure solutions promote simplification, accuracy and an increasingly higher level of productivity for users.  Identify test scenarios, develop test scripts, and execute testing in support of system and user acceptance testing  Ensure that new configuration meets end-users needs  Play an advisory role to the team and the customer when designing and configuring new features within Workday  Become an expert in the business process of the customer and play the role of advocate for customer needs  Support the implementation of change management activities by organizing UAT, authoring release communications, updating Chatter, creating training materials, and delivering training to IT Support teams  Partner with the IT and ES support organizations to provide training, support and technical assistance to end users  Participate in Agile scrum team, responsible as business analyst and central subject matter expert Required Skills 2+ Experience with Workday HCM, Compensation  Familiarity and understanding of Workday iloads  Experience guiding internal customers through entire project lifecycle  Negotiate detailed requirement and solution design trade-offs  Contribute to cross-functional and cross-technical dependency management  Anticipate and communicate blockers, conflicts, and obstacles  Expert knowledge in business process analysis, requirements and design, data modeling, detailed functional design, test planning, and UAT execution  Implementation and support experience with global HR systems from gathering and documenting complex business requirements through testing and production rollout  Change management skills including communication, testing, training and business system and process transformation  Must be a self-starter, highly motivated, able to shift directions quickly when priorities change, think through problems to come up with innovative solutions and deliver against very tight deadlines  Willing to receive direction and guidance within a team environment, adopt and develop best practices and circumnavigate obstacles with creative technical solutions Desired Skills/Experience: Implementation and support experience of Workday Compensation  Experience with the Salesforce.com platform and related cloud or web based technologies  Familiarity with Anaplan

Name: Assistant Controller
Description: Company: LiveVox, Inc.Location: San Francisco, CA  Available Position: Assistant Controller About LiveVox, Inc. LiveVox is a leading provider of enterprise-grade cloud contact center solutions, managing over 9 billion interactions  annually by means of effective channel of choice strategies. Through a patented PCI-certified cloud platform and  redundant IP/MPLS mesh, LiveVox delivers true multi-tenant highly scalable and burstable contact center solutions  such as ACD, predictive dialer, integrated voice response (IVR), centralized call recording, business analytics and  compliance suite. LiveVox enables fast deployment of contact center solutions from the cloud, while offering  customers full control to realize cost efficiencies in the management of their day-to-day business requirements. With  over 450 employees and growing, LiveVox is headquartered in San Francisco with additional offices in the United  States, India, and Colombia.Position OverviewWe are seeking an Assistant Controller to join our team in San Francisco. This is a great opportunity to have an impact  at successful high growth cloud software company, where your ideas and contributions will be valued. This is a key  position within LiveVox’s Accounting Department that will interact with all a levels and individuals throughout the  organization.Impact:  Manage day-to-day accounting operations through month-end close, including Accounts Receivable,  Accounts Payable, Payroll, account reconciliation and other typical accounting areas.   Establish the functional vision, collaboratively set goals and priorities supporting effective delivery  of high quality accounting deliverables.   Select, develop, and coach accounting personnel to build a world class, highly engaged team.   Review and approve work of other accounting team members.   Ensure transactions are accurately and timely reflected in the financial statements.   Review international accounting entries and prepare monthly eliminating journal entries.   Coordinate and prepare for monthly close meeting.   Prepare explanations for fluctuations in trended numbers.   Assist with monthly financial reporting, including required bank reporting.   Implement new technical accounting standards.   Assist with annual external audit management and provide solutions to audit request and answers to auditor  inquiries.   Assist with various tax preparation and filings   Work with company leadership and stakeholders inside and outside the Accounting department to  implement scalable processes.   Identify areas for improvement related to accounting, policies, processes and systems and proactively  implement improvements   Participate in strategic initiatives and assist with other ad hoc projectsQualifications Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or Finance required   CPA required   Demonstrated successful experience managing and growing an accounting team  DocuSign Envelope ID: 85661A21-08ED-4D9E-A8D8-C5068BAD4CFE   Strong technical accounting background   Combination of public and private accounting experience   Experience with NetSuite or similar enterprise software is required. Zuora, Avalara AvaTax, Concur  experience desired   Experience managing accounting teamsThe successful candidate will possess: a solid understanding of US GAAP and full cycle accounting   a strong work ethic, with a do what it takes to get the job done mindset   a strong analytical and problem-solving skillset   a positive customer services attitude   meticulous attention to detail and accuracy   highly-developed organizational and follow-through skills, and the ability to manage competing priorities   the ability to work both individually, as a team member and team leader   excellent written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to interact effectively with all levels  throughout the companyLiveVox is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know. We're always looking to bring smart, talented people with diverse backgrounds, interests and experiences to join our team.

Name: Group Manager, Digital Marketing Data Science and Analytics
Description: OverviewCome join Intuit as a Group Manager in the Small Business Group (QuickBooks) Data Analytics & Science team. We are looking for creative problem solvers with a passion to deliver data-driven insights. This position leads a team of talented analysts and scientists to work alongside with business stakeholders to deliver customer insights and recommendations.ResponsibilitiesLeads and nurtures a team of talented analysts and scientists with a focus on customer acquisition, retention and end-to-end customer experiences.Partners with business leaders (e.g. marketing, product and customer success) to define business strategies, areas of investment, and critical priorities.Translates business and analytics strategies into multiple short-term and long-term projects, and manages end-to-end execution.Activates analytics insights that lead to decisions or better hypotheses, and evangelizes innovative analytics ideas that enable new opportunities.Drives analytics rigor by inspecting and experimenting methodologies, improving techniques, and creating a learning culture.Drives data roadmap from data quality to data visualization, and marshals resources from multiple functions to deliver scalable solutions.Roles-model “win-together” while challenging status quo and driving changes across teams regardless of organizational structure.Examples of deliverables:Data insights to inform the future: development of KPIs, business performance diagnostics, customer behavioral analyses, self-service analytics, and etc. to drive actionable customer insights.Data products to transform customer experiences: personalized features, data predictions, propensity modeling, and etc. to make customer experiences more intelligent with data.Data capabilities to improve productivity: data roadmap with data engineering partners, continuous process improvement, tool and platform adoption, and etc. to raise data standards. Qualifications10+ years of diverse analytics experience on end-to-end customer-level dataProven experience in leading a team of analysts and/or scientistsStrong passion in uncovering strategic opportunities and solving business problemsProficient with SQLExperience in statistical modeling techniquesExperience in data gap assessments, requirements and infrastructure implementationOutstanding communications skills with both technical and non-technical colleaguesUndergraduate degree a must. Masters in a quantitative discipline preferred

Name: Senior Director of Strategy, Visa Business Solutions
Description: Common Purpose, Uncommon Opportunity. Everyone at Visa works with one goal in mind – making sure that Visa is the best way to pay and be paid, for everyone everywhere. This is our global vision and the common purpose that unites the entire Visa team. As a global payments technology company, tech is at the heart of what we do: Our VisaNet network processes over 13,000 transactions per second for people and businesses around the world, enabling them to use digital currency instead of cash and checks. We are also global advocates for financial inclusion, working with partners around the world to help those who lack access to financial services join the global economy. Visa’s sponsorships, including the Olympics and FIFA™ World Cup, celebrate teamwork, diversity, and excellence throughout the world. If you have a passion to make a difference in the lives of people around the world, Visa offers an uncommon opportunity to build a strong, thriving career. Visa is fueled by our team of talented employees who continuously raise the bar on delivering the convenience and security of digital currency to people all over the world. Join our team and find out how Visa is everywhere you want to be.  Visa’s Business Solutions (VBS) drives a robust range of payments solutions for commercial clients in the Small Business, Middle Market, Large Corporate, and Government segments. As technology rapidly develops to increase efficiency in electronic payments, Visa is at the forefront serving the growing demand for innovative payment solutions across the Travel & Entertainment and B2B space. The leader will direct Visa Business Solutions to new and emerging Payment technologies for our commercial clients.  The Senior Director of Strategy for VBS will be entrusted with a broad portfolio of responsibilities helping Visa accelerate the growth of its products and services that facilitate payments from one business to another. He/she will be a core member of the VBS team, working closely with VBS colleagues in the U.S. and worldwide. Additionally, he/she will collaborate closely with colleagues across Visa, including Finance, Sales, Client Support, and Technology. The position reports to the Senior Vice President of Strategy for VBS and is based in the San Francisco Bay Area.  This executive will build and execute strategies to grow Visa’s small business card and commercial card products, the corresponding technology platforms that enable these products, and non-card solutions like B2B Connect. VBS is a strategic growth area for Visa, with a mission to deliver payment services that move businesses forward and help them thrive, locally and globally.     Job DescriptionDesign, lead, and execute strategic initiatives to drive growth in VBS on a global basis, engaging directly with clients and partners of Visa, often at executive levels. This includes strategic growth areas within both existing VBS products/services as well as additional opportunities yet to be brought to market. Develop and manage a strategic global framework for pricing VBS products and services that balances pricing for value, developing and growing the market, and Visa’s financial objectives.Ensure Visa’s Rules optimally serve the B2B payments ecosystem, balancing multiple competing priorities and time horizons.Develop, communicate, and refine VBS’s overall strategy, including engaging Visa’s executive leadership team and regional leadership teams. Outstanding academic credentials, including a degree from a top tier institution. MBA or post-graduate degree strongly preferred.Experience in or in-depth knowledge of payments is strongly preferred, ideally with a deep understanding of cards and payments and in particular commercial and small business payments.A proven record of accomplishment delivering high impact results working on projects in the areas of corporate strategy, growth initiatives and new market/segment/business strategies.Superior analytic skills, including the ability to derive the business implications from numbers and analysis.Strong leadership skills, in particular a demonstrated record of leading multi-disciplinary teams towards a common objective with tangible results.Excellent communication skills, including ability to constructively engage and influence executive leadership, and to structure clear and concise written communications.Global or multi-national business experience is preferred.15+ years of business experience with experience in payments, banking, or consulting.  All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Name: Sr. Analyst, Scaled Enforcement Operations - Entertainment and Media Industry Opportunity
Description: Who We AreThe Twitter Service organization provides meaningful and effective support and services to the Twitter community. We are on our way to becoming recognized as the best embodiment of a service driven culture, placing customer needs at the center of operations as we actively listen and help. Our mission is to provide customer service so remarkable, it removes any barriers towards participating in the public conversation. Within the Twitter Service organization, our Scaled Enforcement Operations team focuses on combating scaled attack patterns, automation development, and protecting the Twitter brand and user experience by preventing terms of service violations across the Twitter platform. To continually strengthen our core services, Scaled Enforcement Operations is now hiring for a deadline-focused multitasker with experience driving large scale and high quality decisions and operations.  What Youll Do  In this role, you will drive daily scaled enforcement tasks and initiatives in order to eliminate spam and abuse, enforce API Terms of Service, and detect and remediate scaled attack patterns which detract from overall Platform Health. You will utilize MySQL and a robust set of internal tools to assist in the larger team providing 24/7 coverage for defending the Twitter platform. You will also: Use in-house tools to thwart high volumes of spam, automation, and abuse.  Rapid heuristic rule testing, development, and launch.  Prioritize daily tasks against ongoing projects, SLA targets/backlogs, and incidents.  Analyze and make decisions on data sets, in order to accurately train and refine automation.  Join global on-call rotation; accurately assess the severity of spam and API related incidents and respond quickly and effectively.  Be the spam, abuse and API enforcement subject matter expert within the Twitter Service organization, and be the first point of contact for related inquiries.  Empower Twitters developer community by delivering consistent, reliable, and high-quality support.  Participate in bug triage, troubleshooting, and tool testing. Report and resolve inefficiencies in tools, policy, workflows etc; propose and support new methods of eliminating bad actors and drive ongoing improvement in team operations.  Perform end-to-end investigations into top priority attack patterns; develop, launch, and administer operational tools and processes to streamline enforcement protocols.  Engage with Twitters internal and external partners to ensure coverage and strong business partnerships. Excel in collaboration, both inside and outside the team. Open, thorough, timely communication is critical.  Effectively communicate with cross-functional partners in product and engineering, prioritize business needs, deliver global training, lead product specific quality assurance, and deliver excellent results.  Exposure to sensitive or graphic content including but not limited to vulgar language, violent threats, pornography and other graphic content.  Please note that this role may require weekend hours.  Who You Are  If this role sounds like a great match, you probably have:  Passion for being a Twitter user, catching spam and abuse, and ensuring platform health.  Strong interest in online spam and platform abuse strategies; knowledge of anti-spam and anti-abuse best practices.  Experience with content analysis, pattern recognition, and applied statistics.  Outstanding interpersonal skills and are an analytical thinker, great at navigating complex issues, experienced in analyzing large data-sets, a fantastic team-player, and you thrive in dynamic fast-paced environments.  Amazing attention to even the smallest details, ability to seek (and retain!) knowledge, share and effectively apply your learnings.  Advanced technical operations skills; the ability to quickly adapt to new tools and processes.  Excellent written and verbal communication skills and proven success in teaching complex topics in an interactive and engaging environment.  6 months experience excelling in project work, business analytics, content evaluation, or quality assurance is preferred.  Background working with excel, text editing software, regular-expression, SQL, CSS, HTML, Python, and Scalding are preferred. Requirements BA/BS in related area of focus, CS degree desired.  2+ years experience querying relational databases using SQL.  2+ years experience in online operations, security, technical support, policy enforcement or related domain.  We are committed to an inclusive and diverse Twitter. Twitter is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, marital status or any legally protected status.

Name: Director of Strategy and Operations for Digital Partnerships
Description: Common Purpose, Uncommon Opportunity. Everyone at Visa works with one goal in mind – making sure that Visa is the best way to pay and be paid, for everyone everywhere. This is our global vision and the common purpose that unites the entire Visa team. As a global payments technology company, tech is at the heart of what we do: Our VisaNet network processes over 13,000 transactions per second for people and businesses around the world, enabling them to use digital currency instead of cash and checks. We are also global advocates for financial inclusion, working with partners around the world to help those who lack access to financial services join the global economy. Visa’s sponsorships, including the Olympics and FIFA™ World Cup, celebrate teamwork, diversity, and excellence throughout the world. If you have a passion to make a difference in the lives of people around the world, Visa offers an uncommon opportunity to build a strong, thriving career. Visa is fueled by our team of talented employees who continuously raise the bar on delivering the convenience and security of digital currency to people all over the world. Join our team and find out how Visa is everywhere you want to be.  The Director of Strategy and Operations for Digital Partnerships will define and implement projects to focus and align the Digital Partnerships team broadly across Visa. The Director position will drive: Revenue focus and discipline through deliberate coverage and program based client targets, monitoring through pipeline orientation (top deals, by product, quantified in revenue terms).Management visibility into revenue based coverage ratios to ensure resources stacked to right opportunities & accounts.Regular reviews to ensure we are covering the right clients (not missing an influential emerging client type). Client segmentation which results in differentiated access to resources, programs, client benefits.Forums for recognition to celebrate top deals, teams and tap top performers as educators.Clear scorecard metrics/performance indicators, goals and insights which help drive alignment and focus to the organization broadly.Initiatives which drive progress againstfeedback programmatically collected from the field (client survey participation, Sales team feedback, other feedback to product).Processes for sharing best practices to drive NPS, deal performance, strategic engagement, other.Proactive design of next set of business development programs including, gathering feedback from regional/global leaders on programs needed complemented with client and competitive/external trend diagnostics to establish a point of view and prioritize opportunities. Responsibilities include creating strategic insights - grounded in data and facts, thought leadership and structure to strategic projects. Building out unique, creative and impactful solutions by integrating insights across Visa’s many expert functional resources and leading collaborative solution development. Developing rigorous, fact based, quantitative analysis to support recommendations. Building out tools and track the evolving needs of digital partners and team performance. Identifying clear and realistic long-term key success factors and strategic priorities. Performing complex data analysis and design to drive unique insights for internal and external purposes.    This is a global role that includes frequent interaction with key internal and select external stakeholders. Internally this role will work directly with teams including: Finance, Marketing, Human Resources, Digital Partnerships leaders, Global Business operations, Analytics, and other product teams. Typically, 10 years of relevant experience including 3+ years’ experience in management consulting, payments industry, retail strategy, digital platforms, financial services and/or previous strategy functional experience in a global organization. Bachelor’s Degree. MBA from top-tier institution or equivalent graduate degree.Experience with Salesforce and sales planning to maximize team adoption of CRM, structure coverage and segmentation and build out pipeline reporting, as well as other key performance indicators.Ability to prioritize deliverables and projects to meet timelines efficiently, to adapt to changes in priorities quickly, and to structure and manage multiple initiatives simultaneously with focus on a drive to completion and tangible impact.Superior analytical and problem solving skills, with demonstrated intellectual and analytical rigor; attention to detail and ability to structure and analyze sophisticated modeling and data analysis.Team oriented, collaborative, diplomatic and flexible with ability to influence in a highly matrixed organization. Name: Head of Sales Processes, Systems, and Data Quality, Uber Eats - San Francisco or NYC
Description: At Uber, we ignite opportunity by setting the world in motion. We take on big problems to help drivers, riders, delivery partners, and eaters get moving in more than 600 cities around the world.  We welcome people from all backgrounds who seek the opportunity to help build a future where everyone and everything can move independently. If you have the curiosity, passion, and collaborative spirit, work with us, and let’s move the world forward, together. About the Role Uber is a technology company that is changing the way the world thinks about transportation. We are building technology people use every day. Whether it's heading home from work, getting a meal delivered from a favorite restaurant, or a way to earn extra income, Uber is becoming part of the fabric of daily life.  You’ll be driving the right insights to help our stakeholders focus their energy and attention on the most important strategic priorities. Identifying the key opportunities to power improved business performance and helping to determine the areas where each group can contribute to our broader goals. What You’ll DoLead, inspire, and develop a team of program and project managers who oversee the adoption of effective Sales and Account Management practices by cataloging and identifying process optimization opportunities, improving data quality, and developing systems to increase Restaurant success and channel productivityBring Restaurant, Client-facing rep, and line manager feedback into the organization to identify opportunities and recommend solutions to increase productivity of Restaurant recruitment and development programsManage a data-driven, transparent, and inclusive process to develop, garner buy-in, and resource a prioritized project roadmap to develop new and revamp existing Sales/Account Management processes and systemsEstablish reporting and business review rhythms to drive visibility of the health/productivity of existing processes, identification of processes to suitable for broader adoption, and progress of the project roadmapCollaborate and closely partner with Sales, Marketing, Sales Enablement, Business Systems, Product, Analytics & Data Science, Data Engineering, Legal/Compliance to ensure successful initiativesWhat You’ll Need8+ years of experience in B2B organizations working managing and developing a team and working cross-functionally with Sales, Marketing, Sales Enablement, Business Systems, and Data Engineering in both mature and high growth start-up environments5+ years of experience in managing internal process and systems teams with a high degree of proficiency in process design and optimization, program and project management, and successfully rolling out projects in global organizationsSelf starter with an analytical orientation; empathetic and leans in and embraces rolling up your sleeves with your team; skilled at balancing between short-term needs and long-term investments; thrives on change and comfortable with ambiguity; collaborative, detail oriented, process-driven, and decisive workstyleExcellent written and verbal communication skills to technical and non-technical audiences. Stakeholder management and consensus building (across internal Business, Product, and Engineering partners)High proficiency in structured and unstructured data environments, evaluating build vs buy technology solutions, customizing Sales and Account Management third-party tools (e.g., CRM, Reporting, Commission Plans), and product development lifecycle and processesStrong personal code of ethics, integrity, diversity and trust. Strong references from former employers and business partners; passion for building relationships

Name: Sales & Partnerships Associate
Description: Covo is one of todays leading coworking groups, taking customer service and hospitality to the extreme, wrapping coworking around a coffee shop, bar, and events space. Our members and partners love us, the market were going after is huge, and were just getting started.  We are looking for an Associate to join our Business Development & Strategic Partnerships team to help grow our largest partnerships, and launch new partnerships. In this role, you will be responsible for leading day-to-day operations with Covos strategic partners, while developing and executing on new partner growth initiatives. You will serve as a partner advocate, often functioning as a liaison between our partners and internal team.  We are looking for a strategic thinker who executes; this person thrives in a fast-paced, always-on, results-oriented culture. You love problem solving, collaborating across functional domains, and driving projects from beginning to end. You love pounding the pavement and making inroads. Youre an excellent communicator and enjoy working with others to deliver results. This is a hands-on, high execution role which requires excellent business, people, and analytical skills.  WHAT YOU'LL DO: Outreach to the phenomenal companies who are brand-aligned with us. This includes international corporations like Thrive Global and Virgin Group, local corporations like IndieGogo, Yahoo, accelerators and incubators including Y-Combinator and 500 Startups, non-profits like Full Circle Fund and associations like the GGBA Chamber of Commerce. We have connections to many of these groups, but you will make inroads into many more.Securing partnership deals, sponsorships, group memberships.Manage key partner relationships, actively engaging to meet sales & marketing goals while also handling the operational day-to-dayWork alongside partnerships team to build out strategy for executing on shared volume goals with our largest partners. Bring your ideas to the table.Establish processes and reporting to help streamline the teams operationsPartner with marketing team to develop and launch new marketing campaigns with partnersDevelop a deep understanding of Covos mission, goals, day-to-day operations, and competitive contextCollaborate with partners to ensure that the experiences we build together are the best possible for users, support our partners' goals, and align with Covos missionDevelop strong relationships at all levels, identifying key decision makers and influencers WHAT WE LOOK FOR: Motivated, self-starter, who can work with little supervisionSome level of experience in partnerships, business development, sales support, account management, or management consulting. This can be your first job out of college, but you have relevant experience from earlier work experience.Strong organizational, analytical, written, and verbal communication skillsOutstanding interpersonal skills and ability to build effective working relationships with any team internally or externallyAbility to think creatively, critically and thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic, work environmentAppetite to actively learn and immediately apply learnings to make decisions and change behaviorsBA/BS required SALARY, BENEFITS & PERKS: $30,000+ (BOE) base salary plus tiered commission for sales/partnershipsReceive over $2,400 annually for a wellness benefit premium contribution to KaiserDaily adult beverage from the Tap LoungeGenerous PTO and holidaysExcellent health coverage benefitsGenerous, paid parental leave which covers up to 15 weeksDog-friendly officeMembership at Covo

Name: Head of People Operations
Description: PlushCare is looking for a Head of People to further cultivate and deepen our PlushCare values and to recruit new members. The ideal executive will be a dynamic hands-on leader with deep business acumen, analytical abilities, strategic insight, sound judgment, and in-depth executive experience in human resources and business. The Head of People will spearhead all initiatives related to key human resources and talent.  We're looking for a positive and thoughtful self-starter that can take initiative and adapt to evolving circumstances. The role will report directly to the CEO and lead our people operations and recruiting. The Job:Build out our people strategy including: performance management, talent acquisition, employee engagement, compensation, benefits, retention, employee and manager training, employee handbook, and culture initiatives.Establish and implement HR systems and processes to support a workforce that will scale to over 50 employees in the next 12-18 months. that the CEO and management team have the "pulse of the company" in order to make proactive and effective organization decisions.Evaluate, streamline and improve current recruiting processes.Partner with the management team to determine long-term growth strategy for the company.Recruit for strategic technical and senior roles as needed.Qualifications:8+ years experience in a People Operations / HR role, with recent experience expanding and managing People Operations at a high-growth start-up.Bachelor's degree, Master's degree or related certifications a plus.Experience supporting both salary and hourly workforces, creating relevant and meaningful employee programs, reviews and feedback loops.Excellent project management skills with a proven ability to design and implement people strategy Name: Tableau Reporting Specialist
Description: Job DescriptionTableau Reporting Specialist As part of the Information Services team, the Wealth Management (WM) Technology Team drives the vision to create an industry leading, client-centric wealth technology experience. The team is looking for forward thinking, action oriented individuals to help drive the implementation of innovative, cutting-edge solutions. Summary: This position reports to the WM Reporting Team Lead and supports the development and implementation of Tableau dashboards and datasets for the WM department.  The Tableau Report Developer works with subject matter experts from the project and business teams to determine: Data requirements for the PWM Reporting platform; develop functional specifications; provide detailed data flow documents. They will also participate in the full development process life-cycle from concept, through testing and implementation. This includes identifying necessary data, reconciling with the new application and the legacy data sources and ensuring a successful implementation of PWM Reporting capability. Specific tasks include: communicating business term definitions; establishing data quality rules; writing and executing data quality checks; researching and analyzing data in support of business functions; process and workflow knowledge; and user acceptance testing. RESPONSIBILITIES• Design and develop Tableau reports and dashboards that will yield actionable insights that present the answers to business questions• Develop, implement, and optimize analytical processes and associated KPI’s to improve how we measure and report on the performance of the organization• Run ad-hoc analysis for Product and Business Managers using standard query languages and operationalize for repeatable use via Tableau reporting suite• Code and modify SQL/ETL based on dashboard requirements• Maintain validation of reporting business rules, documentation and distributions to proper stakeholders• Train and educate co-workers on data visualization tools and best practices• Participate in design and delivery of curriculum related to rollout of new reports and dashboards to drive adoption and to enhance business decision-making capabilityQUALIFICATIONSExperience & Education:• BA or BS in Management Information Systems, Mathematics, Computer Science, or Engineering required• 5+ years of experience using business intelligence reporting tools. Mastery of Tableau for the creation and automation of Enterprise Scale dashboards• 5+ years of experience writing advanced SQL, performance tuning of BI queries, data modeling, and data mining from multiple sources (SQL, ETL, data warehousing).• Knowledge of Private Wealth Management/Investment Management – with ability to interpret definitions and calculations from business language to developer logic• Experience with portfolio management and related reporting• Expertise with Data Visualization best practices• Possess a strong foundation in data analytics, an understanding and foundation in data science• Have exposure to statistical modeling experience (R, SAS, SPSS). (Preferred) Technical Skills:• Strong visualization design and development experience with Tableau (and other Business Intelligence tools)• Expert in writing SQL• Excellent attention to detail and experience debugging code Professional Skills/Competency:• Proven track record of delivery for business critical BI/Analytics projects• Ability to operate with cross-functional teams• Strong quantitative and analytical skills - ability to quickly analyze data to identify key insights and apply them to the business• Clear, high-level understanding of complex data models and software integration/delivery• Excellent communication skills, including ability to present effectively to both business and technical audiences at all levels of the organization• Strong orientation to clients, including demonstrated ability to understand needs and apply this knowledge to drive data enhancements Personal Skills/Competency• Consistently demonstrates and follows high standards of integrity in business decision-making• Demonstrates excellent communication and interpersonal skills; able to communicate clearly and concisely in a variety of settings and styles; is effective in a variety of formal presentation and meeting settings• Gains support for change by providing context and responding with sensitivity to concerns; takes initiative to recommend/ develop innovative approaches to getting things done• Can quickly find common ground and solve problems for the good of all; is a team player and encourages collaboration• BI Tools – Required (Tableau required)• SQL – Required• Excel - Required• Wealth Management/Investment Management data experience - Required• TFS/JIRA or other issue tracking application preferred Mental/Physical Requirement• The ability to learn and comprehend basic instructions; understand the meanings of words and respond effectively; and perform basic arithmetic accurately and quickly.• Vision must be sufficient to read data reports, manuals and computer screens.• Hearing must be sufficient to understand a conversation at a normal volume, including telephone calls and in person.• Speech must be coherent to clearly convey or exchange information, including the giving and receiving of assignments and/or directions.• Position involves sitting most of the time, but may involve walking or standing for brief periods of time.• Must be able to travel in a limited capacity. Company DescriptionThe Norman Group is recruiting these full time positions for one of our clients, a software technology provider to banks.  The Norman Group is a management consulting firm providing project staffing and management consulting to banks and the financial services industry. The Norman Group was established in 1997 in Charlotte, NC. We offer management, project, and IT consulting, across specific domains; including treasury, payments, foreign exchange, factoring, risk & compliance and trade finance.  Normans clients have access to an entire project team including analysts, developers, QA specialists, and project/ program managers. The Norman Group employs a talented group of consultants and though their backgrounds are diverse, they share common characteristics in their analytical abilities, ethics, and commitment to teamwork.

Name: Middleware Development Business Analyst (Financial background only)
Description: Job DescriptionMiddleware Development team is looking for a Business Analyst. In this role, you will work with both IT teams and other internal organizations to gather requirements associated with the enterprise application for desktop and mobile. The Senior IT Systems Analyst reviews and communicates business objectives and translates into technology specific requirements. The position will also collaborate closely with business and technical resources in support of various testing activities and phases. This covers creating requirements for components of the system created by internal IT groups, as well as vendor platforms. This position will be responsible for leveraging advanced analytical, research and problem solving skills to define innovative technology solutions in cooperation with developers to meet business objectives.  The BSA will collaborate among the business, various vendors and other middleware team members in designing APIs that will be constructed by our onshore/offshore development team. This individual will be responsible for documenting the data exchange at the data field level with the supporting systems and work with the middleware team to document error handling, determine the number of services required and delivery timelines based on the middleware release schedule. The BSA will also support testing efforts (unit, integration and load) assisting with the set-up of test systems, data scrambling and establishing test data across platforms to enable integration testing.  The ideal candidate will possess a deep and broad understanding of Information Technology best practices and processes. Additionally a strong and demonstrated strength in analysis and support of consumer banking systems is required.  The Senior IT Systems Anaylst reports to the Digital Technologies Delivery Lead. RESPONSIBILITIESElicit, analyze, validate and manage technical requirements definition, flows and deliverables for projects. Perform this by working with business partners to understand work effort requirements and then translate into IT actionable tasks.Working closely with the IT team to deliver solution design documents and requirements. Partner closely with technical teams supporting data movement, application development and testing. Diligently support and lead where needed various activities between the teams to ensure the business and technical requirements and objectives are met. Ensure appropriate project documentation is compiled and proper review and approvals from respective teams as gathered and collated.Contribute to the the overall system(s) design. Evaluate current processes and procedures to ensure relevance and accuracy. Make recommendations for changes and keep documentation current.Perform as the subject matter expert on the various consumer banking systems and processes assigned. Inclusive of this is gathering a deep understanding of the data within the systems and business processes supported by the system(s).Build critical working relationships with the business and users communities through gathering a thorough understanding of the business models and processes employed.Specify and fully document application customizations that would bear scrutiny by an internal audit or external regulatorsExpert level understanding of REST/SOAP paradigm and sync vs Async integration design and architecture.Have strong experience in enterprise application integration including SOA, BPM, APIs, Web Services (SOAP/RESTful), Micro Services, Containerization (Open Shift Containers, Kubernetes and etc.)Strong analytical, problem solving and data analysis skillsPerform duties & responsibilities specific to department functions & activities.Performs other duties & responsibilities as required or assigned by supervisor.Responsibilities include the following: 1) adhering to and complying with all applicable, federal and state laws, regulations and guidance, including those related to Anti-Money Laundering (i.e. Bank Secrecy Act, USA PATRIOT Act, etc.), 2) adhering to Bank policies and procedures, 3) completing required training, 4) identifying and reporting potential suspicious activity to the BSA/AML Officer, and 5) knowing and verifying the identity of any customer(s) that enters into a relationship with the Bank. understand the meanings of words and respond effectively; and perform basic arithmetic accurately and quickly.Vision must be sufficient to read data reports, manuals and computer screens.Hearing must be sufficient to understand a conversation at a normal volume, including telephone calls and in person.Speech must be coherent to clearly convey or exchange information, including the giving and receiving of assignments and/or directions.Position involves sitting most of the time, but may involve walking or standing for brief periods of time.Must be able to travel as position requires.May be required to lift 25-50lbs. Name: Finance Solutions Analyst
Description: Sitecore is the global leader in experience management software that combines content management, commerce, and customer insights. The Sitecore Experience CloudTM empowers marketers to deliver personalized content in real time and at scale across every channel—before, during, and after a sale. More than 5,200 brands––including American Express, Carnival Cruise Lines, Dow Chemical, and L’Oreal––have trusted Sitecore to deliver the personalized interactions that delight audiences, build loyalty, and drive revenue.  Sitecore is experiencing spectacular growth all over the world. To build on Sitecore’s success and growth, we’re looking for a skilled Finance Solutions Business Partner to work as part of our IT Department. Position Summary: As a Finance Solutions Analyst you will engage with and support all Finance functions. You will help define and drive projects that involve/impact existing IT owned systems and/or processes. You will play an important role in continuously improving how Finance leverages technology to make things “successful across the board.” This position employs business process knowledge, analysis, testing and collaboration, along with technical skills to accomplish assignments. Education and Experience Requirements:Around 3-5 years experience, providing system / application support to a suite of financial applications (NetSuite, Coupa, Expensify, Adaptive, Xactly)Experience as a conduit between IT & Finance, with a good understanding of financial systems processesExperience in technology projects with exposure to SDLC waterfall and agile software developmentStrong Customer Service experience with excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group; Executives, managers, and business users.Excellent analytical and problem-solving skillsAbility to lead discussions with the business, solicit input, facilitate decisions in a professional manner.Ability to multi-task and organize effectively to meet business expectations with excellent organizational and time management skillsComputer proficiency with MS Office application. Advanced Excel, Word, PowerPoint,Proficient utilizing Reporting toolsBachelor's degree in Business, Finance, or equivalent experience. After an offer is made and accepted, E-verify will be utilized to establish your identity and employment eligibility as required by the U.S. Department of Homeland Security. Name: Business Analyst, Account Management
Description: We believe the economy is better when everyone has access. When everyone has room to grow. No one should be left out because the cost is too great or the technology too complex. We started with a little white credit card reader but haven't stopped there. We're empowering the independent electrician to send invoices, setting up the favorite food truck with a delivery option, helping the ice cream shop pay its employees, and giving the burgeoning coffee chain capital for a second, third, and fourth location. We're here to help sellers of all sizes start, run, and grow their businessand helping them grow their business is good business for everyone.  Square's Account Management organization works with Square's largest merchants to grow their businesses and to deliver insights to Square's product teams. We aim to use data to shape merchant engagement strategy, to measure & improve team impact, and to help inform Square's product roadmap. We are looking for a Business Analyst to join the Account Management Strategy & Operations Team to power Account Management's strategy, analysis, processes, and tools to drive revenue growth and efficiency.  In this role, you will increase the productivity and revenue impact of the Account Management team through a combination of analyses, initiatives, and process improvements. You will need to synthesize insights through the vast amount of data captured by Square and develop actionable strategies that will help grow our sellers and their engagement with Square. You will work closely with leaders in the organization and cross-functional partners to drive program strategy and execution. The successful candidate will possess a passion for innovative analysis, processes that scale, and the ability to develop findings and recommendations that transcend the numbers. You Will:Develop and deliver performance analysis and program recommendations to inform executive decisionsIdentify tools, processes, and automation that will improve Account Management operationsOwn the Account Management team metrics, reporting, and dashboards we use to run the businessEvaluate the efficiency of Account Management channels & new initiatives and advise Account Management leadership on where to focus to maximize returnsInteract regularly with stakeholders across all areas of the companyBachelor degree required, with a major in an analytical or technical field strongly preferred2+ years of analytical experience, ideally in analytics, business operations, finance, or consultingExpertise in data analysis and manipulation using database (SQL) and Visualization tools (Tableau, Looker, Excel, etc)Demonstrated experience applying quantitative analysis and logical reasoning to drive business outcomesCreativity in developing actionable analysis and recommendationsStrong communication skills and business acumenSelf-starter and high degree of motivation to go above and beyond the task at handAbility to succeed in a collaborative, fast-paced environment At Square, our purpose is to empower within and outside of our walls. In order to build the best tools for the businesses and customers we support all over the world, we have to start at home with a workforce as diverse and empowered as our sellers. To this end, we take great care to evaluate all employees and job applicants equally, based on merit, competence, and qualifications. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply and always consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records, in accordance with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance. Applicants in need of special assistance or accommodation during the interview process or in accessing our website may contact us by sending an email to assistance(at)squareup.com. We will treat your request as confidentially as possible. In your email, please include your name and preferred method of contact, and we will respond as soon as possible.SDL2017

Name: FinTech Business Analyst
Description: At Uber, we ignite opportunity by setting the world in motion. We take on big problems to help drivers, riders, delivery partners, and eaters get moving in more than 600 cities around the world. We welcome people from all backgrounds who seek the opportunity to help build a future where everyone and everything can move independently. If you have the curiosity, passion, and collaborative spirit, work with us, and lets move the world forward, together.  About the Role FinTech is a part of the CFOs organization and responsible for innovating and building the best financial products & systems in the world. Our DNA is customer obsession, top-quality products, teamwork and transparency. As a business applications guru you will envision and execute financial product roadmap to enable an accurate, streamlined accounting and financial close process worldwide  What Youll Do Project manage finance/procurement/expense application projects from inception to completion.Lead the success of the projects, and ensure long-term seamless and scalable processesWork with Finance and other cross-functional teams to get a deep understanding of the processes and data flows, and translate business requirements into system functional specificationsWork with Engineering and other technical teams to deliver system solutionsCoordinate and facilitate user acceptance testing and conduct end-user training What Youll Need You are an Oracle R12 Expert who has worked on various Oracle Application Financial Modules. You do not shy away from building your own application, (ground up) if the need arisesYou can run your own queries, analyse data to fix or define problemsDemonstrated track record of driving programs/projects to meet business requirements and challenging delivery datesExperience in deploying financial application projects globallySolid understanding of Accounting, FP&A, Allocations, Consolidations, Reporting, and ComplianceExpert in Financial modules- P2P/O2C/R2R About the Team We build and implement all finance systems, with teams specializing in process, product, implementation, project management and analytics.

Name: Associate Monetization Strategy Manager
Description: *Title:** Associate Pricing Strategy Manager*Location:** This role will be based in either San Francisco, CA or Mountain View, CA.*The Role** Do you want to identify high-profile, needle-moving opportunities and partner with senior management, product managers, marketers, operations, and sales to bring them to fruition?  The LinkedIn Pricing Strategy team is looking for an Associate Pricing Strategy Manager to help accelerate growth and improve go-to-market strategy across our monetization businesses ($4B+ in revenue). The person will work closely with others on the pricing strategy team and leaders in our marketing, sales, and product organizations to help craft new business models, define monetization strategies for new offerings, optimize packaging & pricing for existing offers, and develop global processes to ensure successful pricing execution. If you?re excited by driving growth through global, cross-channel and cross-product initiatives and want to be part of a company that is redefining how professionals succeed, LinkedIn would love to talk to you. *Responsibilities** + Innovate on go-to-market monetization strategy  + Identify & prioritize opportunities to drive customer value, penetration, & bookings  + Help prioritize product roadmaps and determine go-to-market monetization strategy for new offerings  + Align packaging & pricing with customer value and success  + Evolve packaging/pricing models to better align with differing customer needs / value / willingness-to-pay and encourage deeper customer relationships  + Optimize price levels based on value/willingness-to-pay, competition, and go-to-market strategy  + Improve monetization processes, insights, and performance measurement  + Develop process foundations to improve price governance, execution, market validation, & decision making  + Measure and track monetization performance to enable continuous improvements  + Team up with a diverse cross-functional group of marketing, product and sales experts to bring industry leading solutions to market  + Conduct hypothesis-driven analyses to identify and quantify pricing & packaging opportunities  + Scope, structure, and execute upon strategic pricing initiatives to accelerate business growth  + Build analytical models to inform and influence pricing strategy  + Drive voice of customer interviews and large-scale quantitative customer research  + Work with the Product, Sales, and Marketing teams to develop and refine solutions, build consensus, and steer senior-level decision making  + Design testing and implementation plans to support global rollout of new packaging and pricing initiatives  + Communicate key insights to cross-functional stakeholders and senior leaders  + Extract and synthesize key results and prioritize for communication  + Transform findings into actionable recommendations *Basic Qualifications** + 2+ years of experience in consulting, marketing, and/or business strategy roles  + BA/BS degree *Preferred Qualifications** + 2+ years? experience with pricing or go-to-market strategy in the technology space  + Highly quantitative and data-driven. Experience using hypothesis and data-driven analyses to solve large, complex business problems and quantify business opportunities.  + Pricing strategy expertise: Demonstrated experience in monetization strategy and pricing/packaging optimization, preferably in SaaS / Software / Internet businesses  + Marketing strategy skills. Ability to understand customer needs/perceived value, drive customer value creation, and develop go-to-market strategies to accelerate growth.  + Experienced researcher. Expertise with research methodologies and data analytics to support pricing strategies  + Communication skills. Able to communicate effectively both written and verbally  + Commitment: Ability to drive key initiatives to successful outcomes in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment

Name: Sales Strategy & Operations
Description: Sales Strategy & Operations  San FranciscoBuild, improve, fix, and measure things.  The sales team at Stripe works with new and existing businesses of all shapes and sizes. As a member of the sales operations team, you’ll be responsible for overall productivity and effectiveness of the sales organization, partnering closely with sales leadership and the broader sales team to drive initiatives. Responsibilities include resource planning, go-to-market analysis, reporting, quota setting and management, sales process optimization, sales training, sales program implementation, sales compensation design and administration.  We are looking for a self-starter who has demonstrated success dealing with ambiguity, operating in a high-growth environment, and solving problems with limited oversight. Ideal candidates will have sales operations experience scaling a technology sales team and superior communication skills.Operating as a partner to sales management, you’ll: Determine go-to-market approaches and conduct regular business and resource planning.Define, manage and provide insights on key performance metrics.Create and manage processes such as sales target setting, forecasting and budgeting.Design sales workflows for your relevant channels.Oversee implementation of enabling systems and tools, working closely with internal systems teams.Our Ideal Candidate:Has 6+ years of sales, strategy and operations experience in a high-tech growth environment, or operational experience in investment banking, management consulting, private equity, venture capital, or business insights / analytics roles.Has strong analytical skills and a structured approach to solving unique business problems. Has experience working with data and large data sets.Has an enthusiastic “roll up your sleeves” mentality.Works well under pressure, with a high degree of adaptability and flexibility in a fast paced, rapidly changing environment. Nice to haves Prior experience at a growth stage Internet/software company.Prior experience in the payments industry. You should include these in your application: A resume or LinkedIn profile. #LI-CC1We look forward to hearing from you. Apply now

Name: Business Finance & Strategy
Description: Business Finance & Strategy  San FranciscoBe instrumental in building an elite team driving strategy, planning, and analysis at Stripe!  Stripe builds the most powerful and flexible tools for running an internet business. We handle billions of dollars each year and enable millions of users around the world to scale faster and more efficiently by building their businesses on Stripe. More than half of US internet users have purchased something from a Stripe user in the past year.
