Name: Executive Assistant (Mid-Senior Level)
Description: ERM is seeking a highly motivated Executive Assistant to join our team in Walnut Creek or San Francisco, CA to provide high quality administrative and project support for the Pacific West Business Unit.  We are seeking an organized administrative professional to apply self-initiative, positive team attitude, technical quality and creativity, to support our Pacific West Leadership team and organize an administrative team supporting the Business Unit.  As a highly resourceful team player, who’s comfortable working in a fast-paced environment, sometimes under pressure, while remaining flexible, proactive, and efficient, this individual needs to have the ability to exercise good judgment in a variety of situations, to pay attention to detail, with strong written and verbal communication, administrative and organizational skills, and the ability to balance multiple priorities.  This is an excellent opportunity for an administrative professional looking to join a well-positioned global environmental leader in an exciting and growing industry. RESPONSIBILITIES:Complete a variety of administrative tasks for the Business Unit Managing Partner (BUMP) and Area Managers, including managing the Business Unit Share point site; maintaining executive files on One Drive and One Note; updating and generating reports in Salesforce; tracking and reporting of business analytics; arranging detailed and highly accurate travel plans, expense reports and itineraries; and developing and organizing meeting schedules and agendas; compiling documents for meetings; and scheduling and administrative support.Responsible for organizing the administrative team across the BU ensuring the team is efficiently and effectively supporting project and office teams as well as meeting financial metrics.Participate as a member of the Pacific West Leadership Team, including but not limited to weekly team meetings, monthly strategy meetings, and monthly Partner calls. Schedule calls, prepare agendas, track and report out on action items, identify and execute administrative special projects.Anticipate the needs of the BUMP and Area Managers and proactively bring together appropriate people and resources to support addressing these issues.Represent the Business Unit Manager and Area Managers both internally and externally with a high level of professionalism and in a manner that reflects positively on the organization; establish and maintain positive working relations with the leadership teams.Complete critical aspects of deliverables and special assignments by establishing objectives, determining priorities, managing time, gaining cooperation of others, monitoring progress, problem solving and making adjustments to plans.Accept ownership for accomplishing new and different requests; explore opportunities to add value to job accomplishments and Business Unit.Support communication plan developed in conjunction with the BUMP and Area Managers, driving the cadence of the plan and drafting communications.Effectively handle activities and communications relating to the various management teams in which the BUMP and Area Managers participate, with a high degree of professionalism, accuracy and confidentiality. Manage contacts and communications, including composing and preparing correspondence that are sometimes confidential, proactively understanding who the primary contacts are, and keeping track of periodic communication needed for primary contacts and groups.Coordinate meetings, including sending meeting invites and keeping relevant record and correspondence for events; assist in setting up videoconferences, WebExs and Teleconferences for office meetings.QUALIFICATIONS:Minimum 7 years of working experience in professional services or corporate organizations supporting, fast-paced executives.Associates degree; BA, BBA, BS in business or related discipline preferred.Excellent organization, time management, verbal and written communication skills with an emphasis on confidentiality, good professional judgement, and the confidence to articulate effectively.Exceptional interpersonal skills and ability to interact comfortably with a wide variety of audiences, including other executives, senior management, clients, vendors and Board members, as well as employees. Ideally will have worked and collaborated with colleagues across North America and overseas.Demonstrated ability to manage/coordinate multiple projects and successfully prioritize multiple tasks with good judgment, initiative and follow-through. High confidence level in addressing unplanned or short-notice issues that require sound judgment and limited direction.Proven ability to produce accurate, high-quality work in a fast-paced work environment, as well as to work under pressure efficiently with rapidly changing priorities.Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office, including Word, One Note, One Drive, PowerPoint and Excel required. Other MIS experience such as Workday and Salesforce a plus.Ability to operate independently and remotely from a supervisor. Please submit your resume and brief cover letter. Thank you for your interest in ERM!  ERM does not accept recruiting agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, ERM employees or any other company location. ERM is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Name: Data Analyst - Greenlight Operations
Description: At Uber, we ignite opportunity by setting the world in motion. We take on big problems to help drivers, riders, delivery partners, and eaters get moving in more than 600 cities around the world. We welcome people from all backgrounds who seek the opportunity to help build a future where everyone and everything can move independently. If you have the curiosity, passion, and collaborative spirit, work with us, and lets move the world forward, together.  About the Role The North America Greenlight team is part of the Global Community Operations organization which provides premier customer support to riders and driver-partners. This role is part of the Greenlight Program team, a group responsible for strategy & customer experience design for our network of 200+ in-person centers that serve driver-partners. The GL Program team consists of two major functions: Operational Strategy and People Strategy. This team focuses on driving the future of the Greenlight organization; the Data Analyst will deliver customer support driven insights to the Operations Strategy team and to the local Field teams. They will identify opportunities and help prioritize work for cross-functional teams with the mission of improving the customer experience at Greenlight locations.  What Youll Do Own data analysis and visualization, and communicate recommendations and insights to stakeholders across the organizationCoordinate with other members of the Greenlight Program Team and the CommOps Analytics and Insights Team to measure the impact and efficiency of new products and business processesDevelop analytical frameworks to support decision making in the US and CanadaPartner closely with specific Lines of Businesses to provide insights that drive decisions around process, policy and productBuild, maintain, and communicate detailed reporting & models What Youll Need At least 2 years of data science, business intelligence, investment banking, consulting, or related experienceBA, BS, or MS degree in Economics, Business, Engineering, Operations Research, or other quantitative focusSQL fluencyExperience in reporting-based software, such as Shiny, Looker, TableauExceptional Excel & data management skillsStrong communication and organization skillsComfortable owning and juggling multiple projects or work streams at oncePassion for launching new and exciting projects in a fast paced working environment Bonus Points If High-growth analytics or operations experienceOperations, marketing, product experienceExperience working in a support environment (contact management analytics, Zendesk API familiarity, etc.)Programming languages such as R and/or Python About the Team The Uber North America Greenlight Program team develops and implements strategy for the network of Uber Greenlight locations across the US & Canada. Uber Greenlight locations help new partners get on the road for the first time, build engagement with the platform over time, and serve as a logistics hub for the city. Uber Greenlight locations serve as the face of Uber for driver-partners.

Name: Purchasing Manager
Description: At PagerDuty, we believe that people do their best in a culture that fosters inclusion, innovation, and success. Our values - Community, Growth, Passion, Team and Trust - serve as the foundation of our collaborative and dynamic culture. Whether it’s conducting a retrospective, participating in our monthly Hackdays, cranking out a new product feature, supporting our two PagerDuty bands, or doing our day to day work, Dutonians live and breathe these five values every day. Together, we solve real customer issues and fulfill our mission of connecting teams to real-time opportunities and elevate work to the outcomes that matter.The Purchasing Manager is responsible for leading all procurement efforts to efficiently and effectively enable business units and functional partners to maximize the value they receive from suppliers to meet their objectives.The PM will work to transform existing procurement processes that are currently handled in siloes, driving the vision, strategy and working cross-functionally to centralize direct and indirect sourcing and procurement from initial request through final delivery, incorporating aspects of supply and demand analyses, contract negotiation, and execution, as well as ongoing performance management and continuous improvement. You will be a department of 1 initially.How You Impact Our VisionLead and mentor for procurement activities both tactically and strategicallyDevelopment of organizational procurement strategyCreate/enhance/change/ influence/document new ways to improve productivity and optimize the value of each member of the team for the greater good of the CompanyDrive productivity, predictability, and cost optimization effortsManagement of procurement systemsWork cross-functionally to drive adoption continuous improvementLead negotiation strategy with our suppliers as neededAbout YouHands-on experience building strong teams and skills to bridge members of the team and functional areasIn-depth knowledge of sourcing/procurement practices and negotiationsStrong communication, presentation, customer service, negotiating, listening and writing skillsSoftware proficiencies required: NetSuite, Accounts Payable, Tableau understanding, MS Office SuiteStrong team orientation and organizational acumenStrong negotiation skills to use for large commercial dealsAbility to drive change and develop a shared vision cross-functionallyThrives in a fast pace and changing environmentMetrics-driven: able to identify, develop and manage metrics required to ensure quality and performance of the teamMinimum QualificationsAt least 10 years of senior supply management experience (or 15 years depending on the job requirements and the skills/education of the candidate), operational management experience, or experience in the primary service delivery of the organization is typicalPreferred QualificationsBA/BS in technical, business or analytical discipline required. MBA/MS a plusAre you passionate about Joining a creative company where you are pushed beyond your comfort-zone both professionally and personally? Then apply nowPagerDuty offers:Competitive salaries and company equityComprehensive benefits package including: medical, dental, and vision plans for you, your spouse and family401K, pre-tax commuter benefits, corporate discounts, cell phone allowance and more!Generous parental leave, paid vacation (3 weeks vacation your first year, 4 weeks afterwards) in addition to 12 paid holidays and ample sick leavePaid employee Volunteer Time - 20 hours per yearMonthly company wide hack daysCatered lunch daily plus breakfast on Wednesdays, and plenty of snacks and drinksConvenient office location in SoMa tech hub – accessible by BART, Muni and CalTrainPagerDuty is committed to creating a diverse environment and is an equal opportunity employer. PagerDuty does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, parental status, veteran status, or disability status.PagerDuty is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities in our job application process. Should you require accommodation, please email accommodation@pagerduty.com and we will work with you to meet your accessibility needs.Our stewardship of the data of many thousands of customers means that a background check is required to join PagerDuty. We will, nonetheless, consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records in a manner consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.PagerDuty uses the E-Verify employment verification program.To all recruitment agencies: PagerDuty does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, PagerDuty employees or any other company location. PagerDuty is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Name: Business Analyst, Uber for Business Sales
Description: At Uber, we ignite opportunity by setting the world in motion. We take on big problems to help drivers, riders, delivery partners, and eaters get moving in more than 600 cities around the world. We welcome people from all backgrounds who seek the opportunity to help build a future where everyone and everything can move independently. If you have the curiosity, passion, and collaborative spirit, work with us, and lets move the world forward, together.  About the Role The Business Analyst, Uber for Business Sales is first and foremost an analytical and technical problem solver, who is able to dive into unstructured environments to design solutions that will materially improve sales effectiveness and efficiency. You will drive the analysis behind global decisions related to our Uber for Business SMB sales and build scalable processes that enable internal and external stakeholders to leverage data and act upon insights. You will have the opportunity to work on a wide range of high-priority projects, and have exposure to multiple stakeholders within (Product, Systems, and Operations) and outside Uber (sales agents, customers). This is a highly cross-functional role, and the ideal candidate is passionate about data, empathetic, and a self-starter who can drive impact through process improvement, teamwork, organization and data analysis.  What Youll DoOwn analysis of operational metrics to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of our global scaled sales teams; craft impact and ROI analyses for project and experiments focused on scalably improving sales outcomesIdentify operational weaknesses and help improve or innovate new processes to keep local teams as efficient as possibleProblem solve. We're faced with new and interesting problems that need to be solved every single day. Identify and implement short-term solutions in a timely manner, while helping define the long-term solutionBecome a trusted POC between CommOps analysts, global and regional sales teams, and product / Salesforce development team, to ensure data needs are metBuild and own periodic reporting and global dashboards for our Community Operations and Business partners. Take advantage of the ever-growing amount of data we have at our fingertips to help stakeholders all over the world manage and improve our operationsCoordinate with members of other business teams spanning the company to measure the impact and efficiency of new initiatives and business processes What you'll needBA/BS/Masters in Economics, Business, Engineering, Operations Research, or other quantitative focusMinimum 2 years of experience using data to facilitate business decisions; high growth, technology, management consulting, business intelligence, or investment banking/private equity backgroundExpertise in SQL and Excel (and / or google spreadsheets)Passion for presenting complex analyses to leaders in a clear, digestible manner to sell your ideasSelf-starter attitude, and ability to exercise judgment and resolve difficult problems without supervisionExcellent analytical thinking and attention to detail - you connect the dots between the data and operations and gut check every number you seeHighly collaborative: excited to work with several key stakeholders and many different teams. Bonus Points ifExperience with Salesforce (preferred) or similar CRMExpertise, solid proficiency or desire to learn R and/or PythonExperience working with sales data, support data, or contact management About Uber for Business Uber for Business has one goal: to allow businesses of any size to harness Uber's technology to move their business in new ways, with less hassle. From enterprises that need a seamless global travel solution to local businesses that want to provide courtesy rides to customers, or clinics providing reliable rides for patients, and more. With over 65,000 businesses around the world already on board, Uber for Business is building for the future of how work gets done, wherever you need to go. About Community OperationsCommunity Operations is pioneering how Uber manages customer and partner support around the globe. The team you will join has one mission: Make Customer Experience our #1 Competitive Advantage. You and your teammates will champion this mission every day until there are no doubts its a reality.

Name: Outbound Research Manager
Description: Zendesk is looking for an energetic and motivated manager to join our Marketing team as an Outbound Research Team Manager. Your main responsibility in this role will be to oversee a team of researchers who are identifying potential customers and target businesses that would benefit from Zendesk products. The research that your team will do will help the Sales organization reach out to future Zendesk customers.This role is based in our San Francisco, California global headquarters and reports to the Senior Director, Upmarket Campaigns. To be successful in this role, candidates must have a market research, sales development and/or campaigns background, people management experience, team player mindset, a passion for developing a program and team from the ground up, willingness to learn new technologies and processes, and demonstrate strong collaboration skills. What you get to do every day:Manage a team of five researchers toward specific campaign outcomes for target listsCreate research processes and introduce best practices to guide the researchers project work from the ground up in building account and contact targets for enterprise campaignsWork with stakeholders, including Campaigns, Sales and Product Marketing, to inform, guide and deploy research strategyMake recommendations around researcher and project workflow to optimize campaign efficiency and time to market Map closely to campaign strategy and Ideal Customer Profiles in overseeing researchers workCreate ongoing opportunities for collaboration among researchers to support and codify replicable best practicesPartner with Analytics and Campaigns to leverage data insights around campaign engagement and conversion to iterate on market research approachWork with marketing and sales operations to optimize data capture in Salesforce, our Sales Force Automation system Build out accounts and contacts in SalesforceEnsure data integrity by overseeing de-duplication and clean-up procedures as neededCommunicate regularly with the Marketing, Sales, and Marketing/Sales Operations teamsDevelop researchers into career tracks for sales or marketingEnjoy a great team environment with a fun and energetic atmosphereWhat you bring to the role:BS/BA degree in business, marketing, communications, analytical sciences or a related degreeAt least 3 years of work experience, preferably in SaaSPeople management experienceSalesforce experience High energy and strong team ethicCollaborative mindsetGoal-orientedDemonstrated success at meeting targets#LI-MS1The best customer experiences are built with Zendesk. Zendesks powerful and flexible customer service and engagement platform scales to meet the needs of any business, from startups and small businesses to growth companies and enterprises. Zendesk serves businesses across a multitude of industries, with more than 125,000 paid customer accounts offering service and support in more than 30 languages. Headquartered in San Francisco, Zendesk operates worldwide with 15 offices in North America, Europe, Asia, Australia, and South America. Learn more at www.zendesk.com.Interested in knowing what we do in the community? Check out the Zendesk Neighbor Foundation to learn more about how we engage with, and provide support to, our local communities. Zendesk is an equal opportunity employer, and were proud of our ongoing efforts to foster diversity & inclusion in the workplace. Individuals seeking employment at Zendesk are considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, medical condition, ancestry, physical or mental disability, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.By submitting your application, you agree that Zendesk may collect your personal data for recruiting, global organization planning, and related purposes. Zendesk's Candidate Privacy Notice explains what personal information Zendesk may process, where Zendesk may process your personal information, its purposes for processing your personal information, and the rights you can exercise over Zendesks use of your personal information.

Name: Data Science Intern - Summer
Description: Because you belong at TwilioThe Who, What, Where and WhyWho? This is an internship opportunity for the Summer of 2019. You will be working in a rapidly evolving and fast-paced environment, with a team that is implementing a reliable, auto-scaling, software-based telephony applications, and develops machine learning solutions for improving quality of service, natural language processing, and fraud prevention, among others.  You should have the following: You are working towards an advanced degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science/Engineering or another quantitative discipline.You want to develop skills and industry experience while working on machine learning-based products that have an impact on real customers.Hands-on experience with Python or R, and familiarity with C/C++ or Java/Scala.Experience in data processing, analytics, business intelligence, and reporting is a plus.Experience with technologies such as hadoop, spark, etc. is a plus.What? As a Data Science Intern you will experience the following - Be a Data Scientists, not just an "intern".During your internship, you will be given responsibility for core features or research topics directly affecting services that ship to our users.You will be expected to embrace the challenges, learn fast and deliver great results.You will bring the willingness to learn and grow and we will reciprocate with ample opportunity to do just that, in a friendly, fun and exciting startup environment!Learn to develop beautiful and profitable applications.Demonstrate consistent improvement in your coding skills, issue-tracking and source control systems, and agile research and development mentality.Participate in code reviews, bug tracking and project management with the rest of the Twilio Team.Why? Twilio is a company that is empowering the world’s developers with modern communication in order to build better applications.  Twilio is truly unique; we are a company committed to your growth, your learning, your development and your entire employee experience. We only win when our employees succeed and we're dedicated to helping you develop your strengths. We invest in weeks dedicated to tackling hard problems and creating your own ideas. We have a cultural foundation built on diversity, inclusion and innovation and we want you and your ideas to thrive at Twilio. Come join us. About us:More than 2 million developers around the world have used Twilio to unlock the magic of communications to improve any human experience. Twilio has democratized communications channels like voice, text, chat, and video by virtualizing the world’s telecommunications infrastructure through APIs that are simple enough for any developer to use, yet robust enough to power the world’s most demanding applications. By making communications a part of every software developer's toolkit, Twilio is enabling innovators across every industry — from emerging leaders to the world’s largest organizations — to reinvent how companies engage with their customers. Founded in 2008, Twilio has over 1,000 employees, with headquarters in San Francisco and other offices in Bogotá, Dublin, Hong Kong, London, Madrid, Mountain View, Munich, New York City, Singapore and Tallinn.Twilio is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, gender, gender identity, parental or pregnancy status, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or Veteran status and operate in compliance with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

Name: Order Processing Specialist
Description: Job DescriptionJob DescriptionSkilled Order Processing Specialist who is goal-oriented and selfmotivated.  The successful applicant will be responsible for maintaining client and vendor relations and  performing a variety of sale operations and data entry tasks as it relates to operational excellence at Ecovacs.  The ideal candidate will have a strong background in working with multiple internal and external partners  (customers and vendors) to effectively lead projects, manage contracts, and implement systems.RESPONSIBILITIES:  Daily review of CRM opportunities  Data Entry SOP's for processing orders, closing orders, invoicing accts.  24 Hour turnaround from orders booked/closed to shipping  Collaborating with Finance, Sales, & Operations to resolve order questions  Resolve shipment delays/issues with 3PL or fulfillment center  3PL administration, coordination, and shipping process CORE RESPONSIBILITIES: Customer Excellence contract execution, vendor and item setups, order management, scorecard  compliance, EDI (preferred)  Direct, optimize and coordinate full order cycle  Business Process Improvement, Reporting, & Project Management  Manage ASN's, daily shipments, discrepancies'  Send sample shipments for marketing  Invoicing, New SKU's set/up, New Account set/upQUALIFICATIONS:  Minimum 2 years working experience in Data Processing  B.S. in Business Administration, Logistics or Supply Chain desired but not required  Record of successful project & process implementations  Master with SAP Business One  Excellent analytical, problem solving and organizational skills  Ability to work independently and handle multiple projects  Excellent written and oral communication skills

Name: Marketing Manager, Customer Acquisition
Description: Coming January 2019!Why This Job Is Important Almost every part of our daily life is now digital, from hailing a cab to paying a bill. But our medicines have not caught up. They're still stuck in an analog era.  Propeller Health is changing that. Our mission is to improve people's health by connecting the world's medicines. Our growing team enjoys working together to create and apply technology to challenging problems that have enormous social costs.  We empower people to lead their lives without the limits of their chronic disease; you will promote a positive and organized environment in which to serve our patients and customers. If you're looking for a workplace where your voice is heard, your ideas are encouraged, and you are valued for your contributions, then Propeller may be a great fit for you. About the Role As part of the marketing team, the Marketing Manager, Customer Acquisition will provide hands-on management for all of Propeller's direct-to-patient marketing initiatives. This individual will drive the efficient scale of current marketing initiatives and be tasked with constantly testing new methods for attracting, educating and converting prospective Propeller members.  The Marketing Manager, Customer Acquisition will work closely with Product, Analytics, and Marketing Communications to implement, track and optimize patient acquisition activities. This person will be detail-obsessed and able to seamlessly manage several projects simultaneously. Our goal is to find and help as many people as possible with asthma and COPD live better lives. The right candidate will be motivated by making a difference in individual patients' lives. We are leading the transformation of how patients and their caregivers improve the treatment of chronic disease through digital medicines. This requires all of us to embrace the unknown and constantly seek better ways to communicate to patients, partner, and internal teams. ResponsibilitiesDesign, test, and optimize multi-channel marketing programs to improve activation and retention of Propeller patients this activity includes paid social, SEM, programmatic and offline activities (direct mail, radio/TV)Collaborate with the Product team to manage the front-end patient experience through a platform of CRM toolsWork cross-functionally with Business Analytics and Design teams to optimize targeting, creative marketing messages and budget allocation.Work with Propeller partners to develop targeted, co-branded marketing programsMonitor direct-to-consumer marketing best practices to help generate new strategies and channels for testingCommunicate progress and results within the Marketing team and to other key stakeholdersAbout You3-5 years working in direct-to-consumer online and offline performance marketingDeep experience in paid social marketingExamples of ramping efficient volume/scale with an online or app-based productData-driven and analytical: Proven ability to create and track towards CPA/LTV benchmarks and communicate performanceExperience with app install networks a plusExcellent written and verbal communication skills with an eye for detailAble to effectively engage and collaborate with internal and external teamsAgency management experience a plusBachelor's degreePropeller Health is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are dedicated to building a diverse and inclusive team with a wide range of backgrounds and experiences, each helping us understand our patients better, and strengthen our team. We firmly believe that hiring and supporting a diverse team allows us to do the best work of our lives, and make the disease experience different. To do this, we strive to maximize access to every opportunity, cultivate a diverse set of candidates, and if hired, providing them with support, mentorship, and growth opportunities. We don't discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, ability status, or any other differences. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. All are welcome here.

Name: Engagement Manager - TME - Senior Principal
Description: The TME (Technology, Media & Entertainment) Engagement Manager (EM) is responsible for understanding and qualifying new business opportunities, driving proposal generation and presentation, leading and contributing directly to client solution delivery in a billable capacity, and ultimately ensuring the clients full satisfaction. The EM is also a key leader and mentor for Clarity Insights consultants at all levels, assembling and managing high performance client project teams, and contributing to the development of individuals, the TME practice, and Clarity Insights overall. He/she manages client P&L and related business performance, with direct revenue and margin growth objectives.Successful candidates have deep technical expertise and significant leadership experience with enterprise-class data analytics technology and solutions in the high tech industry.As a key Clarity, TME and client leader, the TME EM establishes effective, collaborative working relationships with Clarity executives, TME partners, Solution Architects, and Senior Business Analysts, and with Service Line Directors and consultants across our core delivery competencies including Data Science, Data Engineering, Data Visualization, Data Strategy and Cloud.A career at Clarity Insights is differentour people and culture (we are a consultants consulting company), our relentless client service commitment, and our specialization in data analyticsset us apart. We have the data analytics expertise and scale to compete with the largest systems integration firms, and yet still provide the nimble, focused, bespoke experience of a boutique.Business development responsibilities include....Build fully satisfied, reference-able client relationships, and actively contribute to the positive reputation of Clarity among prospects and in the marketAssemble and lead collaborative, high-performing business development and delivery teamsCreate high quality introductory presentations, proposals, Statements of Work, deliverables, and other client- and market-facing contentLead the delivery at least $2.5M in recognized annual services revenueManage the profitability (direct revenue and expenses) of client engagements in accordance with client commitments and internal policies and rulesAppropriately leverage and protect Clarity intellectual property in business development and deliveryPersonal utilization responsibilities include....Play a valuable business and/or technical leadership role(s) in client solution delivery, including working as a technical SME, identifying and responding to delivery extension/expansion opportunities, and actively managing the client relationship and expectationsAchieve an annual utilization target set by ClarityClarity contributions responsibilities include....Mentor employees and contribute to their individual development, and lead performance management processes for client delivery teamsContinuously learn about clients, target market segments, and data analytics business and technology trends, and effectively communicate/share information with colleaguesParticipate regularly in effective recruiting, candidate interviewing, and employee on-boarding activitiesBuild, cultivate, and curate Clarity intellectual property that contributes to business development and client delivery performanceAssist others in achieving business development and client delivery goals by providing leads, content, peer review, qualified client references, and other sharing that promotes successPublishing content and/or creating and delivering presentations that effectively promote the Clarity brandActively participate in and support organizational development and process improvement initiativesConstructively share ideas, observations, and evaluations that could contribute to Claritys client, people, and business goalsKey REQUIRED qualifications include...Bachelors Degree and 8+years work experienceMinimum 8 years of recent, progressive experience and demonstrable expertise in enterprise-class data analytics solutions and services. Minimum of 2 years of recent and hands-on experience implementing data & analytic solutions using emerging technologies (i.e. Hadoop, Spark, AWS, Azure, Tableau, Open Source, etc...), machine learning or predictive analyticsMinimum 2 years of recent, progressive experience and demonstrable business expertise implementing digital advertising or digital broadcasting solutionsMinimum 4 years of recent, progressive experience in consulting leadership rolesMinimum 2 years of recent leadership experience in enterprise-class data analytics projectsA strong understanding of market-leading data analytic technology platforms, roles, and trendsExceptional written and verbal communication skills, including experience writing custom proposals, responses to Requests for Proposal, Statements of Work, data analytics advisory deliverables, and executive-level presentationsRecent work references related to industry and data analytics expertise, and people and program/project leadership experienceCompletion of a B.S./B.A. degree or equivalentMust reside in the San Francisco bay area and willing to travel anywhere within the bay area to support bay area accounts. Must be open to limited travel to support TME sales opportunities outside of the bay area.At this time, we can only consider candidates that do not require any type of visa sponsorship or transfer now or in the futurePreferred qualifications include....Deep expertise/experience with one or more market-leading, enterprise-class data analytics platformsExpertise/experience with Agile project delivery methodology for software developmentCompletion of an M.S/M.B.A. degree is preferredClarity Insights is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. We believe in treating each employee and applicant for employment fairly and with dignity.GLDR#LI-SH1

Name: Director, Data Science & Analytics
Description: Cisco Meraki is revolutionizing the way IT administrators manage their infrastructure by providing simple and secure cloud-managed solutions. With a large install base of customers and rich, multi-dimensional data sets, the potential for data science to improve business performance for both our customers and our own business is enormous.As Director of Data Science, you will build and lead a central data team, whose mission is to provide the organization with access to clean data, robust tools, and drive data-driven decision making using both simple and advanced analytical techniques.We are looking for a proven data science leader, with experience and interest in building top-performing teams, guiding the application of data science and machine learning methods, an eye and passion for data quality, and the ability to connect analytics to business impact.This role is based in San Francisco and be part of our Strategy & Analytics Department.WHAT YOU WILL DOOwn vision and roadmap for teamHire a team of data analysts and scientists to support our strategy, product, and support departmentsDetermine and manage pipeline for team’s work and prioritize based on business needsSupport career paths, mentorship, and growth for team membersProvide technical direction on key data infrastructure decisionsEnsure access to high quality data and that consistent metrics and analytical approaches are being adhered to across the organizationWHO YOU AREPhD in a technical field (e.g., engineering, science, math, statistics)5-8 years of experience in business analytics, consulting, data science, business intelligence, data quality, and/or data engineeringAt least 1-2 years of management experiencePassionate about data quality and consistencyDemonstrated execution of outcomes against objectives and deadlinesStrong analytical intuition and business acumenInterest in and ability to understand cloud networking technologiesSense of urgency to drive impactBONUS POINTSMBA or Graduate Degree in ManagementAre you wondering what it is like to work at Cisco Meraki? Picture a beautiful office, balanced catered meals, fully stocked kitchens, onsite gym and paid time off to volunteer. Meraki Cisco has crafted an amazing equal opportunity focused office where employees thrive. With that said, we are confident you will love it here. Check out more of our benefits on our job page, at https://meraki.cisco.com/jobs, and we look forward to talking with you soon.

Name: Microsoft Dynamics CRM Business Analyst
Description: Job Description IBM Services is a team of business, strategy and technology consultants enabling enterprises to make smarter decisions and providing unparalleled client and consumer experiences in cognitive, data analytics, cloud technology and mobile app development. With global reach, outcome-focused methodologies and deep industry expertise, IBM empowers clients to digitally reinvent their business and get the competitive edge in the cognitive era in over 170 countries.Bottom line? We outthink ordinary. Discover what you can do at IBM.IBM Services is seeking Microsoft Dynamics Customer Relationship Management (CRM) Business Analysts to collect and analyze requirements and solve client problems using Microsoft Dynamics CRM solutions. You will serve as a liaison between clients and project consultants, particularly during initial project phases. You will work primarily on project execution but may be involved in sales support as well.  Microsoft CRM Business Analysts are responsible for identifying, developing and deploying end-user solutions in CRM systems. Using your deep functional knowledge and familiarity with the Microsoft Dynamics CRM application, you will ensure that client business requirements are met while providing a variety of advisory services around project management, business process development, implementation support and end-user training.Primary Responsibilities:Project ExecutionSupport the translation of client business requirements into CRM solutions, including requirements approval, communication, traceability and reuseContribute to the transfer of functional requirements to development and test teamsUse CRM workflow technology to automate business processesStay abreast on updates and new releases in CRM technologies (Microsofts and its competitors)Educate end-users on CRM functionsSales SupportHelp determine and translate customer needs into a solution and approachContribute to proposal developmentContribute to scope, approach, and estimating input to the proposal teamContribute to and participate in client demonstrations and presentationsAdditional skills required:Microsoft Office Suite, specifically Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and VisioTeam Foundation Server (TFS)Familiarity with Microsoft technologies/trendsStrong analytical, presentation, and writing skillsBENEFITS Health Insurance. Paid time off. Corporate Holidays. Sick leave. Family planning. Financial Guidance. Competitive 401K. Training and Learning. We continue to expand our benefits and programs, offering some of the best support, guidance and coverage for a diverse employee population. http://www-01.ibm.com/employment/us/benefits/https://www-03.ibm.com/press/us/en/pressrelease/50744.wssCAREER GROWTH Our goal is to be essential to the world, which starts with our people. Company wide we kicked off an internal talent strategy program called Go Organic. At our core, we are committed to believing and investing in our workforce through: Skill development: helping our employees grow their foundational skillsFinding the dream job at IBM: navigating our company with the potential for many careers by channeling an employees strengths and career aspirationsDiversity of people: Diversity of thought driving collective innovationCORPORATE CITIZENSHIP With an employee population of 375,000 in over 170 countries, amazingly we connect, collaborate, and care. IBMers drive a corporate culture of shared responsibility. We love grand challenges and everyday improvements for our company and for the world. We care about each other, our clients, and the communities we live, work, and play in!http://www.ibm.com/ibm/responsibility/initiatives.htmlhttp://www.ibm.com/ibm/responsibility/corporateservicecorps Candidates that live in or near one of the following cities preferred, but all candidates considered: Atlanta, Chicago, Columbus, Houston, Dallas, Raleigh, Washington DC Metro Area, Piscataway, Philadelphia. GBSEA17RWMS Required Technical and Professional Expertise At least 3 years team lead experience or management experience of 5+ team members (management consultant only)At least 2 years project experience in enterprise business application development and delivery (e.g., CRM, ERP, SCM, HCM)At least 1 year project implementation experience using Microsoft Dynamics 365, Microsoft Dynamics CRM online, or Microsoft Dynamics CRM 2016, 2015, or 2013At least 2 years project experience translating client business needs into software capabilitiesAt least 2 years project experience with business requirements analysis and modelingAt least 2 years project experience creating functional designs, test conditions and test scriptsAt least 2 years experience working within a team environmentBasic knowledge of software development methodologies (Waterfall and/or Agile) Preferred Tech and Prof Experience At least 2 years consulting experience working for a global systems integratorMicrosoft Certified Professional (MCP)At least 1 year project experience working with Microsoft Dynamics 365 Operations or Microsoft Dynamics AX 7, 2012, or 2009At least 1 year project experience working with global and offshore project teamsAt least 1 year experience with system integration or user acceptance testingAt least 1 year experience with organizational designAt least 1 year experience with business process design or re-engineeringAt least 1 year experience with developing and implementing end-user training programsAt least 1 year experience implementing or using CRM systems to support sales and marketing functionsAt least 1 year experience implementing or using CRM systems to support customer service, call center, or field service operations EO Statement  IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Name: Business Analyst V
Description: Job DescriptionTitle: Business Analyst V  Location: SFO  Duration: 6 Months  Our ideal candidate has experience working with Sales Operations, and considered expert in Salesforce's Org62 and on Salesforce technology (Reports, Dashboards, Wave Analytics). They should have experience working with large, complex data sets, experience in the technology industry, exceptional analytical skills, expert in Excel, very familiar with Google Sheets/Quip Spreadsheets, and great communication skills. They must have a proven ability to build relationships with both business and IT partners, demonstrate the ability to act independently, and be successful as well as flexible in an unstructured, team-oriented environment. Deliverables include: Detailed business analysis, analytic models, dashboard creation and reporting, cross-functional collaboration regarding data integrity, and presentations for Salesforce executives. Responsibilities:*Develop and maintain data in key reports; regularly monitor for changes and make updates for peak accuracyIdentify and address data issues on an ongoing basis; work with key partners to recommend process improvements for better data quality and effectivenessWork with business partners to understand business challenges, KPIs and metrics driving the businessPerform data analysis using Salesforce Reports, Wave Analytics and possibly Apex & SQLDevelop reports and dashboards, draw key insights and leverage them to help set the strategic agenda for the business. Deliver insights & recommendations to various stakeholders to facilitate data-driven makingAssist in developing and delivering presentations for senior executivesWork collaboratively across the Office of Innovation, IT, Customer Success, Sales and other supporting groups.Required Skills/Experience:*3-4 years of demonstrated success in technical skills, data analysis, quantitative analysis and business reasoningStrong experience with Salesforce Org62, deep understanding of key Objects ([C360, Company, Account, User] and their hierarchies), and Salesforce technology (Reports, Wave Analytics)2+ years experience working with and querying a large Enterprise Data WarehouseExceptional attention to detailAbility to tell compelling stories and explain complex issues in simple waysSelf-starter and high degree of motivation to go above and beyond the task at handExceptional problem solving skills: demonstrated ability to understand business challenges, structure complex problems, develop solutionsExperienced in using Office tools (Excel, PowerPoint, GDoc equivalents), Tableau and Business Objects to create reports and presentationsExperience with SQL and Business ObjectsAdditionally Preferred Experience:*Bachelors required, MBA preferredExperience in collaborating with Salesforce Sales Operations, Sales Strategy, Customer Success Group, Account Executives and Success Managers a definite plusStrong presentation skills, especially related to building compelling PowerPoint presentationsExperience with Apex, Data Science, Statistical Analysis and development in R a definite plusExperience using methods such as Logistic Regression, Linear regression, clustering, classification, decision tree etc. a definite plus-----------------------------------------------------------------------------.

Name: Sr Product Manager- Driver Engagement - Core Driver Earnings
Description: At Uber, we ignite opportunity by setting the world in motion. We take on big problems to help drivers, riders, delivery partners, and eaters get moving in more than 600 cities around the world. We welcome people from all backgrounds who seek the opportunity to help build a future where everyone and everything can move independently. If you have the curiosity, passion, and collaborative spirit, work with us, and lets move the world forward, together.  About the role: You will manage a small team of Product Managers focused on Core Driver Earnings. This is the team responsible for helping drivers understand what has been earned. From trip receipts to weekly pay statements to cash out flows, Product Managers on this team are responsible for the highest traffic visual elements within the Driver app that occur off trip. Drivers primarily drive with Uber to earn money, and as a Product Manager on the team chartered with communicating earnings, you will be responsible for helping improve earnings satisfaction and retention.  What youll do:As the Product Manager Lead for Core Driver Earnings, you will do all of the following:Define a roadmap that improves satisfaction for, and engagement with, Uber by redefining how earnings are communicated to driversManage a team of PMs who will help you execute against the roadmap aboveCollaborate with designers through iterations of the large number of user interfaces you will ownCollaborate with data science to understand interaction effects of changes to your surfacesPartner with peers across Driver and Marketplace orgs to ensure the UIs you launch have a stable enough framework / platform that others can quickly iterate on top of our initial launches What youll need:Minimum 5 years of experience as a Product ManagerStrong written and oral communication skills Demonstrated experience delivering executive level presentations as well as detailed product requirement documentationPrior experience collaborating with designers to launch front end featuresPrior experience collaborating with engineers with demonstrated ability to understand and tradeoff engineering cost against business goalsDemonstrated analytic capability. SQL competency a plus Questions youll address in the role:How can Uber display driver earnings information pre-trip, post-trip, and over the course of the week to maximize comprehension?How can Driver Earnings ship a set of features that all partner teams can build on top of?How can a retrospective experience be integrated with a planning experience to help drivers make more informed decisions about when and where they drive?

Name: Sr. Manager, Digital Media Retention Insights
Description: Job Description The Experience Insights & Operations (EIO) team is central to Adobe's goal of enabling customers to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences. The Sr. Manager, Digital Media Retention Insights  will support critical efforts across the Experience Insights & Operations team by leading retention insights, and driving cross-functional action that results in both experiential improvements and business benefit..  Reporting to the Group Manager of Digital Media Customer Experience Insights, this role will work closely with the global retention team, Sales teams, extended Customer Experience team, customer support teams, product teams, and engineering to improve experiences while achieving business goals.  The ideal candidate will have a strong business or financial analytics background and the ability to deliver broad customer improvements in an Enterprise SaaS company that result in measureable customer success. The candidate will have extensive hands-on experience retrieving and manipulating raw data, generating insights from the data set, and telling a story with the info that influences leadership.  Partnering with key stakeholders, this role will leverage data, reports and storyboards to evangelize customer-focused solutions, work with customer data and other feedback channels to build our understanding of experiential levers, and play a critical role in translating knowledge into action. In addition, this role will lead the aggregation, reporting, and status of retention efforts within Customer Experience, including Customer Care.  In addition, the Sr. Manager, Digital Media Retention Insights will lead efforts to surface deep retention expertise to identify opportunities for customer experience improvements, propose hypotheses and test designs to validate ideas, and drive programs that improve retention, workflows, and customer satisfaction.  Central to this role will be the ability to look across the industry and make experience-driven recommendations based on retention trends in the Digital Media space. There should be a strong sense of minimum viable experience. ResponsibilitiesWithin the Customer Experience organization, lead retention insights for Digital Media; work across teams to drive and monitor actions based on retention insights; collaborate closely with cross-functional teams also focusing on retention as a top strategic goalEngage with global retention team, product managers, designers, engineering, support and other business stakeholders on driving retention insights to actionProduce summary views of KPIs and inhibitors in executive-level dashboards and reports; develop expertise on retention KPI progressAd hoc retention analysis and translating improvements into recurring revenue impactAdvocate and champion customer needs around the retention experience with Digital Media teamsShowcase opportunities, pain points and wins through deep-dive storyboards with supporting qualitative and quantitative dataDocument measurable impact of changes, and build success stories to share; consolidate best practices to share across teamsCultivate deep expertise on the end-to-end retention experience; align closely with stakeholders and regularly communicate improvements implemented by AdobeRequirements:Strong degree of comfort presenting a business case to and working with executives and teamsAbility to network and focus attention around customer experience goalsExperience with data retrieval, analytics, and visualization tools (SQL, SAS, R, Excel, Tableau)Equally comfortable working in a program management and data/analytics capacity; fluency with data analysis, customer research, and performance measurementProven track record of success in addressing retention-related levers, opportunities and pain points across teams and surfaces for maximum customer and business benefitExperience defining A/B tests that lead to the aboveExperience collecting, synthesizing, and prioritizing product input from multiple sources and functions (customers, industry practices, sales, account managers, quality teams, partners, engineering, management, etc.)Expertise in building meaningful views by customer segment for finance, commerce, and product data resulting in widely-shared presentations and dashboards; Tableau or PowerBi a plusCreates/optimize retention processes across marketing, product strategy, account management and support teams (web, phones and chat)Effective storyteller with ability to pivot toward multiple business interests and prioritiesAbility to be both detail-oriented and see the big picture (strategic focus)Deep understanding of Adobe and our Digital Media product space a plusPassionate about customer experience and problem solving, strong appetite for excellence, collaborates to achieve goalsBS/BA with 10+ years software, high tech or management consulting experience, MBA preferredCompetenciesBusiness Acumen: Strong business, strategic and technical acumen. Visionary and detail-oriented.Driving Results: Sets aggressive goals and realistic timelines. Pursues long term objectives relentlessly. S/he sees the opportunity and creates a plan to seize it.Influential: Proven ability to work with, influence and lead efforts across the company and at multiple levels.Strong Communicator: S/he is highly articulate and creates a business case in a compelling manner. S/he communicates passion, energy and excitement. At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on . You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique approach where ongoing feedback flows freely.  If you're looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the and explore the meaningful we offer.  Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of race, gender, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status.  Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of race, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status.

Name: Digital Business Analyst
Description: Digital Business Analyst Oakland/San Francisco (work from home 80%) Leading Bank Contract: 12-24 mos (may convert to FT) Rate: $ DOE W2 REQUIRED SKILLS : SQL, SharePoint, Use Cases 3-4 years of Business Analysis experience (writing BRDs/FRDs/Use Cases) Excellent communication (Virtual team) As a Digital Business Analyst you will write requirements for the Payments Virtual Solutions & Innovation team. Responsibilities: Write a different kind of requirement for a new product release/upgrade (e-payments, BillPay, online payments, etc.). Write 'metric requirements' that measure customer activity, so a product is launched and there are certain things the product mgr wants to measure - clicks, what the customer activity is - 'business events' (BEV)- to capture the customer behavior - so these requirements address those 'metrics about behavior' that the product manager wants to measure. Use Use Cases, SQL , Sharepoint experience -their requirements are added to the BRD so that the developers include it in the coding, and when an event is executed - this code is jumped to - to capture the required metric. Assist in tracking customer behavior, tracking the actions taken by the customer, understanding how the customer is using this product. Knowing when do you think the activity will be triggered is part of the thought process required when writing the requirements - They access Teradata so need to know SQL - join, select union's, and need to know Use cases. - provided by DiceDigital Business Analyst

Name: PWM Business Analyst (Performance Reporting Ecosystem)
Description: Job DescriptionThe Business Analyst works with subject matter experts from the business, vendors and the project team to define requirements for Performance Reporting. They will also translate these requirements into functional specifications and detailed data and process flow design documents, and participate in the full development process life-cycle from concept through testing, implementation, and support.  In addition, the Business Analyst will assist the team in planning for Salesforce integration to the ecosystem and the business and deliver requirements for full Salesforce deployment in 2019. This will entail a deep understanding of Wealth Manager and CSA daily tasks and long term goals and how to build/replicate/improve processes, data quality and work flows within an integrated ecosystem. This includes documenting enhancements for future development of the ecosystem. RESPONSIBILITIES· Collaborate with project team, Product Managers, business and technology partners to jointly identify data needs required to deliver the next generation of wealth management technology solutions.· Ensure business requirements are being met with the delivered business functionality for integration between Salesforce and bank’s systems to support key functions and highlight differences and potential changes/solutions.· Develop and communicate process changes, enhancements, and modifications, verbally and through written documentation, to management, peers, staff, and other employees so that issues and solutions are understood.· Work closely with developers and vendors to debug or rectify issues.· Actively engage with the project team to help determine the approach for adoption and rollout and then lead the adoption and rollout for Wealth Managers and CSAs with the new functionality and improved processes.· Communicate results and insights with project teams and stakeholders (e.g. through live presentations and ongoing analysis/reports).· Perform duties & responsibilities specific to department functions & activities.· Performs other duties & responsibilities as required or assigned by supervisor. Responsibilities include the following: 1. Adhering to and complying with all applicable federal laws, regulations and guidance, including those related to Anti-Money Laundering (i.e. Bank Secrecy Act, USA PATRIOT Act, etc.)2. Adhering to Bank policies and procedures3. Completing required training4. Identifying and reporting potential suspicious activity to the BSA/AML Officer5. Knowing and verifying the identity of any customer(s) that enters into a relationship with the Bank QUALIFICATIONS Experience & Education: · BA in Mathematics, Finance, Computer Science, or Engineering required· 3-6 years of relevant work experience with background in portfolio management, working with various custodians and workflows· 3-6 years of relevant experience in business analysis and/or data management· 3-6 years of relevant work experience with Salesforce integrations· Technical Skills:· Excellent attention to detail· Knowledge of discretionary portfolio management with ability to translate business practices into business requirements Professional Skills/Competency: · Ability to demonstrate solution to Wealth Managers and CSAs & trading professionals (front office facing)· Strong quantitative and analytical skills - ability to quickly analyze issues to identify key insights and apply them to the business· Clear, high-level understanding of complex data models and workflows· Focus on development/ improvement of process to support continuous evolution of a more competitive and profitable Bank· Excellent communication skills, including ability to present effectively to both business and technical audiences at all levels of the organization· Strong orientation to clients, including demonstrated ability to understand needs and apply this knowledge to drive data enhancements Strong understanding of traditional and alternative asset class investment data, including but not limited to: equity, fixed income, private equity, real estate, derivatives, mutual funds, ETFs, global assets, and foreign exchange.Company DescriptionThe Norman Group is recruiting these full time positions for one of our clients, a software technology provider to banks.  The Norman Group is a management consulting firm providing project staffing and management consulting to banks and the financial services industry. The Norman Group was established in 1997 in Charlotte, NC. We offer management, project, and IT consulting, across specific domains; including treasury, payments, foreign exchange, factoring, risk & compliance and trade finance.  Normans clients have access to an entire project team including analysts, developers, QA specialists, and project/ program managers. The Norman Group employs a talented group of consultants and though their backgrounds are diverse, they share common characteristics in their analytical abilities, ethics, and commitment to teamwork.

Name: Women's Healthcare Professional Sales Representative
Description: Women's Healthcare Professional Sales Representative - Field Sales - San Francisco, CAPosition OverviewThe Professional Sales Representative targets, promotes and sells Vertical products to physicians and other specialized medical or healthcare providers. The Professional Sales Representative manages his/her territory in order to maintain and maximize sales of Vertical products to achieve territory, district and corporate objectives. As a member of the sales team, this position works closely with the District Manager, sales representatives and other internal & external groups, to achieve district and corporate objectives.Duties and Responsibilities Achieve quarterly sales goals specific to assigned territory and product portfolio Meet established call average expectations and sales performance expectations Effectively develop and manage territory business plans (targeting, routing, customer segmentation) Analyze data and manage territory to effectively target high prescribing physicians Use functional and technical knowledge of Vertical products, healthcare, managed care, and customer markets to meet or exceed customer needs Determine the appropriate strategic approach to gain access and acceptance for all Vertical products Abide by the Corporate Code of Conduct and Business Ethics and all Company policies and procedures Adhere to all administrative requirements, including but not limited to expense reporting, call reporting, and business planning Actively participate in scheduled Company meetings, including but not limited to District and National conference calls, national sales meetings, and other business meetings Travel within the territory for normal business and outside territory for other business events (business meetings, trade shows, etc.)Experience and Qualifications Bachelor’s degree required, focus on biological science or related discipline preferred 2+ years of pharmaceutical selling experience in quota-driven role preferred Demonstrated ability to adapt approach to meet and exceed business objectives when faced with an obstacle or a customer concern Demonstrated ability to develop and maintain positive, ethical customer relationships Track record of sustained high performance in current or previous positions and strong aptitude for learning Strong business acumen, analytical skills, and ability to understand market opportunities Strong interpersonal skills and ability to communicate effectively, both written and oral Demonstrated ability to work in a highly collaborative team environment Ability to understand and present clinical information Planning, organization, and project management experience including creating and executing business plans Ability to thrive in a culture that is performance based, fast paced, and results oriented Knowledge of the business and market in the assigned territory preferred Proficient computer skills, including MS Office, sales database and web-based applications Ability to travel as necessary or required, which may include overnight and/or weekend travel Valid driver’s license and clean driving record required Occasional lifting of up to 20 poundsAbout UsOsmotica Pharmaceutical is a global specialty pharmaceutical company with a proven history of developing commercially successful pharmaceutical products using a proprietary osmotic technology platform. In February 2016, Osmotica Pharmaceutical combined with Vertical Pharmaceuticals, LLC and Trigen Laboratories, LLC to create a world-class, fully-integrated specialty pharmaceutical and generics company.  Vertical Pharmaceuticals, LLC was founded in 2003 with a mission to develop, market, and acquire products offering therapeutic benefits for patients and healthcare providers. Vertical Pharmaceuticals supplies branded prescription products, specializing in Neuroscience and Women’s Health with brands such as Lorzone®, Divigel®, and OB Complete®.  Trigen Laboratories, LLC is a generic pharmaceutical company offering unique products across an increasing array of categories. Trigen seeks to bring value-driven generic products to its customers, working vigorously with its partners to identify and develop products which face an assortment of challenges. Additionally, Trigen identifies unique marketing opportunities and is steadfast in its pursuit to deliver products to best serve these markets. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability or veteran status.

Name: Group Manager, Accountant Segment Data Science and Analytics

Name: Sales Engineer
Description: Metric Insights, an exciting and growing startup, is developing cutting-edge, enterprise technology that is disrupting the Business Intelligence and Analytics space.
