Name: Corporate Banking Manager
Description: In this role, you will be responsible for the Corporate Banking lending activity in a geographical region, and managing a team of Corporate Banking Relationship Managers and Portfolio Managers to meet objectives and goals. You will be responsible for a Corporate Banking loan portfolio with average loan size of $25-50 million and a Commercial loan portfolio with average outstandings of $150MM to $500MM.  Functions Lead and manage a large team of Corporate Banking Relationship Managers and Portfolio Managers to successfully grow revenue by successfully prospecting for new business and retaining/expanding existing customer relationships.Develop contacts within the community to increase business development opportunities for all Corporate Banking Relationship Managers.Enhance the coordination and sales efforts for assigned geographic team and for management of team sales goals.Responsible for the P&L of team and establishing sales goals and strategies for team.Assess performance of team against set goals.Partner and team with marketing resources, treasury management services and other product/service providers within the company.Develop and implement cross-selling strategies. Proactively keep current with commercial, economic and financial situations relating to new or existing business.Establish strong customer relationships with some of the most complex customers and their key principles to form deep client relationships and obtain trust.Identify, hire, performance manage, motivate and retain top talent.Promote and maintain efficient operations processes designed to achieve the highest levels of customer service quality.Manage and maintain credit quality standards.Create, manage, and maintain controls to ensure the highest quality standards are maintained in regard to account management (past due loans) and timely follow-up.Achieves outstanding credit exams.Grants credit within approved guidelines.Demonstrate compliance with all bank regulations that apply to your position, and keep up to date on regulation changes.Maintain working knowledge of our policies and procedures regarding the Bank Secrecy Act, Regulation CC, Regulation E, Bank Security and other regulations that apply to your position. Supervisory Responsibilities 3-8 employeesQualificationsRequires a bachelor's degree or equivalent, and proven track record in developing business in the Corporate Banking industry. Master's degree preferred.10+ years of relevant corporate lending experience.5-8 years' prior management experience leading a team.Experience setting production goals and ensuring achievement of goals.Significant experience and in-depth knowledge of corporate lending or finance industry.Experience directing and leading the activities of a Corporate Banking team having overall responsibility for planning, budgeting, implementing, and maintaining costs, methods, and associates.Experience developing, modifying, and executing company policies that affect immediate operation(s) and company-wide affect.Experience interacting with executive levels on matters concerning several functional areas, divisions and/or customers. Interactions normally involve controversial situations, customer negotiations, or influencing and persuading other senior-level managers.Requires the ability to change the thinking of, or gain acceptance of, others in sensitive situations.Excellent relationship management and business development abilities, analytical and problem-solving skills, sales skills, and credit and credit quality skills with prior lending authority experience.Proven track record of success in developing new clients and business, including prospecting, sourcing and networking.Excellent negotiating skills and ability to manage complex customer relationships. Experience managing and developing others and ability to build and maintain relationships.Excellent planning and organization skills with the ability to change course (adaptable) at a moment's notice.Ability to train and present to small and large audiences including developing presentations and presenting to customers at high level (i.e. CFO, CEO, and other Executive levels). Physical Requirements and Working Conditions Work involves:sittingwalkinglifting up to 25 pounds.Frequent travel No relocation offered.  About Us  We do things a little differently here at Umpqua. Our retail stores serve as community hubs, our associates are given up to 40 hours of volunteer time each year, and we're never satisfied with the status quo. It's no wonder we've made "Fortune's 100 Best Companies to Work For" eight years in a row. But greatness has no finish line, so we continue every day to keep people at the center of everything we do. We focus on building relationships, understanding our customers' needs and connecting to people in new and innovative ways -- always staying true to our mission of providing personalized banking for all people, whenever and however they prefer to bank.  Umpqua Bank is committed to employing a diverse workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, protected veteran status, or disability.SDL2017

Name: Data Science Manager, Analytics - Instagram
Description: Instagram is a global community of more than 1 billion, which means jobs here offer countless ways to make an impact in a fast growing organization. Instagram was built to connect people to the people and interests they love. Our app has played a critical part in forming meaningful communities where people can connect with each other and share what matters most to them.Were looking for analytics leaders to work on our core products with a passion for social media to help drive informed business decisions for Instagram. You will enjoy working with one of the richest data sets in the world, cutting edge technology, and the ability to see your insights turned into real products on a regular basis. The perfect candidate will have a background in computer science or a related technical field, will have experience working with large data stores, and will have some experience building software. You are scrappy, focused on results, a self-starter, and have demonstrated success in using analytics to drive the understanding, progression, and user engagement of a product. This position is located in our Menlo Park office and possibly San Francisco. Responsibilities:Apply your expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining, and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and understand how our users interact with our core productsPartner with Product and Engineering teams to solve problems and identify trends and opportunitiesInform, influence, support, and execute our product decisionsBuild/maintain reports, dashboards, and metrics to monitor the performance of our productsMine massive amounts of data and extract useful product insightsManage development of data resources, gather requirements, organize sources, and support product launchesMininum Qualifications:3+ years of experience in managing other team members4+ years of experience doing quantitative analysis2+ years of experience in an analytical role in a technology company, consulting, investment banking, or product management2+ years of experience with SQL or other programming languagesExperience initiating and driving projects to completion with minimal guidanceExperience communicating the results of analysisPreferred Qualifications:Bachelor Degree in Computer Science, Math, Physics, Engineering, or related quantitative field.Understanding of statistical analysis, experience with packages, such as R, MATLAB, SPSS, SAS, Stata, etc.Experience with large data sets and distributed computing (Hive/Hadoop).

Name: Marketing Associate Analyst
Description: Zendesk is seeking a Marketing Associate Analyst to join the Regional Marketing team. Youll be joining a diverse team that manages marketing programs, operations, and events to support growth in North America and Canada. As a Marketing Associate Analyst, you will help to define, plan, track and manage complex projects. Youll be supporting a diverse team to help us make the right decisions and achieve our goals.Responsibilities include revenue performance management, budget management, analytics & reporting.Revenue Performance Management and Budget ManagementManage regional marketing budget, expense management using Coupa and monthly reporting to keep the team on trackPartner with management to support and evolve RPM initiativesDemonstrate marketing contribution to pipeline and ROIAnalytics & ReportingLeverage technologies, tools and data to measure and prove successExtract, transform and load data sets to report and deliver meaningful insights.Partner with teams and lead efforts on quantitative analyses that translate data into actionable insights and actionable plansWork with cross-functional teams to push projects forward, driving recommendations through to implementation.Build and maintain reports and/or dashboards that provide visibility into business performance. Monitor KPIs related to Go-To Market performance. Collaborate with Analytics mentor to learn Zendesk systems, data structures, and develop analyses to support growth initiatives.Desired Skills and ExperienceBS/BA degree in business engineering, economics, or related degree OR equivalent combination of education, training, and experience0 - 2 years of experience in strategy consulting, data analytics, business intelligence, or a strong desire to learn marketing analyticsEnjoy working cross-functionally with other teamsExcellent written and verbal communication skillsA knack for identifying and investigating anomalies in data and operationsHands-on experience with SalesforceFamiliarity with BI tools (e.g. BIME, Tableau, GoodData) and Excel functions, and building enterprise level reports and dashboards. Working knowledge of SQL and data warehouses (e.g. BigQuery, MySQL)Familiarity with marketing funnel reporting and industry KPIs, such as website sessions, MQLs, pipeline, and MRR a plusExperience analyzing CRM data (e.g. Salesforce) and web tracking (e.g. Google Analytics) a plusThe best customer experiences are built with Zendesk. Zendesks powerful and flexible customer service and engagement platform scales to meet the needs of any business, from startups and small businesses to growth companies and enterprises. Zendesk serves businesses across a multitude of industries, with more than 125,000 paid customer accounts offering service and support in more than 30 languages. Headquartered in San Francisco, Zendesk operates worldwide with 15 offices in North America, Europe, Asia, Australia, and South America. Learn more at www.zendesk.com.Interested in knowing what we do in the community? Check out the Zendesk Neighbor Foundation to learn more about how we engage with, and provide support to, our local communities. Zendesk is an equal opportunity employer, and were proud of our ongoing efforts to foster diversity & inclusion in the workplace. Individuals seeking employment at Zendesk are considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, medical condition, ancestry, physical or mental disability, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.By submitting your application, you agree that Zendesk may collect your personal data for recruiting, global organization planning, and related purposes. Name: Associate Consultant
Description: Careers at TopDown Consulting  Associate Consultant Location: United States – Multiple Locations Overview: We are looking for Associate Consultants that will assist with implementations of world-class client solutions. Strong analytical and financial skills, as well as technical proficiency with financial or operational systems, are required. Ideal candidates will have excellent communication skills, strong business acumen, solid presentation skills, and be able to contribute to streamlining business processes.  This role is for professionals or recent advanced degree graduates looking to gain a foothold into the EPM consulting industry. Gartner states that this is one of the fastest growing segments of software and this role can be the entry point for the motivated candidate.  An ideal candidate will have a minimum of 1-3 years professional work experience in finance, accounting or Management Information Systems (MIS) fields with a bachelors or advanced degree from an accredited university.  As an employee of a virtual company, the Consultant must be self-sufficient and pro-active in managing their work, while maintaining appropriate communication and escalation to TopDown management. They should be able to work both independently and as part of a team, and be committed to continuously improving TopDown’s operations and profitability. Key Duties and Responsibilities:The Associate Consultant will join the team in a growth role to help architect, develop and maintain the necessary processes and systems in support of the overall objectives of the implementation leadership team.This individual must develop skills that facilitate a comprehensive understanding of the business, as well as the data and reporting requirements of the client.This individual will learn to focus on partnering with the customer to address issues that impact the overall success of the project. In addition, continually search for efficient and effective ways to improve systems, processes and tools to retrieve and analyze data to support the growth client.The Associate consultant must adhere to the defined Standards and Practice Guide.This Associate Consultant must be able to confidently deliver in conversation or presentations complex topics, including abstract concepts, to customers.This individual will most likely begin their career as an accountant, financial, business or MIS analyst.What sets this consulting position apart from the standard financial analyst and IT support roles is the potential to develop the unique skill of understanding the business requirements with the creative capacity and experience to design efficient and effective data tools and systems.Work in conjunction with customer to systematically retrieve, format and maintain data.Design reports and retrieve data to support the customer in effectively analyzing the business, including ad hoc reporting.Ability to drive business requirements discussion, capture key issue and formalize findings.Work with customer to build systems to automate models focused on sound business principals.Assist with designing client systems to support their reporting needs and to manage the day to day business.Requirements: This role requires a good attitude, strong business ethics, an analytical mind, the ability to think on your feet, and excellent customer skills. 1-3 years business experience.Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance or Management Information Systems.Oracle Hyperion Enterprise Performance Management application experience.Experience with planning, forecasting, and financial accounting processes.Good presentation and communication skills, both written and verbal.Excellent Microsoft Office skills with ERP skills preferred.Willingness to travel up to 100%, Monday through Friday

Name: Business Analyst (Risk, Ethics and Compliance)
Description: The Business position is within the Risk, Ethics and Compliance department and is critical in establishing and monitoring risk registers & indicators, implementing corrective action plans, conducting risk assessments and evaluating the effectiveness of the company's control framework. This position includes supporting the development and implementation of procedures and policies that support the enterprise-wide risk management activities. The Business Analyst will operate cross functionally and in areas with significant ambiguity and complexity from both a legal and operational frame of reference.How you will make an impact:Creates and maintains risk register items in Governance, Risk & Compliance (GRC) system platform. Completes risk scoring and analysis and does research for risk assessments and trend documentation. Analyzes transactions, internal reports and financial information for risk assessments.Develops relationships and partnerships with the business units for risk reporting and periodic risk attestations.Assists in the valuation of the effectiveness of the company's internal control framework in addressing risks and accomplishing the companys goals and objectives.Assists in providing training and technical support to management and employees regarding risk management strategies and programs.Develops in depth working knowledge of the GRC risk processes and IT applications that support the risk management process. Researches risk implications, drafts risk assessments and performs analyses to frame risk discussions with business unit partners.Assists in creating risk training and providing GRC risk program technical support to management and employees. Researched and drafts documents to present legal and business options to facilitate discussion of compliance requirements.Assists in drafting risk project plans, coordinates project meetings and documentation, monitors and reports on progress.Performs miscellaneous duties as assigned.What we look for:Strong organizational/time management skills and project management skills and multitasking abilities.Detail-oriented; flexible and creative.Strong analytical, problem solving and negotiation skills.Knowledge of project development life cycle a plus.Knowledge of risk management and healthcare regulatory processes a plus.Knowledge of risk standards like ISO, COSO, FAIR a plus.Knowledge of Delta Dental products, policies, claims, eligibility and underwriting procedures and guidelines, optional.Knowledge of health care & insurance industry issues a plus.Creative problem solving and critical thinking skills with a bias toward action and a "get things done" attitudeAbility to maintain confidentiality.Ability to travel as needed.Bachelors degree in business management, finance, economics, statistics, computer science and/or other related fields.2 years experience in business management, risk, legal, regulatory analysis or compliance experience, business operations, or project management desired.Comparable education or experience may be considered.Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work in a team environment to drive project initiatives and work with other analysts on the team.Optional: Knowledge of technical analytical tools e.g. SQL, Tableau, or ROptional: Certifications in Compliance (CHP or CCEP); Certified Risk Analyst (CRA), Certification in Risk Management Assurance (CRMA), Professional Risk Manager (PRM)Benefits and perks:12 days starting vacation plus 11 holidays and your birthday off!Multiple medical insurance options: 100% paid or low cost premiums 100% paid dental insurance100% paid vision insuranceOnsite gym and/or gym discount and fitness incentive Culture of learning: substantial tuition reimbursement to improve your skillsCareer growth: we love promoting from within Strong commitment to work/life balance Technology allowanceSocial responsibility and volunteer opportunitiesIf you think this sounds like you, lets chat. We would love to tell you more!ABOUT Delta DentalAs the first company to specialize in dental insurance, we are passionate about oral health and its importance to future generations. Our core purpose is the advancement of oral health care to our customers, partners and consumers through dental insurance programs and philanthropic efforts.We are part of the Delta Dental Plans Association, a network of companies that provides dental coverage to 74 million people in the U.S. Delta Dental of California, Delta Dental of New York, Inc., Delta Dental of Pennsylvania and Delta Dental Insurance Company, together with our affiliate companies, form one of the nations largest dental benefits delivery systems, covering 33 million enrollees. All of our companies are members, or affiliates of members, of the Delta Dental Plans Association, a network of 39 Delta Dental companies throughout the country.Delta Dental provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Delta Dental complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

Name: Business Operations Lead -- Marketing, Sales, Partnerships & International
Description: We believe the economy is better when everyone has access. When everyone has room to grow. No one should be left out because the cost is too great or the technology too complex. We started with a little white credit card reader but haven't stopped there. We're empowering the independent electrician to send invoices, setting up the favorite food truck with a delivery option, helping the ice cream shop pay its employees, and giving the burgeoning coffee chain capital for a second, third, and fourth location. We're here to help sellers of all sizes start, run, and grow their businessand helping them grow their business is good business for everyone. The Business Operations Lead will manage overall planning, budgeting and operations for Marketing, Sales, Partnerships and International. Reporting directly to the head of these combined organizations, this individual will drive critical strategic, analytical, and operational initiatives designed to increase productivity, efficiency and effectiveness across the group. In addition, this individual will help accelerate our go-to-market efforts. We are looking for someone who has deep technical expertise in data tools and platform, and the ability to provide strategic and proactive guidance that sets the team up for success. You will: * Identify, scope and drive priority initiatives including goal setting, annual / quarterly planning, budgeting, competitive assessment and market segmentation across organization * Partner with Finance organization to maintain accurate and actionable budgets and forecasts for organization * Develop and implement regular and consistent reporting and analysis of key performance metrics across investments and activities across teams * Evaluates results against expected performance and collaborate with individual teams to develop optimization recommendations * Together with Finance, define consistent approach to modeling to forecast revenues, profits, and ROI, during annual and quarterly planning * Monitor competitive activity, industry trends and go-to-market best practices to inform strategies and tactics across teams * Proactively build global systems and processes to drive efficiency and effectiveness * Conduct in-depth analysis of our business and key value drivers to identify growth opportunities * Partner with teams to build business cases for potential investments * Work with Business Intelligence, Marketing Analytics and Sales Operations to ensure that data, analytics and dashboards required for operation of organization are resourced and set in place * Drive understanding of customer journeys, customer segment behaviors, channel efficiency and cross channel attribution * Develop and present operational insights and recommendations, and drive implementation of those recommendations with a diverse array of cross-functional partners * Perform strategic value-added analyses around business growth opportunities * Keep functions accountable to goals and committed actions You have: * Experience developing complex GTM and revenue and return models for high growth businesses * Proven statistical analysis and modeling experience with expertise in analytical techniques and their applications to marketing, sales and business metrics * Ability to translate quantitative data into actionable business recommendations and communicate complex data concepts in ways that organization will understand * Expert-level proficiency in Microsoft Excel, SQL, Salesforce and data visualization tools * Excellent understanding of business practices related to marketing, sales and business development * Strong communication skills * Distinctive problem-solving and project management skills * Strong business acumen and the ability to successfully navigate and influence within a complex business environment; ability to handle multiple, simultaneous projects under deadline pressure * Empathetic to the daily rigor and short term demands of an acquisition organization and able to tie these to long term, strategic initiatives * Experience managing a team, direct and matrixed * 10+ years of experience #LI-MR2 At Square, our purpose is to empower within and outside of our walls. In order to build the best tools for the businesses and customers we support all over the world, we have to start at home with a workforce as diverse and empowered as our sellers. To this end, we take great care to evaluate all employees and job applicants equally, based on merit, competence, and qualifications. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply and always consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records, in accordance with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance. Applicants in need of special assistance or accommodation during the interview process or in accessing our website may contact us by sending an email to assistance(at)squareup.com. We will treat your request as confidentially as possible. In your email, please include your name and preferred method of contact, and we will respond as soon as possible.SDL2017

Name: Data Engineer
Description: ABOUT ENVOY:Envoy makes workplaces work better. With a focus on the details, we craft beautiful, modern software that elevates the workplace experience. Companies like Slack, Pinterest, Spotify, Nike, and American Express have worked with Envoy to welcome over 30 million visitors to more than 10,000 locations around the world. We are proudly backed by Andreessen Horowitz, Menlo Ventures, Initialized Capital, and many others.Our mission is to challenge the status quo of workplace technology. This idea started at the front desk, where we set a new standard for visitor sign-in. Now, were looking around the officeto the mailroom, meeting rooms and beyondand asking how can we make this better, too? We envision a world where technology is woven through our workplaces, all of it working together to make our time there delightful. If this world sounds exciting, wed love for you to help us build it.ABOUT THE ROLE:Envoy is growing fast (getting close to 100 people) and with growth comes a ton of opportunities to use Data Analysis to solve problems, improve processes and simply make better decisions.We value being a top-notch organization with a strong data and engineering-driven culture, and have the same high standards with our data, code, systems, and people. We value learning and growth (and not being bored) and hire fully-formed, diverse, well-rounded, communicative people we can envision being friends with and trusting. The Data team today is made up of full-stack data analysts / scientists and we are looking for more data nerds (sort of a hybrid data analyst / scientist w/ some engineer in them). While we like full-stack, we know that each individual will bring a different set of skills. This role is mostly focused on our Engineering needs, providing Data infrastructure, integrations and building data products.You have to love data for its power to drive actionable insights and empowering folks across the company. Youre a SQL master and enjoy using leading tools to instrument, clean, transform, model, and effectively visualize data. We happen to use Redshift, S3, Looker, Python, Segment, Heap, dbt, Stitch.You will: Focus on supporting our Data infrastructure and integrations.Take the lead in building full-stack Data products.Be the liaison between the Data team and the Engineering team by helping with instrumentation and data models.Build, utilize, and support tools that enable us to become even more data-driven than we already are. Drive quality into our data pipeline and ultimately data, be it through good standards, in-depth & helpful reviews, data validation methods, anomaly detection and alerting, multivariate experiments w/ proper control group(s), partnering with engineering on data storage and logging, well-thought out ETL, and clearly and succinctly documenting where and how funky 3rd party data becomes our clean, gold-standard set.Partner closely with anyone and everyone across the company to build dashboards, extract insights and empower them with dataHelp the Product team with Event Tracking, segmentation, funnel analysis, KPIs, experiments.Explore data from all sides of the business (Sales, Success, Marketing, Finance) and drive insights through modeling (Marketing attribution models, churn prediction, account health)Facilitate decisions on standards, frameworks & tools, build vs use, and best practices. We try and keep our data and tools simple, clean, readable, and consistent to maximize our time on Envoy problems.Learn, teach, & share. With your fellow teammates and the world (blogs, open source, etc). Its good for you, good for Envoy, and good for the world.You are: A champion of quality, ensuring accuracy and reliability of data.A problem solver, not afraid to dive into a problem to understand root-causes.Communicative & empathetic. You are happy when helping others succeed.Fast-paced. You love the speed of and impact you have in startups.Constantly looking to learn, and improve how you work.Very high standards but practical, you know that perfect is the enemy of good.You have: 3+ years of Software Engineering experience w/ a focus around Data productsA clear understanding of everything it takes to build web services.Domain Knowledge of SaaS Business Analytics or Product AnalyticsExperience with our tools: SQL, Looker, Python, AWSExperience with statistics, modeling, data visualizationsKnowledge of & experience with where the data comes from and how it makes it through the pipeline into a query result or interface. Youve worked 1st hand (or in close partnership with an engineer) with various data storage technologies, pipelines, ETL, and visualization systems at scale. We use PostgreSQL, Redshift, Looker, DBT, Stitch, Split.io.A passion for delivering high-quality actionable insights.Bonus points: You contribute to an open-source project or library of any sort.Youve excited about working in a startup environment.Leadership experience. Youve driven a project or led a team to a good outcome a few times, and the team would reflect positively on it.Experience with security exploits, techniques, and tools. As Envoy becomes commonplace around the world, we become more and more of a target.If this kind of work sounds interesting, we'd love to hear from you! We're open to all backgrounds and levels of experience, and we believe that great people can always find a place. People do their best work when they can be themselves, so we value uniqueness. We never discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status or disability status.Our HQ is in San Francisco and were open to remote candidates in the Pacific-Eastern time zones. Collaboration and the ease of chatting face to face is important to us.

Name: Localization Operations Business Analyst
Description: At Uber, we ignite opportunity by setting the world in motion. We take on big problems to help drivers, riders, delivery partners, and eaters get moving in more than 600 cities around the world.  We welcome people from all backgrounds who seek the opportunity to help build a future where everyone and everything can move independently. If you have the curiosity, passion, and collaborative spirit, work with us, and let’s move the world forward, together. About the RoleThe Localization Team is seeking an experienced Localization Business Analyst to help our Localization Operations team. In this role, you’ll guide localization business decision making process through gathering metrics and data from various sources, analyzing them, and providing insights. In addition, you’ll handle all the budget, cost model update, invoicing, and financial side of our business unit. Lastly, you’ll create high quality decks, reports, and dashboards for the team.*Flexibility to work from our Palo Alto office on Tuesdays & Thursdays, and the entire team works from home 1 day per week!*What You’ll DoCreate function-relevant online dashboards, with little or no help from engineering, for our Localization Program Managers, Language Managers, and Management TeamRecommend strategic decisions to leadership based on analyzing data and providing business insightsUpdate our financial cost model to reflect the reality of our evolving businessOwn and scale vendor financial reporting processEnhance the process for both invoicing and data trackingPerform analytics on raw data and provide regular insight & reportsCreate highly polished decks for management with data pulled in from various sourcesWhat You’ll NeedBA/BS degree or equivalent practical experienceMinimum of 2 years of localization business analyst experience in high-tech industry on the client sideProficient in SQLExceptional Excel / data management skills and creating reportsExperience presenting data visually and selling ideas to leadershipExperience handling budget and reportingPassionate about subjects such as experimental design, data visualization, and statistical analysis techniques.Ability to navigate ambiguity, work independently and be able to chart direction of projectsStrong analytical and problem solving experience, coupled with excellent business judgmentVery detail-oriented, quality-focused and proactiveExcellent written and verbal communication skills and the ability to manage multiple and diverse stakeholders across businesses and leadership levelsAbility to learn new tools/systems quicklySelf-directed - you need to take initiative in tackling large problems head onExcellent team playerPassionate about Uber and our missionBonus Points ForMBA degreeExperience in technology, management consulting, business intelligence, or investment banking sectorExperience with Looker, Tableau, or other data visualization softwareAbout the TeamAt Uber, it’s essential that we maintain a close connection with users regardless of which language they speak. With millions of published words, communicating messages across 500+ cities in 70+ countries, we need your help to ensure that each word is carefully chosen to match the tone and voice of Uber. As an early member of our Localization Team, you'll have the opportunity to build the local roots of an expanding global brand.

Name: Digital Marketing Optimization Specialist
Description: Company DescriptionDropbox is a leading global collaboration platform that's transforming the way people work together, from the smallest business to the largest enterprise. With more than 500 million registered users across more than 180 countries, our mission is to unleash the worlds creative energy by designing a more enlightened way of working. Headquartered in San Francisco, CA, Dropbox has more than 12 offices around the world.  Team DescriptionOur Marketing team sets product positioning and strategy, manages product launches, and gathers customer insights. Were responsible for maximizing our products' potential, in order to delight our users and help Dropbox grow. We partner with teams across the company, including Product, Sales, and Engineering. Role DescriptionWere looking for a Digital Marketing Optimization Specialist to guide experimentation and growth strategy for our digital marketing channels. As an optimization specialist, youll partner with channel owners to prioritize areas for improvement, create testing plans, and test your hypotheses into implementation. Youll improve our focus on results by refining how we measure our efforts across teams. You will also dive into data to provide quantified support for whole-team initiatives or recommendations for unexplored strategy areas. Your findings will have significant impact on the direction taken by individual channels and the Digital Marketing team overall. ResponsibilitiesPropose and size experiment opportunities, build A/B testing plans, and evaluate test results to help make marketing optimization decisionsCraft experimentation frameworks and processesPartner closely with analysts to better measure the success of our efforts across digital marketing channelsProvide data-based support and quantify opportunity size for major Digital Marketing initiatives and strategiesUse deep knowledge of our internal SQL database to create and advise on segmented target audiencesBe a full thought partner for marketing channel owners in driving growth in their areas Requirements2-3 years experience in growth/conversion marketing, performance marketing, or a business analytics roleA/B testing and optimization savvyAbility to write complex SQL queriesQuick learner - able to quickly capture context and analyze new parts of the businessCritical thinking - ability to break down vague problems into smaller, concrete questions and deliver recommendations to non-analytical audiencesProven experience in reactive and proactive analytical ability Benefits and Perks100% company paid individual medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage401k + company matchMarket competitive total compensation packageFree Dropbox space for your friends and familyWellness ReimbursementGenerous vacation policy10 company paid holidaysVolunteer time off Company sponsored tech talks (technology and other relevant professional topics)Dropbox is an equal opportunity employer. We are a welcoming place for everyone, and we do our best to make sure all people feel supported and connected at work. A big part of that effort is our support for members and allies of internal groups like Asians at Dropbox, BlackDropboxers, Latinx, Pridebox (LGBTQ), Vets at Dropbox, Women at Dropbox, ATX Diversity (based in Austin, Texas) and the Dropbox Empowerment Network (based in Dublin, Ireland).

Description: Company DescriptionDropbox is a leading global collaboration platform that's transforming the way people work together, from the smallest business to the largest enterprise. With more than 500 million registered users across more than 180 countries, our mission is to unleash the worlds creative energy by designing a more enlightened way of working.  Headquartered in San Francisco, CA, Dropbox has more than 12 offices around the world.Team DescriptionOur Business Strategy & Operations team sets and drives key business initiatives across the company. Name: Business Analyst
Description: Atomwise is a leading artificial intelligence (AI) drug discovery company in San Francisco, CA. We develop and use patented AI technology to help companies and universities discover and develop small molecules that will improve human health and agricultural productivity. The Partnering team is looking for a Business Analyst who will develop data-driven insights and strategies to support marketing and business development efforts. The right person will leverage their quantitative skills, knowledge of the pharmaceutical industry, and collaborative approach to guide critical decisions for Atomwise. This is an exciting position with potential for growth and advancement.  You will  Perform research to shape partnering deal structures.  Develop market research and KPIs to optimize marketing strategies.  Lead the analysis of internal Atomwise datasets to guide team priorities.  Requirements  Highly analytical and attentive to detail (an Excel guru).  A startup mindset: can-do attitude and no task is too large or too small.  Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field.  Preferred  Experience providing analytical support for decision making.  Experience in strategy consulting or an analytical role.  Knowledge of the pharmaceutical industry.  When applying, please provide  A cover letter.  A paragraph stating how your skills and experience will help the Atomwise Partnering team.  A paragraph stating how Atomwise can help you to achieve your career goals.  A resume.  Compensation & benefits  Competitive salary, commensurate with experience.  Stock compensation plan – you’ll be an Atomwise co-owner.  Platinum health, dental, and vision benefits.  401k with 4% match.  Flexible work schedule.  Great colleagues.

Name: Head of Workplace Analytics
Description: Company DescriptionDropbox is a leading global collaboration platform that's transforming the way people work together, from the smallest business to the largest enterprise. With more than 500 million registered users across more than 180 countries, our mission is to unleash the worlds creative energy by designing a more enlightened way of working.  Headquartered in San Francisco, CA, Dropbox has more than 12 offices around the world.Team DescriptionOur Office team is responsible for creating the unique Dropbox environment in our growing offices around the world. From San Francisco to Sydney, our office team locates, designs, and maintains our global campuses. Meanwhile, the Tuck Shop crew raises the culinary bar with every meal.Role DescriptionThe Real Estate & Workplace Services (REWS) team aims to delight Dropboxers, and a crucial piece of that energy comes both from daily operations and strategic initiatives. REWS strives to continually enhance and improve our global offerings. Thus, this position will focus on data analysis, metrics tracking, and reviews of key performance indicators to recommend program enhancements. This role also will disseminate this information and focus on enhanced written and visual communications for the REWS team via reports, dashboards, and repositories that serve as resources for executive leadership, the internal REWS team, and Dropboxers as a whole. The goal of these efforts are to drive constant improvement of the REWS teams performance and enhanced visibility in support of all Dropboxers.The role also supports strategic initiatives advanced by the Director of REWS and REWS leadership team to improve efficiency and Dropboxer customer satisfaction. The specific focus of this role will be to program manage these key initiatives and support global alignment while promoting efficiencies across REWS. The role will measure the ongoing success of the real estate and workplace services programs to inform required adjustments needed to re-align with evolving business needs. Reporting on program progress and success is critical. The end objective is to improve the REWS groups efficiency and effectiveness through enhanced communication, successful programs and performance measurement.The ideal candidate is passionate about solving problems and implementing innovative solutions to increase efficiency and effectiveness of the global real estate portfolio and workplace services, which provides the creative places for Dropboxers to be successful and drive the business. Responsibilities AnalyticsResponsible for data collection, aggregation and auditing to support accurate key metric reporting and analysis performed by the organization. Maps aggregate data from multiple sources to assist in creating a complete analysis, improvement and/or recommendation.Reviews accuracy of information provided to develop golden-source-of-truth data sources and responds to requests from management and partner teams.Supports development of more complex analysis (e.g. global views, market dynamics, benchmarking, etc) related to specific initiatives.Provides detailed analysis to identify and support optimization initiatives across a spectrum of real estate-related activities, including organization design, process improvement, and management practices. CommunicationsTells our story in creative, inspiring ways that resonate with our internal clients and stakeholders with both written and graphic tools.Manages communications to our internal stakeholders, including monthly reporting, surveys and information dissemination, newsletters, etc., while ensuring that a high caliber of information is consistently issued on a timely, regularly basis.Creates, manages and maintains content for our internal communications to Dropboxers including executive reporting, our team website, and company-wide presentations.Supports various team leads to enhance their documentation efforts. Program ManagementEstablishes key metrics and reporting for real estate, operations, and events to facilitate data and tool development with key stakeholders to be included into capital and operational planning.Assists in the building of programs and metrics around operational functions driven through REWS. Generate monthly reports and ongoing dashboards to show program impact and effectiveness with particular focus on the employee experience.Program manages REWS solutions to address Dropboxs global footprint and unique requirements. Assists in identifying opportunities to introduce real estate programs, support solution development, organized solution, manage team members involved and deliver results.Partners closely with space planning and workplace services leaders to understand measures of success tied to qualitative deliverables and services.Champions partnerships, internally, inter-departmentally and externally, on initiatives and collaborative methodology and program roll outs. Requirements5+ years operating in real estate consulting, management consulting, real estate or workplace operations analytics, and/or corporate workplace finance.10+ years experience total, for which a Masters degree could be credited to years of experience.Very strong communications skills and attention to detail and accuracy.Ability to present complex subjects in a clear and concise manner.High individual accountability and ownership.Skilled in Excel (and comparable tools) with ability to create pivot tables, charts, and map various data streams.Bachelors in business, finance, or real-estate related field. Benefits and Perks100% company paid individual medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage401k + company matchMarket competitive total compensation packageFree Dropbox space for your friends and familyWellness ReimbursementGenerous vacation policy10 company paid holidaysVolunteer time offCompany sponsored tech talks (technology and other relevant professional topics) Dropbox is an equal opportunity employer. We are a welcoming place for everyone, and we do our best to make sure all people feel supported and connected at work. A big part of that effort is our support for members and allies of internal groups like Asians at Dropbox, BlackDropboxers, Latinx, Pridebox (LGBTQ), Vets at Dropbox, Women at Dropbox, ATX Diversity (based in Austin, Texas) and the Dropbox Empowerment Network (based in Dublin, Ireland).

Name: Merchandise Pricing & Planning Associate
Description: The RealReal is leading the way in authenticated luxury consignment, online and in real life at our brick and mortar locations. Founded in 2011, we're growing fast and fundamentally changing the way people buy and sell luxury a multi-billion dollar industry. With a team of in-house experts who inspect every item we sell, our commitment to authenticity sets us apart and creates a foundation of trust with shoppers and consignors. Our mission to extend the lifecycle of luxury items is leading innovation in sustainable fashion. We're proud to promote the circular economy and to be the first luxury member of the Ellen MacArthur Foundation's prestigious CE100 USA.  Employees at The RealReal are dedicated, collaborative and innovative, and we're looking for exceptional talent to join our team. Build your career with us and enjoy 401K matching, health, dental and vision insurance, commuter flex spending, healthcare flex spending, generous PTO, a mother's room, flexible work hours and Friday bagels!  As a Merchandise Pricing & Planning Associate at the RealReal, you will be responsible for the development and execution of demand & pricing strategy for multiple high growth categories. The focus of the pricing and planning team is on maximizing revenue while integrating division level goals that provide a positive client experience. The ideal candidate has a proven track record of leveraging their analytical skill set, strong communication skills, creative problem solving, and strong relationship building abilities to successfully oversee a business. This person will report to the Senior Manager, Pricing & Planning Strategy. DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIESEvaluate & implement pricing strategies and models based on current business and competitive market dynamicsPerform rigorous data analysis to develop and inform demand forecasts and pricing strategies in partnership with the Merchant teamIdentify, implement, and lead coordination of educational and pricing initiatives to internal teams which requires top notch written and verbal communication skillsPerform ad hoc analysis to identify risks and opportunities and recommend courses of action to drive salesCollaborate & partner with Merchandising team on a daily basis to push the business forwardPartner with Business Intelligence, Copy Editing, Site Merchandising, and Product Management as needed on both the day-to-day and strategic projectsLeverage financial acumen to analyze and recap sales performance to inform course of action, run scenarios, and revise forecasts as necessaryREQUIREMENTSBachelor's degree or equivalent experience required3-4+ years of proven success in merchandise planning, financial planning, strategy or business analyticsVery proficient in Microsoft Office and advanced ability in Excel; experience with G Suite a plus.Strong Analytical, Merchandise Planning, Financial Modeling, & Problem Solving SkillsAbility to handle multiple work streams with proven success in analyzing large data sets related to a wide variety of business problems. Comfortable and confident making data driven recommendationsExceptional time management and organizational skillsThrives in a fast paced environment where the only constant is changeTeam player who is able to work effectively and collaboratively across multiple departments

Name: Sales Rep-San Francisco Triad CA DERM
Description: *46192BR***Responsibilities:** Lilly is bringing more innovation to the Dermatology field. This innovation will be presented to dermatologists through a sophisticated, respected and prepared sales force.  The Dermatology sales specialist is responsible for effectively handling a defined territory and focus on priority health providers in that area. The sales specialist will build preference for Lilly as a partner in Dermatology, grow customer value metric scores, meet sales targets, effectively engage customers, have business ownership mindset and effectively implement corporate strategies.  Primary Position Responsibilities (key result areas and levels of responsibility) in representing Lilly as a leader in Dermatology community and marketplace: Territory Management: + Historical track record of sales success: Strive to consistently achieve quarter-over-quarter sales growth in the territory, which results in exceeding sales expectations.  + Manage territory fundamentals of call planning, program implementation, message delivery, and customer prioritization to achieve results.  + Conduct market analysis to develop and implement territory business plans.  + Utilize strategic account based selling to achieve goals by building relationships with the total office and meeting customer needs with all members of an account.  + Identify and develop influential business relationships, with the focus on anticipating and exceeding needs, with key customers/influencers/prescribers, speakers, thought and opinion leaders, state and local advocacy groups, teaching institutions, and managed care personnel/organizations when appropriate.  + Focus on developing or building key resource and referral networks to enhance the standard of care for dermatology patients within the territory. Customer Focus: + Partner with customers to understand practice workflow and patient needs within the practice. As a business owner, provide resources and meet customer needs for disease-state information, diagnostic and patient identification resources, and product-specific support.  + Assist and coordinate with physicians and office staff through drug initiation process, device training, patient support programs, and follow-up where applicable.  + Support treatment initiation logistics where appropriate. Teamwork: + Collaborate compliantly with cross-functional partners to support positive customer and patient experiences. Disease State and Dermatology Market Knowledge: + Develop deep knowledge of dermatology industry/research, local and regional market trends, disease-state, product and competitor knowledge.  + Pursue ongoing medical knowledge development within and outside of formal Lilly training by reading industry/technical literature (e.g. articles, journals, newsletters) and attending medical conferences as requested.  + Share learning with teammates to serve as a resource within your team.  + Earn a reputation throughout the dermatology community as a subject-matter expert and a valued resource. *Req ID:**46192BR*Additional Skills/Preferences:** + Sales experience with either dermatology/immunology and/or biologics/in-office infusions  + Strong background in navigating complex accounts within integrated health systems  + Extensive experience or deep understanding of specialty pharmacy distribution model  + Ability to incorporate the ?total office? selling approach/account management  + Ability to personalize the customer approach-IQ/EQ balance  + Experience in non-sales role such as marketing, six sigma, operations, or affiliate leadership  + Quick learning agility/self-development focus  + Patient centric mindset  + Consistent record of exceeding sales expectations  + Strong business analytical skills (business/ financial acumen)  + Strong verbal and written communication skills  + Demonstrated ability to handle complexity while making the product experience simple for the customer *Additional Information:** + Live in or be willing to relocate to the area of responsibility.  + Approximately 25%-50% travel; some overnight travel may be required.  + Valid driver's license and acceptable driving record.  + Ability to provide secure and temperature controlled location for product samples may be required.  + Lilly is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status. *Workplace Arrangement:** Sales *Title:** Sales Representative-San Francisco Triad CA Dermatology *Job Category:** Sales *Basic Qualifications:** + Bachelor?s Degree  + Professional certification or license required to perform this position if required by state  + Two years of sales experience in pharmaceutical/medical field, experience calling on medical professionals, or an advanced degree in a business or science based field (e.g. MBA, Pharm D, MS).  + Qualified candidates must be legally authorized to be employed in the United States. Lilly does not anticipate providing sponsorship for employment visa status (e.g., H-1B or TN status) for this employment position. *Company Overview:** At Lilly, we unite caring with discovery to make life better for people around the world. We are a global healthcare leader headquartered in Indianapolis, Indiana. Our 39,000 employees around the world work to discover and bring life-changing medicines to those who need them, improve the understanding and management of disease, and give back to our communities through philanthropy and volunteerism. We give our best effort to our work, and we put people first. We?re looking for people who are determined to make life better for people around the world. *City:** San Francisco *Country:**USA*State / Province:** California *Region:** North America

Name: RPA Technical Lead and Architect
Description: We’re changing the way people think about transportation. Not that long ago we were just an app to request premium black cars in a few metropolitan areas. Now we’re a part of the logistical fabric of more than 600 cities around the world. Whether it’s a ride, a sandwich, or a package, we use technology to give people what they want, when they want it.  For the people who drive with Uber, our app represents a flexible new way to earn money. For cities, we help strengthen local economies, improve access to transportation, and make streets safer.And that’s just what we’re doing today. We’re thinking about the future, too. With teams working on new modalities, self-driving cars and even urban air transportation, we’re in for the long haul. We’re reimagining how people and things move from one place to the next.About the Role Uber is building its Robotic Process Automation Center of Excellence and is looking for a hands-on, details-oriented Technical lead/ Architect.  The Technology Lead / Architect is responsible for Intelligent Automation (IA) delivery oversight from a technology perspective. The role is responsible for the delivery of automations that are secure, efficient, and accurate. The role also manages hardware, software, and access related to IA. TL will also manage development team responsible for delivering the automation building the automation pipeline from a technology lens. He or She will work in collaboration with the other Technology stakeholders at Uber.  The Technical lead will report to the COE Lead. What You’ll DoIdentify, design, and implement IA technology (RPA first and then Chatbot) and creative automation solutionsManage technical resource allocation across automation deploymentsDevelop a streamlined factory model of IT infrastructure management and provisioning of application and bot account access, focusing on scalability and securityOversee hardware / software performance related to automations (e.g. infrastructure, bot monitoring, license management, change management, monitoring and metrics reporting)Facilitate deployment governance and decision making, and hand-off to business and/or managed services teamsLeverage previous exposure to wide variety of technology solutions to drive the adoption of best practices around coding, design, quality, controls, security, and performanceProvides continuous oversight to IA developers and support teams during automation delivery and operationsBuild and manage a strong team of automation developers and providing technical oversight and experience.Work with Technology Lead to build the implementation plan for RPA project and socialize with RPA Program Leadership and other stakeholders (including delivery teams)Liaise with external and internal stakeholders including senior leadership to communicate project progress, issues, risks, and solutionsWork with workforce readiness teams and production readiness teams to prepare for deployment, and facilitate final sign off with the businessFacilitate deployment governance / decision making and hand-off to business and/or managed services / operations teamsProvide oversight over switch over of the automation from Development to Production, maintaining alignment across automation initiativesWhat You’ll Need10+ years of professional experience in software development, working across both Agile and Waterfall methodologies, and with Business and Technology groupsAt least 2-3 years of experience in Robotic Process Automation (RPA) with one of the market
