Name: Heroku- Director or Senior Product Manager- Analytics
Description: Want to have a foundational role and decide the future of how Heroku uses data to build products? As the Data Analyst for the Product Team, you’ll be responsible for ensuring key stakeholders know exactly what’s going on with the business at all times. You’ll bring thought-leadership and technical expertise to build and maintain scalable reporting and self-service data exploration. You’ll work closely with the leaders of each team to understand their data needs and empower them to make critical decisions backed by data. This is a newly created role within our Product Analytics team that is designed to move fast. You’ll have the opportunity to make a huge impact as the future success of Heroku will largely depend on our ability to execute and scale operationally.ResponsibilitiesBe our go-to data expert and have a deep understanding of our data warehouse and data processing layers.Own data integrity and availability.Obtain a holistic understanding of each department’s data needs and ensure they have the proper tools to make decisions using data.Identify gaps in existing data, create data product specs, and work with Engineering teams to implement data tracking.Evangelize data knowledge and insights: lead communications with your team leads and other teams, collaborate with both technical and non-technical colleagues to complete data projects and ensure all parties can use the insights to further improve.Maintain a customer-centric focus: strive to be a domain and product authority through data, develop trust amongst your peers and leaders, and ensure that your team has access to data to make decisions.Able to prioritize and execute in ambiguous scenarios work with stakeholders and mentors to distill the problem, adapt your tools to answer complicated questions, and identify the trade-offs between speed and quality of different approaches.Build analytical frameworks to measure team success: partner with cross-functional teams to define success metrics, craft approaches to track the data and identify errors, quantify and evaluate the data, develop a common language for all colleagues to understand these critical metrics ensuring consistency of data-driven decision-making throughout the orgOperationalize data processes - provide the organization with ad-hoc analysis, automated dashboards, and self-service reporting tools so that everyone gets a good sense of the state of the businesscompetencies3+ years of experience in analytics with increasing responsibilityStrong proficiency in SQL, ETL, and data modeling in a business environment with large-scale, complex data sets.Fluency in data analysis, including defining KPIs and communicating about data to inform the success of the business and its features to a range of audiencesExpert in hands-on development with BI Platforms (Looker strongly preferred, Tableau, PeriscopeData, etc...)Comfortable giving definition to ambiguous problems. Can do this independently with limited guidance.Detail-oriented with superior organizational skills. Demonstrated ability to manage and prioritize workload and roadmaps.Analytical Toolkit - You can use different methods to analyze results, including time series analysis, experimental design, and data visualizationHealthy dose of curiosity to ask and answer questions we haven't thought aboutPosting StatementSalesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this Web site or directly to managers. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesforce.com or Salesforce.org.Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance and the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring, Salesforce will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Name: Software Engineer Intern - Summer
Description: Because you belong at TwilioThe Who, What, Where and WhyWho? This is an internship opportunity for the Summer of 2019. You will be working in a rapidly evolving and fast-paced environment, with a team that is implementing a reliable, auto-scaling, software-based telephony application stack on top of commodity cloud computing resources such as Amazon's EC2.  You should have some or all of the following: Working towards a degree in computer science, computer engineering or a related field.Love of software development with several side projects and you may even be in the open source community.A hungry entrepreneurial and "can do" spirit, as evidenced by successful interest in learning new technologies.Has experience in data processing, analytics, business intelligence, and reportingHas experience with technologies such as hadoop, spark, python, scala etc.Teams Hiring - API team is responsible for the front door of Twilio's REST API. Our services handle billions of requests a week with five 9s, 99.999%, of uptime. If you want to learn about scale, distributed systems, and love APIs you will learn a lot on this team. BillingPipeline/Billing Platform team develops infrastructure to empower Twilio products to accurately bill customers at scale. As a pay-as-you-go micro-transaction platform, our teams develop highly scalable solutions for pricing, billing, real-time usage aggregation, and other mission critical systems. Business intelligence team provides actionable insights to business units and enables fact based decision making for Twilio. We build scalable self service analytics platform that includes data ingestion, integration and transformation services developed using distributed technologies that allows us to handle rapidly growing data needs at Twilio. Cloud Orchestration owns the tools and automation around Twilio’s deployment system, automated remediation system (Lazarus), and the network service mesh. These systems allow development teams to deploy safely and easily, improve the resiliency of their systems, while keeping service-to-service communications observable, performant, and secure. Data Platform provides trusted services to move, store and analyze data, so Twilio developers can deliver products more reliably, quickly and cost effectively. Engagement Apps team is responsible for using Twilio's products to help Twilio become the best customer engagement company on the planet. If you want to improve customer interactions across the entire company globally while playing with and providing feedback on the latest and great Twilio products first, this team is for you. We're looking for a full stack engineer who is comfortable (and excited) to play with the newest products first. Growth Engineering team is responsible for helping our customers discover, sign-up and get productive on Twilio. We look across the entire company to find ways to grow Twilio's user base and utilization. This team is looking for a savvy, creative full stack engineer who is comfortable jumping into many products. Messaging Twilio is known for SMS and larger Messaging platform (read WhatsApp, Facebook etc), and as an engineer on the Messaging team you will have hands-on impact on the largest product offered to Twilio's customers. Messaging volume has increased 10x on Twilio's platform in the previous few years. Observability is part of the Platform Engineering unit: Twilio’s investment in agility. Our mission is to maximize the availability of all telemetry and event data from Twilio's globally distributed application platform. By making continuous investments in our Observability Pipeline, Twilio is able to continually improve the reliability of our services. Phone Numbers team focuses on building systems to search, buy and test millions of verified phone numbers with varied capabilities in the comprehensive inventory and the ability for customers to use their own numbers. We focus on our customers who are using 100K+ numbers in their daily business by handling over 5 billion+ http calls per month. Platform Access is part of the Platform Engineering unit: Twilio’s investment in agility. Our mission is to empower every engineer at Twilio with the ability to self-manage the IAAS aspects of their products, top to bottom. This is an opportunity to take part in some highly visible and impactful projects - reducing the time to provision cloud infrastructure from days down to seconds! Programmable Voice builds unique communication experiences with our API to build interactive voice applications, from recognizing speech to building enterprise class call centers. The Programmable Voice team develops and operates the worldwide infrastructure to make, receive and control calls including services such as Speech, Conference and Media services. Security team seeks to make Twilio the most trusted brand in communications. We develop software, systems, tools, and processes that ensure Twilio's cloud, applications, and corporate environment meet the highest security standards. Successful candidates will be challenged to deliver on projects focused on maintaining customer trust and doing security at scale. TaskRouter is one of Twilio's fastest growing products, growing >10x year over year. We solve distributed state management at a very large scale for the world’s largest contact centers: Zillow, ING Bank, Lyft, Otis Elevator, and Liberty Mutual to name a few. We’re the brains of Twilio’s top priority: Twilio Flex. You’ll be challenged with thinking at scale and how to solve large-scale distributed systems. Understand (Data Science) team builds machine learning products in the intersections of communications and NLP, focusing on conversational agents and natural language understanding and summarization. The team's mission is build platforms for developers and businesses to improve their customer experiences while increasing their operational efficiency. Web Infrastructure is a Console Platform team responsible for the front door of Twilio's Console. Our services handle all web traffic for Twilio. Our team is unique in that our services are used by Twilio customer and engineers alike. You will learn about scale, web technology, and our console platform and act as a force multiplier on this team. Wireless team builds products enabling the Internet of Things (IoT) for Twilio’s customers. We are a standalone business unit within Twilio, meaning you can work on everything from API design, scalability and big data to collaborating with customers on new IoT offerings. We are looking for someone that want to make an impact on one of Twilio’s fastest-growing products, and a dent in the universe. What? As a Software Engineer Intern you will experience the following - Be a Software Engineer, not just an "intern".Ship many different projects during your summer.Engineers at Twilio solve problems in distributed computing, real-time DSP (audio processing), virtualization performance, distributed messaging, busses and more.During your internship, you will be given responsibility for core features and services that ship to our users.You will be expected to embrace these challenges, learn fast and deliver great results.You will bring the willingness to learn and grow and we will reciprocate with ample opportunity to do just that, in a friendly, fun and exciting startup environment!Learn to develop beautiful and profitable applications.Demonstrate consistent improvement in your coding skills, issue-tracking and source control systems, and agile development mentality.Participate in code reviews, bug tracking and project management with the rest of the Twilio Team.Why? Twilio is a company that is empowering the world’s developers with modern communication in order to build better applications.  Twilio is truly unique; we are a company committed to your growth, your learning, your development and your entire employee experience. We only win when our employees succeed and we're dedicated to helping you develop your strengths. We invest in weeks dedicated to tackling hard problems and creating your own ideas. We have a cultural foundation built on diversity, inclusion and innovation and we want you and your ideas to thrive at Twilio. Come join us. About us: Twilio's mission is to fuel the future of communications. Developers and businesses use Twilio to make communications relevant and contextual by embedding messaging, voice and video capabilities directly into their software applications. Founded in 2008, Twilio has over 650 employees, with headquarters in San Francisco and other offices in Bogotá, Dublin, Hong Kong, London, Madrid, Mountain View, Munich, New York City, Singapore and Tallinn. Twilio is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, gender, gender identity, parental or pregnancy status, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or Veteran status and operate in compliance with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

Name: Architect – Hyperion Planning
Description: Careers at TopDown ConsultingArchitect – Hyperion PlanningLocation: United States – Multiple LocationsOverview:The Hyperion Planning (HP) Architect will provide an expert consultative component in our customer’s ongoing efforts to expedite the ROI, and maximize the effectiveness of their Enterprise Performance Management (EPM) and Business Intelligence (BI) solutions. In this role you will act as a business solution or technical systems leader to our client base, creating EPM and BI visions and solutions leveraging Oracle Hyperion tools.A Hyperion Planning Architect has broad and deep expert product knowledge with EPM and BI solutions, has a track record of successful, large implementations, and is capable of creating and documenting estimates, designs, and plans for complex projects. In addition, an Architect is a thought leader in the industry and participates in marketing initiatives that promote the company’s brand through various types of social media and industry conferences.As an employee of a virtual company, the Architect must be self-sufficient and proactive in managing their work, while maintaining appropriate communication and escalation to TopDown management. They should be able to work both independently and as part of a team, and be committed to continuously improving TopDown’s operations and profitability.Key Duties and Responsibilities:Responsible for designing, creating, documenting, and implementing scalable solution and implementation plans.Provides technical expertise and hands on implementation work during critical project milestones.Leads presales activities as needed to develop solution offerings and presentations, and to demonstrate, present, and explain our services offerings to prospective clients.Has a deep understanding of TopDown’s engagement methodology, core values, attitudes, business ethics, etc., and actively promotes them with other staff.Mentors and develops staff through coaching, recruiting, teamwork, self-directed learning and mentoring, and may also be responsible for managing medium engagement teams (up to 10 individuals).Assists in presales efforts to explain our services offerings to prospective clients.Identifies opportunities for additional TopDown consulting services.Requirements:This role requires a good attitude, strong business ethics, an analytical mind, the ability to think on your feet, and excellent customer skills.Bachelors or Master with 8+ years related work experience.Experience with planning, forecasting, and financial accounting processes.Possesses excellent presentation and communication skills and the ability to gain the confidence of business executives.Served in a leadership role on at least five Planning implementations utilizing related tools: Hyperion Planning (HP), Hyperion Essbase, Business Rules, Calculation Manager (CM), Essbase Load Rules, Essbase Calculation Scripts, MaxL, Data Relationship Management (DRM), Enterprise Performance Management Architect (EPMA), Oracle Data Integrator (ODI), Hyperion Application Link (HAL), Financial Reports (FR), SmartView, etc.Willingness to travel up to 100%.

Name: Engineering Manager, Analytic Applications
Description: Welcome to Planet. We believe in using space to help life on Earth. Planet designs, builds, and operates the largest constellation of imaging satellites in history. This constellation delivers an unprecedented dataset of empirical information via a revolutionary cloud-based platform to decision-makers in commercial, environmental, and humanitarian sectors. We are both a space company and data company all rolled into one.  Customers and users across the globe use Planet's data and machine learning-powered analytics to develop new technologies, drive revenue, power research, and solve our world's toughest challenges.  As we control every component of hardware design, manufacturing, data processing, and software engineering, our office is a truly inspiring mix of experts from a variety of domains.  We have a people-centric approach toward culture and community and we are iterating in a way that puts our team members first and prepares our company for growth.  Join Planet and be a part of our mission to change the way people see the world. The Role: As the Engineering Manager for Analytics Applications team at Planet, you will be championing the conception, development and deployment of new applications that use of Planet's unique earth observation data set to address the needs of our growing customer base. This can range from developing examples that demonstrate the power of Planet Analytics, like identifying the number of new oil well pads built each week in the Permian Basin, to more complex analytics applications that relate information derived from imagery to phenomena occurring on the earth's surface, like modeling crop yields from radiometric response of certain wavelengths of light recorded in Planet's imagery.  You will be coordinating activity, technical requirements, and resources for the Engineering team in collaboration with other customer-facing teams, and will hence report into the Analytics Engineering organization. You will also work with the Product team and Global Customer Success teams to collect customer requirements, coordinate schedules and set development priorities.  This position is located at Planet HQ in San Francisco, CA. Responsibilities:Ensure success of prototyping projects working with Technical Sales LeadsEnsure use of good engineering principles in development of prototypes/demosWhere possible, ensure Planet products and features are used in prototypesProvide excellent feedback to core engineering team from prototyping projects and early analytics engagementsCoordinate project team resourcing with relevant Engineering ManagersManage lifecycle (maintenance, transition to core eng, or decommissioning) of prototypesExplore modeling of relationships between data derived from imagery and phenomenon happening on the surface of the earth (e.g. relationship between NDVI and crop yield; relationship between shipping traffic and economic activity; relationship between parking lot car counts and consumer spending)Provide input and feedback to core engineering team on key components of the Platform for AnalyticsMust Haves:Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or equivalent combination of technical education and work experience.6+ years of industry experience, including 2+ years as a manager responsible for a software engineering team.Proven track record of delivering high-quality customer facing deliverables using agile development methodologies.Experience with developing and maintaining cloud-based machine learning powered productsExperience working directly with customers to understand requirements.Experience with software/system design, and software development and deployment best practices.Ability to successfully manage and organize multiple parallel projects and priorities.Knowledge of industry standard data science tools and techniques.Knowledge of deep learning methodologies on imagery and time series data.Outstanding communication and facilitation skills, in both local and globally distributed teams.Nice to Haves:Familiarity with geo-spatial data, satellite imagery, and remote sensing.Some press about us: Our CEO, Will Marshall's TED Talk  "Tiny Satellites ushering in the New Space Revolution" Bloomberg Businessweek  "The All-Seeing Eye in the Sky video" Bloomberg Businessweek video  "Planet And Rocket Lab Create Mission Patch To Honor Women In Aerospace" Planet Blog Join Us: Planet is headquartered in San Francisco, California, Earth. If you are feeling inspired, check out our website www.planet.com/careers and apply. Be sure to include a cover letter to let us know why you think you'd be a good fit and feel free to mention anyone you have previously worked with at Planet. We are committed to building a diverse team and encourage applications from people of all backgrounds.

Name: Director, Consultant Relations
Description: DayTwo is seeking a Director of Consultant Relations to drive our early stage consulting and sales growth in the areas of health managements and employee benefits at Fortune 500 companies, and with major benefits consultancies. Drawing on a strong understanding of the healthcare marketplace, business, and international healthcare systems, this highly motivated individual, is responsible for formulating strategies to directly develop, define, negotiate and close key partnership deals across the U.S. This role will rely heavily on your ability to bring your network and healthcare experience to craft effective working relationships, with the ultimate goal of establishing DayTwos product pipeline of microbiome-based diagnostics and therapeutic solutions as the preferred choice in leading healthcare organizations.Relationships-driven and mission-oriented, this leader will build strong relationships with a consultative sales mindset. Possessing a strong understanding of the healthcare marketplace, this sales leader will identify and secure new business opportunities and partnerships with various players in the space, specifically targeting employee benefits consultants and leverage key consultant relationships. Initially, this will be an individual contributor role; however, this individual will have the opportunity to build and lead a team of strategic account executives as DayTwo continues to scale and grow its business across the U.S. DayTwo is in an exciting, growth phase, and the Director should be excited about evolving with the organization and continuing to grow professionally and personally.ResponsibilitiesWork in conjunction with the COO to establish short and long term Go-To-Market strategy to develop and execute comprehensive sales initiatives for the healthcare marketplaceIdentify healthcare providers and influencers, assess and develop new market initiatives, and analyze business opportunities to strengthen, expand and drive market penetration, along with strong channel partnership effortsRapidly build a sales pipeline that can support a sustainable sales targetDevelop and cultivate high level executive relationships with assigned prospects Act as advisor on marketing and branding initiatives Coordinate across consultant channels in building relationships and awareness of solutionsDirect implementation of comprehensive programs and oversee vendors for continuous process improvementConsult with clients to formulate solutions for employer-based wellness and health management programs Negotiate best practice contract termsUnderstand target customers business needs, leveraging consultative skillset to develop customized proposalsScope proposals to ensure appropriate levels of and accounting for consultant engagement, services, and deliverablesWhat You Bring To The Team10+ years of commercial experience in business development or sales in healthcare, corporate wellness and/or industry and successful experience in developing long-term, relationship based, complex, consultative solutionsBachelors Degree requiredProficiency in healthcare and market knowledge to develop and implement sales/marketing business plans to establish new partnerships in order to execute strategies for growthHave experience calling into and setting meetings with leaders at payers, including health plans and large self-insured employersExisting relations with field consultant professionals at healthcare and employee benefits consultants Proficiency in business analytics in order to forecast growth opportunities including excel and CRMs (Salesforce preferred)Strong executive presence; ability to build relationships at different levels of customer organizations from C-level to mid-level managersProven business development experience in cultivating and nurturing key relationships and ability to communicate and execute strategy consistent with client needsStrong communication and negotiation skillsTravel as required - In addition to face-to-face meetings at consultant offices, travel may include industry conferences and DayTwo-hosted eventsAmbitious, high energy individual with experience in start-ups or fast-paced, highly entrepreneurial environmentsBenefits & PerksCompetitive compensationStock OptionsHealth, dental, and visionPaid Time OffOnsite gymWalkable to BART

Name: Business Analyst - CEO Support, Chemical Industry
Description: Connell Brothers Co. (CBC) is seeking a top-notch Business Analyst in San Francisco.Someone ready to hit the ground running with confidence, exceptional communication skills, and a keen ability to listen and respond appropriately. Our team is a highly collaborative one that thrives on the ability to offer strong support to the organization. We are looking for someone (preferably) with an MBA and a minimum of five years' experience as a Business Analyst or related position.Connell Brothers Company (CBC), a division of Wilbur-Ellis Company, is among the largest and most highly respected international marketers and distributors of industrial chemicals, minerals and food ingredients in the Pacific Rim. With a keen focus on customer support and quality control, we supply specialty chemicals, agricultural and engineering products, and ingredients for food and consumer products. CBC provides complete supply chain management from transportation and documentation to warehousing, sales and distribution through locations strategically located throughout Asia. Company Description:  Connell Brothers Co. (CBC) is the largest marketer and distributor of specialty chemicals and ingredients in the Asia-Pacific region, with over 100 years of industry experience.In our extensive network across 48 locations in 18 countries, big-business resources meets small business agility. With our intimate market knowledge and our creative approach, CBC provides our business partners with unlimited opportunities to grow their businesses.  CBC provides its customers with the highest caliber technical expertise and the most extensive network in Asia. The company's technical staff offer not only practical expertise but also international business experience and strong knowledge of local markets and cultures. Acting as a single point of contact for sourcing and supplying products, CBC provides complete supply chain management from transportation, documentation, warehousing, and sales and distribution through its multiple locations.  Our main markets are in Life Sciences for Food and Nutrition, Personal and Home Care, Pharmaceuticals, Consumer Products. Industrial Solutions covers specialty markets for Coatings, Construction, Adhesives and Sealants, Inks, Plastics, Rubber, Lubricants and Enzyme Solutions.  CBC is headquartered in San Francisco, is a division of Wilbur-Ellis Company. Wilbur-Ellis, is a leading US privately-held, family-run international distribution business with sales of $4 billion. For more information about our company, please visit our website www.connellbrothers.com General Purpose and Scope of Position:  We are seeking an experienced Business Analyst who can gather important company data and compile it into reports that shareholders and senior management can use. This individual will work closely with the CBC President on projects related to strategic planning, business plans and business results analysis. Our ideal candidate has the ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously and translate business data into digestible information that will be used to understand and manage the business. This individual should be able to take charge of a project and see it to completion with minimal supervision.  This position offers the candidate an exciting opportunity to work on a day-to-day basis with the President to manage the business and ensure it achieves its strategic goals and objectives. Key Responsibilities & Deliverables:Provide business support to the CEO.Prepare reports and PowerPoints for senior management and board presentations.Track decisions at meetings, make sure appropriate individuals are assigned follow-up tasks and that the tasks are accomplished.Identify, analyze, and monitor topics that affect company revenues, profitability, and other key performance measures. Use data and findings to create straightforward, understandable tables, graphs, and written reportsIdentify key market trends and issues. Draw from Country Managers, Regional Marketing Heads and industry sources to collect data about customers, competitors, and market conditions for analysis and interpretation.Monitor the impact of company initiatives and plans on sales and profitability.Lead ad-hoc projects as appropriate.Key Personal Attributes Include:High integrity and ethical standards, and an excellent role model for the organizationStrategic and analytical thinker with strong business acumenPractical in approach, strong problem-solving abilities with good organizational skillsSelf- motivated, results orientated with high drive and need for achievement.Strong interpersonal and communication skills with ability to establish relationships across organization levels, both internally and externallyStrong business partnership ability and customer/market focused.Resilient, resourceful and optimisticWilling to seek input, adaptable and flexibleAbility to prioritize and make decisionsWilling to engage and accept responsibilityCultural appreciation, understanding and respectful of diversityPositive and can-do attitudeKey Skills & Abilities Include:University degree, MBA preferred.Minimum 8 years of working experience in business administration, marketing, or project management. Experience and knowledge in Chemistry are highly desired. Financial analysis skills are also valuable.Insight and interest in international business trends, particularly in Asia PacificExperience with strategic planning and forecastingStrong analytical skills. Adept at using Excel for analysisBusiness and marketing analysis skills including the ability to interpret information with insight and intelligence.Strong written and oral communication skills.Ability to work effectively in teams, diverse group, international cultures, and new environments.Fluency in EnglishTravel Requirements:Willingness to travel up to 20% of the time.Compensation and Benefits:Competitive annual salary (to be determined based on experience and other factors)Comprehensive employee health and retirement benefit offeringsRelocation reimbursement is not includedIf you are an internal Wilbur-Ellis employee, please notify your manager prior to applying for any position. Thank you!COMPANY CULTURE - (CBC is a division of Wilbur-Ellis Company) Wilbur-Ellis is a company you can be proud to call your employer Wilbur-Ellis markets and distributes agricultural products, animal feed and specialty chemicals and food ingredients. A privately held and consistently profitable company, we employ more than 4,000 people throughout North America and Asia-Pacific. Wilbur-Ellis is for and about people Wilbur-Ellis has enjoyed over ninety-three years of success and growth, all thanks to our people. Our employees are both leaders and team players who thrive on creativity, entrepreneurial spirit and a dedication to quality work, our customers and each other. Wilbur-Ellis invests in the industry's best workforce Wilbur-Ellis invests heavily in our employees by offering skill development and training, competitive compensation and benefits and a tradition of promoting from within for a broad range of career opportunities. And we foster a supportive, people-first work environment.

Name: Senior Marketing Manager, QuickBooks Online Payroll
Description: OverviewIntuit is the global leader in financial management software. We are pioneering the shift to cloud computing for consumers, small businesses and those that serve them. We are rethinking how we can impact customer’s financial lives so profoundly they would never go back to the old way. This means dramatically rethinking how we can enable small businesses to run their businesses with confidence, and save time by using both our cloud solutions and our partners.  Ever wanted to know what it’s like to rebuild the plane while it’s flying? Come join the Payroll team at QuickBooks, a cross-functional team of folks passionate about making life easier on the millions of small business owners who are creating jobs for millions of others. The changing macro landscape with freelancers and contractors booming is just one of the key trends fueling this team’s charter for massive and rapid innovation, from monetization strategy to global expansion. If you lay awake thinking there has to be a better way to empower small business owners to manage their teams and power the global economy, come join us. We are a highly cross-functional, high-priority team that is humbly driven to bring the best ideas to life in a big way.ResponsibilitiesThe QuickBooks Online Payroll team is seeking a rock star Senior Marketing Manager to deliver disruptive experiences in the SMB payroll space, dramatically growing customer acquisition. As a Senior Marketing Manager, QuickBooks Online Payroll, you will: Drive consideration and conversion improvement within our largest acquisition channel by analyzing the end-to-end funnel; defining hypotheses to improve at various points of drop-off; and coordinating and executing iterative test plans across a variety of touch points including in-product and in digital marketing channelsDrive disruption in the current presentation and delivery of the product portfolio, pricing and promotional strategyPartner deeply with digital, sales, franchise, partnerships and CMC teams to create awesome end-to-end customer experiences that are integrated across a variety of online and offline channels (e.g., web, search, in-product, direct response, sales, care)Understand drivers of customer choice across our portfolio of offerings and improve mix towards highest value offeringsDrive disruption in the current presentation and delivery of the product portfolio, pricing and promotional strategyPartner closely with a tight-knit cross-functional team spanning marketing, product, design, business development, analytics, finance and strategy teamsContribute significantly to the development and execution of the 1- and 3-year marketing strategy and plans.Actively analyze business data to generate insights and make informed decisions that drive business results QualificationsAt least 10 years of business experience leading complex, cross-functional projects to successful executionComfortable analyzing diverse sets of data to develop insights; experience with quantitative data analysisAbility to prioritize and make strategic choices, specifically narrowing from a range of opportunities to highest-impact near-term leversComfortable making difficult tradeoff decisions based on data and gutInfluences across teams to get things done, consistently communicates and influences across all levels up to Executive and across multiple functions to achieve resultsBias for actionStrong creative problem-solving and analytical skillsExcellent verbal, written, visual/presentation and interpersonal communication skillsStrong results orientation and decision making skillsDetail-oriented, sweating the details to deliver awesome

Name: Investigations, Disputes & Risk Director
Description: Investigations, Disputes & Risk Director  The Investigations, Disputes and Risk Director position is located in our San Francisco office and mainly supports the Financial Advisory Services ("FAS") practice. The FAS practice applies financial, economic, and data analysis expertise and experience to assist our clients address their critical issues. The qualified candidate will work closely with AlixPartners' senior economists and experts to address complex issues in economics, finance, statistics, and econometrics associated with commercial litigation, business performance, and investigations. Examples of our services include: Litigation Support and ValuationExpert reports and testimonyEconometric methods and statistical modelingFinancial damage analysisMerger simulations, market definitionBusiness AnalyticsApplication of economic concepts and econometric analysis within corporate settings.Improvement of business performance using economic models, tools, and reasoning.Integration of economic theory and applied analytics to address corporate problems.Development of tools and dashboards for use by business management.Responsibilities:Draft written reports.Communicate with clients and colleagues in written and oral form.Review and summarize materials produced in litigation matters such as depositions, financial statements, and client data.Prepare presentation materials.Perform quality control reviews over work product.Generate and manage large and complex data sets.Formulate hypotheses relevant for the issues being addressed.Apply statistical analysis.Develop and run econometric models in Stata, SAS, R, and/or other statistical programs.Organize documents and work papers, including the preparation of supporting materials for expert reports and other deliverables.Use client data to develop actionable recommendations within a variety of functional areas.Develop and assess business projections and forecasts.Minimum Qualifications:A Master's degree or higher in finance, economics, statistics, mathematics, or other quantitative fields.Minimum of 5 years of experience working in a professional services firm providing dispute and litigation servicesStrong project management skills including the ability to manage multiple tasks, self-prioritize tasks and meet deadlines.Specialization in industrial organization, applied econometrics, applied microeconomics, financial economics, and quantitative methods preferred.Strong technical economics training and economic reasoning skills.Well-developed analytical abilities.Ability to prepare econometric models and perform statistical analysis.Proficient in Stata, SAS, R, and/or other statistical programming languages.A professional demeanor with advanced communication and presentation skills.Ability to work well with others in a team environment, as well as independently with an entrepreneurial attitude.Ability and willingness to travel domestically and internationally, sometimes on short notice and for extended periods of time.Ability and willingness to maintain a flexible work schedule in order to meet client needs.Ability to work well under pressure.Desire and interest to meet new people and network socially.A positive and energetic attitude. Name: Consultant – Hyperion Planning
Description: Careers at TopDown Consulting  Consultant – Hyperion Planning Location: United States – Multiple Locations Overview: A Oracle Hyperion Planning Consultant has hands-on knowledge with Oracle Hyperion EPM and BI solutions and has a track record of successful implementations. A Oracle Hyperion Planning Consultant has successfully completed core product training, completes the implementation work assigned in a timely manner, and is able to assist in validating the requirements and design of the solution. A Consultant is able to perform the routine and non-routine activities in each area of responsibility independently, with minimal coaching and supervision.  This position will provide an integral consultative component to our customers’ ongoing efforts to expedite the ROI, and maximize the effectiveness of their Oracle Hyperion Enterprise Performance Management (EPM) and Business Intelligence (BI) solutions. In this role you will act as a key interface from TopDown Consulting to our client base.  As an employee of a virtual company, the Consultant must be self-sufficient and proactive in managing their work, while maintaining appropriate communication and escalation to TopDown management. They should be able to work both independently and as part of a team, and be committed to continuously improving TopDown’s operations and profitability. Key Duties and Responsibilities:Work with clients on scoping specific projects, and then work with the client to produce measurable results.Assist with designing, building and testing client applications.Determine information requirements and reporting needsDocumenting project activities.Communicate personal and project status to TopDown and Client managementBecome intimately familiar with TopDown’s engagement methodology and service offerings, as well as the partner solution offerings within their respective practice.Assist in presales efforts to explain our services offerings to prospective clients.Identify opportunities for additional TopDown consulting services.Requirements: This role requires a good attitude, strong business ethics, an analytical mind, the ability to think on your feet, and excellent customer skills. MBA or Bachelors with 3-7 years related work experience.Experience with planning, forecasting, and financial accounting processes.Excellent presentation and communication skills, both written and verbal.Hands-on participation in at least one Planning implementation utilizing related tools: Hyperion Planning (HP), Hyperion Essbase, Business Rules, Calculation Manager (CM), Essbase Load Rules, Essbase Calculation Scripts, MaxL, Data Relationship Management (DRM), Enterprise Performance Management Architect (EPMA), Oracle Data Integrator (ODI), Hyperion Application Link (HAL), Financial Reports (FR), SmartView, etc.Willingness to travel up to 100%.

Name: Senior Manager, Analytics - Entertainment and Media Industry Opportunity
Description: Company DescriptionUbisoft is composed of over 14,000 talented people located in 5 continents across the globe. With more than 80% of our teams dedicated to creation, Ubisoft is the biggest in-house creative force in the industry.  The companys 40+ different creative studios work hand-in-hand each day to deliver rich and innovative gaming experiences that reflect the creativity and diversity of their teams. This cross-studio collaboration model means every team member has the opportunity to participate in challenging projects based on iconic brands including Assassin's Creed, Tom Clancy's Rainbow Six Siege, Tom Clancy's The Division, For Honor, Rabbids, Rayman, Watch Dogs, Far Cry, The Crew, Just Dance and more.  With an expansive global distribution network, Ubisoft is also a company that stays in close contact with its local fans. Job Description Ubisoft, a global leader in the video games and entertainment industry, is seeking a Senior Manager, Marketing Analytics to build and lead a team focused on Brand, Media, Digital and Web analytics.  This person will be a high-performing individual with an analytical mind and strong interpersonal and communication skills. The ideal candidate is a self-starter who can manage their time effectively and educate themselves while contributing to marketing investments performance. Responsibilities: Partner with marketing leaders across Brand, Media, and owned Digital channels to create a comprehensive measurement framework for key franchises  Collaborate with business intelligence team to maintain a marketing data warehouse by providing clear requirements and timely data validations.  Develop robust analytic processes to frame campaign expectations, inform decision-making, and recommend marketing strategies  Implement solutions to measure and optimize the impact of marketing activities on sales and user engagement  Manage a team of media and brand analysts supporting specific brands (games) and media channels (e.g. web) lead ongoing projects, ad hoc analysis, and insight generation\  Synthesize data from various sources to deliver actionable insights and codify learnings as best practices  Work closely with marketing teams and agencies to define key performance metrics, create and maintain reports and identify trends and opportunities across media, social and web activities Qualifications Bachelor degree in a technical or quantitative discipline (Mathematics, Economics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering), Masters preferred; MBA a plus  Minimum 7 years of professional related experience, including management responsibilities  Strong quantitative skills, and experience utilizing scientific analytic methods, qualitative methods, and quantitative analysis techniques, as well as predictive modeling  Demonstrated success presenting complex qualitative and quantitative research data in a clear and compelling manner that inspires action  Excellent organizational, communication and interpersonal skills  In depth knowledge of SQL, Tableau and Excel. Experience in programming and with R or comparable statistical modeling tool is a plus  Experience creating and maintaining a data warehouse is a plus  Experience with ad serving platforms (e.g. Double Click) and CRM solutions is a plus Additional Information Ubisoft is committed to creating an inclusive work environment that reflects the diversity of our player community. We are an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age or disability status.

Name: Senior Solution Design Technical Lead, Data Services
Description: The Data Services Solution Design Technical Lead will be responsible for developing and maintaining complex technology data solutions for the enterprise. Responsibilities include interfacing with IT, Enterprise Architecture, Enterprise Data Governance, Business and Vendor partners to understand and influence requirements and technical solutions and support of technical solutions built by vendors and BSC resources. Coming in with an understanding of the importance of end-to-end data management and data integration methodologies and strategies.  Responsibilities:  Lead design and development activities on concurrent and future complex data initiatives with multi-source systems and deliver high quality integrated data hub. Provide technical leadership in designing and implementing large-scale, complex enterprise applications requiring high performance and availability. Be able to synthesize complex data/information and lead complex technical implementations. Ability to matrix manage/organize others with the IT organization in order to get work done quickly. Experience in a large, complex organization or corporate structure environment required. Consults and makes recommendations to management on significant issues.  • 10 hands-on design, coding, integration, and deployment experience in enterprise data applications.  • Extensive experience in database management and data integration bulk/batch/real-time load strategies and analytical concepts.  • Expert in one or more of the database and database appliances in use in BSC (Oracle, MS SQL Server, IBM Puredata (Netezza), MySQL), SQL, ETL, ELT, Shell Scripting and procedural languages.  • Strong knowledge of data, big data management, data warehouse and data virtualization design patterns.  • Experience working with multiple Data Integration, Master Data Management, Data Reconciliation, Data Governance, Data Quality and Data Virtualization tools like Informatica PowerCenter, IBM Infosphere MDM, Infogix Assure, Informatica Data Quality, and Denodo.  • Strong technical understanding of data modeling, data mining, data integration, data architecture, data warehousing and data quality techniques.  • Experience in programming languages like Java, Python, R preferred.  • Good understanding of SOA and web services architectural patterns.  • Knowledge of business intelligence and analytical tools like Business Object, Tableau, SAS is preferred.  • Strong ability to analyze business requirements and transform into technical design and system solutions.  • Experience to assess the current state and identify opportunities for improvement aligning with current technology trends and strategic plans.  • Experience in understanding requirements, preparing technical solution design documents, process, and data flow diagrams.  • Ability to effectively communicate status, design, and approach to management/business sponsors/product managers.  • Familiar with standard software development tools, including incident tracking, version control, documentation and testing systems.  • Self-directed works with limited management direction and exercises considerable latitude in determining technical objectives of the assignment.  • Experience with iterative development life cycle methodologies and application of those principles, especially agile development practices.  • Ability to build strong relationships and drive alignment on difficult topics.  • Demonstrated experience working with vendor partners, cross-functional and development teams in terms of end to end technical delivery.  • Strong analytic, process flow, problem-solving, communication, customer service, organization skills, required.  Education:  • BS or MS in Computer Science, Electronic Engineering or equivalent experience

Name: Principal, Analytics Business Development
Description: Job DescriptionWe work with the worlds best brands to provide end to end process transformation that delivers improved results businesses can see, and improved experiences customers can feel. Our mission is to help our clients maximize their customer lifetime value and increase their competitive advantage by helping drive productivity and efficiency while delivering measurable results.  Our world-class innovative and analytics-driven business solutions include digital transformation services, such as research and design studios, analytics and consulting, in addition to IT services, customer engagement services, and business process transformation services, such as intelligent automation, F&A and procurement solutions.  We are a unique Big Data analytics solutions provider that helps leading organizations achieves positive, high-impact business outcomes through the delivery of continuous and context-sensitive predictive insights. Our analytics platform enables faster, scalable and intuitive development and application of predictive insights by business users. Our solutions are built as dynamic predictive apps targeted to optimize specific business problems across a given business process.  Our predictive solutions power smarter marketing for effective customer acquisition, retention, and lifetime value growth leading to enhanced customer equity and profitable growth. Responsibilities The DBD directs business development and sales activities with prospective clients and is accountable for the client relationship from deal conception to closing. Responsible for selling Advanced Analytics (predictive) Products with a focus on generating new business and growing revenue.  Our Sales team helps the clients to architect future state operating models, enhance service operations, and maximize the value from our engagement.  This individual leverage his/her domain, technical, digital and operational business knowledge to create demand and persuade prospective clients through the development and presentation of compelling value propositions and purchasing rationales.  The DBD will thoroughly understand the prospective clients business, both strategic and tactical, including themes and underlying issues, and will align our current and future capabilities to create client opportunity and solve business problems.  Experience and Competency Requirements Develop and implement strategic sales plans and forecasts to achieve corporate sales objectives > $x M in new sales bookings each quarter for our analytics groupDevelop presentations, business cases and ROI models, RFQ responses, Statements of Work and other documentation as necessary in an effort to present in the context of client needs and facilitate new business Sales from Initial Contact through Contract SignatureEnsure contractual alignment and input with Support Team(s) to ensure client deliverables and timelines are met with frequent internal communication to ensure internal teams are prepared to deliver successfully for our new clientsTravel as needed to client sites to lead client meetings including incorporating appropriate resources when neededEffectively communicate our value proposition at CXO, VP and other levelsWork well with cross functional teams to be responsive to clients and advance Sales opportunities through Sales StagesCreate and update Sales forecast in sf.com to accurately reflect sales pipeline activity and ensure forecasting and fiscal revenue recognition and timing accuracyWork with business operations to create and update opportunity financial models for approval and complianceEnsure effective control of sales process and results, and take corrective action to guarantee that achievement of objectives falls within designated budgetsConstantly read and study market research and adjust sales strategy to meet changing market and competitive conditionsMonitor competitor products, sales and marketing activitiesEstablish and maintain relationships with industry and client influencersInteract with our business development team to drive relationships with key strategic partnersLead presentations to executive management at our and at clientsEstablish and maintain a consistent corporate image throughout all internal and external communicationCoordinate liaison between sales department and other sales related unitsAnalyze and control expenditures of division to conform to budgetAssist other departments to provide input into technical publications, product roadmaps, etc.Prepare bi-weekly sales report showing sales volume, potential sales, and areas of proposed client base expansionReview and analyze sales performances against quota and plan to determine the effectivenessDirect product research and developmentMaintain extensive knowledge of product features, functionality and roadmap at business and technical levels · Remote Work Up to 40% of the time  · Travel Up to 60% of the time Must Haves:Minimum 7 years of business development experience selling into Retail, Travel or Hi-Tech clientsMinimum 3 years experience selling analytics as a service

Name: Sr. Analyst Strategy and New Business Development
Description: Job Title: Sr. Analyst Strategy & New Business Development  Duration: 6 Months  Responsible for the preparation, analysis and presentation of monthly and ad-hoc financial reports. Assist in preparation of annual budget and current and future year forecasts. Review administration of purchase requests and accounting documents. Analysis and presentation of monthly and annual fleet results/plans will also be required. Experience in accounting and finance including planning, analysis and financial reporting. A thorough knowledge of accounting and finance principles, excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to present financial analysis to management is essential. Proficiency in the use of Microsoft Excel/Word software and a working knowledge of reporting software.  JOB DESCRIPTION:  Support development of corporate deliverables including:  •Support preparation for Board of Director meetings and Quarterly Business Reviews  •Support development of annual Long Range Plan, including development of cross-functional strategies and initiatives  •Support recurring efforts to drive insights and build knowledge of key market, competitor, and consumer dynamics  Activities include:  I.Analyze competitor strategies and performance to identify threats/opportunities across channels and geographies  II.Mine consumer insights data to identify actionable opportunities for Gap Inc.  III.Support cross-functional business partners with analytic insights and problem solving  IV.Support product strategy roadmap, including monthly market share reporting. Looking for more of a strategy / analytical background  What are the Top 3-5 Skills needed to perform this role/job?:  •Strong analytical and financial modeling skillsets, experience with business case and valuation modeling, ability to work with large set of data  •Expert (beyond proficient) in both excel and PowerPoint  •Able to quickly identify key issues and develop hypotheses • Able to work in and bring structure to ambiguous environments  •Able to synthesize disperse information into effective strategies and innovative insights, translating complex ideas into simple, actionable recommendations; strong written and oral communicator  This candidate MUST have excellent analytical skills, Excel skills, and PowerPoint skills. Investment banking background is highly preferred.  Additional Desired Skills: nimble and resourceful. We are a very small team, so need this person to be dedicated and flexible  Type of background you are looking for (education, # yrs experience, etc.): minimum 3 years of working experience from top consulting or investment banking firms; we are willing to train Athleta specific skills, not willing to spend time on training basic Excel, PowerPoint, data analytic and financial modeling skills  Software skills required: need this person to be an expert in Excel and PowerPoint  Any traits that would make a candidate NOT a good fit for the role/what you DON’T want to see on resume?: this is a heavy data analytics, financial modeling analyst position.

Name: Business Analyst, Compensation
Description: At Uber, we ignite opportunity by setting the world in motion. We take on big problems to help drivers, riders, delivery partners, and eaters get moving in more than 600 cities around the world. We welcome people from all backgrounds who seek the opportunity to help build a future where everyone and everything can move independently. If you have the curiosity, passion, and collaborative spirit, work with us, and lets move the world forward, together.  About the Role Uber is searching for a Compensation Analyst to support our fast growing population. This role will be a key contributor in the development and implementation of compensation strategies and will focus on our offers process. Our rapid expansion brings us unique challenges -- join us as we strive to innovate and create new solutions!  What Youll Do Work with recruiting and business leaders to develop offersApply your expertise in quantitative analysis, for measurement and tracking of key compensation and recruiting-related metrics to help inform, influence, support, and execute business decisionsParticipate in the research for, and ongoing development and administration of new hire compensation programs that matches Ubers needsDevelop and update quantitative models to assess compensation practice and competitive positionBuild reusable technology to scale and sustain program delivery and reusable analytics to automate insights and findingsDesign and author compensation metrics, reports, and tools to inform compensation program decisions and forecast, report, and/or analyze compensation business outcomesParticipate in the development and completion of compensation processes and initiatives such as annual compensation reviews, job performance and ad hoc analyses. Formulate recommendations regarding regular review and updates to the compensation structure.Participate in compensation surveys to collect and analyze competitive salary information to help set the company's compensation positionProduce ad hoc analyses with quick turnarounds based on business requests What Youll Need 2 years of experience in a professional, productive environment. A deep background in Compensation, Mathematics, Finance, Statistics or Economics preferred Previous experience in consulting is also a plusExperience in Excel with regard to formulas and charting. Possess superb knowledge of Word, internet and other software applicationsExcellent analytical skills are needed to effectively analyze data and create meaningful, understandable models, reports and metricsDemonstrated ability to work in a self-guided manner and within a team, conduct research, formulate conclusions and present conclusions regarding business issuesAbility to develop concise presentation decks to illustrate and communicate related information Bonus Points IfProficiency with SQL, R, and/or spreadsheet software About the Team Our success brings us unique challenges - join us as we build innovative and creative people and compensation solutions! You'll serve as a key member of the broader global People Operations team and interact regularly with the people team and business leaders. Our compensation team is currently based out of our San Francisco global headquarters.

Name: Operations Business Analyst
Description: We believe the economy is better when everyone has access. When everyone has room to grow. No one should be left out because the cost is too great or the technology too complex. We started with a little white credit card reader but haven't stopped there. We're empowering the independent electrician to send invoices, setting up the favorite food truck with a delivery option, helping the ice cream shop pay its employees, and giving the burgeoning coffee chain capital for a second, third, and fourth location. We're here to help sellers of all sizes start, run, and grow their businessand helping them grow their business is good business for everyone.  Squares Hardware Team builds the tangible connection to Square. We started with a simple and elegant Reader that turns any phone or tablet into a mobile point of sale - and we continue to lead this category with advances in chip card and NFC technology. Next, we introduced the Square Stand, the best way to turn your iPad into a countertop point of sale. Most recently, we expanded our HW portfolio with our first Android-based solution: Square Register, the first fully integrated point of sale that enables people to start selling right out of the box. As we introduce more products, we will meet the needs of more and more sellers with stand-out hardware products, globally.  You Will Bring data to help inform opportunities for operational performance improvementBuild out metrics and KPIs for HW Ops by working with business DRIsEnsure supply chain objectives are being achieved through dashboards that actively monitor performanceBe responsible for defining, developing and optimizing curated datasets with standardized metrics for consumption by the operations teamAct as the focal point for all Ops data requests and ensure that work plans are optimized for scale and speedCreate and manage said work plans, facilitate the collaboration of cross-functional teams and technical teams, own final deliverables, and measure incremental improvements through KPIsTranslate business and analytics needs into well-defined data and process requirements to supportInfluence cross-functional decision making by identifying opportunities through dataPerform ad hoc analysis, respond to insight requests and data extractions to resolve critical business issuesBe the ambassador for Hardware Operations data.You have:A strong understanding of operations and supply chain that will enable you to define and optimize metrics and improvement opportunitiesA strong track record in working with and influencing cross-functional partners and solving ambiguous problems and seeing them through to completionExperience querying relational databases (e.g. Vertica, SQL Server, Oracle, etc.) Even better if experience with SnowflakeExperience translating business goals into metrics and building dashboards and visualizations using BI tools (e.g. Tableau). Preference given for LookerDemonstrated ability to translate complex details into the big pictureEven better:Experience in consumer electronics supply chain At Square, our purpose is to empower within and outside of our walls. In order to build the best tools for the businesses and customers we support all over the world, we have to start at home with a workforce as diverse and empowered as our sellers. To this end, we take great care to evaluate all employees and job applicants equally, based on merit, competence, and qualifications. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply and always consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records, in accordance with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance. Applicants in need of special assistance or accommodation during the interview process or in accessing our website may contact us by sending an email to assistance(at)squareup.com. We will treat your request as confidentially as possible. In your email, please include your name and preferred method of contact, and we will respond as soon as possible.SDL2017

Name: Business Intelligence & Data Analyst
Description: We’re looking for intelligent, driven professionals to join our newly formed Operations Strategy & Analytics team! We are responsible for leveraging data driven insights to drive overall servicing strategy across contact channels, customer segmentation, product roadmaps, and technology investments. The ideal candidate will have strong analytical and problem solving skills, as well as interpersonal skills to work across the organization and with external partners to drive forward recommendations.What You’ll DoBuild relationships across operations to develop a robust understanding of needs and opportunities to improve visibility to key business metricsCreate robust and stable data pipelines and reporting to track portfolio performance and help ensure progress to quarterly and annual goals across the full customer lifecyclePartner with operational teams across internal sites and external vendors to develop and continuously grow our business intelligence capabilitiesAnalyze large volumes of customer interaction data to drive insightsLeverage technical solutions to continuously drive efficiency through automationMaintain a strong understanding of our evolving data warehouseContinuously working on strategic initiatives to transform the ongoing customer experience as a key competitive differentiator and scale the businessWhat We Look ForPassion and drive to disrupt the lending and financial industry for the better2+ years of experience in analytically-driven roles (analytics, business intelligence) focused around manipulating large and complex datasetsStrong working knowledge of SQL and/or experience in Python or RStrong interpersonal skills and ability to work in a team environment, cross-functionally, and with external partiesAbility to think creatively and critically and thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic, and often ambiguous work environmentA passion for finding insights in data and driving change based on those insightsAbility to communicate findings and recommendations clearly to both technical and non-technical audiencesEnough laziness to find a faster way to do your least favorite tasksHumility and team player - you go out of your way to help teammatesAffirm is reinventing credit to make it more honest and friendly. Started by PayPal co-founder Max Levchin, Affirm gives consumers the flexibility to buy now and make simple monthly payments. Unlike other credit options, Affirm offers transparent payment terms (no fees or compounding interest), and employs advanced technology to reach a broader consumer population.#LI-BS1

Name: Forecasting Analytics Manager
Description: Affirm aims to provide better financial products to improve the lives of consumers. We need an exceptional Forecasting Analytics Manager to scale operations, support our growing business and lead all planning functions and processes for all customer support teams (front office, back office, collections). The ideal candidates will have strong business acumen and judgement with the ability to lead cross functional programs/projects, build new processes, drive continuous improvements and implement technology to support new businesses, vendors and partners.What you'll need to succeedThis role requires a strong, experienced planning manager with a passion for process improvement and analyzing business data and performance metrics. The Ops Expansion and Vendor management team’s mission is to scale and simplify our operation to satisfy business needs by creating customer-focused solutions, while inspiring and enabling others to do the same. We’re focused and committed to evolving the way we outsource and insource work to scale customer support to meet our customer’s demands.As a Forecasting Analytics Manager, you will lead, manage, and own the solution to the problem statement: how do we ensure the right case goes to the right person each time, every time 24x7. You will lead staffing, growth, and productivity conversations with vendor program managers and team managers. Your projects and impact often span offices and time zone, and it's your job to keep all the players coordinated on the project's progress and deadlines. What You'll Do Lead planning and forecasting initiatives for Customer Operations teams (in-house & outsourced)Develop and maintain advanced forecasting models for key business metrics informing utilization of labor and staffing levels across in-house and outsourced teams using current trends and historical dataPartner with SalesOps, FP&A and Product Operations to ingest company wide implications for new product and merchant launches and marketing initiatives and translate that data into ops modelsManage inventory levels by word group and provide management with direction for overflow strategies, outsourcing, and reallocation of laborDrive productivity efficiencies through data insightsEstablish and utilize best methods (statistical models, processes and software tools) in creating staffing forecastsPresent planning recommendations to leadership, drive timely decisions, and ensure clear and concise communication to all XFN stakeholdersLead forecast and inventory planning meetings with FP&A, Product and Merchant Success managers, reviewing recommended staffing forecasts and goals; Prepare, report, and communicate forecast measurements to management by defending recommendations with sound models and logic What We Look For BA/BS degree in Business, Industrial Engineering, any related field (mathematics, statistics, finance, business analytics etc.) or equivalent practical experienceAdvanced SQL knowledge + experience building statistical and/or machine learning modelsAbility to collaborate across various levels of an organization, with experience in leading cross-functional process improvementsDemonstrated ability to work towards strategic business goalsExcellent analytical, problem solving and communication skillsWorking knowledge of Python, R or other scripting languagesAbout AffirmAffirm is reinventing credit to make it more honest and friendly. Started by PayPal co-founder Max Levchin, Affirm gives consumers the flexibility to buy now and make simple monthly payments. Unlike other credit options, Affirm offers transparent payment terms (no fees or compounding interest), and employs advanced technology to reach a broader consumer population.

Specifically, responsible for providing strategic oversight to pre and post-sale activities to ensure client satisfaction as well as development and growth of the relationships. As an Account Manager, you play a critical role in a team as the clients’ trusted advisor and champion. Your deep understanding of your clients’ business objectives and analytical mindset will shape future strategies through data driven insights and recommendations.
