Name: Director, Total Rewards and Organization Analytics
Description: In June 2017, Sumo Logic announced another $75M funding round led by Sapphire Ventures, with participation from new and existing investors including DFJ Growth, Greylock Partners, Sequoia Capital, and others ( https://www.sumologic.com/press/2017-06-27/75-million-funding-round/). This brings our total funding to $235.5M to date. Sumo Logic's business has scaled significantly, We have also enjoyed consistent growth in our recurring revenue and customer count to over 1,600+ customers, reflecting every major vertical and company size. Who Are We? We are a secure, cloud-native, machine data analytics service, delivering real-time, continuous intelligence from structured, semi-structured and unstructured data across the entire application lifecycle and stack. Our mission is to democratize analytics, making it accessible, simple and powerful for businesses of all sizes to build, run and secure their organizations. With Sumo Logic, customers can harness the power of machine data to gain operational business and customer insights that lead to competitive advantage and differentiated customer experience. What Do We Do? Sumo Logic was founded in 2010 by experts in log management, scalable systems, big data, and security. We imagined a world of Yottabyte-scale machine data, where machine learning algorithms and advanced analytics could make sense of it all. Today, our purpose-built, cloud-native service analyzes more than 100 petabytes of data, more than 16 million searches, and delivers 10s of millions of insights daily positioning Sumo among the most powerful machine data analytics services in the world. Our customers around the globe rely on Sumo Logic for the analytics and insights to build, run and secure their modern applications and cloud infrastructures. With Sumo Logic, customers gain a service-model advantage to accelerate their shift to continuous innovation, increasing competitive advantage, business value, and growth.  Our People Operations team is seeking to hire a Director of Total Rewards and Organization Analytics. You will provide your subject matter expertise in Compensation and Benefits to develop our Global Total Rewards function and deliver solutions that will attract, retain and motivate top talent. You'll also lead Organization Analytics and Workforce Planning to drive informed business and organizational decisions. JOB RESPONSIBILITIESa) TOTAL REWARDS Be the company expert on global compensation and benefits strategy.  Design and manage the strategic direction of the Total Rewards function ensuring it supports Sumo's values, priorities, and changing business needs.  Lead the design, build and scaling of the Total Rewards team and capabilities (comp, equity, benefits, and recognition programs) including compensation philosophy and structure, incentive plans, benefits strategy, and equity programs focused on attracting and retaining key talent across an increasingly diverse business and workforce.  Direct the management of Sumo's benefits plans globally, including reporting and analysis, design, cost management, administration, customer service, communication and vendor management.  Execute compensation management processes and implement fiscally sound base pay salary structures, variable pay plans and other employee recognition opportunities that will support Sumo's compensation philosophy.  Stay current on legislation, trends, marketplace changes, and advances and make recommendations to ensure competitiveness and compliance in all relevant markets  Work with and manage external consultants as needed.  Play a critical role on the larger HR Leadership team. b) ORGANIZATION ANALYTICS Develop strategy, build and manage an analytics model which enables data-driven decision making.  Execute a vision for the delivery of information, working with key stakeholders supporting the business with analytics and workforce planning solutions.  Via analysis, identify workforce trends and opportunities, and work with appropriate leaders and teams to develop plans. COMPETENCIESHighly adaptable, strategic and capable of solving complex business issues.Communicate effectively and can present complex materials in a clear and concise manner, using data to tell the story.Relate to and build strong, credible relationships with business leaders and employees.Strong experience in building and managing high-performing teams, coaching individuals for success and growth.A demonstrated ability to achieve goals drawing upon excellent collaboration and influencing skills.Highly regarded for extensive planning, organization and delegation abilities.Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.Positive, can-do attitude, exhibiting openness and a solution-oriented approach to resolve challenges.Exceptional responsiveness, a high sense of urgency.Outstanding team collaboration: exceptional partner with HR, finance, payroll team members to support overall needs.Demonstrated experience in proactively seeking ways to improve and streamline processes and systems.Unquestioned integrity and ethics to handle sensitive and confidential situations and information.High degree of composure: able to confidently handle challenging situations.Aptitude for critical thinking, decision-making, problem-solving.Passionate about personal development, training, learning and seeing individuals develop to their fullest potential.REQUIRED EDUCATION AND KNOWLEDGE10+ years broad-based and progressive experience designing, developing, and managing global compensation and benefits programs using state-of-the-art knowledge of current best practices.A broad global perspective and extensive knowledge in the design and implementation of best in class compensation and benefits programs within a global organization.Proven HR leadership experience and the ability to see the "broad picture" and operation strategically in all functionsGreat blend of hands-on operational and design/strategy experience.Strong experience in organization analytics and workforce planning, using data and systems to drive business and organizational decisions.Knowledge of survey administration and leveraging survey feedback along with multiple organization data points to inform organization decisions/initiatives.Solid business and external market trend acumen.Extensive experience in designing and improving operational efficiency with a high-degree of rigor and impact to support a growing global workforcePrior leadership roles working with a BOD Compensation Committee and Executive Compensation in a publicly held company.A Bachelor's Degree in Human Resources or related field required, a Master's Degree in related field is a plus.

Name: Senior Manager, Analytics
Description: Credit Karma is working to make financial progress possible for everyone. Data and analytics play a pivotal role in this mission and every part of our business – informing new product design, driving marketing efficiency, and powering the recommendations we personalize to each of our 80+ million members.We’re looking for a Senior Manager, Analytics to be the single point person for Personal Loans, our fastest growing vertical. In this high-impact, high-visibility role, you will lead a team to drive key product decisions through deep analytical insights and rigorous measurement. If you love designing tests and turning analysis into tangible business results, this role could be for you.What you’ll do:Lead a team and be responsible for their career development and growthConduct analysis and design tests to support new product launches, drive improvements to existing features, and inform the product roadmap.Have oversight into Business Intelligence and Recommendation Analytics challenges for the verticalBe a thought partner to product management and drive data-informed product decisions.Develop learning agendas and test plans to support agile, data-driven decision-making.Perform exploratory analysis to generate hypotheses, identify gaps, and size opportunities for new product featureWhat’s great about it:You’ll get to solve highly analytical problems and have a direct impact on the future of the Credit Karma product.The role is highly cross-functional, which means you get to work with product, engineering, marketing, business development, and data science.You’ll serve as an influential sounding board for product leadership and help apply a high level of rigor to decision-making.Your work will help us design better products, improve user experience, and inform overall business strategy.What we expect:8-10 years of analytics experience in a fast-paced environmentBS/MS in Business, Economics, Engineering, Math, Stats, or equivalent experienceExperience of managing people and teams requiredExperience with consumer finance/lending is a bonusAbility to problem-solve and understand key drivers of marketing effectivenessStrong SQL and Excel skills with exposure to R/PythonExperience with working with engineering/product a plusExperience with working with consumer finance a plus Great communication skills with analysts and non-analysts alike

Name: Senior Business Analyst - Insurance
Description: Blue Owl is a stealth mode Silicon Valley insurtech that is rethinking, reimagining, and re-engineering insurance from the ground up. Our goal is to challenge the industry with an innovative product and best-in-class experience. We are starting with auto insurance, using data science to prevent collisions before they happen. Our customers are excited about what we’re doing, and so are our investors. We are well-funded and nearly ready for our public launch.We are seeking a Senior Business Analyst—an experienced BA with a proven track record of delivering project success across a variety of insurance product lines and system architectures—to bring together our business requirements process across a range of projects, stakeholders, vendors and systems. As our only Senior BA, you will play a pivotal role in E2E product and feature delivery—from working with insights and design through to implementation across a number of engineering teams. You will be a decision maker and a problem solver, who can consult widely, synthesize information from multiple sources, formulate options and shepherd complex problems through to decision. In doing this, you will leverage your strong insurance knowledge and experience with insurance and digital systems. You will report to our Director - Insurance Product.This is a key early addition to our team who will be making decisions and solving problems that significantly impact our customers and our business.To date, we have assembled a team of talented engineers, data scientists, and insurance experts to prepare our product for launch. As our Senior Business Analyst, you will bridge the areas of product, underwriting, insurance, claims and technology to help our business delivery change at an ever increasing pace. You will be actively involved in feature design and business requirements, so this is a role for someone who wants to get their hands dirty in a fast-paced startup environment.Because we are in stealth mode leading up to our public launch, you won't be able to find much on us online, but you'll get all the details if selected for an interview.Primary Responsibilities:Work cross-functionally across all areas of the organization (insurance, pricing, underwriting, claims, developers, insights, legal, product, user experience designers and other subject matter experts) to obtain a well-rounded understanding of what is being asked for and our ability to deliver it within the constraints of our environment.Translates stakeholder inputs into meaningful business requirements and then on into stories that the scrum teams can deliver against.Create and maintain detailed documentation on products and processes using a wide variety of technical tools that are constantly evolving.Co-ordinate multiple streams of work at one time.Co-ordinate rollouts of features across projects and product linesLead projects and feature teamsIdentify opportunities to improve operations and processes, and deliver improvements.Be comfortable discussing project scope with all levels of an organization.Additional responsibilities as assigned.Experience, Skills, and TraitsExcellent analytical skills.Superior stakeholder management and relationship building skills.Solutions focusedBe able to execute the role with a high degree of independence and flexibility.Clear communicator who can have the harder conversations when warranted.Solid project management understanding - managing dependencies, risks and timelines is in your DNA - be able to plan ahead across complex multi-project deliverables.Continuous improvementKnowledge of Registry Systems/Policy Administration Systems, eg Guidewire, EIS or similar.QualificationsBachelor’s Degree in Technology, Engineering, Business/Economics, Science or Mathematics or similar fieldsProven experience in analyst rolesInsurance experience essential - auto, home, life, otherBenefits & Position Details100k - 120k base salary, depending on qualificationsGreat work/life balance with a comprehensive benefits program designed to help you and your family thrive. Medical, dental, catered daily lunch, and gym membership included.Fun, high-energy, results-oriented work environment and a flexible schedule in a mission-driven organization.Role based in our downtown San Francisco office. Locals preferred, but relocation considered for outstanding candidates.BlueOwl, LLC is an equal opportunity workplace and affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Name: Director - Customer Data & Growth Analytics
Description: Our past is full of iconic moments but our future is going to spark many more. We're looking for the people who'll help make our next decade just as revolutionary as our first five. If you're one of the super-talented who thrive on change, aren't afraid to take risks and love to make a difference, you're the right fit. Come grow with us.The Customer Data and Analytics organization is a critical component of the Customer and Strategy Team at Gap Inc. This team is chartered with unlocking the power of customer data and analytics to drive customer obsession across Gap Inc. Additionally, this organization is responsible for building the Customer Data and Analytics Platform on behalf of the entire organization in partnership with GapTech.  Reporting to the Senior Director Decision Support and Analytics, the Director, Customer Data & Growth Analytics is focused on leveraging customer data and analytics methods to drive customer and business outcomes for key stakeholders across the Banana Republic brand. Decision Support AnalyticsPartner with key stakeholders specifically within the Banana Republic brand to leverage customer data and analytics to drive customer and business outcomesPerform analytics and leverage existing internal analytical tools to improve decision making and customer strategy development for key stakeholders across the Banana Republic brandBuild and manage delivery of a roadmap for customer data science and analytics to support the key growth initiatives for the Banana Republic brandProactively identify opportunities to evolve the customer data and analytics roadmap based on needs of key stakeholdersTalent DevelopmentWhile this is initially an individual contributor role, there will be the opportunity to develop and mentor other members of the Decision Support and AnalyticsKey Experiences:7+ years of experience in customer analytics5+ years of building and leading high performing teamsDeep knowledge of retail and ecommerce customer domains requiredStrong business acumen, and superior written, verbal and presentation skillsAble to deliver near-term wins while building towards a larger strategic visionProficient in data access methods for large customer and transaction databasesProficient in leveraging customer analytical methods to drive customer and business outcomesBachelors degree (preferably in a quantitative field such as math, statistics, physics, chemistry, engineering, economics, computer science, operational research); Masters degree highly desired, but not required.KEY BENEFITS:Merchandise discount for our brands: 50% off regular-priced merchandise at Gap, Banana Republic and Old Navy, 30% off at Outlet and 25% off at Athleta.One of the most competitive Paid Time Off plans in the industry.*Employees can take up to five on the clock hours each month to volunteer at a charity of their choice.*Extensive 401(k) plan with company matching for contributions up to four percent of an employees base pay.*Employee stock purchase plan.*Employees receive medical, dental, vision and life insurance.*Employees can apply for tuition reimbursement.*Family care programs.Commuter benefits.Pet Discount Program. *For eligible employeesGap Inc. is an equal-opportunity employer and is committed to providing a workplace free from harassment and discrimination. We are committed to recruiting, hiring, training and promoting qualified people of all backgrounds, and make all employment decisions without regard to any protected status. In 2016, Gap Inc. was named one of the Best Places to Work by the Human Rights Campaign for the thirteenth consecutive year and was the sole winner of the Catalyst award for equality in the workplace in 2016.

Name: Client Success Data Insights
Description: Our company mission is to transform people's healthcare experience from confusing and complicated to empowering and trustworthy. Likewise, for the leading employers we work with, we are trusted partners in helping them take control of their healthcare spendoften the second highest line item in their budget. Our Client Success team is looking for a Client Data Insights Consultant to help employers better understand their health benefits investment.  In this role, you'll join our dynamic Client Success team where you'll be instrumental to enhancing our analytic ability into a differentiated client experience. You will work closely with our Account Executives and Account Managers to maximize and apply insights gleaned from available data, and to use opportunities to share and discuss those insights to help build valued relationships with our clients.. You will also be a key contributor to producing and delivering annual and quarterly business reviews which detail clients' key demographic and cost drivers contributing to overall healthcare spend. You will also influence development for business reporting tools to support our team's growth and ability to demonstrate value for our clients. Your work will help us turn data into insights and reports that will inform and guide our clients' business decisions.  ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES  To be successful as a Client Insights Consultant, you must possess and be able to execute upon these main skill sets: Advanced Analytic SkillsDemonstrate ability to analyze and interpret data, and to translate it into meaningful insights and actionable recommendations for clients:Continually provide analytic and business insights to address client business gaps and/or opportunities, and to create value for the clientApproach clients with coherent, actionable recommendations appropriate to their business needsProactively identify client healthcare issues and opportunities, and use the appropriate level analytic support to drive solutionsFocus on the quantitative analysis of client spend and issues using data from internal and external sources to provide insight to decision-makersPartner with internal teams as the voice of Client Success in the development of additional automated reporting tools for our clientsContinuously evaluate data for accuracy, and serve as point of contact with Analytics and other key teams to address any data integrity issuesManage multiple simultaneous analytic projects with complex deliverablesCommunicationDemonstrate strong interpersonal communication and presentation skills Develop best practice for templates and deliverables around the data used to deliver the client analytic information Create compelling presentation materials that help to deliver each client-storyEducate the client on analytic methods, shape their thinking and influence their decision-makingDemonstrate a flexible approach to communication; successfully adapt messages quickly to the appropriate level or function KEY QUALIFICATIONS 4+ years healthcare reporting experience within a complex, fast-paced environmentBackground in Business Operations, Strategy, Analytics or relevant experienceBasic/intermediate SQL skillsExperience with Looker, Tableau, or Domo a plusExceptional communication skillsStrong analytical, conceptual and problem-solving abilitiesPassionate about health care industryBS, ideally in a quantitative discipline (engineering, economics, math, etc.)MBA or management consulting experience a plus but not requiredExceptional organizational and time-management abilitiesAbility to establish and maintain multiple key cross-functional relationshipsCollective Health is a technology company working to create the healthcare experience we all deserve. Founded in 2013, our team of engineers, designers, product managers, and actuaries are redefining the $1 trillion market of employer-sponsored health benefits with data-driven and people-focused products. Our complete health benefits solution helps great companies like Activision Blizzard, Palantir, Restoration Hardware, and Pinterest take care of their people by harnessing the power of design and technology. Based in San Francisco, CA, we're backed by some of the best investors in Silicon Valley including Google Ventures, Founders Fund, NEA, and Redpoint Ventures. For more information, visit us at https://www.collectivehealth.com.We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.Collective Health

Name: Full Stack Senior Software Engineer- Analytics
Description: The Opportunity You’ll be performing the data pipeline development effort for Analytics in Marketo which deals with petabytes of data and serves thousands of customers.  You would be the key person developing all backend data pipelines including batch and streaming pipelines and grow as a professional to be the go-to person for all our backend needs for Analytics.  We are looking for a data geek with technical background in analytics space who has a strong focus and dedication to delivery; a passionate data engineer with expertise in developing data pipelines to support data warehouse, data lake and business intelligence in a SaaS environment. Experience in building pipelines for supporting AI/ML products would be a big plus.  If you’re passionate about innovative technology around data analytics, business intelligence and artificial intelligence domain (data lake, big data, spark, scala, kafka, DataProc, AirFlow, SnowFlake, Looker, TensorFlow), thrive in delivering tightly scheduled roadmaps, Marketo is the place for you! ResponsibilitiesDevelop data pipelines including batch and streaming, to support data warehouse, business intelligence and AI/ML products.Be part of multiple projects at the same time and deliver on time in Agile environment.Work closely with architects, data scientists, engineers and product managers to understand product and engineering requirements to ensure the delivery.Learn new technologies/technical solutions with respect to Analytics and Artificial Intelligence product roadmap.Mentor junior team members, be able to drive at times for some of the deliverables.Basic Qualifications5+ years of experience (including big data, distributed data processing, business intelligence and data warehouse) in a SaaS environment.3+ years of experience in building data pipelines (both batch and streaming)3+ years of experience working in Agile/Scrum setup.Experience developing distributed applications and API in a SaaS environmentGreat communication skills, and the ability to lead junior team members.Solid experience of SQL and NoSQL database technologies.Proficiency in Java/Scala, Spark, shell scripting.Experience on building pipelines either on GCP or on AWS stack.Understanding of GCP stack comprising of CloudSQL, DataProc, Spanner, BigQuery, DataFlow, TensorFlow.Experience of building traditional data warehousing using ELT/ETL tools.Preferred QualificationsExposure to UI technologies: Node-JS,React, ReduxExperience with analytics product offerings to multi-tenant architectureExperience with Looker, SnowFlakeExperience of building Data LakeExperience with ETL frameworks, data warehouse and BI products (Talend, Pentaho BI) Marketo is an equal opportunity employer.

Name: Technical Business Analyst
Description: Technical Business Analyst Apply Job ID 1683960-2 Location San Francisco, California, United States Clearance  Description  Every day at Perspecta, we enable hundreds of thousands of people to take on our nation's most important work. We're a company founded on a diverse set of capabilities and skills, bound together by a single promise: we never stop solving our nation's most complex challenges. Our team of engineers, analysts, developers, investigators, integrators and architects work tirelessly to create innovative solutions. We continually push ourselvesto respond, to adapt, to go further. To look ahead to the changing landscape and develop new and innovative ways to serve our customers.  Perspecta works with U.S. government customers in defense, intelligence, civilian, health care, and state and local markets. Our high-caliber employees are rewarded in many waysnot only through competitive salaries and benefits packages, but the opportunity to create a meaningful impact in jobs and on projects that matter.  Perspecta's talented and robust workforce14,000 strongstands ready to welcome you to the team. Let's make an impact together.  Perspecta has a need for a Technical Business Analyst in Wilkes-Barre, PA.  Under direct supervision, has duties of instructing, directing, and checking the work of other technical staff. Reviews design documents and ensure technical specifications and designs are correct. Performs all functional duties independently. Works on high-visibility programs, or mission critical aspects of assigned program(s). Oversees the efforts of direct reporting resources and/or is responsible for the efforts of all staff assigned to a specific job. Responsible for the completion of assigned engineering projects within budgetary and scheduling guidelines. Leads technical staff assigned for the duration of a project or may function as ongoing lead for technical staff associated with one or more technical areas. Does not have formal supervisory responsibilities, although may provide input for (project) team member performance appraisals. QualificationsA minimum of ten (10) years experience in software development and/or related field; • A degree from an accredited College/University in Software Engineering, Computer Science, or related discipline is preferred; • Able to perform all functional duties independently on high-visibility programs, or mission critical aspects of a given program; • Able to oversee the efforts of direct reporting resources and/or be responsible for the efforts of all staff assigned to a specific job; • Experience training, mentoring, and providing technical direction to less experienced personnel; • Extensive experience with designing, coding, testing, debugging and documenting software solutions to complex problems concerning computer equipment capacity and limitations, operating time and form of desired results; • Extensive experience analyzing complex business applications, developing block diagrams and logic flow charts, and translating detailed design into software; • Extensive experience with performance tuning software to reduce execution time or improve efficiency; • Extensive experience authoring or contributing to both program-level and user-level software-related documentation such as requirements specifications, design documents, technical manuals, and user manuals; • Be a US Citizen, have earned permanent residence status (Green Card), or have lived in the US for the past 5 years; • Able to obtain a permanent clearance; • Excellent communication skills.SDL2017

Name: Data Science Manager, Analytics - Instagram Live
Description: Jobs at Instagram  Data Science Manager, Analytics - Instagram Live San Francisco, California, USInstagram is a global community of more than 1 billion, which means jobs here offer countless ways to make an impact in a fast growing organization. Instagram was built to connect people to the people and interests they love. Our app has played a critical part in forming meaningful communities where people can connect with each other and share what matters most to them.  We’re looking for analytics leaders to work on our core products with a passion for social media to help drive informed business decisions for Instagram. You will enjoy working with one of the richest data sets in the world, cutting edge technology, and the ability to see your insights turned into real products on a regular basis. The perfect candidate will have a background in computer science or a related technical field, will have experience working with large data stores, and will have some experience building software. You are scrappy, focused on results, a self-starter, and have demonstrated success in using analytics to drive the understanding, progression, and user engagement of a product. This position is located in our Menlo Park office and possibly San Francisco.Responsibilities Apply your expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining, and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and understand how our users interact with our core productsPartner with Product and Engineering teams to solve problems and identify trends and opportunitiesInform, influence, support, and execute our product decisionsBuild/maintain reports, dashboards, and metrics to monitor the performance of our productsMine massive amounts of data and extract useful product insightsManage development of data resources, gather requirements, organize sources, and support product launchesMinimum Qualifications3+ years of experience in managing other team members4+ years of experience doing quantitative analysis2+ years of experience in an analytical role in a technology company, consulting, investment banking, or product management2+ years of experience with SQL or other programming languagesExperience initiating and driving projects to completion with minimal guidanceExperience communicating the results of analysis Preferred Qualifications Bachelor Degree in Computer Science, Math, Physics, Engineering, or related quantitative field.Understanding of statistical analysis, experience with packages, such as R, MATLAB, SPSS, SAS, Stata, etc.Experience with large data sets and distributed computing (Hive/Hadoop). ApplyInstagram is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, genetic information, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.  If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at accommodations-ext@fb.com or you may call us at +1 650-308-7837.

Name: Solutions Administrator
Description: Careers at TopDown Consulting  Solutions Administrator Location: Open Overview: A TopDown Solutions Administrator has hands-on knowledge of Oracle Hyperion Enterprise Performance Management (EPM) solutions and a track record of administrating enterprise-scale EPM solutions. A Solutions Administrator has successfully acquired and applies core product training to the day-to-day operations critical to Oracle Hyperion Essbase, Planning, and Financial Management systems. The Solutions Administrator is able to perform all routine production support and system monitoring activities independently.  This position provides an integral support component to our customers’ ongoing efforts to expedite the ROI and maximize the effectiveness of their Oracle Hyperion EPM solutions. In this key support role, the Solutions Administrator acts as a key interface from TopDown Consulting to our client base by delivering exceptional application support to a variety of their departments and end-users.  As an employee of a virtual company, the Solutions Administrator must be self-sufficient and proactive in managing their work, while maintaining appropriate communication and escalation to TopDown management. They should be able to work both independently and as part of a team, and be committed to continuously improving TopDown’s operations and profitability. Key Duties and Responsibilities:Customer Service — Deliver quality systems administration and support to TopDown customers, participate in internal and client status calls and team meetings, document productivity in weekly activity reports and escalate issues internally and externally as needed.System Administration — Load and validate data, maintain metadata, update and run calculations and consolidations, manage security, (re)start Hyperion services, inform on patch and version releases, execute backup, failover and recovery procedures.Service Desk & Support — Troubleshoot end user configuration and application issues, assist with data reconciliation and investigations, escalate software defects to Oracle.Reporting & Analytics — Create and maintain SmartView sheets, application web forms, and Excel-based ad hoc reports, create and maintain individual reports and report repository in Hyperion Reports.Documentation & Transition — Document existing system administration, service desk, and reporting procedures, document service desk issues and associated resolutions, transition system knowledge to new or replacement support staff, communicate personal and system status to TopDown and Client management.TopDown Firm Building — Assist presales efforts to explain our services offerings to prospective clients, identify opportunities for additional TopDown consulting services, participate in mentorship, recruiting, and marketing opportunities as needed.Requirements: This role requires a great attitude, strong business ethics, an analytical mind, the ability to think on your feet, and excellent customer communication skills. Bachelors degree with 3-7 years related work experienceExperience with planning, forecasting, and financial accounting processesHands-on participation delivering or supporting at least one EPM solution utilizing core products and related systems and software including: Oracle Hyperion Planning, Oracle Hyperion Essbase, Oracle Hyperion Financial Management (HFM), Business Rules, Calculation Manager, Load Rules, Calculation Scripts, Data Relationship Management (DRM), FDQM, Enterprise Performance Management Architect (EPMA), Oracle Data Integrator (ODI), Hyperion Application Link (HAL), Financial Reports (FR), Smart View, etc.Hands-on experience with support ticket tracking systems a plusWillingness to travel up to 25%

Name: Cloud Solution Architect
Description: C3 is the leading AI software platform for digital transformation. At the C3 Platform's core is the revolutionary C3 Type Systeman extensible, model-driven AI architecture. The comprehensive and proven C3 Platform enables enterprises to develop, deploy, and operate enterprise-scale AI applications 10 to 100x faster than alternative approaches.  C3 has an opening for a Cloud Solution Architect. You will be required to work with customers to configure and deploy the C3 platform and C3 product suite applications using public, private, or hybrid cloud architecture. You will be interacting with large enterprises with complex system landscapes, so breadth of experience is paramount. This role requires a perfect combination of "big picture", solution-oriented mindset and solid implementation skills. Your Responsibilities:Work with customers to architect a full-stack solution using C3 software that fully integrates with customer's existing cloud infrastructure from data flow, security, DevOps and other standpoints.Provide recommendations and best practices to optimize customers' cloud presence, performance, security and cost in light of the C3 platform.Compare and contrast building applications with the C3 platform versus building them with cloud primitives.Assess technical risks and come up with mitigation strategies.Perform debugging, troubleshooting, modifications and unit testing of custom solutions built on C3 platform.Develop new specs, documentation, participate in the development of technical procedures and user support guides.Requirements:5+ years hands-on experience with one of the major public cloud vendors.Engineering degree in Computer Science or Electrical Engineering.Demonstrated ability to design and implement a working solution using public cloud primitives.Deep understanding of enterprise architecture and enterprise application integration.Extensive experience with Unix-based operating systems.Experience with relational databases (any vendor).Solid understanding of data modeling best practices.Working knowledge of Agile Software development methodology.Strong organizational and troubleshooting skills with attention to detail.Strong analytical ability, judgment and problem analysis techniques.Interpersonal skills with the ability to work effectively in a cross functional team.PreferredProficiency in data integration/EAI technologies, such as Tibco.SaaS and business intelligence/analytics implementation experience is a plus. C3 provides a competitive compensation package and excellent benefits including: Competitive salary, generous stock options, 401K, medical, dental, and vision benefits. At the office, we offer a fully stocked kitchen with catered breakfast and lunch, table tennis and pool table, free membership at our on-site gym, Friday evening social hours with food, drink and music and a fun team of great people. C3 is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of any legally protected characteristics, including disabled and veteran status.

Name: Partner Deal Operations Analyst
Description: Job CategoryFinance and Operations  Job Details  This is an opportunity for an ambitious and talented individual to make an impact in a high profile role within Revenue Operations, that partners directly with the Alliances sales organizations. As a part of the global Partner Operations team, the individual would work closely with the Alliances sales teams to formulate and vet the business, pricing, and contractual terms in complex partnership proposals and to ensure effective and appropriate monetization of all partner relationships. The individual will formulate and manage deal execution processes that require constant interface with multiple internal functions including sales, sales strategy, finance, revenue accounting, legal, and sales operations to ensure that internal controls and processes are in place and that all functions are prepared to support rapid deal execution. This job requires equal parts critical thinking, attention to detail, and analytical insight. It also provides a chance to achieve significant responsibility and autonomy, access to senior executives, and prospects for rapid career development within one of the most innovative and fast-growing groups within SalesforceLocation: San Francisco, CAType: Full-timeResponsibilities include but are not limited to:  + + Review and approve reseller partnership proposals for an assigned territory, to include evaluating the business case for partnerships and ensuring that all requests align with Salesforce.com internal requirements.  + Communicate requests for approval for proposals and drive alignment with other groups and exec leaders across Salesforce.  + Identify concepts that pose business, legal, or other risk, determine possible courses of action, and make recommendations to the Partner Account Manager (PAM) and other Alliances sales leaders. Ensure PAM completes necessary steps to maintain compliance with all SFDC partner requirements.  + Ensure that all necessary approvals and supporting documents are recorded per Salesforce policy prior to advancing requests through process.  + Work cross-functionally with members of sales, technical architects, legal, finance, sales operations, and other SFDC teams to ensure that approvals are met.  + Provide routine reporting and analysis on team operational metrics.  + Undertake project-based work as needed in areas such as enablement, standardization, and approval optimization. Required Skills and Attributes: + + BA/BS required, preferably in finance or related field.  + 3-5 years experience, mainly in pricing, strategy, consulting, or other highly analytical business function.  + Highly analytical with strong quantitative skills  + Advanced Excel skills; ability to build financial and business models is a must.  + Strong PowerPoint skills; able to create concise, attractive, executive-level slides  + Incisive sense of commercial acumen with a ?big picture? outlook  + Excellent communications skills; summarizes complex concepts in an accessible manner  + Inquisitive, questioning mindset with close attention to detail; leaves no stone unturned and double-checks everything  + Team player with high level of emotional maturity; able to be diplomatic and work effectively with wide variety of personality types  + Dedicated to continuous improvement in all functions  + Ability to multi-task and perform in a high-paced and fluid environment  + Ability to work with a sense of urgency and minimal supervision  + Ability to proactively identify problems and generate plan to solve them ?Plus? Skills and Attributes: + + MBA or advanced degree.  + Familiarity with common technical and business principles for SaaS and PaaS companies  + Experience working in a channel/partner function.  + Experience reviewing, editing, or negotiating complex business contracts  Posting Statement  Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this Web site or directly to managers. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesforce.com or Salesforce.org.  Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance and the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring, Salesforce will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.  Salesforce, the Customer Success Platform and world's #1 CRM, empowers companies to connect with their customers in a whole new way. We are the fastest growing of the top 10 enterprise software companies, the World's Most Innovative Company according to Forbes, and one of Fortune's 100 Best Companies to Work For six years running. The growth, innovation, and Aloha spirit of Salesforce are driven by our incredible employees who thrive on delivering success for our customers while also finding time to give back through our 1/1/1 model, which leverages 1% of our time, equity, and product to improve communities around the world. Salesforce is a team sport, and we play to win. Join us!

Name: Build Your Career
Description: Bloomingdale's Executive Development Program (EDP) - Store Management "Nationwide Opportunities" The Bloomingdale's Executive Development Program (EDP) is your first step in developing your leadership skills to successfully manage mulit-million dollar businesses. Our developmental curriculum provides the skills and confidence needed for you to lead a team of professionals in our stores. As an EDP you will serve as a selling leader to cultivate a team that is intuitively responsive to the needs of our upscale clientele. You will have exposure to all functional areas of retail from leadership, human resources, promotional events, business analysis, problem solving, buying and planning, visual merchandising and store operations. We will guide you on how to recruit, attract and retain the top professionals in the industry. You will build problem solving and collaboration skills as well as influencing and presentation skills. You will learn how the store team works to maximize sales opportunity by leveraging our core values (People, Service and Loyalty). After the successful completion you will be promoted to lead and inspire our store professionals to achieve business results. Essential functions of EDP:Develop and inspire a world class team while applying leadership skills learned in Executive Development ProgramDevelopmental courses; virtual self lead and classroom style facilitated by subject matter expertsStrategically plan and implement a project to highlight your leadership accomplishmentsInspire others to drive business results. Recruit, interview and select a team of highly engaged professionalsEnhancing problems solving skills to manage complex relationshipsWork in a fast-paced, competitive and constantly changing environmentEngage with our communities through strong philanthropic supportAppointed a Senior Executive and peer mentor to provide you with additional guidance and coaching.Ongoing executive education and development throughout your careerQualifications:Bachelor's degree with a solid academic record, all majors welcomedLeadership skills that include professional business ethics, assertiveness and self-motivationAbility to solve problems and manage complex relationshipsAbility to prioritize projects and execute multiple tasks to achieve productivity and business goalsStrong business background including analytical skill to strategize data and draw conclusionsWillingness to relocate as you advance in your career may increase your chances for more frequent promotions This job overview is not all inclusive. In addition, Macy s, Inc. reserves the right to amend this job overview at any time. Macy s is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment. Macy s, Inc. including Macy s and Bloomingdale s will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal convictions in a manner consistent withSFPC Art. 49andLA MC ch. XVIII Art. 9.

Name: Principal Product Manager, Business Technology
Description: Job CategoryProducts and Technology  Job Details  The Salesforce Business Technology team is seeking an experienced Principal Product Manager to lead product design, strategy, and enterprise delivery with a focus on SaaS solutions and application development. As a high functioning individual contributor, directing work assignments and portfolio roadmaps, influencing the balance of scope-budget-timelines and strategic planning, and influencing delivery success in a global organization at scale are some the key responsibilities of this role. Our ideal candidate must enjoy working in a highly dynamic, fast-paced and high-growth environment, have deep technology and domain expertise, and have demonstrated success in overseeing multiple complex programs in parallel. Are you that somebody?Responsibilities:  + Recognized principal, technical or business contributor. Also recognized as a premier technical, industry or product specialist. Has high level of knowledge of relevant technologies, emerging business/ industry trends, competitive technical direction and product direction. May direct others.  + Works on issues that impact department success or address future concepts, products or technologies. Creates formal networks with key decision makers and serves as external spokesperson for the organization. In addition, may integrate research and emerging technologies into company product platforms.  + Determines methodologies and procedures on new assignments based on general direction from senior management. Works on issues and projects which have high complexity. Acts as an advisor on complex issues and projects, exercising discretion and latitude in reaching project goals. Leads cross functional teams and mentors others.  + Elevates the conversation with business partners to the strategic level, understanding strategic goals and proposing plans to support them effectively  + Responsible for the overall success of program with accountability for the Business Technology solution across teams by assuring delivery against integrated and aligned requirements, design, roadmap and solution architecture.  + Partner with various business partners, vendors and solution teams to evaluate how to best acquire or leverage existing technology to meet evolving business requirements. Responsible for the sourcing strategy and vendor selection of products and services as part of the initiatives  + Identifies program critical success factors and drives mitigation of significant issues and risks. Assesses and escalates the risks of delivery of the solution while providing appropriate visibility to executive sponsors  + Promotes simplification, efficiency and an increasingly higher level of productivity for business through optimal solutions. Required Skills/ Experience: + Minimum of 12 years of professional experience in product management and/or relevant applications delivery experience  + Bachelor?s degree or equivalent work experience  + Deep experience in enterprise process and applications with an emphasis on:  + Enterprise Application Integration, Data Warehouse, Business Intelligence & Analytics, Data Science  + Proficient with agile/scrum development methodologies  + Excellent organizational, written, and oral communication skills  + Strategic leadership with proven ability to set a vision, excite, influence, and lead a cross-functional team  + Function independently and as part of a team under aggressive deadlines in a (really) fast-paced environment, convey a strong professional image, exhibit interest and positive attitude toward all assigned work, and strive for continued improvement. The successful candidate will enjoy the risk and opportunity of advanced technology development.  + Creative thinker who thrives on solving challenging problems with analytical thinking skills  + Strong technical acumen to oversee architects and engineers and proactively identify risks and issues.  + Gathering and transforming business requirements and market needs into a successful product strategy  + Proven ability to deliver on commitments at scale  + Ability to handle multiple competing priorities in a fast-paced environment  + People management and Product Management leadership experience preferred.  Posting Statement  Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this Web site or directly to managers. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesforce.com or Salesforce.org.  Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance and the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring, Salesforce will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.  Salesforce, the Customer Success Platform and world's #1 CRM, empowers companies to connect with their customers in a whole new way. We are the fastest growing of the top 10 enterprise software companies, the World's Most Innovative Company according to Forbes, and one of Fortune's 100 Best Companies to Work For six years running. The growth, innovation, and Aloha spirit of Salesforce are driven by our incredible employees who thrive on delivering success for our customers while also finding time to give back through our 1/1/1 model, which leverages 1% of our time, equity, and product to improve communities around the world. Salesforce is a team sport, and we play to win. Join us!

Name: Principal, Analytics Business Development
Description: Job DescriptionWe work with the worlds best brands to provide end to end process transformation that delivers improved results businesses can see, and improved experiences customers can feel. Our mission is to help our clients maximize their customer lifetime value and increase their competitive advantage by helping drive productivity and efficiency while delivering measurable results.  Our world-class innovative and analytics-driven business solutions include digital transformation services, such as research and design studios, analytics and consulting, in addition to IT services, customer engagement services, and business process transformation services, such as intelligent automation, F&A and procurement solutions.  We are a unique Big Data analytics solutions provider that helps leading organizations achieves positive, high-impact business outcomes through the delivery of continuous and context-sensitive predictive insights. Our analytics platform enables faster, scalable and intuitive development and application of predictive insights by business users. Our solutions are built as dynamic predictive apps targeted to optimize specific business problems across a given business process.  Our predictive solutions power smarter marketing for effective customer acquisition, retention, and lifetime value growth leading to enhanced customer equity and profitable growth. Responsibilities The DBD directs business development and sales activities with prospective clients and is accountable for the client relationship from deal conception to closing. Responsible for selling Advanced Analytics (predictive) Products with a focus on generating new business and growing revenue.  Our Sales team helps the clients to architect future state operating models, enhance service operations, and maximize the value from our engagement.  This individual leverage his/her domain, technical, digital and operational business knowledge to create demand and persuade prospective clients through the development and presentation of compelling value propositions and purchasing rationales.  The DBD will thoroughly understand the prospective clients business, both strategic and tactical, including themes and underlying issues, and will align our current and future capabilities to create client opportunity and solve business problems.  Experience and Competency Requirements Develop and implement strategic sales plans and forecasts to achieve corporate sales objectives > $x M in new sales bookings each quarter for our analytics groupDevelop presentations, business cases and ROI models, RFQ responses, Statements of Work and other documentation as necessary in an effort to present in the context of client needs and facilitate new business Sales from Initial Contact through Contract SignatureEnsure contractual alignment and input with Support Team(s) to ensure client deliverables and timelines are met with frequent internal communication to ensure internal teams are prepared to deliver successfully for our new clientsTravel as needed to client sites to lead client meetings including incorporating appropriate resources when neededEffectively communicate our value proposition at CXO, VP and other levelsWork well with cross functional teams to be responsive to clients and advance Sales opportunities through Sales StagesCreate and update Sales forecast in sf.com to accurately reflect sales pipeline activity and ensure forecasting and fiscal revenue recognition and timing accuracyWork with business operations to create and update opportunity financial models for approval and complianceEnsure effective control of sales process and results, and take corrective action to guarantee that achievement of objectives falls within designated budgetsConstantly read and study market research and adjust sales strategy to meet changing market and competitive conditionsMonitor competitor products, sales and marketing activitiesEstablish and maintain relationships with industry and client influencersInteract with our business development team to drive relationships with key strategic partnersLead presentations to executive management at our and at clientsEstablish and maintain a consistent corporate image throughout all internal and external communicationCoordinate liaison between sales department and other sales related unitsAnalyze and control expenditures of division to conform to budgetAssist other departments to provide input into technical publications, product roadmaps, etc.Prepare bi-weekly sales report showing sales volume, potential sales, and areas of proposed client base expansionReview and analyze sales performances against quota and plan to determine the effectivenessDirect product research and developmentMaintain extensive knowledge of product features, functionality and roadmap at business and technical levels · Remote Work Up to 40% of the time  · Travel Up to 60% of the time Must Haves:Minimum 7 years of business development experience selling into Retail, Travel or Hi-Tech clientsMinimum 3 years experience selling analytics as a service

Name: Freelance Product Manager - Decision and Growth Analytics
Description: Title:Freelance Product Manager - Decision and Growth AnalyticsLocation: San Francisco, CAStart: ASAPEnd: 6 monthsResponsibilities Decision Support Analytics Partner with key stakeholders specifically within Product Management to leverage customer, transactional, as well as other forms of data and analytics to drive customer and business outcomesPerform analytics and leverage existing internal analytical tools to improve decision making by providing data driven insights into complex Product Management initiatives across all phases of their lifecycle – pre-build, MVP, pilot, scaleTranslate complex quantitative analysis and concepts in a concise and compelling way to various audiences to gain organizational alignment around project resultsDrive adoption of data-driven solutions by key stakeholders across Product ManagementProactively identify opportunities to inform the Product Management roadmap based on analytic insightsQualifications5+ years of experience in analyticsMust have strong technical skills with the ability to create scalable processes to efficiently reproduce complex financial analysesDeep knowledge of retail and ecommerce customer domains requiredStrong financial modeling and analysis skills and the ability to leverage multiple sources of data to draw actionable, data driven insightsExperience working closely with executive leadershipStrong business acumen, coupled with written, verbal and presentation skillsAble to deliver near-term wins while building towards a larger strategic visionProficient in data access methods for large customer and transaction databasesProficient in leveraging analytical methods to drive customer and business outcomes

Name: 9978 Technology Expert II
Description: Introduction THIS POSITION IS LOCATED IN MOCCASIN, CAWho are we?SAN FRANCISCO PUBLIC UTILITIES COMMISSION (SFPUC) Headquartered in San Francisco, we have 2,300 employees working in seven counties with a combined annual operating budget of over $900 million. OUR MISSION: To provide our customers with high quality, efficient, and reliable water, power and wastewater services in a manner that is inclusive of environmental and community interests, and that sustains the resources entrusted to our care. OUR VISION: We are an innovative utility leader, recognize for excellent results in service, safety, stewardship, and inclusiveness. We are an award-winning and industry-leading utilities organization committed to our customers, community interests, and the environment. To learn more about our organization, please visit our website at www.sfwater.org APPOINTMENT TYPE: Temporary Exempt. This position is excluded by the Charter from the competitive Civil Service examination process and shall serve at the discretion of the Appointing Officer. POSITION INFORMATION This position will manage Hetch Hetchy Water Power’s (HHWP’s) IT staff (Control Network, Business Network and SCADA) for the SFPUC.  This position will work under the direction of the HHWP Division Manager who is also the CIP Senior Manager and NERC Compliance Officer for the SFPUC. This position will oversee HHWP IT/OT staff, which manages HHWPs Control Network, Business Network and SCADA. The incumbent must have experience managing and directing highly technical employees; provide conflict-resolution and consensus-building in order to meet the needs of several clients with conflicting needs; predict and plan for future events and make strategic and tactical decisions for the purpose of meeting IT/SCADA goals for the department and the Division; communicate effectively orally to direct and mentor staff; communicate effectively in writing to produce complex reports, instructions to subordinates and users, and for other purposes; exercise judgment, decisiveness and creativity; establish and maintain good working relationships; use logic and analysis to solve information technology problems; solid IT background and consistently keep up-to-date with advancements of the field; have every quality of a leader and a strong strategic and business acumen.  Functions include oversight of the use of HHWP Information technology (IT), devise the company’s IT strategy and ensure that all systems necessary to support its operations and objectives are in place collaboratively developing and overseeing programs covering all relevant regulatory requirements and compliance activities including but not limited to the following: patch management, change and configuration management, network monitoring, incident response and disaster recovery; preparation for NERC CIP audits, periodic reporting and other CIP regulatory filings; performing compliance risk/gap assessments; and keeping management informed about these activities. MAJOR IMPORTANT, AND ESSENTIAL DUTIESSet objectives and strategies for the IT departmentSelect and implement suitable technology to streamline all internal operations and help optimize their strategic benefitsDesign and customize technological systems and platforms to improve utility operations (water and electric)Plan the implementation of new systems and provide guidance to IT professionals and other staff within the organizationApprove purchases of technological equipment and software and establish partnerships with IT providersOversee the technological infrastructure (networks and computer systems) in the HHWP Division to ensure optimal performanceDirect and organize IT-related projectsMonitor changes or advancements in technology to discover ways the company can gain operational advantage, reduce risk or minimize costsAnalyze the costs, value and risks of information technology to advise management and suggest actionsCollaboratively developing and overseeing programs covering five core CIP IT requirements: patch management, change and configuration management, network monitoring, incident response and disaster recoveryEnsuring CIP mandated access controls are developed and enforcedCoordinating HHWP preparation for NERC CIP audits, periodic reporting and other CIP regulatory filingsPerforming compliance risk/gap assessments; coordinating with HHWP department managers to plan work, monitor deadlinesREQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIESProven experience as CIO or similar managerial roleExcellent knowledge of the information technology (IT) and operational technology (OT), specifically within the utility industryBackground in designing/developing utility IT/OT systems and planning IT/OT implementationSolid understanding of data analysis, budgeting and business operationsSuperior analytical and problem-solving capabilitiesA strong strategic and business mindsetExcellent organizational and leadership skillsOutstanding communication and interpersonal abilitiesAbility to identify and resolve problems of a sensitive or political natureAbility to exercise independent judgment and initiativeAbility to communicate orally, demonstrating skill to present findings, recommendations and policies before public officials, other officials, the press, employees, and employee representativesAbility to communicate effectively in writing, including preparing administrative and statistical reportsAbility to establish and maintain cooperative working relationships with officials and management, employee representatives, employees, departmental colleagues, staff and members of the publicAbility to plan, organize and coordinate research and statistical work; and supervise and coordinate resources and activities Minimum Qualifications If you are interested in a job like this, we are looking for people that have the following:These minimum qualifications are to be used as a guide for establishing the education, training, experience, special skills and/or license which may be required for employment in the class. Although these minimum qualifications are typical of the class, additional minimum qualifications and special conditions may apply to a particular position and will be stated on the job announcement.EDUCATION Possession of a baccalaureate degree from an accredited college or university in Computer Science, Engineering, or other closely field related; AND EXPERIENCE Five (5) years of verifiable journey-level work experience in IT/Security project management; five (5) years of experience managing IT and/or SCADA staff; AND LICENSE Valid driver's license DESIRABLE QUALIFICATIONS5+ years IT/Security Project Management experience, of which include5+ years experiencing managing IT and/or SCADA staff2+ years NERC CIP experience with a utility with at least medium impact BES facilities5+ years operational utility experienceITIL certificationCISSP certificationStrong communication skillsSUBSTITUTION Additional qualifying work experience as indicated in Minimum Qualification Experience may substitute for the required education on a year-for-year basis. One (1) year (equivalent to 2,000 hours) of additional qualifying work experience will be considered equivalent to 30 semester units/45 quarter units. VERIFICATION Applicants may be required to submit verification of qualifying education and experience at any point during the recruitment and selection process.  Note: Falsifying one’s education, training, or work experience or attempted deception on the application may result in disqualification for this and future job opportunities with the City and County of San Francisco. If education verification is required, information on how to verify education requirements, including verifying foreign education credits or degree equivalency, can be found at http://sfdhr.org/index.aspx?page=456  Verification of required work experience typically must be on the employer’s letterhead, and must include the applicant’s name, job title, description of job duties, dates of employment, hours per week, and signature of the employer, supervisor, or appropriate representative.  Employees of the City and County of San Francisco may submit performance evaluations showing duties performed to verify qualifying City experience. City employees will receive credit for the duties of the class to which appointed. Credit for experience obtained outside of the employee's class will be allowed only if recorded in accordance with the provisions of Civil Service Commission Rules. CCSF employees will not receive credit for experience obtained outside of their classification unless recorded in accordance with the provisions of the Civil Service Rule 110.9.1/111A.11.2.  Experience claimed in self-employment will only be accepted if supported by documents verifying income, earnings, business license and experience comparable to minimum qualifications above. Copies of income tax papers or other documents listing occupation and total earnings must be submitted.  Verification of required valid licensure/certification typically must be a photocopy of the license/certificate including the name of the issuing agency as well as the name of the license/certificate holder, license/certificate number, and expiration date.How To Apply  Applications for City and County of San Francisco jobs are only accepted through an online process. Visit http://www.jobaps.com/sf to register an account (if you have not already done so) and begin the application process. Select the desired job announcementSelect “Apply” and read and acknowledge the informationSelect either “I am a New User” if you have not previously registered, or “I have Registered Previously”Follow instructions on the screenNeed help completing the application? Computers are available for the public (from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. Monday through Friday) to file online applications in the lobby of the Dept. of Human Resources at 1 South Van Ness Avenue, 4th Floor, San Francisco. We communicate by email Applicants may be contacted by email about this announcement and, therefore, it is their responsibility to ensure that their registered email address is accurate and kept up-to-date. Also, applicants must ensure that email from CCSF is not blocked on their computer by a spam filter. To prevent blocking, applicants should set up their email to accept CCSF mail from the following addresses (@sfgov.org, @sfdpw.org, @sfport.com, @flysfo.com, @sfwater.org, @sfdph.org, @asianart.org, @sfmta.com, @sfpl.org, @dcyf.org, @first5sf.org). Applicants will receive a confirmation email that their online application has been received in response to every announcement for which they file. Applicants should retain this confirmation email for their records. Failure to receive this email means that the online application was not submitted or received. Word of advice All work experience, education, training and other information substantiating how you meet the minimum qualifications must be included in the "Education" and "Training and Employment Record" sections of the City and County of San Francisco online application by the filing deadline. A resume does NOT substitute for this section of the City application and will not be considered in determining whether you meet the minimum qualifications.Applications completed improperly may be cause for ineligibility, disqualification or may result in lower scores. Have questions about the application process? If you have any questions regarding this recruitment or application process, please contact the exam analyst, Jonathan Pettey, by telephone at 415-554-1636, or by email at jpettey@sfwater.orgSelection Procedures  Applications will be screened for relevant qualifying experience. Additional screening mechanisms may be implemented in order to determine applicants’ qualifications. Only those applicants who most closely meet the needs of the Department will be invited to participate in the selection process. Applicants meeting the minimum qualifications are not guaranteed advancement to the interview.Conviction History As a finalist for a job, you will be fingerprinted, and your fingerprints will be sent to the California Department of Justice (DOJ) and the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI). The resulting report of your conviction history (if any) will be used to determine whether the nature of your conviction (or arrest, in limited circumstances) conflicts with the specific duties and responsibilities of the job for which you are a finalist. If a conflict exists, you will be asked to present any evidence of rehabilitation that may mitigate the conflict, except when federal or state regulations bar employment in specific circumstances, such as: Candidates for positions with the Unified School District and the Community College District may be disqualified from consideration should their conviction history not meet the standards established under the California Education Code.Candidates for positions with the Recreation and Park Department may be disqualified from consideration should their conviction history not meet the standards established under California Public Resources Code 5164.Having a conviction history does not automatically preclude you from a job with the City. If you are selected as a finalist, the hiring department will contact you to schedule a fingerprinting appointment.Conclusion TERMS OF ANNOUNCEMENT Applicants must be guided solely by the provisions of this announcement including requirements, time periods, and other particulars, except when superseded by federal, state, or local laws, rules, or regulations. Clerical errors may be corrected by posting the correction on the Department of Human Resources website at www.jobaps.com/sf REQUESTS Applicants with disabilities who meet the minimum eligibility requirements for this job announcement can find information on requesting a reasonable ADA Accommodation at:  http://www.sfdhr.org/index.aspx?page=20#applicantswithdisabilities NOTES General Information concerning City and County of San Francisco Employment Policies and Procedures:  http://www.sfdhr.org/index.aspx?page=20 Terms of Announcement: http://www.sfdhr.org/index.aspx?page=20#announcementsdefinitions Copies of Application Documents: http://www.sfdhr.org/index.aspx?page=20#copies Right to Work: http://www.sfdhr.org/index.aspx?page=20#identification Driver's License requirement: http://www.sfdhr.org/index.aspx?page=20#license DRUG TESTING REQUIREMENT Applicants for positions may be required to pass pre-employment drug and alcohol testing, may be subject to drug and alcohol testing upon reasonable suspicion or after a work-related accident.  Copies of Application Documents: Applicants should keep copies of all documents submitted, as these will not be returned.  Right to Work: All persons entering the City and County of San Francisco workforce are required to provide verification of authorization to work in the United States. THE CITY AND COUNTY OF SAN FRANCISCO IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER. MINORITIES, WOMEN AND PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES ARE ENCOURAGED TO APPLY. Issued: November 19, 2018  Recruitment No.: TEX-9978-091616  Micki Callahan, Director  Department of Human Resources  Team: PUC/JP 415.554.1636  (#01135872)Benefits All employees hired on or after January 10, 2009 will be required (pursuant to San Francisco Charter Section A8.432) to contribute 2% of pre-tax compensation to fund retiree healthcare. In addition, most employees are required to make a member contribution towards retirement, ranging from 7.5%-13.25% of compensation. For more information on these provisions, please contact the personnel office of the hiring agency.  For more information about benefits, please click here.
