Description: corporations, healthcare [************************************************************************************************** and cultural instileadership. Our core values [*********************************************** define who we are,e that champions inclusion, diversity [*************************************************** and overall employee well-being [****************************** through programs suranding and marketing [*********************************************************************************************************** strStrategy and Place [************************************************************************************************** Making and is lookdown to not only delivering a better world [************************************************************* but working to maficiency in Microsoft [************************************************************************************************** Office Suite, Adobcompany that is pioneering the future [*************************************** Our teams around t  AECOM Consultant III, Strategy in San Francisco, California  United States of America - California, San Francisco  Job Summary  Strategy Plus, AECOM's design consulting studio operates at the intersection of Business Transformation, Communications Strategy and Place Making and is looking for highly motivated applicants who possess outstanding analytical, communication and design skills. The successful candidate will join our multidisciplinary team of talented designers and be responsible for supporting our state of the art consulting projects which encompass world class corporations, healthcare and cultural institutions, universities, and local and federal government.  Working as a collaborative team player, this individual will be responsible for excellence in delivering specific activities within a project, including client interaction, communication, planning, research, data analytics, visualization, presentation preparation and report writing with oversight from a Project Manager and Principal in Charge. Our clients are located through the Americas and this individual may be required to travel up to 50% of the time.  Candidates will be expected to possess experience in one or more of the following:  Business strategy, analytics and operations planning  Communication strategy branding and marketing + Workplace strategy, planning and design  Assisting in creating and delivering change management strategies and organizational development plans  Experience in user research, design strategy, and space programming  Highly collaborative, highly communicative creative team player  Excellent presentation and communication skills - Design Story Telling  Comfortable in a fast-paced, open, creative environment  Ability to contribute to workshops, focus groups and presentations  Critical thinking and persuasive writing skills  Familiarity with research methodologies and processes  Flexibility and the ability to work on more than one project in more than one team  Minimum Requirements  Bachelor's degree in business, architecture, planning, design, social science or another relevant field  10+ years relevant post education experience  Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, Adobe Creative Suite (specifically InDesign)  Revit or other space planning / design CAD systems  Web based data analytics, visualization, GIS and presentation software  Project management, project work planning, scheduling  Space programming, user research, design strategy and conceptual design  Preferred Qualifications N/A What We Offer  When you join AECOM, you become part of a company that is pioneering the future . Our teams around the world are involved in some of the most cutting-edge and innovative projects and programs of our time, addressing the big challenges of today and shaping the built environment for generations to come. We ensure a workplace that encourages growth, flexibility and creativity, as well as a company culture that champions inclusion, diversity and overall employee well-being through programs supported by company leadership. Our core values define who we are, how we act and what we aspire to, which comes down to not only delivering a better world , but working to make amazing happen in each neighborhood, community and city we touch. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each person's potential, and we'll help you reach yours.  Job Category Cost Management and Consulting Services  Business Line Buildings & Places  Business Group DCS  Country United States of America  Position Status Full-Time  Requisition/Vacancy No. ******BR  Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status.

Name: Offering Manager Intern I - Summer
Description: Job Description This is an internship position, candidates applying must be registered students in an undergraduate program.  Join the next generation of data-driven, user-centric innovators and entrepreneurs who are working to solve big, meaningful problems. IBM is transforming product management and has created a new discipline called IBM Offering Management. We are looking for early-career, technically-minded entrepreneurs for an intensive internship program with offering teams who are solving complex problems in a changing world. Selected interns will be considered for the Associate Offering Manager (AOM) Program. The Associate Offering Manager (AOM) Program is the cornerstone of this transformation.  Our interns operate at the epicenter of multidisciplinary teams which include design, engineering, sales, marketing, finance and legal. These offering teams serve our customers needs under ever-shifting circumstances and have passion for solving user problems with technology.  Interns in this program at IBM build deep and broad skills including market and competitive analysis, planning and shepherding product development, driving adoption through marketing and digital engagement, and sensing how offerings are performing in the market.  You will work with experienced IBM offering managers, designers and engineers who will challenge you and provide opportunities to accelerate your growth. You will build valuable experience and organizational eminence through mentors and opportunities to network across the business.  When considering applicants for this role, we look for education and background in areas such as innovation, entrepreneurship, engineering, computer science, market/user research,design thinking,technology commercialization, business and go-to-market practices.  We look for candidates who exhibit the aptitude and experience relevant to product management.  During this internship you'll be matched and deployed to an offering team in one of the following locations based on business demand:  Austin, TX - Dallas, TX - Littleton, MA - Cambridge, MA - Ann Arbor, MI - New York, NY - Yorktown Heights, NY - Raleigh-Durham, NC - Emeryville, CA - San Francisco, CA - Chicago, IL.  Required Technical and Professional Expertise Must have basic knowledge in product management, product development, entrepreneurship, design thinking, market research, go-to-market (GTM) strategy, business analytics, or other related work.English: Fluent Preferred Tech and Prof Experience At least 1 year of experience in product management, product development, entrepreneurship, design thinking, market research, go-to-market (GTM) strategy, business analytics, or other related work. EO Statement  IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Name: Commercial Associate (Healthcare, Education, Not For Profit Group) – San Francisco/San Diego/Los Angeles
Description: Job Description: Commercial Associate (Healthcare, Education, Not For Profit Group) – San Francisco/San Diego  Bank of America's Specialized Industries Banking group is seeking a Commercial Associate to join our Healthcare, Education & Not For Profit Group in California. This group is part of the Commercial Bank which serves public and private companies, generally with annual revenues of $50 million to $2 billion. Healthcare, Education & Not For Profit supports the financial needs of a variety of 501c3 not for profit clients including healthcare, private universities, colleges and K-12 schools, cultural, professional and social service organizations. Primary responsibilities are focused on developing business development skills and increased proficiency in the financial services/products that Bank of America delivers to our healthcare clients. *This position can be based in San Francisco or San Diego.  The Commercial Associate participates as an integral member of the core Client Team, working with commercial clients. Develops, participates and/or presents client/client team presentations (economic updates, markets forecasts, industry updates, industry valuations), pitch books and relationship reviews. Participates in the credit approval process in order to gain exposure to Credit products and the decision/approval process. Participates in treasury solutions packaging in order to gain exposure to Treasury products/services and their related approval/support processes. Coordinates with product partners, deal team members and clients throughout the course of a transaction. Delivers financial, industry, and economic analyses and other activities to facilitate decision making with comprehensive and in-depth company and industry research. Responsible for new business analytics to support the client teams, focusing on enhancing existing relationships, and identifying opportunities for up-tiering. Monitors Plus One activities across multiple portfolios in order to identify opportunities for expanding client relationships. Work efforts must be thorough and focused, exhibiting strong oral and written communication skills. Able to work with minimal supervision on assigned tasks, and is able to connect analytical work to the client needs and strategic objectives. Requirements:Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance, or related areaCompletion of Commercial Credit Training ProgramMinimum 3 - 5 years of previous business experienceDemonstrates initiative / self-motivationPossesses strong interpersonal skillsPossesses strong analytical and modeling skillsPossesses understanding of corporate financial statementsDemonstrates strong critical thinkingDemonstrates the ability to independently make decisionsKnowledge and proficiency of internal/external programs such as Navigator, GUS, CapIQ, Pitchbook, Factset, etcDesired:Desire to work in Specialized Industries with an interest in Healthcare, Education & NFP Institutions

Name: Senior Analyst, Consumer and Business Insights
Description: Requisition Number: SS-14188Area of Interest: MarketingOrganization: CorporateBrand/Division: Shared ServicesPosition Type: Full-timeJOB DESCRIPTIONAbout the TeamThe Marketing Strategy and Analytics team is based at the Williams-Sonoma, Inc. (WSI) corporate headquarters in San Francisco, CA. Through leading-edge expertise in Analytics, Data Science, and Marketing Strategy, our mission is to drive profitable growth across our brand portfolio and ensure that our brands are top-of-mind with consumers. We're responsible for leveraging multi-brand, multi-channel customer data to provide WSI with strategic advantages in the marketplace. We strive for continuous improvement and innovation in everything we do.Our team delivers strategic advantages for the WSI family of brands by providing:* Deep customer data insights to understand consumer behaviors and fuel opportunities* Predictive analytics and data science best practices* Data innovation & execution to power our world-class multi-channel marketing engine* Sophisticated measurement of marketing investment and program incrementalityAbout the Role* Deliver customer analytic projects, providing actionable insights to business stakeholders. Examples include:* Customer demographics, KPIs and other profile metrics for each brand as well as for key initiatives* Insights to drive new customer acquisition, reactivation and retention* Customer value, needs and preferences across life stages and cohorts* Market basket and other product-level analyses* Responsible for all stages of analytic projects, including:* Objective identification and hypothesis development* Source data identification* Programming in SQL, SAS, Python, R or other statistical package for data manipulation and analysis* Interpretation and extraction of insights* Synthesis, packaging (including visualization) and communication of findings and recommendations* Connect web & sales data to derive insights about how customers interact with both our online and offline shopping channels* Publish business intelligence reporting for KPI tracking and performance trending* Develop consumer surveys including questionnaire design and implementation, results interpretation and communication with actionable results* Collaborate with Technology partners to improve data quality, new data capture and drive efficiency in usage.* Seek continuous improvement in process improvement, analytics tools and techniques, automation, results visualization and storytelling. Keep up with industry best practices.You're excited about this opportunity because you will...* Work on a variety of analytic projects, across brands and different business opportunities, but always with the customer at the center of everything we do* Collaborate with smart and motivated team members and stakeholders who are curious and like to innovate* Make an impact by providing insightful data to guide decision making and offer proactive solutions in a culture that is very data-driven and values our teamWhy you will love working at Williams-Sonoma, Inc.* We're a successful, fast-growing company with an entrepreneurial vibe* A technologically and data-driven business* Competitive salaries and comprehensive health benefits* We're at the forefront of tech and retail, redefining technology for the next generation* We're passionate about our internal and external clients and live/breathe the client experience* We get to be creative on a daily basis* A smart, experienced leadership team that wants to do it right and is open to new ideas* We believe in autonomy and reward taking initiative* We have fun!REQUIREMENTS AND QUALIFICATIONSWe're excited about you because...* You have excellent analytic and critical thinking skills, combined with strong written and verbal communication skills* You have a strong ability to translate complex data into compelling stories, and have strong data visualization skills that help influence your message* You can get up to speed quickly, can roll-up your sleeves and dig in to the technical details but also step back and see the big picture* You're passionate about consumer data and curious about their behavior, always seeking ways to use data to impact their behavior with us* You have a deep understanding of large scale marketing databases and systems, and expertise in data mining techniques* You work effectively with cross-functional partners in a collaborative environment* You're well-organized, with high attention to detail, deadline-oriented and act with a sense of urgency to drive actionable resultsTechnical Competencies required:* Degree in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Mathematics, Applied Analytics, Operations Research or Computer Science* 4+ years of business-based analytics, with hands-on data analysis experience with a variety of analytic tools. Knowledge of emerging analytic techniques and tools* Excellent SQL skills* Experience analyzing clickstream data* Skilled in Tableau or other similar visualization tool* Exposure to data analysis tools such as Python, SAS, R, and Hive, and an understanding of MapReduce* Experience developing survey questionnaires and analyzing survey results is a plus* Experience in multi-channel consumer retail industry is a major plus* Experience in consumer marketing is a major plusAbout Williams-Sonoma, Inc.Founded in 1956, Williams-Sonoma, Inc. is the premier specialty retailer of high-quality products for the kitchen and home in the United States. Our family of brands are Williams-Sonoma, Pottery Barn, Pottery Barn Kids, PBteen, West Elm, Williams-Sonoma Home, Rejuvenation, and Mark and Graham. These brands are among the best known and most respected in the industry. We offer beautifully-designed, stylish and functional products for every area of the home, including the kitchen, living room, bedroom, home office, closet, laundry room and even outdoor spaces. We've seen some big changes since our first brick-and-mortar store opened more than half of a century ago. What hasn't changed is our passion for high-quality products, functional design, outstanding customer service, and enhancing the lives of our customers and the communities where we operate. Today, we're a multi-brand, multi-channel, global enterprise supported by state-of-the-art technology and some of the most talented teams in retailing - and we're always looking for new energy and ideas.Benefits:Once you are here, you can look forward to a wide variety of benefits. Our corporate vision--to enhance our customers' quality of life at home--extends to the lives of our associates. To that end, we offer an extensive benefits package designed to help you grow, personally and professionally, to keep you healthy, to prepare you for the unexpected, to care for your family and to build a secure future. Depending on your position and your location, here's a look at what you might be eligible for:* A generous discount on all Williams Sonoma Inc. brands through multiple shopping channels* A 401(k) plan and other investment opportunities* Paid vacations, holidays and other time-off programs* Health benefits, including health, dental and vision insurance; health and dependent care tax-free spending accounts; medical, family and bereavement leave; same-sex domestic partner benefits; short- and long-term disability programs; life and travel insurance; an employee assistance program* Tax-free commuter benefits* A wellness program that supports your physical, financial and emotional health* In-person and online learning opportunities through WSI University, LearnIt and AcademyX* Cross-brand and cross-function career opportunities* Quarterly sample sales* A business casual work environment* A bike share program* Time off to volunteer* Matching donations to qualifying nonprofit organizations* Company-sponsored walks and runs* Healthy, organic options in the cafeteria and an awesome salad bar* Discounts on nearby gyms and other local businessesWSI will not now or in the future commence an immigration case or "sponsor" an individual for this position (for example, H-1B or other employment-based immigrationThis role is not eligible for relocation assistance.*LI-JC1Williams-Sonoma, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer.Williams-Sonoma, Inc. will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, or other applicable state or local laws and ordinances.

Name: Assistant Director for Housing Administration
Description: Posting Details  Position Information  Requisition Number 2018-1631Staff Job Title Assistant Director for Housing Administration Job Location Main Campus - Hilltop Salary Type Exempt Minimum Hire-In Rate (for OPE positions only) Job Type Full-Time Union Type Non Union Travel No Travel Work Environment Office Job Summary  The Assistant Director of Housing Administration is responsible for overseeing the room assignment and occupancy management process and serving as the systems administrator for the housing management software system, StarRez, for the Office of Student Housing and Residential Education (SHaRE) within the Division of Student Life.  The Assistant Director is part of the SHaRE Leadership Team and assumes leadership responsibilities at the departmental and University levels. These include working with and chairing SHaRE committees, supervising special projects, and undertaking special assignments. As a member of the larger staff in Student Life, the Assistant Director collaborates and cooperates to create leadership and intercultural competence opportunities to support student learning and development in the Jesuit Catholic tradition.  This position serves in on-call duty capacity for senior-level response. As such this position is required to live on campus.  Job Responsibilities  Data Systems and Occupancy Management Oversees the assignment operations, assignment programs and information systems for student housing. Acts as the primary project manager for the StarRez Housing Management System. Work directly with University information system programs in the development, testing, and refinement of the system for both housing production and employment modules.Works collaboratively with StarCare, ITS, Student Accounts and Business & Finance to ensure smooth interface of the StarRez system.Serves as SHaRE point-of-contact for CS Gold meal plan issuance and issues.Authorizes and maintains user accounts for staff.Provides training, documentation and information for students and staff.Establishes yearly room selection dates in consultation with the Senior Director of Student Housing and Residential Education.Develops and prepares reports, dashboards, and correspondence for the department, division, and campus partners (i.e., detailed residence hall rosters, occupancy reports, etc.).Plans, develops, and maintains housing application as well as student staff selection processes using PortalX.Serves as the primary liaison using the Banner student information system; works closely with ITS and the Banner program.Manages all aspects of the occupancy management system including: a.Develops room allocation model based on incoming student estimates by analyzing historical data to form assumptions and make strategic room allocation decisions  b.Maintenance of a tracking system for incoming contracts  c.Coordinates exemption and contract cancellation processes and tracking of all related activity  d.First-year and continuing student waitlist management  e.Coordinates all associated data collection and reporting Works collaboratively with StarCare, ITS, Student Accounts and Business and Finance, and the Manager of Finance and Operations for the Division of Student Life to ensure the establishment and maintenance of general controls and the elimination of risks related to the StarRez housing software and Banner systems including: a.Reconciliation of financial transactions between StarRez and Banner.  b.Elimination of conflicts by ensuring segregation of duties.  c.StarRez student account reconciliations.  d.Student Meal Plan policy enforcement.  e.Management of unallocated residence housing.  f.Meal plan adjustments reconciliation.  g.Defining governing policies and rules for governing activities between the StarRez and Banner systems.  h.Ensure timeliness of rate tables creation for future terms.  i.Maintenance of advanced charge configurations in alignment with billing timing requirements.  j.Maintenance of application change management processes and documentation.  k.Management and tracking of informal user access in StarRez system.  l.Ongoing management of StarRez user access roles.  m.Monitoring of job logs in StarRez system.  Supervision of staff Recruits, selects, trains, supervises, and evaluates Housing Assignment Coordinators.Conduct regular meetings with the Hall Assignments Team.Provide functional area supervision to other SHaRE staff pertaining to areas within the Housing Administration domain. Operations and Customer Service Addresses student and parent concerns with regards to assignment, contract, roommate requests, changes and refund requests. Determines resolution of all resident petitions for early contract cancellation, change, reductions and refunds.Collaborates with SHaRE Central Office staff in the development of departmental policies, long-range planning and responses to issues and trends affecting on and off campus housing.Oversees all functions relating to the Room Assignment Process, Continuing Student Room Selection, New Student Room Selection, Consolidations, etc.Develops and administers a variety of systems to maintain office files and records for rapid reference.Practices customer service by explaining policy and procedural issues to students or other stakeholders.Participates in the coordination of check-in and checkout of residents throughout the year.Coordinates exception and contract cancellation processes and tracking of all related activity.Arranges regular building audits with the Associate Director of Facility Operations.Attends regular one-on-one meetings with the Senior Director of Student Housing and Residential Education.Attends regular SHaRE department meetings and Central Office meetings.Other duties as assigned. Professional Relationships Develops and maintains relationships with faculty, staff and administration at the University, with special attention paid to, but not limited to: Business and Finance, ITS, Admission, ROTC, CIPE, Living-Learning Communities, Athletics, One Card, Student Disability Services, International Scholar and Student Services, Student Accounts, and JEEP.Serves on selected department and University committees.Attends and as appropriate presents at student affairs related conferences, workshops and retreats in order to develop new skills and experience. Accountability to University Vision, Mission, and Values  As part of the larger staff in Student Life, the Assistant Director for Housing Administration collaborates and cooperates across divisions and departments to create a supportive University community that encourages student learning and development in the Jesuit Catholic tradition and commits to: Promoting a common good that includes the needs of all studentsEngaging differences in a manner that allows students to learn from the diversity of perspectives, experiences and traditions that exist within the University communityProviding experiences that challenge students to develop spiritually, intellectually, emotionally, physically, socially, culturally and morally in order to prepare them to contribute to the University communityDrawing out the leadership qualities inherent in every individual, and to providing opportunities for students to apply knowledge and skillsCreating an environment that supports a socially responsible way of being together in communityRecognizing and celebrating the achievements and contributions of all students Supervision Received  The Assistant Director for Housing Administration reports to and is directly supervised by the Senior Director for SHaRE. Verbal and email contact is expected on a regular and frequent basis. Written reports may be necessary as a follow-up to specific situations within the supervised communities. The periodic evaluation of the occupancy management strategy and personnel will occur with the Senior Director in consultation with other members of the SHaRE Leadership Team. Decisions involving policy, procedures, and personnel with regards to housing occupancy and systems management are at the discretion of the Assistant Director and should be communicated to, and made in consultation with, the Senior Director of SHaRE.  Minimum Requirements  Bachelor's degree required; three to five years of relevant experience. Masters degree in Higher Education, Business Administration, Data Analytics, or Information Systems strongly preferred. Evidence of the ability to provide excellent service and problem-solving skills. Strong oral and written communication skills. Ability to act independently, use independent judgment and multi-task in a busy and high traffic environment. Experience using the StarRez and CS Gold systems preferred. Evidence of ability to work within a cooperative and collaborative environment. Ability to work some weekend and evening hours.  Additional Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities Special Instructions to Applicants Job Open Date 10/02/2018 Job Close Date Posted until Filled Yes About USF  The University of San Francisco is located in the heart of one of the world's most innovative and diverse cities, and is home to a vibrant academic community of students and faculty who achieve excellence in their fields. Its diverse student body enjoys direct access to faculty, small classes and outstanding opportunities in the city itself. USF is San Francisco's first university, and its Jesuit Catholic mission helps ignite a student's passion for social justice and a desire to "Change the World From Here." For more information, visit www.usfca.edu.  EEO Policy  The University is an equal opportunity institution of higher education. The University does not discriminate in employment, educational services and academic programs on the basis of an individual's race, color, religion, religious creed, ancestry, national origin, age (except minors), sex, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, medical condition (cancer-related and genetic-related) and disability, and the other bases prohibited by law. The University reasonably accommodates qualified individuals with disabilities under the law.  Fair Chance Ordinance  Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. For more information visit: http://sfgov.org/olse/fair-chance-ordinance-fco.  Supplemental Questions  Required fields are indicated with an asterisk (*). * How did you hear about USF employment opportunities?USF websiteA current USF employeeA former USF employeeA newspaper, magazine, or higher education periodicalThe Chronicle of Higher Education website or magazineMonster.comCraig's ListIndeed.comLinkedInOther: Please specify belowIf you selected Other above, please specify (Please Limit Description to 150 Characters) (Open Ended Question) * Are you 18 years or older?YesNo* If selected, do you agree to submit to a background check?YesNo* If selected, are you able to provide original documentation showing your authorization to work in the United States?YesNo Applicant Documents  Required Documents Cover LetterResume Optional DocumentsSDL2017

Name: Technical Program Lead
Description: About OpendoorAt Opendoor, we’re on a mission to make it simple to buy and sell homes. The traditional process is broken, with an average home taking over 90 days to sell and costing thousands of dollars. We make buying and selling a home stress-free and instant. We’ve built an exceptional team, have raised over $300 million from top-notch investors and are growing fast, buying and selling more than $100 million of homes per month.We’re looking for a talented Technical Program Lead to join our platform team. You will work closely with counterparts in our various business units, analytics and engineering to ensure that our data and analytics platform and the functionality it supports, meets the needs for the broader growth around market expansion and customer oriented goals of Opendoor. You will lead complex, multi-disciplinary engineering projects using your engineering expertise. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating them to project stakeholders. You're equally at home explaining your team's analyses and recommendations to stakeholders as you are discussing the technical trade-offs in product development with engineers.Responsibilities: Formulate, structure and drive technical programs for the platform teams spanning Data Infrastructure, Analytics and the Foundation teams.Influence the outcomes for the programs you manage without formal authority over cross functional teams that need to contribute.Take the lead in providing clarity and structure in ambiguous situations through a rigorous approach to problem solving, asking the right questions and applying insights you’ve gained.Develop and cultivate fruitful and meaningful partnerships and outcomes with all stakeholders, thinking in terms of the products we build and metrics that are meaningful.Roll up your sleeves as required, and derive solutions from data by writing your own analytics scripts and tools.Originate and drive initiatives focused on improving program execution and engineering excellence. Focus on delivering consistent results and customer impact.Basic Qualifications:5+ years of technical program management experience, including delivery of entire products from start to finishStrong analytical and quantitative skills; ability to work with business owners and product management to define key business questions and to build data sets that answer those questionsAbility to multi-task and manage tasks with varying priorities.Excellent written and oral communication skills with technical and non-technical stakeholders.Understanding of the technical architecture of complex and highly scalable data and analytics applications including but not limited to data pipelines, micro services, relational and NoSQL databases and cloud architectures.Comfortable working in a fast paced, highly collaborative and dynamic work environment.Bachelors degree in computer science, engineering or a related technical discipline.Preferred Qualifications:Familiarity with big data platform technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, Presto, Hive, RedShift, etc.You have worked with Amazon Web Services(AWS) technologies.Opendoor values OpennessOur team celebrates our diverse backgrounds, being open about who we are and what we do allows us to be better. Individuals seeking employment at Opendoor are considered without regards to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or other protected status under all applicable laws, regulations, and ordinances.This position is for employment at will and not for any definite time period.

Name: Sr Associate Director of Enrollment Data Systems, ERP
Description: Posting Details  Position Information  Requisition Number 2018-1592Staff Job Title Sr Associate Director of Enrollment Data Systems, ERP Job Location Main Campus - Hilltop Salary Type Exempt Minimum Hire-In Rate (for OPE positions only) Job Type Full-Time Union Type Non Union Travel No Travel Work Environment Office Job Summary  The Senior Associate Director of Enrollment Data Systems uses data and system analysis to identify opportunities to improve business processes. The Senior Associate Director is the lead subject matter analyst in Strategic Enrollment Management (SEM) systems and business processes that supports the USF Student Lifecycle. The Sr. AD collaborates with Undergraduate Admissions, Student Financial Services, The Office of the  Registrar, Graduate Enrollment, International Admissions, and Enrollment Communications within SEM to ensure proper data gathering and optimal Enrollment Management system usage in support of SEM's business functions. The Sr. AD is the leading divisional expert in of Banner Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) system's General, Student, and Financial Aid modules, the Degree Works student success tracking systems and other  technical tools and services SEM acquires for its business needs. The Sr. AD manages the support of SEM's use of Ellucian's Banner Student Information (SIS) system and is responsible for maximizing Banner Student and Financial Aid modules functionality to advance SEM's business goals. The Sr. AD also manages decision support services required by SEM leadership and staff including but not limited to data reporting via Slate, USF Operational Data Store (ODS), and Tableau. The Sr. AD works with the Center for Institutional Planning and  Effectiveness (CIPE) to ensure data integrity and with the Information Technology Services (ITS) Project Management Office and ITS Application Services on technical solution evaluations and system implementations. The Sr. AD reports to the AVP of Integrated Enrollment Data Management. The Sr. AD is  responsible for supervising and developing one Assistant Directors' skillset and responsibilities as well as student workers in Enrollment Data Systems. The Sr. AD is expected to take a leadership role within the  Enrollment Data Systems team, to exercise independent and critical thinking, and to advise management and end users on the best way to implement and enhance technology to achieve strategic administrative and operational goals. Additionally, the Sr. AD provides best-practices guidance on Banner ERP use and  functionality both to colleagues in SEM and the schools, colleges, and related student service offices. The Sr. AD is responsible for ensuring data integration provides optimal data accessibility and share use of enrollment data between SEM's systems functions efficiently.  Job Responsibilities Lead and mentor Assistant Director and student worker(s) in SEM data and business processes in support of SEM's strategic goals. Prioritize and manage Enrollment Data Systems activities. Report statues regular to AVP, IEDM.Work closely with Director and Senior Associate Directors in Financial Aid for the annual review and implementation of the Financial Aid packaging scheme for new admits and continuing students. Create reports and support in monitoring the effectiveness of the FinAid packaging implementation, provide troubleshooting support and issue resolution. Work closely with Associate Registrars in leading Banner upgrades, migration, new version and/or functionality implementation. Provide support to Student Accounts including but not limited to operational reporting, data integrity, integration assistance between CashNet and Banner. Create reports and provide configuration support for Registrar's Office including but not limited to registration, grades, graduation, credit transfers set up and monitoring. Design assessment strategies to determine if business processes and technical solutions have achieved desired objectives. Manages Banner configuration, maintenance, updating, and data conflict resolution.Generate Reports and SQL programs for tabular and statistical reporting, as well as produce ad hoc reports for SEM. Provide proactive solutions to data collection issues through workflow analysis.Provide proactive recommendation to data collection enhancement.Keep current with new data collection, retrieval, and analysis tools and services to aid in the continuous improvement of SEM reporting needs and services. Participate in functions, events, and ceremonies managed by SEM.Proactively work with AVP, IDEM to use data and systems analysis to identify opportunities to improve business processes and collaborate with appropriate stakeholders in developing recommendations  and/or solution. Take the lead in the creation of end-to-end test plans while executing and managing activities in the test plan to ensure that all objectives are met and that the solution works as expected. Leverage knowledge of business process analysis methodology, processes, tools, and administration with strong emphasis on business improvement, standardization, documentation, and training. Review and understand user documentation and/or release notes from vendors as well as change requests within USF to analyze impact to SEM systems and operations. Recommend changes in policies  and procedures as applicable. Draw on professional experience to help lead and mentor various teams including and not limited to training end users regarding any new functionalities and features included in upgrades, releases, and  new solutions. Ensure data standards are widely known and used by all users of SEM systems.Administer budgetary approval for direct report.Support SEM analysis and forecasting efforts by coordinating with CIPE in the development and creation of critical dashboards, reports. Maintain expert knowledge of SEM systems and stay abreast of SEM data structures, report extraction techniques, and software solutions. Maintain professional knowledge by attending conferences, training, and, participating in professional communities. Ensure the integrity and confidentiality of the student academic records by complying with FERPA and USF academic policies. Conduct Technology Tool Assessment; Create system documentation.Perform other related duties as assigned. Minimum Requirements Bachelor's degree required.8 years of experience working in a university enrollment management with at least 3 years of experience as the leading divisional expert in the Banner Student and Banner Financial Aid modules. Extensive knowledge of Banner SIS as well as business processes within the Office of the Registrar, Student Financial Aid, and Student Accounts. Ability to administer and configure Banner SIS as an  expert user. Experience in Banner Student and Banner Financial Aid implementation. Knowledge of Banner Student and Banner Financial Aid data structure required.Knowledge of enrollment CRM and Admissions processes a plus.Advance skills in SQL for both reporting and Banner system configurationOutstanding customer service orientation. Must show characteristics of sound judgment based on information available to support good decision-making. Very strong interpersonal and communication skills; highly articulate in both verbal and written forms, translating complex technical concepts into non-technical language. Accountable and empowered ability to take responsibility, self-start to ensure realization of SEM goals. Strong desire and aptitude to continue learning and broadening professional skills with SEM.Understanding of and the ability to apply Business Process Analysis techniques and methodologies. EX: capable of producing scope and requirements documentation, cost benefit analysis, and change  requests, etc. Experience analyzing business processes to develop and implement proposals to  enhance functionality. Proven problem solving skills with ability to assess a specific business scenario and develop an appropriate process and/or technical approach to support the desired business outcomes. Excellent analytical skills, including the ability to understand systems and software as they relate to processes and data. Ability to analyze project dependencies to prioritize competing demands for  business users and team members. Project management skills and experience.Ability to handle multiple complex work priorities; Ability to organize, plan, and work on projects with little to no supervision. Ability to act as project lead in a team environment. Ability to mentor and grow team members' skillset. Understanding of and commitment to University of San Francisco's Vision, Mission and Values.At least two to three years of progressive IT responsibility, particularly in a Banner student/admission/student accounts/financial aid environment and Slate enrollment CRM environment  Additional Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities  Position could require occasional time spend at the SF Downtown location.  Position could require occasional work on nights and weekends for university functions and ceremonies.  Special Instructions to Applicants Job Open Date 08/08/2018 Job Close Date Posted until Filled Yes About USF  The University of San Francisco is located in the heart of one of the world's most innovative and diverse cities, and is home to a vibrant academic community of students and faculty who achieve excellence in their fields. Its diverse student body enjoys direct access to faculty, small classes and outstanding opportunities in the city itself. USF is San Francisco's first university, and its Jesuit Catholic mission helps ignite a student's passion for social justice and a desire to "Change the World From Here." For more information, visit www.usfca.edu.  EEO Policy  The University is an equal opportunity institution of higher education. The University does not discriminate in employment, educational services and academic programs on the basis of an individual's race, color, religion, religious creed, ancestry, national origin, age (except minors), sex, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, medical condition (cancer-related and genetic-related) and disability, and the other bases prohibited by law. The University reasonably accommodates qualified individuals with disabilities under the law.  Fair Chance Ordinance  Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. For more information visit: http://sfgov.org/olse/fair-chance-ordinance-fco. Name: EPIC Clarity Analyst
Description: Job Title: EPIC Clarity Analyst  Location: San Francisco, CA  Type: Contract  The EPIC Clarity Analyst works closely with clinicians across hospital / healthcare departments to optimize effective use of systems. Pulls required data from Clarity and coordinates analytical support for health management and research, including profiling, health economics, and business analytics / performance metrics.  Defines systems and applications to support various functions.  Provides customer service, troubleshooting and maintenance.  Manages programs that include formulating strategies and administering policies, processes, and resources; functions with a high degree of autonomy. Responsibilities: Collaborate with business operations, healthcare clinicians, and IT applications and technical teams to translate operations workflow and patient experience objectives into technical requirements.  Leads project teams to improve clinical informatics results and provide advice  Performs highly-complex quality assurance testing, designs and runs SQL (Structured Query Language) queries for enhanced and complex medical data access, and plans, develops, and writes documentation. Knowledge Skills and Abilities: Advanced ability to serve as a technical leader and information resource, and to work collaboratively with senior staff and management across departments, providing advice, counsel, and analysis on issues of policy, functionality, system efficiency, upgrades, business analytics, and industry advances and trends.Education, Licenses and Certifications: Bachelor's degree in health care information technology, computer science, or related area, and / or equivalent combination of experience / training.  Certification: Epic Clarity Data Model

Name: Deloitte Risk and Financial Advisory Consultant (Full-Time) Summer/Fall 2019 - University of California Berkeley
Description: Position summaryDo you thrive in times of disruption? Have a passion for turning challenges and opportunities into long-term competitive advantages? As a Consultant in Deloitte Risk and Financial Advisory, you’ll have the opportunity to gain valuable hands-on experience working alongside leading professionals across diverse industries while building your professional skills in a variety of project experiences. Our Deloitte Risk and Financial Advisory practice helps organizations effectively navigate business risks and opportunities—from strategic, reputation, and financial risks to operational, cyber, and regulatory risks—to gain competitive advantage. We apply our experience in ongoing business operations and corporate lifecycle events to help clients become stronger and more resilient. Our market-leading team’s help clients embrace complexity to accelerate performance, disrupt through innovation, and lead in their industries.Work you’ll do As a Consultant, you will have the opportunity to work on multiple projects leveraging your business or technology related degree to help our clients more confidently make decisions to drive performance. You will help our clients embrace change, grow their business, accelerate performance, and navigate periods of crisis or controversy and emerge resilient.  The type of work you focus on will be influenced by your office placement and business needs. Your recruiter will be able to provide more information about our offices. Projects may be aligned to the following areas and include:  • Internal Audit & Assurance: Helping clients advance transparency, relevance, and the quality of information disclosed to the markets and investors so that they can meet regulatory and attestation requirements. Inspecting accounting systems and controls for improvement opportunities, leveraging our methodologies to help clients improve their information technology controls or technology risk management programs, and/or participate in the development or execution of internal audit strategic plans Regulatory & Operational Risk: Supporting clients with their most pressing regulatory and operational challenges. Helping them to identify, remediate, monitor, exploit, and manage enterprise risks and create value through implementing a compliant, resilient enterpriseForensic: Assisting with compiling, analyzing, and documenting facts for matters under investigation or in litigation and helping clients manage and respond to internal and external investigations, regulatory concerns, litigation, and other business controversyRisk Intelligence: Helping clients to embrace their most strategic risks, providing a platform of advisory services that enable senior executives to plan for, spot, assess, manage, and respond to brand and reputational, financial, catastrophic risks and unforeseen threats that could undermine their competitive position and jeopardize their critical assets, reputation or financial standing  Regardless of project type, your work will require:Proficiency in verbal and written communication skills essential to interacting with clients and teamsAbility to work independently and manage multiple projects/assignments/responsibilities in a fast-paced environmentProblem solving and critical thinking skillsAbility to quickly and concisely research and collect data from unique placesAbility to synthesize data and convey information in a meaningful way The team Deloitte Risk and Financial Advisory helps organizations navigate a variety of risks to lead in the marketplace and disrupt through innovation. The insights of our professionals, combined with our specialized products and services, help clients learn how to embrace complexity and leverage their position of strength to accelerate performance. Learn more about our Deloitte Risk and Financial Advisory practice at Deloitte.QualificationsRequired:Undergraduate or Master’s degrees in the following majors will be considered: o Accounting or related degree. A concentration in management information systems, business analytics or other business technology related areas is a plus  o Technology related degree such as Management Information Systems, Business Analytics, Computer Science, Computer Information Systems, Data Analytics, Engineering, Information Science/Management and Math  o Other majors will be considered with a concentration in accounting or a related area A strong understanding of Windows-based applications including proficiency with Microsoft Excel, Word, and PowerPointTravel (domestic and possibly international) up to 75% may be required, depending on role and location  Preferred:Meets minimum requirements for CPA eligibility or other relevant certifications before beginning full-time employmentStrong academic track record (minimum GPA of 3.2)Relevant work experience or work experience in a professional environment (e.g., internships, summer positions, school jobs) How you’ll grow Through your variety of experiences at Deloitte, you will have the opportunity to develop analytical, communication, and leadership skills that can help you achieve your full potential, no matter what career path you eventually choose. You will be continually challenged by your clients, your team members, and your peers. Along the way, you will have access to mentoring, counseling, and training opportunities to help foster and accelerate your development of new skills and capabilities. For new campus hires, we offer extensive onboarding and new hire training to help you hit the ground running. You’ll travel to Deloitte University for national new hire training that includes technical and soft skills training, as well as invaluable networking opportunities. Explore Deloitte University, The Leadership Center. Benefits At Deloitte, we know that great people make a great organization. We value our people and offer employees a broad range of benefits. Learn more about what working at Deloitte can mean for you. Deloitte’s culture Our positive and supportive culture encourages our people to do their best work every day. We celebrate individuals by recognizing their uniqueness and offering them the flexibility to make daily choices that can help them to be healthy, centered, confident, and aware. We offer well-being programs and are continuously looking for new ways to maintain a culture where our people excel and lead healthy, happy lives. Learn more about Life at Deloitte. Corporate citizenship Deloitte is led by a purpose: to make an impact that matters. This purpose defines who we are and extends to relationships with our clients, our people and our communities. We believe that business has the power to inspire and transform. We focus on education, giving, skill-based volunteerism, and leadership to help drive positive social impact in our communities. Learn more about Deloitte’s impact on the world.Recruiter tips We want job seekers exploring opportunities at Deloitte to feel prepared and confident. To help you with your interview, we suggest that you do your research: know some background about the organization and the business area you’re applying to. We also suggest that you brush up on your interviewing skills and practice discussing your experience and job history with a family member, friend, or mentor. Check out recruiting tips from Deloitte professionals.As used in this document, “Deloitte” means Deloitte LLP and its subsidiaries. Please see www.deloitte.com/us/about for a detailed description of the legal structure of Deloitte LLP and its subsidiaries. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability or protected veteran status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law.  Deloitte will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance where applicable. See notices of various ban-the-box laws where available. https://www2.deloitte.com/us/en/pages/careers/articles/ban-the-box-notices.html Requisition code: S19CALEF20JULCS-RFA

Name: Full Stack Software Engineer
Description: Job Description A San Francisco company who is revolved around an advanced networked business analytics platform, is looking to add a Full Stack Software Engineer to their growing team. This individual would be interested in building the most advanced systems to solve business problems. You would be responsible for enterprise applications and shared components of their Java-based platform for Business Intelligence and Analytics system. You will design and develop systems by using Agile development methodology and support existing and new product features.  Required Skills & Experience BE/ME/MCA Computer Science degree or related field 3 to 5 years of software development experience with solid foundation in data structures, algorithms and software design with strong analytical and debugging skills Working knowledge of using JavaScript libraries such as jQuery and frameworks such as AngularJS, ReactJS Hands on experience on developing web content using web markup, including HTML5 and CSS3. Knowledge of designing, developing and maintaining RESTful based APIs Desired Skills & Experience Knowledge of data structures ETL processes and tools Familiarity of Caching, Clustering, Distributed Computing What You Will Be Doing Tech Breakdown  Java JavaScript Dropwizard/Spring Boot Angular JS/React JS HTML5 MongoDB SQL Daily Responsibilities  100% Hands On The Offer Competitive Salary: Up to $190k/year, DOE You will receive the following benefits:  Medical Insurance & Health Savings Account (HSA) 401(k) 3 weeks PTO Flexible Remote Days Pre-tax Commuter Benefit

Name: Product Manager, Head of Family Services
Description: With over 15 million active users and $90 million in venture funding, Life360 is the world’s largest mobile app for families. Today, we are very focused on location sharing and safety, but our mission is to become the must-have Family Membership that gives families peace of mind anytime and anywhere.  Our team is focused on building technology that helps families feel safe and together even when they are outside of the home and apart. From personalized location-based alerts that help make daily coordination easier, to advanced sensor tech that can detect if you are in a car crash and automatically send you an ambulance, we are leveraging smartphones to their fullest extent to reinvent how families get through the day.  You will be joining Life360 at a key moment in our history. We doubled active users and tripled revenue in 2017, and we are scaling our team to accommodate this rapid growth. We currently have 95 full-time employees, with offices in San Francisco, Las Vegas, and San Diego.About the JobWe are looking for an exceptional product manager that can translate user needs into a cohesive suite of family-oriented products and services. You will be responsible for creating the vision, strategy, and roadmap across family communication (messaging, photo sharing, check-ins), coordination (location reminders, scheduling, lists), and safety (trusted contacts, emergency guides, safety services) to help families stay connected and coordinated in their everyday lives. The ideal candidate is a strategic thinker that has deep user empathy and an obsession for great user experience. We are looking for a leader that build amazing products that will propel Life360 through various stages of revenue and user growth. This role reports to the VP of Product Management at Life360.ResponsibilitiesCreate a compelling product vision and roadmap in collaboration with key stakeholdersOwn the product lifecycle from research and requirements gathering through development and releaseConsistently monitor and improve the core user metrics for the company - from customer satisfaction/quality to user experience to subscription/revenueManage product marketing, user education, and communication touch points throughout the experiencePartner with growth, analytics and marketing teams to enable faster iteration of experimentsDirectly hire, manage and develop a team of product managersBe a strong and powerful voice across the company for the family coordination and safety experienceQualifications7+ years of consumer internet or mobile product management experienceTrack record of successfully delivering products with demonstrable business impactProven analytical skills and data-driven prioritization and decision makingTechnical background in Computer Science, Math, or related engineering disciplines. MBA preferred.Strong oral and communication skillsFamiliarity with location based mobile appsKnowledge of subscription based revenue modelsPerksFridays are Work From Home days at Life360Competitive pay and benefitsFree snacks, drinks (three ways to brew your favorite cup of coffee), and food in the officeCatered lunches throughout the weekHealth, dental and vision insurance plans401k plan$200/month Quality of Life perkA great office with plenty of light in the heart of the SOMA district in beautiful San FranciscoWhatever makes you stronger makes us stronger. We buy you the things you need to improve yourself and get your job done

Name: Software SaaS Security Technical Business Analyst
Description: Job descriptionMortgage Cadence, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Accenture, has been partnering with mortgage lenders since 1999, offering the industry’s only true one-stop shop mortgage technology solutions designed for point-of-sale through post-closing. In a time when efficiency, speed and the customer experience are paramount to the success of lenders, Mortgage Cadence offers the most reliable software and dedicated people, supporting lenders every step of the way. Each of our products has revolutionized the mortgage lending process in some way, changing the way lenders lend and borrowers finance.  As a software company, we think like a start-up, with every employee empowered and encouraged to be visionary. Teamwork and innovation define what we do as we take our customers into the future by providing the last lending solution they will ever need.Role description: Work with the business to  define technical and functional requirements. Assess the security architecture, ensuring that it meets  the business requirements and performance goals as defined by the long term  direction. Work with other architects and leads to ensure that the security  components security technology, operations, and management are integrated as  defined in the requirements. Fully understand the capabilities and limitations  of the security components: security technology, operations, and  management . Review and assist with integration of the security architecture requirements for production and sub production  environments. Review and assist with integration of all non-functional requirements,  including technical,and operations  requirements. Participate in decisions regarding hardware, network products, and  software for security architecture. Participate  in decisions regarding software design architecture. Participate in the security architecture analysis, design, and  implementation, and ensure that the product fulfills the requirements. When  applicable, work with the solution integration architect on these tasks. Work  with the support unit to determine how the application is supported in  production, including back ups, disaster recovery, system performance, and  project management. Obtain stakeholder buy in for designs. Validate the design  with the stakeholders to ensure that the design satisfies the requirements.  Review security architecture deliverables throughout development to ensure  quality and requirement traceability. Identify and communicate any cross area  or cross release issues that affect other project areas. Ensure adherence to  all quality management plans and standards by participating in quality  management reviews. Make sure that the security components interact to fulfill  the requirements and meet performance goals. Participate in confirming the  completeness and consistency of the design deliverables. Assist with Resolution of any  inconsistencies discovered. + Basic qualificationsMinimum of 5 years of experience with enterprise, infrastructure, or application security architectureMinimum of 5 years of experience with cloud architectures and API web-services delivery, risks, and controls.Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP)Preferred Skill Requirements:Information Systems Security Architect Professional (ISSAP) or Information - Systems Security Engineering Professional (ISSEP) or similar certification preferredApplication Development background preferredAbility to identify and define security architecture components as new requirements ariseAbility to define the complete security infrastructure environmentAbility to interact communicate with business effectivelyAbility to maintain current knowledge of all relevant security technology, operations, management developments and seek opportunities to deploy new technologies that benefit the businessAbility to assemble and test security componentsAbility to provide technical leadership on client engagement, including serving as a resource to the project team and the client by evaluating and proposing technical alternatives for resolving business and technology issuesAbility to create security architecture scope, definition, construction, and executionAbility to design and develop cost effective security solutions that meet functional, technical, and performance requirementsAbility to map business requirements to technology capabilityAbility to identify gaps and omissions in the end to end solutionAbility to review ongoing and proposed projects to identify opportunities for reuse and process improvementAbility to review project deliverables for completeness, quality, and compliance with established project standardsAbility to provide security expertise to project resources and the client to meet project deadlines and ensure that project objectives are metAbility to consult with and develop resources for methods, procedures, and standards to use during design, and unit testing phases of the projectAbility to document and communicate the status of progress against plans, taking corrective action as necessaryApplicants for employment in the US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States and with Accenture (i.e., H1-B visa, F-1 visa (OPT), TN visa or any other non-immigrant status).  Candidates who are currently employed by a client of Accenture or an affiliated Accenture business may not be eligible for consideration.  Accenture is a Federal Contractor and an EEO and Affirmative Action Employer of Females/Minorities/Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities.  Equal Employment Opportunity  All employment decisions shall be made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other basis as protected by federal, state, or local law.  Job candidates will not be obligated to disclose sealed or expunged records of conviction or arrest as part of the hiring process.  Accenture is committed to providing veteran employment opportunities to our service men and women. APPLY SAVE THIS JOBShare

Description: OverviewAbout First Republic: First Republic is an ultra-high-touch bank that provides extraordinary client service. We believe that one-on-one interactions build lasting relationships. We move quickly to serve our clients’ needs so that their financial transactions are handled with ease and efficiency. Client trust and security are paramount in our line of business. Ultimately, our goal is unsurpassed client satisfaction which will lead to personal referrals – our number one source of new business. We recognize that our competitive advantage starts with our people and our culture. At First Republic, we work hard and move quickly as a very coordinated team. If you are looking for an opportunity to grow and contribute in a fun, fast-paced environment, First Republic is the place for you. We have exceptional people focused on providing extraordinary service.ResponsibilitiesAbout the Role: We are looking for a hands on Senior Marketing Manager, focused on B2B marketing who will be responsible for driving top of funnel product growth. Name: Senior CRM Manager
Description: TripAdvisor is the world’s largest online travel site, visited by 390 million travellers each month, and our business – TripAdvisor Experiences (including Viator) – is one of the fastest growing key areas not just for TripAdvisor, but across the travel industry. We provide the experiences that help travellers create unforgettable memories and make the most of their trips, from champagne brunch on top the Eiffel Tower to cage diving with sharks in Hawaii. TripAdvisor provides a unique, global work environment that captures the speed, innovation and excitement of a start-up, at a thriving, growing and well-established industry brand. You will be part of a dynamic, fun, and energetic team where you can immediately make meaningful contributions.  This is a unique opportunity to work for one of the most progressive companies in the digital space. We’re looking for a talented Senior CRM Manager to own critical elements of our Experiences & Travel Agents email programmes, as well as assisting in technical projects that increase our efficiency and improve the experience for both our travellers and travel agents.  Why this job is excellent  As a Senior CRM Manager for a pioneering digital organisation, you will play an integral part in shaping its future success. This is a fantastic opportunity for a technically-minded CRM manager to further develop their skills whilst creating groundbreaking customer & travel agents experiences that drive exponential business growth.  What you’ll get  You’ll be surrounded by a leading team of digital experts who will support your development within a fast-paced business environment. Working alongside seasoned CRM professionals, you will report to the CRM Director and have frequent exposure to the senior leadership in the organisation.  You’ll get experience of working across the entire company by building partnerships with key stakeholders (Customer Service, Marketing, Sales, Business Development, Product and Engineering functions).  What Youll Do  This is a pivotal role, which requires end-to-end delivery from capturing business requirements through to planning, product delivery, and evaluation of performance against KPIs.  You’ll be highly motivated and excel at managing multiple projects simultaneously to test and execute immediate change.  Responsibilities will include, but not be restricted to:  Responsible for planning, developing and executing strategies to drive user engagement and improve conversion and repeat rates of Viator Travel Agents  Translate business goals into accurate delivery requirements, including but not limited to: specifying required data, segmentation & targeting logic, and dynamic content requirements  Work cross functionality with product, engineering, coding, copy, business development, design, analytics, and other teams outside of CRM, to deliver programs and initiatives  Conduct in-depth user research & quantitative analytics that will directly impact strategy and the roadmap  Writing technical specs, testing and executing email programmes as per business needs  Own comprehensive daily, weekly, monthly reporting of all relevant CRM KPIs & build the right dashboards to track and socialize performance  Articulate and present strategy, progress, results and data analyses / learnings effectively to stakeholders and the wider business  Serve as the CRM expert for Viator Travel Agents program to drive smooth execution and optimization  Managing one-off email requests  What We Seek  5+ years’ experience working in a CRM role in a high energy online environment  Proven history of developing high quality digital user experiences  Ability to manage large, cross-functional projects and deal with multiple monthly launches  Proactive & independent, always looking for ways to take initiative and improve existing programs/processes  Superb verbal and written communication skills with a high degree of comfort interpreting results and communicating insights effectively to stakeholders and senior leadership  Experience working with Coding and Engineering teams to drive technical projects  Meticulous attention to detail with a clear, methodological approach to problem solving  Results-driven marketer with proven quantitative and analytical skills; should be extremely comfortable with Excel (functions, pivots, etc.).  Creative problem-solving skills with focus on efficient execution while balancing big-picture thinking  Undergraduate degree required
