Name: (Lead/Senior) Database and Implementation Engineer
Description: (Lead/Senior) Database and Implementation Engineer  Location: San Francisco  Reports To: Director of Engineering  Aktana is looking for a talented Senior Database Engineer to help develop and administer large-scale data integration, data processing and data analytics database and platform.  Responsibilities:   Architect, design, and implement large scale data management and business analytics  solutions at a detailed level by applying industry knowledge, best practices, and  architectural guidance to ensure system functionality, performance, and cost efficiencies   Create packages, procedures, functions, triggers, and views to implement business logics   Analyze and understand data sources and end-user requirements to deliver data  integration solutions for managing Aktana data.   Design, build, test, implement, and support ETL/Data Integration solutions that meet  defined requirements   Formulate and implement monitoring, security, and availability policies, procedures and  standards relating to server and storage management.   Manage database updates to production using SQL scripts or other automation  technology   Script and/or develop in-depth application and database monitoring tools and recovery  mechanisms.   Background in tuning and optimizing of MySQL, SQL Server, Oracle, or Postgres  environments as well as diagnosing and solving performance issues.  Requirements:  Education  o BS/MS degree in Computer Science or related fields and/or equivalent work experience.  People and Project Management Skills  o Excellent verbal and written English communication skills  o Ability to lead and mentor heterogeneous engineering teams in complex projects  o Incredible work ethic that thrives in fast paced, collaborative, dynamic team work  environment  o Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously, meeting different schedules and  deadlines  o Proven ability and desire to deliver projects on time, on quality  o Able to cope with and thrive in uncertain and changing project requirements  o Ability to lead technical projects and code at the same time  o Experience with/understanding of Agile development processes  Technology Skills and Experience  o 5+ years database development and architecture experience in a production  environment supporting large data platforms.  o Strong experience of data modeling, schema design, and stored procedures  o Strong experience on SQL, Procedural SQL including programming and ways to  optimize SQL code in one of RDBMS environments  o 4+ years of ETL Development experience with strong ETL and SQL  programming skills (required); MySQL experience (required)  o Experience with ETL (required), Pentaho (preferred), Informatica or similar tools  o Working experience with both high volume OLTP and high volume batch processing  o Tuning experience with high volume OLTP and high volume batch processing  o Strong scripting and automation skills with bash, perl, python, java, or ruby on Linux  and Windows environments.  o Demonstrated understanding of RDBMS clusters and replication with one of RDBMS  systems: MySQL , SQL Server, or Oracle,  o Extensive experience on system and database monitoring  o MySQL , SQL Server, or Oracle certification required  o Demonstrated self-motivation and a personal track record of life-long learning  Pluses:  o Understanding differences in setup/tuning strategy for different OS platforms:  especially Linux vs. Windows  o DNS Services  o Experience with NoSQL data management and analysis technologies such as  Cassandra, MongoDB, Hadoop, HDFS, HBase, Pig, Hive, Redis, MemcacheD

Name: Neuroscience Sales Specialist - San Francisco- San Mateo, CA 2437705 -
Description: Job DescriptionJoin us on our exciting journey! IQVIA™ is The Human Data Science Company™, focused on using data and science to help healthcare clients find better solutions for their patients. Formed through the merger of IMS Health and Quintiles, IQVIA offers a broad range of solutions that harness advances in healthcare information, technology, analytics and human ingenuity to drive healthcare forward.DescriptionAs the only global provider of commercial solutions, IQVIA understands what it takes to deliver nationally and internationally. Our teams help biopharma get their medicines to the people who need them. We help customers gain insight and access to their markets and ultimately demonstrate their product’s value to payers, physicians and patients. A significant part of our business is acting as the biopharma’s sales force to physicians or providing nurses to educate patients or prescribers. With the right experience, you can help deliver medical breakthroughs in the real world.  Neuroscience Sales Specialist  Our customer, Janssen’s Neuroscience division offers medications for the treatment of schizophrenia and continues to develop products in mental health. The primary objective of the specialty representative is to meet established sales goals by delivering real value to our customers through differentiated products and services. The specialty representative will be supported in this initiative with tools and promotional resources designed to have local impact. The successful representative will demonstrate the ability to target and manage their territory strategically while operating within an assigned budget. They will also need to be a highly engaged, positive team player and show a high degree of customer focus. The customer base generally for this role would be inclusive of Health Care Professional and treatment team members in the private Psychiatry and Community Mental Health settings.  Neuroscience Sales Specialist Role:Applies account management approach, consultative selling skills, and clinical expertise to enhance our business and build support for our portfolio of products. Analyzes and applies qualitative and quantitative market data to assess business opportunities and priorities, including relevant impact of local, District, and Region health care quality, delivery and reimbursement trends.Demonstrates business acumen and ability to understand and deliver current brand strategies across the schizophrenia and mood therapeutic areas.Develops and applies knowledge of payer access and affordability landscape in the territory regarding the company’s products.Performs business analytics to recognize customer opportunities, strengths, and trends, and to monitor the effectiveness of the business plan. Adjusts the plan to minimize the impact of competition and to maximize sales opportunities.Works effectively and efficiently with multiple local internal business partners to align and execute on key business plan objectives.

Name: Storyteller - Workplace Analytics Customer Solutions
Description: Microsoft has been on the front lines of technology innovation for decades. We continue to challenge the status quo by introducing Workplace Analytics (WpA) and reimagining how organizations should consider their most valuable resource: time. ? Workplace Analytics is a revolutionary way to answer age-old questions of C-Suite executives: How do my various departments and teams spend their time, both internally and externally? What work is worth doing and where does waste exist? How can we drive a culture of both productivity and engagement? ? To answer these questions, Workplace Analytics leverages O365 metadata and combines machine learning with behavioral data science to provide visibility into an unlimited set of collaboration metrics. These metrics help pinpoint the specific collaboration behaviors that drive successful sales results, high employee engagement scores or any other desired business outcomes.  As the solution has become widely available and demand grows, so does our specialized Workplace Analytics team within Microsoft. In support of this growth, we are looking for ambitious, talented, laser-focused people to join us as we directly impact the future of work.  Read more about Workplace Analytics here: https://products.office.com/en-us/business/workplace-analytics *The Set-Up** ? Our mission is to show the world how behavioral data can solve complex organizational problems, and then use lessons learned from those customer interactions to further develop the Workplace Analytics solution. Think of our function as a blend of data analysis, strategy consulting and product incubation. Our team is aggressively moving the solution into the marketplace and will carry our momentum to win more Fortune 500 companies in the coming year. *The Team** We are a group of fast thinkers who work collaboratively with a high degree of respect for each other. We are proactive problem-solvers, obsessed with the content of Workplace Analytics, and care deeply for the success of our customers. We are structured thinkers who value quality and appreciate creativity grounded with common sense. We work hard and we like to have fun as well. *Responsibilities***The Role** We're seeking a new team member to tell creative stories rooted in data that resonate with and inspire our customers.  Workplace Analytics unlocks the ability for organizations to understand how they operate, and our team uses the proprietary data of Workplace Analytics to deliver the findings and insights that matter most for our customers. With new data and a new market, one challenge we face is fully communicating the value of these findings to our stakeholders. This is where the Lead Storyteller role comes in ? the person in this role will employ his or her expertise in business storytelling and content creation to convert value propositions and data insights into fluent, impactful narratives.  The Workplace Analytics Lead Storyteller will be a catalyst for turning organizations? business strategies into realities by linking complex data analysis and executive-level messaging into a clearly defined vision. He or she will be our customer messaging ?Center of Excellence,? working with our client delivery teams to tell high business value stories to our customers.  This role will also work with our product engineering team. He or she will bring their communication skills and understanding of business storytelling to influence product strategy, features and design, injecting their own expertise and observations from customer interactions. *Job Summary** ? Drive success for the Workplace Analytics product and team by tailoring messaging, narratives, stories and content that our clients incorporate into critical business decisions. Specifically: ?  + Distill complex data analysis insights into consumable and actionable messages for our customers  + Evangelize and serve as the team?s internal go-to source of storytelling frameworks, approaches, and best practices  + Develop a standard delivery template and technique for our analysis insights and stories, with distinctive branding integrated into the work product that we deliver  + Craft externally facing content that resonates across platforms and audiences  + Collaborate closely with product and engineering teams to link learnings to product development  + Team with our customer delivery team to create compelling use cases / playbooks to provide for future customers *Qualifications***Basic Qualifications:** + 5+ years of experience in management consulting, business strategy, data journalism, marketing or advertising roles *Preferred Qualifications:** + 7+ years of experience in management consulting, business strategy, data journalism, marketing or advertising roles  + Experience distilling complex concepts into easily consumable customer-facing content  + Excellent writing and communications skills  + Expertise in data visualization principles  + Above-average understanding of statistical / mathematical concepts  + Deep understanding of story structure, and the use of storytelling in business across cultures, geographies, and industries  + Demonstrated production of narrative-based content  + Client facing experience, preferably in a for-profit consulting context  Work location ? Redmond or San Francisco?  _Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include, but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings:_ ? _?_ ? _Microsoft Cloud Background Check: This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter._ ? _?_ ? _Microsoft will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of San Francisco?s Fair Chance Ordinance._ ? ? _Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.? We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request?via the?_ **Accommodation request form** at https://careers.microsoft.com/us/en/accommodationrequest **.** ?  _Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.?_ ?  \#workplaceanalytics

Name: Business Analyst - Mission Control
Description: Our past is full of iconic moments but our future is going to spark many more. We're looking for the people who'll help make our next decade just as revolutionary as our first five. If you're one of the super-talented who thrive on change, aren't afraid to take risks and love to make a difference, you're the right fit. Come grow with us.Overview The Business Analyst will provide actionable insights to Business Partners by analyzing data from multiple data sources, to solve problems and evaluate complex scenarios. This role must demonstrate an ability to take ambiguous business challenges and provide analytical solutions, make informed, data driven decisions to drive growth across all digital properties. Understanding monthly business forecasts and ecommerce analytics such as traffic, conversion, net demand and average order size is a must.  In this role, you will work across Production, Digital Marketing, GapTech and Business Planning teams.Key ResponsibilitiesIdentify real time business drivers that may be negatively impacting business performance vs forecast.Provide solutions or ideas to pivot a downward trend in businessMonitor, alert, and communicate appropriate trends based on Business goals and propose actionable insights to steer the business in the right directionEnsure dashboards are up to date and accurateAssess marketing channels real time and understand how theyre impacting the businessNotify marketing channel managers if channel is under performingSupport the brands with any additional deep analysis that needs to be doneDemonstrate professional conflict resolution and interpersonal communication skillsEnsure effective communications up, down and across the businessAbility to promote collaboration and teamworkKey ExperiencesCollege degree; ideally in Finance, Business, or Computer Science4+ years as a Business Analyst, Marketing or FP&A ideally in eCommerceProven experience to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure and fast pace environment is crucialAbility to promote collaboration and teamwork across organizational boundaries.Great communication and interpersonal skills to effectively communicate to all levels and multiple departments.Attention to detail and deadlinesKEY BENEFITS:Merchandise discount for our brands: 50% off regular-priced merchandise at Gap, Banana Republic and Old Navy, 30% off at Outlet and 25% off at Athleta.One of the most competitive Paid Time Off plans in the industry.*Employees can take up to five on the clock hours each month to volunteer at a charity of their choice.*Extensive 401(k) plan with company matching for contributions up to four percent of an employees base pay.*Employee stock purchase plan.*Employees receive medical, dental, vision and life insurance.*Employees can apply for tuition reimbursement.*Family care programs.Commuter benefits.Pet Discount Program. *For eligible employeesGap Inc. is an equal-opportunity employer and is committed to providing a workplace free from harassment and discrimination. We are committed to recruiting, hiring, training and promoting qualified people of all backgrounds, and make all employment decisions without regard to any protected status. In 2016, Gap Inc. was named one of the Best Places to Work by the Human Rights Campaign for the thirteenth consecutive year and was the sole winner of the Catalyst award for equality in the workplace in 2016.

Name: Senior Data Scientist - Business Data Analyst
Description: OverviewThe Senior Data Scientist – Business Analytics will be using customer driven analytics to drive growth and improved decision making in Intuit’s Small Business Division. This role requires an individual with advanced analytical skills, excellent communications skills, and a passion for creating actionable customer insights to influence business operations and strategy.ResponsibilitiesPartner closely with business and technical teams to understand their project objectives and provide data-driven solutions and recommendationsAbility to sift through large amounts of information, extract the key insights, and communicate succinctlyDesign and develop data preparation components and processes that extract and transform data across disparate database tables by creating aggregates tables for reporting and analytics, ensuring integrity of analysis data by developing the requirement specifications and assisting the development and testing of data tablesApply existing data mining techniques – descriptive and predictive modeling tools, and methodologies and/or design new data mining algorithms to drive solutionsPartner directly with the product development team on product instrumentation, product flow and data captureEnsures solutions are scalable, repeatable, efficient and effective QualificationsBachelor’s degree in a quantitative field - Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering or related fields; Master’s preferred5+ years of work experience involving quantitative data analysisDatabase experience with advanced SQL skills; experience researching and manipulating complex and large data sets; Hadoop experience a plusProficient in analytical and modelling tools, such as Python, R or SASExperience with data visualization tools, such as TableauExperience with A/B test and experimental designWillingness to dig-in and understand the data and to leverage creative thinking and problem-solving skills are absolute mustsSelf-starter who takes the initiative to get things doneOutstanding team player with a customer-back mindset

Name: Sr Associate Director of Enrollment Data Systems, ERP
Description: Posting Details  Position Information  Requisition Number 2018-1592Staff Job Title Sr Associate Director of Enrollment Data Systems, ERP Job Location Main Campus - Hilltop Salary Type Exempt Minimum Hire-In Rate (for OPE positions only) Job Type Full-Time Union Type Non Union Travel No Travel Work Environment Office Job Summary  The Senior Associate Director of Enrollment Data Systems uses data and system analysis to identify opportunities to improve business processes. The Senior Associate Director is the lead subject matter analyst in Strategic Enrollment Management (SEM) systems and business processes that supports the USF Student Lifecycle. The Sr. AD collaborates with Undergraduate Admissions, Student Financial Services, The Office of the  Registrar, Graduate Enrollment, International Admissions, and Enrollment Communications within SEM to ensure proper data gathering and optimal Enrollment Management system usage in support of SEM's business functions. The Sr. AD is the leading divisional expert in of Banner Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) system's General, Student, and Financial Aid modules, the Degree Works student success tracking systems and other  technical tools and services SEM acquires for its business needs. The Sr. AD manages the support of SEM's use of Ellucian's Banner Student Information (SIS) system and is responsible for maximizing Banner Student and Financial Aid modules functionality to advance SEM's business goals. The Sr. AD also manages decision support services required by SEM leadership and staff including but not limited to data reporting via Slate, USF Operational Data Store (ODS), and Tableau. The Sr. AD works with the Center for Institutional Planning and  Effectiveness (CIPE) to ensure data integrity and with the Information Technology Services (ITS) Project Management Office and ITS Application Services on technical solution evaluations and system implementations. The Sr. AD reports to the AVP of Integrated Enrollment Data Management. The Sr. AD is  responsible for supervising and developing one Assistant Directors' skillset and responsibilities as well as student workers in Enrollment Data Systems. The Sr. AD is expected to take a leadership role within the  Enrollment Data Systems team, to exercise independent and critical thinking, and to advise management and end users on the best way to implement and enhance technology to achieve strategic administrative and operational goals. Additionally, the Sr. AD provides best-practices guidance on Banner ERP use and  functionality both to colleagues in SEM and the schools, colleges, and related student service offices. The Sr. AD is responsible for ensuring data integration provides optimal data accessibility and share use of enrollment data between SEM's systems functions efficiently.  Job Responsibilities Lead and mentor Assistant Director and student worker(s) in SEM data and business processes in support of SEM's strategic goals. Prioritize and manage Enrollment Data Systems activities. Report statues regular to AVP, IEDM.Work closely with Director and Senior Associate Directors in Financial Aid for the annual review and implementation of the Financial Aid packaging scheme for new admits and continuing students. Create reports and support in monitoring the effectiveness of the FinAid packaging implementation, provide troubleshooting support and issue resolution. Work closely with Associate Registrars in leading Banner upgrades, migration, new version and/or functionality implementation. Provide support to Student Accounts including but not limited to operational reporting, data integrity, integration assistance between CashNet and Banner. Create reports and provide configuration support for Registrar's Office including but not limited to registration, grades, graduation, credit transfers set up and monitoring. Design assessment strategies to determine if business processes and technical solutions have achieved desired objectives. Manages Banner configuration, maintenance, updating, and data conflict resolution.Generate Reports and SQL programs for tabular and statistical reporting, as well as produce ad hoc reports for SEM. Provide proactive solutions to data collection issues through workflow analysis.Provide proactive recommendation to data collection enhancement.Keep current with new data collection, retrieval, and analysis tools and services to aid in the continuous improvement of SEM reporting needs and services. Participate in functions, events, and ceremonies managed by SEM.Proactively work with AVP, IDEM to use data and systems analysis to identify opportunities to improve business processes and collaborate with appropriate stakeholders in developing recommendations  and/or solution. Take the lead in the creation of end-to-end test plans while executing and managing activities in the test plan to ensure that all objectives are met and that the solution works as expected. Leverage knowledge of business process analysis methodology, processes, tools, and administration with strong emphasis on business improvement, standardization, documentation, and training. Review and understand user documentation and/or release notes from vendors as well as change requests within USF to analyze impact to SEM systems and operations. Recommend changes in policies  and procedures as applicable. Draw on professional experience to help lead and mentor various teams including and not limited to training end users regarding any new functionalities and features included in upgrades, releases, and  new solutions. Ensure data standards are widely known and used by all users of SEM systems.Administer budgetary approval for direct report.Support SEM analysis and forecasting efforts by coordinating with CIPE in the development and creation of critical dashboards, reports. Maintain expert knowledge of SEM systems and stay abreast of SEM data structures, report extraction techniques, and software solutions. Maintain professional knowledge by attending conferences, training, and, participating in professional communities. Ensure the integrity and confidentiality of the student academic records by complying with FERPA and USF academic policies. Conduct Technology Tool Assessment; Create system documentation.Perform other related duties as assigned. Minimum Requirements Bachelor's degree required.8 years of experience working in a university enrollment management with at least 3 years of experience as the leading divisional expert in the Banner Student and Banner Financial Aid modules. Extensive knowledge of Banner SIS as well as business processes within the Office of the Registrar, Student Financial Aid, and Student Accounts. Ability to administer and configure Banner SIS as an  expert user. Experience in Banner Student and Banner Financial Aid implementation. Knowledge of Banner Student and Banner Financial Aid data structure required.Knowledge of enrollment CRM and Admissions processes a plus.Advance skills in SQL for both reporting and Banner system configurationOutstanding customer service orientation. Must show characteristics of sound judgment based on information available to support good decision-making. Very strong interpersonal and communication skills; highly articulate in both verbal and written forms, translating complex technical concepts into non-technical language. Accountable and empowered ability to take responsibility, self-start to ensure realization of SEM goals. Strong desire and aptitude to continue learning and broadening professional skills with SEM.Understanding of and the ability to apply Business Process Analysis techniques and methodologies. EX: capable of producing scope and requirements documentation, cost benefit analysis, and change  requests, etc. Experience analyzing business processes to develop and implement proposals to  enhance functionality. Proven problem solving skills with ability to assess a specific business scenario and develop an appropriate process and/or technical approach to support the desired business outcomes. Excellent analytical skills, including the ability to understand systems and software as they relate to processes and data. Ability to analyze project dependencies to prioritize competing demands for  business users and team members. Project management skills and experience.Ability to handle multiple complex work priorities; Ability to organize, plan, and work on projects with little to no supervision. Ability to act as project lead in a team environment. Ability to mentor and grow team members' skillset. Understanding of and commitment to University of San Francisco's Vision, Mission and Values.At least two to three years of progressive IT responsibility, particularly in a Banner student/admission/student accounts/financial aid environment and Slate enrollment CRM environment  Additional Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities  Position could require occasional time spend at the SF Downtown location.  Position could require occasional work on nights and weekends for university functions and ceremonies.  Special Instructions to Applicants Job Open Date 08/08/2018 Job Close Date Posted until Filled Yes About USF  The University of San Francisco is located in the heart of one of the world's most innovative and diverse cities, and is home to a vibrant academic community of students and faculty who achieve excellence in their fields. Its diverse student body enjoys direct access to faculty, small classes and outstanding opportunities in the city itself. USF is San Francisco's first university, and its Jesuit Catholic mission helps ignite a student's passion for social justice and a desire to "Change the World From Here." For more information, visit www.usfca.edu.  EEO Policy  The University is an equal opportunity institution of higher education. The University does not discriminate in employment, educational services and academic programs on the basis of an individual's race, color, religion, religious creed, ancestry, national origin, age (except minors), sex, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, medical condition (cancer-related and genetic-related) and disability, and the other bases prohibited by law. The University reasonably accommodates qualified individuals with disabilities under the law.  Fair Chance Ordinance  Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. For more information visit: http://sfgov.org/olse/fair-chance-ordinance-fco. Name: Product Marketing Manager - Telephony
Description: Daddy’s SmartLIne Telephony business is helping millions of small businesses look more professional, work anywhere and get more done with their day. As Manager of Product Marketing, you will build and lead the execution of across multiple channels with a goal of selling and marketing GoDaddy’s SmartLine Services to new and existing GoDaddy customers.GoDaddy’s SmartLine Telephony team helps small businesses look professionalsave time and get back to what matters with robust and reliable services that allow them to seamlessly and professionally communicate, collaborate and run their business.  As a leader the in SmartLine Product Marketing team, you will lead cross functional teams focused on driving user acquisition onto GoDaddy’s SmartLine offering. You’ll drive the creation of multi-year strategies geared at meeting aggressive growth goals while ensuring execution of near term campaigns and initiatives drive to reach immediate user acquisition, upsell/x-sell and retention targets.  This is a rare opportunity to blend entrepreneurial skills with exceptional operational, financial and leadership acumen. Responsibilities:Lead development of strategic vision and tactics required to achieve critical customer, shareholder and employee goals for the Smartline business.Define critical metrics across strategic growth levers and deeply understand/communicate business unit performance to senior leadership, partner closely with finance and business analytics to communicate trending and identify new opportunities.Partner with Product Management leadership to define annual and quarterly roadmap and own the development and management of annual budgetPartner with central teams to put in place programsLead cross functional team focused on the collection and communication of key qualitative and quantitative customer data to guide product-specific marketing initiatives. Oversee the creation of robust, data-driven marketing plans and lead marketing counterparts in eCommerce, Product Management, Advertising and Telesales to bring initiatives to market.Develop and build strong relationships with key stakeholders in an effort to collaborate and drive the overall business.Requirements:10+ years of progressive experience in marketing, with SMB marketing experience preferred. Proven experience leading marketing strategy development across acquisition, upsell/x-sell and retention.Demonstrated team building and development skills as well as an exceptional track record in cross-functional team building.“Roll up your sleeves” mentality and desire to own programs from concept to execution.Great communication skills, written and oralAbility to build relationships across an organizationPassion for gaining customer insights and translating insights into effective marketing programsSolid analytical ability, with track record of “test & learn” mindset.Enjoy working in a fast paced, high-output, time sensitive environment.MBA Preferred.Travel Required. #LI-SH1 ​ About GoDaddy GoDaddy powers the world's largest cloud platform dedicated to small, independent ventures. With nearly 17 million customers worldwide and over 71 million domain names under management, GoDaddy is the place people come to name their idea, build a professional website, attract customers and manage their work. Our mission is to give our customers the tools, insights and the people to transform their ideas and personal initiative into success. To learn more about the company visit www.GoDaddy.com.  GoDaddy is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We will not discriminate against any applicant or employee on the basis of age, race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, medical condition, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, marital status or civil partnership/union status, physical or mental disability, pregnancy, childbirth, genetic information, military and veteran status, or any other basis prohibited by applicable federal, state or local law. GoDaddy will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with local and federal requirements.  If you need assistance completing an application for a position with us, please reach out to our Recruiting Team at Recruiting@godaddy.com

Name: Software SaaS Security Technical Business Analyst - Location Negotiable
Description: - Job description Mortgage Cadence, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Accenture, has been partnering with mortgage lenders since 1999, offering the industry’s only true one-stop shop mortgage technology solutions designed for point-of-sale through post-closing. In a time when efficiency, speed and the customer experience are paramount to the success of lenders, Mortgage Cadence offers the most reliable software and dedicated people, supporting lenders every step of the way. Each of our products has revolutionized the mortgage lending process in some way, changing the way lenders lend and borrowers finance. As a software company, we think like a start-up, with every employee empowered and encouraged to be visionary. Teamwork and innovation define what we do as we take our customers into the future by providing the last lending solution they will ever need. Role description: Work with the business to define technical and functional requirements. Assess the security architecture, ensuring that it meets the business requirements and performance goals as defined by the long term direction. Work with other architects and leads to ensure that the security components security technology, operations, and management are integrated as defined in the requirements. Fully understand the capabilities and limitations of the security components: security technology, operations, and management . Review and assist with integration of the security architecture requirements for production and sub production environments. Review and assist with integration of all non-functional requirements, including technical,and operations requirements. Participate in decisions regarding hardware, network products, and software for security architecture. Participate in decisions regarding software design architecture. Participate in the security architecture analysis, design, and implementation, and ensure that the product fulfills the requirements. When applicable, work with the solution integration architect on these tasks. Work with the support unit to determine how the application is supported in production, including back ups, disaster recovery, system performance, and project management. Obtain stakeholder buy in for designs. Validate the design with the stakeholders to ensure that the design satisfies the requirements. Review security architecture deliverables throughout development to ensure quality and requirement traceability. Identify and communicate any cross area or cross release issues that affect other project areas. Ensure adherence to all quality management plans and standards by participating in quality management reviews. Make sure that the security components interact to fulfill the requirements and meet performance goals. Participate in confirming the completeness and consistency of the design deliverables. Assist with Resolution of any inconsistencies discovered. + Basic qualifications - Minimum of 5 years of experience with enterprise, infrastructure, or application security architecture- Minimum of 5 years of experience with cloud architectures and API web-services delivery, risks, and controls. - Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP)Preferred Skill Requirements:- Information Systems Security Architect Professional (ISSAP) or Information - Systems Security Engineering Professional (ISSEP) or similar certification preferred - Application Development background preferred- Ability to identify and define security architecture components as new requirements arise - Ability to define the complete security infrastructure environment - Ability to interact communicate with business effectively - Ability to maintain current knowledge of all relevant security technology, operations, management developments and seek opportunities to deploy new technologies that benefit the business - Ability to assemble and test security components - Ability to provide technical leadership on client engagement, including serving as a resource to the project team and the client by evaluating and proposing technical alternatives for resolving business and technology issues - Ability to create security architecture scope, definition, construction, and execution - Ability to design and develop cost effective security solutions that meet functional, technical, and performance requirements - Ability to map business requirements to technology capability - Ability to identify gaps and omissions in the end to end solution - Ability to review ongoing and proposed projects to identify opportunities for reuse and process improvement - Ability to review project deliverables for completeness, quality, and compliance with established project standards - Ability to provide security expertise to project resources and the client to meet project deadlines and ensure that project objectives are met - Ability to consult with and develop resources for methods, procedures, and standards to use during design, and unit testing phases of the project - Ability to document and communicate the status of progress against plans, taking corrective action as necessaryApplicants for employment in the US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States and with Accenture (i.e., H1-B visa, F-1 visa (OPT), TN visa or any other non-immigrant status). Candidates who are currently employed by a client of Accenture or an affiliated Accenture business may not be eligible for consideration. Accenture is a Federal Contractor and an EEO and Affirmative Action Employer of Females/Minorities/Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities. Equal Employment Opportunity All employment decisions shall be made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other basis as protected by federal, state, or local law. Job candidates will not be obligated to disclose sealed or expunged records of conviction or arrest as part of the hiring process. Accenture is committed to providing veteran employment opportunities to our service men and women.  APPLY SAVE THIS JOB Share

Name: Senior Technical Sales Engineer
Description: Splice Machine is a Scale-Out SQL RDBMS, Data Warehouse & Machine Learning Platform in one, seamlessly integrating analytics and AI to power mission-critical applications. Join an elite team of pre and post sales executives as a Technical Sales Engineer, working from anywhere in the US.  Splice Machine's CEO, Monte Zweben, is a serial entrepreneur and former Founder/ CEO of Blue Martini, one of the most successful IPOs in early 2000 ($2.9B). He started Splice Machine to disrupt the $30 billion traditional database market with the first open-source dual engine database and predictive platform to power Big Data, AI and Machine Learning applications.  Splice Machine has recruited a team of legendary Big Data advisors including Andrew Moore, Dean of Carnegie Mellon School of Computer Science and former VP Engineering Google, Roger Bamford, "Father of Oracle RAC", Michael Franklin, former Director of AMPLab at UC Berkeley, Ken Rudin, Head of Growth and Analytics for Google Search, and Bruce Cleveland, Founding Partner at Wildcat Ventures and former Siebel & Oracle senior executive, to collaborate with the Splice Machine team as we blaze new trails in Big Data.  Splice Machine's predictive platform solution helps companies turn their Big Data into actionable business decisions. Our predictive platform eliminates the complexity of integrating multiple compute engines and databases necessary to power next-generation enterprise predictive AI and Machine Learning applications. Some of our use-cases include: -At a leading credit card company, Splice Machine powers a customer service application that returns sub-20ms record lookups on 7 PB of data  -At a Fortune 50 bank, Splice Machine is replacing a leading RDBMS and data warehouse with one platform in a customer profitability application  -At an RFID tag company, Splice Machine is replacing a complex architecture for a retail IoT solution  -At a leading financial service company, Splice Machine powers an enterprise data hub for 10,000 users  -At a leading healthcare solution provider, Splice Machine powers a predictive application to learn models and use them to save lives in hospitals  The Senior Technical Sales Engineer will provide pre-sales technical support to our prospective customers throughout the sales process. About YouYou are a master at enabling complex, technical big data sales to enterprise businesses.You have extensive knowledge of the big data ecosystem and the importance databases and data warehouses play in the world of AI and Machine Learning.You will utilize your strong technical, business savvy, and customer-centric competencies to provide the highest level of business and technical consultations to the sales team and prospects.Your focus on the customer's business requirements, technical needs, and history presenting targeted business solutions, leading to an incredible history of building long-lasting relationships and facilitating multi-million dollar deals.What You Will DoStrategize, design and present solutions that will help customers solve real business problems using Splice Machine.Present and articulate strengths, features, benefits, and competitive advantages of Splice Machine's revolutionary predictive solution, helping them journey down the Big Data path.Execute the technical aspects of the sales strategy by developing appropriate solutions and building ongoing technical relationships across complex enterprise account organizations.Travel as required.RequirementsExperience as a sales engineer, pre/post sales technical consultant, or solutions architect selling Hadoop, Machine Learning, AI or other big data technology.Understanding of "Scale-Out" architectures, including differentiating between "Scale-Up" and distributed database architectures, while identifying the appropriate solution to recommend to customers.Deep understanding in one or more of the following technology areas: RDBMS, Data Warehousing, Analytics, Business Intelligence, or Big Data Solutions.Demonstrated record of strong customer-facing skills and ability to build and sustain ongoing customer relationships; ability to practice excellent customer service skills in a fast-paced environment.BS in Computer Science or other technical majors preferred.Experience in high performance very large databases. Mastery of performance tuning techniques including indexing, partitioning, and information lifecycle management and solid SQL programming skills preferred. Our team enjoys access to the best tools available, an open and collaborative work environment and a supportive culture inspiring them to do their very best. We offer great salaries, generous equity, employee & family health coverage, flexible time off, and an environment that gives you the flexibility to seize moments of inspiration among other perks.  We encourage you to learn more about working here!

Name: Sales & Partnerships Associate
Description: Covo is one of todays leading coworking groups, taking customer service and hospitality to the extreme, wrapping coworking around a coffee shop, bar, and events space. Our members and partners love us, the market were going after is huge, and were just getting started.  We are looking for an Associate to join our Business Development & Strategic Partnerships team to help grow our largest partnerships, and launch new partnerships. In this role, you will be responsible for leading day-to-day operations with Covos strategic partners, while developing and executing on new partner growth initiatives. You will serve as a partner advocate, often functioning as a liaison between our partners and internal team.  We are looking for a strategic thinker who executes; this person thrives in a fast-paced, always-on, results-oriented culture. You love problem solving, collaborating across functional domains, and driving projects from beginning to end. You love pounding the pavement and making inroads. Youre an excellent communicator and enjoy working with others to deliver results. This is a hands-on, high execution role which requires excellent business, people, and analytical skills.  WHAT YOU'LL DO: Outreach to the phenomenal companies who are brand-aligned with us. This includes international corporations like Thrive Global and Virgin Group, local corporations like IndieGogo, Yahoo, accelerators and incubators including Y-Combinator and 500 Startups, non-profits like Full Circle Fund and associations like the GGBA Chamber of Commerce. We have connections to many of these groups, but you will make inroads into many more.Securing partnership deals, sponsorships, group memberships.Manage key partner relationships, actively engaging to meet sales & marketing goals while also handling the operational day-to-dayWork alongside partnerships team to build out strategy for executing on shared volume goals with our largest partners. Bring your ideas to the table.Establish processes and reporting to help streamline the teams operationsPartner with marketing team to develop and launch new marketing campaigns with partnersDevelop a deep understanding of Covos mission, goals, day-to-day operations, and competitive contextCollaborate with partners to ensure that the experiences we build together are the best possible for users, support our partners' goals, and align with Covos missionDevelop strong relationships at all levels, identifying key decision makers and influencers WHAT WE LOOK FOR: Motivated, self-starter, who can work with little supervisionSome level of experience in partnerships, business development, sales support, account management, or management consulting. This can be your first job out of college, but you have relevant experience from earlier work experience.Strong organizational, analytical, written, and verbal communication skillsOutstanding interpersonal skills and ability to build effective working relationships with any team internally or externallyAbility to think creatively, critically and thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic, work environmentAppetite to actively learn and immediately apply learnings to make decisions and change behaviorsBA/BS required SALARY, BENEFITS & PERKS: $30,000+ (BOE) base salary plus tiered commission for sales/partnershipsReceive over $2,400 annually for a wellness benefit premium contribution to KaiserDaily adult beverage from the Tap LoungeGenerous PTO and holidaysExcellent health coverage benefitsGenerous, paid parental leave which covers up to 15 weeksDog-friendly officeMembership at Covo

Name: Program Operations Manager, Global Medical Information & Communications
Description: Save time and apply through your LinkedIn account. Click the Apply with LinkedIn button and your LinkedIn profile will be imported into our site. In order to move forward, you will need to create an account. Your password must be eight characters long, contain at least one special character, one capital letter and a number. We look forward to discovering your talents.POSITION SUMMARY:The Senior Program Manager of Global Medical Information and Communications is responsible for initiatives, projects, and/or tasks assigned by Senior Director as it relates to Global Medical Information and Communications activities. These activities include but not limited to, NCCN monitoring, compendia submission tracking, report creation, project management, overseeing and troubleshooting systems and product knowledge data use used in responding to medical inquiries related to company products. This role will also provide support for Medical Information and Communication systems and related vendors, management of team specific contracts and budget including tracking and reporting of project-specific spend against target spend. Other activities will also include project planning, initiation, and management, managing timelines, and contributing to analyses that inform decisions and strategy. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND RESPONSIBILITIES:Business PracticesEstablish methods, procedures, processes, and best practices to be utilized within GMSACollaborates across departments to ensure medical information and communication standard processes are harmonized, as appropriatePlanning & Project ManagementSupports financial planning and analysis of programs and initiatives including budgeting, program reviews, forecasting, and long-range planning as relates to medical information and communication initiativesSupports senior director of Global Medical Information and Communications with the execution of strategic projects and facilitation of meetings and project timelinesManage Medical Information and Communication content submission, review, and approval process via internal committees and systemsVendor ManagementProvides oversight of the contracting and purchasing programs, ensuring a consistent and efficient approach to negotiating, contracting, requisitions, purchase orders, invoices, reconciliation, and accounts payableProvide support pertaining to receiving, processing, and disseminating clinical and safety information via call centerInformation Systems (technology and tools)Manage vendors to support systems and projects beginning with the RFP process through the initiation and implementation and reportingManage and maintain GMSA Content Aggregator Platform and ensure resources are updated in a timely fashionManage systems and vendors associated systems and vendors associated with Medical Information (IRMS) and integration of content to CRM. Create and implement new processes and/or systems to facilitate team efficiencies and output.Maintain the Medical Information/Communication intranet webpage contentResponsible for developing, implementing, and managing the MA information systems strategyCollaborate with key stakeholders such as IT to develop multi-year technology solution roadmaps in support of business and data analytic needsSupport systems and operational integration and roll-out of Global Call Center ServiceTransparency ReportingCollaborates with Legal, Regulatory Affairs, Commercial and other parts of the organization to ensure compliance with aggregate spend and Physician Payments Sunshine Act reporting activitiesSupport compliance monitoring by generating reports for use by Medical Information (or MA if appropriate) and for reconciliation with other parts of the organization (e.g. drug safety and quality assurance)Library ServicesCoordinates processes for ensuring availability of scientific material including journal articles and abstracts through the establishment of an e-library function while maintaining the highest level of compliance and copyright considerationsComplianceEnsures all department policies, procedures, and systems are in compliance with internal and external regulatory and compliance guidelinesADDITIONAL FUNCTIONS AND RESPONSIBILITIES:Team CollaborationEnsure training and development of team members, and work to identify and provide formal and informal training for other stakeholders regarding MA processes and complianceEstablish collaborative working relationships with functions outside of MA including, but not limited to: Clinical Development; Regulatory Affairs; Portfolio & Project Management; Finance; HR; Legal; IT; Drug Safety; and Commercial to optimize the financial, technical, compliance, and strategic management of key functional areasOther duties as assignedEDUCATION, EXPERIENCE, KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES:A minimum of BA/BS in a scientific discipline required, advanced clinical / scientific degree preferred with at least 8 years’ experience (an equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered)Experience in a corporate setting with an emphasis on medical information (or general medical affairs) operationsProven project and operational management and team leadership experienceAn in-depth understanding of Phase IV/post-marketing drug development is preferred (knowledge of or experience with Phase I-III drug development is a plus)Experience with the strategy and implementation of information technology solutions particularly related to CRM systemsUnderstanding of Physician Payments Sunshine Act Reporting RequirementsProven ability to work in and embrace a fast-paced and dynamic work environment with a high level of autonomyAbility to work well on cross-functional basis internally and with business partnersProficient computer skills, including Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, and ExcelProficient in various communication / collaboration platforms including Gmail, Google Calendar, Slack, Hangout, Box, Google Docs and SharepointExcellent interpersonal skillsTECHNICAL KNOWLEDGE REQUIRED:Equipment: PC, scanners, facsimile machine, voice mail and e-mail systems, and common office machines, or ability to be trained. Knowledge of other equipment required:Software Knowledge: Windows, MS Office (Outlook, Word, Excel). Knowledge of other software required: MS Project, Tableau, EvernoteINTERNAL AND EXTERNAL RELATIONSHIPS:Effectively interact with other functional areas within GMSA and across the organization (Regulatory Affairs, Clinical Development, Commercial, Project Management, etc).Build strong relationships with external parties, such as vendors and service providers. EFFORT REQUIRED/ENVIRONMENTAL CONDITIONS:Physical Activities: On a continuous basis, sit at desk for a long period of time; intermittently answer telephone and write or use a keyboard to communicate through written means. Some walking and lifting up to 20 lbs. may be required. The noise level in the work environment is usually low to moderate. The physical demands described above are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions and responsibilities of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions and responsibilities.Laboratory Activities, if applicable: Biology and chemical laboratory environments experience needed. Environmental health and safety requirements also apply.TRAVEL:Travel may be required up to 5% of your time

Name: Women's Healthcare Professional Sales Representative
Description: Women's Healthcare Professional Sales Representative - Field Sales - San Francisco, CAPosition OverviewThe Professional Sales Representative targets, promotes and sells Vertical products to physicians and other specialized medical or healthcare providers. The Professional Sales Representative manages his/her territory in order to maintain and maximize sales of Vertical products to achieve territory, district and corporate objectives. As a member of the sales team, this position works closely with the District Manager, sales representatives and other internal & external groups, to achieve district and corporate objectives.Duties and Responsibilities Achieve quarterly sales goals specific to assigned territory and product portfolio Meet established call average expectations and sales performance expectations Effectively develop and manage territory business plans (targeting, routing, customer segmentation) Analyze data and manage territory to effectively target high prescribing physicians Use functional and technical knowledge of Vertical products, healthcare, managed care, and customer markets to meet or exceed customer needs Determine the appropriate strategic approach to gain access and acceptance for all Vertical products Abide by the Corporate Code of Conduct and Business Ethics and all Company policies and procedures Adhere to all administrative requirements, including but not limited to expense reporting, call reporting, and business planning Actively participate in scheduled Company meetings, including but not limited to District and National conference calls, national sales meetings, and other business meetings Travel within the territory for normal business and outside territory for other business events (business meetings, trade shows, etc.)Experience and Qualifications Bachelor’s degree required, focus on biological science or related discipline preferred 2+ years of pharmaceutical selling experience in quota-driven role preferred Demonstrated ability to adapt approach to meet and exceed business objectives when faced with an obstacle or a customer concern Demonstrated ability to develop and maintain positive, ethical customer relationships Track record of sustained high performance in current or previous positions and strong aptitude for learning Strong business acumen, analytical skills, and ability to understand market opportunities Strong interpersonal skills and ability to communicate effectively, both written and oral Demonstrated ability to work in a highly collaborative team environment Ability to understand and present clinical information Planning, organization, and project management experience including creating and executing business plans Ability to thrive in a culture that is performance based, fast paced, and results oriented Knowledge of the business and market in the assigned territory preferred Proficient computer skills, including MS Office, sales database and web-based applications Ability to travel as necessary or required, which may include overnight and/or weekend travel Valid driver’s license and clean driving record required Occasional lifting of up to 20 poundsAbout UsOsmotica Pharmaceutical is a global specialty pharmaceutical company with a proven history of developing commercially successful pharmaceutical products using a proprietary osmotic technology platform. In February 2016, Osmotica Pharmaceutical combined with Vertical Pharmaceuticals, LLC and Trigen Laboratories, LLC to create a world-class, fully-integrated specialty pharmaceutical and generics company.  Vertical Pharmaceuticals, LLC was founded in 2003 with a mission to develop, market, and acquire products offering therapeutic benefits for patients and healthcare providers. Vertical Pharmaceuticals supplies branded prescription products, specializing in Neuroscience and Women’s Health with brands such as Lorzone®, Divigel®, and OB Complete®.  Trigen Laboratories, LLC is a generic pharmaceutical company offering unique products across an increasing array of categories. Trigen seeks to bring value-driven generic products to its customers, working vigorously with its partners to identify and develop products which face an assortment of challenges. Additionally, Trigen identifies unique marketing opportunities and is steadfast in its pursuit to deliver products to best serve these markets. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability or veteran status.

Name: Senior Analyst, Global Real Estate Finance & Strategy
Description: Our past is full of iconic moments but our future is going to spark many more. We're looking for the people who'll help make our next decade just as revolutionary as our first five. If you're one of the super-talented who thrive on change, aren't afraid to take risks and love to make a difference, you're the right fit. Come grow with us. Getting recognized by any industry for your work is an honor, but being included in Business of Fashions first-ever Best Companies To Work For In Fashion report is especially exciting. At Employer Inc., one of our driving values is to provide meaningful career experiences that allow our employees to grow, while also building an unrivaled and engaging culture that inspires people to do their best work. We are thrilled to be acknowledged for the work we are passionate about and strive to offer to our amazing employees every day! Employer Inc.s Global Real Estate Finance & Strategy team is a centralized corporate function that provides strategic and analytical support to the Employer, Inc. portfolio of brands including Employer, Banana Republic, Athleta, and Old Navy. We are dedicated to all brands and are responsible for making strategic investment decisions for the companys fleet of retail stores.We are currently seeking a Staff Analyst to join the team of dynamic industry professionals. The ideal candidate has strong analytical and organizational skills are essential in this energizing environment. Your insights will be pertinent to your team's recommendations on strategic real estate decisions. Your key responsibilities include building business cases for store investments and lease renewals which include the development and analysis of pro forma sales call, cannibalization potential, forecasted store P&L, and return on investment metrics such as IRR and NPV. You will make an impact on store creation for our brands globally. Your creativity, attention to detail, and dynamic cross-functional partnership will be essential to every project. You deliver in deadline driven environments with calculated and strategic orientation. You will resolve immediate issues while anticipating needs for the future. You will partner with Store Development, Store Operations, Real Estate Field, Real Estate Law, and other functional groups externally and internally across the company. You will have high exposure and opportunity to expand knowledge and experience with each project. If you are eager to join an industry leading organization, innovate in your area, and learn new skills, tell us about yourself and we hope to meet you soon.As one of the world's largest specialty retailers, our past is full of iconic moments. But we're most passionate about the future, and the people who will help make our next decade just as groundbreaking as the last fifty years. Essential Duties & ResponsibilitiesPrepare and deliver insights and recommendations based on analysis. Utilize multiple points of data to develop forecasts for business case development Support senior management and cross-functional business partners with timely, accurate, actionable financial analysisPerform analysis and critical thinking to support annual market planning and drive fleet level decisionsBuild and maintain collaborative working relationships with all business partners including Real Estate Field, Store Operations, Design, Store Development, Legal, Corporate Finance & Corporate Shared ServicesRequired QualificationsStrong financial acumen coupled with the ability to explain financial concepts to non-finance business partnersWorking knowledge in Excel functionality and ability to utilize data for creative thinkingDevelops business cases with analytical approach Leads multiple projects simultaneouslyProactive individual who looks for opportunities to improve existing processes and businessCollaborates with cross-functional teams effectivelyMinimum educational level:Bachelor's degree in finance, economics or related fieldCPA a plusExperience1-3 years professional working experiencePhysical RequirementsLimited travelKEY BENEFITS:Merchandise discount for our brands: 50% off regular-priced merchandise at Employer, Banana Republic and Old Navy, 30% off at Outlet and 25% off at Athleta. One of the most competitive Paid Time Off plans in the industry.* Employees can take up to five on the clock hours each month to volunteer at a charity of their choice.* Extensive 401(k) plan with company matching for contributions up to four percent of an employees base pay.* Employee stock purchase plan.* Employees receive medical, dental, vision and life insurance.* Employees can apply for tuition reimbursement.* Family care programs. Commuter benefits. Pet Discount Program.*For eligible employeesEmployer Inc. is an equal-opportunity employer and is committed to providing a workplace free from harassment and discrimination. We are committed to recruiting, hiring, training and promoting qualified people of all backgrounds, and make all employment decisions without regard to any protected status. In 2016, Employer Inc. was named one of the Best Places to Work by the Human Rights Campaign for the thirteenth consecutive year and was the sole winner of the Catalyst award for equality in the workplace in 2016.

Name: Business Information Security Officer
Description: Where good people build rewarding careers. Think that working in the insurance field can’t be exciting, rewarding and challenging? Think again. You’ll help us reinvent protection and retirement to improve customers’ lives. We’ll help you make an impact with our training and mentoring offerings. Here, you’ll have the opportunity to expand and apply your skills in ways you never thought possible. And you’ll have fun doing it. Join a company of individuals with hopes, plans and passions, all using and developing our talents for good, at work and in life.Job Description  The Business Information Security Officer (BISO) functions as the security leader with their area of responsibility. This role will have dual reporting structure, one reporting to the AoR and one into the Information Security Program Office and is responsible for establishing and driving a business specific Information Security program aligned with the business area risks and the Allstate Corporation Information Security Program. The BISO serves as the trusted advisor, both to the business and to the CISO. This role will liaise between the business and Allstate Information Security (AIS), keeping clear lines of communication including but not limited to; transparency to the business on upcoming security initiatives, reporting of security risks to the CISO and appropriate committees, as well as a key player in the information security incident response process, from identifying impact to the business and to consumers, to helping shape remediation, and developing external and internal message points. In addition, this role will ensure business compliance with the Information Security Policy and Standards while continuously monitoring and reporting on risks and documented exceptions. Responsibilities: Establish a documented Information Security Program and supporting strategy for the area of responsibility (AOR) Ensure program is aligned with the AIS Information Security Program, Policies and StandardsEnsure inclusion of all applicable regulatory, legal and contractual obligationsLeverage the Enterprise and AOR specific Information Security Risk Assessments to establish and monitor the programUpdate the program annuallyAORs:Information Security Risk ManagementPolicy ComplianceAccess ManagementData ProtectionEducation and AwarenessPartnershipProvide input into the Allstate Corporation Information Security ProgramReview and provide input into the Information Security Policy and StandardsEnsure clear lines of communication between AOR and the Chief Information Security OfficerProvide reporting on the state and efficacy of security controls for their projects and platformsSecuring ongoing security funding for special/complex projects, and evangelizing security awareness across Business UnitKey Success CriteriaSupport the Business Unit and CISO in seeking cost optimizing and driving reduction in operations costs of managing the security controls.Increased levels of security across designated Business Unit.Improved compliance with security standards and policies across Business Unit teams.Greater awareness of information security and data privacy requirements (globally); andDrive adoption of global security program standards throughout the product and core business platform teams.
