Name: Decision Analytics Associate Consultant (San Francisco area, CA)
Description: ZS is the world’s largest consulting firm focused exclusively on helping companies improve overall performance and grow revenue and market share, through end-to-end sales and marketing solutions – from customer insights and strategy to analytics, operations and technology. From our worldwide offices, ZS experts draw on deep industry and domain expertise to help companies make smarter decisions quickly and cost effectively. We are particularly known for our strong presence in the pharmaceutical and health care sectors, yet work across a range of industries. ZS's Business Consulting group delivers solutions to a broad spectrum of marketing and sales challenges. We also help our clients transform their marketing and sales organizations to implement these solutions. Our solutions and recommendations are based in rigorous research and analysis underpinned by deep expertise and thought leadership. DECISION ANALYTICS ASSOCIATE CONSULTANT Decision Analytics Associate Consultants (DAACs) design and execute analyses to address business problems for our clients and project teams. DAACs leverage their analytic skills to find data-driven insights that help our clients solve their most important business problems, and engage with clients to help them understand the implications and make plans to act on them. Responsibilities:Develop and apply advanced statistical models that help clients understand dynamic business issues;Leverage analytic techniques to use data to guide client and ZS team decision-making;Design custom analyses in R, Tableau, SAS, Visual Basic and Excel to investigate and inform client needs;Synthesize and communicate results to clients and ZS teams through oral and written presentations;Develop client relationships and serve as key point of contact on aspects of projects;Provide client and ZS teams project status updates;Create project deliverables and implement solutions;Advance problem solving skills and improve ZS’s capabilities;Guide and mentor Associates on teams. Qualifications: • Bachelor's or master's degree required in any discipline with strong record of academic success in quantitative and analytic coursework such as operations research, applied mathematics, management science, data science, statistics, econometrics or engineering;2-4 years of relevant post-collegiate job experience. A PhD may substitute in lieu of work experience;High motivation, good work ethic, maturity and personal initiative;Strong oral and written communication skills;Empathy, adaptability and emotional intelligence;Close attention to detail, with a quality-focused mindset;Self-discipline for planning and organizing tasks;Aptitude for, and enjoyment of, working in teams.  ZS is a global consulting firm; fluency in English is required, additional fluency in at least one European or Asian language is desirable.  Candidates must possess work authorization for their intended country of employment. An on-line application, including a full set of transcripts (official or unofficial), is required to be considered.  ZS Associates offers a competitive compensation package with salary and bonus incentives, complete medical/dental/life insurance programs and retirement benefits. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. NO AGENCY CALLS, PLEASE.   Connect with ZS on social media:Like ZS Careers on FacebookFollow ZS Careers on Twitter and InstagramFollow ZS on LinkedIn for more job opportunitiesSubscribe to the ZS YouTube Channel ZS has been recognized globally for its expertise in consulting and its flexible work environment. View ZS’s accolades.

Name: Internal Consultant
Description: Job DescriptionOn Lok Lifeways  We are a non-profit committed to our participants. On Lok Lifeways PACE long term senior care is provided by On Lok Senior Health Services, a 501(c)(3) non-profit Dedicated to The Care of Elders: On Lok, Inc. is a not-for-profit organization founded in the early 1970s by a group of citizens concerned about the plight of elders and the lack of long term options in the community. On Lok, Inc. serves as the administrative arm of a group of five affiliated non-profit organizations. Its functions include research and development, human resources, fundraising and management information systems.  We understand the importance of a system that works together. Your expertise, drive and passion can help us carry out our mission to improve lives and advance healthcare.  Join our team of leaders to begin a rewarding career!  POSITION SUMMARY: This position will support the organization-wide strategic plan by leading the design and execution of high-priority strategic planning projects, and operating as an internal consultant on key initiatives defined by the strategic plan. This position will involve high exposure to the Senior Leadership Team and will report to the Senior Director of Strategic Planning. DUTIES / RESPONSIBILITIES:Project Definition:a. Define and identify the problem to solve, while keeping a strategic mindsetb. Understand needs quickly and analyze how best to achieve desired outcomesc. Be able to propose a variety of analytical methods to best define and scope the workResearch:a. Work with stakeholders to gather informationb. Be able to draw upon knowledge to quickly hone in on data sourcesc. Digest and synthesize large amounts of information quicklyAnalysis:a. Be able to employ a variety of analytical methods depending on the issueb. Be well versed in financial modelling, cost-benefit analysis, operational efficiency analysis, buy-versussell decisions, scenario planning, statistical analysis, marketing analytics, feasibility studies, etc.c. Be rigorous in drawing insights from informationRecommendations:a. Deepen insights and frame decision points for the organizationb. Use data and objectivity to guide discussionc. Effectively contextualize recommendationsPersuasion and presentation:a. Create effective storyboards for varying levels of the organization and diverse audiencesProject management:a. Develop project workplans and execute with efficiency and autonomyb. May be assigned to other departments and functional areas to manage key projectsc. May be called upon to oversee in-flight projects in other departmentsd. May provide coaching and technical assistance to project teams that need more hands-on support in building business cases, creating change management plans, defining scope of work, planning work, etc.Other duties and projects, as assigned.QUALIFICATIONS (knowledge, skills, abilities):Bachelor's degree with outstanding academic performance required. Master's degree in business, or related analytical specialty preferred.Minimum 3-5 years of firm-based management consulting, or structured internal consulting.Exceptional analytical and quantitative problem-solving skillsStrong record of leadership, collaborative teamwork, and good judgmentAbility to navigate nonprofit organizations with sensitivity and effectivenessAbility to communicate complex ideas with organization, narrative and persuasionAttention to detail, and the ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneouslyDemonstrated level of resourcefulness and can-do attitudeKnowledge of the healthcare industry a plus. Knowledge of affordable housing also a plus. The above statements are intended to describe the general nature of work performed. They are not considered as an exhaustive list of all job tasks performed. On Lok reserves the right to change job descriptions, work hours or work sites as required by the program/  On Lok's Employee Benefits include (eligible for any position for 20 hr/wk or more): Medical, Dental, and Vision coverageRetirement Savings Plan 403(b) and Term Life/AD&D InsuranceFlexible Spending Account, Commuter Checks, MLA scholarships, Employee Assistance Program (EAP)Pet Insurance and additional discountsHolidays (10 per year), vacation time, sick leave, and long-term disability insurance Job Posted by ApplicantPro

Name: Product Designer
Description: Who We Are:Perpetua's mission is to transform digital advertising from a painful manual chore with uncertain results into a delightful experience that can predictably impact a company's bottom line. We help companies with world-class products and brands win on Amazon by analyzing large amounts of data and using AI to develop smart optimization algorithms that drive transformational sales growth.As a Product Designer, you will be involved in every aspect of the product development process, from coming up with the next great product innovation to making final visual tweaks right before launch. You will be expected to utilize your full range of product design, interaction design, and visual design skills, and you will own the experience for a wide area of the Perpetua product.What You'll Do:Take full ownership over designing the new Perpetua native mobile app from the ground upCompletely rethink how complex, cross-channel advertising campaigns can be monitored and managed entirely from a mobile deviceWork with the Product Manager to turn broad conceptual ideas into practical, elegant solutionsHelp establish a design discipline and the design systems used at PerpetuaProduce wireframes, prototypes and high fidelity designs using tools such as Sketch, Zeplin and PrincipleContribute to high-level strategic decisions with the rest of the product and executive teamWhat You'll Have:Diploma or degree in digital design, interaction design or communications2+ years of UX/UI design on a software product teamExperience with end-to-end (UI + UX) product designExperience designing native mobile applicationsAdvanced proficiency in design tools such as Sketch, Photoshop or IlustratorAdvanced proficiency in animation and prototyping tools such as Principle or InVisionStrong communication skillsAbility to think on your feet and adapt to changing/open-ended requirementsDemonstrated strategic product thinking and visionBonus Points For:Previous experience with a fast scaling start-upExperience with B2B or business insights and analyticsRelevant personal projects and open source workExperience in a marketing or advertising spaceCompany Benefits:Impactful work that will help lay the foundation for future projectsMeaningful equity at an early stage companyGround floor opportunityPaid-for mealsUnlimited snacks and drinksGym membershipFull benefits including medical, dental, visionTop of the line technology to help you build your own workspaceFlexible time off policyAt Perpetua, we are dedicated to pursuing and hiring a diverse workforce with varied experiences, perspectives and opinions. We believe diversity helps our team perform better and enables us to build an outstanding product for our customers. Name: Business Analyst
Description: Job Description: Candidate needs to have strong excel skills and Tableu experience a plus. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree (BA/BS) from 4-year college or university required. Minimum of 2 years of related experience and/or training. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Strong organizational and analytical skills. Ability to provide efficient, timely, reliable and courteous service to customers. Ability to effectively present information. Requires knowledge of financial terms and principles. Ability to calculate intermediate figures such as percentages, discounts and/or commissions. Conducts basic financial analysis. Ability to comprehend, analyze, and interpret documents. Ability to solve problems involving several options in situations. Requires intermediate analytical and quantitative skills. Intermediate experience in MS Office Products (Excel, Access, Power Point, Word, etc.). Heavy emphasis on Excel and PowerPoint. Ability to use query and report generation tools. Responsibilities: The purpose of this position is to provide the research, data mining/analysis, reporting and interpretation of global, national, regional, local and/or account company performance metrics. Generates, reviews and understands reports. Uses aggregate data from multiple sources to assist in creating a complete analysis, improvement and/or recommendation. Reviews the accuracy of information provided and responds to requests from management and vendors. Understands and works with scenario planning (exit/maintain/grow) tools/models. Analyzes trends in general business conditions. Identifies opportunities for improvements by and among the clients and/or companies. May coordinate involvement of personnel from other departments and information technology groups to facilitate successful project implementations. May act as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) for key systems/processes in subject teams and day-to-day functions. Facilitates the maintenance and reporting of benchmarks and performance metrics. Other duties may be assigned. No formal supervisory responsibilities in this position. May provide informal assistance such as technical guidance and/or training to coworkers. May coordinate and assign tasks to co-workers within a work unit and/or project. Decisions made with understanding of procedures and company policies to achieve set results and deadlines. Responsible for setting own project deadlines. Errors in judgment may cause short-term impact to coworkers and supervisor.

Name: Sales Account Executive (SaaS)
Description: Chartio is changing how companies work by building the best visualization interface to data. We make connection easy and building dashboards intuitive, so anyone on a team can create beautiful charts and draw meaningful insight from their data.Old Business Intelligence tools were complicated, expensive and just plain bad. We mean to change all that.Are you someone who loves data, is analytical and knows how to close deals selling SaaS platforms? Are you a competitive and team player who is always fighting to get to the top of the leaderboard and love to win?We are looking for experienced, self driven and hardworking sales executives to join our sales team. We are a fast moving team and this is an opportunity for you to be a key part of building a successful business and sales team.As an Account Executive, you’re a B2B hunter with experience selling SaaS to companies with a primary focus of This is a full cycle sales position. To be successful in this role you will have experience with Inbound / outbound qualification, discovery calls, product demos, running point on trials with a Sales Engineer through the POC, negotiating terms and closing the sale.You will be our voice to customers and focus on driving sales through outbound calls/emails/meetings/demos and through quickly qualifying the large number of inbound leads we receive. You will be an expert at analyzing customer needs, building trust and mapping solutions that make customers happy. Our goal is to build lasting customer relationships.If you are ready to be part of a growing startup company with amazing benefits and an opportunity to make uncapped earnings, we'd love to hear from you.ResponsibilitiesManage a full sales cycleGenerate new business opportunities and effectively manage the pipelineForecast monthly and quarterly salesProvide input to product and marketing teams from conversations with customersManage contract T’s&C’s negotiations during the sales process.Must meet and exceed your quarterly and annual quota targets.Approach all deals with a customer-first “ready to help” mentality.Work cross-functionally with different organizations such as Sales, Marketing, Customer Success, Product and EngineeringAccurately track all sales activity and forecasting in Salesforce.RequirementsAbility to understand customer requirements and identify solutions.Must be a self-starter with a strong desire to learn and grow.1-3 years of account executive sales experience (in a closing role), preferably in SaaS platform software.Strong prospecting abilities and track record of building net new business.Proven track record of success and over-achievement of quotas.Effective written and verbal communicator.You have strong interpersonal skills and are an excellent team player.Adaptability - you understand that change is constant, and you embrace it. You’re agile and resilient. You move quickly and encourage continued improvement.Strong work ethic and competitive mindset. You always want to be at the top of the leaderboard.You have the ability, desire and willingness to learn independently.You have a curiosity for the data and analytics space.Knowledge of Salesforce or similar CRM.This position is an inside sales role with little to no travel requirements. Must be able to report into San Francisco office daily.DesireablesDatabase familiarityBusiness Intelligence familiarityAnalytics/Statistics backgroundBenefitsCompetitive salary & uncapped commission structureEquity at a pre-IPO companyHealth, dental and vision insurance401KFree lunches, snacks and drinksGreat startup company culture

Name: Solution Owner - Customer Success Transformation
Description: As a member of the Business Transformation Team at Splunk, you are passionate about doing meaningful, transformative work, building strategies that can be operationalized and sustained over the long term - positioning our company for continued high-growth.  As a Solution Owner in the team, you are a business strategist and technologist who is driven to design holistic, end-to-end business transformation solutions, curious about problems and understanding how everything works, and a passionate advocate for the evolution of Customer Success capabilities in a fast-paced SaaS company.  You enjoy working in a dynamic role on interesting and complex transformation initiatives - wearing the hat of a Business & Systems Analyst (BA/BSA), Project Manager (PM) or Product Owner at any given time - flexing to the needs of the program as it moves from strategic planning and capability roadmapping, to discovery and blueprinting, to detailed solution design and implementation.  You are experienced and provide subject matter expertise on a range of process improvement and management activities for core Customer Success capabilities (e.g., Adopt to Renew, Customer Success Management, Renewal Coordination and Management, Customer Issue Management, etc.).  If you are inspired by the opportunity to build the right strategies to take our business to the next level, evolving our Customer Success capabilities and setting our people up for success - then this job is for you!  Responsibilities: I want to and can do that!  Translate strategy into plans for transforming Customer Success capabilities.  + Understand Splunk?s operating model and commercial objectives and engage with various functional leaders to understand their long- and short-term business strategies  + Support Business Transformation Program Managers to establish capability transformation roadmaps, define transformation program goals and objectives, and identify opportunities for continuous improvement  + Partner with Business Transformation Program Managers in process delivery and process re-engineering; anticipate requirements, uncover areas for improvement, and develop/implement solutions  Analyze business challenges and design solutions that deliver value across the LAER customer engagement model.  + Analyze business challenges (as-is), generate creative ideas/potential solution approaches (to-be), and help drive, design, deliver and document holistic solutions across people, process, technology, and data dimensions  + Leverage expertise in industry best practices, policies, procedures, and methodologies to establish process excellence and ensure transformation objectives are met  + Leverage a combination of strong business acumen, solid analytical and problem solving skills, and excellent facilitation techniques to lead the business into a operationally excellent end solution  Serve as a product owner for Customer Success capabilities, transformation programs, and internal-facing products/systems (e.g., Salesforce, Gainsight, Aviso, Xactly, etc.).  + Partner with business stakeholders to understand, analyze, refine, prioritize, and communicate business needs to ensure that the assigned agile team fully understands the project scope, objectives, and requirements  + Develop artifacts that translate business needs into executable, user-centered requirements - clearly articulating product decisions to business users, product teams, and internal stakeholders  + Work with client stakeholders, scrum masters, and product teams to maintain, prioritize, and sequence them based on business value or ROI - coming up with creative ways to test ideas and introduce value early  Work across organizations as a change agent.  + Maintain a diverse, cross-functional network and serve as a liaison for the Business Transformation team, transformation programs, and/or Customer Success business stakeholders  + Work with change management, learning and development, and communications teams to ensure business readiness for change and the adoption of new ways of working needed to realize the value of transformation programs and technology investments  + Support Business Transformation efforts to strengthen Splunk?s organizational muscle to successfully plan for and execute transformations  Requirements: I?ve already done that or have that!  + Minimum of 10 years of Business Process Improvement experience or relevant combinations of professional experience spanning: strategy and operations, business analysis, business systems analysis, project management, product management, customer success management, software renewals, etc.  + Experience and expertise across the Customer Success capability (Adopt to Renew, Customer Success Management, Renewal Coordination and Management, Customer Issue Management) - particularly in a high-growth, highly-scaled SaaS Environment  + Experience with business transformations and Customer Success capability evolutions accelerated by enterprise technologies (e.g., Salesforce, Gainsight, etc.) - you identify opportunities for efficiency and productivity that are realized through technology  + Familiar with execution within agile software delivery frameworks (e.g., Scrum, Kanban, SAFe, XP, Lean) especially for the automation of business processes, improvements, or redesigns - bonus points for experience driving team cadence, running Scrum ceremonies, facilitating Backlog Refinement sessions, etc.  + You are known for: asking tough questions to understand the ?why?, communicating complex principles simply, collaborating with cross-functional teams composed of diverse business and technical stakeholders, taking a solution-based approach that leverages our collective knowledge, taking personal accountability and getting the work done.  + Your super powers! Are you a consultant who built a career solving problems in these domains? Have you earned advanced certifications for relevant methodologies or technologies? We want to know how the breadth and depth of your experiences sets you apart!  Education: Got it!  Bachelor?s degree/foreign equivalent in a related discipline or substantial relevant on the job experience  MBA a plus but not required (especially if you have other super powers, see above)  Splunk is an Equal Opportunity Employer.  About Splunk  Splunk was founded to pursue a disruptive new vision: make machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. Machine data is one of the fastest growing and most complex areas of big data?generated by every component of IT infrastructures, applications, mobile phone location data, website clickstreams, social data, sensors, RFID and much more.  Splunk is focused specifically on the challenges and opportunity of taking massive amounts of machine data, and providing powerful insights from that data. IT insights. Security insights. Business insights. It?s what we call Operational Intelligence.  Since shipping its software in 2006, Splunk now has over 13,000 customers in more than 110 countries around the world. These organizations are using Splunk to harness the power of their machine data to deepen business and customer understanding, mitigate cybersecurity risk, prevent fraud, improve service performance and reduce costs. Innovation is in our DNA ? from technology to the way we do business. Splunk is the platform for Operational Intelligence!  Splunk has more than 2,700 global employees, with headquarters in San Francisco, an office in San Jose, CA and regional headquarters in London and Hong Kong.  We?ve built a phenomenal foundation for success with a proven leadership team, highly passionate employees and unique patented software. We invite you to help us continue our drive to define a new industry and become part of an innovative, and disruptive software company.  Benefits & Perks: Wow! This is really cool!  SF Only  Medical, full company paid Dental, Vision and Life Insurance, Flexible Spending and Dependent Care Accounts, Commuter Accounts, Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP), 401(k), 3 weeks of PTO, sick leave, stocked micro kitchens in Splunk offices, catered lunches on Mondays, catered breakfast on Fridays, basketball hoops, ping pong, arcade games, BBQ?s, soccer, ?Fun Fridays?.  Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.  Non SF  Medical, full company paid Dental, Vision and Life Insurance, Flexible Spending and Dependent Care Accounts, Commuter Accounts, Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP), 401(k), 3 weeks of PTO and sick leave. Our work environments vary by location however we believe in hosting amenities and fun activities to fuel our energy. You may find fully stocked micro kitchens, catered lunches on Mondays and breakfast on Fridays, basketball hoops, ping pong, arcade games, BBQ?s, soccer and ?Fun Fridays?.  This isn?t a job ? it?s a life changer ? are you ready?  Individuals seeking employment at Splunk are considered without regards to race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, age, physical or mental disability or medical condition (except where physical fitness is a valid occupational qualification), genetic information, veteran status, or any other consideration made unlawful by federal, state or local laws. Click here to review the US Department of Labor?s EEO is The Law notice. Please click here to review Splunk?s Affirmative Action Policy Statement.  Splunk does not discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. Please click here to review Splunk?s Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination Provision.  Splunk is also committed to providing access to all individuals who are seeking information from our website. Any individual using assistive technology (such as a screen reader, Braille reader, etc.) who experiences difficulty accessing information on any part of Splunk?s website should send comments to accessiblecareers@splunk.com. Please include the nature of the accessibility problem and your e-mail or contact address. If the accessibility problem involves a particular page, the message should include the URL of that page.  Splunk doesn't accept unsolicited agency resumes and won't pay fees to any third-party agency or firm that doesn't have a signed agreement with Splunk.  To check on your application click here.

Name: Usability & Business Analyst
Description: Our CompanyInsikt is a rapidly growing technology company that connects borrowers seeking loans with investors seeking better, stable returns. Our mission is to bring trust and transparency back to the world of lending and securitization while also helping underserved families and small businesses find responsible credit options. We are accomplishing this mission by enabling:Lending: Our proprietary white-label lending platform (Lendify) allows any retail store, online brand, or distribution partner to make loans or provide purchase financing to its customers, in its own brand name, without any prior credit expertise and with minimal upfront investment.Investing: Our proprietary investing platform allows accredited investors to buy into a variety of investment instruments backed by distinct loan portfolios underwritten in-house. Each investor has online access to all the same data as our Risk and Analytics teams, ensuring transparency into all investment instruments. We have brought together the best and brightest from top-tier technology companies, leading financial service providers, and world-class investment firms. We are funded by some of the best investors and entrepreneurs in the world, including First Mark Capital, Revolution Ventures, Capital One, Continental Investors and Serengeti Asset Management.Our Values We are a tight-knit team of highly talented and motivated people from a diverse set of backgrounds and industries all tenaciously driven by our mission. We value creativity, courage, and collaboration and we believe in letting the best and most innovative ideas rise to the top. We are looking for the absolute best people who want work hard, play hard, and build a socially-minded, profitable, and enduring business in the process.The job We are looking for a Usability Analyst to help improve the experience of people applying for our loans and improving the number of applicants completing the process.Responsibilities include: Drive analytical insights through in-depth analysis of our data assets Interview users that had issues to understand improvement opportunities Interact with agents to gather feedback and identify where to focus the attention Prepare improvements suggestions for our product managers and engineers Communicate to agents and partners about new features and monitor the impact Support new initiativesJob RequirementsThe ideal candidate will have:Written and verbal fluency in English & Spanish A true curiosity and passion for understanding the underlying aspects of every business challenge Willingness to get your hands dirtyeveryone, top to bottom, is an individual contributor Desire to step outside of your comfort zone, wear multiple hats, and learn new things Strong critical thinking skills and ability to weigh trade-offs quickly and empirically Strong attention to detail with qualitative and analytical skills An energetic, driven, fun, and generally awesome personality! Passion for walking a mile in anothers shoes Strong communication, organizational, interpersonal and listening skillsCompensation Compensation is competitive and will be based on prior work experience Insikt Options 401(k) Complimentary snacks in the office Onsite gym Convenient location in Downtown San Francisco less than two blocks from BART We offer equity packages that allow you to have ownership in this growing company. Full medical, dental and vision coverage. Insikt pays 100% for employee premiums and 50% dependent premiums for medical, dental and vision benefits. You can expect a collaborative environment, team building activities, dinners, and fun monthly gatherings, along with mentorship and career growth. We believe in getting people to where they need to go. This value extends beyond our business principles into Insikts internal career development philosophy. As such, you will work closely with a highly-experienced management team to mentor you and help you achieve your personal career goals.

Name: Android Digital Experience Owner
Description: The Android Experience Owner is a senior-level leadership role with broad responsibilities across multiple digital journeys that comprise a complete Android Mobile App experience. The person in this role will lead other leaders (multiple teams) and may also have senior or principal-level direct reports who are individual contributors. In addition, they will collaborate across the Enterprise to ensure that the experience delivered meets both customer and business objectives.  Maximizing Digital Product Management value to the bank Provides a vision for the Android Mobile App experience (Why, What, How) linking customer experience outcomes to business objectives.Leverage data and business understanding to ensure new and existing digital products manage risk while giving our customers great experiences.Partner with capability managers, delivery managers, architects, UXDesign, scrum masters, business lines and other product managers to evangelize the best solutions and facilitate execution across various stakeholders.Hands-on leader who excels at data analysis and customer research to drive discovery and ensure the right problems are identified along with the most fitting solution.Work collaboratively across BLs / Functions to define, sequence, and execute the Enterprise Android Mobile App RoadmapAct as a leader and mentor for other digital product managers.Advocates and embodies customer-obsession, within and outside the Omnichannel Experience organization, resulting in simple, innovative, lovable digital products/experiencesPresents persuasively and authoritatively to peers and senior leadership, while facilitating collaborative conversation.Directs people and work efforts across several, simultaneous projects to meet business goals.Measures and manages the Digital Product Management contribution by o Synthesizing each project’s business goals to set specific, measurable objectives so we can measure success.  o Managing ongoing measurement and reporting of these criteria.  o Consistently delivering work that meets or exceeds the criteria.  o Reporting regularly on these measurements to senior leadership. Manages the “brand” of the product management team and promotes a customer-obsessed culture within the Bank, making the team a source of expertise others seek and want to join. Leading the business of Digital Product Management Partner with the VP of Platform Experience to: o Define and evolve the Android experience in alignment with the Consumer Strategy.  o Create Enterprise product roadmaps aligned with partner business objectives.  o Taking products from initial concept through user research, co-creation, and rapid prototyping.  o Partner with Agile Scrum Lead to evolve how Agile and lean management practices are applied to digital product management.  o Applying perspective from best practices in platform based strategies. Clearly quantifies the strategic value and business benefit of digital products and drives pitching them to executive management for investment approval.Demonstrates thought leadership by integrating analytics, business model, and design thinking to drive innovative new experiences for customers that have a positive impact on business results.Manages a consistent, repeatable set of product artifacts (product-level roadmaps, feature / function gap analysis, journey / process maps, inventory of “best-in-class” experiences), evolving them in sync as our business changes and grows. Building a world-class Android product management team Manages, hires and develops a high-performing team with appropriate skills. Motivates and engages team members to achieve peak performance and high job satisfaction.Leads and inspires product managers across multiple areas (including money movement, cards servicing, authentication, communications, financial management, multi-language support).Formally mentors team members who show potential for team leadership.

Name: Account Manager, Biz/Tech/Fi, Digital Operations
Description: Account Manager  The Account Manager is the operational point of contact for Condé Nast's key advertising business relationships. Specifically, responsible for providing strategic oversight to pre and post-sale activities to ensure client satisfaction as well as development and growth of the relationships. As an Account Manager, you play a critical role in a team as the clients' trusted advisor and champion. You manage the day-to-day operations of your team and partner to develop, execute and manage complex campaigns on our platform. Your deep understanding of your clients' business objectives and analytical mindset will shape future strategies through data driven insights and recommendations. Responsibilities:Partner with Sales on all aspects of campaign planning, launch execution, optimization and recap with sales and other internal groups and support teams for key clientsOutline and advise on new and innovative opportunities through client calls or emails with sales and activation as neededKnowledgeable on client current events and business affairsEstablish regular contact with customers to ensure their needs are met, work with Sales Planner in measuring progress and proactively address issues and develop solutionsLiaise with internal groups as needed to troubleshoot and deliver solutions to clientsUp-sell and renew existing campaigns/clients, with new, innovative, on-strategy ideas that focus on retention and growing businessManage client relationships and client satisfaction, including determining client goals, deliverables, approvals, and asset management in order to achieve best results and campaign successCommunicate directly with agencies, clients, internal teams and outside vendors as necessary on custom program implementationand become an expert on site content, editorial specials and new ad units to create the strongest media plans possible Desired Skills and Qualifications 4+ years of relevant professional experience, Advertising field preferredBS, preferred in Marketing or Business (or other related field)Demonstrated success at working with cross-functional teams and building strong relationships internally and externallyProven track record of client customer success, stakeholder management and ability to drive incremental revenueStrong attention to detail, good follow-up and able to generate creative solutions to meet client needsAbility to multi-task across multiple projects and stakeholdersExperience with Ad Technology / Ad Platforms: ideally, DFP, Salesforce.com, AdBook, Facebook Ads Manager, Omniture, DAR, MOATExcellent organization and communication and skillsProficient in Keynote, PowerPoint, Word, ExcelAbout Condé Nast: Condé Nast is a premier media company renowned for producing the highest quality content for the world's most influential audiences. Attracting more than 100 million consumers across its industry-leading print, digital and video brands, the company's portfolio includes some of the most iconic titles in media: Vogue, Vanity Fair, Glamour, Brides, Self, GQ, GQ Style, The New Yorker, Condé Nast Traveler, Allure, Architectural Digest, Bon Appétit, Epicurious, Wired, W, Golf Digest, Golf World, Teen Vogue, Ars Technica, The Scene, Pitchfork and Backchannel. The company's newest division, Condé Nast Entertainment, was launched in 2011 to develop film, television and premium digital video programming.  For more information, please visit condenast.com and follow @CondeNast and @CondeNastCareer for Twitter and @condenastcareers for InstagramSDL2017

Name: Director, Sales Strategy & Operations - Global Industries GoToMarket
Description: Join us as we pursue our disruptive new vision to make machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers. At Splunk, we?re committed to our work, customers, having fun and most importantly to each other?s success. Learn more about Splunk careers and how you can become a part of our journey. Role: Splunk is seeking an analytical and strategic operations leader to join the Global Sales Strategy & Operations Team. This individual will be a key business partner and trusted advisor to our Global Industries GoToMarket team. Splunk is in its infancy stages of building out the industries practice and this individual will be a key contributor in shaping the company?s industries strategy, resource investments and operating cadence.  Key responsibilities will include determining the early success metrics of the Industries GTM team and developing highly repeatable and scalable industry-specific campaigns by closely interlocking with our Products, Market Group, Marketing and Sales team. Ultimately, each industries team will be successful if it is growing faster than the rest of the business and boosting our sales team?s productivity.  The ideal candidate will be data driven, system savvy, intellectually curious, a fast learner, detail oriented and able to move quickly while keeping focused on high impact projects with limited direction and supervision. Equally important, this individual will also be able to communicate effectively with sales leadership and senior executives across multiple departments Responsibilities: Planning ? Work with global leadership teams as well as cross functional leaders (HR, Finance, Product, Marketing, etc.) to design and execute the industries GTM sales motion, determine the resources required to execute the plan, align on strategies and execution plan with our direct sales teams, and socialize the plan with the broader GTM team. This person will be the strategic voice of the Global Industries team.  Execution ? Manage day-to-day operational tasks, including but not limited to headcount and resourcing allocation, salesforce.com hierarchy and industries data management. Improve processes and increase efficiencies for the sales organization as well as for the sales operations group.  Reporting & Analytics ? Ensure key dashboards and reports are accurate and relevant. Leverage existing and/or new applications to improve delivery technology. Collaborate with senior management to refine KPIs and interpret results into actionable recommendations. Identify trends to improve business results including lead conversion, lead management and pipeline reporting.  Project Management ? Ensure surgical execution of the industries strategies across the various GTM functions. Ensure all parties are well-aligned and socialized of various initiatives launched by the Global Industries GTM team. Requirements: + 8+ years of experience in Management Consulting, Investment Banking, Business Strategy or Sales/GoToMarket Operations role desired  + Experience working for fast-growing enterprise software companies is a plus  + Works effectively in complex and matrixed organizations. Able to see the big-picture while also being hands-on and in the details.  + Always focused on doing what?s right for the business. High energy and contagious enthusiasm. Willing to take on the tough projects and challenges to support growth of the business.  + Ability to be highly productive with minimal oversight from senior management.  + Sets goals and drives to fulfillment. Takes responsibility for actions and for outcomes.  + Possesses business acumen, strong analytical, troubleshooting, problem-solving, and project management skills.  + Strong interpersonal skills and able to speak in front of senior audiences as well as write clearly, concisely, and compellingly  + Demonstrated ability to solve problems and provide practical business insights from complex data sets  + Gathers and uses data strategically to create improvements and persuade others  + Ability to manage multiple concurrent projects and drive initiatives in a cross-functional environment.  + Willing to travel as needed (~25%)  + Location: San Francisco or San Jose  + Bachelor?s Degree in an analytical field (e.g. Computer Science, Business, Engineering, Mathematics, or Statistics).  + MBA/ graduate degree preferred but not required  We value diversity at our company. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which the candidate is applying. For job positions in San Francisco, CA, and other locations where required, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.  About Splunk  Splunk was founded to pursue a disruptive new vision: make machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. Machine data is one of the fastest growing and most complex areas of big data?generated by every component of IT infrastructures, applications, mobile phone location data, website clickstreams, social data, sensors, RFID and much more.  Splunk is focused specifically on the challenges and opportunity of taking massive amounts of machine data, and providing powerful insights from that data. IT insights. Security insights. Business insights. It?s what we call Operational Intelligence.  Since shipping its software in 2006, Splunk now has over 13,000 customers in more than 110 countries around the world. These organizations are using Splunk to harness the power of their machine data to deepen business and customer understanding, mitigate cybersecurity risk, prevent fraud, improve service performance and reduce costs. Innovation is in our DNA ? from technology to the way we do business. Splunk is the platform for Operational Intelligence!  Splunk has more than 2,700 global employees, with headquarters in San Francisco, an office in San Jose, CA and regional headquarters in London and Hong Kong.  We?ve built a phenomenal foundation for success with a proven leadership team, highly passionate employees and unique patented software. We invite you to help us continue our drive to define a new industry and become part of an innovative, and disruptive software company.  Benefits & Perks: Wow! This is really cool!  SF Only  Medical, full company paid Dental, Vision and Life Insurance, Flexible Spending and Dependent Care Accounts, Commuter Accounts, Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP), 401(k), 3 weeks of PTO, sick leave, stocked micro kitchens in Splunk offices, catered lunches on Mondays, catered breakfast on Fridays, basketball hoops, ping pong, arcade games, BBQ?s, soccer, ?Fun Fridays?.  Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.  Non SF  Medical, full company paid Dental, Vision and Life Insurance, Flexible Spending and Dependent Care Accounts, Commuter Accounts, Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP), 401(k), 3 weeks of PTO and sick leave. Our work environments vary by location however we believe in hosting amenities and fun activities to fuel our energy. You may find fully stocked micro kitchens, catered lunches on Mondays and breakfast on Fridays, basketball hoops, ping pong, arcade games, BBQ?s, soccer and ?Fun Fridays?.  This isn?t a job ? it?s a life changer ? are you ready?  Individuals seeking employment at Splunk are considered without regards to race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, age, physical or mental disability or medical condition (except where physical fitness is a valid occupational qualification), genetic information, veteran status, or any other consideration made unlawful by federal, state or local laws. Click here to review the US Department of Labor?s EEO is The Law notice. Please click here to review Splunk?s Affirmative Action Policy Statement.  Splunk does not discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. Please click here to review Splunk?s Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination Provision.  Splunk is also committed to providing access to all individuals who are seeking information from our website. Any individual using assistive technology (such as a screen reader, Braille reader, etc.) who experiences difficulty accessing information on any part of Splunk?s website should send comments to accessiblecareers@splunk.com. Please include the nature of the accessibility problem and your e-mail or contact address. If the accessibility problem involves a particular page, the message should include the URL of that page.  Splunk doesn't accept unsolicited agency resumes and won't pay fees to any third-party agency or firm that doesn't have a signed agreement with Splunk.  To check on your application click here.

Name: Financial Planning amp; Analysis Manager

True team player and self-starter with a keen sense of urgency, who likes to see the big picture and focuses on details  ? Name: Sr. Product Manager, Ad Platform
Description: Sr. Product Manager, Ad PlatformActivision Blizzard Media is a rapidly growing business created to connect advertisers with our 350M+ global player base across Activision, Blizzard and King. The initial goal of this thriving start-up effort has been to create premium, innovative advertising experiences for world-class casual mobile games like King’s Candy Crush Saga. Looking ahead, we plan to launch advertising across the Activision Blizzard portfolio, including high growth areas like eSports. This is a really exciting time to join this growing business.  We are seeking a skilled senior product manager that has a passion for digital advertising, data-driven platforms and the gaming industry. You enjoy gaining a deep understanding of relevant technology and your target customer, creatively solving complex problems, and can effectively communicate your solutions. You are a team player and enjoy working in a collaborative and fast-paced environment. You enjoy playing with data to support your decisions, pinpointing areas of product prioritization and helping align tactical implementation with corporate strategy.  Working with internal teams and external stakeholders you will identify product opportunities and partner with Engineering to build effective solutions and with Product Marketing to take them to market. You will be responsible for the roadmap, feature definition and prioritization of key areas of our ad platform. The right candidate will have a strong understanding of the back-end workings of an ad platform such as demand selection and yield optimisation.Your role within our KingdomWork with key stakeholders to evaluate product needs and identify key business drivers in order to develop set the strategy for mediation and build a product roadmap aligned with the product visionDevelop detailed product requirements inclusive of product mocks if needed and work with engineering to verify understanding and determine LOEBuild business cases and analytical insight for new business initiatives; this requires identifying and understanding key issues for particular customer personas, quantitatively analyzing these issues, and communicating key insights and resultsIdentify and influence strategic requirements with external demand partners to meet our mediation goalsShape the direction of products based on predictive revenue modeling by working hand-in-hand with data scientistsSkills to create thrillsMinimum 5+ years as a product manager in digital advertising or related industry required. Ideally, you will have a strong understanding of programmatic media buyingPrevious experience working on demand mediation productsExperience defining products for mobile applicationsStrong problem-solving capabilities evidenced by a proven ability to quantitatively and qualitatively analyze product concepts, strategic opportunities and competitive threatsExcellent interpersonal skills with demonstrated ability to influence cross-functional teamsBachelor's degree in technical field required. MBA preferredA great saga needs all sorts of heroesMaking games is fun. Especially when you do it with people who share the same idea of what makes a good workplace, great. We design games for everyone, no matter where they are or who they are, and we employ all sorts of people from all kinds of backgrounds to bring them to life. Truth is, we simply can’t expect diversity in our players and originality in our games without first nurturing it in our people. A great saga needs all sorts of heroes. And that’s it.We’re Seriously PlayfulOfficially, we’re a leading interactive entertainment company for the mobile world. Unofficially, we’re a serious business that’s not afraid to have fun. Every day at King, we mix intuition with logic, art with science and magic with mathematics to create the games the world loves to play. Together with our parent company Activision Blizzard, our mission is to bring moments of magic to everyday life. If you think this is something you can help us achieve, let’s talk.Apply now!Want to join our Kingdom? You’ll find all you need to apply, plus more information on our culture, values and benefits, including relocation packages at jobs.king.com. All applications should be made in English.

Name: Investment Senior Associate - Munich Re Ventures
Description: Title Investment Senior Associate - Munich Re Ventures  20-Nov-2018 Job DescriptionINVESTMENT SENIOR ASSOCIATE Munich Re Ventures  Location: San Francisco, CA  The Group: Munich Re Ventures  Munich Re Ventures invests in and partners with innovative companies to develop growth opportunities for Munich Re, including its subsidiaries Hartford Steam Boiler and ERGO Group. Munich Re is the world’s largest reinsurance company, with a global platform spanning all aspects of primary insurance and reinsurance.  Munich Re Ventures is responsible for corporate venture capital activities that deliver both strategic and financial value through minority investments and business partnerships. Our current areas of focus include the Internet of Things, Cyber Security, InsurTech, Autonomous Vehicles/Mobility, AI, Digital Health and more. We are active investors who frequently lead rounds and our syndicate partners include top tier venture capital and corporate venture capital firms.  Internally, the team works hand-in-hand with leaders in the Businesses, Engineering, Product Development, Innovation & IT to develop and execute on investment and partnership strategies. Externally, the team works with venture capital firms, incubators / accelerators, universities, entrepreneurs, and other corporations to develop technologies, companies and management teams that help us to strategically grow and transform the business.  The Role: Investment Senior Associate  The Investment Sr. Associate will be a member of the investment team and will participate in the end-to-end sourcing and execution of deals. In addition, there will be exposure to some post-close engagements in on-going relationships, and the on-going processes of the venture group. As a member of Munich Re Ventures, this role will also help with the development of strategic investment themes, market landscaping and other research. The position is located in San Francisco, with frequent travel within the US and internationally. The Investment Senior Associate will:Partner internally with the businesses to understand and inform their strategy, evaluate specific opportunities, gain business sponsorship, and identify specific activities to deliver strategic value.Assist in development of strategic themes and actionable investment thesis in areas of strategic relevance, in collaboration with the businesses and rest of the MRV team.Network externally to generate deal flow and relationships.Assist in preliminary due diligence on specific opportunities to assess attractiveness.Assist in preparation of review materials, updates, and Investment Memos for MRV’s governing bodies and the Investment Committee.Manage deal tracking and reporting.Conduct research on industry sectors, specific companies, and venture activity.Communicate successfully with entrepreneurs, management teams, syndicate partners, and other stakeholders, including attorneys, advisors, consultants, and Board Members.Represent Munich Re Ventures at various venture capital, investment, and innovation conferences and topical industry events. The Person: Successful Candidate  The successful candidate will have strong analytical business experience and a passion for new technology and engaging in the start-up community. Strategic Vision & Passion for Creating the Future: To be effective in this role requires gaining an understanding of Munich Re’s global insurance and reinsurance businesses, including business models, drivers of economic value, the insurance value chain, competition, risk transfer mechanisms and products, and regulatory environment. Individuals must be able to then build upon this knowledge to envision alternative futures and growth strategies and specific tactical paths to getting there, based on emerging trends, market dynamics, and evolving customer needs and partner opportunities.Intellectual Curiosity: This role requires an innate and insatiable intellectual curiosity about business, technology, and business models. Active and constant monitoring and engagement with the innovation ecosystem is essential.Strong Analytical Skills: Candidates must have requisite financial and investment analysis and research skills. Superior Visual & Written Communication Skills: This role requires the ability to sift through large quantities of information, both quantitative and qualitative, identify the salient points, and then communicate them in the appropriate form in a succinct and elegant story or case.Superb Communicator & Relentless Networker: The position requires a high level of communication, influence and interpersonal skills in order to network, navigate, and execute internally with cross-functional teams and externally with multiple stakeholders and partners.Disciplined Adaptable Tactician: This role requires strong execution and follow-through in emergent and uncertain situations. The ability to be adaptable and problem solve in the face of evolving internal and external stakeholder agendas and changing priorities is critical.Requisition Number2572BRQualificationsRequirements and Qualifications:3 + years of experience, including 1-2 years in venture capitalMBA required, preferably combined with a degree in one of the investment themes mentionedKnowledge and fluency in emerging technology and business models in sectors relevant to Munich ReSuperior oral, written and visual communication skillsSuperior proactive networking and relationship development skillsProven teamwork skills both as a leader and cross-functional team memberSelf motivated with high initiativeWilling to travel 15-20% of the time including internationallyState California Employment Type Full Time Additional Information We are an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.  The work environment characteristics, and any physical and mental requirements described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee. Other duties, responsibilities and activities may change or be assigned at any time with or without notice. City San Francisco Company Name Hartford Steam Boiler Country United States of America

Name: Marketing Manager, Analytics & SEO
Description: OverviewThe First Republic Brand Strategy team is focused on delivering digital and personal relevance to First Republic clients and prospects. The team oversees the firstrepublic.com property as well as digital advertising.  The Marketing Manager, Analytics & SEO supports First Republic web properties in the following areas: leads the implementation, optimization and measurement of SEO, monitors/analyzes, reports on analytics to identify opportunities for site optimizations and oversees web governance and risk, inclusive serving as an internal Accessibility subject matter expert. Position will work closely with multiple groups across the organization including Digital Technologies, Digital Channels and Data Analytics.ResponsibilitiesAnalytics: Assess firstrepublic.com site health metrics on a regular basis, identify and report out trends, provide recommendations for content, design, navigation enhancements.Respond to adhoc analytics requests. SEO: Collaborate with outside agencies and stakeholders to develop strategy, manage/lead/track implementation and measure effectiveness of SEO.Monitor and respond to SEO issues.Create SEO best practices documentation for publishers on firstrepublic.com.    Accessibility: Stay informed on Accessibility guidelines and updates.Guide accessibility audit on public website and act as SME for digital partners.Educate internal audiences on best practices.Drive accessibility related updates forward.Develop and present quarterly/annual reporting.
