QualificationsMinimum: Bachelor’s degree in a related field, including Marketing, Business, or Communications.At least 5 years of business experience and 3+ years within a Digital Marketing function or team.Proven success implementing SEO best practices, including technical tasks, on-platform and off-platform optimization.Experience working with SEO platforms and measurement tools.Experience working with a content management solution in a medium to large enterprise.Experience in Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics and/or other analytics toolsHighly analytical. Ability to identify key data points and translate into actionable results and optimization recommendations. Solid understanding of key performance indicators, dashboard reporting and performance measurement.Knowledge of online/digital accessibility and web governance guidelines and best practices.Experience ensuring website conforms to accessibility best practicesExperience managing projects with broad scope and multiple cross-company stakeholders.Understanding of Web governance principles and best practices and able to manage broad cross-company stakeholders to ensure best practices are maintained.Effective communicator. Ability to articulate an issue or opportunity in both quantitative and qualitative terms, and develop & deliver articulate, clear communications, both verbally and in written form, that resonates with a variety of audiences.Intuitive and people-savvy, capable of understanding, navigating, and influencing in a complex organization.Strong Project Management skills with the ability to manage multiple projects and priorities under tight deadlines, consistent/flawless follow through, flexible and able to shift gears and move fast.Experience working with agency partners.Highly organized and detail oriented.Provide extraordinary service to our clients – business units, partners.Ready to hit the ground running in all areas. Preferred: Basic knowledge of HTML and CSS.Experience working with Siteimprove, Sitecore.Experience working in different analytics platforms.SEO Certification.Experience within financial services or other highly regulated industry.Experience with a client-focused luxury brand.

Name: Sr. Business Analyst, Credit Products & Valuations
Description: Sr. Business Analyst, Credit Products and ValuationsOur Company Insikt is a rapidly growing, mission driven, financial technology company with the goal of making access to responsible, credit building, lending products a reality for all hardworking, financially underserved people. We are accomplishing our mission by partnering with leading companies to offer our credit products to their best customers using their brands, their employees, and their marketing assets. This partnership based approach to lending leads to efficiencies in our business that allow us to offer best-in-class rates and terms. Everything we do is built on our proprietary, white-label, lending tech platform (Lendify) that powers every aspect of lending from underwriting and credit decisioning to funding and servicing. We are well funded and positioned for continued growth in 2018. Our backers include some of the best investors and entrepreneurs in the world, including First Mark Capital, Revolution Ventures, Capital One, Continental Investors and Serengeti Asset Management.Our Team We have brought together the best and brightest from top tier technology companies, leading financial service providers, and world class investment firms. We are a tight-knit team of highly talented and motivated people from a diverse set of backgrounds and industries all tenaciously driven by our mission. We value creativity, courage, and collaboration and we believe in letting the best and most innovative ideas rise to the top. We are looking for the absolute best people who want work hard, play hard, and build a socially-minded, profitable, and enduring business in the process.The Job Insikt is looking for multiple Sr. Analysts to join our Strategy and Analytics team. In this role you will: A) ensure the unit level profitability of all of our loan products through the development, application, and maintenance of an appropriately complex valuation framework and model and B) drive analytical insights across the company including sales, marketing, credit, and operations, through in depth analysis of our data assets. We are a data-driven organization that values logical, fact-based recommendations to move our business forward. You will be responsible for uncovering insights, partnering with business owners to take action on those insights, and measuring the impact of your strategies. You will have access to a robust data infrastructure that captures details on every aspect of our business as well as a highly experienced management team. We are trying to solve some of the toughest problems in lending:How do you responsibly lend to someone who doesnt have a credit history while making a profit at the same time? How do you optimize for growth and resiliency at the same time? How can you identify high potential borrowers and design the credit journey to realize their dreams?Responsibilities: Strategic thinker: Develop business strategies that will drive growth, profitability, and competitive success for Insikt in the face of shifting consumer demands Product: Develop and implement new product and pricing strategies for various lending products; lead product level modeling/analytics Marketing: Lead direct-to-consumer marketing efforts for select products, and strategic intent for products distributed through the retail channel. Build targeted insights to inform the design and development of new customer experiences, as well as breakthrough technology and concepts designed to deliver on new go-to-market strategies Credit Risk: Drive step-change improvements in credit performance by connecting drivers of future consumer credit trends to historical behavior, creating risk models, and testing hypotheses using rigorous monitoring and analysis Execution: Manage and sequence delivery of business intent, build business requirements and execute against the product strategy. Oversee multiple projects concurrently Partnership: Work closely with colleagues across Technology, Sales, Operations, Finance and others to drive improvement in quality, volume, service, and profitability Analytic orientation: A proven track record of decision making and problem solving based on analytics. Conceptual thinking skills must be complemented by a strong quantitative orientation, given that a large part of the business is based on rigorous analytic marketing & credit risk management Strong business judgment, leadership and integrity: He/she should be a tenacious decision maker, able to bring a healthy, aggressive, yet responsible approach to business Impeccable written and oral communication credentials, coupled with strategic influencing skills and the ability to drive agreement through intellect, interpersonal and negotiation skills Clear results orientation: display an intense focus on achieving both short and long term goals. He/she should be able to drive and execute an agenda in an uncertain and fluid environment Successful track record of thriving in a fast paced, entrepreneurial and dynamic environment. Previous consulting experience is a plus.Experience & Skills: Degree in a quantitative field like statistics, economics, applied math, operations research or engineering. Advanced degree is a plus 2+ years of industry experience in a data science or analytics role Proficiency in SQL, Python - able to write structured and efficient queries on large data sets Firm grasp of statistical theory and practical application of statistical concepts to real world problem solving. A true curiosity and passion for understanding the underlying aspects of every business challenge Strong oral and written communication skills, and ability to collaborate with cross-functional partners to build the business Ability to thrive in a fast paced startup environment Comfortable producing executive level presentationsCompensation We offer an annual bonus program and equity packages that allow you to have ownership in this growing company. You can expect a flexible and collaborative work environment, team building activities, dinners, fun monthly gatherings, and a host of other startup perks including an awesome office in the San Francisco Financial District, a free gym membership, an office ping pong table, office yoga classes, and a stocked kitchen. The team is growing quickly. Highly talented and motivated employees will have the opportunity to help shape the direction of Insikts future. At Insikt, we are inspired by our mission to promote financial inclusion and driven to change the way credit is accessed. Join us and help us grow!

Name: Senior Business Intelligence Engineer
Description: Sr. Business Intelligence Engineer  At Zymergen IT, one of our key missions is to enable the enterprise to run more efficiently and effectively. Currently, we are building an Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW) to provide business analytics solutions and are looking for a motivated, empathetic, and experienced BI engineer to join this exciting team. This role has the overall responsibility for establishing and evangelizing BI and data visualization services in support of our business operations with Business Intelligence, and plays a critical role in enabling the ability to bring order and insight to the data.  Job Description and Specific Responsibilities Immediate responsibilities include:  Lead the technical charter on a BI platform for self-service analytics Work with product development and other key stakeholders to analyze their reporting needs, and define and implement appropriate analytic solutions to meet their needs Partner effectively with business stakeholders on data definition and data dictionary, data quality management, data delivery management, and performance optimizations Work closely with the business and technical teams in understanding our business domains and then delivering actionable output Define standards and procedures for best practices for visual intelligence design & development Qualifications/Experience Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related technical field 5+ years of data visualization experience using a business intelligence platform (experience with Tableau preferred) 5+ years experience with one or more database management tools like MySQL(preferred), or other database platforms Ability to write efficient SQL scripts for analysis and reporting Ability to perform thorough analysis of complex data, draw sound conclusions, and devise actionable strategies Experience on processing, filtering, and presenting large quantities of data Ability to prioritize and execute multiple tasks in a highly dynamic environment with results-oriented mindset Detail-oriented with proven analytical, problem identification and resolution skills Ability to work effectively in an unstructured and fast-paced environment, and have a high degree of self-management with clear communication and commitment to delivery timelines Proven interpersonal, written communication and presentation skills must be able to explain technical concepts and analysis implications clearly to a wide audience Additional Details Include any additional details that are important to the role. Examples of some details that you may include: travel requirements, working hours (if different from standard 9-5), projected career path for this role, previous experience in the field of synthetic biology is not essential.  Founded in 2013 and based in the San Francisco Bay Area, Zymergen is a technology company unlocking the power of biology. We deliver better economics for products made from biology that are used across industries, bring new products to market faster, and develop novel products. Our proprietary platform uses robots and machine learning to engineer microbes faster, more predictably, and to a level of performance previously unattainable. These microbes, and the products they produce, have broad applications across industries such as chemicals and materials, agriculture, and healthcare. For more information visit .

Name: Cloud ERP Data Analytics and Insights Director - Redwood
Description: Lead a team that acts as the central resource and driving force for the design, process, manufacturing, test, quality and marketing of product(s) as they move from conception to distribution. Organize interdepartmental activities ensuring completion of the project/product on schedule and within budget.  As a member of the product development division, you will analyze and integrate external customer specifications. Suggest and justify product directions and specifications. Specify, design and implement moderate changes to existing software architecture. Build new products and development tools. Build and execute unit tests and unit test plans. Review integration and regression test plans created by QA. Communicate with QA and porting engineering to discuss major changes to functionality.  Work is non-routine and very complex, involving the application of advanced technical/business skills in area of specialization. Leading contributor individually and as a team member, providing direction and mentoring to others. BS or MS degree or equivalent experience relevant to functional area. 7 years of software engineering or related experience.  Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans status or any other characteristic protected by law. Preferred Qualifications*Oracle Development, Global Business Strategy and Analytics (GBSA) Strategist **Location: US ** _Preferred Qualifications_  Every day, enterprises around the world focus on how to help their employees work simpler and smarter. And while enterprises are as diverse as the people in them, ranging from global manufacturing field managers, to automotive dealers, to financial advisors, and even public workers in growing cities in the world, they all share many core needs. They need to connect employees with their customers so they in turn can thrive. The scope of our opportunity is enormous. At Oracle, we re committed to growing our global cloud business and SaaS products and solutions. The Global Business Strategy and Analytics (GBSA) group is focused on helping our Cloud Application Development group set and drive key business and customer strategies and initiatives for ERP solutions. We are looking for a GBSA strategist who can help us scale and build a world class strategy and analytics capability for our SaaS products and solutions. Here s the kind of person we re looking for.*You thrive on working well with others to bring data to life.*You make the people around you better because you re providing them with data driven insights into the business and our SaaS customers. You love to collaborate with product managers, designers, strategists, user researchers, engineers, executives, and inspire them to grow Oracle through a data driven approach that produces insights and foresights into our SaaS business to help grow and expand it while at the same time taking care of customers and delighting them.You re a SaaS business strategist and data scientist.*You can manage and sift through large volumes of data to provide patterns, trends and insights to improve decision making, help predict outcomes and validate investments and priorities.You re a fantastic storyteller through business and data driven insights.*You know that our products and services tell our customers a story through the end-to-end Digital Transformation innovation for ERP back-office. You won t rest until that Oracle story is a compelling one fueled by the data you are analyzing, synthesizing and giving meaning to in an effort to help our SVPs, product managers, engineers and others see the business through a unique, data driven prism.*You re a business practitioner and an internal advocate for Modern Oracle business intelligence and EPM cloud technologies.*You can share your modern business practice and learnings via internal and external channels, including blogs and videos. You will have the opportunity to collaborate with product marketing and corporate communications to share Oracle on Oracle internal journey and experience.What are the technical requirements?*5-7 years in data analytics supporting a global business at Oracle or prior to Oracle.Experience with data analysis and databases in a business environment with large-scale complex datasetsExperience in bringing creative ideas and proposals to development teams and executives supported by qualitative justification and quantitative analysisStrong data manipulation, product analytics, and statistical analysis (e.g. multivariate hypothesis testing, experimentation, regressions, etc.) skills.Proficiency using Excel to create complex, scalable and robust models for scenario analysis and what if planningExperience with SQL, and R, Python is a plus; visualization skills and experience with visualization tool (e.g. Oracle BICS, Tableau) is a plusFamiliarity and understanding of SaaS business drivers and problems. Ability to have a framework-driven process of analyzing business problems and developing solutions using data to influence outcomes and decisions.Must have excellent verbal, written, and presentation skills to share insights in a way that is easy to grasp and actionable. Experience conveying key insights from complex analysis in summarized business terms.Keen ability to develop relationships at all levels from executives to engineers to help drive adoption of data and insights driven decision making.Experience designing and building out executive level dashboards to help make it easy for decision makers to access data, insights and reportsExperience with big data solutions and predictive modeling/statistics/econometricsBachelors or Masters degree in management, business, computer science or other equivalentWhat will you do as a business strategist at Oracle?*You will build relationships with application development executives, engineers, product managers andfinance[LH1] business partners to drive an end-to-end understanding of data andreporting working[LH2] with business / product owners to understand and define their data and analytical needs.You will elevate how we engage with internal and external stakeholders by continuously improving and simplifying the effectiveness of how we use data to drive superior decision making and outcomes to help grow the business.You will work with engineering and possibly external business partners cross functionally and globally to capture and ingest source data (where necessary) so we can transform the data into manageable insights and foresightsYou will research competition and market tends and propose creative ideas and approaches to helping grow the business through competitive intelligence that will help arm our executives and product managers with keen insightsYou will help build reports and perform analysis to draw insights while working with the appropriate parts of the organization to implement changes based on those insights.You will be comfortable working with a geographically dispersed team, in various time zones, across the globe.You will learn, grow, and be challenged. You will speak up and represent your position amongst peers and leadership, while remaining resilient and open to constructive criticism.You will sometimes make tough compromises, or find things take longer than you want them to, or need to work extra hard to convince a colleague of your position.*Job:** **Product Development**Organization:** **Oracle**Title:** *Cloud ERP Data Analytics and Insights Director - Redwood City, CA**Location:** *United States**Requisition ID:** *18001B97*

Name: Solution Architect, Advanced Analytics and AI
Description: Solution Architect, Advanced Analytics and AI Be a part of our success story. Launch offers talented and motivated people the opportunity to do the best work of their lives in a dynamic and growing company. Through competitive salaries, outstanding benefits, internal advancement opportunities, and recognized community involvement, you'll have the chance to create a career you can be proud of. Your new trajectory starts here at Launch.  LAUNCH CONSULTING is seeking an innovative, collaborative Solution Architect-Data Services to help drive and accelerate the critical development and growth of our Advanced Analytics Practice, where we help our clients go further, faster. Do you have deep cloud analytics solution expertise and a passion for enabling individuals and businesses to achieve big goals? This is a technical, customer facing role accountable for the end-to-end customer cloud analytics experience.  The ideal candidate will have experience and success as a senior consultant leading business process, cloud analytics, data architecture, and design discussions with customer executives to design and deliver solutions. We seek a lifelong learner who is both driven by curiosity and comfortable taking risks.  The position will focus on mapping client goals & requirements to Azure data based architecture and data technology solutions as well as design, execution & validation of POC’s. Required Experience/Qualifications:Strong, demonstrated and referenceable consulting skills2-5 years of experience and deep understanding in Machine Learning and/or Artificial IntelligenceUnderstanding of cloud computing technologies, business drivers, and emerging computing trends and their impact on target industry organizations (data architecture focus)2-5 years of experience with deep understanding in databases and analytics, including big data (Hadoop, Spark), noSQL and relational databases (e.g., SQL Server, MySQL, Oracle, Cassandra, MongoDB, DocumentDB), Data warehousingExperience working in Python, R, and/or working with tools like SAS, SPSS, MATLAB focusing on Machine Learning & Deep Learning.5 years of success in consultative/complex technical sales and deployment projects, managing complex stakeholder relationships to get consensus on solution/projectsDemonstrated ability to work in ambiguous situations and across organizational boundariesTechnical BS degree with Computer Science or Math backgroundBusiness Athletes: Launch looks for the same attributes we admire in top athletes and applies them to the business world: MASTERYCOMMITMENTFOCUSDETERMINATIONINTEGRITYTEAMWORKPOSITIVITYGOAL-ORIENTEDHEALTHY COMPETITIONGOOD SPORTS We interview for these traits above and beyond the technical skill set required for a particular role. Surrounding ourselves with Business Athletes leads to a competitive, fun, winning environment.  Qualified applicants, please respond to inquire@launchcg.com with your full name, resume, and a brief description of how your skills match the requirements above.  Please refer to Job #1742 when responding to this posting.  *Launch Consulting is a veteran-owned company and equal opportunity employer. Veterans encouraged to apply.

Name: Senior Analyst, Consumer and Business Insights
Description: Requisition Number: SS-14188  Area of Interest: Marketing  Organization: Corporate  Brand/Division: Shared Services  Position Type: Full-time JOB DESCRIPTION About the Team  The Marketing Strategy and Analytics team is based at the Williams-Sonoma, Inc. (WSI) corporate headquarters in San Francisco, CA. Through leading-edge expertise in Analytics, Data Science, and Marketing Strategy, our mission is to drive profitable growth across our brand portfolio and ensure that our brands are top-of-mind with consumers. We're responsible for leveraging multi-brand, multi-channel customer data to provide WSI with strategic advantages in the marketplace. We strive for continuous improvement and innovation in everything we do.  Our team delivers strategic advantages for the WSI family of brands by providing: Deep customer data insights to understand consumer behaviors and fuel opportunitiesPredictive analytics and data science best practicesData innovation & execution to power our world-class multi-channel marketing engineSophisticated measurement of marketing investment and program incrementalityAbout the RoleDeliver customer analytic projects, providing actionable insights to business stakeholders. Examples include:Customer demographics, KPIs and other profile metrics for each brand as well as for key initiativesInsights to drive new customer acquisition, reactivation and retentionCustomer value, needs and preferences across life stages and cohortsMarket basket and other product-level analysesResponsible for all stages of analytic projects, including:Objective identification and hypothesis developmentSource data identificationProgramming in SQL, SAS, Python, R or other statistical package for data manipulation and analysisInterpretation and extraction of insightsSynthesis, packaging (including visualization) and communication of findings and recommendationsConnect web & sales data to derive insights about how customers interact with both our online and offline shopping channelsPublish business intelligence reporting for KPI tracking and performance trendingDevelop consumer surveys including questionnaire design and implementation, results interpretation and communication with actionable resultsCollaborate with Technology partners to improve data quality, new data capture and drive efficiency in usage.Seek continuous improvement in process improvement, analytics tools and techniques, automation, results visualization and storytelling. Keep up with industry best practices. You're excited about this opportunity because you will... Work on a variety of analytic projects, across brands and different business opportunities, but always with the customer at the center of everything we doCollaborate with smart and motivated team members and stakeholders who are curious and like to innovateMake an impact by providing insightful data to guide decision making and offer proactive solutions in a culture that is very data-driven and values our team Why you will love working at Williams-Sonoma, Inc. We're a successful, fast-growing company with an entrepreneurial vibeA technologically and data-driven businessCompetitive salaries and comprehensive health benefitsWe're at the forefront of tech and retail, redefining technology for the next generationWe're passionate about our internal and external clients and live/breathe the client experienceWe get to be creative on a daily basisA smart, experienced leadership team that wants to do it right and is open to new ideasWe believe in autonomy and reward taking initiativeWe have fun!REQUIREMENTS AND QUALIFICATIONS We're excited about you because... You have excellent analytic and critical thinking skills, combined with strong written and verbal communication skillsYou have a strong ability to translate complex data into compelling stories, and have strong data visualization skills that help influence your messageYou can get up to speed quickly, can roll-up your sleeves and dig in to the technical details but also step back and see the big pictureYou're passionate about consumer data and curious about their behavior, always seeking ways to use data to impact their behavior with usYou have a deep understanding of large scale marketing databases and systems, and expertise in data mining techniquesYou work effectively with cross-functional partners in a collaborative environmentYou're well-organized, with high attention to detail, deadline-oriented and act with a sense of urgency to drive actionable resultsTechnical Competencies required:Degree in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Mathematics, Applied Analytics, Operations Research or Computer Science4+ years of business-based analytics, with hands-on data analysis experience with a variety of analytic tools. Knowledge of emerging analytic techniques and toolsExcellent SQL skillsExperience analyzing clickstream dataSkilled in Tableau or other similar visualization toolExposure to data analysis tools such as Python, SAS, R, and Hive, and an understanding of MapReduceExperience developing survey questionnaires and analyzing survey results is a plusExperience in multi-channel consumer retail industry is a major plusExperience in consumer marketing is a major plus About Williams-Sonoma, Inc.  Founded in 1956, Williams-Sonoma, Inc. is the premier specialty retailer of high-quality products for the kitchen and home in the United States. Our family of brands are Williams-Sonoma, Pottery Barn, Pottery Barn Kids, PBteen, West Elm, Williams-Sonoma Home, Rejuvenation, and Mark and Graham. These brands are among the best known and most respected in the industry. We offer beautifully-designed, stylish and functional products for every area of the home, including the kitchen, living room, bedroom, home office, closet, laundry room and even outdoor spaces. We've seen some big changes since our first brick-and-mortar store opened more than half of a century ago. What hasn't changed is our passion for high-quality products, functional design, outstanding customer service, and enhancing the lives of our customers and the communities where we operate. Today, we're a multi-brand, multi-channel, global enterprise supported by state-of-the-art technology and some of the most talented teams in retailing - and we're always looking for new energy and ideas. Benefits: Once you are here, you can look forward to a wide variety of benefits. Our corporate vision--to enhance our customers' quality of life at home--extends to the lives of our associates. To that end, we offer an extensive benefits package designed to help you grow, personally and professionally, to keep you healthy, to prepare you for the unexpected, to care for your family and to build a secure future. Depending on your position and your location, here's a look at what you might be eligible for: A generous discount on all Williams Sonoma Inc. brands through multiple shopping channelsA 401(k) plan and other investment opportunitiesPaid vacations, holidays and other time-off programsHealth benefits, including health, dental and vision insurance; health and dependent care tax-free spending accounts; medical, family and bereavement leave; same-sex domestic partner benefits; short- and long-term disability programs; life and travel insurance; an employee assistance programTax-free commuter benefitsA wellness program that supports your physical, financial and emotional healthIn-person and online learning opportunities through WSI University, LearnIt and AcademyXCross-brand and cross-function career opportunitiesQuarterly sample salesA business casual work environmentA bike share programTime off to volunteerMatching donations to qualifying nonprofit organizationsCompany-sponsored walks and runsHealthy, organic options in the cafeteria and an awesome salad barDiscounts on nearby gyms and other local businesses WSI will not now or in the future commence an immigration case or 'sponsor' an individual for this position (for example, H-1B or other employment-based immigration  This role is not eligible for relocation assistance. LI-JC1 Williams-Sonoma, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer.  Williams-Sonoma, Inc. will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, or other applicable state or local laws and ordinances.  Nearest Major Market: San Francisco  Nearest Secondary Market: Oakland  Job Segment: Developer, Retail Sales, Computer Science, Database, SQL, Technology, Retail

Name: Managing Supervisor Consumer
Description: Description Position Overview and Responsibilities FleishmanHillard, a leading global communications agency, has an immediate opening for a Managing Supervisor to join our dynamic consumer practice. This position provides a fantastic opportunity for an organized and seasoned communications professional with a background in technology/consumer technology to work in a fast-paced environment with collaborative teams on integrated programs encompassing product launches, brand-building, media campaigns, and content creation on behalf of our global clients.  As one of the largest full-service agencies in the bay area, FleishmanHillard San Francisco practice groups include Consumer Brand Marketing, Corporate Reputation and Social Responsibility, Healthcare, Technology, and Social + Creative Communications. Clients include Fitbit, GoPro, EA, GM, Genentech, Kaiser Permanente, Bayer, Plantronics, Levi Strauss & Co, and many more.  FleishmanHillard is an entrepreneurial, collaborative environment that values talented, creative people who like to work with others to create cutting-edge programs for our clients. More than 90 percent of FH clients work with teams from more than one geographic location, and across multiple practice offerings. We believe a diverse team brings a wider range of personal and professional experiences and perspectives. We recognize that diversity and inclusion benefit our agency, our clients, and the communities in which we work and live. To that end, we strongly encourage applications from women, people of color, members of the LGBTQ community, veterans, and individuals with disabilities.  Responsibilities include Collaborate with senior team members to create and drive communications campaigns, including product launches, developer relations, product pitching and more. Serve as a day-to-day client contact and manage individual and team work streams on program implementation. Review/assess industry trends to identify opportunities to inject FHs clients into current news cycles; drive story idea development, and work closely with media to shape and control communications that are in line with overall account objectives. Develop and edit high quality written materials, including pitch letters, background materials, recommendation and planning documents, and executive communications. Act as a strategic counselor to account leads and clients, particularly in the area of consumer technology. Key Qualifications The successful candidate must be results-oriented, have a solid track record of effective client management, media relations, strong writing, strong organization and acute attention to detail. Experience executing global and regional communications programs is a plus. Additionally, candidates should have: Minimum of 8 years of agency experience in developing and implementing communications programs, with an emphasis on communications and public relations work for technology and consumer technology clients. Knowledge of the wearables category a plus. Experience managing all aspects of product launches, including messaging, materials creation, and overseeing others to drive programs to conclusion Advanced knowledge of top-tier consumer technology, consumer, tech and business media, and well-developed skills in building and maintaining traditional and digital media relationships. A demonstrated hands-on media approach is required. Broad technology business understanding, strong analytical abilities and critical, creative thinking. Candidate should have the ability to engage off- and online audiences, and tell complex stories in an easily digestible way. Demonstrated experience working directly with clients on day-to-day activities, managing teams to effectively execute public relations plans, and drafting and implementing strategic corporate communications programs within budget. Superior writing skills, with the ability to develop and edit high-quality materials such communications plans, position papers, fact sheets, news and online media materials, bylined articles, trend analysis summaries, executive correspondence, and presentations. Ability to engage with and counsel internal contacts across the clients business and deliver connective insights to assist clients in driving alignment and execution of cross-company initiatives. Candidate should have experience building relationships and working with diverse stakeholders effectively. The ability to develop and generate support for strategic, comprehensive communications plans that apply creative tactics and use a variety of communication channels, including digital (e-mail, social media, blogs and intranet), print publications and brochures, executive memos, face-to-face meeting scripts/talking points, special events, video, and FAQs. Experience managing and coordinating projects with multiple work streams, including managing junior team members and client budgets, both directly and indirectly. Ability to illustrate a results-focused approach and commitment to going the extra mile for clients. Experience working directly with clients on day-to-day activities. Energetic, self-starter and resourceful problem solver gets things moving and keeps them on track. High attention to detail with the ability to manage multiple ongoing activities. Good interpersonal skills, can work effectively in a team environment, negotiate approvals diplomatically, and maintain composure and quality under deadlines in a fast-paced environment. Culture hound who is an avid consumer of media (television, film, magazines, books, social media) and is quite naturally up on the latest trends. Personal interest in fitness, outdoors and/or sports a plus. About FleishmanHillard FleishmanHillard specializes in public relations, reputation management, public affairs, brand marketing, digital strategy, social engagement and content strategy. We have been named PRWeeks Global Agency of the Year and Best Places to Work; a Standout Agency on Advertising Ages A-List; NAFEs Top 50 Companies for Executive Women for eight years running; and among our firms award-winning work weve taken home 5 Lions in the past two years at the Cannes International Festival of Creativity. Were also more motivated by what we can give than what we receive, and in our 70th year weve initiated a worldwide service commitment to support social inclusion in the communities in which we work and live. FleishmanHillard is part of Omnicom Public Relations Group, a division of Omnicom Group Inc., and has more than 85 offices in 30 countries, plus affiliates in 43 countries. Visit us at .  FleishmanHillard is committed to equal employment opportunity and affirmative action. FleishmanHillard does not discriminate in any aspect of employment on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, age, veteran status, disability, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local employment discrimination laws where FleishmanHillard does business.  FleishmanHillard will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.  About Omnicom Public Relations Group is a global collective of three of the top global public relations agencies worldwide and eight specialist agencies in public affairs, marketing to women, fashion, global health strategy and corporate social responsibility. It encompasses more than 6,000 public relations professionals in more than 330 offices worldwide who provide their expertise to companies, government agencies, NGOs and nonprofits across a wide range of industries. Omnicom Public Relations Group delivers for clients through a relentless focus on talent, continuous pursuit of innovation and a culture steeped in collaboration. Omnicom Public Relations Group is part of the DAS Group of Companies, a division of Omnicom Group Inc. that includes more than 200 companies in a wide range of marketing disciplines including advertising, public relations, healthcare, customer relationship management, events, promotional marketing, branding and research.  If you need assistance reviewing career opportunities or completing an application, please call 314-982-6283 or email our .

Name: Acquisition Workstation Account Executive
Description: Job ID #: 67229  Position Title: Acquisition Workstation Account Executive - Global Accounts  Location: USA-CA-San Francisco  Functional Area: Sales  Facility: Work at Home  Relocation Provided: No  Education Required: Bachelors Degree  Experience Required: 5 - 7 Years  Travel Percent: 40  Position Description  As an Acquisition Workstation Account Executive for Lenovo, you'll be responsible for delivering net new account wins across the Global segment. Within each account you will have responsibility for selling solutions from our entire portfolio, focusing specifically on Workstations. From these sales you will drive revenue and profit to position our company for continued growth and success. You will champion the innovative power of our products to make our customers more productive, collaborative and transformative. You will understand Lenovo's portfolio of award-winning products and develop strategies to help new and existing customers find and implement the best solutions. This is a client facing, acquisition sales role requiring deep industry experience, the ability to identify, cultivate, and close net new business, and expertise working large deals at the C level. We are looking for a hunter with a successful and proven track record to take their career, the territory and our clients to the next level. Build partnerships with existing, current and new workstation customers by coordinating the efforts of sales, opportunity management, marketing and pre and post sales technical support to maximize Revenue and Margin for Lenovo Workstation products.Builds & executes operational plans for Workstation PC products, P Series Monitors and Options.Owns ongoing analysis of metrics & business performance to produce weekly report for workstation business performance & relevant actions and recommendations.Engages marketing team to ensure coverage of WS products and options in eDM's, catalogs, DM etc.Assess & mitigate risks / issues through effective contingency plans.Experience in cold-calling important in order to identify and pursue new acquisition opportunities - plan and execute acquisition activities in the workstation area in agreement with sales / account teamsMaintains competitor analysis to identify business opportunities, provide insightful & actionable outputs across products, markets & competitors - includes product positioning & SWOT analysis.Delivers Subject Matter Expert (SMB) support to sales & marketing teams, on both technology & products. Provides monthly / quarterly road map updates to relevant extended teamsLI-90210-US,*LI-95101-US 2HCampaign Position Requirements Minimum 8 years business development, or sales / marketing experience in the IT industry (software and hardware)Proficient in being able to sell the value of Workstation & associated solutions; Understand Workstation & associated solutions technology and its practical application/ contribution to customers' requirementsBusiness analytical skillsMedia and press engagement. Local Press Release validationProject management skillsNegotiation and communication skillsExperience in working with channel partners We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.

Name: Nurse Case Manager
Description: ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:  Performs utilization management (UM), quality improvement (QI), and case management (CM) duties Reviews requests for complex inpatient and outpatient services Follows clinical guidelines for authorization of services Follows the appropriate turnaround timeframe for decisions and notification of members and providers Researches clinical guidelines from different sources Presents complex cases to Medical Director for review Monitors QI projects including the Practice Improvement Program and other studies Prepares QI reports and presents findings to colleagues Investigates member and provider complaints and appeals; reports findings to Health Plan. Identifies achievable CM goals using motivational interviewing techniques Coordinates health care needs with members, families, and providers Coordinates referrals to primary care, specialty care, ancillary services, and other resources Ensures that services are provided at the most appropriate level of care Monitors outcomes of UM, QI, and CM including preparing and interpreting appropriate statistical reports Provides training and guidance to UM Coordinators on UM, QI, and CM activities Updates policies and procedures as needed to meet health plan and legislative requirements Follows regulations, agreements, and guidelines applicable to healthcare programs Performs other job duties as required by manager/supervisor.QUALIFICATIONS: Current California Registered Nurse or Licensed Vocational Nurse license Knowledge of managed care helpful Supervisory experience is helpful Good communication and interpersonal skills Knowledge of community resources and cultural needs Recent experience in case management or care management is helpful Ability to work with providers, members and their family Ability to perform efficiently and appropriately in busy environment Strong analytical and problem solving skills Good organization and prioritization skills LANGUAGE:  Must be able to fluently speak, read and write English. Fluent in Chinese (Cantonese and/or Mandarin) required. Fluent in other languages are an asset. STATUS:  This is an FLSA Non-exempt position. This is not an OSHA high-risk position.
